title: Inside Look
desc: Series creator and writer Neil Cross, and Luther star, Idris Elba take you inside the first episode and inside the mind of Luther himself.

title: Episode #1.1
desc: Luther returns to work after a traumatic arrest to investigate the murder of a former child genius's parents, and quickly deduces that their daughter is responsible. However he is unable to find evidence to convict.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: A gunman is murdering uniformed police officers, and warns that there will be further shootings unless his terms are met. Luther is determined to flush the killer out.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: John Luther is on the trail of a satanic occult killer who kidnaps a woman but leaves her baby in the living room. Things get harder when a man accuses Luther of attacking him. Things take a grisly turn when the woman is found.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: When a serial killer goes on the rampage, Luther must put his personal life aside and delve inside the murderer's mind to discover what is driving him to kill so many girls, and why.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: Luther and the team are after the people involved in the violent kidnapping of Jessica Carrodus and they are in search of diamonds.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: Luther, suspected of murder, goes on the run to try and prove his innocence. With Alice's assistance, they set out together to exact revenge on the real killer.

title: Episode #2.1
desc: Still plagued by the death of his ex-wife, Luther returns to work to face a surreal and nightmarish case of a masked murderer determined to enter into folklore.

title: Episode #2.2
desc: Luther must rescue Ripley, abducted by Cameron, in time to prevent Cameron's final murderous set piece. But Jenny's ruthless and vengeful boss is demanding compensation for stealing her protege.

title: Episode #2.3
desc: As Luther's affection for Jenny grows, so does his determination to protect her and help her back on her feet. Baba, however, is determined to keep Luther on a tight leash.

title: Episode #2.4
desc: Luther's personal and professional life spirals out of control as he tries to cover up Toby's death and appease a suspicious Baba. He must also protect Jenny from any further harm.

title: Episode #3.1
desc: Luther investigates a case of a fetishist who is murdering women which is similar to an unsolved case from the 1980s. The team attempt to catch the copycat killer, whose murderous spree has only just started.

title: Episode #3.2
desc: Luther's date with Mary, and the promise of romance, is interrupted by the news of another murder. The killer has struck again - the number of victims is escalating fast.

title: Episode #3.3
desc: In what looks like a gangland crime - two hoodies are shot at close range. But an un-connected crime sees Luther make a un-connected connection that might provide the real answer to what happened.

title: Episode #3.4
desc: Marwood makes his vendetta personal - targeting Luther and those closest to him, raining destruction on everything he touches.

title: Episode #4.1
desc: While on a leave of absence, Luther is suddenly dragged back into his former life in London to battle the demons of his past and to stop a cannibal serial killer.

title: Episode #4.2
desc: Will a cold case unlock the mystery from Luther's past that is haunting him? The detective is forced to put himself and Emma in danger to stop the serial killer's end game.

title: Episode #5.1
desc: When a series of seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a tangle of leads and misdirection that appears designed to protect an untouchable corruption.

title: Episode #5.2
desc: Luther must confront a demon from his past, as the police and Cornelius converge on his home. Halliday is convinced the body in the morgue isn't that of the killer.

title: Episode #5.3
desc: Luther's friend is in danger and a young woman has been kidnapped by the killer. As revenge threatens to consume him the detective must choose who to save and who can't he bear to lose?

title: Episode #5.4
desc: Luther's left reeling by tragic events but must race to save the others from a killer determined to complete his macabre masterpiece. Can the troubled DCI come to terms with the problems that threaten his career, life and those around him?

title: Episode #1.1
desc: Tony's cantankerous funk - which he calls a superpower - is taking a toll on his co-workers. Meanwhile, a new writer starts at The Tambury Gazette.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: Thinking he has nothing to lose, Tony contemplates trying heroin. He babysits his nephew and starts to bond - just a bit - with Sandy.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: Tony hires a sex worker - but it's not what you think. A trip to the comedy club turns awkward. The nurse gives Tony a piece of her mind.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: Tony pushes back on Matt's idea to go on a blind date. Also, Tony makes an introduction and issues an uncharacteristic apology.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: Brian (finally) convinces Tony and company to visit his apartment for a story. Meanwhile, Matt receives a distressing call from his son's school.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: Making an earnest attempt to be happy - or at least not miserable - Tony gives some long overdue recognition to those who have stood by him.

title: Episode #2.1
desc: Determined to be kind but still struggling to be happy, Tony attends a Zen meditation course with Matt, whose own marriage is on the rocks.

title: Episode #2.2
desc: Lenny's girlfriend's son takes a position at the Gazette. Sandy contemplates writing a gossip column. Matt gets iffy advice from his therapist.

title: Episode #2.3
desc: A turn of events at the paper hits Sandy hard. Roxy and Pat share a meal, and Tony tries to support Matt's desire to get back out there.

title: Episode #2.4
desc: Tony interviews a local woman addicted to corrective surgery. Later, he holds back the snark in hopes of cheering up Kath.

title: Episode #2.5
desc: The curtain goes up on the community theater revue and things go about as well as can be expected. Tony receives devastating news.

title: Episode #2.6
desc: Grieving over another loss, Tony asks his friends and co-workers for space, not sympathy. Later, he wrestles with what it means to move on.

title: Episode #3.1
desc: Tony, who continues to keep Emma at arm's length, reluctantly agrees to go to Matt's house for a round of drinks. Brian bumps into a familiar face.

title: Episode #3.2
desc: The Tambury Gazette welcomes a gloomy new staffer. Meanwhile, Kath visits a psychic, and a restless James makes plans for his future.

title: Episode #3.3
desc: Tony takes a trip with Matt to honor his father. James has second thoughts about his new living arrangements. Tony helps Kath score a date.

title: Episode #3.4
desc: Matt searches for a sport at which he can beat Tony, Lenny asks Tony to be his best man, and Kath has dinner with a persnickety teacher.

title: Episode #3.5
desc: Anne gives Tony some advice on moving forward, Emma crosses paths with an old friend, Matt suffers a health scare, and James stands up for himself.

title: Episode #3.6
desc: An interview with a sick child hits Tony hard. Later, he makes a decision about Lisa's insurance money and joins his friends at the town fair.

title: Night of the Sentinels: Part 1
desc: A young teenager has been rejecting her mutant powers ever since she discovered them. But when giant robots track her down, it's up to the X-Men to save her.

title: Night of the Sentinels: Part 2
desc: After breaking into the headquarters of the newly discovered government branch called The Mutant Control Agency, the X-men lose two of their own members in a battle with the Sentinels.

title: Enter Magneto
desc: As the Beast waits for his arraignment in court in front of an anti-mutant public, Magneto tries to break Beast out of jail, only to receive resistance from Beast. An old enemy of Wolverine's pops up, and the X-Men take him in. Magneto then attacks a military base, trying to bring mutants together against the oppression brought upon.

title: Deadly Reunions
desc: Professor Xavier and Magneto confront each other for the first time in years, meanwhile Wolverine and Sabretooth come face to face. Professor Xavier tries to examine Sabretooth's mind to figure out his rage problem. After his last terrorist action failed, Magneto plots a new one to bring Professor Xavier out into the open. Sabretooth and Wolverine confront each other in the mansion's war room.

title: Captive Hearts
desc: Wolverine has strong feeling for Jean Grey, but she's with Cyclops. Storm has a paralyzing case of claustrophobia and must overcome this as the X-Men venture into the New York sewers to rescue Jean Grey and Cyclops from a deformed race of mutants called the Morlocks. Storm confronts the leader of the Morlocks, Callisto, who wants Cyclops to rule beside her as king.

title: Cold Vengeance
desc: After leaving the X-Men, Wolverine looks for solitude in the arctic, but comes across Sabretooth, who's been tracking him. When the safety of a local tribe is threatened by Sabretooth, Wolverine must defeat him. Meanwhile Jubilee, Storm and Gambit do some investigating at an island resort called Genosha that seems to be a safe haven for mutants.

title: Slave Island
desc: Gambit, Storm, and Jubilee head to the island resort of Genosha... and end up as mutant slaves.

title: The Unstoppable Juggernaut
desc: The X-Men discover their home destroyed and Professor X missing. Their search leads them to a titanic mutant who can become an unstoppable force.

title: The Cure
desc: Rogue seeks a scientist who claims to be able to "cure" any mutant of their powers. But is he for real?

title: Come the Apocalypse
desc: An ancient and immensely powerful mutant called Apocalypse plots to destroy the world to bring in a newer more world.

title: Days of Future Past: Part 1
desc: The mutant travels back in time to avert a future catastrophe.

title: Days of Future Past: Part 2
desc: Gambit sets out to prove his innocence by thwarting an assassination he supposedly caused. Can he succeed?

title: The Final Decision
desc: Senator Kelly has been abducted by Magneto and given the facts about Magneto's goals of superiority of mutants over humans, the X-men's beliefs of peaceful co-existence between both races, and the Sentinel's plans of global domination. And must make a decision of his future plans in politics based on this information.

title: 'Til Death Do Us Part: Part 1
desc: Jean and Scott get married. Newly elected President Kelly has freed Beast who has been incarcerated since the attack on government facility at the beginning of Season 1 and added him as part of his Presidential cabinet. Another friend who was thought to be dead at the same incident has resurfaced, but this time he's not so friendly. With the President's newly found pro-mutant point of view, the public feels betrayed are reacting with violence.

title: 'Til Death Do Us Part: Part 2
desc: Scott and Jean are on their way to a secluded island for their honeymoon, but gets cut short by Mister Sinister. As Morph continues with his plans of revenge against the X-Men, he starts losing his motivation. But Mister Sinister makes sure he finishes what he started. The Friends of Humanity have began to rally.

title: Whatever It Takes
desc: Storm recovers from her injuries and returns to her duty as leader of the X-Men. When a tear in the astral plane appears in Africa, Storm goes there to investigate. It just so happens that the tear is in her home village. Meanwhile Xavier and Magneto are lured to the Savage Land in Antarctica and Wolverine continues his search for Morph.

title: Red Dawn
desc: Colossus returns home to Russia with Jubilee by his side. They are confronted by a newly revived Russian, life force absorbing, super soldier from the cold war, named Omega Red, who has a bad history with Wolverine. Xavier and Magneto continue their treacherous journey through the Savage Land.

title: Repo Man
desc: After Wolverine has been lured to Canada by an alleged message from his old friend, Heather Hudson, he finds himself fighting Heather's husband, Vindicator, and the Canadian super team, Alpha Flight, instead. Alpha Flight believes that they were only sent after Wolverine to get him to rejoin their team. However, their General Chasen has a more sinister agenda: to retrieve Wolverine's adamantium skeleton -- at any cost.

title: X-Ternally Yours
desc: Every ten years, The Assassins Guild and The Thieves Guild must each give an offering to a supernatural being called The X-Ternal, in exchange for power. When it comes to be Gambit's brother, Bobby, who has to offer the tithing this time, he comes up missing. The Assassins Guild want to exchange him for Gambit, so he can finally come face to face with the woman he left at the altar 10 years before.

title: Time Fugitives: Part 1
desc: Bishop returns from the future to again attempt to fix his world, but this time his actions lead up to a far greater tragedy occurring.

title: Time Fugitives: Part 2
desc: To stabilize his own timeline, Cable comes to the present to prevent Bishop from saving mutant-kind from Apocalypse's plague.

title: A Rogue's Tale
desc: Mr. Sinister send Mystique to destroy the X-Men while Professor X is lost in the Savage Land. Rogue starts having painful visions of a mysterious woman and they're literally driving her crazy when the mysterious woman possesses Rogue's body. Unknown to the X-men, this mystery woman holds some dark secrets to Rogue's past before she joined the X-Men.

title: Beauty and the Beast
desc: The Friends Of Humanity attack a hospital for the blind that Beast is working at. And Wolverine plans on tearing them apart from the inside. Beast and one of his blind patients, Carly, fall in love together. But Carly's father is a mutant hater and won't stand to see them associating with each other. When the Friends Of Humanity kidnap Carly for associating with a mutant, Wolverine, Beast, and the FOH come full circle. Meanwhile, in the Savage Land, Xavier and Magneto are struggling to survive.

title: Mojovision
desc: On a world ruled by Television, an alien named Mojo is master. When he abducts the X-Men and forces them to be action heroes in his shows, he may have to deal with more than he bargained for when Mojo's original action hero sabotages him. Xavier and Magneto are still slowly making their way through the Savage Land.

title: Reunion: Part 1
desc: Xavier and Magneto finally make their way back to Xavier's plane, only to be ambushed by some mutates. The new ruler of the Savage Land is revealed but not until they make a new ally. Morph sends a message to the X-Men revealing his location which provides an encounter with Mr. Sinister and his group of Nasty Boys.

title: Reunion: Part 2
desc: The X-Men are now in the Savage Land and are powerless like Xavier and Magneto, which leaves the X-Men open to being experimented on by Mr. Sinister. The only ones left to rescue them are Ka-Zar and Wolverine. Once everyone regains their powers, the Savage Land is restored. But what does the future hold for the Savage Land now?

title: Out of the Past: Part 1
desc: Wolverine is lured into the Morlock tunnels by a former lover who is accompanied by a group of cybernetic mercenaries called Reavers. Wolverine discovers this woman he used to love isn't the woman he once knew, as she's gone through the same cybernetic alterations that the Reavers have, and a new moniker, calling herself Lady Deathstrike. She has discovered a long buried alien craft and needs Wolverine's adamantium claws to cut it open.

title: Out of the Past: Part 2
desc: After being released from an alien spacecraft, a being called the Spirit Drinker starts draining the life force of the people around it, including The Reavers, Lady Deathstrike and Jubilee. Can the X-Men figure out the secret of destroying it before the drained life forces are gone forever?

title: Phoenix Saga, Part 1: Sacrifice
desc: Professor X's visions leads to his decision to blindly send the team to commandeer a space shuttle on which they are then attacked by Shi'ar agent Erik The Red who has plans to ambush the rebel, Lilandra when she exits a space wormhole. Jean Grey experiences a transformation as the shuttle travels through an energy field.

title: Phoenix Saga, Part 2: Dark Shroud
desc: A psychic probe in the form of a beam of light causes Professor X's to emit a psychic projection of his dark side which then attacks the X-Men. Professor X retreats to Muir Island for rehabilitation but is visited by Lilandra.

title: Phoenix Saga, Part 3: Cry of the Banshee
desc: Juggernaut and Black Tom Cassidy kidnap Lilandra for Erik The Red but the X-Men track them down. A fight results in a stalemate until Gladiator, guard to the imperial throne, shows up to take Lilandra captive. Phoenix rescues her and vanquishes Gladiator for the meantime.

title: Phoenix Saga, Part 4: Starjammers
desc: The X-Men fail to protect the M'Kraan Crystal from intergalactic pirates called Starjammers who plan to sell it to D'Ken as well as to use Cyclops as an assassin. Phoenix transports the X-Men to the crystal but D'Ken succeeds in unlocking it's power.

title: Phoenix Saga, Part 5: Child of Light
desc: The X-Men are drawn in to battle against D'Ken within the confines of the world within the M'Kraan Crystal where Phoenix makes a last stand.

title: Savage Land, Strange Heart: Part 1
desc: Separated from the rest of the X-Men, Storm is encouraged by Sauron to free her inner tempest of energy, awakening Garokk.

title: Savage Land, Strange Heart: Part 2
desc: Garokk fuses with the island's volcano and the surging planetary force below it.

title: Obsession
desc: Archangel has become obsessed with destroying Apocalypse, who he blames for ruining his life.

title: The Dark Phoenix: Part 1 - Dazzled
desc: Jean is beginning to lose control, and the Phoenix begins to brazenly take over at will.

title: The Dark Phoenix: Part 2 - Inner Circle
desc: When Mastermind tries to force Phoenix to kill Cyclops, she finally breaks free of the psychic controls on her, leaving the X-Men to fight for themselves.

title: The Dark Phoenix: Part 3 - Dark Phoenix
desc: Jean Grey, now completely part of the Phoenix, returns to her childhood home, overwhelmed by too much emotion and too much power.

title: The Dark Phoenix: Part 4 - The Fate of Phoenix
desc: Xavier reads Lilandra's mind and challenges her guard to the Duel of Honor that Lilandra cannot refuse for Jean Grey's life.

title: Cold Comfort
desc: Iceman, a former X-Man, is caught sneaking into a federal warehouse. He is captured by his former team, but Jubilee tries to help him.

title: Orphan's End
desc: Corsair is on the run from Shi'Ar authorities, who demand that Cyclops turn him over to them.

title: The Juggernaut Returns
desc: Juggernaut's life is at risk when someone else uncovers the Ruby of Cyttorak and claims the powers of Juggernaut for himself.

title: Nightcrawler
desc: On holiday, Rogue, Gambit and Wolverine must protect Nightcrawler, a demonic-looking but kind-hearted monk, from a misled community.

title: Weapon X, Lies, and Video Tape
desc: Wolverine discovers everything about his past life in the government program Weapon X was a lie... including his love affair with Silver Fox.

title: One Man's Worth: Part 1
desc: Trevor Fitzroy and Bantam travel back in time to 1959 and kill Professor X.

title: One Man's Worth: Part 2
desc: Failing to stop the assassination of Xavier, Bishop, Shard, Storm and Wolverine travel forward to the future.

title: Courage
desc: Morph and Wolverine investigate and discover that the Sentinels are back.

title: Proteus: Part 1
desc: Moira MacTaggert is trying to help her son, but when he escapes from Muir Island she calls on the X-Men for help.

title: Proteus: Part 2
desc: Angered at his father's reaction, Proteus creates havoc, but Professor X later calms him down, and he stops the rampage.

title: Sanctuary: Part 1
desc: Weary of battling for mutant supremacy, Magneto offers to transport all mutants to an orbiting asteroid named Asteroid M where they can live peaceful and human-free lives.

title: Sanctuary: Part 2
desc: As Magneto plummets helplessly to Earth, Fabian Cortez assumes control of Asteroid M and sends hundreds of missiles towards Earth.

title: Beyond Good and Evil: Part 1
desc: In the year 3999, Apocalypse steals Cable's computer and time-travels to the past in order to end his struggle against inferior mutants permanently.

title: Beyond Good and Evil: Part 2
desc: The next phase of Apocalypse's plan begins: he targets and abducts the most powerful psychics in the universe.

title: Beyond Good and Evil: Part 3
desc: Cable appears in the past to stop Apocalypse, but is not concerned about saving the psychics much to the mutants' chagrin.

title: Beyond Good and Evil: Part 4
desc: The final battle between mutants and Apocalypse takes place.

title: Have Yourself a Morlock Little X-Mas
desc: Storm, and grouchy humbug Wolverine go last-minute shopping in Manhattan, only to be caught in a life-or-death crisis involving Leech, the littlest Morlock.

title: Lotus and the Steel
desc: Wolverine heads to Japan for some solitude and soul-searching. But he finds his Japanese friends under siege by a gang of bandits.

title: Love in Vain
desc: In a New Mexico desert, Wolverine witnesses the crash of a spaceship carrying horrific, alien bug-like creatures--the Colony.

title: Secrets, Not Long Buried
desc: When Cyclops flies solo to a tiny, western, desert community to see an old friend, his plane is blasted out of the sky. Injured and unable to use his powers, he struggles into town, only to discover his friend is missing and the town is caught in the grips of a militant, mutant-only, anti-human hate group: the Children of the Shadow. The Children of the Shadow hunt him down. When his powers return, Cyclops gets help from some mutants and defeats them.

title: Xavier Remembers
desc: When Professor X suffers a slight concussion, his powerful psychic mind is suddenly open to manipulation.

title: Family Ties
desc: Pietro Maximoff AKA Quicksilver of the mutant team X-Factor and his sister, Wanda, The Scarlet Witch of the Avengers, learn from their dying father, that they were adopted. Magneto, who is looking for his estranged wife, may hold a clue to the Maxinoff twins' past.

title: Phalanx Covenant: Part 1
desc: The X-Men are attacked by the Phalanx, a race of techno-organic aliens seeking to assimilate all life on earth.

title: The Phalanx Covenant: Part 2
desc: The X-Men are attacked by the Phalanx, and are trying to find help but Magneto at first sees this as his chance to watch humanity go down.

title: A Deal with the Devil
desc: Omega Red, the destruction machine from the former Soviet Union and a sworn enemy of Wolverine, is thawed and sent two miles beneath the ocean to salvage a disabled, toxic nuclear submarine threatening to break up near Hawaii.

title: No Mutant Is an Island
desc: A disillusioned Cyclops leaves the X-Men and returns to the orphanage where he grew up, only to find it under the control of a mind-controlling mutant.

title: Longshot
desc: Mojo uses Jubilee as a 'prize' to lure Longshot and the X-Men into a deadly contest which Mojo broadcasts 'live' to raise ratings.

title: Bloodlines
desc: Nightcrawler finally meets the mother who gave him up... Mystique.

title: Storm Front: Part 1
desc: The alien Arkon comes to Earth and begs Storm to return with him to his planet, to save it from meteorological chaos which threatens his people.

title: Storm Front: Part 2
desc: Spectacular preparations for Storm's wedding to Arkon proceed quickly.

title: Jubilee's Fairytale Theater
desc: Jubilee and a group of children are trapped by a cave-in in the caverns underneath the Xavier Mansion, she tells a fairy tale to kill time while they wait to be rescued.

title: The Fifth Horseman
desc: Fabian Cortez kidnaps Jubilee because Apocalypse is trapped in Astral Plane and needs a host body.

title: Old Soldiers
desc: While visiting the grave of a friend in an Army Cemetary in France, Wolverine remembers a mission he did for him, while battling the Nazis and Red Skull with none other than Captain America on his side.

title: Descent
desc: The origin of Mr. Sinister is revealed, as Dr. Xavier attempts to stop Essex before he goes too far.

title: Hidden Agendas
desc: Sam Guthrie's parents have contacted Professor Xavier about their son's mutant powers.

title: Graduation Day
desc: On the verge of Magneto's final stand against humans, the X-Men request him to save a dying Professor X. What choice will he make?

title: Oskuld och panik
desc: Johan and Marianne had been happily married for ten years, and led a comfortable life with their two daughters. They were interviewed about their marriage status one day. Later at a dinner party, their friends, Peter and Katarina, a couple, quarreled about setting restrictions on each other in a marriage. When Marianne got pregnant again, Johan took it unenthusiastica... Read all

title: Konsten att sopa under mattan
desc: Johan and Marianne had a disagreement about certain household issue. Later, they were both led to doubt the role of love in marriage after talking to someone else when at work. They met at lunch but failed to reach out to each other. They talked again that night about their deteriorating sex life, and finally agreed to drop these matters and sweep them under the rug.

title: Paula
desc: Johan came home unexpectedly and told Marianne that he'd been in a love affair with someone named Paula. After his declaration of breaking away from the past, and Marianne's failing to detain him, Johan drove away.

title: Tåredalen
desc: A year had passed since Johan left Marianne. One day they got back in touch and Marianne invited Johan over for dinner. Johan received an offer of job in the US, but was not getting along well with Paula, and Marianne was developing a new relationship with a man. But they were both apprehensive and wanted shelter from each other, so they decided to go to bed together.... Read all

title: Analfabeterna
desc: Johan and Marianne planned to finalize their divorce after several years. They met in order to sign the papers but it was an extremely difficult task to carry out. Touching a low point in his life, Johan balked at getting divorced, thus triggering a bitter altercation between the two of them.

title: Mitt i natten i ett mörkt hus någonstans i världen
desc: Johan and Marianne both had their new life. One day they reunited and went to the summer cottage where they spent their finest hours together as man and wife. They treated each other friendly and kindly and found peace in each other's arms once again.

title: Pehla Nasha
desc: Ishita is the new girl in Sunshine Tuition Centre. Rajat is a studious kid who has a crush on her.

title: Dil To Baccha Hai Ji
desc: Rajat finds out that Pandu has feelings for Anusha. However, his own equation with Ishita is still unbalanced.

title: Ae Kash Ke Hum
desc: Rajat and Ishita bunk tuition for the first time and go out on a date. But things don't go as planned.

title: Kya Se Kya Ho Gaya
desc: A rumour has been spread about Rajat and Ishita which leads to a misunderstanding between them. Rajat fights with Pandu as well and fails in his test. Will he be able to sort things out?

title: Meri Soni Meri Tamanna
desc: Nothing seems to work for Rajat and he breaks down in front of Kaushal sir. He gives Rajat some advice. Will he be able to make things right?

title: Kuch Toh Hua Hai, Kuch Hogaya Hai
desc: Rajjo and Ishita have grown really close. Rajjo is planning something special for Ishita's birthday. But every relationship has its own complication.

title: Chhukar Mere Mann Ko
desc: Rajjo meets Ishita's Best Friend and Papa for the first time. Two of them finally share a moment. Meanwhile, Pandu is being insecure of Anusha's friend.

title: Mera Dil Bhi Kitna Pagal Hai
desc: Rajat's parents find out that he has been bunking his tuition classes. They take away his phone. How will he still manage to talk to Ishita?

title: Aane Wala Pal Jaane Wala Hai
desc: Ishita's life is in turmoil. Her Dadi passed away. Rajat's mom finds out about his relationship with Ishita. They are going through a rough patch.

title: Agar Tum Saath Ho
desc: It looks like a never-ending struggle in Rajat and Ishita's life. Ishita is still trying to cope up with the recent loss. Rajat finally meets her.

title: Natsu no owari no sayonara
desc: After losing a couple of baseball games, Akio Furukawa asks Tomoya to invite his friends and hell him win the game.

title: Itsuwari no ai o sagashite
desc: Mei worries for the brother, in fact he does not yet know what will occupy after completion of school, she decides some time to live at Nagisa. A plan appears at Tomoya, how to compel Mei to think that at Youhei all be well.

title: Surechigau kokoro
desc: Youhei and Sanae go to the appointment, they are accompanied by Tomoya, Nagisa and Mei. Mei feels still, that her brother is hopeless, in spite of intermingling with a reliable girl, she continues to worry for him.

title: Anohi to onaji egao de
desc: Youhei does not attend school, from what his friends and Mei begin to worry. Mei, Tomoya and Nagisa go to FC and ask them, that they gave Youhei possibility again to play a soccer command.

title: Kimi no ita kisetsu
desc: Tomoya and Nagisa come to Youhei. Tomoya fell asleep and saw the past of Misae. When Misae went to senior school, she met a strange boy that was named Katsuki Shima. He it is said that came to her, to carry out her wishes. Misae in love in Igarashi, but he has a girl already.

title: Zutto anata no soba ni
desc: Shima knows that Katsuki not real. Real Katsuki died, and he is only his cat that accepted his form, to carry out the wishes of Misae. On an autumn festival, Misae decided to think a desire. She wished, that Katsuki always loved her and was with her. Tomoya wakes up. He understands that all of it a cat showed him.

title: Kanojo no ibasho
desc: Tomoya, Nagisa and Youhei know that Yukine is related to two municipal bands. Her elder brother, Kazuto, leader of one of groupments. A little boy, by name Yu, comes to Yukine, that she helped to find his senior sister. Youhei decides will pretend to be senior brother Yukine. She tells that Kazuto now dead.

title: Yûki aru tatakai
desc: Tomoya talks Yukine and other, that if bands will continue opposition, them a police will take up. Trying to prevent it, Yukine goes with Tomoya, to persuade the second band to stop opposition. Youhei consents to play the role of Katuzo, but before a battle all are helped to bread from the bakery of Furukawa, that was baked by Sanae. One only Tomoya did not eat bread,... Read all

title: Sakamichi no tochû
desc: The end of school year approaches. Tomoya and his friends discuss the plans on the future. Kyou wants to become a nursery governess in kindergarten, Ryou decides to become train nurse, Kotomi gathers to continue educating in America, and Youhei gathers to become a model. Tomoyadid not yet decide only, that he would do farther. Nagisa falls ill again, that does not all... Read all

title: Hajimari no kisetsu
desc: Tomoya decides that it is time reason more independent, he wants to find job; Akio arranges him to work as in a bakery a salesman. When the day of the trip arrives, Sanae and Akio go out and do not return, forcing Tomoya to spend time alone with his daughter. The two decide to take the trip themselves.

title: Another World: Kyou Chapter
desc: Tomoya finds himself in love triangle with two Fujibayashi sisters.

title: Pilot
desc: Cast aside by Hollywood, screen legends Joan Crawford and Bette Davis battle each other when they sign up for What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?

title: The Other Woman
desc: With production on Baby Jane underway, Bette and Joan form an alliance, but outside forces conspire against them.

title: Mommie Dearest
desc: As production reaches its climax, Bette and Joan clash over every last detail, while both face private struggles.

title: More, or Less
desc: As What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? opens, Bette and Joan face uncertain prospects, Bob deals with his own difficulties, and Pauline makes a surprising offer.

title: And the Winner Is... (The Oscars of 1963)
desc: The fallout from the Oscar nominations leads to underhanded tactics from Joan, while Bette relishes the opportunity to break a record.

title: Hagsploitation
desc: Hungry for another hit, Warner pressures Bob into bringing the original team back together for another project, while Joan receives a surprising blackmail threat.

title: Abandoned!
desc: With production of Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte' underway, the feud intensifies; Bette reveals her vulnerabilities to Bob.

title: You Mean All This Time We Could Have Been Friends?
desc: Joan accepts a leading role on a new film, despite her deteriorating health; Faced with a new rival, Bette reflects on her misplaced feud with Joan.

title: Part 1
desc: After Joseph and Mary's betrothal, Mary is visited by the angel Gabriel, who tells her she will bear the Son of God. Mary and Joseph travel to Bethlehem to take part in Herod's census, where Jesus is born.

title: Part 2
desc: Jesus meets Mary Magdalene and John the Baptist and continues to perform miracles among his people.

title: Part 3
desc: Judas implores Zerah to let Jesus appear before the Sanhedrin in Jerusalem, where "He will be handed over to the unbelievers."

title: Part 4
desc: Christ is condemned and crucified, dying on the cross, but he is resurrected on the third day.

title: No Place Like Home
desc: Bea Smith enters prison after being charged with the attempted murder of her husband. Bea is separated from her daughter and sent to Wentworth on remand. She is then forced to learn how the prison works.

title: Fly Me Away
desc: In the aftermath of the riot, Will blackmails Doreen into helping him and Bea is given no choice but to continue to lie.

title: The Girl Who Waited
desc: Bea gets caught in between rivals Jacs and Franky. While Erica gets the staff offside with forced changes to the 'Wet Cells'.

title: The Things We Do
desc: Franky teaches Bea a tough lesson; Liz struggles with old demons; Franky stirs up new feelings in Erica.

title: The Velvet Curtain
desc: Erica can't escape her feelings for Franky and Bea reveals to Liz the truth about her marriage.

title: Captive
desc: Bea feels threatened when Harry says he may not be able to deal with their daughter any longer. Vera's mother reveals a long standing lie to the staff.

title: Something Dies
desc: Bea pays a high price for crossing Jacs, whilst Franky gets her revenge and Will reverts to his old ways.

title: Mind Games
desc: To gain back control of Wentworth, Jacs makes a final play to break Bea.

title: To the Moon
desc: Bea is buoyed by the inmate's support, while Jacs's power further diminishes and Vera and Fletch's date comes to a humiliating end.

title: Checkmate
desc: The truth behind the riot is finally revealed and Bea confronts a killer leading to deadly consequences.

title: Born Again
desc: Three months after Jacs death, new arrival Joan Ferguson makes an enemy of Franky, while Bea discovers a new purpose.

title: Whatever It Takes
desc: Bea attempts to get revenge on Brayden by goading Harry into an act of violence, whilst Franky's determination to maintain power pushes her to extreme lengths.

title: Boys in the Yard
desc: Following the failure of Harry to avenge their daughter's death, Bea hatches a daring plot to lure Brayden Holt to the jail.

title: The Danger Within
desc: Bea faces down an assassination attempt from the Holt clan. While new inmates enter the compound.

title: Twist the Knife
desc: Bea discovers Simmo has a weakness she can exploit for her own ends. Meanwhile Fletch and Will face off in a confrontation that will end their friendship for good.

title: The Pink Dragon
desc: Simmo's attempt to kill Bea ends in tragedy, while Liz faces her greatest dilemma: to snitch or not to snitch.

title: Metamorphosis
desc: When Ferguson psychologically manipulates Vera she crosses a point of no return whilst Maxine orchestrates a desperate bid to see her spurned lover.

title: Sins of the Mother
desc: An isolated and paranoid Franky tries to uncover which inmate is leaking vital information to Ferguson.

title: The Fixer
desc: When Ferguson discovers Doreen is the pregnant prisoner, the Governor threatens to have Nash's parole revoked unless she lies about the father. Will is publicly accused of an inappropriate relationship with Bea.

title: Jail Birds
desc: Liz struggles to adjust to life on the outside and tries to reconnect with her estranged children. Meanwhile, Derek Channing tries to build his case against Ferguson.

title: Into the Night
desc: As Bea and Franky go to war for control of the prison, Bea puts her daring plan in motion. Meanwhile, Fletch is on a downward spiral of self-destructive behaviour as his final day at Wentworth looms.

title: Fear Her
desc: The extent of Bea's plan is revealed as she makes the final moves to avenge Debbie's death. Meanwhile Franky realises she is losing the support of the women and is forced to consider a deal.

title: The Governor's Pleasure
desc: Bea returns to Wentworth with a heavy charge over the murder of Braydon Holt, while Ferguson makes it clear that she owns Bea. Battle begins over the control of the prison.

title: Failing Upwards
desc: Liz makes a tough decision about her and her family. Franky loses someone close to her, while Bea asserts her dominance as top dog. While Fletch continues his rehab after being struck by a van.

title: Knives Out
desc: Franky's in trouble with her supply cut and her power base decimated, she's on her own when prisoners come after her to claim what they're owed.

title: Righteous Acts
desc: Liz's world is rocked with the arrival of a new prisoner. Franky commences her sessions with Bridget, and admits to a desire for revenge against Bea.

title: Mercy
desc: As Fletch readjusts to work life, Bea must forgo closely held morals as she engages in a secret plan to bring down Ferguson. Bea agrees to a visit with Kaz Proctor to demand she and her group stop committing violence in her name.

title: Evidence
desc: Ferguson is blindsided by Jodie's complaint to the ombudsman. Channing attempts damage control, but Jodie's accusations of brutality promise to be very damaging for the Governor.

title: The Long Game
desc: Bea is held in the psych unit and struggles to accept she had a psychotic episode. Franky is pushed to reveal her biggest secret.

title: Goldfish
desc: When Bea encourages Doreen to uncover the truth behind Ferguson's obsession with "Jianna", Ferguson's renewed interest in Doreen brings on labour.

title: Freak Show
desc: Vera's faith in her Governor is put to the test. Meanwhile, Bea finds herself at her lowest ebb as she realises her war against Ferguson is having an effect on those closest to her.

title: A Higher Court
desc: Franky's parole hearing is brought forward but will she be granted a released? Meanwhile, Doreen faces an agonising choice.

title: The Living and the Dead
desc: When Bea uses her alliance with Fletch to drive a wedge between Vera and Ferguson, her actions set in motion an unstoppable chain of events.

title: Blood and Fire
desc: The walls are closing in on Ferguson - who will survive the final showdown?

title: First Blood
desc: Joan Ferguson steps back into Wentworth prison, but this time as a prisoner. Kaz Proctor, a woman Bea used as an informant in the previous season, and her crew (The Red Right Hand) have also been imprisoned.

title: Poking Spiders
desc: Ferguson launches a campaign to be released into the general prison population regardless of her peril and Kaz organises for the inmates to protest for conjugal visits.

title: Prisoner
desc: Against Vera's wishes, Ferguson is released into general population. The women are out for blood but Vera confines Ferguson to her cell for safety reasons. As always, Ferguson has an end game but will she live to accomplish it?

title: Screw Lover
desc: Ferguson strengthens her alliance with Kaz by painting Will as an abuser and Bea as a 'screw-lover', while Maxine receives a devastating diagnosis.

title: Love and Hate
desc: With Bea in the slot, Ferguson seeks to strengthen her hold over Kaz by manipulating acting top dog, Maxine into an act of extreme violence. Bea and Allie bond while in neighbouring slots.

title: Divide and Conquer
desc: When a young Koori inmate Tasha is subjected to 'prison justice' for pushing the panic button, Doreen shocks everyone by turning her back on Bea.

title: Panic Button
desc: Bea holds a vote among the inmates to determine if there should be a top dog in the prison. Ferguson finds out that there is a surprise witness for Jesper.

title: Plan Bea
desc: A clandestine affair heats up, but neither party knows their every move is being watched. Maxine undergoes a procedure away from the prison.

title: Afterlife
desc: Bea has trouble recovering after her attack. Ferguson returns from hospital and is immediately placed under supervision in a medical hold.

title: Smitten
desc: Bea discovers Allie has fallen back into drug addiction. Franky pursues Shayne in the hope of exposing Ferguson's plan to undermine her trial and secure her release from Wentworth.

title: Eleventh Hour
desc: When Bea commits the ultimate sin of lagging to protect Allie, Kaz seizes on it force Bea to step down as Top Dog. Ferguson strikes again.

title: Seeing Red
desc: Bea scrambles to get a step ahead of Ferguson, who's scheming as the trial approaches. Maxine continues chemotherapy. Liz believes Sonia is innocent.

title: Scars
desc: The women and staff of Wentworth are reeling in the aftermath of Bea Smith's murder.

title: The Bitch Is Back
desc: Franky's trapped by her past, Vera takes desperate measures to foil Ferguson's self defence plea, Liz starts to regret her decision to testify against Sonia.

title: Nothing But the Truth
desc: Liz goes to Court to give her statement against Sonia and Frankie continues to try and find Mikes Killer.

title: Loose Ends
desc: While Liz languishes back in Wentworth waiting for Don to come to her rescue, Sonia is a free woman, and Franky plans her escape.

title: Belly of the Beast
desc: Franky's escape plan could have fatal consequences and Liz is forced to take drastic measures to protect herself.

title: Happy Birthday, Vera
desc: The women become frustrated with the Top Dog's lack of action against Lucy, and Vera receives a birthday present she will never forget.

title: The Pact
desc: Will tries to set up a trap to end the drug supply in the prison with help from Kaz and Allie. While Doreen receives a happy ending when she gets her parole.

title: Think Inside the Box
desc: Franky's escape plan derails her relationship with Bridget, Sonia unleashes on Liz, and Will makes a shocking discovery.

title: Snakehead
desc: Will sets out to expose Jake, forcing Vera to make a choice; Franky engages help from the outside, while the net tightens around Liz.

title: Mere Anarchy
desc: Franky faces danger from an unexpected source, Ferguson pulls strings to sideline Vera, and Liz goes to extreme lengths to try to get a confession from Sonia.

title: Coup de Grace
desc: Ferguson delivers Vera her coup de grace, unleashing unforeseen consequences; Franky's escape plans are waylaid when Kaz persuades her to join forces to bring down the Freak.

title: Hell Bent
desc: Franky and Allie put their escape plan into action, Liz takes desperate measures to protect herself, and Ferguson suspects she's living on borrowed time.

title: Clean Slate
desc: Franky fights to prove her innocence, while the aftermath of the escape drives the staff into conflict.

title: The Boxer
desc: Franky finds the evidence she was seeking and acts on it. Ruby is recruited into fighting against her will. Allie learns some new information. Jake makes an unexpected decision about how to move forward with Vera.

title: Bleed Out
desc: After being shot Franky seeks Bridget's help, but the police net is tightening. Meanwhile, Kaz faces her toughest challenge when she warns Hutch to stop fight club.

title: Winter Is Here
desc: Marie Winter arrives; Sonia makes a deal with Vera and the workshop is reopened. Will cracks under pressure as he confesses to Jake that he buried Joan alive.

title: Bitter Pill
desc: When Jake saves Liz's life in a selfless act, Vera is forced to reassess her opinion of him.

title: Angel of Wentworth
desc: As Sonia tries to spin her 'Angel of Wentworth' PR into an innocence campaign, her past crimes threaten to derail her - and it could be fatal.

title: The Edge
desc: When Sonia is refused entry into Protection, she goes on the attack, setting up a plan to discredit Kaz's position as Top Dog. With Marie onside, they set a scheme in motion, which may have drastic repercussions for Allie.

title: Lovers and Fighters
desc: Ruby's personal information becomes knowledge and Allie convinces her to play it safe. Meanwhile Marie has a lead on who killed her son.

title: Shallow Grave
desc: Will unburdens his problem to Vera, but still loses it. Boomer decides to fight in a boxing match. Rita plays a dangerous game over her cover with Marie. Jake, Will and Vera make a decision.

title: Fractured
desc: Marie discovers that Liz may have witnessed the attack on Cherry Li and tries to protect her from Drago. Meanwhile, Vera, Will and Jake face a blackmail threat - someone else knows the dark secret they are protecting.

title: Indelible Ink
desc: Drago discovers the truth behind Marie's son's death, as a disgraced Channing tries to manipulate Vera and Will into giving him his old job as governor back.

title: Showdown
desc: The police close in on Vera, Will and Jake. While Rita takes drastic action to protect her sister.

title: Blood Wedding
desc: 3 months have passed and Rita is finally released from the slot, with both Rita and Marie receiving 15 year sentences. A junkie takes Vera hostage which makes her rethink her governorship, and Rita suffers a tragic loss.

title: Payback
desc: Rita and Kaz form an alliance to bring down Marie, whilst Jake's jealously toward Vera is apparent as she forms a bond with Greg. The position of Deputy Governor is reassigned to officer Linda Miles.

title: Atonement
desc: Kaz begins a journey of self discovery and atonement, while Linda Miles begins her tenure as acting deputy. Former Walford officer Sean Brody is transferred to Wentworth.

title: Karen
desc: Vera learns the sex of her baby whilst Marie and Kaz try and make amends, with Rita facing an impossible dilemma to keep her identity as a former cop a secret after being told to kill Kaz by the new inmate.

title: Ascension
desc: Wentworth is in shock as they mourn Kaz's death and the following investigation brings staff to a head and inmates to breaking point when they have to vote in a new Top Dog.

title: Mother
desc: The Prisoners tensions are still extremely high, as Marie learns the truth about the death of her son. While Boomer has some long awaited catching up to do, with her mother.

title: Bad Blood
desc: Ruby fights for her life as Marie continues to manipulate Will. Linda works doubles as she's in debt $20,000 as Vera takes Rita to see Ruby against governors orders.

title: Protection
desc: Marie's fall from grace continues her protector wants her silenced for good. Linda struggles after being manipulated by Sean, and Liz meets her son for the first time in years.

title: Under Siege Pt 1
desc: Liz makes a desperate attempt to see her son, whilst Jake learns of Linda's $20,000 debt. Marie makes a bold plan to be exonerated for her crimes but things take a dramatic turn that could change Wentworth forever.

title: Under Siege Pt 2
desc: The lives of officers and prisoners remain in the balance as the siege comes to a violent and bloody end. Lives are changed forever Wentworth will never be the same, ever again.

title: Resurrection
desc: After the siege many of the prisoners and officers struggle to rebuild their lives with the horror they endured, as the new General Manager deals with the fallout of the siege, an old Top Dog reenters the compound, the legendary Lou Kelly.

title: Ends and Means
desc: With Marie being made the scapegoat for the siege she makes a desperate attempt to get into general, as Ruby fights for her innocence when an allegation is lodged against her, while Boomer continues her collision course with Lou.

title: Enemy of the State
desc: With a new arrival Judy Bryant entering the prison, she shakes things up for the inmates and staff alike. While Marie confronts her demons with a session with Dr Miller.

title: Revenant
desc: Allie refuses to guarantee Marie's safety after the Protection Unit gets shut down as the prison teeters on a knife edge, as news of Ferguson's survival sparks turmoil for the entire prison.

title: Fallout
desc: Judy incurs the wrath of Ann through Linda after she sabotages her presentation, while Allie is nervous when she has to contend with Lou's army of supporters and Ruby goes on the hunt to find Rita.

title: Fugitive
desc: Rita makes the ultimate sacrifice for Ruby, while Will clashes with Ann over day-to-day management of the prison, as Ferguson returns to Wentworth much to the dismay of inmates and staff.

title: Battle Lines
desc: On the edge of breaking point Allie finally faces Ferguson in an intense confrontation that brings back memories from years past. As Judy's father rejects her, she snaps with dangerous consequences.

title: Goldfish, Part 2
desc: The Prison remains on lockdown after Ann's attack, Joan continues treatment with Dr Miller, and the inmates are at breaking point resulting in a riot, as Linda suffers a flashback to the siege.

title: Monster
desc: Reb and Lou are rocked by a blast from the past with cult leader Sheila coming into the compound. Ferguson awaits news of her committal hearing as Vera enlists Allie to help her with devastating consequences.

title: The Enemy Within
desc: Vera makes a dangerous plan to bring down Ferguson, while Lou is on the warpath and is out for blood, as Allie realises her time as Top Dog is running out and Linda threatens to sue the department.

title: Rogue
desc: Allie returns to Wentworth.Marie enlists the help of Sheila to help take out Lou with tragic unforeseen circumstances. Boomer is asked to step up as top dog, while Sheila's case is closed when Reb and Lou lie to the police.

title: Requiem
desc: Marie and Lou become allies to bring down a monster with retribution coming at a deadly price. Rita and Ruby say an emotional goodbye to their father.

title: The Ties That Bind
desc: A furious Ann calls a meeting about the 'systemic mismanagement' under Will Jackson's governorship. Rita returns to Wentworth a broken woman, while Marie lies for Will about their affair to a committee.

title: Judas Kiss
desc: Judy crosses Ann yet again when a cruel prank backfires on her, while Eve Wilder makes an entrance with waves when she recognises Joan from her time at Blackmoore almost a decade ago.

title: The Unknown Terrorist
desc: Ann is furious to learn that salacious content is being filmed in the prison and orders strip searches as a result. Judy is finally exposed as Allie's attacker and faces the wrath of the inmates. Ferguson fuels Eve's Jake obsession.

title: One Eye Open
desc: With a dangerous plan that could bring down the prison Lou and Judy team up as Eve's obsession over Jake ends with Linda Miles making one of the most shocking discoveries of her career.

title: Collateral
desc: The staff are put on notice after a Rita lags to Will about Lou's threat to the officers. Gavin and Boomer's camera plan finally unravels when Gavin is caught out by Linda. Rita fears Marie may tell everyone about her past.

title: Will and Testament
desc: Evidence comes back to haunt Joan when the passports in her plan are found by the police. While tensions with the inmates reach an all time high when Rita's past is finally exposed to all the women

title: The Reckoning
desc: Joan surprises everyone when she pleads guilty in court to all her crimes. Marie's redemption comes in a horrific way. As Judy learns she was set up by the NSO, she wants the plan cancelled, but Lou has other plans.

title: Legacy
desc: In Wentworth's final hours the survivors of the prison bomb try and make their way to safety. as in the ruins one final battle rears its head. Wentworth's staff and inmates look to their futures in the ruins of chaos.

title: Space Pilot 3000
desc: A down-on-his-luck pizza delivery guy is accidentally frozen on New Year's Eve 1999, and wakes up in 2999.

title: The Series Has Landed
desc: For the crew's first mission, they must make a delivery to the moon, which is now home to a cheesy amusement park.

title: I, Roommate
desc: Fry is forced to choose between friendship and television when Bender's antenna impairs cable reception at their stylish new apartment building.

title: Love's Labours Lost in Space
desc: While on a mission to save animals from a doomed planet, Leela finds herself the object of a starship captain's amorous advances.

title: Fear of a Bot Planet
desc: Fry and Leela disguise themselves as robots to find Bender after he fails to return from a delivery to a robot planet, only to learn that he has become a celebrity in a culture which fears humans.

title: A Fishful of Dollars
desc: Fry discovers his bank account interest has made him a billionaire and buys the one thing the year 3000 doesn't have: anchovies.

title: My Three Suns
desc: Delivery Boy Philip J. Fry is promoted to Emperor after accidentally drinking his fluid-based predecessor.

title: A Big Piece of Garbage
desc: When a big ball of garbage from the 21st Century returns to threaten New New York, Philip is the only expert on making the weapon to fight it.

title: Hell Is Other Robots
desc: Bender joins a robot church after fighting an addiction to electricity, but reverts to his pre-addictive behavior of cigars, booze and robot hookers, leading to a musical confrontation with the Robot Devil.

title: A Flight to Remember
desc: The crew takes a vacation cruise on the maiden voyage of the new space Titanic.

title: Mars University
desc: Fry matriculates at Mars University and competes with a monkey made smart by Prof. Farnsworth's latest invention while Bender tries to make the local chapter of his robot fraternity cool.

title: When Aliens Attack
desc: A monumental attack from Lrrr of Omicron Persei 8 is precipitated by the loss of a television signal that Fry disrupted in 1999.

title: Fry and the Slurm Factory
desc: Fry wins a contest to visit the factory of his favorite addictive drink, but danger ensues when he accidentally discovers the real factory.

title: I Second That Emotion
desc: Bender flushes Nibbler down the toilet in a fit of jealousy, which prompts Professor Farnsworth to implant in him a chip that will allow him to feel empathy.

title: Brannigan, Begin Again
desc: Zapp Brannigan gets thrown out of the service for destroying a space meeting and as a result of this he begins to work for Planet Express.

title: A Head in the Polls
desc: When a mine disaster causes the market value of titanium to soar, Bender becomes highly profitable and sells his body.

title: Xmas Story
desc: Fry learns how Christmas has changed and remained the same over the last 1000 years when a Robot Santa terrorizes New New York.

title: Why Must I Be a Crustacean in Love?
desc: When the group begins to notice that Zoidberg is acting erratically, Professor Farnsworth deduces that it is mating season on his home planet.

title: Put Your Head on My Shoulders
desc: After a horrendous accident requires his body to be rebuilt, Fry's head is attached to the shoulder of a co-worker while Bender opens a dating service just in time for Valentine's Day.

title: The Lesser of Two Evils
desc: Suspicion falls on a new employee when a shipment goes missing.

title: Raging Bender
desc: Bender becomes a champion robot wrestler.

title: A Bicyclops Built for Two
desc: After learning that there is a second Cyclops still in existence, Leela travels back to her home World to ensure that her species does not go extinct.

title: How Hermes Requisitioned His Groove Back
desc: The Bureaucracy loves Hermes less while loving Fry loads more.

title: A Clone of My Own
desc: Prof. Farnsworth reveals that he cloned himself years ago and introduces his clone to the Planet Express staff.

title: The Deep South
desc: While stranded at the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean with the rest of the Planet Express crew, Fry meets a mermaid and quickly falls in love.

title: Bender Gets Made
desc: Bender gets inducted into the Robot mafia but has a crisis of conscience when their next score involves his friends on the Planet Express ship.

title: The Problem with Popplers
desc: The Planet Express crew discovers a delicious snack food on a remote planet, but Leela has a change of heart when she discovers a disturbing fact about the snack food that endangers Earth.

title: Mother's Day
desc: When Mom of Mom's Robot Factory takes control of every robot on Earth, the only man who can save the planet is Prof. Farnsworth.

title: Anthology of Interest I
desc: The Professor's "What If" machine answers 4 questions.

title: The Honking
desc: When the inheritance Bender claims in the Old Country isn't quite what he expected, the Planet Express crew has to find the source of an age-old curse.

title: War Is the H-Word
desc: Fry and Bender enroll in the Army to receive military discounts, but a war breaks out and the two friends are forced to serve on the front lines.

title: The Cryonic Woman
desc: Fry discovers his 20th-century girlfriend at the cryogenics lab, but problems arise when she wants them both to be refrozen for another 1,000 years.

title: Parasites Lost
desc: Ingesting a bad egg-salad sandwich leads to Fry developing a colony of parasitic worms in his bowels, which set out to make him smarter and stronger.

title: Amazon Women in the Mood
desc: Gigantic feminist Amazons give Fry, Kif, and Zap a grueling workout.

title: Bendless Love
desc: A sleep-walking Bender creates havoc with his uncontrollable bending and is sent to the Bending Factory where he meets Angelyne, a curvaceous fembot.

title: The Day the Earth Stood Stupid
desc: When flying brains invade, Fry is the only one who can save the Earth from destruction.

title: That's Lobstertainment!
desc: The Planet Express staff is amazed to learn that Dr. Zoidberg is related to a famous comedian. Bender convinces a robot soap opera star to finance a movie in the hopes of getting an acting award.

title: The Birdbot of Ice-Catraz
desc: The professor decides to ship hazardous cargo to the outer reaches of space, but the ship travels through some environmentally sensitive areas, including the penguin refuge on Pluto.

title: The Luck of the Fryrish
desc: Fry goes on a quest to recover his lucky 7-leaf clover after being convinced that his brother took over his identity after he was frozen.

title: The Cyber House Rules
desc: Leela returns to the Orphanarium and she meets with her friend Adlai Atkins after some years, and they begin to go out. Adlai is a surgeon and operates Leela to let her have two eyes, and Bender decides to adopt all the children at the Orphanarium to get money from the Government.

title: Insane in the Mainframe
desc: Fry and Bender are mistakenly convicted of robbing a bank and are both sent to a robot mental institution.

title: Bendin' in the Wind
desc: After being crippled, Bender gets a new career as a folk rock singer. Fry, Leela, Amy and Dr. Zoidberg follow him around the country.

title: Time Keeps on Slipping
desc: After being challenged to a game of basketball by the planet of the Globetrotters, Prof. Farnsworth creates a team of mutant, atomic supermen, but the side effects of their rapid growth endangers the universe.

title: I Dated a Robot
desc: Fry ignores the warnings of the Planet Express staff and starts dating a robot with the downloaded personality and holographic image of Lucy Liu. Leela and Bender make a disturbing discovery while trying to save Fry from his short-sighted decision.

title: Roswell That Ends Well
desc: Fry causes trouble for himself and the rest of the crew when he accidentally causes them all to be transported back in time to Roswell, New Mexico in 1947.

title: A Tale of Two Santas
desc: When Fry, Leela and Bender make a delivery to Neptune, they run afoul of the robot Santa Claus. Bender takes his place, but the previous Santa's fearsome reputation makes his job difficult.

title: Anthology of Interest II
desc: An anthology of three "what if" stories: what if Bender was human, what if life was more like a video game, and what if Leela found her true home.

title: Love and Rocket
desc: When the Planet Express ship gets a selectable personality upgrade, Bender chooses one and falls in love... but too briefly.

title: Leela's Homeworld
desc: The Planet Express crew must suffer the wrath of the mutants who live under the city after disposing too much toxic waste into the sewers.

title: Where the Buggalo Roam
desc: Intern Amy Wong's rich parents host the annual Mars Day picnic, but the original Martians have different plans, so Lieutenant Kif Kroker comes to the rescue.

title: A Pharaoh to Remember
desc: Bender worries that no one will remember him when he dies, but he encounters a chance to leave a legacy when he discovers a planet in need of a new pharaoh.

title: Godfellas
desc: When Bender is lost in space, he becomes home and spiritual leader to a race of worshipers who misinterpret his wisdom.

title: Future Stock
desc: Fry bonds with a revived 1980s guy who takes over Planet Express and takes on Mom's Delivery Company, but has a crisis of conscience when his new mentor plans to sell the company.

title: A Leela of Her Own
desc: A pickup game with the family-owned pizza place across the street leads to Leela being the first female Blernsball player, but she has to struggle to avoid being the worst player ever.

title: The 30% Iron Chef
desc: Bender goes on a quest to learn the secret of Ultimate Flavor so he can humiliate his former idol on television.

title: Where No Fan Has Gone Before
desc: Fry is placed on trial for his life because he traveled to the forbidden planet of Omega 3 to rescue all 79 episodes of "Star Trek".

title: Crimes of the Hot
desc: Earth is unable to offset its rising temperature through the usual process, which is the dropping of a giant ice cube into the ocean.

title: Jurassic Bark
desc: Fry discovers the intact fossilized remains of his pet dog from his old life. The Professor reveals he can clone the animal.

title: The Route of All Evil
desc: Prof. Farnsworth's and Hermes' 12 year old sons combine forces to take over Planet Express, but their ambition is more than their ability and they need their fathers' help to save the day.

title: A Taste of Freedom
desc: Dr. Zoidberg's exuberant celebration of Freedom Day makes him Public Enemy #1.

title: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
desc: Amy is distressed when her alien boyfriend Kif becomes pregnant.

title: Less Than Hero
desc: After using a tube of "miracle cream" Fry and Leela gain super powers and form "The New Justice Team" along with Bender.

title: Teenage Mutant Leela's Hurdles
desc: After an overdose at a health club makes the Planet Express staff get younger and younger, they have to find a mysterious Fountain of Aging. Meanwhile, Leela experiences the teenage life she never had with her parents.

title: The Why of Fry
desc: Fry learns that his accidental freezing 1004 years earlier wasn't an accident and he is given a choice that could prevent its happening, but at a cost.

title: The Sting
desc: Sent on the same mission which caused the deaths of the previous Planet Express crew, Leela mourns the apparent death of Fry.

title: The Farnsworth Parabox
desc: Prof. Farnworth creates a box which contains an entire universe and sends Leela into it, where she discovers another Planet Express with a few notable differences.

title: Three Hundred Big Boys
desc: Everyone on Earth gets $300 after the spoils of a military victory are distributed. The members of the Planet Express staff spend it on different things, with varying degrees of success.

title: Spanish Fry
desc: After being abducted by "human horn" poachers, Fry goes on a search for his missing nose.

title: Bend Her
desc: Bender enters the Olympics as a Fembot and has modifications to maintain the illusion, leading to a romantic encumbrance with a soap opera star.

title: Obsoletely Fabulous
desc: The introduction of a new type of robot makes Bender rethink his devotion to technology.

title: Bender Should Not Be Allowed on TV
desc: Bender becomes a star on his favorite soap opera by forgetting his lines and reverting to character, but becomes concerned about the effect he is having on the audience.

title: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
desc: Fry makes a deal with the Robot Devil so he can get robot hands to play the holophoner and impress Leela. In a twist of fate, Fry trades hands with the Robot Devil and writes a masterpiece opera about Leela. However, the Robot Devil has evil plans of his own.

title: Bender's Big Score: Part 1
desc: The crew fall for a scam while relaxing on the Nude Beach planet and end up losing both Planet Express and Bender. While Hermes has a nasty accident and Nibbler summons the Nibblonian forces to try save the day.

title: Bender's Big Score: Part 2
desc: The scammers start using time travel to steal valuable items from the past, Professor Farnsworth enlists the Globetrotters' help, Zoidberg tries to help Hermes recover, Leela goes on a date, and Bender is sent back in time to kill Fry.

title: Bender's Big Score: Part 3
desc: Fry lives his alternate life in the past, Bender returns to the crew having been released by the scammers. Hermes has another accident and Leela gets engaged during a rampage by Robot Santa, but will the wedding go smoothly.

title: Bender's Big Score: Part 4
desc: When the Scammers pull a last scam to take ownership of Earth, everyone is forced off planet. Can they all band together to regain their home planet and also stop the numerous time paradox's causing a huge catastrophe?

title: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 1
desc: Amy and Kif have a ceremony to become part of the same clan and Fry moves in with his new girlfriend discovering she has a very differing lifestyle to his. While the Earth's scientists debate what to do about the rift in space.

title: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 2
desc: Bender starts stalking Calculon and ends up introduced to a special group. A depressed Fry enters the rift, while Farnsworth teams up with rival Wernstrom to collaborate on the rift problem. And tragedy strikes close to home for the crew.

title: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 4
desc: Bender takes control of the League of Robots and makes a deal with the Robot Devil for an army. While everyone else makes a deal with Yivo to get along together, but things don't go smoothly for long when Bender attacks.

title: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 3
desc: A tentacle monster bursts forth from the rift with Fry as it's mouthpiece and it intends to join with all people on Earth. The Planet Express crew plan to stop the takeover and rescue Fry but can they succeed and will Bender help them?

title: Bender's Game: Part 1
desc: Leela has to work on her anger issues after being goaded into entering a Space Demolition Derby with the Planet Express ship and Bender has to work on his lack of imagination after seeing the kids have fun playing Dungeons and Dragons.

title: Bender's Game: Part 2
desc: The Planet Express crew learn Mom is profiting by creating a fake shortage of Dark Matter and set out to stop her but can the Professor recall where he put an important energy crystal. And Bender undergoes therapy at a Robot Insane Asylum.

title: Bender's Game: Part 3
desc: When Bender's out of control imagination mixes with the Die of Power it creates an alternate Lord of the Rings influenced universe where the Planet Express crew must go on a journey across strange lands to destroy the Die of Power.

title: Bender's Game: Part 4
desc: The Planet Express crew continue their journey to destroy the Die of Power, which has a negative effect on Fry. Mom and her sons make a last gambit to get the Die for themselves and Leela tries to convince the Centaurs to join the battle.

title: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 1
desc: When a new Mars Vegas is built, the crew wrangle invites to the opening weekend and the 3009 Universal Poker Championship. Fry discovers he has a new ability to read people's thoughts and Bender starts a secret affair with Donbot's wife.

title: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 3
desc: Bender and Zapp Brannigan team up to capture Leela by using an unwitting Fry. Fry learns more about the Dark Ones, who strike at a new victim. And the Nimbus chases the Feministas across the miniature golf course galaxy.

title: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 2
desc: Leo Wong is building a galaxy sized miniature golf course regardless of the damage it causes, so Leela joins some protesters to oppose him, while Fry joins a group with the same goal of stopping Leo, but President Nixon has other ideas.

title: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 4
desc: The Feministas face the Supreme Court over their 'crimes' but Bender has his own ideas about their fate. As Leo Wong prepares to destroy the Violet Dwarf Star, Fry must decide what the right thing to do is. Then the Dark One arrives.

title: Rebirth
desc: After the events of Over The Wild Green Yonder, Leela is put in an irreversible coma. Fry must find a way to cope with his loss, so he builds a robotic Leela.

title: In-A-Gadda-Da-Leela
desc: Zapp and Leela are alone on an unknown planet after their mission to destroy a death star fails, while the rest of the gang tries to save Earth from being the star's next victim.

title: Attack of the Killer App
desc: Fry and Bender compete to see who can get the most fans on their Twitter-like application on their new eyePhones, not knowing that it's actually part of Mom's evil conspiracy to unleash a new virus on people's brains.

title: Proposition Infinity
desc: Amy gets together with Bender after she breaks up with Kif, which catches the ire of Dr. Farnsworth and others who oppose human/robot relationships.

title: The Duh-Vinci Code
desc: Professor Farnsworth accidentally uncovers the blueprint for a mysterious Leonardo da Vinci invention, and he and his crew travel to Rome for answers.

title: Lethal Inspection
desc: Bender discovers that he has no backup capabilities--meaning that he is mortal, and he and Hermes travel to Mexico so that he can take out his frustrations on his inspector.

title: The Late Philip J. Fry
desc: Fry agrees to travel one minute into the future in Farnsworth's new time machine right before a big date with Leela, but they wind up going far into the future with no way to go back in time.

title: That Darn Katz!
desc: A sinister cat uses Amy's failed dissertation to launch his plan to save his home planet by destroying Earth.

title: A Clockwork Origin
desc: After a dispute with creationists, Farnsworth flees with the others to a remote, uninhabited planet. Upon releasing microrobots in a pond, non-organic life begins to evolve on the planet.

title: The Prisoner of Benda
desc: The Professor's body swapping experiment produces a result he didn't have in mind.

title: Lrrreconcilable Ndndifferences
desc: Lrrr is being pressured to conquer Earth.

title: The Mutants Are Revolting
desc: Fry accidentally reveals that Leela is a mutant, so she is banished to the sewers where all mutants must live. Not willing to accept this, Leela and Fry organize the mutant uprising against this segregation.

title: The Futurama Holiday Spectacular
desc: Three separate holiday stories: X-mas, Robanaca and Kwanzaa. 1. Once more Robot Santa comes to town. Besides the violence he spreads, this time he sings to the crew of the pine tree that are needed for a proper "X-mas". The only problem is that the pine trees have been extinct for over 800 years. However they manage to get some seeds, reforesting the earth. As the oxy... Read all

title: Neutopia
desc: To avoid an imminent bankruptcy, the "Planet Express" is converted into an airline company, but on its the first flight the airliner crash-lands on a strange planet.

title: Benderama
desc: Professor invents a device that creates two half-sized duplicates of any object. Bender uses this device to create copies of himself, so he doesn't have to work, but things quickly get out of control.

title: Ghost in the Machines
desc: Fry believes that a human life is more important than a robot life, so Bender decides to kill himself again, only this time he really follows through. But instead of dying he turns into a ghost that haunts Fry.

title: Law and Oracle
desc: Fry realizes he's stuck in a dead-end job, so he quits and enrolls in the police academy.

title: The Silence of the Clamps
desc: Bender testifies in open court against Donbot, and has to go into Witness Relocation Program, because the entire robot mafia is now after him.

title: Yo Leela Leela
desc: Against all odds, Leela manages to write a successful children story, which becomes a huge TV hit. But Leela's success comes with a secret.

title: All the Presidents' Heads
desc: The crew changes the outcome of the American revolution when they travel back in time.

title: Möbius Dick
desc: While traveling through the Bermuda Tetrahedron, the crew encounters a giant 4-dimensional space whale.

title: Fry Am the Egg Man
desc: Leela buys some alien eggs, and Fry decides to hatch one of them instead of eating it, hoping to get a pet bird, but gets something else instead.

title: The Tip of the Zoidberg
desc: The Professor consistently refuses to fire Zoidberg, despite his complete incompetence in medicine. The reason for such devotion is finally revealed.

title: Cold Warriors
desc: Fry gets the common cold, which is bad news for the 31st century Earth, where the common cold has been extinct for a long time, so no one is immune to it.

title: Overclockwise
desc: Cubert overclocks Bender's CPU to make him more powerful, but that creates some unexpected results. Meanwhile, Leela decides to dump Fry and move on.

title: Reincarnation
desc: The episode contains three separate stories. In the first, which parodies the 1930s B&W cartoons, Fry wants to propose to Leela, so he blows up a comet made of "dimondium" to make her a diamond ring. In the second, which parodies the 1980s video games, the Professor invents a microscope with an infinite magnification and learns all the secrets of the Universe, which p... Read all

title: The Bots and the Bees
desc: Bender fathers a child with the office beverage machine.

title: A Farewell to Arms
desc: Earth gets evacuated after a prediction of the end of the planet.

title: Decision 3012
desc: The Planet Express crew gets involved in the running campaigns for the new world presidency.

title: The Thief of Baghead
desc: Bender gets his friends in trouble by becoming a paparazzo.

title: Zapp Dingbat
desc: Leela's parents break up and while Leela's mother starts dating, her father picks up his youth where he left it off.

title: The Butterjunk Effect
desc: Leela and Amy get involved in the tough world of the Butterfly sport.

title: The Six Million Dollar Mon
desc: After Hermes gets replaced by a machine he gets himself upgraded to become useful again for the company.

title: Fun on a Bun
desc: When Fry gets trapped in ice during Oktoberfest he is mistaken for a caveman and accepted in the isolated world of the Neanderthals. Convinced he is a Neanderthal himself he decides to plot a war against the stuck up Homo Sapiens.

title: Free Will Hunting
desc: After Bender realizes he has no power over the decisions he makes, he goes on a soul searching trip to liberate himself from the shackles of his pre-deterministic operation system.

title: Near-Death Wish
desc: After Fry had a quarrel with Dr Farnsworth about family issues, Fry decides to look up Dr Farnsworths' parents to enjoy the family he never had.

title: Viva Mars Vegas
desc: The Planet Express crew goes gambling in Mars Vegas where they risk far more than losing their chips.

title: 31st Century Fox
desc: When Bender joins the local Fox Hunting Club ethical questions about killing things arise.

title: Naturama
desc: A humorous mockumentary about nature.

title: 2-D Blacktop
desc: After Planet Express ship is scrapped, professor saves it from the junkyard and rebuilds it into a super racer. But an accident during a race sends the ship into a two-dimensional universe.

title: Fry and Leela's Big Fling
desc: Fry and Leela try to have some private time, but no matter where they go someone gets in their way. Finally they pay for a secluded romantic getaway, which turns out to be even worse.

title: T.: The Terrestrial
desc: The crew goes to Omicron Persei 8, where Fry is left behind, and rescued by a local boy, but his only wish is to go home.

title: Forty Percent Leadbelly
desc: Bender finally fulfills his dream of becoming a folk singer by creating a copy of a famous guitar, but then something goes terribly wrong.

title: The Inhuman Torch
desc: Bender accidentally becomes a firefighting hero, and loves it so much that he becomes a full-time firefighter. And he has plenty of opportunities to display his heroism, because fires mysteriously start everywhere he goes.

title: Saturday Morning Fun Pit
desc: President Nixon is watching his favorite TV shows, which spoof three actual cartoon series using Futurama characters.

title: Calculon 2.0
desc: Fry and Bender resurrect Calculon to make "All My Circuits" interesting again. But things don't go exactly as planned.

title: Assie Come Home
desc: Bender searches the entire universe for his shiny metal rear end.

title: Leela and the Genestalk
desc: The reason why Turanga Munda appears more mutated than in her original appearance is explained.

title: Game of Tones
desc: The Planet Express crew journeys into Fry's dreams to pull off a mission in the year 1999.

title: Murder on the Planet Express
desc: The crew get trapped aboard the Planet Express ship with a horrific alien creature.

title: Stench and Stenchibility
desc: Zoidberg's budding romance with a flower shop owner who cannot smell his unpleasant odor is tested when he's given the opportunity to give her a nose transplant.

title: Meanwhile
desc: Professor Farnsworth invents a button that can take a person 10 seconds back in time, inadvertently causing major consequences.

title: The Terrible Secret of Turtle Bay
desc: Dr. Venture, his teen sons Hank and Dean, and their bodyguard Brock head to New York to unveil Dr. Venture's new invention. They are pursued by a ninja intent on acquiring the device.

title: Dia de los Dangerous
desc: Dr. Venture and his family are in Mexico, where the boys get kidnapped by the Monarch's henchmen. Brock goes on a rampage to get them back and Dr. Venture wakes up in a bathtub of ice to find he has no kidneys.

title: Careers in Science
