desc: Dubbed the Ninth Wonder of the World, Jonas Venture's space station, Gargantua-1, has developed a problem, and Dr. Thaddeus Venture must fix his father's creation.

title: Home Insecurity
desc: Brock goes on a wilderness retreat, and gets more than he bargained for when he encounters the Army searching for something. Meanwhile, the Venture family retreats to the panic room when the forces of both The Monarch and Baron Ünderbheit attack.

title: The Incredible Mr. Brisby
desc: Dr. Venture takes the X1 to "Brisbyland" for a meeting with the theme park owner Roy Brisby. But the boys get kidnapped by the "Orange County Liberation Front" and Brock and his former lover and secret agent Molotov Cocktease mount a rescue.

title: Eeney, Meeney, Miney... Magic!
desc: The boys discover a dangerous pod in the lab that projects your fantasies, thus trapping you inside. Dr. Byron Orpheus is introduced as well as his daughter, Trianna, whom Dean becomes enamored with immediately.

title: Ghosts of the Sargasso
desc: Dr. Venture and his family encounter pirates while trying to recover an old crashed aircraft made by Dr. Jonas Venture decades earlier.

title: Ice Station Impossible
desc: Pete White, Master Billy Quizboy, and Dr. Venture are recruited by their old college professor, Dr. Richard Impossible, to work for him doing super-science at his remote arctic lab. But when Hank is infected by one of Dr. Impossible's old serums, Brock must race to locate the lab and save Hank's life.

title: Mid-Life Chrysalis
desc: While trying to relive his younger days, Dr. Venture is seduced by Dr. Girlfriend in disguise as part of The Monarch's evil plan. Brock learns he has to renew his license to kill.

title: Are You There God, It's Me, Dean
desc: While Brock and Hank are held hostage by The Monarch, Master Billy Quizboy and Pete White are called in to help diagnose a mysterious painful illness afflicting Dean.

title: Tag-Sale: You're It!
desc: To raise much-needed cash, Dr. Venture holds a yard sale for his father's old, unwanted super-science equipment and inventions. Brock and other agents from the Office of Secret Intelligence maintain security as many of Venture's arch-nemeses attend, but The Monarch has other plans.

title: Past Tense
desc: Hank and Dean learn about Brock and Dr. Venture's early days as they attend a funeral for Mike Sorayama, an old college buddy they used to tease. But the funeral proves to be a ruse by Sorayama to exact revenge for their torment.

title: The Trial of the Monarch
desc: The Monarch finds himself on trial for a murder, but it soon becomes clear that the "Guild of Calamitous Intent" may be behind the whole thing.

title: Return to Spider-Skull Island
desc: While Hank and Dean run away from home to seek their independence, an old enemy of Dr. Venture's, long thought destroyed, returns seeking vengeance.

title: A Very Venture Christmas
desc: It's Christmas and the Ventures are having their annual party. But the festivities are interrupted by the Dean who accidentally summons a Christmas demon, and the Monarch who plans to blow up the Venture home.

title: Powerless in the Face of Death
desc: Life goes on after the tragic deaths of Hank and Dean. Meanwhile, the Monarch deals with life "inside" but you can't keep a good criminal mastermind down. But will King Gorilla prove to be his greatest ally, or his worst betrayer?

title: Hate Floats
desc: The Monarch has escaped from prison, and the Henchmen re-assemble to serve him. Dr. Venture takes Dean to a shopping mall and the family gets ambushed by the Monarch who was there attempting to win back Dr. Girlfriend.

title: Assassinanny 911
desc: Molotov Cocktease fills in at the Venture compound as Brock goes on a mission to terminate a rogue agent. While Molotov tries to beat some masculinity into Dr. Venture and his sons, we learn something of Brock's past through flashbacks.

title: Escape to the House of Mummies Part II
desc: Team Venture find themselves trapped in the clutches of a bloodthirsty Egyptian cult and their time machine. Dr. Venture narrowly escapes and teams up with Master Billy Quizboy and Pete White, but promptly forgets to mount a rescue. So it's up to Brock and a pantheon of history's greatest men to find another way out.

title: Twenty Years to Midnight
desc: While a mysterious extra-terrestrial Inquisitor evaluates human culture, Dr. Venture discovers an old video recording from his father informing him he must, before tomorrow night, locate and assemble the hidden pieces to a device that will save the Earth from certain doom.

title: Victor. Echo. November.
desc: Hilarity ensues when the Phantom Limb and Dr. Girlfriend try to patch up their differences with the Monarch by going on a double-date with him and his Internet date.

title: Love-Bheits
desc: Baron Underbheit returns as the Venture Bros jet crashes in Underland. The Baron seeks revenge on Dr. Venture and attempts to marry Dean, who is dressed in a Princess Leia slave girl costume when they are captured.

title: Fallen Arches
desc: Dr. Orpheus is awarded an official "Guild of Calamitous Intent" arch villain. He assembles his team of three and auditions his prospective villain at the Venture compound.

title: Guess Who's Coming to State Dinner?
desc: Gargantuan 1 crashes and Col. Bud Manstrong survives and hailed as a national hero. He and the Ventures are then honored at the White House. But the ghost of Abraham Lincoln appears suspecting an attempt will be made to assassinate the President.

title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Kills
desc: The boys are kidnapped by a woman claiming to be their mother. Dr. Orpheus helps Dr. Venture get rid of a Japanese demon that is tied to him.

title: ¡Viva los muertos!
desc: While Dr. Venture constructs his Venturestien Monster, Brock has an existential crisis and a parody "Scooby Gang" arrives, looking to solve a "Mystery". Hilarity, violence, tripping on some vine juice, and a general pissing on Scooby Doo.

title: Showdown at Cremation Creek: Part 1
desc: The Monarch proposes to Dr. Girlfriend. Thanks to the hasty actions of the Henchmen, the entire Venture family finds themselves participating in the wedding. Phantom Limb crashes the party, threatening to destroy everyone unless the wedding is called off.

title: Showdown at Cremation Creek: Part 2
desc: The second part of the season finale. Battle begins between Phantom Limb and the Monarch wedding party. Brock takes charge of the Henchmen in an effort to rescue Dr. Girlfriend.

title: Shadowman 9: In the Cradle of Destiny
desc: The truths and half-truths about Dr. Venture's former arch nemeses are finally revealed

title: The Doctor Is Sin
desc: Dr. Venture learns that a life with no arch enemy is not nearly so sweet

title: The Invisible Hand of Fate
desc: At long last, The Venture Bros. peels away the onion-like shrouds of time for a look back into the troubled past of America's most beloved hydrocephalic former boy genius, to reveal dark secrets that even he didn't know about.

title: Home Is Where the Hate Is
desc: Dr. Venture receives an unorthodox introduction to his new Guild-assigned nemesis

title: The Buddy System
desc: Dr. Venture, in a bid to make some much-needed money, opens up the compound as "Rusty's Day Camp for Boy Adventurers."

title: Dr. Quymn, Medicine Woman
desc: Love is in the air, kind of, when Dr. Venture encounters his childhood friend, Dr. Tara Quymn, in the Amazon Rain Forest.

title: What Goes Down Must Come Up
desc: Ventures are about to learn the hard way that beneath the foundations of the Venture Compound lie deep, dark secrets.

title: Tears of a Sea Cow
desc: The Monarch seeks to re-spark his old hatred by secretly visiting the Venture Compound

title: Now Museum - Now You Don't!
desc: Jonas Jr. converts Spider Skull Island into a Team Venture Museum.

title: The Lepidopterists
desc: The Monarch launches his first attack on his new arch nemesis, the other Dr. Venture.

title: ORB
desc: Brock discovers that his long-standing role as Dr. Venture's bodyguard may not have been the assignment he always thought it was.

title: The Family That Slays Together, Stays Together: Part 1
desc: Brock Samson is a marked man.

title: The Family That Slays Together, Stays Together: Part 2
desc: Heads will fly as the explosive conclusion of The Venture Bros. two-part season finale finds Brock and the Venture family on the run from the Law, The Monarch, Sgt. Hatred and the entire O.S.I!

title: Blood of the Father, Heart of Steel
desc: Questions are answered and truths are revealed.

title: Handsome Ransom
desc: The Monarch attempts to strike Dr Venture where it hurts, by kidnapping Hank & Dean and holding them for a $10M ransom. The plan is foiled when rainbow hero Captain Sunshine arrives to rescues Hank, making him his new sidekick, Wonder Boy.

title: Perchance to Dean
desc: Hank, along with is friend, Dermott, start breaking all of the Venture Compound Rules in a bid to get his father's attention.

title: Return to Malice
desc: Henchman 21, determined to find out who murdered his friend, Henchman 24, kidnaps Hank and Dean and subjects them to the dreaded Chinese water torture. Meanwhile, the Monarch eats a fancy salad and has a reaction to one of the ingredients.

title: The Revenge Society
desc: The Guild of Calamitous Intent comes under attack from an old foe with a new name, Revenge.

title: Self-Medication
desc: Dr. Venture's therapy group, a collection of former Boy Adventurers (who have become failed adults), quickly fall back into their old habits when a mystery is literally dropped into their session.

title: The Better Man
desc: The Orpheus Family is caught between the problems of their past and future as Dr. Orpheus must rescue the man he hates the most from Hell and Triana stands at the crossroads of her destiny.

title: Pinstripes and Poltergeists
desc: The Monarch makes his move on Dr. Venture, just as he's distracted by problems with zoning regulations.

title: The Diving Bell vs. the Butterglider
desc: The semi-season opener finds Dr. Venture semi-paralyzed in a trauma-induced coma.

title: Pomp and Circuitry
desc: Hank and Dean finally graduate from their learning beds. But what's next? College? The army? Life on the outside sees the boys taking two very different career paths -- and one of them leads straight to the Phantom Limb.

title: Every Which Way But Zeus
desc: Somebody has been kidnapping the world's super-scientists and super-villains. But whom? And to what end? The OSI, SPHINX, The Guild of Calamitous Intent and The Revenge Society must put aside their differences and convene a secret think tank to solve a mystery of epic proportions.

title: Everybody Comes to Hank's
desc: With Dean off to New York for a summer internship, Hank is forced by his father to get a job.

title: Bright Lights, Dean City
desc: Dean's summer internship in New York City turns deadly when he learns his new employer harbors a dark secret. Meanwhile, Doc's newfound love of show tunes makes him an easy target for the newly re-formed Revenge Society.

title: Assisted Suicide
desc: Dr. Venture isn't feeling himself lately...he's killing himself. Orpheus suspects it's an inside job and pries the Venture family from their touch football game to help him teach Doc the value of self-love.

title: The Silent Partners
desc: The men of Conjectural Technologies learn that success comes with a price when Billy is kidnapped by the mysterious and extra-creepy investors behind their recent windfall. But who is behind the investors? SPHINX would like to know.

title: Operation P.R.O.M.
desc: The Venture boys embrace society's most feared school dance in this hour long danger-pile. Will they live to look back at their rented suits with horror?

title: From the Ladle to the Grave: The Shallow Gravy Story
desc: See the Venture Family as you've never seen them before: in an 11 minute documentary-style animated UNCENSORED special. Follow the meteoric rise, the equally meteoric fall, and the decidedly un-meteor-like second coming of the most important band Hank Venture, Dermott Fictel and H.E.L.P.eR. robot have ever been in--Shallow Gravy. If you're hungry for rock, then open wide--because here comes a ladle of heavy metal fire and metaphoric meat drippings!

title: A Very Venture Halloween
desc: Halloween Special of The Venture Bros.

title: What Color Is Your Cleansuit?
desc: Dr. Venture hires an army of college interns to help with his ambitious new science project. Dean finds love among the new recruits, but class warfare and nuclear physics threaten to tear the Venture Compound apart. And if they don't, The Monarch will.

title: Venture Libre
desc: One of Dr. Venture's old inventions seems to have gotten a mind of its own, so General Manhowers sends him to Central America to fix it. The Ventures must all confront their own hearts of darkness if they're to survive what's waiting for them in the jungle.

title: Sphinx Rising
desc: Henchman 21's command of Team SPHINX is starting to rub the O.S.I. the wrong way, and his new recruits are rubbing them even wronger.

title: Spanakopita
desc: Every year, since he was a little boy, Dr. Venture flies to the tiny island of Spanikos for a week of fun in the Grecian sun.

title: O.S.I. Love You
desc: Brock and the O.S.I. come under fire from the higher ups when they lose two high value super-criminal prisoners.

title: Momma's Boys
desc: A friendship built on lies threatens to unravel Dr. Venture's sanity.

title: Bot Seeks Bot
desc: Brock and the O.S.I. launch a bold and bizarre surveillance mission against one of the Council of 13's top members.

title: The Devil's Grip
desc: Dr. Venture is missing... presumed dead.

title: All This and Gargantua-2
desc: Join the Ventures-and pretty much everyone they've ever crossed paths with-as they rocket to the Gargantua-2 space station for an epic adventure that will change the Ventureverse as we know it.

title: Hostile Makeover
desc: The Ventures are back! And they're movin' on up to a deluxe apartment in the sky. But will mo' money bring mo' problems? And can The Monarch handle the commute?

title: Maybe No Go
desc: As White & Billy grapple with their arch enemy back in the old 'hood, Doc realizes he can't face his new responsibilities alone when a whale of an enemy shows him how they arch uptown.

title: Faking Miracles
desc: Doc discovers a mysterious invention that could make or break Dean's chances of getting into college, while The Monarch makes a bad first impression on Dr. Mrs. The Monarch's co-workers.

title: Rapacity in Blue
desc: A brutish supervillain launches an assault on the Ventures. Will Doc's latest invention, or a mysterious blue vigilante, save the day? Probably not.

title: Tanks for Nuthin'
desc: Billy and Dr. Venture are the laughing stock of the internet. Meanwhile the death of a G.U.I.L.D. member has Dr. Mrs. The Monarch investigating who this new blue vigilante truly is.

title: It Happening One Night
desc: A legion of avant-garde supervillains redefines the art of arching Dr. Venture while Hank looks for love in a den of ninjas.

title: A Party for Tarzan
desc: In a case of mistaken identity, the Guild targets Dr. Venture for assassination, pooping his party for a fancy new friend.

title: Red Means Stop
desc: The Guild of Calamitous Intent sets a trap for Blue Morpho with a notorious villain as the bait. Meanwhile, two battered men struggle to escape from their mysterious imprisonment.

title: The Venture Bros. and the Curse of the Haunted Problem
desc: The past is haunting the Venture building, literally. Can a good exorcism fix everything? Meanwhile, Hank is pressured by goons to break off his relationship with their mobster boss' daughter.

title: The Rorqual Affair
desc: Deadly waters surround the Monarch when he becomes Wide Wale's prisoner in Part 2 of the Morphic Trilogy.

title: Arrears in Science
desc: The Morphic Trilogy reaches its stunning conclusion in a decades-spanning tale of friendship, betrayal, and mass murder that overwrites Venture history.

title: The High Cost of Loathing
desc: The Monarch faces financial challenges as he attempts to rebuild his fiendish organization, while Dean attempts to build a normal life out of his father's shadow at college.

title: The Inamorata Consequence
desc: Dr. Venture moderates the second annual Treaty of Tolerance Summit (at the old Venture compound) where the Guild of Calamitous Intent and the O.S.I. argue over new agreements. Meanwhile, both Dean and Hank go on side adventures around the compound.

title: The Bellicose Proxy
desc: Monarch and 21 train their first arch as part of their induction into the Guild; Dr. Mrs. the Monarch deals with the mole.

title: The Unicorn in Captivity
desc: Dr. Venture's latest invention is a real game-changer. And the new game is deadly!

title: The Terminus Mandate
desc: Mrs. Monarch finds out from the Guild Council charter that they must either retire as villains, and commit one last arch each, or leave the Guild Council. Dr. Venture tries to get laid by a black widower.

title: The Forecast Manufacturer
desc: On behalf the Guild, Mr. and Mrs. Monarch and 21 go to take out the PP leader. Dr. Venture and Billy go investigate a stolen Guild weather machine. Hank goes out to rescue his girlfriend.

title: The Saphrax Protocol
desc: Deep inside Guild Headquarters, The Monarch and 21 face their ultimate ordeal. Meanwhile, the Venture Brothers face one of their own.

title: Arrival
desc: After resigning, a secret agent finds himself trapped in a bizarre prison known only as The Village.

title: The Chimes of Big Ben
desc: A new Number Eight named Nadia arrives in the Village, and together she and Number Six plot their escape.

title: A. B. and C.
desc: Number Two believes that Number Six resigned because he was going to sell out. Using dream manipulation, Number Two tries to determine which one of three possible candidates Number Six was dealing with.

title: Free for All
desc: Number Six runs for the office of Number Two.

title: The Schizoid Man
desc: Number Six wakes up with a new identity. Now he's Number Twelve. Worse, Number Two asks him to impersonate someone--Number Six. But the new Number Six is more like him than he is.

title: The General
desc: An instant learning process becomes the Village's latest fad, but Number Six is sure that Number Two is using it as a brain washing tool.

title: Many Happy Returns
desc: Number Six wakes up to find the Village totally deserted.

title: Dance of the Dead
desc: Number Six comes across a body that has washed ashore with a radio. After sending the body back out to sea, he tries to use the radio to get rescued.

title: Checkmate
desc: Inspired by a large chess game with people taking the place of the game pieces, Number Six formulates a new escape plan with some compatriots.

title: Hammer Into Anvil
desc: Number Six vows revenge and goes after a sadistic Number Two after he drives a fellow Village resident to her death.

title: It's Your Funeral
desc: Number Six hears of an assassination plot against Number Two, but it's the new Number Two doing all the plotting against the retiring Number Two.

title: Do Not Forsake Me Oh My Darling
desc: With his mind transferred to another body, Number Six wakes up in his London flat and can't convince his colleagues who he is. He takes off to Austria to find the one man who can help him, the person whom Number Two wants him to find.

title: Living in Harmony
desc: In a Wild West setting, a lawman who resigned is trapped in a town called Harmony where the Judge wants him to be the new sheriff - by hook or by crook.

title: A Change of Mind
desc: After a brawl, Number Six is declared "unmutual" and is made to think that he has undergone "instant social treatment."

title: The Girl Who Was Death
desc: Back in London, Number Six is trying to track down a crazed scientist who is protected by his homicidal daughter.

title: Once Upon a Time
desc: Because all other attempts to break Number Six have failed, Number Two decides to engage him in a game where one of them will end up dead.

title: Fall Out
desc: After witnessing the trials of Number Two and Number Forty-Eight and meeting the President of the Assembly, Number Six escapes during the chaos that follows.

title: Regular Show
desc: Mordecai the blue jay and Rigby the raccoon play paper rock scissors for a chair, but they get into a 100 times tie.

title: The Power
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby need a raise to fix a hole in their bedroom wall, they use a magical keyboard that allows them to do anything they want.

title: Just Set Up the Chairs
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to prove to Benson that they are not "slackers" by actually completing a job given to them, setting up the chairs for a kid's birthday party.

title: Caffeinated Coffee Tickets
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try work overtime to earn enough money to buy tickets to a Fist Pump concert, but when they run out of coffee to keep them awake, they enlist the help of a business man and a coffee-bean to keep the coffee flowing.

title: Death Punchies
desc: When Rigby becomes tired of losing at "punchies", he visits Death Kwon Do, a mediocre martial-arts clinic, to learn a move that will enable him to win.

title: Free Cake
desc: Mordecai and Rigby find a plate that they think would look good with cake, but when they don't have enough money for any, they use Skips' upcoming birthday as an excuse to throw a party and to eat the chocolate cake at the snack bar.

title: Meat Your Maker
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to look for hot dogs in the meat locker when they burn the ones that Benson bought, but Rigby's incompetence ends up getting them locked in.

title: Grilled Cheese Deluxe
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby eat Benson's grilled cheese sandwich, Benson makes them buy another one. Unaware that it was Benson's sandwich because of Rigby's lie, Mordecai makes a bet to see who can lie the most without getting caught.

title: The Unicorns Have Got to Go
desc: Mordecai buys a special cologne to get the attention of Margaret, but it ends up attracting partying unicorns instead.

title: Prank Callers
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby try to prove that they are good prank callers by pranking the "Master Prank Caller", they are inadvertently transported into the 80's.

title: Don
desc: Rigby gets jealous of his brother, Don, when he visits the park to stop an audit and is forced to deal with him until he leaves.

title: Rigby's Body
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby are told that all the snacks in the snack bar are free for employees, they go on a junk-food spree. But, the next day, when Mordecai cops-out, Rigby continues to eat junk-food, and his body, literally, leaves him.

title: Mordecai and the Rigbys
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby make a fake band, they accidentally enter for a live performance, even though they haven't a clue how to play any instruments.

title: Ello Gov'nor
desc: After watching a scary movie about a British Taxi, the guys have to help Rigby overcome his fears.

title: It's Time
desc: When Mordecai turns down Rigby's invite to see a horror movie premiere to go to a chick-flick with Margaret, Rigby gets revenge on him by taking advantage of his shyness to ask Margaret on a date before he can.

title: Appreciation Day
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby realize that Benson doesn't appreciate them, they change Benson's description of them in the Book of Park Records so they don't seem like bad employees to future bosses.

title: Peeps
desc: Benson buys a surveillance system to track Mordecai and Rigby's every move when their constant slacking pushes him to the breaking point.

title: Dizzy
desc: When Maellard asks Pops, his son, to give a speech, Mordecai and Rigby try to help him overcome his stage fright.

title: My Mom
desc: Mordecai and Rigby are forced to work under Muscle Man and endure his repetitive jokes.

title: High Score
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to earn respect by increasing their skills on "Broken Bones", an arcade game in the Coffee Shop.

title: Rage Against the TV
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby make it to the final level in a video-game, their T.V. screen goes black. Now they must find a new T.V. so they can finish the game.

title: Party Pete
desc: Mordecai and Rigby look for help when their awesome house party turns lame.

title: Brain Eraser
desc: When Mordecai accidentally sees Pops naked, Rigby tries to find a way to get the image out of his head.

title: Benson Be Gone
desc: Maellard, feeling Benson is to blame for Mordecai and Rigby's mistakes, demotes him and forces him to work alongside Mordecai and Rigby.

title: But I Have a Receipt
desc: Mordecai and Rigby expose a bad board game's flaws when the owner refuses to give them a refund.

title: This Is My Jam
desc: Rigby gets a terrible, terrible song stuck in his head and will go to any lengths to get it out.

title: Muscle Woman
desc: When Muscleman gets dumped by his girlfriend Starla, he becomes too depressed to do anything, and his work is given to Mordecai and Rigby. They try to get the two back together when the work becomes too much.

title: Temp Check
desc: Rigby hires a temp to do his work but gets jealous when the temp becomes tight with Mordecai.

title: Jinx
desc: Rigby must figure out how to unjinx himself without talking.

title: See You There
desc: Mordecai and Rigby find out that everyone has been invited by Muscle Man to High Five Ghost's birthday party except them. They decide to go anyway.

title: Do Me a Solid
desc: When Mordecai forces Rigby to go on a double-date with Eileen, Margaret and himself, Rigby accepts, but only if Mordecai owes him ten "solids", or "instant-favors", and plans to use them to sabotage Mordecai's date.

title: Grave Sight
desc: Mordecai and Rigby plan to host a scary-movie night at the abandoned cemetery in the park so they can raise enough funds to earn a paid-day off.

title: Really Real Wrestling
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to take care of Pops, and miss the biggest wrestling match of the year, after they hurt him while wrestling.

title: Over the Top
desc: Skips accidentally kills Rigby while arm wrestling and fights Death to get him back.

title: The Night Owl
desc: Mordecai and Rigby team up with Muscle Man and Hi Five Ghost to win a radio contest, but the contest creator wants to turn them against each other.

title: A Bunch of Baby Ducks
desc: Mordecai and Rigby come across a family of ducks living in a fountain at the park - and take quite a shine to them.

title: More Smarter
desc: Mordecai begins to make fun of Rigby for not having a high school diploma so Rigby decides to drink a chemical that is supposed to make him smarter.

title: First Day
desc: The morning after being hired at the park, Mordecai and Rigby both look to obtain Pops' old couch and agree to play a game of rock, paper, scissors to decide who gets it.

title: Go Viral
desc: Mordecai and Rigby make a bet with Muscleman and High-Five Ghost to see who can get the most views on their internet videos in one week.

title: Skunked
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby are given the task of picking up road kill, Rigby gets sprayed by a were-skunk. Now, he has to find a cure for the smell before he turns into a skunk, as well.

title: Karaoke Video
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to destroy a promotional video tape of them at a Karaoke Club singing and making fun of everyone at the park, when the gang decides to go there.

title: Stick Hockey
desc: Benson tries to get back Mordecai and Rigby's stick hockey table when he wrongfully gives it away.

title: Bet to Be Blonde
desc: While playing a video game, Mordecai and Rigby make a bet in which the loser of the game has to wear the hairstyle of their game character. Rigby cheats to win the bet and Mordecai is forced to wear a blonde hairstyle.

title: Skips Strikes
desc: When the park's bowling team, "The Park Strikers" make it to the championship match in a bowling tournament, Death, the lead member of the rival championship team threatens to reveal Skips' secret if he does not back out.

title: Terror Tales of the Park
desc: The gang sits around trying to tell the scariest Halloween story.

title: Camping Can Be Cool
desc: Mordecai and Rigby take Margaret and Eileen to a secret camping spot to show them how great camping is.

title: Slam Dunk
desc: Mordecai and Rigby challenge Muscleman and High-Five Ghost to a game of basketball for computer rights and so Mordecai can make Margaret a website.

title: Cool Bikes
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to get Benson to admit they are cool when he bans them from using the cart.

title: House Rules
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to live on their own when they get tired of Benson's excessive house rules.

title: Rap It Up
desc: When a skilled rap group know as "CrewCrew" insult Pops and his poems, Mordecai and Rigby join with him when he challenges them to a rap battle.

title: Cruisin
desc: The guys try to get a girl's phone number in order to win a bet with Margaret and Eileen.

title: Under the Hood
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to find the man who sprayed graffiti on the bathroom wall when they wrongfully accuse Muscleman and get him fired.

title: Weekend at Benson's
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby accidentally knock Benson unconscious, they try to make it seem like it was a dream by dropping him off at his apartment, but end up taking him to his neighbors party to help him impress her.

title: Fortune Cookie
desc: Benson takes the gang to a Chinese Restaurant on a count of his streak of good luck. But when Rigby switches his fortune with Benson's, he gives his bad luck to Benson.

title: Think Positive
desc: Pops threatens to fire Benson if he does not stop yelling at Mordecai and Rigby.

title: Skips vs. Technology
desc: Skips tries to learn how to use a computer when Mordecai and Rigby need him to fix Error 220, a virus that as infected the house computer.

title: Butt Dial
desc: Mordecai accidentally pocket dials Margaret on his cell phone, and he has to erase the embarrassing message he left on her voicemail.

title: Eggscellent
desc: Mordecai wants to win a hat for Rigby by eating a huge omelet.

title: Gut Model
desc: Muscle Man wants to be appreciated at the park so he threatens to leave and take a job as a gut model.

title: Video Game Wizard
desc: Mordecai and Skips decide to work together to win the grand prize in a video game tournament. When Rigby finds out Mordecai chose Skips instead of him, his feelings are hurt.

title: Big Winner
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to tell Muscle Man that the million dollar scratcher ticket they gave him for his birthday is a fake without getting killed for it.

title: The Best Burger in the World
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to outfox Benson using holograms so that they can eat the best burgers in the world.

title: Replaced
desc: When Benson tries out an ostrich and a possum as replacements for Mordecai and Rigby, they have to fight for their jobs.

title: Trash Boat
desc: Rigby changes his name and has to change it back when he realizes that he picked the stupidest name ever... "Trash Boat."

title: Fists of Justice
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to do Skips' work for the day when he cashes-in a coupon that they gave to him on his birthday.

title: Yes Dude Yes
desc: Mordecai thinks that Margaret is engaged, and he wants to find a girlfriend as soon as possible to try and get over her.

title: Busted Cart
desc: Mordecai and Rigby bust up the cart and have to go on a road trip with Benson to the dealership before the warranty expires.

title: Dead at Eight
desc: Death will spare Muscle Man's life if Mordecai and Rigby babysit his kid and have him asleep before he returns.

title: Access Denied
desc: Margaret and Eileen invite Mordecai and Rigby to a club, but they are denied entrance because their clothes aren't good enough.

title: Trucker Hall of Fame
desc: After Muscleman's father dies, Benson asks Mordecai and Rigby to help him get to the Trucker Hall of Fame to spread his Dad's trucker hat ashes.

title: Out of Commission
desc: When the golf cart owned by the Park goes out of commission, Benson orders Mordecai and Rigby to throw it away. But before throwing it away, the cart comes to life asking them for one more day alive.

title: Fancy Restaurant
desc: Muscleman has to learn proper mealtime etiquette when he decides to take Starla and her parents to a fancy restaurant to impress them.

title: Diary
desc: Have you ever read someone's diary? Well has that diary released a giant guardian that wants to destroy you if you don't tell a deep secret? Mordecai, Rigby, and Skips does when Margaret asks if Mordecai and Rigby will water her plants they destroy her diary. But when Skips helps them a little peek from Rigby releases a giant Margaret guardian which they can only stop by like I said a deep secret. Will they reveal a secret or be destroyed by Margaret's diary?

title: The Best VHS in the World
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to return an overdue VHS to the store so they won't be banned from renting new movies.

title: Prankless
desc: Muscle Man vows to never prank again when one of his pranks injures Pops. A rivalry park takes this opportunity to attack the park with pranks of all kinds. The only way the park can be saved is if Muscle Man decides to prank again.

title: Death Bear
desc: Rigby challenges Mordecai to get a picture inside Death Bear's cage at the abandoned zoo to prove that he isn't afraid of the old folklore.

title: Fuzzy Dice
desc: The gang tries to win a pair of fuzzy dice for Pops' Birthday. But its not for sale and it is only located in a smelly, greasy arcade known as the "Fun-Fun Zone".

title: Sugar Rush
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby are given the task of getting donuts for the morning meeting, they buy dangerously double-glazed apple fritters, which Pops eats and becomes high on sugar.

title: Muscle Mentor
desc: After getting fired by Benson, Rigby goes into the mentor program and Muscle man turns out to be his mentor, things don't go to plan.

title: Bad Kiss
desc: Mordecai tries to fix his bad kiss with Margaret by using Rigby's time machine.

title: Exit 9B
desc: When everyone is brainwashed and the park is destroyed, Mordecai and Rigby have to bring everyone back their old selves so they can prevent a highway from being built over the park.

title: Starter Pack
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to get Muscleman to stop pranking Thomas when they realize that his pranks are getting out of hand.

title: Terror Tales of the Park II
desc: Mordecai and Rigby are driving to a Halloween party and tell scary stories to pass the time.

title: Pie Contest
desc: Mordecai and Rigby take over the duty of judging the Park's Pie Contest, but realize that the job isn't all that easy when they find out that they have to pick a winner.

title: 150-Piece Kit
desc: Benson tries to assemble a 150-piece drum kit to prove that he performed a famous drum solo for a well-known rock band.

title: Bald Spot
desc: When Muscle Man notices a bald spot on his head, he tries to cover it to keep Starla from seeing it at their date.

title: Guy's Night
desc: Pops tries to complete the Milk Challenge to prove that he is worthy of becoming one of the guys.

title: One Pull Up
desc: Rigby must perform a single pull-up to avoid being fired on the grounds of poor personal fitness.

title: The Christmas Special
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to destroy a gift for Santa, to save Christmas.

title: TGI Tuesday
desc: Margaret is transferring to another college, so Mordecai, Rigby and Eileen plan a going-away party at the park's abandoned ballroom, still haunted by its past hosts.

title: Firework Run
desc: Muscle Man, Mordecai, Rigby, and High five ghost blow up the fourth of July fireworks and are forced to drive to get new ones.

title: The Longest Weekend
desc: To prove their love for each other, Muscleman and Starla plan to stay away from each other for one weekend.

title: Sandwich of Death
desc: Mordecai and Rigby buy a potentially deadly sandwich at a restaurant, but when Benson falls ill after he eats it himself, they must set out to find the cure before he dies.

title: Ace Balthazar Lives
desc: Mordecai and Rigby want to reunite a famous band when they think the lead singer, who was presumably dead, is alive and living in the park.

title: Do or Diaper
desc: Muscle Man bets Mordecai that if he doesn't kiss Margaret by Friday at midnight, he will have to wear a diaper for a week.

title: Quips
desc: Skips has to tell is cousin, Quips, to stop telling bad jokes when he comes to visit.

title: Caveman
desc: While camping out in a cave, Mordecai and Rigby accidentally melt a caveman frozen in a block of ice. When they try to keep him, Benson requires that they make him more civilized.

title: That's My Television
desc: Mordecai and Rigby help their favorite '80s sitcom star, RGB2, escape from the studio lot and into the mountains to get out of a contract that has trapped him into staying on the show.

title: A Bunch of Full Grown Geese
desc: When the park becomes invaded by vicious territorial geese, Mordecai and Rigby seek the help of the baby ducks to get rid of them.

title: Fool Me Twice
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to get on a Japanese Game Show so they can win the grand mystery prize.

title: Limousine Lunchtime
desc: Mordecai and Rigby accidentally coat the interior of Mr. Maellard's limousine in meatball sub.

title: Picking Up Margaret
desc: When Mordecai volunteers to drive Margaret to the airport, he tries to convince Benson to let him use his car.

title: K.I.L.I.T. Radio
desc: Muscleman, Mordecai and Rigby help "Donny G", a famous D.J. take back over the corrupt local radio station so Muscleman can play his song he wrote for Starla on the radio.

title: Carter and Briggs
desc: Mordecai and Rigby enter a vehicular doughnut contest to win guest spots on their favorite police procedural TV show.

title: Skips' Stress
desc: Skips faces dire consequences when he passes up a day off to reduce his deadly amount of stress.

title: Cool Cubed
desc: When Thomas is incapacitated by a dangerously cold slushie flavor, Mordecai and Rigby must enter his brain to prevent the drink from killing him.

title: Trailer Trashed
desc: A health inspector threatens to shut down the park if sanitary conditions inside Muscle Man's trailer are not improved.

title: Meteor Moves
desc: Mordecai plans to kiss Margaret at meteor shower to prove to Rigby that he isn't in the "friend zone".

title: Family BBQ
desc: When Mordecai is invited to a BBQ with Margaret's family, he tries to get her father to give him a handshake.

title: The Last Laserdisc Player
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to find a laserdisc player so they can see the director's cut of a famous cult classic.

title: Country Club
desc: Mordecai and Rigby try to take back the cart when it is stolen by a rich, snobby country club.

title: Blind Trust
desc: Blind Trust: Benson has to trust Mordecai and Rigby. / World's Best Boss: The park guys want to give Benson a World's Best Boss mug.

title: World's Best Boss
desc: The gang wants to give a Benson a "World's Best Boss" mug.

title: Last Meal
desc: Muscleman gets the guys to take him to fast food joints so he can binge on his favorite foods one last time before going on a couple-diet with Starla.

title: Sleep Fighter
desc: The gang has to stop Muscleman from fighting in his sleep by finding the source of his nightmares.

title: Party Re-Pete
desc: The gang tries to save Benson from an evil party company, who kidnaps and clones to sell their party-animal counterparts.

title: Steak Me Amadeus
desc: Mordecai plans to take Margaret out to a fancy restaurant so he can ask her to officially be his girlfriend.

title: Laundry Woes
desc: Mordecai, still in a state of depression from Margaret's rejection at the Stake Me Amadeus restaurant, ends up finding her sweater in the laundry and plans to give it back to her at her college.

title: Silver Dude
desc: Mordecai and Rigby decide to create songs and sing them to people in the park so they can raise money to buy a special video game, but they run into a silver street performer who is stealing their songs and dancing to them.

title: Benson's Car
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to fix Benson's car when they accidentally throw the T.V. remote into the windshield.

title: Every Meat Burritos
desc: Mordecai, Rigby, Muscleman, and High-Five Ghost want to eat an Every Meat burrito, but the restaurant won't let them buy any until they have an actual car to use in the drive-through.

title: Wall Buddy
desc: When Benson tells Mordecai and Rigby to clean their room, Rigby buys a special room-separating system so he doesn't have to clean the mess.

title: A Skips in Time
desc: When Teenage Skips is accidentally sent into the future while storm-chasing, Mordecai and Rigby have to help him return to the 1700s.

title: Survival Skills
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to buy tortillas for Benson's survival seminar, but they get lost in the woods on the way back to the site.

title: Terror Tales of the Park III
desc: Each of the park guys want to win a bet by telling the scariest story at a Halloween party.

title: Tants
desc: When Pops gives Tants, the table-pants, to Mordecai an Rigby as a gift, they accidentally ruin them and have to get new ones before their "Tants-Lunch" with Pops the next day.

title: Bank Shot
desc: Rigby tries to win a dire bet by beating a guy at "Bank Shot", an arcade game that requires skilled and intricate basket ball bank shots.

title: Power Tower
desc: When Muscle Man is banned from a gym, he tries to win a weight-lifting contest to gain entrance again. But, first he must get his muscles back.

title: The Thanksgiving Special
desc: Mordecai and Rigby accidentally ruin Thanksgiving and must find a way to save it before their families arrive for dinner.

title: The Heart of a Stuntmen
desc: Mordecai, Rigby, High-Five Ghost and Muscleman have to get a stuntman license, so they can perform at a little kids birthday, when the original stuntman cops-out at the last minute.

title: New Year's Kiss
desc: A Rigby that appears to be from the future, tells past-Rigby that he must stop Mordecai from kissing a girl on New Year's Eve.

title: Dodge This
desc: The gang wants to win a dodge ball tournament, but Mordecai notices that CJ, the girl he kissed accidentally on New Year's Eve, is on a team competing in the tournament.

title: Portable Toilet
desc: When C.J. dares Mordecai to eat a sandwich inside a portable toilet, Rigby goes with him and ends up getting the door jammed shut with meatball-gravy.

title: The Postcard
desc: High-Five Ghost gets the help of the guys to remember where he was supposed to reunite with a girl from his past when he receives a "special" postcard from her.

title: Rigby in the Sky with Burrito
desc: When Rigby receives an invitation to his high-school reunion, he realizes that he hasn't accomplished anything that he claimed he would do. So, with little time he tries to achieve one thing, skydiving while eating a burrito.

title: Journey to the Bottom of the Crash Pit
desc: When Benson tells the guys that they have to fill up the crash pit, they try to have one last crash caught on tape. But, when they execute the crash, they realize that the video-camera went down with the car and have to get it back.

title: Saving Time
desc: Benson is mad for Mordecai and Rigby arriving an hour late to the morning schedule. Feeling the scolding was uncalled for, Mordecai and Rigby prank Benson by switching the clocks back 3 hours. Mordecai and Rigby change the park's time-zone.

title: Guitar of Rock
desc: When Benson breaks Mr. Mallard's special guitar, him, Mordecai and Rigby have to get a new one signed.

title: Skips' Story
desc: While on break Skips tells Mordecai and Rigby the story and the truth about how he became immortal.

title: Return of Mordecai and the Rigbys
desc: Mordecai and Rigby, tired of the heat, decide to bring back their band "Mordecai and the Rigbys" so they can enter in a battle of the bands and win an air conditioner.

title: Bad Portrait
desc: Pops' asks Mordecai and Rigby to pick up a portrait of Benson for his ceremony. But when Rigby ruins it, Mordecai is forced to re-paint it.

title: Video 101
desc: Mordecai, Rigby and CJ help Eileen with a music video as a final project for her film-making class.

title: I Like You Hi
desc: Mordecai tries to explain to C.J. that his auto-corrected text "I Like You Hi" was meant to read, "I like Yuji".

title: Play Date
desc: When Mordecai plans to go on a date with CJ, Death pops up and tells him he has to watch Thomas again.

title: Expert or Liar
desc: When Rigby is exposed on a surprise television game show for lying, he tries to find the lead host of the show to redeem himself.

title: Gold Watch
desc: The night before Benson is supposed to be awarded a gold watch for being on-time for work 1000 consecutive days in-a-row, he meets a pair of test pilots at Wing Kingdom and ends up waking up the next morning in the middle of nowhere.

title: Catching the Wave
desc: Pops wants to learn how to surf so he can become "one" with nature.

title: Paint Job
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby strip the paint off of the house with the power washer, they have to re-paint the house by the end of the weekend.

title: Take the Cake
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to pick up a cake for Mr. Maellard's surprise birthday party.

title: Skips in the Saddle
desc: When Skips realizes that he is starting to become lonely, he starts to date again, but inadvertently becomes a contestant on a date-game show when Mordecai and Rigby make him an impressive but fake dating profile on a website.

title: Thomas Fights Back
desc: When Thomas finds out that Benson is going to fire him, he tries to prove to Benson that he is useful by creating and executing a plan to get back the park's stolen statue.

title: Bachelor Party! Zingo!
desc: When Quips comes to town for his bachelor party, Skips, the best man, is given the task of getting chicken wings.

title: Tent Trouble
desc: When Mordecai and Rigby ruin CJ's luxury camping tent, they have to get part-time jobs to raise enough money to buy another one before the camping trip.

title: Real Date
desc: When Mordecai and CJ realize that they have never been on a romantic date, they schedule one. But, their special gifts that they have secretly planned for the other one coincide and create problems for each other.

title: Maxin' and Relaxin'
desc: When Mordecai offers to pick up a mix tape from his parent's house, CJ decides to go with him and meet his parents. But, from past memories, Mordecai worries that his Mom will embarrass him.

title: New Bro on Campus
desc: In high school, Muscle Man wants to show that he is cooler than the new student on campus.

title: Daddy Issues
desc: CJ joins the mini golf tournament but finds out that her dad signed up. Will she beat him?

title: Terror Tales of the Park IV
desc: Mordecai, Rigby, and the gang decide to visit Muscle Man's mother on Halloween. On the way the group tells ghost stories, including one where Mordecai and Rigby die and return to haunt Benson.

title: The End of Muscle Man
desc: The gang tries to help Muscle Man finish his bucket list.

title: Lift with Your Back
desc: Rigby tries to prove he can earn a paycheck, but the only job he is qualified for is a strict moving company with a boss that requires him to life boxes with only his back.

title: Eileen Flat Screen
desc: After Eileen winning a flat-screen tv, Rigby decides to install her new tv to surprise her. The only problem lies within Eileen's roommate who wouldn't let anything new come around her house.

title: The Real Thomas
desc: After Rigby finds out something unusual about Thomas in the night, he decides to explain his friends about the incident. Meanwhile things starts to turn dangerous when they find out the mysterious truth of Thomas.

title: White Elephant Gift Exchange
desc: The gang gets back at Muscle Man after he gives them bad gifts.

title: Merry Christmas Mordecai
desc: After preparing for Eileen's Christmas party, Mordecai finds out that his ex-girlfriend Margaret will be there which leaves him extremely nervous since he doesn't want things to go complicated when he's together with C.J..

title: Sad Sax
desc: Mordecai tries to get back with CJ.

title: Park Managers' Lunch
desc: The gang follows Benson to his Park Manager's Lunch hosted by Gene, the rival park manager, thinking that it is all just and elaborate hoax.

title: Mordecai and Rigby Down Under
desc: During an early morning after a late night of partying, Mordecai and Rigby try to take a nap in a patio furniture crate and accidentally get shipped to Australia.

title: Married and Broke
desc: Muscle Man and Starla participate in a game show to try to win their dream wedding.

title: Format Wars II
desc: When Mordecai, Rigby and their friends decides to rent a movie on laserdisc, a new prophesy tells them that an all new Format War is heading so they need to be prepared to end the Fomat Wars once and for all.

title: Happy Birthday Song Contest
desc: Mordecai and Rigby enter into a contest that gives the winner a chance to re-create the "Happy Birthday Song".

title: Benson's Suit
desc: Benson finds a suit that is designed for battle. But some bad people want it

title: I See Turtles
desc: Eileen and the gang decide to watch the hatching of the turtles and their descent into the sea.

title: Gamers Never Say Die
desc: After Mordecai and Rigby play an old video game, they earn a map that leads them to the special prize, "Maury Moto's Golden Game Badge".

title: 1000th Chopper Flight Party
desc: Mordecai awkwardly attends a party at Margaret's house, hoping to take a piece of cake for C.J.

title: Party Horse
desc: After a horse, with a love of partying, crash-lands on Earth, Mordecai and Rigby learn that he has to pass his U.S. History exam, or else he can never party again.

title: Men in Uniform
desc: The park guys want to keep the park open for business.

title: Garage Door
desc: When the garage door gets destroyed, after a practical joke played by Mordecai and Rigby, they must traverse through a dangerous warehouse to get a new one.

title: Brilliant Century Duck Crisis Special
desc: The Gang fights a giant robot monster bird.

title: Not Great Double Date
desc: Margaret's double date isn't going so well. Del Hanlon has to pretend he's her boyfriend, but he isn't so good at acting.

title: Death Kwon Do-Livery
desc: Death Kwon Do-livery: Mordecai and Rigby want to help save Death Kwon Do sensei's life. / Lunch Break: Mordecai and Rigby want to finish a ten-foot sub.

title: Lunch Break
desc: Mordecai orders a ten foot long sandwich and Benson will fire him and Rigby, if they don't finish the sandwich before the day ends.

title: Dumped at the Altar
desc: The gang helps Muscle Man get married, but problems arise that involve Mordecai and CJ.

title: Dumptown USA
desc: Benson is going to fire Mordecai if Rigby can't bring him back from a bizarre land of dudes also known as Dumptown USA.

title: The Parkie Awards
desc: After Benson doesn't take home the award for Park Manager of the Year, the guys want to make him feel like a winner.

title: The Lunch Club
desc: Rigby ruins Maellard's fancy lunch, and now he or Benson has to write a letter of resignation.

title: Local News Legend
desc: Margaret really wants to host a weekly segment on the nightly local news.

title: The Dome Experiment Special
desc: Benson is determined to prove he was right about the date of the "Dome Experiment".

title: Birthday Gift
desc: Rigby is on a quest for the best birthday gift for Mordecai instead of usual lame ones.

title: Cat Videos
desc: Mordecai and Rigby must get Benson to stop watching cat videos.

title: Struck by Lightning
desc: Muscle Man and HFG get struck by lightning after a football match and lose their memory of being friends together. Will they be able to remember?

title: Terror Tales of the Park V
desc: In Regular Show's fifth installment of "Terror Tales," Benson tries to spice up the park's annual Halloween party by renting a wishmaking machine.

title: Return of the Party Horse
desc: Mordecai and Rigby want to help Party Horse get back together with his girlfriend.

title: Sleep Cycle
desc: Mordecai and Rigby mess up their sleeping cycle because of watching a TV marathon and try to fix it.

title: Just Friends
desc: After Rigby invites Eileen for his big brothers karate presentation, Mordecai gets concerned and worried when hanging out with Margaret.

title: Benson's Pig
desc: Benson gets a pet pig, and asks Rigby and Mordecai to look after it for him.

title: The Eileen Plan
desc: Rigby goes back to High School to study rocks, but wants to keep it a secret from Eileen.

title: Hello China
desc: Hello China: In order to get high school credits, Rigby has to pass a foreign language class taught by Benson in China. / The Eileen Plan: Rigby doesn't think that he's smart enough for Eileen and decides to go back and finally get his high school diploma.

title: Crazy Fake Plan
desc: Rigby has to create a massively crazy fake plan in order to surprise Eileen for the first time ever.

title: Win That Prize
desc: Crazy Fake Plan: Rigby has to create a massively crazy fake plan in order to surprise Eileen for the first time ever. / Win That Prize: Pops wants to go on his favorite game show "Win That Prize," but instead gets deeply involved in the television industry.

title: Snow Tubing
desc: Rigby tries to get Eileen to go snow tubing.

title: Chilli Cook-Off
desc: Benson takes place in a chili cook off that needs to be made with ingredients less than $50

title: Donut Factory Holiday
desc: Mordecai, Rigby, Muscle Man, and High-Five Ghost are watching their favorite "Terrible-Horror" movie "Donut Factory Holiday". They have to get it back to the video store soon, but then they can't get it out of the VCR.

title: Gymblonski
desc: Rigby has only one more class to get his diploma, P.E but when he finds out the teacher is an old bully he will have figure out how to pass.

title: Guys Night 2
desc: The bros go on a second adventure before Thomas goes into hiding as an agent

title: Gary's Synthesizer
desc: Mordecai and Rigby unplug some cables to an old synthesizer, and they have to travel to the planet of Synthos with Skips in order to re-connect them and bring Gary back to life.

title: California King
desc: Rigby goes to dump to get back his trampoline he regrets throwing away.

title: Cube Bros
desc: Muscle Man is sick of being used for all the strong jobs at the park. So he decides to work at an office to show people he's smart too.

title: Maellard's Package
desc: Mordicai and rigby take a job for receiving Mr.Maellard's package,which is very important.

title: Rigby Goes to the Prom
desc: Rigby Wants to take Elieen to his school prom.

title: The Button
desc: The Button: The guys have to protect a large red button from being pushed. / Favorite Shirt: Mordecai, Rigby, and High Five Ghost have to somehow get Muscle Man's favorite shirt back on him before he wakes up.

title: Favorite Shirt
desc: The guys must get Muscle Man's favorite shirt back on him before he awakes.

title: Marvolo the Wizard
desc: Pops thinks he's mysteriously in medieval times and a wizard named Marvolo.

title: Pop's Favorite Planet
desc: Mordecai, Rigby, and Pops go camping to see Pops' favorite planet through his telescope.

title: Pam I Am
desc: Benson try to win over a dome employee named Pam by sneaking her hot wings.

title: Lame Lockdown
desc: The head scientist puts Mordecai and Rigby on a 24-hour lock down inside the Dome, but they want to sneak out and see one of their favorite bands.

title: VIP Members Only
desc: The guys hope to be VIPs at Cheeser's.

title: Deez Keys
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to sneak into the dome laboratory to get Benson's keys back.

title: Rigby's Graduation Day Special
desc: In a half hour special, Rigby has to give a speech at his high school graduation. The speech will be broadcast live on a TV show called "Inspire America," and Rigby wants to make it memorable.

title: One Space Day at a Time
desc: Mortdecai and Rigby are doing their job and stumble upon a jewel that might change their lives.

title: Cool Bro Bots
desc: A group of robots come to help the guys in the dome

title: Welcome to Space
desc: The guys get rescued, but Benson desperately wants to get back

title: Space Creds
desc: While Mordecai and Rigby decide what movie to watch they see an ad and want these really cool rocket shoes so they need cress so it's there mission to find a job to get some.

title: Lost and Found
desc: The guys need to retrieve a wallet on a hostile planet

title: Ugly Moons
desc: Muscle Man vows to prank someone.

title: The Dream Warrior
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to recapture something they lost.

title: The Brain of Evil
desc: Mordecai and Rigby need to catch a brain before it causes too much damage

title: Fries Night
desc: When Benson is dumped by his girlfriend Pam, he goes on a quest for French Fries to fill the void left in his Heart.

title: Spacey Mc SpaceTree
desc: Rigby must pass a safety test.

title: Can You Ear Me Now?
desc: Mordecai and Rigby have to defend their case on a planet inhabited by ear people

title: Stuck in an Elevator
desc: Mordecai and Rigby want to go to a reunion concert.

title: The Space Race
desc: The guys race through space.

title: Operation: Hear No Evil
desc: Mordecai and Rigby want to avoid spoilers of their favorite TV show.

title: Space Escape
desc: The guys must escape a bad guy.

title: New Beds
desc: Space Escape: The guys have to escape from someone bad. / New Beds: The guys get new beds.

title: Mordeby and Rigbecai
desc: The two guys accidentally enter a teleport machine together, the results need to be reversed before it's too late

title: Alpha Dome
desc: Mordeby and Rigbecai: Mordecai and Rigby mess around with a teleportation machine, and you can pretty much imagine how this one goes. / Alpha Dome: The guys confront some people.

title: Terror Tales of the Park VI
desc: In Regular Show's sixth installment of "Terror Tales," the guys gather in the house on the Dome and tell scary Halloween stories just like ol' times, only this Halloween, the stories have an extra terrifying, science fiction twist.

title: The Ice Tape
desc: Pops finds a tape that contain answers to his questions

title: The Key to the Universe
desc: The Ice Tape: The guys need to play a very special VHS tape. / The Key To The Universe: The guys learn something super important.

title: No Train No Gain
desc: The guys help Pops train.

title: Christmas in Space
desc: The guys celebrate their first Christmas in space by opening presents, eating peppermint bark and telling Christmas stories. Benson wants the stories to be more Christmas-y, but the guys keep adding scary elements, which only infuriate their boss.

title: Kill 'Em with Kindness
desc: Pops still doesn't wish to fight Anti-Pops and wants to peacefully work things out, but everyone else doubts kindness will stop Anti-Pops.

title: Meet the Seer
desc: After the incident between Pops and Anti-Pops, the gang search out to find the Seer.

title: Cheer Up Pops
desc: The gang try to support Pops for the imminent battle against Anti-Pops

title: A Regular Epic Final Battle
desc: In the series finale, Mordecai, Rigby and the park workers aids pops in an epic final battle against Anti-pops on Lollipop world and to save the universe, that's right, the universe!

title: Episode #1.1
desc: Sylvia's claim to her inherited part of Horace and Pete's brings the family together, as Horace has to deal with his own relationship to Rachel.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: Pete meets an old friend while Sylvia seeks help and Horace tries to tackle his sexual fantasies.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: Horace's ex-wife visits Horace and Pete's to get some advice.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: An old waitress from the bar revisits Horace and Pete's while Uncle Pete and his son debate sex.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: A wake is held at the bar and Horace, Pete and Sylvia try to reach an agreement concerning the bar and their futures.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: Pete meets a woman through internet dating and brings her home to meet the family.

title: Episode #1.7
desc: Pete has a plan, while Horace and Sylvia have interesting experiences.

title: Episode #1.8
desc: While Silvia and Horace are having some good time in their lives, Pete is facing a situation where he has to make a difficult decision for himself. Fortunately he finds courage from people he wouldn't expect.

title: Episode #1.9
desc: Pete has gone missing for a week which leaves Horace frustrated.

title: Episode #1.10
desc: Horace resurfaces the pub history by revealing the conditions of wrong bringing up attitudes of the previous generations.

title: 3 AM
desc: Former Marine Frank Castle takes the law into his own hands while struggling to come to terms with his traumatic past.

title: Two Dead Men
desc: A mysterious phone call forces Frank's hand. Meanwhile, Madani goes digging for suspects and Curtis delivers a message.

title: Kandahar
desc: Frank skips the subtlety while interrogating Micro. Brutal memories of top-secret missions shed light on Frank's past.

title: Resupply
desc: Madani and Sam plan a delicate operation, Curtis tries to connect with Lewis, and Frank encourages Micro to get his hands dirty.

title: Gunner
desc: Frank and Micro go looking for answers from a reluctant witness. Madani and Sam learn of a looming investigation. Rawlins sees a ghost.

title: The Judas Goat
desc: With Frank in bad shape, Micro calls on Curtis for help. Madani and Russo continue to mix business with pleasure. Lewis stands up for his rights.

title: Crosshairs
desc: Lewis struggles with the ramifications of his actions. Frank and Micro pursue another face from the past. Madani and Sam go bug hunting.

title: Cold Steel
desc: Russo opens up to Madani about his past, Sarah shares her concerns about her son with Frank, and a decoy operation takes a turn.

title: Front Toward Enemy
desc: Following a deadly explosion, Karen lands in a bomber's crosshairs -- and Frank isn't happy about it. Meanwhile, Curtis makes a grisly discovery.

title: Virtue of the Vicious
desc: An attack on a high-profile politician is examined (and reexamined) through different perspectives. Madani faces a painful truth.

title: Danger Close
desc: As danger knocks on Sarah's door, Frank takes his quest for vengeance to the next level with some help from an unexpected ally.

title: Home
desc: Frank makes a damning confession. A shootout leaves Sarah wondering what to believe. Rawlins goes in for the kill, once and for all.

title: Memento Mori
desc: As the authorities close in, an exhausted but unbroken Frank vows to put an end to the war that has consumed his life.

title: Roadhouse Blues
desc: While driving through Michigan, Frank stops for a beer at a roadside bar. But staying out of trouble has never been his strong suit.

title: Fight or Flight
desc: Frank and a reluctant Rachel go on the run as a menacing adversary gives chase. Meanwhile, Madani pays Russo an unwelcome visit.

title: Trouble the Water
desc: As Pilgrim's past comes into focus, Frank and Rachel find themselves in police custody, where they're anything but safe.

title: Scar Tissue
desc: Rachel recalls the night everything changed and lets Frank in on the truth about her name. Russo sits down with a face from his childhood.

title: One-Eyed Jacks
desc: It's not a trap if you know it's coming: That's Frank's philosophy. Madani opens up and Pilgrim plans a visit to an unholy land.

title: Nakazat
desc: Amy (formerly Rachel) develops photographs that point to a conspiracy. Russo reads his own report. Madani's story about Russo comes under fire.

title: One Bad Day
desc: Madani's quest to ID Pilgrim hits a wall. Russo and his crew put their plan into action. Frank encounters someone from the past.

title: My Brother's Keeper
desc: Painful memories take ahold of Russo. Frank's frustration frightens those closest to him. Madani receives a visitor bearing a warning.

title: Flustercluck
desc: A big bounty inspires New York's worst to pursue the Punisher. A restless Amy seeks help from a fellow grifter. Russo and Krista consider the future.

title: The Dark Hearts of Men
desc: As Madani and Krista debate who's worth saving, Frank prepares to storm Russo's territory. A brutal encounter pushes Pilgrim back into old habits.

title: The Abyss
desc: Amy rushes to protect Frank, who lies defenseless in a hospital. Pilgrim gets some crushing news, and Karen Page calls in a favor.

title: Collision Course
desc: Buckle up -- Mahoney and Frank are about to take a ride to remember. Amy makes an entrance, Russo cashes out, and Madani comes clean to Krista.

title: The Whirlwind
desc: Frank, Pilgrim, Madani, Russo, Amy, Curt and the Schultz family. No bullet is left unspent as season two comes to an explosive conclusion.

title: Holiday Knights
desc: The heroes and villains of Gotham City have various adventures during the Christmas holiday season.

title: Sins of the Father
desc: A young street kid finds himself hunted by Two-Face and the boy insists that he help Batman stop the villain.

title: Cold Comfort
desc: Batman and Batgirl hunt Mr. Freeze who is on a destructively nihilistic campaign.

title: Never Fear
desc: The Scarecrow threatens to unleash a powerful new toxin on Gotham City that removes all fear, leaving its victims unafraid of deadly danger. Complications arise when Batman is exposed to the gas.

title: You Scratch My Back
desc: Catwoman entices the estranged Nightwing to cooperate with her against a gangster over Batman's wishes.

title: Double Talk
desc: Arnold Wesker, The Ventriloquist, is released from Arkham Asylum, deemed a healthy man - only to discover that his alternate personality Scarface may still be struggling to return.

title: Joker's Millions
desc: A destitute Joker unaccountably inherits a fortune from a hated rival, only to find out the hard way why.

title: Growing Pains
desc: Robin tries to help a mysterious lost little girl against the equally unknown man pursuing her.

title: Mean Seasons
desc: Batman and Batgirl oppose Calender Girl, a mysterious woman who is attacking various youth oriented media events.

title: The Demon Within
desc: Klarion the Witch Boy takes control of Etrigan the Demon and the Dynamic Duo must stop his destructive mischief.

title: Over the Edge
desc: Batman and his allies apparently have their secret identities exposed and are now are hunted by the police.

title: Torch Song
desc: A rock singer is stalked by an obsessive pyrotechnician turned supervillain, Firefly.

title: Love Is a Croc
desc: Seeing a kindred spirit, Baby-Doll springs Croc from custody to be her lover and partner in crime.

title: The Ultimate Thrill
desc: Batman contends with Roxy Rocket, a stuntwoman-turned-criminal who gets a real thrill out of taking dangerous risks.

title: Critters
desc: A ruined agricultural breeder of dangerously oversized livestock plots his revenge on Gotham City.

title: Cult of the Cat
desc: Catwoman is pursued by a fanatical cat themed cult.

title: Animal Act
desc: The animals from Nightwing's old circus are now inexplicably committing crimes.

title: Old Wounds
desc: Dick Grayson reveals to his successor the secret of the strained relationships with his mentor and Barbara Gordon.

title: Legends of the Dark Knight
desc: Several children give their widely varying opinions of who they think Batman is.

title: Girl's Night Out
desc: When Livewire escapes in Gotham City, Supergirl and Batgirl team up to find her, but the supervillainess has joined with Harley Quinn and Poison Ivy herself.

title: Chemistry
desc: Bruce Wayne falls for and marries the perfect woman who has a dark secret.

title: Judgment Day
desc: Batman investigates the sudden appearance of "The Judge," a faceless vigilante who battles Gotham City's supervillains with lethal force.

title: Beware the Creeper
desc: The Joker throws a reporter into a vat of chemicals and turns him into the manically wacky superhero, The Creeper.

title: Mad Love
desc: Harley Quinn tries to impress her love while the origin of her career as The Joker's sidekick is revealed.

title: Pilot
desc: An ex-lawyer is forced to return to community college to get a degree. However, he tries to use the skills he learned as a lawyer to get the answers to all his tests and pick up on a sexy woman in his Spanish class.

title: Spanish 101
desc: Jeff takes steps to ensure that Britta will be his partner in Spanish class, but winds up with Pierce instead.

title: Introduction to Film
desc: Britta comes between Abed and his father when she signs him up for a film class, and Jeff risks failing a class unless he "seizes the day."

title: Social Psychology
desc: Jeff and Shirley bond by making fun of Britta's new hippie boyfriend, which doesn't go well for any involved. Meanwhile, Troy and Abed become pawns in Annie's psychology experiment.

title: Advanced Criminal Law
desc: Señor Chang is on the hunt for a cheater and threatens to fail the entire class if the culprit doesn't come forward. When someone confesses, Jeff comes to their defense. Meanwhile, Annie recruits Pierce to write the new school song.

title: Football, Feminism and You
desc: Jeff talks Troy into playing for the college's football team, sparking Annie's anger. Pierce helps the dean come up with a new mascot, and Britta tries to become Shirley's bathroom friend.

title: Introduction to Statistics
desc: Will Jeff blow off Annie's Halloween party and sell out his other classmates in order to get a chance to score with a sexy professor?

title: Home Economics
desc: When Jeff loses his home and his car, he is forced to move into Abed's dorm room. Troy has a big date, but why is a jealous Annie trying to help? Meanwhile, Pierce becomes the keyboardist for Vaughn's band.

title: Debate 109
desc: Jeff reluctantly agrees to be Annie's debate partner, Britta humors Pierce by letting him try hypnotherapy on her to get her to stop smoking, and the gang begins to think that Abed's films may predict their future.

title: Environmental Science
desc: Jeff hangs out with Senor Chang to get out of an essay, angering the rest of the group. Meanwhile, Abed and Troy search for their missing lab mouse, and Pierce helps Shirley out with a presentation.

title: Politics of Human Sexuality
desc: Annie helps the dean put on an "STD Fair," but doesn't want to perform an embarrassing demonstration. Meanwhile Jeff finds a companion for a double date with Pierce, and Troy finds out that Abed is a better athlete than him.

title: Comparative Religion
desc: Shirley throws a Christmas party for the gang and much to her surprise learns her classmates come from various religious backgrounds. Meanwhile, Jeff is challenged by the school bully and faces the reality that he may fail Spanish 101.

title: Investigative Journalism
desc: The gang decides not to let an obnoxious student from their Spanish class into the study group. The dean appoints Jeff as editor of the student paper, where Annie is working on a story that could expose the dean as a racist.

title: Interpretive Dance
desc: Jeff runs in to problems when the study group and the dean discover that he's seeing a professor, while Troy and Britta discover each other's secret that they are both taking dance classes.

title: Romantic Expressionism
desc: When Annie starts hanging out with Britta's ex-boyfriend Vaughn, Britta and Jeff vow to protect her. Meanwhile, Pierce feels left out at Troy and Abed's movie night.

title: Communication Studies
desc: Jeff sets out to fix his relationship with Britta after things get awkward with a drunken phone call. Meanwhile, Annie and Shirley make plans to humiliate Señor Chang in order to defend Troy and Pierce's dignity.

title: Physical Education
desc: Jeff refuses to participate in a pool class because the teacher forces him to play in gym shorts, and the study group discovers a white version of Abed at the college.

title: Basic Genealogy
desc: It's Family Day at Greendale. Pierce tries to build a relationship with his stepdaughter, but she has eyes for Jeff instead. Britta gets in trouble with Troy's Nana, and Shirley's kids cause problems for Abed's father.

title: Beginner Pottery
desc: Jeff signs up for a pottery class for an easy credit, but winds up failing the class when his jealousy of another student gets the best of him. Meanwhile, Pierce's incompetence could ruin his group's grade in boating class.

title: The Science of Illusion
desc: Britta's April Fool's Day prank has disastrous consequences, but she refuses to confess that she was responsible. Annie and Shirley temporarily work as security guards, but both of them want to be the "bad cop."

title: Contemporary American Poultry
desc: Jeff's plan to get chicken fingers from the school cafeteria for the study group quickly evolves into a mafia movie-style endeavor with Abed calling all the shots.

title: The Art of Discourse
desc: Shirley gets Pierce kicked out the study group, Jeff and Britta plot revenge on a group of high schoolers who make fun of them for attending community college, and Troy helps Abed accomplish some of his movie-clichéd social goals.

title: Modern Warfare
desc: Greendale Community College is transformed into an apocalyptic war zone when the dean promises the winner of a paintball competition priority registration, and it could fan the flames of sexual tension between Jeff and Britta.

title: English as a Second Language
desc: Annie uses inside information about Señor Chang to get him fired so that the study group will be forced to stay together and take Spanish again. Meanwhile, Troy discovers that he has a natural skill for plumbing.

title: Pascal's Triangle Revisited
desc: Britta and Professor Slater fight for the affection of Jeff. Meanwhile, Troy is confused when Abed doesn't invite him to move into his dorm room.

title: Anthropology 101
desc: Jeff and Britta engage in a dangerous game of relationship one-upsmanship in response to Britta's embarrassing moment at the end of the previous school year, which could cause the entire study group to fall apart.

title: Accounting for Lawyers
desc: Jeff blows off the study group and their break-dancing competition to hang out with his old co-workers at the law firm, but Annie tries to prove that one of them is the person who turned him in and got him fired.

title: The Psychology of Letting Go
desc: Pierce's religion convinces him that the spirit of his dead mother is captured in a cheap lava lamp, Jeff has a crisis of faith when he learns he has high cholesterol, and Britta and Annie try to raise money for the oil spill.

title: Basic Rocket Science
desc: Everyone in the study group except Abed is stuck in a crude 1980s space simulator as it is towed off campus, and Abed leads the team given the difficult assignment of bringing them home.

title: Messianic Myths and Ancient Peoples
desc: Shirley asks Abed to make a film about Jesus, but he quickly angers Shirley by turning it into a self-indulgent mess. Meanwhile, Pierce begins blowing off the study group to hang out with the "hipsters."

title: Epidemiology
desc: The study group is left to fend for themselves by Dean Pelton during a rabies outbreak due to tainted food at Greendale's Halloween party.

title: Aerodynamics of Gender
desc: Britta, Annie and Shirley discover that Abed is skilled at insulting the mean girls, so they use him to their advantage. Meanwhile, Troy and Jeff find a secret garden with a trampoline, which they use for relaxation.

title: Cooperative Calligraphy
desc: Chaos and mistrust tear the study group apart as they try to figure out who stole Annie's pen, causing them to miss the Greendale Puppy Parade.

title: Conspiracy Theories and Interior Design
desc: Dean Pelton tries to bust Jeff for a phony night school credit, which only unveils a series of conspiracies, plots, and double-crosses between Jeff, Annie, and the dean.

title: Mixology Certification
desc: The study group takes Troy out to a bar to celebrate his 21st birthday. While there, Annie assumes a new identity, Abed is propositioned by a man, one of Shirley's secrets is discovered, and Britta and Jeff fight over the "cool" bars.

title: Abed's Uncontrollable Christmas
desc: When Abed wakes up to discover that everything is in stop motion animation, Professor Duncan and the study group help him try to discover the true meaning of Christmas.

title: Asian Population Studies
desc: Annie lobbies for her new crush, who is also Jeff's rival, to join the study group, but a jealous Jeff counters with Chang. Meanwhile, Shirley announces that she's pregnant, but she doesn't know that it could be Chang's.

title: Celebrity Pharmacology 212
desc: Pierce bribes Annie into getting him a bigger role in her anti-drug play, Jeff gets in trouble when he sends a lewd text message from Britta's phone, and Shirley rejects Chang's attempts to be friendly to her.

title: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons
desc: The study group plays Dungeons & Dragons with another classmate to improve his spirits, but Pierce's jealousies cause their good intentions to backfire.

title: Early 21st Century Romanticism
desc: Jeff hangs out with Professor Duncan after a fight with the study group, but Chang tags along and starts a party. Meanwhile, Abed and Troy fight for a librarian's affection, and Britta goes to a dance with a girl she thinks is a lesbian.

title: Intermediate Documentary Filmmaking
desc: Pierce pretends to be dying so that he can bequeath a series of cryptic and sometimes mean-spirited gifts to his study partners, and Abed decides to shoot a documentary film of the situation.

title: Intro to Political Science
desc: Anticipating a visit from the vice president, dean Pelton holds an election for student body president. An idealistic Annie decides to run, but Jeff decides to run against her to spite her and show how stupid politics can be.

title: Custody Law and Eastern European Diplomacy
desc: Jeff uses Shirley's parental rights waiver against Chang as a way to get Chang out of the apartment, while Britta is afraid to tell Abed and Troy that their new friend is a war criminal.

title: Critical Film Studies
desc: Jeff's "Pulp Fiction"-themed surprise party for Abed is spoiled when Abed tells him over dinner that he's done with pop culture.

title: Competitive Wine Tasting
desc: Jeff suspects something isn't quite right when an attractive classmate gets engaged to marry Pierce .

title: Paradigms of Human Memory
desc: While working on the final diorama for their anthropology class, Chang discovers the cache of items stolen by Troy's monkey.

title: Applied Anthropology and Culinary Arts
desc: As the semester draws to a close, the anthropology class final is disrupted when Shirley goes into labor one month ahead of schedule.

title: A Fistful of Paintballs
desc: In a "spaghetti western" parody, Pierce tries to get revenge on the rest of the study group during this year's paintball tournament.

title: For a Few Paintballs More
desc: When the study group learns that there's a sinister plot behind the paintball tournament, they unite the remaining players to defeat the enemy.

title: Biology 101
desc: Jeff's plan to keep Pierce out of the Study Group backfires when he gets kicked out instead, Abed copes with bad news about Cougar Town, and Dean Pelton's authority is challenged by another Greendale dean.

title: Geography of Global Conflict
