title: A Diplomatic Incident
desc: When the French hold out for primacy over a sub-Channel tunnel, P.M. Hacker uses the info that they planted a bomb in their own embassy to obtain more favorable terms.

title: A Conflict of Interest
desc: P.M. Hacker, pressured by rumors of wrongdoing in the City, is tricked by Sir Humphrey into appointing a less-than-honest man as the new Governor of the Bank of England.

title: Power to the People
desc: A local councilwoman is throwing her weight around, but P.M. Hacker's plan to make local government truly responsive to its constituency motivates her to cooperate with Sir Humphrey's opposition.

title: The Patron of the Arts
desc: P.M. Hacker is scheduled to speak at a broadcast awards ceremony -- right after the announcement that the arts budget will be much smaller than hoped.

title: The National Education Service
desc: On the advice of his political adviser, P.M. Hacker plans to eliminate the National Education Service and let parents choose the schools their children will attend. Horrified, Humphrey must prevent the precedent being set of eliminating unnecessary bureaucracy.

title: The Tangled Web
desc: The Prime Minister finds himself in a bit of a pickle when he flatly denies in the House that the government has bugged MP's telephones. It turns out the government was and Sir Humphrey was aware of it. The PM wants Sir Humphrey to back him, but he refuses to participate in a cover-up. The shoe is on the other foot however when Sir Humphrey makes unwise comments to a radio interviewer thinking that the tape recorder has been turned off. The PM agrees to help him, for a price.

title: The Secret of the Dragon Balls
desc: Goku, living alone in his own little world, meets Bulma and sets off on a journey to discover what the Dragonballs do.

title: The Emperor's Quest
desc: While Son Goku and Bulma continue on their quest, Bulma tries to teach him the finer points in life, like setting up camp and bathing. Goku goes hunting and runs into Mai and Shuu, who were sent by Pilaf to Skull Valley to investigate a light that may be a dragon ball. It turns out to be a wolf pack, which Goku fends off. Goku returns home with dinner, and he meets a turtle who he decides to help by returning him to the ocean.

title: The Nimbus Cloud of Roshi
desc: As Son Goku and Bulma take the turtle to the ocean they are attacked by a bear, who Goku defeats. Meanwhile Shuu and Mai inform Pilaf that there was no dragon ball at Skull Valley. The three of them go to a remote island in the Emerald Sea to get a dragon ball from Roshi, the turtle hermit, but they can't find it. Goku and Bulma meet Roshi, who is the master of the turtle they helped, and in gratitude Roshi gives them the dragon ball and his flying nimbus cloud.

title: Oolong the Terrible
desc: Bulma and Son Goku arrives in a town where they find the fifth Dragon Ball, but they only get the Ball when they defeat the Monster that is terrorizing the Village.

title: Yamcha the Desert Bandit
desc: After Oolong is defeated by Goku, he is forced to join the quest because his shape shifting powers may come in handy. In order to find the next dragon ball, they must cross through the Diablo Desert. Oolong disposes of Bulma's dino caps and tries to escape, but she has ways of making him stay. As they cross through the desert, they are confronted by Yamcha, the desert bandit, and he and Goku do battle.

title: Keep an Eye on the Dragon Balls
desc: Goku, Bulma, and Oolong are still crossing Diablo Desert. Meanwhile, Yamcha is plotting his revenge. Pilaf sends Mai and Shuu after Bulma's dragon balls. Goku tells Oolong about the dragon balls, so now the treacherous Oolong has his own ideas about them. Yamcha overhears the conversation, and he develops a plan for the dragon balls himself. This begins a battle of wits among all parties trying to get their hands on the dragon balls.

title: The Ox-King on Fire Mountain
desc: Goku, Bulma, and Oolong continue on their quest in a car given to them by Yamcha, who is secretly following them due to a tracking device in the car. He plans to steal the dragon balls from them. The next stop is Fire Mountain, where supposedly the mighty Ox King has the 6th dragon ball. Goku befriends the Ox King, who trained with his grandfather under Master Roshi. In order to get the dragon ball, Goku is sent to find the Ox King's daughter Chi-Chi, and to obtain the Bansho fan from Roshi.

title: The Kamehameha Wave
desc: Once they land on Roshi's island, Goku and Chi-Chi explain to him their dilemma--Chi-Chi and the Ox King can't get into their castle until the flames on Fire Mountain are extinguished. Roshi agrees to give them the Bansho fan if Goku can convince Bulma to get him a date with an older woman. Unfortunately he realizes that he used the fan as a place mat, then threw it away when it became sticky. He then accompanies them to Fire Mountain to extinguish the flame himself with his Kamehameha Wave. He succeeds, but he accidentally destroys the castle and the mountain too. ...

title: Boss Rabbit's Magic Touch
desc: Goku, Bulma, and Oolong arrive in a town where everyone is afraid of Bulma because of the rabbit costume she is wearing. They discover that this is because Boss Rabbit, a.k.a. Monster Carrot, and his goons rule the town with an iron fist. It is up to Goku, with help from Yamcha and Puar, to free the town.

title: The Dragon Balls Are Stolen
desc: Mai is able to fix Pilaf's dragon ball detector, and they see that Goku and his friends, with their six dragon balls, are on their way to Pilaf's castle to retrieve his dragon ball, the only one they don't have. Pilaf sends Mai and Shuu to meet them and steal their dragon balls, and they get all of them except the one Goku holds. Goku and his companions must then storm the castle to retrieve them.

title: The Penalty Is Pinball
desc: Pilaf steals the last dragon ball from Goku, who, along with his friends, has been trapped in Pilaf's castle. Goku and his friends must find a way to escape before Pilaf can summon the dragon and make his wish for world domination.

title: A Wish to the Eternal Dragon
desc: Puar and Oolong are able to escape their cell through the hole made by Goku's Kamehameha wave, but they are too late to stop Pilaf from summoning the dragon. Now they must find a way to stop him from making his wish.

title: The Legend of Goku
desc: Goku transforms into a terrifying giant ape!

title: Goku's Rival
desc: The start of the "Tournament Saga". Goku begins his training with Master Roshi. Also, Roshi takes a young boy named Krillin as his student. Meanwhile, Yamcha, Bulma, Puar, and Oolong are on their way to the city, but they crash their vehicle in the jungle, and later get lost in the desert.

title: Look Out for Launch
desc: Goku and Krillin find a girl for Master Roshi: a sweet girl named Launch... who holds an alternate personality as the deadliest bandit ever!

title: Find That Stone!
desc: Roshi takes Goku, Krillin, and Launch to a large island for their training, which includes lots of running and finding a stone which Roshi throws into the jungle.

title: Milk Delivery
desc: Roshi incorporates running across the entire island to deliver milk as part of Goku and Krillin's morning training, thus helping to prepare them for the World Martial Arts Tournament. Meanwhile, Yamcha is training for the tournament as well.

title: The Turtle Hermit Way
desc: Goku's and Krillin's training continues. They must till land with their bare hands, study, do construction work, move large rocks, swim, and dodge angry bees.

title: The Tournament Begins
desc: As the World Martial Arts Tournament approaches, Goku's and Krillin's training becomes more intense. Meanwhile, Yamcha increases his own training, causing Bulma to feel neglected.

title: Elimination Round
desc: The first round of the World Martial Arts Tournament begins, and Goku, Krillin, and Yamcha all display their strength.

title: Smells Like Trouble
desc: The quarter-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin. First up is Krillin vs. Bacterian.

title: Yamcha vs. Jackie Chun
desc: The quarter-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament continue with Jackie Chun vs. Yamcha and Nam vs. Ranfan.

title: Monster Beast Giran
desc: After a rain delay and a bar fight involving several tournament participants, the last quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament, Goku vs. Giran, gets underway.

title: Krillin's Frantic Attack!
desc: After interviews with Goku and Krillin, the semi-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament get underway. First up is Krillin vs. Jackie Chun.

title: Danger from Above
desc: The semi-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament conclude with Goku vs. Nam.

title: The Grand Finals
desc: Goku fights Jackie Chun in the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Number One Under the Moon
desc: The epic fight between Goku and Jackie Chun continues.

title: The Final Blow
desc: The conclusion of the fight between Jackie Chun and Goku, who has now once again turned into a monster after looking at the full moon.

title: The Roaming Lake
desc: The start of the "Red Ribbon Army Saga". After the end of the tournament, the group of friends splits up. Goku goes to find his grandfather's dragon ball, Krillin leaves with Roshi to continue his training, and Yamcha, Bulma, Oolong, and Puar return to the city. After bringing water to his village, Nam realizes that it won't last long. He goes in search of the legendary "Roaming Lake", but during his journey he runs afoul of a giant bird. It's up to Goku to save him and help him find the lake.

title: Pilaf and the Mystery Force
desc: Goku is enjoying traveling the world on the flying nimbus--that is, until his dragon radar is stolen while he is swimming. He must track down the thief and get it back so that he can find his grandfather's dragon ball. Meanwhile, Emperor Pilaf is trying once again to assemble the dragon balls. There is also a mysterious military force that is searching for the dragon balls.

title: Wedding Plans?
desc: Goku chases after Pilaf to get the dragon ball from him. Pilaf gives it to Goku, knowing that it is a fake. Pilaf then follows the real one to the village of the Ox King. The Ox King and his daughter Chi Chi mistakenly believe Pilaf's ship to belong to Goku, and a wedding for Goku and Chi Chi is prepared. Meanwhile, the Red Ribbon Army follows Pilaf to the village, also in search of the dragon ball.

title: The Flying Fortress - Vanished!
desc: Pilaf leaves the village with the dragon ball. Colonel Silver follows him, but Pilaf shoots down Silver's plane. Goku returns to the ruined village with Chi Chi, and they learn what happened from the Ox King. Goku leaves to find the dragon ball. He and Silver both track Pilaf to his underground desert fortress, where a battle ensues.

title: The Legend of a Dragon
desc: While Goku befriends and defends a wild monkey and her child, Master Roshi recounts to Bulma and Krillin the legend of the Dragon Balls.

title: Cruel General Red
desc: Silver and the Red Ribbon Army search desperately for the dragon ball, but it is Goku who finds it. Goku and Silver then battle for it.

title: Cold Reception
desc: Goku, unconscious and frozen, is saved from the plane crash by a girl named Suno. She takes him back to her house, where she and her mother revive him. While the Red Ribbon Army searches the village for Goku, he recounts the dragon ball legend to Suno and her mother. Goku learns from them that the army has enslaved the men from their village, forcing them to help search for the dragon ball. They also tell Goku that the army is holding the village chief prisoner in Muscle Tower, so Goku decides to go to the tower and rescue him.

title: Major Metallitron
desc: Goku makes his way through Muscle Tower, battling guards along the way. Once he reaches the 3rd floor he battles Major Metallitron.

title: Ninja Murasaki Is Coming!
desc: Goku continues to make his way through Muscle Tower. On the 4th floor he tests his skills against Ninja Murasaki.

title: Five Murasakis
desc: The battle between Goku and Murasaki continues. Murasaki uses a technique allowing him to split himself into five people--or are there actually five Murasaki brothers?

title: Mysterious Android No. 8
desc: After finishing off Murasaki, Goku befriends Android No. 8, who helps guide him through the rest of Muscle Tower.

title: Horrifying Buyon
desc: After General White uses a trap in the floor to drop Goku and Android No. 8 down to the secret 5th floor, Goku fights the monster Buyon.

title: The Fall of Muscle Tower
desc: Goku battles General White on the top floor of Muscle Tower.

title: The Secret of Dr. Flappe
desc: Goku receives the dragon ball from Android 8, who had been hiding it from the Red Ribbon Army to keep the villagers safe. Afterward they go to see Dr. Flappe to get the bomb removed from Android 8's chest. Meanwhile, Murasaki, having survived the destruction of Muscle Tower, is hot on their trail.

title: A Trip to the City
desc: Goku gets the flying nimbus back, and he goes to West City in search of Bulma, hoping that she can repair the dragon radar. Once he is in the city Goku discovers how different city life is compared to what he is used to.

title: Master Thief, Hasky
desc: Bulma takes Goku on tours of her house and of the city. Meanwhile, Commander Red sends Haski, a master thief, to West City to steal the dragon balls from Goku.

title: Danger in the Air
desc: Haski goes undercover as a fortune teller at the fair so that she can steal the dragon balls from Goku.

title: Bulma's Bad Day
desc: The start of the "General Blue Saga". Goku and Bulma leave the city in search of the next dragon ball. They locate it in the middle of the ocean and land on a nearby island. This island happens to be occupied by General Blue and his forces, who are also looking for the dragon ball.

title: Kame House - Found!
desc: After realizing that the dragon ball is too deep to swim to, Goku and Bulma return to Master Roshi's island to borrow a submarine. While there, Krillin and Roshi tell them about hidden pirate treasure that is supposedly located near the dragon ball. Meanwhile, General Blue sends a scout to follow Goku.

title: Deep Blue Sea
desc: Goku, Bulma, and Krillin go to find the dragon ball in their submarine, and General Blue follows them. Blue also sends his soldiers to Roshi's island to retrieve the other two dragon balls.

title: Roshi Surprise
desc: General Blue continues to follow Goku, Bulma, and Krillin. Meanwhile, Roshi and Launch must prevent the remainder of Blue's forces from stealing the dragon balls.

title: The Trap is Sprung
desc: Goku and his friends continue through the cave, narrowly escaping several booby traps, while General Blue continues to follow them.

title: Beware of Robot
desc: Goku and Krillin fight a robot that is guarding the pirates' secret hideout.

title: The Pirate Treasure
desc: Goku fights a giant octopus. Krillin and Bulma look for the pirate treasure, and they have a run-in with General Blue.

title: Blue, Black and Blue
desc: Goku must defeat General Blue and find the dragon ball before the cave collapses.

title: Escape from Pirate Cave
desc: Goku, Krillin, and Bulma narrowly escape the cave before it collapses. They make it back to General Blue's headquarters, where Goku converses with Commander Red over the radio, and then they go back to Roshi's island. Meanwhile, Blue follows them.

title: Penguin Village
desc: General Blue steals the dragon balls, and Goku chases after him on the flying nimbus.

title: Strange Visitor
desc: The chase ends in a strange land called Penguin Village. While searching for General Blue, Goku makes friends with a host of odd characters. Meanwhile, Blue meets his share of odd characters as well.

title: Arale vs. Blue
desc: General Blue takes Arale hostage to get Goku. But Arale displays some surprising fighting skills of her own.

title: The Land of Korin
desc: The start of the "Commander Red Saga". Goku sets out to find the next dragon ball on his radar. Captain Yellow of the Red Ribbon Army has already found it inside an active volcano. When he tries to retrieve it the volcano erupts, launching the dragon ball into the forest, where it is found by the protector of the land. This puts him at odds with Captain Yellow, who goes to retrieve it.

title: The Notorious Mercenary
desc: Mercenary Tao is hired to kill Goku and retrieve the dragon balls. Meanwhile, Bora tells Goku about the legend of Korin Tower.

title: Tao Attacks!
desc: Mercenary Tao easily defeats Goku and takes the dragon balls. Goku pledges to climb Korin Tower so that he can become stronger and defeat Tao, allowing him to assemble the dragon balls and wish Bora back to life.

title: Korin Tower
desc: Goku reaches the top of Korin Tower. He meets Korin, the mysterious cat who guards the tower, and he attempts to drink the sacred water.

title: Sacred Water
desc: Goku tries time and again to take the sacred water from Korin.

title: The Return of Goku
desc: Goku descends Korin Tower and fights Tao, who has returned to kill him and take the other dragon ball.

title: The Last of Mercenary Tao
desc: Having been defeated by Goku, Tao climbs Korin Tower and drinks the sacred water. He then descends the tower to fight Goku yet again.

title: Confront the Red Ribbon Army
desc: Colonel Violet finds another dragon ball for the Red Ribbon Army, and Goku flies to the army's headquarters to launch a one-man-assault and take their dragon balls. When Bulma and the others discover Goku's plan they call Yamcha to pick them up, hoping that they can reach the Red Ribbon stronghold in time to help him.

title: A Real Bind
desc: Yamcha and the others pick up Krillin, who is swimming in the sea. Meanwhile, Goku launches his assault on the Red Ribbon Army.

title: The End of Commander Red
desc: Goku continues his assault on the Red Ribbon Army while Commander Red and Staff Officer Black argue over protocol. Finally, Goku goes head to head with Black and Red. Meanwhile, Yamcha and the others continue toward the Red Ribbon stronghold.

title: The Last Dragon Ball
desc: The start of the "Fortune Teller Baba Saga". Goku finishes off Staff Officer Black while Yamcha and the others decide on a plan.

title: Who Is Fortuneteller Baba?
desc: When they can't find the last dragon ball on the radar, Goku, Krillin, and Yamcha go to Fortune Teller Baba's Palace to ask for her services. Along the way, they pick up Upa.

title: We Are the Five Warriors
desc: Since Goku and the others do not have enough money to pay for Fortune Teller Baba's services, she agrees to tell them where the seventh dragon ball is only if they can defeat her five fighters in combat. Their first task is to defeat Fang the Vampire.

title: Deadly Battle
desc: Goku brings Roshi and Bulma to Baba's palace, because Krillin has a plan that will help Yamcha in his fight against the Invisible Man.

title: Goku's Turn
desc: Yamcha battles Baba's third fighter, a mummy who is much quicker than he looks.

title: The Devilmite Beam
desc: Goku faces the mummy who defeated Yamcha. He then faces Baba's fourth fighter, the Devil Man.

title: The Mysterious Fifth Man
desc: The fight between Goku and the Devil Man concludes. Also, Goku meets his final opponent, a mysterious masked man who seems familiar.

title: The Strong Ones
desc: Goku fights his fifth and final opponent, the mysterious masked man.

title: The True Colors of the Masked Man
desc: The fight between Goku and the masked man, who has now been revealed as Goku's grandfather Gohan, concludes. Meanwhile, Pilaf uses a satellite to spy on Goku.

title: Pilaf's Tactics
desc: Goku searches for the car that contains the last dragon ball. He finds it, and in order to get the dragon ball he must fight against Pilaf, Shuu, and Mai, who have the advantage of the power suits that Pilaf created.

title: The Eternal Dragon Rises
desc: Having taken the final dragon ball, Goku returns to Baba's palace to get Upa. Together, they return to the Land of Korin to call upon the eternal dragon to restore Upa's father to life.

title: Terror and Plague
desc: Since Roshi told him that he cannot teach him anything else, Goku travels the world looking for new adventures. He meets a young girl whose village is being terrorized by two thugs, so he goes with her to the village to confront them.

title: Goku vs. Sky Dragon
desc: On the advice of an old woman whom he helps, Goku goes to a small town looking to battle Master Chen, the strongest fighter in town. Chen, however, has his own fight with Sky Dragon, a rival martial artist from the same town. In order to win the title of Master of Martial Arts, and save his struggling dojo, Chen must defeat Sky Dragon the next day in the King's Match. Unfortunately, Chen is in poor health and cannot fight, so Goku fights in his stead.

title: Goku Goes to Demon Land
desc: Goku goes to a village whose princess has been captured by demons and taken back to Demon Land. In order to rescue her Goku must venture through the portal of the dead and defeat Shula, the lord of Demon Land. Once he does this he will be able to remove Shula's sword from the portal's entrance, thus closing it and preventing any more demons from coming through.

title: The Rampage of InoShikaCho
desc: Goku meets a family who has fled its village, which is being rampaged by a monster called InoShikaCho. Goku goes to the village to fight the beast, but two other mysterious fighters get there first and defeat it, for a fee. Later, Goku learns that they are working together with InoShikaCho to scam villagers out of money, and he confronts them. Meanwhile, Roshi continues to train Krillin and Yamcha, and he tells the story of InoShikaCho.

title: Which Way to Papaya Island?
desc: Goku saves a fox named Konkichi from a group of thugs, and they befriend one another. In gratitude, Konkichi offers to take Goku to the airport so that he can get to Papaya Island for the next World Martial Arts Tournament, which begins the following day. Unfortunately, neither has enough money for a ticket, so they go to the carnival to win some quick cash at the games. Afterward they return to the airport, where they run into Fortune Teller Baba. She sees that Konkichi is a crook, and he realizes it, so he runs away and gets into more trouble. It is up to Goku to ...

title: Rivals and Arrivals
desc: Start of the "Tien Shinhan Saga". Goku swims to Papaya Island, while everyone else arrives by boat or by plane for the World Martial Arts Tournament. All the competitors sign in, check into the hotel, and meet each other.

title: Preliminary Peril
desc: The preliminary matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin. Yamcha fights an unnamed opponent, Krillin fights Anton the Great, and Tien Shinhan fights a sumo wrestler.

title: Then There Were Eight
desc: The preliminaries of the World Martial Arts Tournament conclude. Goku fights King Chapa, who won the tournament without even being hit last time he entered; Tien Shinhan fights Nam; and Jackie Chun fights a bear.

title: Yamcha vs. Tien
desc: The quarter-final matches are decided, and Yamcha faces Tien Shinhan in the first quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Yamcha's Big Break
desc: The first quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Yamcha and Tien Shinhan continues.

title: Full-Moon Vengeance
desc: Jackie Chun fights Man-Wolf in the second quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: The Dodon Wave
desc: Krillin fights Chiaotzu in the third quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Counting Controversy!
desc: The third quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Krillin and Chiaotzu continues. Also, Master Shen attempts to assassinate Goku for killing his younger brother, Mercenary Tao.

title: Goku Enters the Ring
desc: To impress the ladies Jackie Chun helps Goku and Krillin train for their next match. Also, Pomput's manager attempts to trick Goku into not showing up for his next match, and Launch must save the day. All this leads up to the last quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Goku and Pomput.

title: Tien Shinhan vs. Jackie Chun
desc: Tien Shinhan decides to test Jackie Chun's ability before their match. Later, the semi-finals of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin when Jackie and Tien square off.

title: Stepping Down
desc: The first semi-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Jackie Chun and Tien Shinhan continues.

title: Goku vs. Krillin
desc: Goku fights Krillin in the last semi-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament, and Tien Shinhan confronts Roshi about quitting during their fight.

title: Tail's Tale
desc: The semi-final match between Goku and Krillin continues.

title: Final Match: Goku vs. Tien
desc: Yamcha leaves the hospital to see the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament, and Oolong secures front row seats. The final match between Goku and Tien Shinhan begins.

title: Victory's Edge
desc: The final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament continues. Tien Shinhan uses the Volleyball Technique and the Solar Flare Technique, and Goku fights at full power when he uses his battle strength and the Mirror Image Technique.

title: Tien's Insurrection
desc: The battle between Goku and Tien Shinhan continues. Chiaotzu interferes on Tien's behalf by using his mental powers to paralyze Goku, and Tien uses his Rapid Velocity Technique.

title: The Spirit Canon
desc: The battle between Goku and Tien Shinhan continues. Tien uses the Four Witches Technique and the Tri-Beam Cannon.

title: The Fallen
desc: Because Tien Shinhan's Tri-Beam Cannon destroyed the stage, he and Goku must finish their match in the air.

title: Enter King Piccolo
desc: Start of the "King Piccolo Saga". Goku chases after Krillin's killer. Meanwhile, after finding a piece of paper bearing the mark of King Piccolo near Krillin's body, Roshi tells the others of his first encounter with Piccolo.

title: Tambourine Attacks!
desc: Goku catches up with Krillin's killer, one of Piccolo's minions named Tambourine. Tambourine defeats Goku easily, and he begins killing the fighters whose names are on the list he stole from the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Mark of the Demon
desc: While Tambourine continues to kill the fighters on his hit list, Piccolo creates a new warrior, named Cymbal, to find more dragon balls. Meanwhile, under Roshi's instructions Bulma makes a new dragon radar so that they can find the dragon balls before Piccolo does, and Goku recovers from his fight with Tambourine.

title: Here Comes Yajirobe
desc: Goku and Yajirobe fight over the fish that Goku stole from him. Meanwhile, Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu leave the still-recovering Yamcha and the others on an island while they go in search of the dragon balls. While on the island, Bulma creates a freezing capsule to preserve Krillin's body. Also, Cymbal fights Yajirobe for the dragon ball he possesses.

title: Terrible Tambourine
desc: Tambourine continues on his mission, paying visits to both Giran and Yamcha. He is then sent by Piccolo to kill those responsible for the death of Cymbal. Meanwhile, Goku continues to argue with Yajirobe, trying to convince him to give up his dragon ball. Also, Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu find a dragon ball inside a glacier.

title: Tien's Atonement
desc: After Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu obtain a dragon ball from a group of pirates, they continue on their journey. They find another dragon ball inside a house which is occupied by a man who was previously wronged by Tien, and Tien must face his past. Meanwhile, Goku chases after Yajirobe, who has fled from the persistent boy. Also, Tambourine continues searching for those responsible for Cymbal's death.

title: Goku's Revenge
desc: Goku fights Tambourine. Meanwhile, Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu search for another dragon ball inside a cave. Also, Piccolo sets out to find Goku and Yajirobe.

title: Goku vs. King Piccolo
desc: Goku fights Piccolo. Meanwhile, Roshi finds another dragon ball in the mountains, but he drops it down a canyon.

title: Piccolo Closes In
desc: Piccolo defeats Goku and takes his dragon ball, and Yajirobe agrees to take Goku to Korin Tower to recover. Meanwhile, Chiaotzu finds the dragon ball that Roshi dropped, and with Tien's help they prepare for their battle with Piccolo.

title: Roshi's Gambit
desc: Roshi fights Piccolo. Meanwhile, Goku and Yajirobe continue toward Korin Tower.

title: King Piccolo's Wish
desc: Piccolo calls upon Shenron, the Eternal Dragon, and wishes for his youth to be restored. Meanwhile, Goku and Yajirobe reach Korin Tower.

title: Siege on Chow Castle
desc: Piccolo reaches Eastern City and begins to take over during a parade for King Furry's twentieth term in office. Meanwhile, Yajirobe begins to climb Korin Tower with Goku on his back. Also, Tien mourns the deaths of Chiaotzu and Roshi and sets out to learn the evil containment wave.

title: Conquest and Power
desc: Piccolo captures King Furry and destroys Eastern City. Bulma and the others put Roshi and Chiaotzu in freezing capsules while Yamcha tries to convince Tien to let him learn the evil containment wave with him. Goku and Yajirobe reach the top of Korin Tower. Tien begins his training.

title: Awaken Darkness
desc: Korin tells Goku about the power of the ultra divine water. By entering a portal in the tower, Goku is transported to the ice maze in which the water is located, and he begins his search.

title: A Taste of Destiny
desc: As Goku continues searching for the ultra divine water, he meets a phantom Roshi manifested by the Darkness. The phantom Roshi takes him back to a fake Kame House where phantoms of all of Goku's friends are waiting. Sensing something is wrong, Goku tries to leave and is attacked by Roshi. Meanwhile, Yajirobe tries to find his way out of the maze, and Piccolo announces his reign on TV.

title: The Ultimate Sacrifice
desc: Goku feels different after drinking the ultra divine water, and he and Yajirobe leave the cave. Piccolo orders the people to riot. Android No. 8 goes to the city to find Suno, and he fights off a band of raiders. Tien masters the evil containment wave.

title: Prelude to Vengeance
desc: Piccolo draws lots to decide the next city to be destroyed. He draws West City. As people scramble to get out, Bulma attempts to reach her parents, who live there. Also, bandits break into the Kame House. Meanwhile, both Goku and Tien continue toward Piccolo.

title: Battle Cry
desc: As West City evacuates, Bulma tries to reach her parents. Tien fights Piccolo's newest warrior, Drum. Goku gets sidetracked while helping Chi Chi and the Ox King fight enemy soldiers. Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma prepare to help Tien in his fight with Piccolo.

title: Goku Strikes Back
desc: Goku fights Piccolo, and Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma continue flying toward the battle.

title: The Biggest Crisis
desc: Goku and Piccolo continue their battle while Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma continue flying toward it. Meanwhile, news of the battle breaks on TV.

title: Final Showdown
desc: The fight between Goku and Piccolo comes to a close. Meanwhile, Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma land their plane and decide on a course of action. Also, Yajirobe debates on whether or not he should watch the fight.

title: Lost and Found
desc: Start of the "Piccolo Jr. Saga". Yajirobe takes Goku to Korin Tower to recover from his fight with Piccolo. While there, they tell Korin about the death of the eternal dragon and find out that Kami, the creator of the dragon and the dragon balls, lives high above Korin Tower. He can recreate the dragon so that Goku can bring his friends back to life, but the only way to get there is to use the power pole, which Goku lost during his fight with Piccolo. In order to reach Kami, Goku must find his power pole and return to Korin Tower. Meanwhile, Piccolo Jr. hatches from ...

title: Temple Above the Clouds
desc: Goku uses his power pole to get to the Lookout, Kami's temple in the sky. Meanwhile, reporters storm the Kame house looking for Goku. Also, Piccolo Jr. begins to understand his strength.

title: Earth's Guardian Emerges
desc: Goku cannot defeat Mr. Popo, so he decides to stay at the Lookout and train until he can. Also, he meets Kami. Meanwhile, Tien begins his training for the next World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Eternal Dragon Resurrected
desc: Kami resurrects the eternal dragon. In return, Goku agrees to stay at the Lookout and train for three years. Meanwhile, Bulma, Yamcha, and Tien see the dragon balls flashing, and they call on the eternal dragon to make their wish.

title: Quicker Than Lightning
desc: Mr. Popo attempts to teach Goku to relax his mind. Also, to sharpen his senses, Goku trains blindfolded. Finally, Goku goes to Mt. Rumble to fetch the sacred crown. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, and Krillin continue to train for the next World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Secret of the Woods
desc: After recovering from being struck by lightning, Goku is sent to the woods to train. While there, he meets a family and stays with them. He learns from the grandfather of a fighter named Yao Chun, and he heads to the mountains to fight him. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, and Krillin continue to train.

title: The Time Room
desc: Goku travels back in time to train with Master Mutaito, and he learns about spirit energy. While there, he meets a young Roshi, and he runs afoul of Shen. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu decide to climb Korin Tower.

title: Goku's Doll
desc: Goku fights a doppelganger created by Mr. Popo. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu continue on their journey to Korin Tower.

title: Walking Their Own Ways
desc: Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu stumble upon a village that is worshiping a mountain spirit during a festival, and they take part in the festivities. Meanwhile, Goku plays hide and seek with Mr. Popo to help him detect and control spirit energy.

title: Hotter Than Lava
desc: After a volcano erupts, Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu attempt to prevent the lava from destroying a nearby village. Meanwhile, Goku and Mr. Popo continue to play hide and seek.

title: Changes
desc: It has been three years since Goku defeated Piccolo, and the time has come for the next World Martial Arts Tournament. Having not seen each other in years, all the characters meet and reminisce while signing in for the tournament.

title: Preliminary Peril
desc: The preliminaries of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin. Notably, Goku fights a rematch with King Choppa, and Chiaotzu faces a familiar foe.

title: Battle of Eight
desc: The preliminaries of the World Martial Arts Tournament conclude.

title: Tien Shinhan vs. Mercenary Tao
desc: Tien Shinhan fights Mercenary Tao in the first quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Anonymous Proposal
desc: Goku fights the woman entered as "Anonymous" in the second quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament. Also, the match between Piccolo Jr. and Krillin begins.

title: The Mysterious Hero
desc: The fight between Piccolo Jr. and Krillin concludes. Also, the final quarter-final match between Yamcha and Hero begins.

title: Rematch
desc: The fight between Yamcha and Hero concludes. Also, the first semi-final match between Goku and Tien begins.

title: Goku Gains Speed
desc: The first semi-final match between Goku and Tien continues.

title: The Four Faces of Tien
desc: The first semi-final match between Goku and Tien concludes.

title: Kami vs. Piccolo
desc: Piccolo Jr. fights Hero, who is actually Kami in disguise, in the second semi-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Battle for the Future
desc: Goku finally explains to his friends the true identities of Piccolo Jr. and Kami. Also, the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament begins when Goku faces Piccolo Jr.

title: Super Kamehameha
desc: Goku gets up from the knockdown, and his fight with Piccolo Jr. continues. The fighting is intense, as Piccolo levels a mountain with an energy attack, and Goku unveils his Super Kamehameha wave.

title: Junior No More
desc: The true identity of Piccolo Jr. is finally recognized by the crowd, which flees in terror, and news of the discovery breaks on TV. Piccolo then uses a new technique to increase in size, and his fight with Goku continues.

title: Goku's Trap
desc: Goku enters Piccolo Jr.'s body through his mouth and retrieves the jar that holds Kami. After Kami is freed, Piccolo returns to his normal size, and the battle continues.

title: Goku Hangs On
desc: Piccolo charges up, stealing energy from everyone around him so that he can unleash a massive energy attack. Tien uses the Tri-Beam Cannon to create a shelter for all the non-participants to hide in, and the fight between Goku and Piccolo continues.

title: The Victor
desc: Knowing that if he dies it will also be the death of Piccolo Jr., Kami asks Tien to kill him after Piccolo disables Goku. Before this can happen, Goku recovers and the fight continues.

title: Dress in Flames
desc: Goku and Chi-Chi fly back to the Ox King's castle to announce their engagement. The Ox King and his servants prepare the castle for the wedding, but just when the preparation is nearly complete, the castle once again goes up in flames. With the Ox King still trapped in the castle, Goku and Chi-Chi must find the Bansho fan and extinguish the flames.

title: The Fire-Eater
desc: Goku and Chi-Chi visit the Kame House to find Roshi's instructions for making the Bansho fan. They see that they need a feather from a mystical bird called a fire-eater, so they go to Mt. Kiwi to retrieve one. Once there, they are followed by Mai and Shuu, who are also looking for the bird.

title: Outrageous Octagon
desc: Goku and Chi-Chi reach the mountain that reportedly holds the Bansho fan, but a heavy snowstorm causes them to crash at the mountain's base. They meet an old woman who explains to them that no woman can climb the mountain without causing a storm. She also tells them that there is no fan on the mountain. Goku scales it hoping to gather enough snow to put out the fire at the Ox King's castle. While Goku is climbing the mountain, the old woman teaches Chi-Chi about being a good wife. Meanwhile, Goku is followed by Pilaf, who thinks the fan might be worth something.

title: Mystery of the Dark World
desc: The Bansho fan has no effect on the flames because the fire was forged in the Magical Furnace. Goku and Chi-Chi must travel to the other side of the world to Mt. Five Elements, where they must venture through the Gate of the Five Elements into the Dark World. There, they must find Tajoro, the keeper of the furnace, and convince her to help put out the flames.

title: The End, the Beginning
desc: Goku tries to convince Tajoro to extinguish the flame long enough to fix the leak that causes the Ox King's castle to ignite, but she refuses. This is because the flame is what creates the fog that shrouds Mt. Five Elements, and the fog is what allows spirits to pass between the spirit world and the world of the living--without it, no spirit could ever visit the world of the living again, and all spirits already in the world of the living would be trapped forever. Therefore, they must find another way to put out the flame at the Ox King's castle.

title: Sally
desc: Transplanted New Zealanders Bret and Jemaine--a.k.a. Flight of the Conchords--search for romance and gigs in New York City. At a bohemian party, Jemaine falls for Sally (who used to date Bret), but Bret spoils the moment back at their apartment.

title: Bret Gives Up the Dream
desc: Desperate for cash, Bret and Jemaine decide to get jobs. Only Bret is successful--he gets a job holding up signs. When Murray books them a show, Bret can't get off work, so Jemaine is forced to play with a replacement: a recording of Bret.

title: Mugged
desc: Bret loses Jemaine's trust by abandoning him to a 'gang' of two, and fears the worst when Jemaine doesn't come home.

title: Yoko
desc: Murray is perturbed when Bret cancels a band tour to be with his girlfriend Coco. Jemaine's dismay, coupled with the betrayal felt by lone fan Mel (who has a crush on Bret), threatens the band's future.

title: Sally Returns
desc: A lonely Jemaine runs into Sally, who dumped him (and Bret) earlier in the year. Envisioning a new life with Sally, Jemaine's dreams take a detour when he learns she won't spend time with him until he gets his own place.

title: Bowie
desc: Upset when Murray says he's too small during a photo shoot, Bret decides that Jemaine can help him get over his funk. That night, a 1972-era David Bowie advises Bret to wear an eye patch. The plan backfires when Bret has depth-perception problems.

title: Drive By
desc: Dissed by a rude fruit vendor, Bret and Jemaine concoct an animated music video in retaliation. But as slights against the boys continue, Bret and Jemaine find themselves in the middle of a race war with anti-Kiwi mutha 'uckas.

title: Girlfriends
desc: Brett and Jemaine encounter girlfriend problems in the USA.

title: What Goes on Tour
desc: Using the band's 'emergency fund,' Murray organizes a warm-up tour before a big gig in Central Park. At a bar, the boys get hooked by some 'mermaids' from a women's water-polo team--nearly ruining the tour and their relationship with Murray.

title: New Fans
desc: The Conchords triple their fan base after playing a local world music jam, but Mel is suspicious of the two new fans' motives.

title: The Actor
desc: Bret and Jemaine enlist a semi-pro actor to cheer up Murray after a disappointing gig. Asked to place a good-hearted rejection call, the actor gets carried away, offering Murray and the Conchords a recording deal that's too good to be true.

title: The Third Conchord
desc: Season One Finale. Murray foists a new bongo-playing band member on Bret and Jemaine, triggering angry dances and mutant half-bands.

title: A Good Opportunity
desc: Season Two premiere. After rejecting Murray for spending too much time with another band, Bret and Jemaine find success managing themselves and land a deal to record an ad jingle; Dave shares his 'double-down' deal strategy.

title: New Cup
desc: Bret and Jemaine's fortunes unravel after Bret buys a new tea cup. With emergency band funds unavailable, Jemaine takes desperate measures in hopes of supplementing their income.

title: The Tough Brets
desc: Bret organizes a gang to protect himself from rappers he dissed in a song; Murray and Jemaine get their feelings hurt by Aussie counterparts; Mel paints a portrait Jemaine can't get rid of.

title: Murray Takes It to the Next Level
desc: Murray tries to elevate Bret and Jemaine on his friendship graph, bringing his questioning pal Jim in on the plan; Mel demands an apology from Bret for inappropriate dream behavior.

title: Unnatural Love
desc: Jemaine starts dating an Australian, to Bret's dismay and inconvenience.

title: Love Is a Weapon of Choice
desc: Bret and Jemaine both fall for a woman whose missing dog has epilepsy, triggering a duel, a canine benefit, and a couple of new tunes.

title: Prime Minister
desc: Foiled by the White House, Murray arranges a presidential meeting for the visiting Prime Minister of New Zealand; a tribute gig ends with Jemaine getting mixed up with an Art Garfunkel fanatic.

title: New Zealand Town
desc: Trying to look cool for a gig at the Grand Opening of New York's one-block New Zealand enclave, the Conchords end up getting hooked on hair gel.

title: Wingmen
desc: Bret enlists Jemaine and Dave to help him try to land a girlfriend; Murray regrets making Greg his scapegoat.

title: Evicted
desc: Season Two finale. Unable to pay off their back rent, Bret and Jermaine move in with Mel and Doug; Murray looks to cash in on a stage play about the Conchords' travails.

title: Slumber Party Panic
desc: Princess Bumblegum's latest experiment accidentally unleashes an undead horde upon the Candy Kingdom.

title: Trouble in Lumpy Space
desc: Jake is bitten by Lumpy Space Princess and begins to transform into a Lumpy being. In order to find a cure, Finn is travels to Lumpy Space.

title: Prisoners of Love
desc: After the Ice King kidnaps a large group of princesses, its up to Finn and Jake to free them.

title: Tree Trunks
desc: Tree Trunks joins Finn and Jake on an quest, but finds her talents for adventuring leave something to be desired.

title: The Enchiridion!
desc: Princess Bubblegum sends Finn on his most challenging quest yet--to recover The Enchiridion, the hero's handbook.

title: The Jiggler
desc: After finding a Jiggler in the wild, Finn and Jake decide to adopt the funny creature as a pet.

title: Ricardio the Heart Guy
desc: A new stranger arrives in the Candy Kingdom: a charismatic talking heart named Ricardio. He soon becomes very popular, except to Finn who believes he's hiding something.

title: Business Time
desc: Finn and Jake discover a tribe of businessmen frozen in a block of ice and hire them to make adventuring easier.

title: Memories of Boom Boom Mountain
desc: While having trouble solving the contradictory problems of the residents of a mountain village, Finn recalls where he found the desire to help people.

title: My Two Favorite People
desc: Jake tries hanging out with both his best friend, Finn, and his girlfriend, Lady Rainicorn, at the same time. But soon Jake becomes jealous when Finn and Lady seem too friendly.

title: Wizard
desc: Finn and Jake discover a secret tribe of wizards and take magic lessons for a price they aren't prepared to pay.

title: Evicted!
desc: After Marceline the Vampire Queen visits Finn and Jake at their tree fort she informs them that she is moving in and kicking them out.

title: City of Thieves
desc: A mission leads Jake into a city where everyone is a thief and the chance to be corrupted is incredibly strong.

title: The Witch's Garden
desc: A witch steals Jake's shape-shifting powers, but his ego makes getting them back very difficult.

title: What Is Life?
desc: Finn creates a robot to continuously throw pies at Jake but unexpectedly imbues it with a soul.

title: Ocean of Fear
desc: Finn must overcome his fear of the ocean.

title: When Wedding Bells Thaw
desc: The Ice King announces that he is engaged and to the shock of Finn and Jake it seems the bride is actually willing. But will the Ice King give up his princess kidnapping ways?

title: Dungeon
desc: Finn adventures into a forbidden dungeon, against the wishes of Princess Bumblegum and Jake, and finds more than he bargained for.

title: The Duke
desc: An accident in the Candy Kingdom which Finn and Jake cause is blamed on the Duke of Nuts. Finn and Jake, however, find admitting the truth to be harder and harder as time passes.

title: Freak City
desc: A trickster turns Finn into a giant foot.

title: Donny
desc: Finn and Jake try to reform a bullying ogre, but realize that their good deed has unexpected consequences.

title: Henchman
desc: Marceline the Vampire Queen tricks Finn into swearing allegiance to her.

title: Rainy Day Daydream
desc: Jake's imagination literally runs wild, coming to life and bringing many dangers into the tree house.

title: What Have You Done?
desc: After being told to arrest the Ice King, Finn and Jake face an ethical quandary when they realize the villain has not actually committed any recent crimes.

title: His Hero
desc: Finn meets his hero, the great warrior Billy, who is not everything Finn expected him to be.

title: Gut Grinder
desc: Jake is accused of being a horrible monster that has been terrorizing the locals. Soon, Jake himself is unsure if he is or isn't the monster.

title: It Came from the Nightosphere
desc: Finn summons the Lord of Evil to reconcile with his daughter, Marceline the Vampire Queen, but ends up unleashing him of the unsuspecting land.

title: The Eyes
desc: Because of a creepy horse outside their window, Finn and Jake cannot get any sleep.

title: Loyalty to the King
desc: After shaving, the Ice King is mistaken as a good guy and takes advantage of the situation.

title: Blood Under the Skin
desc: Finn is made fun of by a group of knights and reacts by questing for a set of magical armor that will earn him respect.

title: Storytelling
desc: Unable to give a sick Jake an entertaining story, Finn sets off into the woods to discover a true story.

title: Slow Love
desc: Finn and Jake try to find a girlfriend for a giant snail so that it will stop wrecking their tree-house.

title: Power Animal
desc: Finn is kidnapped, but Jake's short attention span means rescue is dubious.

title: Crystals Have Power
desc: Jake swears a life of non-violence right before a race of indestructible crystal-men abduct Finn to another dimension.

title: The Other Tarts
desc: Finn and Jake are given one of the highest responsibilities: transporting and guarding the rarest pastry in the Candy Kingdom.

title: To Cut a Woman's Hair
desc: An evil witch threatens to crush Jake to death if Finn doesn't deliver her the hair of a princess.

title: The Chamber of Frozen Blades
desc: While he's away, Finn and Jake sneak into Ice King's fortress.

title: Her Parents
desc: Anxious about meeting Lady Rainicorn's parents, Jake tries to pass himself off as a Rainicorn.

title: The Pods
desc: Given the duty of protecting three magic beans, one evil and two good, Finn and Jake decide to plant them to find out which is which.

title: The Silent King
desc: After defeating their king, Finn becomes the new ruler of the Goblin people, and finds that their strange ways are too difficult to understand.

title: The Real You
desc: Nervous about giving a speech at Princess Bubblegum's science conference and barbecue, Finn finds a magical pair of glasses that make him the smartest being in the land.

title: Guardians of Sunshine
desc: Finn and Jake become trapped inside one of BMO's video game creations.

title: Death in Bloom
desc: After accidentally killing Princess Bubblegum's beloved plant, Finn and Jake travel to the land of the dead to bring it back to life.

title: Susan Strong
desc: Having always believed he is the only human left in the Land of Ooo, Finn believes he has discovered a tribe to primitive humans living underground.

title: Mystery Train
desc: While traveling on a train, Finn and Jake find themselves in the middle of a murder mystery.

title: Go with Me
desc: Jake and Marceline give Finn conflicting advise on how to ask out Princess Bubblegum.

title: Belly of the Beast
desc: Finn and Jake must save a group of clueless, party-minded teddy bears living inside the belly of a monster.

title: The Limit
desc: An enormous maze tests the limit of Jake's stretching power.

title: Video Makers
desc: Finn and Jake set out to make their own movie, but have conflicting visions of what their movie should be.

title: Mortal Folly
desc: The Lich, the greatest form of pure evil in the land of Ooo, is accidentally unleashed. With the highest stakes, Finn and Jake set out on the most serious adventure of their career.

title: Mortal Recoil
desc: With the evil Lich seemingly defeated, Finn and Jake are uneasy with their success because of its great cost.

title: Heat Signature
desc: Finn and Jake ask Marceline the Vampire Queen to turn them into vampires. However, she isn't interested in transforming her friends and tricks them into thinking she has.

title: Conquest of Cuteness
desc: Finn and Jake come under attack in their home from a race of super-evil creatures which are too cute to be taken seriously.

title: Morituri Te Salutamus
desc: Finn and Jake end up in a haunted arena where they must fight ghost gladiators to escape.

title: Memory of a Memory
desc: Finding their friend, Marceline the Vampire Queen, in a deep sleep, a mysterious stranger helps Finn and Jake by sending them into her dreams to awaken her.

title: Hitman
desc: The Ice King looks to hire a professional bully to beat up Finn and Jake, but inadvertently hires a deadly, unstoppable contract killer.

title: Too Young
desc: Finn is happy that Princess Bubblegum has regressed to the same age as him. But soon a challenger for the throne arrives to unseat the newly underage princess.

title: The Monster
desc: The king and queen of Lumpy Space ask Finn to find and return Lumpy Space Princess, who has been living in the woods and mistaken as a monster.

title: Still
desc: The Ice King uses a potion that paralyzes Finn and Jake, who become the lonely villain's unwilling best friends.

title: Wizard Battle
desc: The Ice King enters a battle of wizards from all over the Land of Ooo, to win a kiss from Princess Bubblegum--which Finn and Jake look to prevent.

title: Fionna and Cake
desc: In a world where all the characters are different genders, the adventurer Fionna gets advice from her cat-friend Cake on her date with Prince Gumball.

title: What Was Missing
desc: In order to open a magic door filled with stolen items, Finn and all his friends must perform in a band. But everyone's differing musical tastes and overall tensions make things difficult.

title: Apple Thief
desc: After Tree Trunks finds her apples have gone missing, Finn and Jake search the criminal underworld of the Candy Kingdom to recover them.

title: The Creeps
desc: Finn's masquerade birthday party turns into a deadly mystery.

title: From Bad to Worse
desc: The undead plague returns to the Candy Kingdom.

title: Beautopia
desc: Susan Strong returns and asks Finn and Jake to save her people from the Glubs. But Finn is still not sure if he can trust her after last time.

title: No One Can Hear You
desc: After trying to stop a deer that has been licking the Candy Kingdom people, Finn wakes up in a hospital to find everyone missing expect Jake who is acting very strange.

title: Jake vs. Me-Mow
desc: A tiny cat assassin tries to black mail Jake into killing someone, by hiding in his nose with some poison.

title: Thank You
desc: A fire-breathing wolf cub becomes lost in the snowy woods and becomes unlikely friends with a tall snow-creature.

title: The New Frontier
desc: Jake has a dream that seems to foretell his death but, to Finn's dismay, doesn't take it serious.

title: Holly Jolly Secrets
desc: In part two of the holiday special, The Ice King tries to get his video diary back from Finn and Jake.

title: Marceline's Closet
desc: Bored waiting for her, Finn and Jake sneak into Marceline's house, become trapped when she comes home, and witness her strange behavior when she's alone.

title: Paper Pete
desc: A secret war takes place in the library between tiny paper people and mold creatures, and Finn is brought into the middle of it all.

title: Another Way
desc: Finn journeys for a cyclops's magical tears to cure his injuries, but have trouble because of his stubborn inability to follow the advice of others.

title: Ghost Princess
desc: Finn and Jake try to help Ghost Princess by solving her murder.

title: Dad's Dungeon
desc: Finn and Jake discover a lost message from their dad which sends them to a mysterious and dangerous dungeon.

title: Incendium
desc: Trying to help Finn get over his hopeless feelings for Princess Bubblegum, Jake sets out to find a new princess for Finn to go out with.

title: Hot to the Touch
desc: Refusing to believe that she is evil, Finn tries to win over his new crush, Flame Princess.

title: Five Short Graybles
desc: Five short stories of Finn, Jake and their friends.

title: Web Weirdos
desc: After being caught by a giant spider, Finn and Jake try and help the arachnid with its marital problems so they won't be eaten.

title: Dream of Love
desc: Tree Trunks finds love but her public displays of affection nauseate everyone around her.

title: Daddy's Little Monster
desc: Continuing their mysterious quest in the Nightosphere, Finn and Jake must rescue their friend Marceline the Vampire Queen.

title: Return to the Nightosphere
desc: Finn and Jake find themselves imprisoned in the dark realm of the Nightosphere with no memory of how they came to be there.

title: In Your Footsteps
desc: A cute, bumbling bear begins to follow and mimic Finn. At first Finn enjoys having the furry admirer, but soon becomes uneasy with the bear's devotion.

title: Hug Wolf
desc: A Hug Wolf, a monstrous wolf that gives hugs against the will of its victims, turns Finn into one of its kind.

title: Princess Monster Wife
desc: The Ice King steals various body parts from all the princesses to construct his own perfect princess bride.

title: Goliad
desc: Princess Bubblegum uses her own DNA to create an intelligent and immortal sphinx which is planned to one day succeed her to the throne, except that Finn and Jake accidentally affect those plans.

title: Beyond This Earthly Realm
desc: A magic curse turns Finn into a ghost, invisible to everyone but the Ice King.

title: Gotcha!
desc: Lumpy Space Princess sets out to write a book on how to catch a man and goes undercover as Finn and Jake's secretary in order to seduce Finn.

title: Princess Cookie
desc: The Candy Kingdom faces a hostage crisis from a cookie that demands Princess Bubblegum's crown.

title: Card Wars
desc: As Finn joins in on Jake's favorite, hyper-complicated card game, emotions and poor gamesmanship run high.

title: Sons of Mars
desc: Magic Man switches bodies with Jake so that he can escape his trial on Mars, leaving it up to Finn to reveal the truth and save his friend.

title: Burning Low
desc: Finn and Flame Princess cautiously begin a relationship as boyfriend and girlfriend, of which Princess Bubblegum disapproves.

title: BMO Noire
desc: BMO uses hard-boiled detective skills to locate Finn's missing sock.

title: King Worm
desc: Finn finds himself trapped in a bizarre dream, the outcome of which may determine if he ever wakes up.

title: Lady & Peebles
desc: Princess Bubblegum and Lady Rainicorn must rescue Finn and Jake.

title: You Made Me
desc: The would-be usurper to the throne, Lemongrab, returns to the Candy Kingdom, demanding volunteer subjects for his own kingdom.

title: Who Would Win
desc: While training for an epic battle, Finn and Jake take their frustrations out in a fight against each other.

title: Ignition Point
desc: Finn and Jake sneak into the Fire Kingdom to retrieve some of Flame Princess' things, and stumble onto a plot to kill the Flame King.

title: The Hard Easy
desc: A tribe of swamp creatures ask Finn and Jake to save them from a Mega Frog.

title: Reign of Gunters
desc: While the Ice King is away, his sidekick Gunther the penguin uses a magic amulet to conquer the countryside and attack the Candy Kingdom.

title: I Remember You
desc: The Ice King asks Marcelline the Vampire Queen to help him write a song.

title: The Lich
desc: Finn has an unclear premonition involving The Lich and sets out to stop the undead creature.

title: Jake the Dog
desc: Following the unexpected consequences of Finn's cosmic wish it's up to the Jake -- and his short attention span -- to set things right.

title: Finn the Human
desc: Finn's wish to stop the evil Lich has massive cosmic consequences.

title: Five More Short Graybles
desc: Five more short stories with one connecting theme.

title: Up a Tree
desc: Having been magical shrunk to the size of a forest animal, Finn takes up a quest to climb a tree and retrieve his lost flying disc.

title: All the Little People
desc: Finn receives a mysterious bag that contains what appears to be living toys of everyone he knows, which playing with has unexpected results.

title: Jake the Dad
desc: Lady gives birth to a litter of puppies and Jake becomes an eager but frantic father.

title: Davey
desc: Finn becomes Davey, an alter-ego, everyman in order to escape the attention of fame and becomes consumed by his new identity.

title: Mystery Dungeon
desc: Ice King, Neptr, Tree Trunks, Shelby and Lemongrab wake up in a dungeon and must work together to escape.

title: All Your Fault
desc: Lemongrab sends a distress message to the Candy Kingdom which Finn and Jake respond to.

title: Little Dude
desc: Finn's hat comes to life.

title: Bad Little Boy
desc: A return to the gender-swapped world with Fionna and Cake and Marshall Lee the Vampire King.

title: Vault of Bones
desc: Finn and Flame Princess explore a dungeon together.

title: The Great Bird Man
desc: Finn and Jake get lost in the badlands and are saved by Xergiok, ex-Goblin King who now lives in a cave. A look at what Ice King and Marceline were like 996 years ago.

title: Simon & Marcy
desc: Marceline tells Finn and Jake about her and Ice King's past, 996 years ago.

title: A Glitch Is a Glitch
desc: Ice King creates a computer virus to delete everybody except him and Princess Bubblegum. Stuck inside the treehouse during a sword storm, Jake builds a pillow fort while Finn goes to a different world.

title: Puhoy
desc: Depressed by his feelings with Flame Princess, Finn enters a pillow fort where he enters a new world and makes a new life for himself.

title: BMO Lost
desc: BMO gets snatched away by a giant eagle and must find his way home.

title: Princess Potluck
desc: Ice King does everything possible to ruin a princess potluck he believes he didn't get invited to.

title: James Baxter the Horse
desc: Finn and Jake meet a horse with the power to make sad people happy.

title: Shh!
desc: Finn and Jake hold a contest to see who can last longer without talking.

title: The Suitor
desc: Peppermint Butler thinks Princess Bubblegum is spending too much time in her lab and decides she needs a suitor.

title: The Party's Over, Isla de Señorita
desc: After becoming tired of always losing to Finn and Jake and failing to win Princess Bubblegum's love, Ice King decides to throw in the towel.

title: One Last Job
desc: Jake Jr. gets mixed up with some bad eggs, and Jake reunites with his old gang to save her.

title: Another Five More Short Graybles
desc: Five short stories, some involving Finn and Jake building a time machine.

title: Candy Streets
desc: Lumpy Space Princess is robbed and faints before she can tell Finn and Jake who robbed her.

title: Wizards Only, Fools
desc: Princess Bubblegum believes magic is nothing but a bunch of hooey until Starchy gets sick.

title: Jakesuit
desc: Jake is sick and tired of Finn using his body as a suit of armor.

title: Be More
desc: Finn and Jake disguise themselves as MOs in order to infiltrate the MO factory.

title: Sky Witch
desc: Princess Bubblegum and Marceline team up to reclaim lost property.

title: Frost & Fire
desc: After Flame Princess battles Ice King, Finn has an exciting dream.

title: Too Old
desc: Finn and Princess Bubblegum discover a talented lemon citizen named Lemonhope while on a diplomatic trip to Castle Lemongrab; also, something strange is happening to the Earls of Lemongrab, leading to their society crumbling.

title: Earth & Water
desc: Princess Bubblegum subjects Flame Princess to a series of tests to gauge Fire Princess' fiery tendencies.

title: Time Sandwich
desc: Jake crafts the most delicious sandwich ever.

title: The Vault
desc: Jake and BMO help Finn tap into his repressed memories to uncover a secret past.

title: Love Games
desc: Slime Princess needs a husband or else she'll lose the Slime Kingdom to her obnoxious sister.

title: Dungeon Train
desc: Finn and Jake discover a train where every car is a dungeon filled with a new foe for Finn to fight.

title: Box Prince
desc: Finn meets the Box Prince (a cat with a box on its back) and discovers the Box Kingdom has been taken over by an impostor.

title: Red Starved
desc: Finn, Jake and Marceline become trapped underground. Starving for anything red Marceline begins to loose control and turns her eyes to Finn and Jake's blood.

title: We Fixed a Truck
desc: Finn and Jake find a broken down pickup truck and enlist the help of BMO and Banana Man to fix it.

title: Play Date
desc: Sick and tired of babysitting Ice King while the Ice Kingdom is being rebuilt, Finn and Jake call up an old friend to hang out with their annoying houseguest: Abracadaniel. But when Ice King and his new BFF accidentally unleash the demon Kee-Oth, Finn and Jake have to clean up their mess.

title: The Pit
desc: Kee-Oth the Blood Demon has kidnapped Jake, taken him back to his dimension and thrown him in a pit. If Finn wants to rescue his friend, he's going to need Lady Rainicorn's help... and a videotape that will reveal how to open the portal to Kee-Oth's messed-up dimension.

title: James
desc: Finn and Jake accompany Princess Bubblegum on her study of the Desert of Wonders. However, they are soon attacked by goo monsters, and Finn and Jake think that Bubblegum's robot helper James is to blame.

title: Root Beer Guy
desc: Root beer guy must put aside his common everyday life to search for the truth behind the murders, lies, and deceit in the Candy Kingdom.

title: Apple Wedding
desc: Tree Trunks and Mr. Pig are getting married.

title: Blade of Grass
desc: Finn gets a new sword.

title: Rattleballs
desc: Finn meets an old robot in the junkyard who promises to make Finn into a master swordsman.

title: The Red Throne
desc: The Fire King and Don John the Flame Lord take over the Fire Kingdom. Now Flame Princess must use Finn's and Cinnamon Bun's help to get it back.

title: Betty
desc: The Ice King loses his powers, reverts to his old human-self, and begins to wither away due to being over a thousand years old.

title: Bad Timing
desc: Bubblegum Princess invents a time travel sphere that Lumpy Space Princess wants for solving her relationship problems.

title: Lemonhope Part One
desc: Young Lemonhope leaves the candy kingdom after a deep desire to be free of all responsibilities grips him. So he ventures out on his own with nothing more than a lute and hope to find freedom.

title: Lemonhope Part Two
desc: Lemonhope meets an adventurer who teaches him true freedom. But even with his new life of freedom he is plagued with dreams of his lemon kingdom and his family being imprisoned.

title: Billy's Bucket List
desc: Finn meets Billy's ex-girlfriend, Canyon, who finds Billy's bucket list. Finn vows to complete it for his late hero.

title: Wake Up
desc: Finn tracks down who he believes is his father.

title: Escape from the Citadel
desc: Finn finds his long-lost father after following the Lich to the Citadel. As it turns out, maybe this wasn't such a good idea?

title: James II
desc: 'James', Finn & Jake, and Princess Bubblegum discover that James has been cloned 25 times, and that the original zombie James is returning - and not in a good way.

title: The Tower
desc: Finn decides to build a tower to space.

title: Sad Face
desc: Once a month, while Finn and Jake are asleep, Jake's tail comes to life. It travels to a little circus in the forest, where it is known as Blue Nose the sad faced clown. But Blue Nose and the ringmaster come to a disagreement regarding the treatment of the "beast" Goralina.

title: Breezy
desc: In an attempt to help his wilting arm-flower, Finn begins a search for smooches with the help of a friendly bee named Breezy.

title: Food Chain
desc: Finn and Jake learn how the food chain works with a little help from Magic Man.

title: Furniture & Meat
desc: Finn and Jake spend all their money.

title: The Prince Who Wanted Everything
desc: Back to the Fiona and Cake universe when LSP wants the Ice King to tell (her) version of Lumpy Space Prince's life, but she has an ulterior motive.

title: Something Big
desc: The Sky Witch attacks the Candy Kingdom.

title: Little Brother
desc: Shelby gains a little brother who sets off to battle.

title: Ocarina
desc: Kim Kil Whan wants to teach his dad Jake responsibility.

title: Thanks for the Crabapples, Giuseppe!
desc: Ice King goes on a spiritual journey.

title: Princess Day
desc: Marceline and Lumpy Space Princess cause chaos at the Breakfast Kingdom.

title: Nemesis
desc: A crusader against the dark arts seeks to banish Peppermint Butler.

title: Joshua & Margaret Investigations
desc: Jake tells the story of his and his brother Jermaine's' births.

title: Ghost Fly
desc: Jake kills a fly that gets into his soup. However, he and Finn must get creative when the fly returns as a powerful ghost to haunt them.

title: Everything's Jake
desc: Jake is transported to a different world.

title: Is That You?
desc: After the death of Prismo, Finn and Jake do a funeral ritual. But when Jake eats the last pickle of the jar of pickles that Prismo made for him, he is transported to Prismo's lair. Will Finn be able to save him?

title: Jake the Brick
desc: Jake is conducting an experiment of being a brick in a brick-shack.

title: Dentist
desc: Finn has a toothache, so he has to go to the dentist.

title: The Cooler
desc: Flame Princess asks Princess Bubblegum for help when her city is cooled down.

title: The Pajama War
desc: A slumber party is being held in the Candy Kingdom and Finn and Princess Bubblegum are sent to 7 minutes in Heaven.

title: Evergreen
desc: Set in the Prehistoric Era, Evergreen and his apprentice Gunter have to stop a meteor heading towards Earth.

title: Astral Plane
desc: Finn and Jake go camping in the woods. When they go to sleep, Finn has an out-of-body experience and visits other creatures all around Ooo while he slowly ascends to space.

title: Gold Stars
desc: During his first day of school, Sweet Pea is approached by the King of OOO and his companion, Toronto, who lure him into dancing in public.

title: The Visitor
desc: Finn's dream about following a comet to its crash site reunites him with an old friend.

title: The Mountain
desc: Feeling unfulfilled, both Lemongrab and Finn take an introspective journey into the Mountain of Matthew. Inside, they are faced with their desires, their fears and themselves, and must make a pivotal choice.

title: Dark Purple
desc: Susan Strong and her allies infiltrate the mysterious Super Porp factory.

title: The Diary
desc: Jake's son T.V. discovers a mysterious diary in the dried-up moat of the Candy Kingdom, and becomes obsessed with finding out more about the writer known only as "B.P."

title: Walnuts & Rain
desc: Finn & Jake stumble into two different holes and meet two different fates.

title: Friends Forever
desc: The Ice King struggles with the consequences of making new friends.

title: Jermaine
desc: Jake meets his brother Jermaine in a dream and decides to visit him in the real world.

title: Chips & Ice Cream
desc: BMO'S favorite artists find a new home in the treehouse.

title: Graybles 1000+
desc: Cuber returns for the telling of another installment of the Graybles.

title: Hoots
desc: A charismatic stranger in Finn's dream leads Cosmic Owl to shirk his duties.

title: Water Park Prank
desc: Finn and Jake enjoy a day at the water park.

title: You Forgot Your Floaties
desc: Finn and Jake storm Magic Man's house to rescue his new apprentice.

title: Be Sweet
desc: A fed up Lumpy Space Princess leaves the woods for a glamorous career in babysitting.

title: Orgalorg
desc: Gunther experiences strange visions following a walrus race accident.

title: On the Lam
desc: Finn's father, Martin the Human, fights for freedom on a new planet.

title: Hot Diggity Doom
desc: Princess Bubblegum's attention is diverted by a mysterious presence in the sky.

title: The Comet
desc: Finn, Jake, and Orgalorg converge with the comet and meet their destiny.

title: All's Well That Rats Swell
desc: BMO discovers a rogue rat in the tree house's flour and attempts to drive off the creature.

title: Have You Seen the Muffin Mess
desc: Jake and Finn assist Princess Bubblegum in attempting to stop a muffin-based plague.

title: Sow, Do You Like Them Apples
desc: Ice King and Marceline are hungry for a snack.

title: The Gift That Reaps Giving
desc: Death tries to make a mixtape for his girlfriend, Life.

title: Bonnie & Neddy
desc: The greed of the King of Ooo leads to a crisis in the Candy Kingdom, and (ex-) Princess Bubblegum has to return briefly from exile to deal with it.

title: Varmints
desc: Marceline and Bubblegum rekindle an old friendship while fighting off some varmints.

title: Cherry Cream Soda
desc: The arrival of a visitor causes Cherry Cream Soda's life to fall flat.

title: Mama Said
desc: Finn and Jake's loyalty is questioned when King of Ooo sends the duo on a mission to catch flying mushrooms.

title: Football
desc: BMO switches places with his reflection, Football.

title: Stakes Part 1: Marceline the Vampire Queen
desc: Finn and Jake hunt a shadowy predator and Marceline asks Princess Bubblegum for a favor.

title: Stakes Part 2: Everything Stays
desc: As the sun rises on her last day, Marceline recalls her long extraordinary life.

title: Stakes Part 3: Vamps About
desc: Five foes from Marceline's past come back to cause trouble for the land of Ooo.

title: Stakes Part 4: The Empress Eyes
desc: The empress seeks her revenge and uses the Ice King as her puppet. Marceline retaliates and gets her own vengeance.

title: Stakes Part 5: May I Come In?
desc: Marceline, Bonnibel, Finn, Jake and Lumpy Space Princess fight a more traditional vampire, The Hierophant.

title: Stakes Part 6: Take Her Back
desc: Princess Bubblegum searches for a cure for Marceline and Finn and Jake battle a vampire.

title: Stakes Part 7: Checkmate
desc: Marceline's archenemy visits and makes an odd proposal right before battle.

title: Stakes Part 8: The Dark Cloud
desc: Following the release of the Vampire King's Vampuric essence, Finn, Jake, and Princess Bubblegum are forced into a fight against the seemingly unstoppable force without the aid of a depressed Marceline.

title: The More You Moe
desc: On BMO's birthday, Moe comes to visit and give BMO a special birthday mission. But while BMO is away, Moe begins to overstay his welcome at the tree house.

title: The Moe You Know
desc: BMO continues its quest to adulthood. It'll discover that something went wrong in the factory where all the MOs where created.

title: Summer Showers
desc: Jake's Daughter, Viola helps LSP with her play, Summer Showers.

title: Angel Face
desc: BMO creates a live action role-play bounty mission and sets out with Jake as his steed to capture the infamous 'Jack Rabbit Johnson'.

title: President Porpoise Is Missing!
desc: When Jakes video chat buddy goes missing, he must go look for him with Finn in Banana Man's submarine

title: Blank Eyed Girl
desc: A radio program broadcasts the most strange news, a blank eyed girl is going around scaring the inhabitants of Kandy Kingdom. Beware of the Blank Eyed Girl, it's coming for you.

title: Bad Jubies
desc: Finn, Jake, LSP and BMO must content with some deadly weather.

title: A King's Ransom
desc: Ice King suffers a heartbreaking loss and it's up to Finn and Jake to find the culprit.

title: Scamps
desc: A King's Ransom: Ice King suffers a heartbreaking loss and it's up to Finn and Jake to find the culprit. / Scamps: Finn takes a group of at-risk Candy Kingdom youth on a camping trip they'll never forget.

title: Crossover
desc: Due to a wish Finn asked Prismo to make, a while back Finn must now stop himself from another dimension along with a previous villian, from destroying the entire multiverse

title: The Hall of Egress
desc: Finn enters a mysterious dungeon and struggles to find a way out and back to Jake.

title: Flute Spell
desc: With it being rumoured that Finn is seeing someone new, Jake endeavours to find out who.

title: The Thin Yellow Line
desc: Finn and Jake infiltrate the Banana Guard ranks and stumble upon a conspiracy.

title: Broke His Crown
desc: Ice King has some problems with his crown. Princess Bubblegum helps along with Marceline.

title: Don't Look
desc: At the library, Finn learns of a mountain with treasure possessing transformative properties at its peak. He and Jake venture to find the treasure, but find more than they expected when they encounter the hermit guarding the treasure.

title: Frog Seasons, Spring
desc: Finn and Jake are compelled to follow a frog carrying a crown.

title: Beyond the Grotto
desc: Beyond the Grotto: In pursuit of a runaway Sea Lard, Finn and Jake are led down a whirlpool to a curious new land. / Lady Rainicorn of the Crystal Dimension: Jake's son TV finds a hidden box and draws the attention of a super cool Rainicorn named Lee.

title: Frog Seasons, Summer
desc: Finn and Jake are in for a surprise when they force the hand of fate.

title: Lady Rainicorn of the Crystal Dimension
desc: T.V., still living with his mother, discovers a magical object and without knowing, attracts Lee - a rainicorn from the Crystal Dimension, which reveals an important part of Lady Rainicorn's past.

title: Frog Seasons, Autumn
desc: Finn and Jake discover the power held by the crown.

title: I Am a Sword
desc: Fin loses his Fin-Sword and he needs to get it back ASAP, because someone is using it to cause terror and rampage.

title: Frog Seasons, Winter
desc: Finn and Jake follow the frog into the Ice Kingdom. Will they finally bear witness to the purpose of the crown?

title: Bun Bun
desc: Princess Bubblegum feels sad that Cinnamon Bun is the only candy person in the Flame Kingdom, so she creates Bun Bun, a tiny cinnamon bun, to keep him company.

title: Normal Man
desc: Stripped of his magic powers, Normal Man enlists Finn and Jake's help to rescue his brother Glob.

title: Elemental
desc: Ice King discovers something buried deep beneath the Ice Kingdom that could change Ooo forever.

title: Five Short Tables
desc: Fionna and cake go on an adventure to push the art of cake to another level

title: The Music Hole
desc: Finn gets to be the judge of battle of the bands held in the Candy Kingdom, when he starts to hear music that nobody else can.

title: Daddy-Daughter Card Wars
desc: Daddy-Daughter Card Wars: To put his embarrassing past behind him, Jake needs his daughter Charlie's help to win an underground Card Wars tourney.

title: Frog Seasons, Spring (Again)
desc: Finn and Jake come full circle in their pursuit of frog royalty.

title: Preboot
desc: While searching for old human artifacts, Jake, Finn, and Susan Strong meet Tiffany, who is employed by a mysterious Doctor Gross.

title: Reboot
desc: After Susan Strong's chip is activated, she goes rogue and attacks Finn.

title: Two Swords
desc: Finn and Jake puzzle over the nature of a mysterious newcomer.

title: Do No Harm
desc: Doctor Princess thrusts a great responsibility upon Finn. Jake goes adventuring with a new friend.

title: Wheels
desc: Kim Kil Whan seeks Jake's assistance with his daughter's detachment from school. Jake gets distracted by something else instead.

title: High Strangeness
desc: Tree Trunks receives a strange visitor who reacquaints her with some family members. Tensions flare between her and Princess Bubblegum.

title: Horse and Ball
desc: James Baxter takes his turn to showcase his backstory through an interesting collage of flashbacks brought on by his famous Ball being popped.

title: Jelly Beans Have Power
desc: Princess Bubblegum explores her new candy powers.

title: Islands Part 1: The Invitation
desc: Consequences regarding Susan's last sent message appear at the candy kingdom's shore, bringing about new questions and mysteries leading Finn, Jake and Susan to embark on a new adventure

title: Islands Part 2: Whipple the Happy Dragon
desc: After a mysterious craft lands in Ooo, Finn, Jake, Susan Strong, set sail for the Island that it originated, hoping to learn the truth about the past and what happened to the humans.

title: Islands Part 3: Mysterious Island
