desc: After waking up alone and shipwrecked, Finn investigates a bizarre island in search of his friends.

title: Islands Part 4: Imaginary Resources
desc: Finn and Jake find BMO, who is enjoying newfound fame and popularity in a new land.

title: Islands Part 5: Hide and Seek
desc: Susan strong has flashbacks to her life when she was younger, and starts remembering who she actually is.

title: Islands Part 6: Min and Marty
desc: Susan drops a big surprise on Finn and questions about his past are answered.

title: Islands Part 7: Helpers
desc: Finn finally finds what he was looking for but things are not the way he expected them to be. Susan sees someone from her past life.

title: Islands Part 8: The Light Cloud
desc: Finn decides to leave the island and tries to get everyone else as well to come with him

title: Orb
desc: During the journey home from their sea-faring adventure; Finn, Jake, and BMO encounter a mysterious force that enters their dreams.

title: Elements Part 1: Skyhooks
desc: Finn, Jake, and BMO return from their voyage to a radically changed Ooo.

title: Elements Part 2: Bespoken For
desc: The friends learn the story of what happened to Ooo, while Betty continues her attempt to reach Simon, but she's interrupted by someone out to steal her magic.

title: Elements Part 3: Winter Light
desc: Finn, Jake and Ice King break into the Ice World to confront the power-hungry evildoer responsible for the chaos in Ooo and try to rescue Betty.

title: Elements Part 4: Cloudy
desc: After taking a nap, Finn and Jake get separated from Betty and the Ice King. They need to get back and Jake needs to go pee.

title: Elements Part 5: Slime Central
desc: In order to save Ooo, Finn and Jake must gather the four elemental gems. They go to the Slime Kingdom and have to gather Slime Princess's gem.

title: Elements Part 6: Happy Warrior
desc: After gathering the Slime jewel, Finn and LSP go to the Fire Kingdom, to gather the Flame Jewel. Everything has turned even hotter than before.

title: Elements Part 7: Hero Heart
desc: After going to the Fire Kingdom, Finn becomes taken over by fire. LSP has to save him before he destroys the candy kingdom.

title: Elements Part 8: Skyhooks II
desc: After saving Finn the human during a battle between the candy kingdom and the fire kingdom it is discovered that LSP is made of anti-elemental magic and restores Ooo to it's former state.

title: Abstract
desc: Jake struggles through the personal changes happening to him as a mysterious encounter in a dream with his brother Jermaine begins to haunt him.

title: Ketchup
desc: BMO and Marceline play catch up on recent events.

title: Fionna and Cake and Fionna
desc: While performing a reading of 'Fiona and Cake', Ice King is confronted by a familiar figure.

title: Whispers
desc: While safeguarding a frightened Sweet P, Finn is led into a confrontation with an old foe.

title: Three Buckets
desc: Finn and Fern's carefree visit to some old ruins turns disastrous.

title: The Wild Hunt
desc: A fierce creature is terrorizing the Candy Kingdom but before Finn can slay the beast, he must first overcome a guilty conscience.

title: Always BMO Closing
desc: BMO and Ice King hit the road as door-to-door salesmen and stumble upon an irresistible opportunity.

title: Son of Rap Bear
desc: When Flame Princess is coaxed into a high stakes battle against the indomitable Son of Rap Bear, Finn must help her search for a new strategy.

title: Bonnibel Bubblegum
desc: A long lost artifact causes Princess Bubblegum to go back to the creation of the Candy Kingdom.

title: Seventeen
desc: A mysterious knight crashes Finn's birthday bash and presents him with a dangerous gift.

title: Ring of Fire
desc: When an old flame comes calling on urgent business, Tree Trunks reconsiders both her wild past and her tranquil present.

title: Marcy & Hunson
desc: After helping with the creation of a new sword, Hunson Abadeer comes back to try and regain his daughter's love.

title: The First Investigation
desc: Finn and Jake are tasked with investigating reports of a haunting at Joshua and Margaret's old office.

title: Temple of Mars
desc: Searching for answers on Mars, Finn and Jermaine discover that they must first survive a cunning Martian mental trap.

title: Blenanas
desc: Finn's latest literary work meets with only derision, so he sets out to prove all the naysayers wrong.

title: Jake the Starchild
desc: In order to fulfill his grand destiny, Jake is spirited away by a strangely familiar shape-shifting alien.

title: Gumbaldia
desc: Finn and Jake, as ambassadors of the Candy Kingdom, travel to a powerful new city-state in a last ditch effort to stave off war.

title: Diamonds and Lemons
desc: Finn and his friends experience setbacks and creative triumphs in a fantastic new vision of Ooo.

title: Come Along With Me
desc: BMO narrates "The Great Gum War" in which Finn, Jake, Marceline, PB and the Candy Kingdom go to war against Gumbald and his army that will determine the fate of Ooo once and for all.

title: Buruma to Son Gokû
desc: The legend of the Dragon Balls is explained. After doing his chores and fishing, Son Gokû meets Buruma, who is on a quest to find the seven Dragon Balls, two of which she already has. She goes to Son Gokû's house and sees that he has a Dragon Ball, which his adoptive grandfather gave him before he died. When she can't convince him to give her his Dragon Ball, she conv... Read all

title: Arararâ! Tama ga nai!
desc: Bulma and Son Gokû have started their travel. They stop and Bulma throws one of her Hoi Poi Capsules, displaying a house inside, much for Son Gokû's surprise. While helping him taking a bath, Bulma realizes Son Gokû's tail is real and functional, A little bit in shock, she takes a bath while trying to deal with this innocent and bit annoying wild boy. Meanwhile, the c... Read all

title: Kame Sen'nin no Kinto-un
desc: Bulma and Son Gokû left for a while their search for the Dragon Balls in order to help Son Gokû's new friend, turtle Umigame, reach the sea. Bulma is not comfortable with Son Gokû's choice, but she decide to join him, afraid of being left alone and in danger. Soon they face an enemy but Son Gokû will not surrender and he will stand up for his new turtle friend. Son Go... Read all

title: Hitosarai yôkai Ûron
desc: It's been 3 days since Kame Sen'nin gave Son Gokû the Kinton Cloud, and Bulma the Dragon Ball he had. Now, Bulma and Son Gokû are traveling to a valley in order to collect a fifth Dragon Ball (thanks to Bulma's invention, the "Dragon Radar"). They soon reach a village that seems abandoned, but truth is that people were hiding their young daughters from the terrible Oo... Read all

title: Tsuyokute warui Sabaku no Yamucha
desc: Bulma and Son Gokû continue their quest for the sixth Dragon Ball, alongside Oolong, who, Bulma thought, might be useful due to his shape-form abilities. As soon as Oolong heard that they must pass through the Desert, he's terrified and tried to escape. Bulma manages to get Oolong under control in a very impressive and clever way. Bulma realizes that she has lost her ... Read all

title: Mayonaka no hômonsha-tachi
desc: It's been 1 week since Bulma and Son Gokû started their journey in search of the 7 Dragon Balls, and they already have 5 of them. After Gokû and Oolong's meeting with Yamcha and Puar, and the fight between Gokû and Yamcha, Oolong finally reveals to Bulma that he was hiding a Hoi-Poi capsule, with a little trailer inside. While Son Gokû is eating Bulma goes for a bath,... Read all

title: Furaipan yama no Gyûmaô
desc: Goku, Bulma, and Oolong arrive at Fire Mountain, with Yamcha and Puar following closely behind. There, they meet the Ox King, who lives in the castle on Fire Mountain.

title: Kame Sen'nin no Kamehameha
desc: Master Roshi agrees to let Goku borrow the Bansho fan, but when he goes to retrieve it, he remembers that he spilled juice on it and threw it out. He decides to put out the fire himself.

title: Usagi oyabun no tokui-waza
desc: Son Goku, Bulma and Oolong arrive at a village in which the villagers seem scared of Bulma. It is soon found out to be due to her outfit having the rabbit ears associated with the Rabbit Gang, lead by Usagi Ninjinka.

title: Doragon bôru ubawareru!!
desc: Shu runs off with Bulma's suitcase, which contains their Dragon Balls. Luckily, Goku still has the Four-Star Ball.

title: Tsuini Doragon arawaru!
desc: Mai steals the Four-Star Ball from Goku. When they wake up, Pilaf sends giant pinballs rolling after them.

title: Shenlong e no negai
desc: To stop Emperor Pilaf, Oolong interrupts his wish for world conquest with a wish for underpants. A furious Pilaf orders them burned to death. Then Goku looks up at the full moon and unleashes an ancient evil.

title: Gokû no dai-henshin
desc: Goku, now the Great Ape, begins destroying Pilaf's castle. Bulma, Yamcha, Oolong, and Puar are able to escape as Pilaf, Mai, and Shu start attacking Goku.

title: Gokû no raibaru? Sanjô!!
desc: Goku heads towards Master Roshi's island. Suddenly, another boy named Krillin requests training from Master Roshi.

title: Fushigi na On'na no Ko Ranchi
desc: Goku and Krillin bring Launch back to Master Roshi's island. Unknown to either of them, when she sneezes, she turns into a violent blonde criminal.

title: Shugyô · ishi sagashi
desc: Master Roshi gives the boys their final test for the day. He throws a stone into the woods, telling them to find it, and the loser must go without dinner.

title: Inochigake! Gyûnyû haitatsu
desc: Master Roshi has the boys deliver milk in many exhausting runs.

title: Kame senryû kitsûi shugyô
desc: Goku and Krillin continue their intense training.

title: Tenkaichi Budôkai hajimaru!
desc: After months of training with heavy turtle shells, the boys are eager to learn fighting techniques in time for the 21st World Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Deru ka!? Shugyô no iryoku
desc: The preliminaries of the 21st World Martial Arts Tournament begin with Goku, Krillin, and Yamcha eager to advance.

title: Ayaushi! Kuririn
desc: In the quarterfinal matches, Krillin is in the first match against Bacterian, a giant whose stench overwhelms the enemy.

title: Yamucha vs Jakkî Chun
desc: In the quarterfinals, Yamcha fights the powerful Jackie Chun. Nam fights Ranfan, who relies on seduction to win.

title: Detâ! Kyôteki Giran
desc: Goku's quarterfinal opponent, the monstrous Giran fights him with cheating tactics.

title: Kuririn hisshi no dai-kôbôsen
desc: The semifinals begin as Krillin and Jackie Chun fight. Unfortunately, Jackie Chun's too fast for Krillin.

title: Tate Gokû! Osoru beki tenkû X-ji ken
desc: Goku starts his semifinal match against Nam, who uses aerial attacks.

title: Kesshôsen da!! Kamehameha
desc: After many impressive battles, the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament has finally arrived. This ultimate showdown features crafty veteran Jackie Chun taking on the rambunctious youngster Goku.

title: Gokû · saidai no pinchi
desc: The final match between Goku and Jackie Chun continues as Jackie's hypnosis and Goku's janken fail to yield results. They are then forced to unleash their deadliest techniques.

title: Gekitotsu!! Pawâ tai pawâ
desc: Jackie Chun reveals that the actual target of his Kamehameha wave was the moon, to de-power Goku. With both of them exhausted, they agree on a straightforward finish to the fight.

title: Futatabi bôken samayô mizûmi
desc: The river at Nam's village has run dry, and Goku finds that a dam has been built upstream by Giran and his fellow monsters.

title: Pirafu to nazo no gundan
desc: When the dragon radar is stolen, Goku follows the thief to to an antique shop with a Dragon Ball.

title: Gege! Nise Gokû shutsugen!!
desc: The much pursued Dragon Ball ends up in the possession of the great and powerful Ox-King - who just happens to be busy planning his daughter's wedding.

title: Kieta!? Sora tobu yôsai
desc: Both the Red Ribbon Army and Goku pursue Pilaf for the Dragon Ball.

title: Doragon no densetsu
desc: Master Roshi tells everyone the legend of the Dragon Balls.

title: Hijô no Reddo Ribon
desc: Goku and the Red Ribbon Army race each other in a search for the five-star ball.

title: Kita no shôjo Suno
desc: The girl called Snow explains to Goku that the Red Ribbon Army is forcing their village to help them look for the Dragon Ball.

title: Massuru Tawâ no kyôfu
desc: Goku enters Muscle Tower and fights a large android named Major Metallitron.

title: Ninja Murasaki sanjô
desc: Ninja Murasaki is sent to kill Goku. They engage in games of hide and seek, racing, and shuriken throwing.

title: Osorubeshi!! Bunshin no jutsu
desc: Murasaki decides to use his ultimate ninja technique and splits into five clones.

title: Nazo no Jinzôningen 8-gô
desc: Ninja Murasaki releases Android 8 to fight Goku, but Android 8 refuses to fight.

title: Dô suru Gokû!! Senritsu no Buyon
desc: General White releases a monster, Buyon to destroy Goku and Eighter.

title: Massuru Tawâ no saigo
desc: Goku fights General White for the fate of Muscle Tower as Eighter looks on.

title: Kiki ippatsu!! Ganbare 8chan
desc: Eighter still has the bomb inside him, so they go to Dr. Flappe to sort the problem as Murasaki stalks them.

title: Nichi no miyako no Buruma n'chi
desc: Goku reaches West City but has no idea where to find Bulma.

title: Gokû to nakama to kiken ga ippai
desc: General Black hires a master thief, Hasky, to get the balls from Goku.

title: Ki o tsukero! Kûchû no wana
desc: Hasky plans to steal the Dragon Balls while Goku's group is having fun.

title: Buruma no dai shippai
desc: Goku and Bulma head to an island to look for a dragon ball, but it is under the control of General Blue of the Red Ribbon Army.

title: KAME HOUSE hakken saru!!
desc: Goku makes it to Roshi's island and Launch and Krillin return.

title: Burû Shôgun kôgeki kaishi!!
desc: General Blue plans to tail and attack Goku and company at Roshi's Island.

title: Ayaushi Ranchi-san
desc: General Blue continues to chase Bulma, Goku and Krillin's submarine. Meanwhile, Master Roshi is having a bit of trouble with Captain Dock and an aggressive Launch.

title: Kaizoku-tachi no wana
desc: Goku, Bulma and Krillin surface into a pirates' hideout full of traps.

title: Kaitei no gâdoman
desc: Goku and Krillin fight the giant Pirate robot.

title: Yatta! Otakara hakken
desc: The heroes find the treasure chest and General Blue finally shows himself.

title: Kyôfu no hikaru me
desc: Goku and Blue continue fighting and Goku is winning until Blue powers up.

title: Nigero ya nigero!! Dai dasshutsu
desc: As the ceiling collapses, the heroes flee to the getaway submarine.

title: Ncha! Otte Pengin-mura
desc: After a chase, Goku and General Blue fly into a strange land called Penguin Village.

title: Uhohôi! Arare kumo ni noru
desc: In Penguin Village, Goku meets Arale. Blue loses his patience with the locals.

title: Taiketsu! Arare vs Burû
desc: Goku finds Blue and Blue threatens Arale, who begins a fight with him.

title: Makyô no seichi Karin
desc: In the Land of Korin, Captain Yellow threatens the locals for another dragon ball.

title: Kita! Sekai'ichi no koroshiya "Tao Pai Pai"
desc: Mercenary Tao is hired to kill Goku and retrieve the dragon balls. Meanwhile, Bora tells Goku about the legend of Korin Tower.

title: Shôbu!! Kamehame-ha vs Dodon-pa
desc: Red is displeased with Blue and offers him a second chance if he can defeat Mercenary Tao. Bora tells Goku the legend of the Korin Tower.

title: Karin-tô no Karin-sama
desc: Goku eventually reaches the summit of Korin's tower, but Korin is not about to hand the sacred water to Goku.

title: Hatashite!? Chôseisui no kikime
desc: Goku attempts to snatch the sacred water from Korin.

title: Son Gokû no gyakushû
desc: Goku arrives for a rematch with Tao, who finds out about the legend of Korin's tower and the sacred water.

title: Saigo no Tao Pai Pai
desc: Tao reaches the tower summit and treats Korin arrogantly as Goku relaxes.

title: Yuke Gokû! Totsugeki kaishi
desc: As Goku makes his way to the Red Ribbon HQ, Colonel Violet tracks another dragon ball.

title: Reddo Ribon gun hisshi no kôbô
desc: Goku gets past the defenses and attacks the Red Ribbon base. The entire Red Ribbon army attacks him.

title: Reddo sôsui shisu!!
desc: The Red Ribbon soldiers begin fleeing. Red leaves an increasingly frustrated Black to face Goku as he retreats.

title: Saigo no doragon bôru
desc: The war with the Red Ribbon Army comes to an epic conclusion.

title: Kyûto na!? Uranai Baba
desc: Roshi suggests that Goku visits Fortuneteller Baba to find the last Dragon Ball with her clairvoyance.

title: Totsugeki! Warera 5-nin no senshi
desc: Goku must battle five warriors of Baba. Krillin starts against Fangs the Vampire.

title: Kesshi no dai ryûkessen!
desc: Yamcha must fight an invisible warrior that he cannot defend himself from. Goku collects Roshi and Bulma to help out.

title: Gokû kenzan! Akuma no benjo
desc: Thanks to Roshi's fascination with Bulma's curves, Yamcha advances to the third round, but his next fight is in the Devil's Toilet against Bandages the mummified mauler!

title: Hissatsu Akumaito kôsen to wa!?
desc: Goku challenges the mummy to a fight.

title: Nazo no go-nin-me no otoko
desc: Goku goes head-to-head with Spike the Devilman, a winged freak known for feeding off negative vibes. If the little man survives, there's a fifth fighter waiting in the wings, and he smells strangely familiar.

title: Gekitotsu!! Kyôteki dôshi
desc: The final fight begins between Goku and the masked man.

title: Kamen otoko no shôtai wa!?
desc: Pilaf, Shu and Mai set off to Fortuneteller Baba's palace to defeat Goku and steal his last six Dragon Balls. Gohan is about to defeat Goku.

title: Pirafu no dai sakusen
desc: Pilaf, Shu and Mai get in their power suits and challenge Goku to a battle, with the dragon balls at stake.

title: Shenron futatabi
desc: Goku takes all the dragon balls to the Land of Korin, and the dragon rises again.

title: Kinkaku · Ginkaku no hitokui hyôtan
desc: Goku encounters a village which is being terrorized by two men called Terror and Plague.

title: Iza gozen shiai! Gokû vs Tenron
desc: Goku goes to challenge Master Chin, who is busy fending off Rising Dragon and Sky Dragon.

title: Gokû · makai e iku
desc: Goku faces the demon Shula to rescue Princess Misa.

title: Abare kaijû Inoshikachô
desc: Goku sees a monster named InoShikaCho terrorizing a village, just as two men arrive to "defeat" it.

title: Isoge Gokû! Tenka'ichi Budôkai
desc: It is the day before the World Martial Arts Tournament, and Goku heads to Papaya Island.

title: Mezase budô tenka'ichi!!
desc: Krillin and Yamcha are eager to test their strength after training under Master Roshi, and the World Martial Arts tournament is the perfect place to show off their new moves. There's just one problem - Goku is missing in action!

title: Kachi nokoru zo!! Yosen sabaibaru
desc: Goku, Krillin, Yamcha and Jackie Chun advance through the preliminaries. Master Shen's two students, Tien Shinhan and Chiaotzu insult the heroes.

title: Kettei!! 8-nin no yûsha-tachi
desc: The preliminaries end with Goku fighting King Choppa.

title: Taiketsu!! Yamucha vs Tenshinhan
desc: In the finals, Yamcha and Tien start fighting.

title: Yuke Yamucha! Osorubeshi Tenshinhan
desc: Yamcha uses his powerful techniques, but they have no effect on Tien.

title: Kyôfu!! Mangetsu no urami
desc: Man Wolf angrily fights Jackie Chun for revenge.

title: Nanana!! Nanto Dodon-pa
desc: Chiaotzu attacks Krillin with the same technique used by Mercenary Tao.

title: Gyakuten!! Kuririn no 8-den ne dai sakusen
desc: Krillin continues his fight with Chiaotzu.

title: Omatasê! Son Gokû sanjô!!
desc: Pomput's manager realizes Pomput cannot beat Goku, and resorts to cheating.

title: Jitsuryoku hakuchû!! Tenshinhan vs Jakkî
desc: In the semifinals, Jackie Chun and Tien Shinhan begin their match.

title: Gegege!! Shin Tsuru-sen-ryû · Taiyô-ken
desc: Tien and Jackie Chun continue their fight as Jackie tries to show him the error of his ways.

title: Faito!! Gokû vs Kuririn
desc: Goku and Krillin fight their semifinal match.

title: Masaka Gokû!? Kuririn no dai sakusen
desc: Goku and Krillin continue their fight as Goku gets the upper hand.

title: Kesshô!! Hatashite budô tenka'ichi wa!?
desc: Goku fights Tien in the final match of the tournament.

title: Higi · haikyû-ken VS sentô pawâ
desc: Goku reveals that throughout the tournament he had only been using a fraction of his power to protect his opponent, but now he is going to fight at full power, and unleashes an assault on Tien.

title: Tenshinhan no kunô!!
desc: Chiaotzu uses his powers to paralyze Goku so Tien can win easily.

title: Sei ka shi ka!? Saigo no shudan
desc: Tien grows two extra arms and gains an advantage over Goku.

title: Budôkai shûryô! Soshite...!!
desc: Since Tien can fly and knock Goku out of bounds with the Tri-Beam Cannon, Goku seems to have no chance of winning.

title: Kuririn no shi osoroshiki inbô!!
desc: Goku finds Krillin murdered and the Dragon Balls stolen by King Piccolo, assisted by Emperor Pilaf.

title: Pikkoro Daimaô no kyôfu
desc: Goku fights Tambourine, but Goku is weak from hunger.

title: Yomigaere Son Gokû!!
desc: Tambourine begins killing everyone on the list of tournament participants as King Piccolo sends Cymbal to gather the remaining dragon balls.

title: Kaidanji · Yajirobê tôjô!!
desc: Goku fights with the mountain man Yajirobe as Cymbal approaches their location.

title: Majû · Tanbarin ga yattekuru!!
desc: Tambourine next targets Yamcha as Goku requests for Yajirobe's dragon ball.

title: Son Gokû ikari bakuhatsu!!
desc: Master Roshi and Tien continue their search for the dragon balls, and Tien's brutal past comes back to haunt him.

title: Pikkoro Daimaô oritatsu!!
desc: Goku begins his fight with Tambourine and gets the upper hand.

title: Son Gokû tai Pikkoro Daimaô
desc: King Piccolo steps down to face Goku himself.

title: Ganbare! Son Gokû!!
desc: King Piccolo wounds Goku and goes to get the rest of the dragon balls.

title: Kame sen'nin no saigo no Mafûba!!
desc: Roshi, knowing that he is no match for King Piccolo, toys with him during the fight.

title: Wakagaeru ka!? Pikkoro Daimaô
desc: King Piccolo makes his wish to the Eternal Dragon and becomes younger.

title: Kingu Kyassuru no kôbô!!
desc: As King Piccolo prepares to attack Chow Castle, Goku intends to climb Korin's tower.

title: Gokû no negai!! Karin-sama mo nayamu
desc: King Piccolo kills King Furry's subjects and demands Furry tell the world of his conquest. Yajirobe meets Korin.

title: Te ni irero! Nazo no Chôshinsui
desc: Korin tells Goku about his last hope, the Ultra Divine Water hidden deep in an icy labyrinth.

title: Ikiteita Kame-sen'nin!?
desc: Yajirobe and Goku press on in the labyrinth and are shocked to see Master Roshi.

title: Son Gokû tsui ni hasshin!!
desc: Goku has survived the Ultra Divine Water. King Piccolo frees criminals throughout the world.

title: Tenshinhan no ketsui!!
desc: King Piccolo chooses to destroy Bulma's homeland.

title: Kimaru ka!? Densetsu no Mafûba
desc: Tien is forced to fight Drum and waits for his chance to perform the evil containment wave on Piccolo.

title: Gokû · ikari no furu pawâ!!
desc: Goku starts his fight against King Piccolo in Chow Castle.

title: Son Gokû saidai no kiki!!
desc: Goku continues to fight King Piccolo in a destructive clash.

title: Saigo no kake!!
desc: Sensing he is in a losing battle, King Piccolo resorts to a cowardly act, threatening to kill Tien, if Goku moves a muscle. Yamcha reaches the place and lands his plane. Yajirobe has also arrived to watch Goku fight. Upon discovering that King Piccolo killed Shenron, Goku resigns himself to endure repetitive pains getting his limbs crippled. With Goku incapacitated, K... Read all

title: Nyoi-bô no himitsu
desc: As the eternal dragon is dead, Goku must find the creator of the dragon balls, Kami. King Piccolo's egg is about to hatch.

title: Kumo no ue no shinden
desc: Goku extends the Power Pole from Korin's Tower to reach Kami's temple above.

title: Kami-sama tôjô!!
desc: Kami reveals himself to Goku, and agrees to revive the Eternal Dragon if Goku will stay and train.

title: Yomigaeru Shenron!!
desc: Kami revives Shenron, the Eternal Dragon, who Goku's friends call.

title: Kaminari yori mo hayaku!!
desc: Kami and Mr. Popo send Goku on a training mission to fetch a crown.

title: Sora no yô ni shizuka ni
desc: Mr. Popo sends Goku to a forest to find someone who can train his mind.

title: Toki o kakeru Gokû
desc: Goku goes back in time and meets the young Master Roshi, Crane Hermit, and Mutaito.

title: Gokû no teki wa.. Gokû!?
desc: Goku trains with a powerful clay version of himself.

title: Sorezore no michi o mezashite
desc: Tien, Krillin, Yamcha, and Chiaotzu continue their search for Korin's Tower and find a small village at the base of a mountain.

title: Maguma yori atsuku
desc: Tien, Krillin, Yamcha, and Chiaotzu each try to stop the flow of lava towards the village.

title: Arashi no mae no saikai
desc: Three years have passed and the heroes reunite for the 23rd Martial Arts Tournament.

title: Haran no Tenka'ichi Budôkai
desc: Goku and Tien are horrified that Piccolo's son is at the tournament, as the preliminaries begin.

title: Erabareta 8-nin
desc: Tien, Tao, a familiar girl, Goku, Krillin, Piccolo, Yamcha, and Hero advance to the finals.

title: Koroshi-ya Tao Pai Pai no gyakushû
desc: Tien proves to be much stronger than his former master Tao.

title: Son Gokû no kekkon
desc: Goku fights his female opponent, who is angry at him for some reason.

title: Nazo no otoko · Shen
desc: Krillin struggles to fight the unstoppable Piccolo.

title: Gekitô futatabi! Gokû vs Tenshinhan
desc: Hero easily dominates Yamcha, who still refuses to listen to advice.

title: Hontô no chikara
desc: Goku removes his training weights and becomes much faster in his fight against Tien.

title: Yonin no Tenshinhan
desc: Tien splits his body into four separate Tiens and attacks Goku.

title: Dotchi ga tsuyoi!? Kami vs Pikkoro Daimaô
desc: Kami battles Piccolo, intending to destroy his evil half for good.

title: Kono yo no unmei o kakete!
desc: Goku realizes that it is up to him to stop Piccolo in the final match.

title: Deta! Kyûkyoku no chô-Kamehame-ha
desc: Goku starts to win against Piccolo, who decides to unleash his most devastating attack.

title: Pikkoro Daimaô chô-kyoshinjutsu
desc: Piccolo reveals to everyone that he is the reincarnation of King Piccolo and turns into a giant form of himself to fight Goku.

title: Son Gokû no wana
desc: Goku jumps down the giant Piccolo's throat to save Kami, then continues the fight alone.

title: Banji kyûsu!!
desc: Piccolo resorts to his ultimate attack, destroying the entire island and seemingly Goku.

title: Yatta! Chikyû-jô saikyô no otoko
desc: Piccolo flies to the sky to finish off his nemesis. However, Goku has a surprise in store for him.

title: Honô no naka no uedingu doresu
desc: Goku and Chichi prepare for their wedding.

title: Maboroshi no hikuidori
desc: The people are unable to extinguish the fire consuming the castle, so Goku and Chi Chi seek another Bansho fan.

title: Chichi no hanayome shugyô no okage desu
desc: Goku and Chi Chi search for the Bansho fan in a snowy mountain.

title: Isoge Gokû! Gogyôzan no nazo
desc: Goku realizes that the fan won't work and he must go to the Dark World.

title: Moeru Furaipan yama! Isshun no kesshikô
desc: In the series finale, Goku and Chi Chi fight to make their wedding go as planned.

title: Part 1
desc: My log has a message for you.

title: Part 2
desc: The stars turn and a time presents itself.

title: Part 4
desc: ...brings back some memories.

title: Part 3
desc: Call for help.

title: Part 5
desc: Case files.

title: Part 6
desc: Don't die.

title: Part 7
desc: There's a body all right.

title: Part 8
desc: Gotta light?

title: Part 9
desc: This is the chair.

title: Part 10
desc: Laura is the one.

title: Part 11
desc: There's fire where you are going.

title: Part 12
desc: Let's rock.

title: Part 13
desc: What story is that, Charlie?

title: Part 14
desc: We are like the dreamer.

title: Part 15
desc: There's some fear in letting go.

title: Part 16
desc: No knock, no doorbell.

title: Part 17
desc: The past dictates the future.

title: Part 18
desc: What is your name?

title: Pilot
desc: A dancer rejected by his homophobic parents and a family man with a high-paying job find themselves being pulled into the world of ball culture in New York in the late 1980s.

title: Access
desc: Blanca is denied access to a popular bar leading to a purposeful feud. Meanwhile, inexperienced Damon learns the truth about love and sex when he is asked on a date.

title: Giving and Receiving
desc: The House of Evangelista celebrates the holidays and prepares for the Snow Ball in spite of Angel's lack of holiday spirit. Elektra contemplates undergoing an affirming medical procedure.

title: The Fever
desc: Candy's insecurities about her appearance are heightened when she is criticized at a ball. Blanca worries when Damon and Ricky have a medical scare that threatens to tear them apart.

title: Mother's Day
desc: Blanca is forced to reconnect with her estranged siblings after the death of her mother.

title: Love Is the Message
desc: Pray Tell organizes a cabaret for the AIDS ward at a local hospital.

title: Pink Slip
desc: Blanca makes a startling revelation about Lil Papi that changes the House of Evangelista forever; Elektra rethinks her means of survival when the House of Abundance is evicted from their apartment.

title: Mother of The Year
desc: The ultimate showdown takes place at the Princess Ball, when the House of Evangelista battle against the House of Ferocity and Mother of the Year is decided.

title: Acting Up
desc: Blanca encourages the House of Evangelista to follow their dreams. Pray Tell joins an activist group to fight for the rights of HIV-positive people.

title: Worth It
desc: Determined to be an example to her children, Blanca launches a business venture with unexpected results. Meanwhile, Ricky's travels have unpredicted consequences for his relationship with Damon, and Elektra shocks the ballroom community with a bold move.

title: Butterfly/Cocoon
desc: A fatal mishap with a client leads Elektra to seek out the counsel of Blanca and Candy. Meanwhile, moving from friends to lovers proves to be a challenge for Angel and Lil Papi.

title: Never Knew Love Like This Before
desc: The Ballroom community is shaken to its core when a valued member is brutally attacked.

title: What Would Candy Do?
desc: Competition gets the best of Damon and Ricky as they audition for a spot on Madonna's Blonde Ambition tour.

title: Love's in Need of Love Today
desc: After falling ill while organizing his annual AIDS Cabaret, PrayTell lands in the hospital leading to a series of unexpected visitors.

title: Blow
desc: The House of Evangelista plan a large prank to antagonize Frederica. Meanwhile, Angel is introduced to the unsavory side of modeling.

title: Revelations
desc: Relationships are irreparably damaged when Damon reveals the secrets others have been hiding.

title: Life's a Beach
desc: With Blanca reeling from an unexpected loss, Elektra organizes a girls trip to the shore.

title: In My Heels
desc: After a medical set back, Blanca struggles to reassemble the House of Evangelista. Meanwhile, Pray Tell confronts old traumas when an exciting new category is proposed.

title: On the Run
desc: 1994. With the AIDS epidemic reaching fever pitch, Blanca finds purpose working as a nurse's aide at Roosevelt hospital alongside her new love, Christopher. But Blanca's history with a new patient leads to a challenging ordeal. Meanwhile, Lemar shakes up the ballroom community when he becomes father to the unruly House of Khan forcing the House of Evangelista to consider reassembling.

title: Intervention
desc: When Pray Tell's alcoholism leads to expected consequences, Blanca stages a much-needed intervention. Meanwhile, Blanca nervously prepares to meet Christopher's parents.

title: The Trunk
desc: After she is unjustly arrested, Elektra convinces Blanca to aid in disposing of the trunk in her closet before law enforcement finds it.

title: Take Me to Church
desc: After a startling health update, Pray Tell returns home to reconnect with his birth family.

title: Something Borrowed, Something Blue
desc: A visit from an old friend complicates Angel and Papi's wedding plans. Meanwhile, Elektra expands her business with the help of her new, shady, associates.

title: Something Old, Something New
desc: While the dust settles on their unforeseen life change, Papi adjusts to being a guardian and Angel seeks guidance from an unexpected source.

title: Series Finale (Part I)
desc: When Blanca discovers an HIV clinical trial is denying access to people of color, she joins ACT UP in an effort to get Pray Tell and other patients the medication.

title: Series Finale (Part II)
desc: When Blanca discovers an HIV clinical trial is denying access to people of color, she joins ACT UP in an effort to get Pray Tell and other patients the medication. Part 2 of the series finale.

title: Self-Proclaimed Psychic: Reigen Arataka ~And Mob~
desc: Mob is a high school student in a world of psychics and happens to be the strongest esper there is, trying to fit in with the crowd and suppress his ESP abilities but when he reaches his emotional peak of 100% something terrible emerges.

title: Doubts About Youth ~The Telepathy Club Appears~
desc: The Telepathy Club wants Mob to join them to avoid being disbanded for not having enough members but Reigen wants Mob to focus on his job instead.

title: An Invite to a Meeting ~Simply Put, I Just Want to Be Popular~
desc: During Body Improvement Club practice, Mob faints and is left in the club room to recover. The Telepathy Club comments that Mob will never be popular even if he trains his body.

title: Idiots Only Event ~Kin~
desc: During the cold open, delinquents from Salt Middle School are in a turf war with a rival school. When the rival delinquents are unable to win, they call for their leader, Teruki "Teru" Hanazawa. In spite of being physically unimposing, Teru disposes of the Salt delinquents with ease.

title: Ochimusha ~Psychic Powers and Me~
desc: Mob has promised not to use his powers ever again on humans, but a new psychic; Teru, appears. Will Mob use his powers or refuse the duel?

title: Discord ~To Become One~
desc: The president of the Telepathy Club asks Mob to help her find other espers. And a mysterious man talks to Ritsu mistaking him for his older brother Mob.

title: Exaltation ~I've Obtained Loss~
desc: Ritsu meets Dimple who teaches him how to use his new-found powers as thugs from other schools try to find and beat the one responsible for Hanazawa's defeat.

title: The Older Brother Bows ~Destructive Intent~
desc: After Ritsu stirs up trouble with his new found psychic powers, a new psychic; Koyoma, is sent by Claw to capture him

title: "Claw" ~7th Division~
desc: Mob and Teru leave to rescue the kidnapped kids from Claw as Ritsu and the others try to escape on their own.

title: The Heinous Aura ~Mastermind~
desc: All the Scars are sent after Mob and Teru as Ritsu and the others continue their escape.

title: Master ~Leader~
desc: The captured Mob and Ritsu reunite at last. Reigen arrives at the base and is peculiarly friendly with the guards.

title: Mob and Reigen ~A Giant Tsuchinoko Appears~
desc: As Reigen tries to convince Mob to not use his powers against the Scars, something unexpected happens to him.

title: Ripped Apart ~Someone Is Watching~
desc: Mob is still trying to lead an ordinary daily life, but the people around him do not allow it and try to get him out of his comfort zone with disastrous results.

title: Urban Legends ~Encountering Rumors~
desc: Reigen looks for new ways to get some money and decides that urban legends are what will take him out of poverty once and for all.

title: One Danger After Another ~Degeneration~
desc: Reigen sets up an official homepage for his Spirits and Such Consultation Office and he immediately starts to get jobs left and right, including a middle-aged man asking Reigen to curse someone and a woman who's being haunted by a ghost. As he was listening to their problems, Mob realizes something. Why do people treat humans and spirits so differently? Meanwhile, Reigen gets another request from a group of college students that want to take a photo at a haunted location, but.

title: Inside ~Evil Spirit~
desc: Reigen and Mob receive a new job. This time, their client is a wealthy man named Asagiri Masashi. He's not just rich, but super rich, so Reigen and Mob head to his mansion only to find other self-proclaimed psychics there as well. One of the psychics there happens to include the president of the Rising Sun Spiritual Union, Jodo Kirin. The job is apparently to exorcise the evil spirit that is apparently possessing his daughter, Minori.

title: Discord ~Choices~
desc: Mob gets trapped inside a parallel world created by Mogami Keiji. Minori ends up transferring to his class, and Mob becomes the target of bullying. He can't ask anyone for help, and his negative emotions start to build inside. The truth behind the tragedy that Mogami went through when he was alive comes to light. Meanwhile, Reigen and the others were waiting for Mob to regain consciousness back at the Asagiri mansion. Dimple attempts to save Mob by infiltrating Minori's body.

title: Poor, Lonely, Whitey
desc: Reigen's loneliness pushes him to achieve even more than ever before without Mob after realising he doesn't have any friends.

title: Cornered ~True Identity~
desc: After splitting up with Mob, Reigen starts doing a lot of the jobs on his own. He then gets an offer to appear on a TV program. Reigen is ecstatic and accepts the offer, but this was all a trap set by Jodo Kirin, the president of the Rising Sun Spiritual Union. Jodo corners him during the live filming of the show and the fact that Reigen is a fraud comes to light. Reigen gets bashed from all sides and ends up having to hold a press conference.

title: Even Then ~Continue Forward~
desc: The day for the annual marathon and Salt Middle School was drawing nearer. Mob proclaims that if he places in the top 10 he'll tell Tsubomi how he feels about her. Everyone around him cheers Mob on and he starts training hard every day until the day of the event. Meanwhile, Tsubomi and her friend Miki go to Reigen's Spirits and Such Consultation Office with a request. Ritsu happened to be at the office, helping out in Mob's absence, but he hears Tsubomi say something rather surprising.

title: Show Me What You've Got ~Band Together~
desc: While The Claw makes their schemes public, Reigen forms a defense team.

title: Collision ~Power Type~
desc: The boss of the Claw, Suzuki Toichiro barricades himself into Seasoning City Culture Tower after declaring war on the world. After instantly getting rid of the police barriers, they make their next move.

title: Guidance ~Psychic Sensor~
desc: The total offensive of the psychics who want to defeat Claw has begun, but the Supercives are really powerful and will give them more than one problem.

title: The Battle for Social Rehabilitation ~Friendship~
desc: Three years ago, Serizawa was troubled with about his psychic powers. One day, he was visited by the boss, Suzuki Toichiro. Serizawa ends up trusting him since he's the first person to understand what he's going through.

title: Boss Fight ~The Final Light~
desc: The conclusion of the final fight and the start and reinvigoration of numerous relationships.

title: Preparation
desc: Ewan and Charley prepare for their adventure around the globe starting from London. Training courses are in place for a treacherous journey ahead of them.

title: London to Volgograd
desc: Further preparations for the trip as the pair settle on which motorbikes to take. The journey begins for the boys here.

title: Kazakhstan
desc: A twelve hour nightmare for the two as they have their first visa problems in Prague.

title: Barnaul to Western Mongolia
desc: Cutting through part of Russia en route to Mongolia, Ewan and Charley are happy to be on tarmac roads all the way up to Barnaul. The stunning landscape of the Altai region is a pleasant surprise. Once across the Mongolian border they quickly realize how much they will need the good-luck sacred scarf they have been presented with, when they discover Mongolia's distinct... Read all

title: Yakutsk to Magadan: The Road of Bones
desc: Pushing on despite many setbacks, they immerse themselves in the rich culture and their spirits are lifted by the kind people of Mongolia. They know that the Road of Bones lies ahead and will surely test them further.

title: Anchorage to Calgary
desc: Floods wreak havoc as the pair spend their time team working with their support team to get through the remaining few miles of Russia.

title: Calgary to New York
desc: On the final leg of the journey to New York City Ewan McGregor and Charley Boorman are involved in collisions with cars.

title: One Year Later
desc: A year after their trip Ewan and Charlie take a look back at their adventure.

desc: Interview with Dennis Rodman and Haley Joel Osment. Musical guests David Alan Grier and Alan Thicke.

title: Jack Black; Jennette McCurdy
desc: Interviews with Jack Black and Jennette McCurdy; Musical Guest 311.

title: Eric Andre Does Paris
desc: Eric is tired of making America Great Again so he's going to Paris to make France s**tty again.

title: A King Is Born
desc: Eric & Hannibal are back! Eric welcomes Judy Greer and Adam Rippon, and befriends a lost rat on the subway, trying to find its original owner. Also - beer chugging musical guest Anderson Six.Paak!

title: Hannibal Quits
desc: After only one and a half episodes, Hannibal quits the show and is poorly cloned into a giant mutant version of himself named Blannibal.

title: You Got Served
desc: Eric welcomes Omarion and celebrity psychic Tyler Henry and feeds bugs to musical guest Machine Gun Kelly. Eric transforms into the Bench Mensch, a Jewish bench who helps people move.

title: Lizzo Up
desc: Eric welcomes Dermot Mulroney and Diane Guerrero with overweight musical guest Joey Bada$$. Lizzo debuts a surprise spinoff show.

title: The A$AP Ferg Show
desc: Eric welcomes Mercedes Javid and Brenda Song and punishes Grimes. He also gives his dead boss some ranch!

title: Blannibal Quits
desc: Blannibal has had enough of the show and quits. too. Eric gets into a dangerous situation with an organized crime associate. Eric and co-host Lakeith Stanfield welcome Tiffany Pollard and Naya Rivera with musical guest Big Freedia.

title: Named After My Dad's Penis
desc: Eric welcomes Luis Guzmán and Tia Carrere. Felipe Esparza hangs out. Mike Penis returns with a guest list of his own. JPEGMAFIA, Lil Yachty, MURS, Trippie Redd, and Zack Fox on a new Rapper Warrior Ninja.

title: Bone TV
desc: Eric welcomes Robin Givens, Cleopatra Coleman and Jai Rodriguez with musical guest Toro y Moi. Bone TV gets nasty.

title: Is Your Wife Still Depressed?
desc: Eric welcomes Quincy and Chad Johnson. Rapper Warrior Ninja guests Fat Tony, Freddie Gibbs, OG Swaggerdick and CUCO. Ranch it up guy gets a job. Felipe hovers over the guests.

title: The 50th Episode!
desc: Eric welcomes Blake Griffin and Stormy Daniels in the season finale. His crossing guard skills stink and Miss Eric Andre will be finally crowned.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: Apollo One
desc: NASA prepares for the Apollo 1 mission, then investigates the cause of the mission's tragic cabin fire.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: Can We Do This?
desc: The United States launches an aggressive plan to beat the Soviets to the moon.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
desc: During the turbulent year of 1968 Susan Borman looks with dread on her husband's impending mission to orbit the moon.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: We Have Cleared the Tower
desc: With a documentary film crew watching their every step NASA prepares for the Apollo 7 mission.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: Mare Tranquilitatis
desc: Buzz Aldrin, Neil Armstrong, and Michael Collins prepare for the Apollo 11 mission to the moon.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: Spider
desc: The evolution of the lunar module at Grumman Aircraft Engineering.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: That's All There Is
desc: On the Apollo 12 mission rookie astronaut Alan Bean becomes the fourth person to walk on the moon.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: We Interrupt This Program
desc: The Apollo 13 mission as seen through the reporting of two newscasters, highlighting the changing character of news coverage.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: For Miles and Miles
desc: Ten years after becoming the first American in space Alan Shepard battles back from health problems to command the Apollo 14 mission.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: Galileo Was Right
desc: The Apollo 15 astronauts and backup crew go through extensive geology training in preparation for their mission.

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: Le voyage dans la lune
desc: The last manned Apollo mission to the moon is juxtaposed with Georges Méliès' filming of Le voyage dans la lune (1902).

tv: From the Earth to the Moon
title: The Original Wives Club
desc: The lives of the astronaut wives during their NASA years and beyond - through speaking engagements and fashion shows, alcoholism and divorce.

title: Boardwalk Empire
desc: In 1920 Atlantic City, politician Enoch 'Nucky' Thompson makes arrangements to operate a liquor smuggling business during the early days of Prohibition. His driver, Jimmy Darmody, wishes to prove his usefulness.

title: The Ivory Tower
desc: The Feds begin to look into Nucky's affairs, his brother Eli looks to buy off Mrs. Schroeder, and Nucky essentially fires Jimmy Darmody as his chauffeur.

title: Broadway Limited
desc: When a witness turns up who can link Jimmy Darmody to the woods massacre, the Feds get involved, Nucky banishes him, and Rothstein recruits Luciano to kill him.

title: Anastasia
desc: Jimmy forges new relationships in Chicago; Nucky fetes a U.S. Senator; Chalky fingers a lynching suspect; Margaret and Lucy clash.

title: Nights in Ballygran
desc: Nucky makes preparations for the annual Celtic Day dinner on St. Patrick's Day, and Jimmy tries to get Pearl through the trauma of her disfigurement with drugs,

title: Family Limitation
desc: Nucky investigates a boardwalk theft; Jimmy scores points with Johnny Torrio in Chicago; Margaret stands up to Lucy.

title: Home
desc: After Enoch's senile father breaks a leg in his isolated house, the brothers agree that he no longer can live alone and the house should be given to a loyal employee.

title: Hold Me in Paradise
desc: Nucky travels to Chicago and acts as kingmaker during the Presidential convention, but at home brother Eli is shot as a rival mob senses weakness in Thompson's operation.

title: Belle Femme
desc: Jimmy arrives from Chicago under his new agreement with Nucky to retaliate against a rival gang element but gets a chilly reception from Angela.

title: The Emerald City
desc: Harrow guards Margaret and the kids, Jimmy mistakenly thinks Mr. Dittrich is Angela's lover, and Chalky pretends to align himself with Lansky.

title: Paris Green
desc: Van Alland remains suspicious of Sebso, the dying Commodore seeks a rapprochements with illegitimate son Jimmy, and Margaret leaves after a domestic argument with Nucky.

title: A Return to Normalcy
desc: Nucky's organizational skills are put to the test as the election approaches, his judgment's questioned as he handles the Commodore's poisoning, and he reveals his part to Margaret.
Confidantes of Nucky plot against him, Gillian vies with Angela for control of the house, race relations hit a boiling point, and Van Alden celebrates his 13th anniversary.

title: Ourselves Alone
desc: After Nucky is released, he finds that most of his organization have deserted him for the Commodore, Margaret keeps her head, and the IRA asks Nucky for a donation.

title: A Dangerous Maid
desc: The Commoore's faction cuts off Nucky's liquor supply as the treasurer's friends seem to be deserting him but he finds a willing ally in Owen Slater of Sinn Fein.

title: What Does the Bee Do?
desc: With the Commodore's Coast Guard seizing Nucky's liquor, he partners with Rothstein to bring it through Philly, but the Commodore suffers a debilitating stroke.

title: Gimcrack and Bunkum
desc: With the Commodore's stroke, the conspirators against Nucky realize their error and begin to make bad decisions.

title: The Age of Reason
desc: Lucy's water breaks and labor starts; guilt overpowers Van Alden while at the hospital. Nucky's racketeering case gets sent to federal court where someone uses a New Jersey senator to pull some strings. Having reached the age of reason, Margaret's son makes his first confession, and the priest wants her to set an example; Nucky warns her not to trust the sanctity of the confessional. Owen's cheekiness seems limitless. Jimmy spots Manny's lieutenant on the boardwalk with Nucky; a series of crosses, double-crosses, and confrontations follow.

title: Peg of Old
desc: Margaret drives to Brooklyn to see her estranged siblings but receives a cool response, Van Alden has a new boss, and the conspiracy opts to eliminate Nucky.

title: Two Boats and a Lifeguard
desc: When the Feds serve Eli with a subpoena, the trauma causes his father to have a heart attack, and Nucky announces to his rivals that he's retiring.

title: Battle of the Century
desc: Nucky goes to Belfast and offers to trade the IRA machine guns for whiskey, Waxy Gordon plans revenge against Manny Horvitz, and Jimmy enjoys his new status as AC boss.

title: Georgia Peaches
desc: Jimmy's supporters fail to break up Chalky's strikers and negotiations fail as Margaret thinks she can buy Emily's recovery and Manny Horvitz exacts revenge.

title: Under God's Power She Flourishes
desc: Jimmy's experiences at Princeton are seen in flashback, Margaret tries to deal with her guilt, and Doyle tries unsuccessfully to wheel and deal.

title: To the Lost
desc: Jimmy tries to make things right with Nucky, the KKK murderers get justice, and Nucky marries Margaret to avoid her testimony at his trial.

title: Boardwalk Empire: Season 3 New Characters (2012) (TV)
desc: Meet Gyp Rosetti (Bobby Cannavale), Billie Kent (Meg Chambers Steedle), Gaston Means (Stephen Root) and some of the other new characters popping up in Season 3 of 'Boardwalk Empire.'

title: Resolution
desc: Season 3 premiere. Nucky makes a New Year's resolution; Margaret eyes a hospital expansion; Gillian builds a new business; Van Alden calls a gangster's bluff.

title: Spaghetti and Coffee
desc: Nucky's relationship with Billie grows as Margaret becomes involved in women's issues at the hospital. A humbled Eli is released from jail as Gyp muscles into the operation.

title: Bone for Tuna
desc: Gyp and his crew choke off the northbound road to New York and forces Nucky to come to an accommodation as he also tries to muscle into AC's prostitution.

title: Blue Bell Boy
desc: After tracking down a liquor thief, Nucky and Owen end up spending a long night hiding out from the Feds with the precocious perp. Mickey makes a routing call that will have far-reaching consequences. Capone's feud with O'Banion heats up.

title: You'd Be Surprised
desc: A frustrated Rothstein meets with Gyp in Tabor Heights, a paranoid Van Alden is looking over his shoulder, and Nucky goes to great length to insure success for Billie's show.

title: Ging Gang Goolie
desc: Daugherty's men harass Nucky on trumped up charges and he forms an alliance with Esther Randolph while the rift with Margaret grows wider.

title: Sunday Best
desc: Easter Sunday allows for several families to share dinner" Nucky, Margaret and the kids with Eli, Richard with the Sagorskys, and Gyp with his wife and kids.

title: The Pony
desc: Gillian plots revenge for Jimmy's murder, Billie gets a screen test, and Nucky approaches cabinet secretary Andrew Mellon with an offer he can't refuse.

title: The Milkmaid's Lot
desc: Nucky is still feeling the effects of the bomb concussion as Rothstein and other allies withdraw their support while Margaret and Owen come to an understanding.

title: A Man, a Plan...
desc: Nucky plans to whack Joe Masseria and Gyp Rosetti, Richard stands up to Julia's abusive father, and Owen and Margaret plan to run off together.

title: Two Imposters
desc: After Owen's dead body is delivered in a crate and Margaret leaves him, Nucky spends the next day with a seriously wounded Eddie and Gyp's thugs trying to kill him.

title: Margate Sands
desc: After promising Rothstein Mellon's distillery, Masseria is persuaded to withdraw his support for Gyp, and Margaret finds an abortionist in Brooklyn.

title: New York Sour
desc: Nucky makes peace with Masseria and Rothstein, a dalliance causes Dunn Purnsley to murder a talent agent, and Gillian tries to wrest custody of Tommy.

title: Resignation
desc: Van Alden runs errands for O'Bannion and later for Capone. Dr. Valentin Narcisse, an educated, sophisticated thug wants retribution for the murder of Pastor.

title: Acres of Diamonds
desc: Former bootlegger associate Bill McCoy talks Nucky into partnering with a local Tampa hood, and Narcisse attempts to come between Nunn and Chalky.

title: All In
desc: Nucky decides not to partner with Rothstein on his Tampa operation, Narcisse recruits Dunn from Chalky, and Van Alden switches allegiance From O'Banion to Capone.

title: Erlkönig
desc: Agent Knox ruthlessly detains and badgers Eddie, Nucky pulls whatever strings he needs to to get his nephew off the hook, and Gillian becomes more heavily addicted.

title: The North Star
desc: With new partner Meyer Lansky for his Tampa operation, Nucky reacquaints himself with Sally Wheet, Eddie's death causes Knox to fall out with Hoover, and Sagorsky gets a grim diagnosis.

title: William Wilson
desc: Knox resents newly-appointed Hoover taking credit for his work, Roy helps Gillian kick heroin, Nucky and Eli clash over Willie, and Torrio feels that O'Banion's betrayed him.

title: The Old Ship of Zion
desc: Sally Wheet arrives from Florida with a crates of oranges and liquor, Knox continues to pursue criminal charges on the Thompsons, and Nucky helps reconcile Eli and Willie.

title: Marriage and Hunting
desc: Nucky refuses to involve himself in Chalky's growing conflict with Narcisse, Rothstein's need for cash pushes him to collect on Doyle's insurance, and Van Alden agrees to kill O'Banion.

title: White Horse Pike
desc: Nucky discovers that Lansky is betraying him by piggybacking heroin in his liquor trucks, Nacisse and Chalky are at total war, and Knox coerces Eli.

title: Havre de Grace
desc: Chalky and Daughter are on the run after a failed attempt on Nacisse and are being protected by his old mentor, and Willie officially joins the family business.

title: Farewell Daddy Blues
desc: Eli braces for the worst as Agent Knox launches his plan to bring Nucky down. Capone and Torrio reach an agreement in Cicero. Chalky looks to settle scores. Richard steps forward to save Tommy, at Gillian's expense.

title: Golden Days for Boys and Girls
desc: 1931: Nucky is in Cuba attempting to set up networks for shipping into the US when the Volstead Act is lifted. Charlie makes a move on Joe Masseria. Chalky is in chains, and fights for his freedom. There are glimpses of Nucky's past.

title: The Good Listener
desc: Nucky's 1931 deal as a future importer of rum when Prohibition expires seems in jeopardy when the Senator loses interest, and in 1884 a young Nucky has to deal with his sister's death.

title: What Jesus Said
desc: Nucky loses his senatorial interest in his alcohol distribution and seeks out new support. Margaret finds herself in trouble for a deal she made with Arnold Rothstein years before he died. Chalky is still on the run.

title: Cuanto
desc: Luciano encounters Capone in Chicago; Nucky and Margaret find common ground in Atlantic City. Meanwhile, Sally conducts business in Cuba as rumors swirl of a public uprising. In 1884, a young Nucky continues to impress the commodore.

title: King of Norway
desc: When fugitive Chalky comes to Nucky hunting for Narcisse, Nucky advises him against revenge and hides him. Van Alden and Eli are arrested, and an 1897 Nucky moves up with the Commodore.

title: Devil You Know
desc: Chalky comes to an agreement with Narcisse to free Daughter Maitland. Nucky engages in alcoholic depravity. Van Alden and Eli try to steal Capone's ledgers.

title: Friendless Child
desc: In 1897 Nucky's family tries to help the young Gillian and in 1931 his forces try to resist an ambitious Luciano.

title: Eldorado
desc: Nucky visits Gillian, Luciano and Lansky deal with Narcisse and young Nucky faces a turning point. In Chicago, Capone prepares to face trial and in New York Margaret becomes a stock operator a la Joe Kennedy. Scores are made and settled.

title: Shippû dotô
desc: When two vagrant samurais stumble into waitress Fuu, the three get in trouble with the local magistrate.

title: Hyakkiyakô
desc: After Mugen cuts off a former enemy's arm, the enemy sets out to extract revenge on him by kidnapping Fuu and kill Mugen and Jin.

title: Ishindenshin sono ichi
desc: After running away from Fuu, Jin and Mugen enter a town where they are hired by opposing gangs as body guards.

title: Ishindenshin sono ni
desc: The trio's reunion is put on stand still as they all must partake in gang warfare.

title: Bajitôfû
desc: Looking for enough money to catch a ferry, Fuu stumbles upon an artist looking for models to paint - but is this painter all he's really set out to be?

title: Akage ijin
desc: Mugen and Jin lose their weapons and their appetites in a rice eating contest. The only way for them to get them back is by posing as tour guides.

title: Shimensoka
desc: Fuu is caught in a web of deception when she falls for a pick pocket with a heart of gold.

title: Yuigadokuson
desc: A sword of sling slinger with a crush on Fuu reveals the dark secret of Jin's past. To restore his good name Jin will need to dual him.

title: Chimimôryô
desc: The crew is headed for the gallows after getting caught using fake travel permits, but Mugen can save them by outhustling a gang of warrior priest.

title: Idoku seidoku
desc: Mugen takes his training to the next level in preparation for a full moon death match with the killer who uses a deadly armor piercing attack.

title: Daraku tenshi
desc: Jin Falls in love with the suicidal beauty whose husband sold her into slavery, and Mugen tries to make his fortune in beetle sumo wrestling.

title: Onkochishin
desc: When Mugen and Jin do the unthinkable and read Fuu's diary, they are treated to a rich riveting recap of all their greatest misadventures.

title: Anya kôro sono ichi
desc: When Mugen crosses paths with a face from his past, he reluctantly signs on for a heist that could land him a fortune in stolen gold.

title: Anya kôro sono ni
desc: Doublecrossed and headed for the bottom of the ocean, Mugen flashes back to his life before he died for the first time.

title: Tettô tetsubi
desc: Mugen goes under the covers with an undercover investigator who's out to put the smack down on a murderous ring of counterfeiters.

title: Suiseimushi hito yume
desc: Mugen, Jin and Fuu get into a big fight and separate.

title: Suiseimushi futa yume
desc: The Matsumae clan Han mistaken Mugen for Okuru, while Jin and Fuu cross paths once again in the forest.

title: Bunburyôdô
desc: Mugen learns his letter from a sake-guzzling maniac; Jin makes good on a promise; Funn sparks a jealous showdown between two graffiti artist.

title: Ingaôhô
desc: Fuu harbors a female fugitive who may hold the key to finding the samurai who smells like sunflowers.

title: Hikakôgai sono ichi
desc: Mugen defend the honor of a blind songtress, but when the trio of wanderers become a quartet, Fuu must make an important decision.

title: Hikakôgai sono ni
desc: Mugen has his own deadly run-in with the same blind beauty that sent Jin plummeting toward a gruesome end.

title: Dohatsu shôten
desc: The trio fall into the clutches of a horde of rotting zombie treasure hunters. Next they get blown into oblivion by an asteroid.

title: Ichikyû jikkon
desc: A baseball game against American conquerors in which Mugen, Jin and Fuu take part decides the future of Japan.

title: Seishi ruten sono ichi
desc: Fuu tries to end-up the journey with her companions in the best possible way. But they are soon caught by their past.

title: Seishi ruten sono ni
desc: As Jin duels Kagetoki Kariya, the most powerful man in the shogunate, Mugen has to contend with three brothers who want his head.

title: Seishi ruten sono san
desc: As Fuu finally confronts the Sunflower Samurai, Mugen and Jin face their ultimate tests. While Mugen must face the remaining brothers, Jin continues his battle with Kagetoki Kariya. And there's the small matter of their own duel.

title: Angel Attack
desc: Shinji Ikari, a 14-year-old boy in the city of Tokyo-3, is delivered to the secret organization NERV, where he is requested by his enigmatic father to save the city from an invading creature called an Angel.

title: The Beast
desc: In the wake of the previous battle, Misato hastily decides to let Shinji have a room in her apartment, where he discovers just what an irresponsible person his new guardian is. Shinji is also haunted by memories of his fight with the Angel.

title: A Transfer
desc: Shinji transfers into a new school within Tokyo-3, catching the fascination of his classmates - and igniting the ire of one student whose sister was injured in the EVA's last battle. Meanwhile, a second Angel makes its way into the city.

title: Hedgehog's Dilemma
desc: Frustrated by his newfound responsibilities, Shinji runs away from Misato and NERV. After being escorted back to the organization by armed officials, Shinji must decide whether he truly wants to abandon his role as a pilot.

title: Rei I
desc: Rei Ayanami, the pilot of Evangelion Unit 00, is scheduled to undergo another activation test following a horrible accident nearly a month earlier. Shinji makes attempts to understand Rei and her close relationship with his father.

title: Kessen, Dai 3 Shin Tokyo Shi
desc: A new Angel invades, striking a critical blow against Shinji. Taking the enemy's abilities into account, Misato crafts a special strategy involving Units 00 and 01 as well as an enormous positron rifle. Shinji also discovers Rei's motive as a pilot.

title: A Human Work
desc: A new nuclear-powered military robot, Jet Alone, goes out of control during a demonstration ceremony and heads toward an almost certain meltdown. With the help of Shinji and EVA-01, Misato takes it upon herself to stop its rampage.

title: Asuka Strikes!
desc: Misato, Shinji, Touji and Kensuke travel to a famous aircraft carrier to collect the new EVA-02 and its prideful pilot, Asuka Langley Souryuu. A seaborne Angel strikes the fleet, and Asuka leads Shinji into her Eva's entry plug for an immediate demonstration of her skills.

title: Both of You, Dance Like You Want to Win!
desc: A quick attack against a new Angel by Asuka and Shinji ends in an embarrassing defeat when the Angel suddenly divides itself. Shinji and Asuka undergo learning a series of synchronized dance movements as per a new team-oriented strategy.

title: Magmadiver
desc: Banned by Misato from going on a class trip to Okinawa, Shinji and Asuka catch up on their studies. An embryonic Angel is found inside a volcano, and Asuka volunteers to carry out the perilous task of retrieving the creature.

title: The Day Tokyo-3 Stood Still
desc: A city-wide power outage puts NERV into a crisis as another Angel invades Tokyo-3. Shinji, Rei and Asuka attempt to make their way into the headquarters as NERV personnel ready the Evas for manual deployment.

title: She Said, 'Don't Make Others Suffer for Your Personal Hatred'
desc: Misato is promoted to the rank of Major, but she reveals her long-buried sentiments concerning her work at NERV. A massive Angel appears in Earth's stratosphere, and all three Evangelions are deployed to stop it.

title: Lilliputian Hitcher
desc: During a simulation plug experiment, an Angel with the ability to mimic computer circuitry manages to invade the MAGI supercomputer system and trigger a self-destruct sequence. Ritsuko delves into the system's inner workings and leads a furious attempt to cancel the process.

title: Weaving a Story
desc: The Human Instrumentality Committee recollects the past Angel encounters and battles while Gendou conceals the matter of the recently discovered virus-like Angel. Rei and Shinji undergo inter-compatibility testing with their respective Evangelions, but this experiment culminates in a strangely familiar incident.

title: Those Women Longed for the Touch of Others' Lips, and Thus Invited Their Kisses
desc: Shinji visits his mother's grave in the company of his father, and Misato reflects upon her bygone romance with Kaji. Soon afterward, Kaji and Misato discover a startling secret within NERV's Terminal Dogma.

title: Splitting of the Breast
desc: A bizarre Angel possessing a spherical shadow in the air and a Dirac sea-type body on the ground absorbs Shinji and EVA-01. While NERV searches for a means of destroying the Angel--even if that means killing Shinji as well--Shinji languishes inside the entry plug, pondering his role as a pilot and his relationship with the people in his life.

title: Fourth Children
desc: As EVA-04, the planned testbed for the S² engine, disappears under mysterious circumstances, NERV quickly prepares the testing of EVA-03 and the selection of its pilot. Shinji and Touji continue to bond, and Hikari begins to emotionally open herself to Touji.

title: Ambivalence
desc: The activation of EVA-03 goes awry when an Angel takes control of the unit. With EVA-03 itself re-designated as an Angel, Shinji is faced with the moral dilemma of terminating the rogue Evangelion at the risk of harming or killing the pilot trapped within.

title: Introjection
desc: Shinji, furious at his father for the orders given in the previous battle, resigns from NERV. But as an Angel lays waste to the Geo-Front and the other Evangelions, he begins to reconsider his hasty decision.

title: Weaving a Story 2: Oral Stage
desc: His physical form absorbed by EVA-01, Shinji drifts through an introspective state, again contemplating his "mission" and role as a pilot. Meanwhile, Ritsuko and NERV desperately attempt to recover him.

title: He Was Aware That He Was Still a Child
desc: As Kouzou is interrogated by SEELE, he reminisces about the history of NERV, its parent company GEHIRN, Yui and Gendou Ikari, and Ritsuko's mother Naoko Akagi. At the same time, a horrible fate is in store for Kaji concerning his shadowy dealings.

title: Don't Be
desc: Asuka, haunted by childhood memories of her mother's suicide and a notion that she "lost" to Shinji in the previous battle, begins to lose her precious self-confidence as a pilot. A new Angel appears in space and invades Asuka's psyche through a strange beam of light, rendering her helpless.

title: Namida
desc: When an Angel resembling a coil of light arrives, Rei and Shinji are sent to battle it, but the assimilating ability of the foe prompts Rei to self-destruct the EVA-00 in order to kill it and save Shinji. Mysteries abound as a clone of Rei later appears in the hospital, and Ritsuko reveals the terrible secret of the "dummy plug" system to Misato and Shinji.

title: The Beginning and the End, or 'Knockin' on Heaven's Door'
desc: A despondent Shinji encounters a kind-hearted boy named Kaworu, who quickly becomes his close friend. However, Kaworu (selected earlier as the replacement pilot for EVA-02) is soon revealed to be the final Angel. This turn of events leaves Shinji with a cruel dilemma: saving humanity will mean he must kill his only true friend in the world.

title: Do You Love Me?
desc: Shinji, pained by his choice to kill his friend Kaworu, shuts himself off from the world and the people in his life and reflects upon what his true purpose in life is. Instrumentality begins as Shinji wishes for a world of complete solitude and seclusion.

title: Sekai no Chuushin de Ai o Sakenda Kemono
desc: Takes place in Shinji's mind, where he tries to find ways to feel better about himself and other people, while thinking about a solution to his many problems.

title: Secret Origins
desc: Batman and Superman team up to deal with an alien invasion, and a telepathic message leads the duo to a military base housing future ally J'onn J'onzz.

title: Secret Origins: Part II
desc: With the nation's warheads disarmed by Superman after a peace initiative, the heroes rally to stop nocturnal alien invaders from blocking out the sun.

title: Secret Origins: Part III
desc: The heroes are captured by the aliens just as their leader, the Imperium, arrives. After vanquishing the invasion, they decide to officially join forces as the Justice League.

title: In Blackest Night
desc: Green Lantern is brought up on charges of genocide and is forced to attend an intergalactic trial courtesy of the Manhunters.

title: In Blackest Night: Part II
desc: Suspecting a railroad job, the League digs deeper into the charges against the Lantern. When the Guardians of the Universe arrive, the Manhunters' true motivation is revealed.

title: The Enemy Below
desc: The team encounters an agitated Aquaman while trying to rescue a submarine crew. His opinion of surface dwellers doesn't improve after an attempted assassination by Deadshot.

title: The Enemy Below: Part II
desc: The team is captured after helping Aquaman stop an underwater coup by his half-brother, Orm. Struggling to free himself and his son from death, Aquaman sacrifices his own hand.

title: Paradise Lost
desc: Wonder Woman returns to Paradise Island after her abrupt departure, only to find the Amazons turned to stone. Sorcerer Felix Faust demands three mystical artifacts as the ransom.

title: Paradise Lost: Part II
desc: While helping Wonder Woman liberate her island, the League discovers Faust is attempting to free Hades and open a portal to Tartarus, a pit of souls.

title: War World
desc: While handling an asteroid in space, Superman and J'onn J'onzz are captured and banished to Warworld, a planet where combatants are forced to duel to the death.

title: War World: Part II
desc: Fight promoter and new contestant Mongul instructs Superman to throw the fight against him, or he'll destroy the enslaved Draaga's home planet.

title: The Brave and the Bold
desc: Gorilla Grodd uses a mind-control device to obtain isotopes that will help destroy Gorilla City. To that end, he enlists Flash to oppose the Green Lantern.

title: The Brave and the Bold: Part II
desc: Central City is under the rule of Grodd, who plans on attacking Gorilla City with missiles. As Flash confronts the maniacal ape the team races to stop the destruction.

title: Fury
desc: The Justice League must battle a fanatical Amazon scheming to kill all the men in the world.

title: Fury: Part II
desc: With the male heroes suffering from Aresia's bio-weapon, the female Justice Leaguers race to stop their foe before she can contaminate the entire planet.

title: Legends
desc: Several Leaguers are flung into another dimension populated with Green Lantern's childhood comic book heroes, the Justice Guild.

title: Legends: Part II
desc: Still trapped in an alternate dimension, the Leaguers help the Justice Guild wage war against the Injustice Guild. But the secret behind this reality threatens to erase them all.

title: Injustice for All
desc: Arrested and terminally ill, Lex Luthor breaks out of prison to assemble a team of supervillains to help him destroy the Justice League.

title: Injustice for All: Part II
desc: His illness treated by Ultra-Humanite, Luthor pressures his cadre of super-villains to combat the League. While captured, Batman exploits the greed of the group to his advantage.

title: A Knight of Shadows
desc: The League joins with Etrigan the Demon to battle Morgan Le Fay's scheme of world conquest for her son.

title: A Knight of Shadows: Part II
desc: The diabolical Le Fays finally obtain the Stone and plan to use it to revert England back to Medieval Times; Wonder Woman resists the advantage of Harv Hickman-just before he is turned into a parasite.

title: Metamorphosis
desc: Green Lantern's friend is transformed into a monstrous elemental shape-shifter by his jealous employer and is tricked into thinking Green Lantern is responsible.

title: Metamorphosis: Part II
desc: A confused Mason/Metamorpho is finally convinced the League is there to help him. Together they race to head off the newly transformed Stagg before he kills Mason's fiancé-his own daughter.

title: The Savage Time
desc: The Justice League go back in time to World War II to prevent the immortal Vandal Savage from using future technology to change history.

title: The Savage Time: Part II
desc: Mired in World War II, the Leaguers discover that Vandal Savage has usurped Hitler and is getting technology from his future self, setting the stage for his eventual rule.

title: The Savage Time: Part III
desc: With the help of Sgt. Rock, the League races to stop Savage's plans to invade the U.S. with warplanes and forever alter the course of world history.

title: Twilight
desc: Darkseid convinces the League to help him fight Brainiac from destroying his planet of Apokolips.

title: Twilight: Part II
desc: Trapped in Brainiac's headquarters, a temperamental Superman discovers that the metal monstrosity has made a deal with Darkseid, whose own son Orion engages him in battle.

title: Tabula Rasa
desc: Lex Luthor finds an extremely advanced android that can imitate superpowers and manipulates it to attack the Justice League.

title: Tabula Rasa: Part II
desc: Android Amazo has absorbed most of the League's powers, but begins to question Luthor's true motivations. Meanwhile, Batman reveals he has a contingency plan for Superman going AWOL: Kryptonite.

title: Only a Dream
desc: A man becomes a supervillain who attacks his victims in their dreams.

title: Only a Dream: Part II
desc: With the other members of the Justice League trapped in their worst nightmares, Batman and Martian Manhunter have to defeat Doctor Destiny and save them before it is too late.

title: Maid of Honor
desc: Diana makes friends with a flighty princess only to discover her fiancé is the immortal supervillain Vandal Savage.

title: Maid of Honor: Part II
desc: The Justice League works to thwart Vandal Savage's plan to blackmail the nations of the world with an orbiting railgun.

title: Hearts and Minds
desc: After learning of his mentor Katama's fall in battle, the Green Lantern travels to a world at the edge of the galaxy to investigate.

title: Hearts and Minds: Part II
desc: Joined by Hawkgirl, Martian Manhunter, and the Flash, the Green Lantern and Katma face the fanatic cult leader Despero in an effort to stop his plans to conquer the galaxy.

title: A Better World
desc: In an alternate reality, a version of the Justice League known as the Justice Lords discovers the League's world and plot to take it over.

title: A Better World: Part II
desc: With the Justice League out of the way, the Justice Lords begin to establish their own style of order.

title: Eclipsed
desc: Released by a soldier, an evil entity takes control of various people and threatens the world.

title: Eclipsed: Part II
desc: With the other members of the Justice League possessed by the entities, the Flash must find a way of stopping them from carrying out their plan to exterminate humanity.

title: The Terror Beyond
desc: Solomon Grundy attacks a harbor. After the military has him contained, Aquaman arrives and steals Grundy. When the League finds out Aquaman is involved, they head to Dr. Fate to get some answers.

title: The Terror Beyond: Part II
desc: Fate and Aquaman wanted to sacrifice Grundy to prevent the return of a mystic being. The being has arrived; Aquaman leaves to protect Atlantis. Hawkgirl finds out the being had visited her homeworld long ago.

title: Secret Society
desc: While the Justice League is experiencing serious internal friction, Gorilla Grodd carefully assembles a well organized supervillain team to attack it.

title: Secret Society: Part II
desc: With the Justice League disbanded, its former members are targeted by the super-villains of the Secret Society.

title: Hereafter
desc: During a battle with the Revenge Squad, Superman apparently falls in battle.

title: Hereafter: Part II
desc: Superman has been transported into the distant future. With no powers, he must find a way to get back to the present, he finds an unexpected ally in Vandal Savage, the Earth's lone human survivor. Meanwhile in the present, Lobo joins the League, as Superman's replacement.

title: Wild Cards
desc: The Joker creates havoc in Las Vegas with his Royal Flush Gang.

title: Wild Cards: Part II
desc: The Joker's real plan becomes apparent when he unleashes Ace upon the Justice League.

title: Comfort and Joy
desc: Members of the Justice League celebrate Christmas.

title: Starcrossed
desc: Hawkgirl's people, the Thanagarians, arrive to offer the planet protection from another alien race threatening to invade Earth.

title: Starcrossed: Part II
desc: With Earth now under Thanagarian control, the Justice League goes into hiding to recover and cope with the betrayal of one of their own.

title: Starcrossed: Part III
desc: The Justice League launch an assault on the Thanagarians before the activation of a hyperspace gate that will destroy Earth.

title: Beginnings
desc: Daisy Steiner and Tim Bisley meet by chance and hatch a plan to pose as a couple to rent an apartment whose landlord requires a professional couple.

title: Gatherings
desc: Daisy decides to throw a party to shirk responsibility. Tim reluctantly agrees.

title: Art
desc: Tim has been up all night playing Resident Evil and is still feeling the effects of some speed that he bought. Daisy has an interview at a new women's magazine publisher. Brian's ex-partner of performing art, Vulva, invites him to a showing of his newest performance piece. Daisy and Tim join him. Tim freaks out and starts seeing everyone as Zombies because of the mix of booze, speed, Twiglets (which make him violent) and the lack of sleep he's had. When Vuvla acts rudely towards Brian, Tim comes to the rescue with his hallucinations.

title: Battles
desc: Daisy's boyfriend breaks up with her, and feeling the need for a loving relationship, she asks Marsha if she can have a dog. Marsha agrees and Tim is hesitant because of his past experiences with dogs which have given him a big fear of them. While Daisy and Twist go out to buy a dog, Mike and Tim go paint-balling. They run into Duane Benzie, who used to be Tim's best friend until he stole Tim's girlfriend.

title: Chaos
desc: After an all day marathon of Star Wars movies, it's Tim's turn to take Colin out for a walk. While he isn't paying attention, the dog is stolen. Daisy thinks Tim got rid of Colin on purpose because she knows he doesn't like Colin. All suspicions are dropped after they receive an anonymous letter revealing where Colin is.
