title: Is There a Creator?
desc: This program examines some recent scientific theories of the universe and conceptions about God they may suggest.

title: The Riddle of Black Holes
desc: After reviewing theories about how black holes form and how they were detected this program looks at their counterintuitive behavior that makes them seem so bizarre.

title: Is Time Travel Possible?
desc: But if we succeed with time travel, what are the consequences of such freedom? Will we get trapped in a plethora of paradoxes and multiple universes that will destroy the fabric of the universe?

title: What Happened Before the Beginning?
desc: Following a review of the discovery and evidence for the Big Bang this program examines the progress of scientists trying to determine what went on before the Big Bang that could have caused it.

title: How Did We Get Here?
desc: Scientists explore a variety of ways that life may have formed on earth and try to recreate them.

title: Are We Alone?
desc: This program considers the likelihood that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe and the prospects that it may inhabit a nearby planet. Then the various methods being used to look for alien intelligence are reviewed.

title: What Are We Really Made Of?
desc: This program delves deep into the atom to find the ultimate constituents of matter focusing finally on the theoretical Higgs Boson.

title: Beyond the Darkness
desc: Scientists have discovered that the universe we see is an incidental component of all there is. This program explains how dark matter and dark energy were discovered and how scientists are struggling to understand them.

title: Is There Life After Death?
desc: Science is a long way from answering the question posed in this program. But exploring it has proved a fertile avenue for investigation into what exactly is consciousness and self-awareness.

title: Is There an Edge to the Universe?
desc: To the average person it seems obvious that the universe must have an edge. Yet most cosmologists think that like a ball, or more likely a bagel, the universe has no end, other then a temporal one - a beginning and, perhaps, an end. But several scientists agree with the common man that there is an edge to the universe and they have some definite ideas about what is beyond the edge and how to prove their case.

title: Does Time Really Exist?
desc: After a brief explanation of how we measure time this program takes a detailed look at how we perceive time. Then it's time for the physicists to present their ideas about what time is before Steve Weinstein talks about two dimensional time.

title: Are There More Than 3 Dimensions?
desc: To scientists it looks like the weakness of gravity, the existence of dark matter and the big bang may all be dependent on how many dimensions there are to the universe. But are the three dimensions we're used to too few or too many? This program examines the pet theories of several scientists about the dimensionality of our universe, how they are going about proving their theories and why their theories don't agree with the three dimensions that seem obvious to us.

title: Is There a Sixth Sense?
desc: Several scientists have conducted experiments, although with somewhat questionable controls, that suggest humans may have a rudimentary capabilities for telepathy and precognition. This program reviews the studies and the scientists speculate about how these capabilities may work and why we might have them.

title: Are There Parallel Universes?
desc: This program presents the scientific foundation for parallel universes. Then it reviews the various speculative ideas scientists are exploring about how universes form and how they interact. In our explorations we bump into our old cosmic friends; black holes, white holes, dark matter and the big bang.

title: How Does the Universe Work?
desc: A revolution in science is underway that will transform life on Earth and ensure our survival as a species. If we can solve the equation of everything, it will present the keys to creation itself.

title: Can We Travel Faster Than Light?
desc: The laws of physics allow a variety of ways to get around the universe faster than the speed of light. These prospects are explained along with the daunting engineering challenges of making them practical and safe.

title: Can We Live Forever?
desc: This program reviews current thinking about what causes death and aging. Then it examines increasingly bizarre ideas about how to prevent them.

title: What Do Aliens Look Like?
desc: This program gives serious consideration to what life forms on other planets might look like founded on the vast diversity of life on earth now and in the past and what is now known about the environments on other planets found by the Kepler telescope. Then it indulges in a little speculation about what extra-terrestrial intelligence might be like.

title: Will We Survive First Contact?
desc: Mankind longs for proof that we are not alone in the universe, but the moment of first contact will certainly mean the end of the world as we know it. Whether that is a bad thing for humanity or the start of a great future is the subject of much debate.

title: Is There a Superior Race?
desc: Are races different on the inside as well as the outside? Is there such a thing as race at all? Or, could advances in technology create a superior race? The answers to these questions may tell us where humanity is headed.

title: Is the Universe Alive?
desc: The cosmos may be a superorganism, a collection of separate bodies acting like a single being. Scientists are probing this colossal creature for its beating heart, quantum-computing brain and even its offspring. Or are space & time illusions we created?

title: What Makes Us Who We Are?
desc: What is it that gives each one of us a unique identity? As we move through life our outer appearances transform almost entirely. Our opinions and ideas change. Are we all born with a permanent sense of self or can our identities be altered?

title: What Is Nothing?
desc: Can there be such a thing as nothing? Scientists are looking for answers in the mind-bending science of Quantum Mechanics. Their work may uncover what our cosmos is made of, how it came from nothing and when it might collapse into an empty void again.

title: Can We Resurrect the Dead?
desc: What if death wasn't the end? Resurrecting bodies isn't enough. To truly live again, we must also resurrect our minds. Scientists are developing ways to digitally preserve the contents of our brains. We may rise again as software, embedded in new forms.

title: Can We Eliminate Evil?
desc: Researchers are uncovering the hidden forces that inflame our inner demons, looking for ways to neutralize the source of evil in the brain. Methods include learning impulse control and stimulating altruism. But can psychopaths who lack empathy be helped?

title: Mysteries of the Subconscious
desc: The subconscious has long been thought of as the source of our primal fears and desires. But scientists have discovered how the subconscious makes snap decisions that protect us from harm, and that it can be trained to actually heal our bodies of disease.

title: Will Eternity End?
desc: Can time tick on forever or will time itself end? It's possible that eternity already exists, and the future is traveling back in time to shape the present. Or time might even be a holographic projection, reaching back to us from the end of eternity!

title: Did We Invent God?
desc: Did God invent humanity? Or did we invent God? Since our brains are where we experience reality, does imagining God make God real? One neuroscientist is trying to find the answer by peering into the human mind, and seeing what God really looks like!

title: Is There a God Particle?
desc: Scientists have hunted for a particle to explain how matter came to exist in the universe. In 2012 they found it - the Higgs Boson, the God Particle. But the discovery raises many questions. And what if we owe our existence something else?

title: When Does Life Begin?
desc: What defines the beginning of a life? New evidence reveals that inside all of us are traces of cells from our relatives, blurring the lines between one life and another. Technology is now giving birth to new life forms made of surprising components.

title: Can We Survive the Death of the Sun?
desc: We are all at the mercy of the Sun: someday, it will bathe us in a fiery, planetary holocaust. How can we survive the death of our star? The technology to move ourselves to Mars or another "Earth" sounds like sci-fi, but almost within our grasp.

title: How Do Aliens Think
desc: By studying the non-humans in our midst, the evolution of human language, and the psychology of super-intelligent beings, scientists are learning how alien minds might function.

title: Will Sex Become Extinct?
desc: Every person who has lived was created from the genes of one man and one woman, but human reproduction is about to undergo a revolution. Technology is close to making children from two fathers, or two mothers. If this is the case, will sex become extinct?

title: Can Our Minds Be Hacked?
desc: Our minds store our entire lives, our memories and our deepest desires and our brains are biological computers. Could brain hackers someday be able to rewrite our thoughts similar to how computer hackers hack email?

title: Are Robots the Future of Human Evolution?
desc: From our smartphones to our cars, we have robots that live and work beside us. We are designing them to think and move on their own. Is it possible that these objects evolve to be smarter than humans or will we choose to merge with the machines?

title: Is Reality Real?
desc: Do we live in the "real world" or is it all in our mind? Our perception of reality is controlled by society. Thanks to "the optimism bias", we make unrealistic assessments about our own reality. Human senses capture only a small part of nature.

title: Do We Have Free Will?
desc: What if everything that has or will happen has already been determined? Until the discovery of quantum uncertainty, physicists were convinced free will does not exist. Now other scientists have stepped into the fray, arguing that free will is an illusion.

title: Did God Create Evolution
desc: Is life the product of evolution or is it thanks to the guiding hand of God? Believers in Intelligent Design argue complex life could not have evolved randomly. Was life created by evolution, by God or both?

title: Is God an Alien Concept?
desc: Is God worshiped in other worlds across the cosmos? How might alien deities differ from our own? Have advanced aliens discovered everything there is to know about the universe, or are they too looking for answers? The answer may lie buried on Earth.

title: Is Luck Real?
desc: Do you make your own luck, or does luck make you? Some scientists believe luck is strictly a matter of statistics and probabilities - but others believe unseen forces are at work.

title: Is Poverty Genetic?
desc: Are the wealthy just born in the right place at the right time? Are the poor victims of a system designed to keep them down? Or do physics and biology determine who is rich and who is poor? Scientists have found that throughout history, the distribution of wealth is governed by hidden forces: DNA, environmental stress, patterns of human migration and even the laws of thermodynamics! Nature seems to demand winners and losers in life. But does this mean greed is king, and the rich can take what they want? Or does the cooperation among even the smallest microorganisms ...

title: How to Collapse a Superpower
desc: The stability of the US, Europe, China, or any global power depends on high-speed digital communication. With a little imagination, could a few terrorists sabotage this massive network? Cripple a mighty nation? Perhaps even tear down modern civilization? Our increasing dependence on digital devices and global interactivity may be placing us in grave danger. Scientists around the world are dealing with new threats such as body hacking, Trojan Horse viruses, and brain-damaging Internet addiction. But what if the ultimate threat isn't an attack on technology, but the ...

title: Does the Ocean Think?
desc: There could be an undiscovered species on Earth unlike anything we've ever known. Not in the ocean, but the ocean itself.

title: Is a Zombie Apocalypse Possible?
desc: It is a nightmare that has stalked us for centuries: hordes of human beings transformed into mindless, bloodthirsty monsters that usher in the downfall of civilization. Could this nightmare ever become reality? Scientists have discovered pathogens that turn insects into the walking dead. New deadly strains of viruses are attacking humans every day. Mathematicians are calculating the likelihood of surviving a zombie virus outbreak. Neuroscientists are even discovering that we can easily lose conscious control of our bodies. If we were in the middle of a zombie ...

title: Is Gravity an Illusion?
desc: Gravity is an unsolved mystery of the universe. Why do all objects that have mass pull on one another? New theories propose unexpected answers.

title: Will We Become God?
desc: Humanity's potential seems limitless. But could we become as powerful as God? Scientific breakthroughs grant our species seemingly divine abilities.

title: Is There a Shadow Universe?
desc: Cosmologists agree that "dark matter" has helped shape our Universe, but now they need to figure out what dark matter is. What's going on in this hidden world? Could it have formed its own dark stars, planets, and even life forms?

title: When Did Time Begin?
desc: We float along the river of time. But does that river have a source? Where did time come from?

title: Are We All Bigots?
desc: If you had less than one second to make a life-or-death decision to shoot a man who might be armed with a lethal weapon, what would you do? Would the ethnicity of the man affect your decision?

title: Can Time Go Backwards?
desc: Could science ever make the clock move backwards? Experiments in quantum physics are showing that the future influences the present: what happens later limits the choices we think we have now.

title: Are We Here for a Reason?
desc: Evolution say that all life exists only to reproduce; a new theory proposes that instead of passing on genes, humans have another purpose.

title: Do We Live in the Matrix?
desc: Our universe seems real. But what if it's a video game? Scientists in a variety of fields are taking seriously the possibility that we live in a virtual reality.

title: Are Aliens Inside Us?
desc: Odds are excellent that extraterrestrial life exists. So why haven't we found aliens out in the galaxy? Are we looking in the wrong places?

title: Why Do We Lie?
desc: We all agree lying is shameful. Yet we still deliberately deceive each other constantly. Are our brains wired for lying from a young age? The brains of pathological liars may provide insights. Will technology make it easier for us to be dishonest, or could it someday instantly reveal someone is lying? Perhaps we are deceitful because our limited senses prevent us from seeing the real truth. Scientists say our own memories deceive us, and have managed to implant false memories. Other scientists look for ultimate truth in the subatomic world - only to end up turning ...

title: What Makes a Terrorist?
desc: Terrorists, like any group, have a cause to rally around. But for them, the cause justifies the deliberate targeting of innocent civilians. How can they think that way? Now, science is peering into the dark heart of terror networks to find out why.

title: Is Privacy Dead?
desc: We examine a life without privacy in order to solve crimes and prevent terrorism.

title: Are There More Than Two Sexes?
desc: Science reveals the line between male and female is blurred. And the battle of the sexes is happening deep within our cells. Are there more than two sexes?

title: Can We All Become Geniuses
desc: Genius lies somewhere in the human mind, bringing mathematical insight, sparking artistic inspiration and enabling some to see what most cannot. Might we augment our biology with technology to unlock the genius inside us all?

title: Is the Force with Us?
desc: New research is beginning to reveal a hidden force in the universe - one that penetrates space with trillions of invisible connections, instantly linking every place in our world and joining our future with our past. Is the Force with us?

title: Can We Cheat Death?
desc: Scientists are peering inside the mechanisms of aging, tampering with the cellular makeup of our DNA, and imagining a world where death is cured like a disease. Are we entering a new age of immortality?

title: Can We Hack the Planet?
desc: Unless we can turn the planet's problems into solutions, humanity may be coming to an end. Scientists are unlocking the secrets of nature to tame the elements and harness energy. Can we hack the planet to save humanity?

title: Is Gun Crime a Virus?
desc: Every 17 minutes, someone is killed with a gun. It's a wave of violence that political debate can't seem to stop. Is this an epidemic that scientists can help cure? Could gun crime be a virus?

title: Adam
desc: Stephen discusses various topics beginning with 'A', including Adam's navel, with his guests Danny Baker, Hugh Laurie and John Sessions.

title: Astronomy
desc: Stephen discusses all things astronomical with his guests Bill Bailey, Rich Hall and Jeremy Hardy.

title: Aquatic Animals
desc: Stephen discusses various aquatic animals with his guests Clive Anderson, Bill Bailey and Meera Syal.

title: Atoms
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the almost impossible quiz show with guests Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Howard Goodall and Jeremy Hardy. The theme of this edition of the show is atoms and questions range from Argentina to the composition of air.

title: Advertising
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the challenging quiz in which points are awarded. Alan Davies, Rob Brydon, Rich Hall and Gyles Brandreth face questions related to advertising - from Aristotle to alcoholics.

title: Antidotes
desc: Stephen discusses all things 'A' with his guests Danny Baker, Jo Brand and Howard Goodall, including various antidotes for ailments.

title: Arthropods
desc: Stephen discusses all things arthropods with his guests Jo Brand, Jimmy Carr and Jackie Clune.

title: Albania
desc: Stephen Fry's discusses what his sporty ancestor have to do with Albania, along with other things beginning with 'A' with his guests Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Sean Lock, Linda Smith.

title: Antelopes
desc: Stephen discusses all things African with his guests Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Dave Gorman and Jeremy Hardy.

title: Aviation
desc: Stephen discusses all things aviation with his guests Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Julia Morris and Peter Serafinowicz.

title: Arts
desc: Stephen Fry poses questions on the topic of arts to Alan Davies, Linda Smith, Bill Bailey and Richard E. Grant. Questions in this edition include - who invented the telephone and what is the most dangerous animal in Africa?

title: Advent
desc: Stephen Fry hosts a festive edition of the quiz show. Alan Davies, Sean Lock, John Sessions and Phill Jupitus attempt to identify the gender of Rudolf the reindeer and guess which Christmas decoration a German village exported worldwide.

title: Blue
desc: Colourful host Stephen Fry quizzes contestants Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Bill Bailey and Sean Lock on the topic of blue. Questions on butterflies, beetles and baguettes feature including - what rhymes with orange?

title: Birds
desc: Our feathered friends are the subject of this edition of the quite interesting quiz. Stephen Fry asks the questions as Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Phil Kay and Rich Hall forget everything they thought they knew about birds, bills and brothers.

title: Bombs
desc: Guests Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall try to avoid being damp squibs as they face questions on the topic of bombs. Host Stephen Fry lights the blue touch paper in an explosive edition of the quiz show.

title: Bible
desc: Brainy host Stephen Fry delves deep into the world of bizarre Biblical arcana with guests Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson. Including questions on baldness and Andy Warhol's underwear.

title: Bears
desc: Jimmy Carr, Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Alan Davies answer questions on bears, bulbs and bamboo posed by host Stephen Fry. Featuring the memorable moment when Jimmy Carr arranges the letters on a board into a strange but true sentence.

title: Beavers
desc: Bantermeisters Alan Davies, Anneka Rice, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey beaver away to impress host Stephen Fry with their knowledge of the topic of beavers. Bulges, bacteria and the Pope's Friday meal are also the subject of questions.

title: Bees
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. With Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Fred Macaulay and Rich Hall. Bees, barnacles and basketball are subjects on the agenda.

title: Bats
desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Alan Davies, Josie Lawrence, John Sessions and Rich Hall tackle the subjects of butterflies, blackberries and Bernards.

title: Bills
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Clive Anderson, Phil Kay, John Sessions and Alan Davies on the subjects of Bills, Bens and buildings.

title: Beats
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded if their answers are 'quite interesting'. With Mark Gatiss, Sean Lock, Linda Smith and Alan Davies.

title: Birth
desc: Christmas special. Stephen Fry chairs a festive version of the almost impossible quiz with guests Alan Davies, Mark Steel, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall.

title: Campanology
desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Alan Davies, Bill Bailey, Rob Brydon and Rich Hall tackle the subject of campanology.

title: Cummingtonite
desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Doon Mackichan, Arthur Smith, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies attempt to answer impossible questions based around the subject of cummingtonite.

title: Common Knowledge
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Today's subjects include chickens, cormorants and cardigans. With Jimmy Carr, Rory McGrath, Sean Lock and Alan Davies.

title: Cheating
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include cheating, caravans and cuckoo clocks. With Jeremy Clarkson, Alexander Armstrong, John Sessions and Alan Davies.

title: Cat's Eyes
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include cat's-eyes, camels and centurions. With Rich Hall, Sean Lock, Jo Brand and Alan Davies.

title: Cockneys
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include cockneys, catfish and coal. With Bill Bailey, Rory McGrath, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

title: Constellations
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include chihuahuas, cheese and constellations. With Jeremy Clarkson, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies.

title: Corby
desc: Actor, author and national treasure Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. This time, china, Corby and coffee are the topics under discussion.

title: Creatures
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which guests are rewarded if their answers are 'quite interesting'. This edition's subjects include chimps, chromosomes and cuttlefish. Stars Helen Atkinson Wood, Bill Bailey, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies.

title: Cleve Crudgington
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include corks, cats and carbon dioxide. Panellists are Clive Anderson, Mark Steel, John Sessions and Alan Davies.

title: Carnival
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Fry probes clowns, cuckoos and Cinderella with panellists Clive Anderson, Jo Brand, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

title: Combustion
desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include catastrophes, cosmonauts and coconuts, with Bill Bailey, Dara O'Briain, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

title: Danger
desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Sean Lock, Jimmy Carr, Jo Brand and Alan Davies live on the edge as they tackle the subject of danger.

title: Discoveries
desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Arthur Smith, Clive Anderson, Vic Reeves and Alan Davies explore uncharted territory in this edition dedicated to discoveries.

title: Dogs
desc: This edition features guests Alan Davies, Liza Tarbuck, Jeremy Clarkson and Neil Mullarkey sniffing around the subject of dogs.

title: Dictionaries
desc: This edition features Alan Davies, Phill Jupitus, Ronni Ancona and Rory Bremner tackling the subject of dictionaries.

title: Death
desc: This edition features Alan Davies, Sean Lock, Andy Parsons and Clive Anderson gravely tackling the subject of death.

title: Drinks
desc: This edition features Alan Davies, John Sessions, Phill Jupitus and Jimmy Carr taking a swig and answer questions on the subject of drinking.

title: Differences
desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Alan Davies, Julian Clary, Jo Brand and Dara O'Briain try and find common ground in this edition dedicated to the topic of differences.

title: Pilot
desc: The Pilot Version - The very first attempt at televising the QI format. No titles, background photos or set design as we later knew from the following Commissioned Series version. Its possible this Pilot was recorded relatively cheaply, unedited, "as live", as Stephen Fry refers to running out of tape, as the banter gets quite anarchic, and the running time hits 35 mi... Read all

title: Descendants

desc: Host Stephen Fry and guests Jo Brand, Jessica Stevenson, Alan Davies and Phill Jupitus make themselves at home discussing the topic of domesticity.

title: Engineering
desc: Stephen Fry hosts another edition of the quiz show that mines the world of trivia. Alan Davies, Jimmy Carr, Rob Brydon and Bill Bailey are the guests trying to avoid going loco as they tackle tough teasers on the subject of engineering.

title: Electricity
desc: Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Rich Hall tackle some electrifying questions from host Stephen Fry.

title: Eating
desc: Alan Davies, Jimmy Carr, Phill Jupitus and Johnny Vegas sink their teeth in to some delicious questions on eating.

title: Exploration
desc: Bill Bailey, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies answer questions on some quite interesting explorations.

title: Europe
desc: Phill Jupitus, Dara O'Briain, David Mitchell and Alan Davies get continental in this Europe themed episode.

title: Everything, Etc.

title: Espionage
desc: Host Stephen Fry edgily exposes Espionage with Jo Brand, Vic Reeves, Clive Anderson and Alan Davies.

title: Eyes and Ears
desc: Host Stephen Fry is all Eyes and Ears with guests Phill Jupitus, Jimmy Carr, David Mitchell and Alan Davies.

title: Entertainment
desc: Host Stephen Fry is joined by Bill Bailey, Pudsey Bear, Jo Brand, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies to discuss Entertainment in a special Children in Need edition.

title: Endings

title: France
desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Phill Jupitus, Jo Brand, Hugh Dennis and Alan Davies on all things French, and their answers must be interesting if they are to score points.

desc: Panel-based quiz where contestants aim to be interesting. Stephen Fry is all fingers and fumbs with Jo Brand, Phill Jupitus, Dara O Briain and Alan Davies.

title: Food
desc: Stephen Fry takes a fresh look at food with David Mitchell, Rich Hall, Jimmy Carr and Alan Davies.

title: Gardens

desc: Stephen Fry and Alan Davies are joined by a selection of guests for a compilation of favourite moments from the M series.

title: Naming Names

title: Noble Rot

title: Naked Truth

title: Silly Season
desc: The silly season is here and Sandi Toksvig tests her guests Stephen K Amos, Ivo Graham, Holly Walsh and Alan Davies with some frivolous trivia questions.

title: Pilot
desc: A young woman falls from a bar's upstairs terrace and a suicide note is found, but a pregnancy test and links to a political group suggest foul play.

title: 2. Bölüm
desc: Behzat runs into an old flame in a psych ward. A child's body found with both kidneys removed prompts suspicions of criminal organ trafficking.

title: Gerçegin Pesinde
desc: When an ex-con who killed a woman in a robbery is murdered shortly after his release, Behzat suspects a former cop did it to avenge his wife's death.

title: Görünenin Ardindaki Sir
desc: The stabbing deaths of a fencing teacher and his elderly neighbor cast suspicion on an alleged gold digger, an estranged wife, her lover and others.

title: Kayip Yasamlar
desc: A financial adviser is killed in a parking garage getting in a car he bought for his son's birthday. Was the car's previous owner the intended target?

title: Gecenin Gizledikleri
desc: After receiving an insistent warning from a fan, a rising nightclub singer is strangled while sleeping over at friend Gönül's home.

title: Kapanmayan Yaralar
desc: When a young woman is found raped and murdered in her home, the police try to work out why the killer left out-of-circulation banknotes on her body.

title: Geçmisin Gölgesi
desc: When the police question a young woman who reported her identical twin sister's murder, they discover a world of difference between the two siblings.

title: Taban Girmek
desc: A soccer star is found cuffed to a bed and killed by a blow to the chest, casting suspicion on his jealous girlfriend, his shady manager and others.

title: Karanlik Koridorlar
desc: When a man accused of illegal magazine distribution dies in police custody, Behzat must lead a touchy investigation that could impact his colleagues.

title: Cevapsiz Sorular
desc: Photos found on Facebook and in a home identify suspects in the murder of a college student found on a roadside, and reveal a personal link to Behzat.

title: Geride Kalanlar
desc: Sitting on the rooftop terrace from which his daughter fell to her death, Behzat notices something that could possibly provide the answers he seeks.

title: Yarim Kalmis Hesaplar
desc: Behzat finds himself in a race against time to save his brother from a revenge-seeking kidnapper who has a personal connection to a recent case.

title: Tehlikeli Iliskiler
desc: Behzat's last conversation with his brother's kidnapper leads the detective on a hunt for evidence that will expose the undersecretary's wife.

title: Karanlikta kalanlar
desc: When an ad agency owner is found murdered in her hotel room, suspects include her angry ex-husband and a model she fired over a fashion show mishap.

title: Güvercin Tedirginligi
desc: The fatal shooting of a professor studying the problems of Turkish minorities gives rise to speculation that his murder was politically motivated.

title: Diken Üstünde
desc: When Feride unexpectedly goes to the police to make a confession, Behzat and his men fear their part in the matter will be discovered.

title: Kayip Zamanlar
desc: A second killing during the investigation of a toy shop owner's murder leads Behzat's team to a decade-old case that links the two victims.

title: Hesaplasma
desc: When Ercüment returns to Ankara to discuss his agreement with the undersecretary and a murder soon follows, Behzat sets out to prove he's the killer.

title: Küçük Balik Büyük Balik
desc: Feride gives her testimony in court. Behzat's continued pursuit of Ercüment takes him and his team from Ankara's streets to Istanbul's.

title: Yasarken Ölmek
desc: Behzat gets a rare chance to investigate a murder before it actually occurs, when a man dying from arsenic poisoning asks him to find out who did it.

title: Dinmeyen Öfke
desc: After his late daughter's ex-boyfriend is released from prison, Behzat questions him and learns more about the last days of Berna's life.

title: Yerdeki Kan
desc: A man who stalked the wife of a murdered gynecologist is ruled out as a suspect. So why are his prints found soon after at an unrelated murder scene?

title: Zikzak Yaparak Kaçmak
desc: Cocaine packets found on a man who was shot to death suggest a drug dispute, but further investigation reveals a cover-up of the true motive.

title: Intihar ve Cinayet
desc: The death of a drummer who seemingly killed herself with a gas oven leads to her boyfriend's apparent suicide, but Behzat suspects both were murders.

title: Sihhiye Köprüsü
desc: Behzat and his team investigate the murder of a meatball vendor thrown from a bridge. Sule runs into problems while trying to tutor Behzat's nephew.

title: Adini Vermek Istemeyen Dinleyici
desc: The homicide team takes on a rare nonmurder case when a kidnapper calls a local radio show, threatening to kill the announcer's 5-year-old daughter.

title: Kelebek Gibi Uçmak
desc: The investigation of a boxer who was found stabbed to death leads Behzat and his team into the dark underworld of illegal fighting matches.

title: Aysegül Arafta
desc: In a trash heap, garbage collectors find the body of a young woman whose tattoos lead Behzat's team to investigate the possibility of a satanic cult.

title: Iz Birakanlar Unutulmaz
desc: A retired Colonel named Can Uçar is found dead in his house. It seemed that the colonel shot himself in a ceremonial suicide. But the Murder Squad believes that the colonel was murdered and the suicide faked. Chief Constable asks Behzat Ç to investigate. Behzat Ç. finds that Colonel was interviewed by a reporter and he tries to find her. One the girl is located he realises that Can Uçar's murder was just the tip of the iceberg. Behzat ç. gets critical information from reporter which puts his life in danger.

title: Gece Baskini
desc: The body of a failed political candidate is found riddled with bullets. Was it his divisive politics that got him killed? Or his harassment of women?

title: Kisisel Gelismek
desc: When a life coach is strangled shortly after a seminar, footage of the event shows a mysterious briefcase that never left his side -- but is now gone.

title: Kizilcahamam
desc: During a vacation getaway, Behzat investigates the murder of a symposium speaker at the same resort and is shocked when he gets the ballistics report.

title: Maziden Gelen
desc: Suspects abound in the murder of a real estate developer, who was unhappily married four times and had recently fired his brother-in-law.

title: Içimizdeki Cellat
desc: The murder of a mother and her two small kids leads Behzat's team to her husband, the relatives who disapproved of her marriage and a missing vagrant.

title: Gece Uçusu
desc: The homicide team investigates the murder of a airline hostess who had made many enemies at work before being killed. Behzat and Sulle sink into depression over Ecrument's return to the city.

title: Tekinsiz Yollar
desc: Ecrument is deemed not worth protecting any longer, and Big Brother sends a squad of special police from Istanbul to Ankara to kill him. Selim is finally caught by Eda, and Harun forgives Cevat. Behzat tries to keep up.

title: Baslangicin Sonu
desc: The team tries to hide Eda and Selim's news from Harun on his big day. Behzat learns why Ercüment has been vengeful toward him, and who killed Berna.

title: 39. Bölüm
desc: After crashing into a car while drunk and yelling into a phone, a surgery technician is strangled at home. An unstable Behzat awaits trial in prison.

title: 40. Bölüm
desc: While examining the body of an unidentified man found in a lake, Ghost sees an embroidered monogram that triggers childhood memories.

title: Kesik Parmak
desc: In his mailbox, Cevdet finds a CD containing video of an unidentified man being tortured and killed in a fashion similar to a case from 15 years ago.

title: Yüzünü Arayan Kadin
desc: To investigate the drug links to the finger-chopping case, the police chief partners Behzat with the headstrong leader of the narcotics unit.

title: Kara'dir Su Bahtim...
desc: When a homeless woman is found stabbed to death on a neighborhood street, Behzat's team has difficulty uncovering her real name, let alone her killer.

title: Benim Annem Cumartesi!
desc: An elderly Kurdish woman seeks help in finding out who killed her son, who went missing 30 years ago after being arrested at a protest in Ankara.

title: Büyük Hesaplasma/Filler Tepisirken
desc: Hearing a gunshot over the phone, Behzat's team rushes to save one of their own. Facebook messages provide leads in a high school boy's murder.

title: Kandaki Mesaj
desc: Vulture finds a creepy item in his home. While investigating a murder in his old neighborhood, Harun runs into his former fiancee.

title: Cürümüs Bir Seyler Var Ankara'da
desc: When a touring stage actor meets the same demise as the character he is playing, Hamlet, the homicide team is tasked with finding his murderer.

title: Kalbim Babama Ait
desc: The team investigates the case of a transgender woman found dead on a roadside. Behzat comes home to find his ex-wife acting like they never divorced.

title: 49. Bölüm
desc: The investigation of an unemployed family man's murder reveals he owed a large debt to a dangerous person, whom Behzat recognizes from a past case.

title: 50. Bölüm
desc: A political cartoonist's murder gives rise to speculation that he was killed by a religious conservative group over an upcoming cartoon on evolution.

title: 51. Bölüm
desc: When a man is found dead in a remote shack, Behzat recognizes him as one of Ercüment's henchmen. Tekin's young daughter is kidnapped.

title: 52. Bölüm
desc: Behzat learns the recent murders of a boxer in a hotel room and a woman in a tub were inspired by a novel series, and a third killing is yet to come.

title: Büyük Tezgah
desc: The case of a doctor killed in her home appears to be a theft gone wrong. But when a suspect turns up dead, it's clear something bigger is going on.

title: Veterinerin Sir Ölümü
desc: Behzat and his team anxiously wait to interrogate Tacettin once he regains consciousness. A veterinarian is found strangled with a dog collar.

title: Geçmisle Yüzlesmek
desc: Harun learns his sister is investigating Larissa. A worker's murder leads Behzat's team to spy on an appliance store, where shady activity is spotted.

title: 56. Bölüm
desc: Four pals steal a large amount of cash found on a driver who was knocked unconscious during a car crash. But their lucky find soon leads to murder.

title: Geçmisin Arkandan Gelecektir
desc: After an elderly man is shot dead at close range while hunting, Behzat's team finds a witness: a senile pal who thinks he's still living in the 1950s.

title: Basim Belada
desc: An address found on a man shot dead in the street leads to a nightclub musician, who denies killing him despite a blood feud between their families.

title: Derin Iliskiler
desc: Behzat finds a shocking link between an old friend and the murder of a company informant digging for insider information on a $60 million deal.

title: 60. Bölüm
desc: Two bumbling wedding musicians land in hot water when they agree to hide a groom with cold feet at their home, only to find him dead later that night.

title: Nikah Masasi
desc: Behzat's big day arrives. In an odd twist on an honor killing, a man is found stabbed to death, with a sex doll -- also stabbed -- laying nearby.

title: Kentsel Bölüsüm
desc: When a property developer who'd recently acquired land in the slums is shot dead, Behzat's team visits the angry residents who are being displaced.

title: 63. Bölüm
desc: While investigating the murder of a young worker at a car rental agency, the team learns the victim recently got int a fight at a bar with Savas.

title: Bir Cinayetin Geçmisi
desc: The strangling of a well-liked doctor seems without motive, until the last person to talk to the victim -- a cured patient -- is caught telling a lie.

title: Kayip Ceset
desc: A cab driver reports seeing one of his regular clients getting stabbed and buried, but when the team arrives at the burial site, the body is missing.

title: 66. Bölüm
desc: A truck driver smuggling arms is pulled over by thieves posing as cops and killed, but the hijackers fail to cover all their tracks.

title: Sular Bulanirken
desc: A body is discovered at the same site where the severed fingers were found. The homicide team continues to search for Ghost.

title: 68. Bölüm
desc: Ercüment returns to Ankara and targets Esra. Behzat searches for his mother's killer. Selim allows a detail to slip that makes Cevdet suspicious.

title: Akintiya Karsi...
desc: When Esra refuses to give up her investigation and is sent to jail on false charges, Behzat sets out to take down Ercüment. Aziz finds his quarry.

title: 70. Bölüm
desc: Behzat throws caution aside as he hunts for those linked to the murder of a loved one. Surveillance footage captures a face that may be the killer's.

title: 71. Bölüm
desc: After learning that Gökhan has a record, Behzat digs deeper to find out who pulled strings to place the ex-con as a courthouse security guard.

title: Kesisme
desc: While working undercover at the bar with Eylül, Behzat unexpectedly crosses paths with Ercüment. Vulture gives his statement about the shooting.

title: Son Düzlük
desc: On his way to meet with Behzat, Esra's ex-husband encounters foul play. Ercüment gives the former undersecretary's wife a test of loyalty.

title: Öteki... Bizden Olmayan...
desc: When the body of a teen girl is found at a construction site, the team learns she and her little brother had disappeared from home during the night.

title: Sakli Öfke
desc: Behzat and his team investigate the murder of a man who abused street children, unaware that the killers are people they're working closely with.

title: Bebek Gibi
desc: Behzat has a disturbing reaction upon seeing a pregnant murder victim. Sevket views surveillance footage of his mother's last night in the hospital.

title: Gözler Kör Kulaklar Sagir
desc: A nanny's odd reaction during an interrogation leads Behzat to the motive for the murder of a grandfather. Sevket learns the truth about his mother.

title: Evde
desc: Behzat gathers his team members at Vulture's house for a long, cathartic night of drinking anisette, airing grievances and revealing secrets.

title: Saatler
desc: The murder of a retired counter-terrorism chief with a reputation for making false arrests reminds Behzat of his own part in an innocent man's death.

title: 80. Bölüm
desc: A student activist is fatally stabbed following a scuffle at a petition-signing event. Ghost makes progress in his investigation of Eylül.

title: Arsiv
desc: En route to meet Ghost, who's phoned to say he has Eylül, Behzat revisits defining moments from his past and tries to make sense of his present life.

title: Degerli Ceset
desc: Before performing an autopsy on a murder victim found in a park, Barbaros is ordered by a mobster to hand over an item inside the body's stomach.

title: Yanilgi
desc: When an eminent physicist getting a passport at the police station is poisoned by injection, Behzat orders all exits blocked and hunts for the killer.

title: Saplanti
desc: Homicide team members are shocked to learn the prime suspect in their new case is one of their relatives. Cevdet is forced to make a terrible choice.

title: Evlat Sevgisi
desc: The investigation of a 16-year-old girl's murder reveals the teenager was bullied at school and beaten at home. Eylül receives a lucrative offer.

title: Kapanmayan Hesap
desc: The stolen diamonds put Barbaros and Muzaffer in danger. Eylül discovers the offer she accepted comes with rewards, but also complications.

title: Senaristin Ölümü
desc: While investigating the murder of a screenwriter, Behzat and his team are pulled behind the scenes of a television drama series.

title: Karisik Zamanlar
desc: When a private investigator is found strangled with a dog leash, Behzat learns he was trying to find a stolen dog that was to appear in a commercial.

title: Dava
desc: After an attempt is made to kill Gökhan in prison, Harun and Eda are sent to Bolu to find his hiding family members, who are also in danger.

title: Adalet
desc: The trial for the assassination case finally begins and Gökhan takes the stand. Meanwhile, Barbaros and Muzaffer seek their own form of justice.

title: Egitim Zayiati
desc: The body of a 22-year-old man who'd recently completed his military service is found in a dumpster. Ayse identifies the photographer she saw.

title: Orantisiz Güçlüler
desc: When a student dies of a cerebral hemorrhage after a university protest, the team must determine whether force used by security officers caused it.

title: 93. Bölüm
desc: Shortly after a young man's body is found with surgical-like incisions on his torso, a second victim with the same type of cuts is discovered.

title: Yüksek Gerilim
desc: Behzat discovers a cover-up behind the murder of a pizza delivery man, and accidentally interrupts Barbaros and Muzaffer as they are exacting revenge.

title: Dönüm Noktasi
desc: Certain Muzaffer didn't act alone, Behzat has Barbaros followed. Sule spies Emre in a shocking meeting. Gökhan reveals who arranged the assassination.

title: Son Hesaplasma
desc: Barbaros and Muzaffer settle a final score. With solid proof in hand, Emre plans to make a capture. Those behind the assassination must pay.

title: 97.Bölüm
desc:

title: 98.Bölüm
desc:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

title: 99.Bölüm

Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

title: 100.Bölüm
desc: Akbaba Bey returns to join the squad. Behzat wants to learn whether he met with Defne before.

title: 101.Bölüm
desc:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

title: 102.Bölüm
desc:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

title: 103.Bölüm
desc: Tahsin awakes. "Ragip" and "Ercu" force Behzat C. to make a decision. Meanwhile, Sevket's girlfriend is missing with all of his money, gold and his watch collection.

title: 104.Bölüm
desc:
Know what this is about?

title: 105.Bölüm
desc:
