desc: Suzaku is enrolled in Ashford Academy, but is shunned because of his association in the murder of the previous Viceroy. Although he and Lelouch are old friends, they decide to keep it a secret for Lelouch's sake.

title: Kôneria wo ute
desc: Zero makes his appearance at a vital time, and his objective is to capture the Viceroy Cornelia. However, Cornelia is just as good as Lelouch.

title: Kuro no kishidan
desc: The student council of Ashford academy are taken hostage as is the Viceroy's younger sister, Lady Euphemia.

title: Rifurein
desc: Refrain, a drug that makes a person remember the past, is being targeted at Elevens. Kallen's motives and beliefs are examined.

title: Guren mau
desc: Zero's Black Knights are becoming a rallying point for Japanese, and they receive "gifts" from the main underground Japanese forces. Zero once again inserts his forces into battle, with the intention of capturing Cornelia.

title: Narita kôbôsen
desc: Zero manages to destroy most of Cornelia's units and the superior technology of Kallen's Knighmare is enough to take on the White Knight, who saves Cornelia. Lelouch is pursued by the White Knight.

title: Kyôto kara no shisha
desc: Shirly plucks up the courage to ask Lelouch out. Lelouch assumes the identity of Zero and goes to meet the main figures in the Japanese rebellion, wanting to gain their support.

title: Shârî to jûkô
desc: Lelouch has doubts about his actions, as they caused the death of Shirly's father. Viletta reveals to Shirly that she believes that Lelouch is involved with the Black Knights, those responsible for her father's death.

title: Giasu tai giasu
desc: Lelouch is scattered as he can not remember what happened when he was unconscious. Shirly found out that he is Zero. Mao reveals his presence. He also has the power of Geass.

title: Kassai no mao
desc: Mao's ability to read people's minds enables him to manipulate people. Lelouch must defeat him or face the destruction of what he fights for.

title: Toraware no nanari
desc: Lelouch's sister Nunnally is kidnapped by Mao. Suzaku and Lelouch work together to save her, while Lelouch tries to keep Geass, and Zero, a secret.

title: Kishi
desc: An inauguration ceremony is held for Clovis' memorial art museum, with Euphemia judging the art contest. Lelouch helps Kyoshiro Tohdoh's comrades rescue their leader.

title: Kururugi suzaku ni meijiru
desc: Lelouch now knows the identity of the White Knight as his friend, Suzaku, who is officially named Princess Euphemia's Knight. Lelouch draws Suzaku into a trap.

title: Kami no shima
desc: Lelouch, Euphemia, Suzaku and Kallen find themselves on a mysterious Island. Euphemia knows that Zero's true identity, Lelouch, is her brother. Suzaku finds out that Kallen is the pilot of Guren.

title: Kyûshû seneki
desc: Suzaku is sent into a battle after handing in his resignation as Euphemia's Knight. Lelouch, as Zero, comes to assist him in a tight spot.

title: Gakuensai sengen!
desc: Euphemia has an idea that may finally bring peace to Japan. She goes undercover to Ashford Academy to talk to her brother.

title: Chizome no euphie
desc: Lelouch must decide whether to accept Euphy's terms of peace. His motives for destroying Britannia is to create a peaceful world for his sister Nunnally, but he also recognizes his want for revenge.

title: Semete kanashi mi totomo ni
desc: Lelouch's accidental Geass on Euphemia destroys any hope of peace, and Suzaku, enraged at what Zero has done, sets out with revenge in mind. V2 reveals Zero's secret of Geass to Suzaku.

title: Tsuiraku no sutêji
desc: The Black Knights fight against Britannia in a battle for the Tokyo Settlement.

title: Zero
desc: After using his Geass on Cornelia, Lelouch discovers that she doesn't know who killed his mother. C2 senses that Nunnally has been kidnapped, and Lelouch abandons the Black Knights to rescue her.

title: Majin ga mezameru hi
desc: One year after the Black Rebellion, a brainwashed Lelouch and his "younger brother" Rolo are gambling at Babel Tower when C2 and the Black Knights attack the complex to retrieve Lelouch.

title: Nihon dokuritsu keikaku
desc: Lelouch remembers his capture by Suzaku and how his father used Geass to alter his memories. Lelouch and Black Knights escape to the Chinese Federation consulate, where Zero announces his return and the recreation of the USJ.

title: Toraware no gakuen
desc: Lelouch returns to Ashford Academy during Zero's broadcast, causing Viletta to doubt that the real Zero has returned. Guilford demands that Zero reveal himself or else he will execute the captive Black Knights.

title: Gyakushû no shokeidai
desc: Lelouch deduces the nature of Rolo's Geass and convinces Rolo to spare him. Li Xingke takes control of the Chinese Federation consulate. Guilford prepares to execute the Black Knights, and Lelouch enacts a plan to save them.

title: Naito obu raunzu
desc: Suzaku returns to Ashford Academy to determine if Lelouch has regained his memories. The academy throws him a welcome festival. C2 attends, complicating things for Lelouch as he tries to hide her presence.

title: Taiheiyô kishû sakusen
desc: Rolo uses his Geass on Suzaku so Lelouch can converse with Nunnally without revealing that his memories have returned. Lelouch and the Black Knights attempt to capture Nunnally as she is transported to Japan.

title: Suterareta kamen
desc: Nunnally is sworn in as the new Viceroy, and she announces the recreation of the SAZOJ. Knowing he cannot go against his sister, Lelouch slips into a state of depression.

title: Hyakuman no kiseki
desc: In a private conversation with Suzaku and some Britannian officials, Zero requests he be exiled in exchange for delivering 1,000,000 Japanese to the SAZOJ.

title: Kinshijô no hanayome
desc: Lelouch learns the Chinese Empress, Tianzi, is being forced into a political marriage to First Prince Odysseus eu Britannia. The wedding is orchestrated by the High Eunuchs, who will become nobles of Britannia in exchange for turning over half their land to Second Prince Schneizel el Britannia.

title: Shinko kagayaku koku
desc: After storming the royal wedding and kidnapping the bride, Zero and the black knights have an all out fight with the Chinese Federations troops in what is Zeros biggest challenge yet

title: Omoi no chikara
desc: The Black Knights continue their fight against the Chinese, but the battle takes a turn for the worse when the Britannians back the Eunuchs. They no longer care about the empress' wellbeing, meaning Zero may have lost his bargaining chip and the battle.

title: Rabu atakku!
desc: The Knights of Round have become students at Ashford Academy right as Lelouch has returned. But he has other worries, like the countless dates his stand-in set up while he was away. Lelouch must take on his next challenge-Cupid Day!

title: Kako kara no kikaku
desc: Lelouch confronts Jeremiah on a train station while Shirley decides what to do after learning the truth about Lelouch.

title: Giasu gari
desc: With Shirley's death hanging over him, Lelouch directs his anger towards the Geass power. He makes his first contact with the mysterious V2 and declares war. Meanwhile, Suzaku plans to take drastic measures to force answers about Lelouch out of Kallen.

title: C no sekai
desc: Lelouch finally meets his father face to face but things go wrong as Lelouch sees C2 past.

title: Chôgasshûkoku ketsugi daiichigô
desc: The emperor is missing, and Zero takes the chance to ratify the United Federation of Nations. With the 47 nations involved, they will have enough backing to declare war on the Britannian Empire, finally freeing their countries. But nothing is ever so easy...

title: Tsuchi no aji
desc: While the war rages on, Lelouch begs for Suzaku's help in making sure Nunnally will be safe. But with the death of Euphemia and Shirley still heavy in his heart, will Suzaku be able to do this for Zero, the murderer, or is it for Lelouch, his oldest friend?

title: Dainiji Tôkyô taisen
desc: The battle for Tokyo fills the sky. The Black Knights take out the power gaining temporary advantage, but when Suzaku appears, he threatens to use Britannian's most terrifying weapon: the F.L.E.I.J.A. But to fire such a devastating weapon...is it worth it?

title: Uragiri
desc: Devastated about the use of the F.L.E.I.J.A., Lelouch takes his anger out on Rolo as Schneizel arranges a meeting with the leaders of the Black Knights.

title: Kôtei shikkaku
desc: Lelouch has lost everything and knows the only thing left is to take out his father, the Emperor. But he's not the only one bent on seeking him out. Suzaku, on Schneizel's orders, plans to assassinate the Emperor. What awaits the two on Kamine Island?

title: Ragunareku no setsuzoku
desc: Lelouch confronts his father in the Sword of Akasha and learns the truth about his mother's death.

title: Kôtei Rurûshu
desc: Lelouch has overtaken the empire, establishing himself as Emperor. He starts by abolishing the aristocracy and announcing Suzaku as the Knight of Zero. Lelouch announces that Britannia will join the U.F.N., but Schneizel makes an unexpected move.

title: Shunaizeru no kamen
desc: Nunnally has declared Lelouch and Suzaku as her enemies. By siding with Schneizel she is allowing the use of the F.L.E.I.J.A., but she has been led to believe the destructive weapon would be used only when necessary. However, Schneizel has other plans.

title: Damokuresu no sora
desc: The Black Knights fight a close battle with Schneizel, neither side giving way. Before the F.L.E.I.J.A.'s can destroy them all, Lelouch must outsmart the brother he has never beaten and face the sister he has spent his life protecting.

title: Re;
desc: Lelouch tries to persuade Nunnally into giving him the key of Damocles as the battle concludes.

title: Episode #1.1
desc: A woman is found murdered in the middle of the Oresund Bridge - on the border between Sweden and Denmark. What looks at first to be one murder, however, turns out to be two.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: After the murder on the bridge, the killer makes his presence known and chooses a tabloid journalist to act as a contact with the outside world.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: To draw attention to the increased number of people falling through the cracks of society, the killer kidnaps a homeless man and demands a large ransom from four landlords for his survival. So what is the price of a human being after all?

title: Episode #1.4
desc: Knowing the killer has carefully planned his crimes, Saga and Martin wonder whether they can catch him off guard by doing something he doesn't expect.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: The murderer has groomed a number of schizophrenics to commit carefully synchronized violent crimes on the same day in Malmo and Copenhagen.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: A rogue policeman is killed by someone in uniform. The detectives believe that the killer for whom they are searching was the killer. They also now suspect that the killer may indeed be one of them - that he is actually is a cop.

title: Episode #1.7
desc: A bus-load of children is kidnapped and are threatened to be killed. The police believe that the kidnapper is the killer, and the hunt continues.

title: Episode #1.8
desc: Because the detectives suspect that a policeman is involved, a profile of the killer is developed and several police fit the profile and a search among them begins. The hunt continues and a particular suspect is found.

title: Episode #1.9
desc: Things are brought closer to home when the criminal's mask is removed.

title: Episode #1.10
desc: The crime spree is resolved. However, many loose threads remain.

title: Episode #2.1
desc: A tanker is heading towards the bridge. When it is boarded by the coastguard the crew are discovered to be missing. The only people on board are five youths, drugged and chained. Saga and Martin are assigned to investigate the case.

title: Episode #2.2
desc: Four individuals wearing animal masks post a video online claiming responsibility for the tanker Saga and Martin are investigating. Deaths are reported of people eating poisoned food. Are the cases connected?

title: Episode #2.3
desc: Saga and Martin continue their hunt for the eco-terrorists, who have realised the police are on their trail.

title: Episode #2.4
desc: The hunt is on for the leader of the eco-terrorists, with Saga and Martin hoping to stop any further attacks from happening.

title: Episode #2.5
desc: As the investigation moves forward a new group of four, animal head wearing, eco-terrorists post a video online. Saga is having some relationship "issues".

title: Episode #2.6
desc: A sunken boat containing skeletal remains is found, that appears to be related to the eco-terrorist case. Martin's son is taken into hospital in a serious condition.

title: Episode #2.7
desc: A chemical plant is attacked which threatens to contaminate a water source. Saga realises living with a partner is harder than she thought. Martin looks into Saga's past.

title: Episode #2.8
desc: Martin visits Jens in prison and seems to be getting to him. As they re-interview witnesses Saga suspects a statement has been tampered with. Laura regains consciousness and remembers what her assailant looks like.

title: Episode #2.9
desc: Saga and Martin have a sketch of the suspect, but can they get to them in time to avert 'The Graduation'. Their friendship is placed under strain by Martins inquiry into Saga's past.

title: Episode #2.10
desc: It becomes apparent that the case isn't over and Saga and Martin race to prevent another terrorist attack. Saga faces a decision that may destroy her friendship with Martin.

title: Episode #3.1
desc: When a well-known gender theorist, and owner of Copenhagen's first gender-neutral preschool, is found murdered at a construction site in Malmö, Saga has to cooperate with a new Danish colleague, Hanne, who has difficulty accepting Saga.

title: Episode #3.2
desc: Saga gets a new Danish colleague, Henrik Sabroe, and together they continue to investigate Helle Anker's murder.

title: Episode #3.3
desc: The police receive a video demanding a ransom in exchange for Hans' release. They manage to locate him, but when they are about to free him, they find that his kidnapper has been shot and Hans has been abducted again.

title: Episode #3.4
desc: Hans is still in a coma. Saga makes a mistake in a dramatic hostage situation, but they manage to arrest a suspect who is taken in for questioning.

title: Episode #3.5
desc: Lillian discovers a wound in Hans' mouth, which turns out to be a branding mark. The other two victims are examined again and they also have the same kind of branding mark. The perpetrator is probably branding his victims, but for what?

title: Episode #3.6
desc: Saga and Henrik see a connection between the victims and some artwork hanging in a museum. All of the artwork is owned by Freddie Holst, a well-known and successful Danish business man.

title: Episode #3.7
desc: An older couple is found murdered in a spectacular fashion in their house outside Ystad. They have a connection to a piece of art and they both have branding marks in their mouths, just like the previous victims.

title: Episode #3.8
desc: The hunt for the killer intensifies, and Saga and Henrik are certain of his identity. But when they are about to bring him in, he has disappeared.

title: Episode #3.9
desc: Saga has been forced to take a leave of absence from the investigation and her old colleague Rasmus Larsson takes her place.

title: Episode #3.10
desc: The hunt for the perpetrator and Freddie's newborn baby continues.

title: Episode #4.1
desc: Set two years after Season 3, this fourth and final season starts with the discovery of a woman who was brutally murdered at the base of the bridge. Henrik seeks Saga's help, but being imprisoned, there's nothing she can do.

title: Episode #4.2
desc: Henrik and his new colleague, Jonas, continue to investigate Margrethe Thormod's murder. Their two main leads are the radical leftist group, Red October, and the missing refugee, Taariq.

title: Episode #4.3
desc: Richard, the Swedish journalist and expert on radical leftist groups is missing, but he suddenly turns up again and broadcasts live on the internet.

title: Episode #4.4
desc: Taariq recognizes a car related to the case. He wants to push the owner for money, but is himself accused of robbery. Saga fears that will be more murders and Henrik's efforts for the homeless girls ends up in disappointment.

title: Episode #4.5
desc: The taxi driver who drove Margrethe Thormod and was the last person to see her alive, turns out to have connections to another victim as well, while suspicions about the Sonning couple also grow.

title: Episode #4.6
desc: Henrik believes he found the connection between all victims and an unexpected finding ends up on the investigation board. At the same time, the crack between him and Saga is greater than ever.

title: Episode #4.7
desc: The investigation on Tommy continues but his mother, who is still in police custody, refuses to cooperate. Niels Thormod comes up in the investigation again.

title: Episode #4.8
desc: The homeless girls know who the killer is and try to get in contact with Henrik, but the killer is after them and the girls have to run for their lives. Meanwhile, Saga finds a match for the killer's fingerprint.

title: Meet The Sarabhais
desc: Sahil, elder son of Sarabhai family, upset with quarrel happening between his mother Maya and wife Monisha left home and reached Goa. He met a flop novel writer Nagesh. He told tragedy of his life to him.

title: Monisha and Maya's Birthday
desc: Monisha and Maya's birthdays are on the same day and both want to spend their birthday with Sahil, but only one of them can. They both do different things to persuade Sahil.

title: Cricket Match
desc: Maya arranges tickets for the cricket match final for herself and Indravadan, but Indravadan gets food poisoning because of Monisha.

title: Tiger Ya Tota ?
desc: Monisha thinks that Sahil is cheating and is having an affair with his colleague.

title: Drama Rehearsal
desc: Indravadhan is planning a play. But things don't go as planned.

title: Popat Lal
desc: Maya's uncle passes away. She decides to sing at his funeral but loses her voice because of Monisha.

title: Indravadan Inside A Cupboard
desc: Indravadan locks himself in a closet, with the help of Sahil, to make Maya realize his importance in her life.

title: Bachelor Party
desc: All of the men in the family decide to have a bachelor party, as Monisha and Maya are out of town, but get caught by their wives.

title: Monisha Learns a Lesson
desc: Monisha's carelessness makes Sahil go to his clinic with an empty tiffin box. Angry with this and the her other messy habits, Sahil employs a maid servant, Bindu bai.

title: Scrabble Competition
desc: Maya challenges Indravadhan in a game of Scrabble. Who will win?

title: Maya's Cleanliness Drive
desc: Maya's sister, Vidisha decides to stay with Monisha when she comes to India for her wedding shopping. A disappointed Maya fakes illness and moves in with Monisha so that she can clean the house.

title: Rosesh Is In Love
desc: Rosesh falls in love with Maggie, a dominating socialite. Maya is deeply saddened as she believes that Maggie will snatch Rosesh away from her.

title: Prank on Indravadan
desc: Maya invites her friend Sarita and her husband Dinesh to her. All hell breaks loose when Dinesh dies after drinking a drink made by Indravadhana.

title: Cookie Sharma
desc: Indravadan's attempts at romancing Maya fail. This leads to him fantasising about a film actress he has just met, Cookie Sharma.

title: Sonia's Vision Cause Chaos
desc: Sonia, the third child of the Sarabhais, predicts that someone in the Sarabhai house will die.

title: Rosesh Gets Psychoanalysed
desc: Rosesh suffers from insomnia due to his incomplete poetry.

title: Maya And Monisha Wager A Bet
desc: Maya has a bet with Monisha that men cannot remember important dates.

title: Sahil's New Car
desc: Sahil buys a car which costs him a fortune. But Rosesh drops his play's prop on it which causes the light to break.

title: Indravadan's Diet
desc: Indravadhan starts suffering from high cholesterol. Maya decides to put him on a strict diet.

title: Love is Blind: Sahil and Monisha's Story - Part 1
desc: Maya narrates the love story of Sahil and Monisha to Dushyant.

title: Love Is Blind: Sahil and Monisha's Story - Part 2
desc: Maya narrates the love story of Sahil and Monisha to Dushyant.

title: Sahil's Personal Diary
desc: Maya and Monisha discover Sahil's personal diary which reveals that he had an affair.

title: Seance To Connect With Baa
desc: The lease for the Sarabhai residence expires. Since Ba was the only one to know where the lease papers were, the family decides to call Ba's spirit.

title: Baa Possesses Monisha
desc: Maya and Sahil discover something fishy about Ba.

title: Khichdi With Sarabhais: Part 1
desc: After Rosesh publishes his book, Maya decides to encourage him by fake praises.

title: Khichdi With Sarabhais: Part 2
desc: Maya and Indravadhan land in trouble when they have to take care Dipender, their friend's pet dog.

title: Bury the Hatchet
desc: Indravadhan and Rosesh decide to become friends. Similarly, Maya and Monisha decide to stay under one roof.

title: Sunehri
desc: The Sarabhais hire a maid, Sunehri, who isn't as innocent as she appears to be. She robs them.

title: Dushyant And His Unhelpfulness
desc: Monisha damages Maya's phone but her plan to get Dushyant to repair it is met with resistance. Everyone recalls Dushyant causing a blackout. Inadvertently, Indu reveals to Dushyant that Maya's phone is not working.

title: Sahil and Monisha Fight
desc: Sahil and Monisha have a fight because of Sahil's crazy patient, Neelima.

title: Radhabai and Vitthal Leave
desc: Maya fires her servants due to their negligence.

title: Sudhanshu Paints Maya: Part 1
desc: Maya falls in love with Sudhanshu, an artist who agrees to paint her potrait.

title: Maya Falls in Love: Part 2
desc: Maya considers moving in with Sudhanshu.

title: Men Are Rational Fools: Maya's Bet with Indu
desc: Maya tries to prove to Monisha that men are rational thinkers.

title: Daughter-in-law Day
desc: Monisha prepares a speech for Maya on the occasion of daughter-in-law day.

title: Maya's Nightmare
desc: Sahil has got a big offer in Delhi. Sahil living far away from her and closer to Monisha's family upsets Maya and she goes to the extent of faking cancer to make sure he cancels the trip.

title: Sibling Rivalry
desc: Rosesh makes it through a movie audition while Sahil's work is appreciated among his peers. When the family ignores Sahil's achievement, he lists out the dangers of being in the movie business.

title: Monisha's Worries
desc: Monisha bemoans the lack of romance in her life and soon, the whole family finds out about this. Dushyant and Maya step in to try and resolve Sahil's problem.

title: Indravadan Hypnotised: Part 1
desc: A hyponitist, Siddharth Anirudh Prasad, gets insulted by Indravdhan at a party.

title: Indravadan Hypnotised: Part 2
desc: Maya and Sahil try to stop a sari-clad Indravadan, who thinks he is Maya, from going out. Maya speaks to Siddharth to get Indravadan out of the hypnotised state.

title: Maya's Antakshari
desc: Maya and Monisha challenge each other in a game of Antakshari.

title: Baldev-Sarupa's Marital Problems
desc: Rosesh decides to quit poetry but at the same time, Baldev and Sarupa come to the Sarabhais regarding their marital problems.

title: Rosesh Kidnapped
desc: Rosesh is kidnapped for ransom and Indravardhan decides to bargain. When Rosesh finds out, he refuses to come home.

title: Monisha Becomes a Millionaire
desc: Monisha's millionaire uncle names all of his property to Monisha.

title: Indravadan's Play
desc: Indravadhan decides to do something constructive and hence, ends up writing a play.

title: Indravadan's Birthday Wish
desc: Indravadhan wants freedom as a birthday gift. But things end in disaster.

title: Sharman Kapadia's Trouble
desc: Sharman, a relative of the Sarabhais, falls in trouble after accidentally killing his colleague.

title: Truth Day: Rosesh's Confession
desc: Maya realizes that Rosesh is married to a middle-class girl and has a child.

title: Maya and Indravadan's Love Story
desc: It is nostalgia time for Indravadan and Maya as someone is writing a book on their marriage. Maya recounts how she loved Indravadan's poems and how these two got married.

title: Monisha's New Pet
desc: Rosesh writes an ode to Monisha's pet goldfish, which she has named after Maya. When both the mother and the wife stand in the society elections, Sahil is left dangling between them.

title: Rosesh's Heartbreaking Discovery
desc: Rosesh comes upon a letter written by Maya for Indu, talking about her disinterest in having a third child. Saddened by the feeling that he was unwanted, Rosesh puts himself up for adoption.

title: Monisha's Date With Patang Kumar
desc: Patang Kumar, a TV actor, visits Monisha's house and flirts with her.

title: Poetry Competition
desc: Indravan mocks Rosesh's poetry. Maya challenges him that Rosesh will win the poetry contest at the Art and Poetry Club Annual function, which is to be judged by Anirudh aka Kachcha Kela.

title: Maya's Amnesia
desc: Maya loses her memory after an accident and becomes middle-class.

title: Rosesh Breaks Traffic Laws
desc: Rosesh is found guilty for drunk driving.

title: The Big Fight: Indravadan vs Sahil
desc: After an argument, Indravadhan and Sahil decide to never talk to each other.

title: Homeless Indravadan
desc: Maya kicks Indravadhan out of the house as he doesn't help in household chores.

title: Jugal and Nayesha
desc: Maya's divorcée sister, Nayesha comes to visit her from Spain and ends up falling in love with Jugalkishore, Monisha's loud cousin.

title: Indravadan's Trap: Women Are Suspicious
desc: Maya finds out that Indravadhan is having an affair.

title: Maya's Agenda: A Bride for Rosesh - Part 1
desc: Rosesh starts dating a high society girl, Yuyu.

title: Maya's Agenda: A Bride for Rosesh - Part 2
desc: Maya becomes enemies with Yuyu's offensive mother, Simple.

title: Madhu Phupha's Niece
desc: Madhu Phupha's niece, Kismi comes to stay at the Sarabhais for a few days.

title: Indravadan Meets Yamraj
desc: Indravadhan believes that he is dying in a few days.

title: Who Will Accompany Sahil to the Party?
desc: Sahil gets invited to a party by a famous cricketer. Problem arises when he has to decide that who will accompany him, Maya or Monisha?

title: Monisha's Makeover
desc: After being fed up with Monisha's unsophisticated behavior, Maya decides to transform her into a sophisticated socialite.

title: Monisha's Woe, Maya's Joy
desc: After a huge fight with Sahil, Monisha considers committing suicide. Everyone is worried for her.

title: The Midas Chant's Magic
desc: Dushyant gives Sahil an African chant. After reciting the chant, whatever Sahil says shall happen. This proves to be a disaster for everybody.

title: Find a Bride in 30 Days: Part 1
desc: Rosesh visits a well known psychic who says that if he doesn't get married in the next 30 days, he will have to wait for 58 years for marriage. The Sarabhais freak out and plan to arrange Rosesh's marriage as soon as possible.

title: Find a Bride in 30 Days: Part 2 & Baba Cindolin
desc: The Sarabhais invite Cindolin who, through his magic ball, shows the events which will follow in the next seven years, which include a family member's death.

title: Monisha Ki Mannat
desc: The Sarabhais are back and stuck in a bus, thanks to a sticky situation Monisha has got them into. So what exactly happened to the family in these seven years and will Rosesh's heart go 'beat beat' with the entry of Jasmine Mavani?

title: Monisha Ki Mannat - 2
desc: The Sarabhais reach Matkadhar Baba's samadhi and what follows is a chain of crazy things. Whoopie, Rosesh can now finally marry Jasmine but will Maya let him?

title: Rosesh Gets Married?
desc: The mannat is fulfilled and Rosesh is all set to marry Jasmine.

title: Papa Don't Preach, Says Sahil!
desc: If news of Rosesh becoming a 'father' is making Maya have a nervous breakdown, Indu's 'interfering' ways are making Sahil see red.

title: Indu's Antics
desc: Sahil states that Indu is a bad influence on Arnab. Indu wants to prove that he is more than just a 'spoilt brat'. Will hosting an exhibition of antiques help?

title: Man of the Hour, Kachcha Kela
desc: Indu and Maya Finally set the exhibition of antiques. Then Kachcha Kela came with his new Poem. During the exhibition Dushyant notice something about Kachcha Kela and start to blaming him for stealing. Is he innocent or really a thief?

title: Jasmine, Maya Lock Horns!
desc: Sahil and Indu patch up. Meanwhile, Maya decides to leave the house. And that's not all, her nemesis Jasmine Mavani throws a challenge at her, khot nath kehti.

title: Maya Sarabhai vs Sahil Sarabhai
desc: There are very bad comments for Maya written on the chits. Maya finds out it was Sahil as the chits were printed from his tablet. However, Maya finds out that it was Rosesh who had written about Maya.

title: Bahu Machhar Beta Khachhar
desc: Rosesh finally bags a big serial but can he impress his director? Meanwhile, Maya shows off some serious acting chops.

title: Monisha-Sahil, Divorced?
desc: 'Rosla' moves in with Jasmine. Arnab goes missing and Maya's wish seems to have finally come true.

title: Smoke Gets in Your Eyes
desc: New York City, 1960s. In the ego-driven Golden Age of advertising, everyone is selling something and nothing is what it seems.

title: Ladies Room
desc: Don continues to conceal his complicated personal life, even in the face of Roger's invitation to open up.

title: Marriage of Figaro
desc: Pete returns home from his honeymoon excited about his new marriage but conflicted about his past encounter with Peggy.

title: New Amsterdam
desc: Pete Campbell oversteps the mark when he pitches an idea for ad campaign to the head of Bethlehem Steel without telling Don Draper. Draper wants him fired but learns a lesson in corporate politics. Pete's wife wants to buy a Manhattan apartment but he has to approach his cold and distant parents for a loan. Pete's in-laws, however, are more forthcoming.

title: 5G
desc: Don Draper is shaken when his past life comes back to haunt him. After his picture appears in a local newspaper, Adam Whitman, a man who claims to be his younger brother, approaches him. Don, or Dick as his brother knows him, initially denies everything but in the end admits to having taken on a new name. He refuses however to have anything to do with him and tries to buy his silence. When one of the ad men gets a short story published, Pete Campbell is frustrated that his own stories have yet to see the light of day. When his wife approaches an old beau to see if he ...

title: Babylon
desc: The Agency is looking to land an advertising contract to promote tourism to Israel. Don and his team try to come up with a theme but know so little about the country that they're stumped. So Don calls Rachel Menken to see if she has any ideas. Roger Sterling is getting tired of sneaking around with Joan Holloway and suggests she should get her own apartment but she knows better. Peggy comes up with an advertising concept during a testing session for a new line of lipsticks and she's subsequently asked to write copy.

title: Red in the Face
desc: When Don invites Roger home for dinner, too much alcohol fuels repercussions between Don and Betty and between Don and Roger. Joan puts Roger off for the weekend, spending time with her roommate Carol instead. Pete exchanges a wedding gift for a rifle, and then shares a hunting fantasy with Peggy. Bertram Cooper arranges for the Nixon campaign to meet with him, Roger, Don, and Pete.

title: The Hobo Code
desc: Pete Campbell and Peggy Olson start an office romance. Peggy's copy for the lipstick account goes over well and the men in the firm congratulate her. A new telephone receptionist, Lois Saddler, takes a liking to Salvatore Romano but his own interests seem to lie elsewhere. Don Draper gets an unexpected bonus from Bert Cooper and wants to take Midge on a surprise trip to Paris. She seems too involved with her beatnik friends however. Don reflects on his unhappy childhood and in flashbacks he reveals some life lessons he learned early on when a hobo spent the day ...

title: Shoot
desc: Don is courted by Jim Hobart, head of a larger ad firm who offers him more money and more creative resources to join them. Betty Draper rekindles her interest in modeling after Hobart suggests she should try it. She doesn't realize it's all part of the strategy to get Don on board. Peggy Olsen is fretting over her weight gain but doesn't appreciate Joan's advice about getting ahead in the office. The ad team tries to counter the advertising coming out of the Kennedy campaign. Pete Campbell comes up with an idea to keep Kennedy's image off TV in key States.

title: Long Weekend
desc: It's Labor Day weekend and most of the men are sending their wives away for a few days. Don Draper's wife Betty is dreading the thought, as her father and his new girlfriend, whom she detests, will be staying with them. With the election approaching, the team at Sterling Cooper is gloomy since the Nixon campaign has not been following their advice. Roger Sterling was hoping to spend Friday night with Joan Holloway but having just seen the movie The Apartment (1960), she is feeling a bit used. She plans a night on the town with her old college friend who has some surprising information ...

title: Indian Summer
desc: Peggy is given the opportunity to write copy for a new weight loss device that everyone knows is useless. She finds an interesting use for it, however. Afraid of losing the Lucky Strike cigarette account, Bert Cooper gets Roger Sterling to come in for a one-hour meeting but he has another attack. Don Draper becomes a partner and takes over for his friend Roger, but some of the ad men are sharpening their resumes nonetheless. Pete Campbell wants a promotion but Draper doesn't seem too interested. Pete sneaks into Don's office and takes home a parcel sent by Adam ...

title: Nixon vs. Kennedy
desc: Election night arrives and the staff of Sterling Cooper has a party while watching the returns. The election is close and it's obviously going to be a long night. Now a senior partner in the firm, Don Draper must hire a new head of account services, a post that Pete Campbell yearns for. Aware of Draper's secret past, he tries to strong-arm him into giving him the job. With his secret out, Don panics and he asks Rachel Menken to run away with him. Regaining his composure, Don calls Pete's bluff leading to a confrontation with Bert Cooper.

title: The Wheel
desc: Don and Betty Draper have an argument when it becomes apparent that he doesn't want to spend Thanksgiving with her family and she plans on going only with the children. He also learns some information about his brother Adam. Pete Campbell confirms that he has landed an account from his father-in-law for a new skin care product called Clearasil. He objects however when Don gives the account to Peggy Olson, whom he has just promoted to junior copywriter. Peggy proves her mettle in auditions for the weight loss device but later is feeling unwell and goes to the hospital ...

title: For Those Who Think Young
desc: On Valentine's Day, the staff of the Sterling Cooper Advertising Agency is hustling and checking out the newest office equipment. Don and Duck clash over an account, and Betty hears from an old friend.

title: Flight 1
desc: A plane crash causes the firm to go after the account for the airline involved and drop the smaller airline they have an account with. Peggy pays a visit to her mother and sister, who are now guardians of a child.

title: The Benefactor
desc: Trouble rises on the set of a commercial while Don plays hooky from the office.

title: Three Sundays
desc: Freddy and Ken take a client out to lunch who stirs Roger Sterling's heart.

title: The New Girl
desc: Joan finds Don the perfect secretary, and Don finds himself in the middle of issues between TV comedian Jimmy and his wife, Bobbie.

title: Maidenform
desc: Don and Duck try to bury the hatchet, and Peggy attempts to join in on the execs' after-hours meetings. Also, Duck receives a family visit at the office.

title: The Gold Violin
desc: To show that he has "arrived," Don buys a new car. Pete, Harry and Ken come up with a plan to attract new business, and Don's secretary makes a serious error, which could mean trouble for Joan. Cooper gets a new piece of office art that attracts the interest of the Sterling Cooper staff.

title: A Night to Remember
desc: Betty becomes suspicious that Don is having an affair after her conversation with Jimmy Barrett, Joan helps out in the television department, and Peggy helps the church with a dance flyer.

title: Six Month Leave
desc: Don checks in to a hotel after his separation from Betty. Back at the office, he is forced to get rid of Freddy against his will because of his drinking problem.

title: The Inheritance
desc: Don and Betty try to keep up appearances as they go to Betty's parents after her dad has a stroke. Peter has a long-dreaded meeting with his mother before he and Kinsey leave for a convention in Los Angeles.

title: The Jet Set
desc: Don blows off the convention in Los Angeles when he meets a beautiful, exotic woman. Back at Sterling Cooper, a member of the creative staff comes out of the closet, and Duck falls off the wagon and initiates his power play.

title: The Mountain King
desc: Don drops off the Sterling Cooper radar and visits the wife of the man whose identity he stole. Back at the office, Bert and Roger consider the merger offer, Peggy makes a play for a real office, and Peter loses his father-in-law's account.

title: Meditations in an Emergency
desc: Under the backdrop of the Cuban Missile Crisis, Don returns to New York just as Betty finds out that she is pregnant. Meanwhile, everybody at Sterling Cooper contemplates their futures as news of the merger slowly leaks out.

title: Out of Town
desc: Don accidentally learns a secret about Salvatore during a business trip to Baltimore. Back at the office, the firings continue, but the new management appoints Peter and Ken as new co-heads of accounts.

title: Love Among the Ruins
desc: Don is brought in to save the day for a P.R. campaign involving the building of the new Madison Square Garden, only to have the rug pulled out from under him. At home, Betty argues with her brother over how to care for their sick father.

title: My Old Kentucky Home
desc: Roger Sterling throws an expensive party with his new wife, Joan throws a dinner party, Peggy and Paul get stoned while working on an ad campaign, and Don's daughter Sally steals money from her grandpa.

title: The Arrangements
desc: Don has reservations about a misguided potential client who wants to sell jai alai as the "new national pastime." Meanwhile, Sal produces the "Patio" television commercial, Peggy searches for a roommate, and Betty's father passes away.

title: The Fog
desc: Betty has hallucinations of her deceased father as she delivers her baby, Peter considers trying to sell the untapped "Negro market" to a reluctant client, and Peggy begins to question her future at Sterling Cooper.

title: Guy Walks Into an Advertising Agency
desc: The bosses come in from London to reorganize Sterling Cooper, but a key player's career is sidetracked by a freak accident. Meanwhile, as Joan prepares to leave her job, her husband gives her some bad news.

title: Seven Twenty Three
desc: As Don secures an account with Conrad Hilton, Sterling and Cooper try to strong-arm Don into signing a contract. Meanwhile, Betty meets with her acquaintance from the governor's office, and Duck tries to get Peggy to leave Sterling Cooper.

title: Souvenir
desc: Don and Betty renew their love affair while on a business trip to Rome, while Peter has a bout of infidelity with an au pair in his building while his wife is away.

title: Wee Small Hours
desc: Betty tries to meet with Henry Francis again, while Don steps up his pursuit of his daughter's former teacher. At the office, Don disappoints Conrad Hilton and is forced by a client to fire Salvatore over an unwelcome advance.

title: The Color Blue
desc: As Sterling Cooper prepares for its 40th anniversary party, the bosses in London drop a bombshell to Lane. Miss Farrell's troubled brother pays a visit to her and Don, and Betty stumbles onto her husband's secrets.

title: The Gypsy and the Hobo
desc: An old flame and potential client reenters Roger Sterling's life, Joan's husband searches for a new job, and Don finally comes clean to Betty about his true identity.

title: The Grown-Ups
desc: On the weekend of the John F. Kennedy assassination, Pete finds out that he lost the promotion to Cosgrove, Roger Sterling's daughter's wedding goes off as planned, and Betty musters up the courage to respond to Don's confessions.

title: Shut the Door. Have a Seat
desc: With another sale on the horizon, Sterling, Cooper, and Draper convince Lane Pryce to fire them and then join them as they start up a new advertising firm. At home, Betty follows through with her plans to divorce Don.

title: Public Relations
desc: The new firm is struggling for business, so Peter and Peggy resort to a cheap publicity stunt to lure a client. Meanwhile, Don's personal problems and an unflattering newspaper interview puts his and the firm's image in jeopardy.

title: Christmas Comes But Once a Year
desc: Freddy returns with a valuable new client, the firm reluctantly throws a Christmas party for its most important client, and Don prepares for his first Christmas away from his children.

title: The Good News
desc: Don flies to Los Angeles to visit Anna before his New Year's vacation to Acapulco, but her bad news influences him to cancel his vacation and return to New York, where he discovers that Lane has problems of his own.

title: The Rejected
desc: Peter finds out that he will become a father, and has to break some bad business news to his father-in-law. Meanwhile an office focus group study for a client has some unintended personal consequences for Don.

title: The Chrysanthemum and the Sword
desc: Don is forced to compete with a cocky upstart rival for a potential account with Honda motorcycles, but Roger's prejudice causes unexpected problems. Meanwhile Betty considers a psychiatrist for Sally because of her behavior.

title: Waldorf Stories
desc: Don has a wild lost weekend after winning a CLIO award, while Peggy is forced to work all weekend in a hotel room with an "uninspired" co-worker. Meanwhile, Peter is livid after he learns that the other partners hired Ken Cosgrove.

title: The Suitcase
desc: Don deliberately delays returning an important call from California, because he knows it's bad news about Anna. Instead, he keeps himself occupied by forcing Peggy to miss her birthday dinner to pull an all-nighter with him for a client.

title: The Summer Man
desc: While Don's thoughts turn inward while he deals with Anna's death, Peggy is placed in a difficult situation when an obnoxious new hire in the creative department is disrespectful to Joan.

title: The Beautiful Girls
desc: Sally makes an unwelcome surprise visit to the office to see Don, Peggy tries to stop an acquaintance from publishing an article that could get her in hot water, and Roger Sterling tries to reconnect with Joan.

title: Hands and Knees
desc: Don becomes frightened that his lie will be exposed when government agents question Betty about him, Lane has shocking news for his father when he comes to bring him home, and Joan considers having an abortion.

title: Chinese Wall
desc: The partners try to keep their cool after they discover that Roger has lost their biggest account, Peter's wife goes into labor, and Don tries to convince Faye to compromise her ethics to drum up new business.

title: Blowing Smoke
desc: Don makes a bold, desperate move to save Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce, but the other partners are furious with his actions. Meanwhile, Sally's psychiatrist suggests that she is improving, but Betty is skeptical.

title: Tomorrowland
desc: Don takes the kids to California and comes back with a surprise announcement. Meanwhile, Betty fires the kids' nanny before they move out of the old house over one questionable incident, and Peggy gets a shot at a new account.

title: A Little Kiss, Part 1
desc: Megan throws Don a surprise birthday party, the war between Pete Campbell and Roger Sterling intensifies, and new mother Joan begins to wonder if she still has a job when she's ready to come back.

title: A Little Kiss, Part 2
desc: Megan is hurt by Don's negative response to the surprise party, Lane finds a missing wallet in a cab, Joan makes an unexpected visit to the office, and Pete makes a play for a bigger office.

title: Tea Leaves
desc: Betty discovers that she has a tumor, Peggy interviews an obnoxious young copywriter for a job, the firm tries to get the Mohawk Airlines account back, and Don and Harry try to court The Rolling Stones to record a commercial.

title: Mystery Date
desc: Don runs into someone from his past. Joan makes a decision, and Roger gives Peggy extra work.

title: Signal 30
desc: While Lane needs some help closing with a potential new client, Peter begins to crack under the pressure of both his home life and work life.

title: Far Away Places
desc: A peaceful hotel getaway ends in disaster for Don and Megan, an LSD trip could have a disastrous effect on Roger's marriage, and Peggy loses her cool after an unsuccessful pitch meeting.

title: At the Codfish Ball
desc: Don gets a visit from the in-laws and his children just as he's about to receive a prestigious award and tries to save the Heinz account. Meanwhile, Peggy and her boyfriend take the next step in their relationship.

title: Lady Lazarus
desc: Megan convinces Don that she should give up her job at the firm so that she can pursue a career on Broadway, while Peter has a fling with an acquaintance's wife.

title: Dark Shadows
desc: A depressed Betty tries to make things uncomfortable for Don and Megan, Roger tries to take out some secret weapons for a meeting with a prospective Jewish client, and Don makes a snap judgment that angers the creative department.

title: Christmas Waltz
desc: Lane searches for a way to get rid of a sizable debt, the firm prepares to pull out all the stops when it gets a second chance to land Jaguar as a client, and Don tries to comfort Joan when she reaches her breaking point.

title: The Other Woman
desc: Peter asks Joan to make an unspeakable sacrifice to help secure the Jaguar account, Peggy prepares to make a drastic move in response to Don's treatment, and Megan's acting career begins to create tension with her and Don.

title: Commissions and Fees
desc: Lane's entire world comes crashing down after getting busted for forging Don's signature on a check, and Sally experiences an awkward rite of passage while spending the weekend with the Drapers.

title: The Phantom
desc: As the partners consider expanding the office space, Don begins seeing ghosts and gets a request to advance Megan's acting career. Meanwhile, Peter's affair comes to a disappointing end, and Megan's mom briefly reunites with Roger.

title: The Doorway, Part 1
desc: Don and Megan take a trip to Hawaii for the holidays, Sally's friend visits the Francis family, a comedian torpedoes Peggy's Super Bowl ad campaign, and Roger gets some bad news about his mother.

title: The Doorway, Part 2
desc: Don strikes up a friendship with the surgeon in his building, Peggy tries to save her campaign, Roger makes a scene at his mother's funeral, and Betty goes to Manhattan to find Sally's friend.

title: Collaborators
desc: While Don continues his affair with Sylvia, Pete's latest infidelity threatens his marriage. Meanwhile, Peggy's icy relationship with her new staff continues, but she also gets an unlikely tip on a potential new client.

title: To Have and to Hold
desc: Don works in secret on a Heinz ketchup campaign while Megan gets a love scene on the set of her soap opera. Meanwhile, Harry makes his power play while Joan has more trouble with the secretaries.

title: The Flood
desc: Set among the events surrounding Martin Luther King's assassination, Peggy tries to get a new apartment, Ginsberg is set up on a date, and Don has a revelation during his weekend with the kids.

title: For Immediate Release
desc: As the firm prepares to go public, Don and Pete's actions cause them to lose two huge clients. However, Roger uses a new connection to put them in position to gain their biggest client ever.

title: Man with a Plan
desc: Things quickly become awkward after the two firms merge, Don asserts his dominance over Sylvia, Pete has to deal with his ailing mother, and Bob Benson helps out a sick Joan.

title: The Crash
desc: The creative department has a wild, drug-influenced weekend as they work on the Chevy account, Don has trouble letting go of Sylvia, and Sally walks in on an unwelcome intruder.

title: The Better Half
desc: Peggy becomes unsatisfied with her apartment and with Abe, Don has an eventful weekend with Betty while Megan has problems on the set, Roger has time with his grandson, and Pete begins exploring his options outside the firm.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
desc: Cutler and Chaough prepare to make radical changes to the firm while Sterling and Draper are visiting a client in Los Angeles. Joan's decision to go after a new account on her own leaves Pete furious and frustrated.

title: Favors
desc: Don is preoccupied with keeping Sylvia's son from being drafted, Peggy has a rat in her apartment, Don and Ted bury the hatchet, Pete has a problem with his mother's new nurse, and Sally makes an accidental discovery about her father.

title: The Quality of Mercy
desc: Don renews his battle with Ted after seeing his relationship with Peggy, Sally interviews at a boarding school, and Pete discovers Bob Benson's background.

title: In Care Of
desc: With his personal and professional life crumbling around him, Don positions himself for a change of scenery. Meanwhile, Pete's life is falling apart as well, thanks to the meddling of Bob Benson.

title: Time Zones
desc: Don is on the outside looking in on the forced indefinite paid leave from his job. While Ted heads back to New York for a few days, Don takes the opportunity to head to Los Angeles in part to meet with a California transformed Pete while he reunites with Megan, who is living full time there while pursuing what looks to be a promising acting career. Back in New York, Peggy avoids Ted at all cost while she learns to deal with the new "Don", Lou Avery, most specifically on the Accutron account for which she is getting consulting help from Freddie Rumsen. On top of that, ...

title: A Day's Work
desc: Sally discovers that Don is not working, Pete lands a big account but is undercut by management, and Joan is forced to move some secretaries around after Lou and Peggy have some problems.

title: Field Trip
desc: After a fight with Megan during a surprise trip to California, Don decides it's time to get back to work. Meanwhile, Betty joins Bobby on a field trip to a farm.

title: The Monolith
desc: Don returns to work, but quickly falls off the wagon after learning that he's been assigned to Peggy. Meanwhile, Roger and his ex-wife go to a commune to rescue their daughter, who has abandoned her child.

title: The Runaways
desc: While Lou becomes the object of ridicule for the copy writers, Don tries to get away to California after a call from his pregnant niece. Meanwhile, the new office computer drives Ginsberg to the brink of insanity.

title: The Strategy
desc: Peggy has second thoughts about her Burger Chef campaign when Don is asked to pitch her commercial, Pete visits his wife and daughter on his trip back to New York, and Bob Benson gets some surprising news from G.M. about the account.

title: Waterloo
desc: Don and Peggy prepare to pitch to Burger Chef, one day after the Apollo Moon Landing. Meanwhile, a power struggle in the firm between Sterling and Cutler leaves Don's future hanging in the balance.

title: Severance
desc: Don is oddly drawn to a diner waitress as he learns about the loss of an old acquaintance, Peggy and Joan are disrespected by a chauvinistic client, and Cosgrove is in for big changes after his biggest business connection retires.

title: New Business
desc: While Megan comes to New York with her mother and sister to collect her belongings, Don has a romance with the waitress. Meanwhile, Peggy and Stan work with a famous photographer on a commercial shoot.

title: The Forecast
desc: Don decides to sell his apartment, Joan stumbles into a relationship while on a trip to Los Angeles, Glen tells Betty and Sally that he is going to Vietnam, and a copywriter gets in trouble for his rude behavior to a client.

title: Time & Life
desc: The partners discover that the firm is losing its independence and there's nothing they can do about it. Peggy is not sure if she wants to come along. Meanwhile, Pete and Trudy have trouble getting their daughter into private school.

title: Lost Horizon
desc: Don goes AWOL from McCann Erickson in the middle of a meeting. Joan quickly gets fed up with the sexism at the new firm. Roger and Peggy put off reporting to their new jobs as long as possible.

title: The Milk and Honey Route
desc: Don is stuck in Oklahoma after his car breaks down. Betty discovers that she is not in good health. Pete gets an unexpected job offer that could enable him to get his life with Trudy and his daughter back.

title: Person to Person
desc: Don's journey ends in California with Anna's niece, Stephanie, where he contemplates his future. Roger decides to marry Megan's mother, Marie. Joan has a business proposition for Peggy, who is coming to terms with her feelings for Stan.

title: Independence Day
desc: Three teenage sidekicks decide to investigate a fire at a genetics laboratory... and discover a plot to create a clone of Superman.

title: Fireworks
desc: Robin, Kid Flash, and Aqualad are captured and only Superboy, the telepathically controlled clone of Superman, can free them. As they struggle to reach the surface, they must do battle with the transformed scientist known as Blockbuster.

title: Welcome to Happy Harbor
desc: Batman has yet to assign the team a mission, and the team grows restless. A fire at a nearby power plant is the team's first mission or is it just a test?

title: Drop-Zone
desc: Batman sends the team on its first official mission - to observe and report on a Venom Factory. The team chooses its leader.

title: Schooled
desc: Young Justice is assigned transport duty. To deliver parts of an android that has duplicated the powers of several Justice Leaguers. The creator of the android wants him back.

title: Infiltrator
desc: Roy rescues a scientist from the League of Shadows. He asks Young Justice to protect her and neutralize the weapon that she was working on. Artemis joins the team.

title: Denial
desc: When the team investigates the disappearance of Kent Nelson (formerly Doctor Fate), the scientific-minded Wally West is forced to confront his disbelief in magic while battling Abra Kadabra and Klarion the Witch Boy for the ultra-powerful helmet of fate.

title: Downtime
desc: After a poor performance during a mission, Batman gives the team some time off. Aqualad considers going back to Atlantis.

title: Bereft
desc: The team awakens in the Biaylan desert with amnesia. Miss Martian tries to unite the team to restore their memories, and must find the cause of their amnesia.

title: Targets
desc: Red Arrow has to protect one villain from another in order to ensure that peace talks between two warring nations go well.

title: Terrors
desc: Batman assigns Superboy and Miss Martian to go undercover inside Belle Reve, a federal prison designed to house the world's worst super-villains.

title: Homefront
desc: When the cave is attacked, can Artemis and Robin - the two teens without super-powers - save the Team (or even themselves) from the unknown invaders?

title: Alpha Male
desc: When Batman sends the Team and new "den-mother" Captain Marvel to India to investigate bizarre reports of armed animals attacking human beings, can Aqualad pull his fractured Team together?

title: Revelation
desc: Batman assigns the Team to battle the Injustice League, when plant creatures they control begin a global assault.

title: Humanity
desc: The Team is on the hunt for Red Tornado, and their friend Zatanna wants to come along for the ride.

title: Failsafe
desc: When the Justice League is defeated during an alien invasion, the Team has to step up and fill their mentors' shoes.

title: Disordered
desc: Superboy's "Sphere" goes through a surprising change, revealing a connection to the forever people of New Genesis.

title: Secrets
desc: It's Halloween. Artemis and Zatanna are in Manhattan for a girls' night out. There, they encounter the deadly Harm, who has a secret.

title: Misplaced
desc: When Earth's 5 most powerful sorcerers make all the adults on the planet disappear, it's up to the Team, Zatanna, and Billy Batson to stop them.

title: Coldhearted
desc: On his birthday, Kid Flash must deliver a transplant heart in a race against time, artificial extreme weather conditions and supervillain opposition.

title: Image
desc: A covert operation against Queen Bee in Qurac forces Miss Martian to finally face her greatest fears and her biggest secrets. But will she reveal those secrets to her friends - or allow what she's hiding to take down the entire team?

title: Agendas
desc: Superboy returns to Project Cadmus, where he learns the top-secret genetics lab may have created another Super-clone...

title: Insecurity
desc: Red Arrow's return undercuts Artemis' confidence, while the team's mission to track down Sportsmaster threatens to expose her darkest secrets.

title: Performance
desc: Robin, Artemis, Superboy, Miss Martian, and Red Arrow go undercover as the Daring Dangers to discover the link between Haly's circus and stolen weapon technology.

title: Usual Suspects
desc: The team gets a new member and a new mission - a mission that may finally expose all of the team's secrets ... and all of their lies!

title: Auld Acquaintance
desc: The team finally learns the identity of the traitor in their midst, forcing a battle against an enemy more dangerous than any they've ever faced before!

title: Happy New Year
desc: Five years after the Justice League were controlled by Vandal Savage, their time under his control comes back to haunt them. The Team has to take on alien invaders, starting with Lobo.

title: Earthlings
desc: The team of Miss Martian, Superboy, Beast Boy and Adam Strange are sent to the planet Rann.

title: Alienated
desc: The invading Kroloteans receive aid from an unexpected ally.

title: Salvage
desc: Superboy and Blue Beetle take on Intergang, while Nightwing tries to salvage the soul of a former comrade.

title: Beneath
desc: Blue Beetle searches for a missing friend, while the team of Miss Martian, Batgirl, Bumblebee and Wonder Girl return to Bialya.

title: Bloodlines
desc: A mysterious intruder appears inside Mount Justice claiming to be a time-traveling visitor from the future.

title: Depths
desc: Artemis returns to the team to protect an important satellite launch.

title: Satisfaction
desc: Green and Red Arrow try and stop the original Speedy from taking his revenge on Lex Luthor.

title: Darkest
desc: An old friend returns to Mount Justice and takes revenge to prove himself to his new masters.

title: Before the Dawn
desc: Aqualad meets the Light's partner and learns of their plans for Earth while Miss Martian's revenge backfires on her. Meanwhile, the team meets a new, seemingly unbeatable super villain.

title: Cornered
desc: The team is trapped inside the Hall of Justice for a cage match against a brutal alien gladiator!

title: True Colors
desc: When the Reach forms a devil's alliance with Lexcorp, Robin leads a squad undercover to investigate.

title: The Fix
desc: Black Manta seeks vengeance against Miss Martian.

title: The Runaways
desc: Nightwing tasks Blue Beetle with chasing down a group of potentially dangerous super-powered teenage runaways. But Blue Beetle is not the only one hunting them....

title: War
desc: A conqueror from another world becomes a wild card in an intergalactic game of supremacy - placing planet Earth square in the jackpot.

title: Complications
desc: Black Manta gives Miss Martian 24 hours to live, but that may be more time than Aqualad has, with Sportsmaster and Cheshire on the hunt for his head!

title: The Hunt
desc: A band of misfits is put to the test when Lex Luthor sends them behind enemy lines ... to rescue the team!

title: Intervention
desc: The team embarks on a desperate endeavor to free Blue Beetle!

title: Summit
desc: The Light calls a summit to decide the final fate of Aqualad, the team ... and the entire planet Earth!

title: Endgame
desc: When the earth is threatened by the Reach, the team must team up with Lex Luthor and fight the reach with out the Justice League.

title: Princes All
desc: A continuation of the second season; the team faces the difficulty of meta-human trafficking and a new intergalactic threat.

title: Royal We
desc: Dick Grayson, Artemis Crock, Conner Kent and Jefferson Pierce go undercover in Markovia to stop the Bedlam Syndicate's meta-human trafficking cartel - before it claims another victim.

title: Eminent Threat
desc: Conner Kent and Prince Brion Markov are in the clutches of Count Vertigo, leaving Dick Grayson, Artemis Crock and an emotionally damaged Jefferson Pierce to save them and put an end to the Bedlam Syndicate.

title: Private Security
desc: While Jefferson, Connor and Artemis find homes for their Markovian strays, Dick assembles a new squad and hits the road - but may not survive the trip.

title: Away Mission
desc: A distant conflict sends the team on an away mission while the Happy Harbor gang decide what to do with Brion Markov and Halo.

title: Rescue Op
desc: Brion Markov is determined to rescue his missing sister - even if it means throwing down against the entire League of Shadows.

title: Evolution
desc: Aliens once again threaten the Earth, but with the Justice League split and scattered, only Earth's first and greatest hero can save us!

title: Triptych
desc: As Meta-Human trafficking spreads across the United States, three very different teams of heroes seek to put a stop to it!

title: Home Fires
desc: The Light hires an assassin to take out a member of the team, but who's the target?

title: Exceptional Human Beings
desc: With no news on his sister, Brion is growing more and more impatient, but Batman's on the case.

title: Another Freak
desc: Victor confronts his father about his football game. Halo and Forager go to high school.

title: Nightmare Monkeys
desc: Garfield Logan tests out a pair of Goode VR goggles. Then the goggles test him.

title: True Heroes
desc: Grayson's operatives attempt to stop an auction of enslaved Meta-teens.

title: Influence
desc: The team reassembles while the Justice League faces a new threat in space.

title: Leverage
desc: A new Gamma Squad is sent out on its first mission to investigate rumors of meta-trafficking in Russia.

title: Illusion of Control
desc: Across the nation, the team gives thanks for what they have - and for what they very well might lose.

title: First Impression
desc: The Reach are back, terrorizing small-town America - unless the Outsiders can stop them.

title: Early Warning
desc: Project Rutabaga threatens to create an international crisis for the Outsiders.

title: Elder Wisdom
desc: The Outsiders face Lex Luthor's machinations. But Lex isn't the only one trying to manipulate them.

title: Quiet Conversations
desc: Victor Stone reaches a crisis point. And he's not the only one.

title: Unknown Factors
desc: Dick Grayson and Jefferson go after Gretchen Goode - only to encounter the ominous Overlord.

title: Antisocial Pathologies
desc: The betrayals come fast and furious, and with them, a reckoning.

title: Terminus
desc: The hunt for Halo is on. Pray the team doesn't find her.

title: Into the Breach
desc: The Outsiders make one last attempt to save Halo...and the galaxy.

title: Overwhelmed
desc: In the calm before the storm, Artemis and Conner journey back to their pasts.

title: Nevermore
desc: In the season finale episode, things come full circle as the team and the Outsiders return to Markovia for the final confrontation.

title: Inhospitable
desc: Miss Martian, Superboy, Beast Boy, and Martian Manhunter take a little vacation... to somewhat unfriendly climes.

title: Needful
desc: While attempting to solve a growing list of mysteries, Miss Martian, Superboy, and Beast Boy consult with royalty.

title: Volatile
desc: Miss Martian and Superboy grapple with family traditions, while Beast Boy grapples with something darker.

title: Involuntary
desc: Answers come to light as Beast Boy, Miss Martian and Superboy uncover the awful truth.

title: Tale of Two Sisters
desc: Artemis Crock's life is interrupted by devastating news - just as multiple Shadows fall across her path.

title: Artemis Through the Looking Glass
desc: Tigress catches up with her sister, Cheshire, as a Shadowed history catches up with them both.

title: The Lady, or the Tigress?
desc: Oracle's memories challenge Tigress' decision to trust her new allies.

title: I Know Why the Caged Cat Sings
desc: For Tigress, saving everyone may not be an option, unless help is offered from an unexpected source.

title: Odnu!
desc: Zatanna and her protégées find themselves on the cusp of war.

title: Nomed Esir!
desc: Zatanna and her protégées encounter new allies and an ancient foe.

title: Teg Ydaer!
desc: Dr. Fate tests Zatanna's new Sentinels of Magic to see if they can stand against Chaos.

title: Og Hitrof Dna Reuqnoc!
desc: Zatanna rallies the Sentinels of Magic before Chaos consumes the Earth.

title: Kaerb Ym traeh!
desc: Zatanna and the Sentinels of Magic gain unlikely allies, but the new alliance may not be enough.
