desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are on a quest in Georgia and Azerbaijan. They will test three new GT Cars to see how they drive, how they perform and last but not least how they race on a genuine Formula One Racing Track.

title: Legends and Luggage
desc: Jeremy Clarkson playing around with some Lancia's. James is showing us a historical Porsche and Richard takes Clarkson to Stansted Airport to try out new ways to bring you from A to B.

title: The Mongolia Special-Survival of the Fattest
desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are dropped in the vast wilderness of Mongolia and told to await a delivery.

title: Funeral for a Ford
desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present a short and informative history class on one of the bedrocks of British life; the medium-sized Ford saloon.

title: The Grand Tour Presents: Seamen
desc: The route begins in Cambodia at Siem Reap and then winds downriver to Tonlé Sap lake, before joining the Mekong Delta and sailing into Vietnam. The final port of call is Vung Tau, in south Vietnam.

title: The Grand Tour Presents: A Massive Hunt
desc: Hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond, and James May journey through Madagascar in search of buried treasure.

title: The Grand Tour Presents: Lochdown
desc: The presenters are celebrating the great 70s American cars they saw in TV shows, as they road trip around Scotland, creating chaos on the streets of Edinburgh and building a homemade floating bridge across the Hebridean sea.

title: The Grand Tour Presents: Carnage A Trois
desc: On a road trip, the trio dish up a hair-raising mountain climb, bomb defusals, propeller powered cars, helicopter stunts and the most thrilling race of their lives before reaching the English Channel for a jaw dropping medieval climax.

title: A Disastrous Affair
desc: After a bungled raid which kills an innocent man young DS Steve Arnott faces disgrace. However he is transferred to the anti-corruption squad, whose head, superintendent Ted Hastings, gives him a "very special case" to investigate - DCI Tony Gates, recently awarded a medal for heroic conduct but with a suspiciously high arrest rate. Hastings tries to get Gates on minor bribery charges, in vain, and is unaware that the married Gates has covered up a fatal hit-and-run by his lover, businesswoman Jackie Laverty. Meanwhile DC Kate Fleming joins Gates's team and tells ...

title: The Assault
desc: Having been duped into covering up Jackie's hit and run, Gates is desperate to sever ties with her. But as Arnott and Fleming close in on his secret, Gates is plunged into an even more dangerous situation.

title: In the Trap
desc: Gates, knocked unconscious by the attackers, tampers with evidence, hiding a whiskey glass before police arrive to find Jackie has vanished. He claims he has just got there himself. Hastings and Arnott quiz him on his relationship with Jackie and he admits she was an old flame but denies knowledge of her money laundering. Arnott goes over the top in confronting him with evidence to suggest he was at Jackie's house when she was killed but makes himself look desperate. Gates is taken off the case and later, whilst investigating Wes's murder, is grabbed by masked men and...

title: Terror
desc: Whilst the money laundering investigation is passed to Fraud Squad, Gates is still hounded by his blackmailers. Kate wants to connect him to Jackie's murder and sets out to gain his trust to find further proof though Gates' loyal colleague Morton rumbles her. Hastings and Arnott interview Gates' team and learn from D.S. Cottan that he diverted them from attending the drug dealers' murders, leading them to believe that Gates knew that the dead pair were working with Jackie though Gates persuades his gullible superior that the couple were in fact terrorists building a ...

title: The Probation
desc: Gates returns to rescue Arnott but leaves before Kate, her cover now blown, arrives to find evidence that a body had been stored at the warehouse. Arnott recalls that the chief torturer was called Tommy and admits to Kate that Gates saved him. She believes he is weakening in his attitude to Gates, whom he goes to see in secret, confirming his view that Gates is innocent of all the murders. Convinced that Gates is in danger but can bring the killers to justice Arnott persuades Hastings to let Gates set up a meeting with Tommy, recorded on a wire. Arnott and Kate intend...

title: The Ambush
desc: A police convoy escorting a civilian under a witness protection scheme is attacked, the witness hospitalized and all the police officers killed, except Inspector Lindsay Denton, who organized the operation at very short notice and who only informed DCC Dryden of the route. Ted Hastings asks Steve and Kate to interview her but Kate pulls out, claiming one of the dead officers, Jayne Akers, was a friend - though she has been having an affair with Jayne's husband Rich. Her place is taken by Georgia Trotman, who is troubled that the men are savage with their interrogation...

title: Carly
desc: Following the deaths of Georgia and the witness it is Steve who gets a grilling as to the police presence at the hospital whilst Lindsay is accused of attacking her neighbour, which she denies. Steve discovers that a nurse on the witness's ward, Claire Tindall, was threatened into giving the killer access by a man she knows as Joe, but whom she is unable to identify. Lindsay continues to search for vanished teenager Carly Kirk and Kate is drafted in as her assistant - in reality a move to try and get Lindsay to admit her guilt - but Lindsay sees through the ruse. ...

title: Behind Bars
desc: Lindsay is remanded in custody where she is victimized by both staff and prisoners. Meanwhile Steve and Kate discover the identity of the dead witness from blunt inspector Cottan. He was known as Tommy and Cottan believes that Jayne Akers, his liaison officer, was the real mole who betrayed the escort. Kate visits Lindsay, who knows about her affair with Jayne's husband whilst Cottan has similar suspicions. Lindsay's accusations also cause friction between Hastings and Steve, whilst Dryden's driving offence attracts the press so to save himself he strikes a deal ...

title: Blood Money
desc: An arrogant Dryden is questioned regarding the traffic offence and is dismissive though Steve lets him know Lindsay has revealed that he knew about the convoy route and aims to pursue it further. Rich Akers is also pulled in after £20,000 of which he claims ignorance is found under the floor boards at his house. Hargreaves is convinced this was the bribe given Jayne to betray the escort and when Steve and Kate examine Jayne's car they discover a tracking device though Hargreaves is not keen for its revelation. Furthermore Cottan and Hargreaves see video evidence ...

title: Last Words
desc: Lindsay wakes up in a lock-up and is questioned by her abductors. Prasad soon kills his accomplice, Cole, but Lindsay outwits him and makes him admit on the phone that he and Cole were working for Dryden, who set up the ambush. Steve locates her at her dead mother's bedside and she is granted bail, unaware that Prasad, whom she believed that she killed in self-defense, is still alive and demanding immunity. Cottan brings in his old mate Morton for some dirt on Dryden and it is revealed that Dryden had sex with Carly Kirk. He is arrested and questioned, admitting that ...

title: The Caddy
desc: Prasad claims that Dryden wanted Tommy silenced as he was blackmailing him about Carly, hence the ambush. However the order was to spare Lindsay. Hastings charges Dryden for the driving scam but has insufficient evidence for the weightier charges as Dryden apparently proves that the last he saw of Carly was when he put her on a train. Kate is surprised that Steve seems to believe in Lindsay's innocence until he admits that he is purposely trying to gain her confidence to trap her. When she is shown to have accepted a proposal by a colleague to snare a child abuser she...

title: Monsters
desc: When a criminal is shot dead by a police armed-response unit led by Sergeant Danny Waldron, AC-12 gather evidence suggesting it was a deliberate killing rather than self-defense.

title: The Process
desc: Danny's armed-response unit come under increasing scrutiny as AC-12 feed Kate information to help her crack their story. Steve makes a shocking discovery, then his own past catches up with him.

title: Snake Pit
desc: DS Steve Arnott believes there is a dark secret in Danny Waldron's past. Then the spotlight falls on his questionable conduct in a previous inquiry - the Lindsay Denton case.

title: Negative Pressure
desc: Fresh testimony launches AC-12 back on the trail of the Caddy, a corrupt officer with links to organized crime.

title: The List
desc: AC-12's loyalties are divided when DS Arnott comes under scrutiny from his colleagues.

title: Breach
desc: Steve is arrested on suspicion of murder but continues to protest his innocence. Kate's undercover operation unveils unexpected facts, but will it hold the key to uncovering the identity of the Caddy?

title: In the Shadow of the Truth
desc: When DCI Roz Huntley captures a serial killer, Forensic Coordinator Tim Ifield alerts AC-12 to a possible miscarriage of justice.

title: Who Sows the Wind
desc: A dismembered body is discovered, and worries grow when Roz fails to report for duty. After further questioning of Michael Farmer unearths crucial new information, AC-12 challenge the case against him.

title: In the Trap
desc: As shocking new evidence is unearthed, AC-12 step up their investigation into the case against Michael Farmer.

title: Moral Superiority
desc: The discovery of new forensic anomalies appears to provide AC-12 with a major breakthrough. Meanwhile, Nick Huntley comes under scrutiny.

title: Lying Nest
desc: AC-12's future hangs in the balance after Hilton bars them from investigating Roz Huntley. But Roz's problems are building closer to home.

title: Royal Hunting Ground
desc: AC-12 pit their wits against Roz Huntley in a climactic duel to find Tim Ifield's murderer and unmask Balaclava Man.

title: Operation Pear Tree
desc: When three police officers are shot dead during the hijack of a seized drugs transport, AC-12 move in to investigate possible police collusion.

title: The Head of Medusa
desc: A fresh police leak enables another audacious raid, while Arnott's attempts to gather information put him in a dangerous situation.

title: Code Zero
desc: Corbett's most daring plan yet requires McQueen to exploit links with corrupt police officers. Meanwhile, the AC-12 team make a shocking discovery.

title: The Betrayal
desc: Tensions rise in the OCG following the events at Eastfield. With troubling questions hanging over the identity of the mysterious H, suspicions mount among the AC-12 team.

title: On Your Own
desc: As the hunt for H intensifies, Steve and Kate wonder if Hastings is guarding a dark secret.

title: The Intrigue
desc: The search for the mysterious H reaches its climax as long-buried secrets finally come to light.

title: Episode #6.1
desc: AC-12 investigate DCI Jo Davidson's apparent mishandling of the murder of an investigative journalist.

title: Episode #6.2
desc: AC-12 suspect a cover-up as an officer on DCI Davidson's team appears to have sabotaged the inquiry into Gail Vella's murder.

title: Episode #6.3
desc: A new witness comes forward claiming to have crucial evidence in Gail Vella's murder. Kate is torn between her loyalty to Jo and to AC-12.

title: Episode #6.4
desc: DCI Jo Davidson faces increasing pressure from all sides as AC-12 make major breakthroughs in the investigation, but an attempt to interview a key witness goes horribly wrong.

title: Episode #6.5
desc: AC-12 link Gail Vella's murder with a historic case of police corruption, and Kate hatches a plan to tell once and for all if Jo is bent.

title: Episode #6.6
desc: As AC-12 struggle to deal with the repercussions of tragic events, Hastings makes one final bid to uncover institutionalized corruption before his time runs out.

title: Episode #6.7
desc: With time running out, AC-12 attempt to unmask 'H',the fourth individual commanding the network of corrupt officers behind the murder of Gail Vella. But sinister and powerful forces appear intent on orchestrating a cover-up.

tv: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
title: A Body in the Bay
desc: In 2001, a dismembered corpse is found floating in Galveston Bay, Texas.

tv: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
title: Poor Little Rich Boy
desc: Durst reveals details about his childhood including witnessing his mother's suicide.

tv: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
title: The Gangsters Daughter
desc: A tip leads a district attorney to re-open the investigation into the disappearance of Kathie Durst.

tv: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
title: The State of Texas vs. Robert Durst
desc: In 2003, Galveston, Texas, becomes a media circus as the press descends to cover Durst's trial.

tv: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
title: Family Values
desc: Family and friends of Kathie Durst continue to hunt for the truth about what happened to her.

tv: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
title: "What the Hell Did I Do?"
desc: Filmmakers spend nearly a decade investigating Robert Durst and his alleged crimes.

title: Episode #1.1
desc: The family and staff of Downton are shocked when they find that the heir to the title and fiancé of the Earl's daughter Mary perished on the Titanic, and the Earl hires a crippled army comrade as valet.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: The new legal heirs to Downton, lawyer Matthew Crawley and his nurse mother Isobel are invited to live on the estate, but there is resentment of them as interlopers from both up and downstairs as interlopers.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: Gwen's ambitions to leave service to become a secretary is discouraged, Bates takes painful steps to overcome his limp, and a dashing Turkish diplomat visiting Downton seems to work his charms on everyone - especially Mary.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: Mrs. Hughes is reunited with an old beau, now a widower proposing marriage, and the Countess hires Matthew Crawley to see if the will can be broken and disagrees with his mother on a diagnosis.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: Bates sees Thomas stealing a bottle of wine, the footman tries to frame him for petty theft, and Mrs. Crawley tries to convince the Dowager Countess to surrender her annual entitlement prize for best bloom in the village.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: O'Brien and Thomas continue their efforts to frame Bates, Mary falls in love with Matthew, and Sybil is injured in a political disturbance and Branson is blamed.

title: Episode #1.7
desc: Mary finds it was Edith who let the ambassador know about Pamuk's death, Cora announces her pregnancy, and Thomas and O'Brien hatch new slanders against Bates as War clouds loom.

title: Episode #2.1
desc: After Bates' mother dies, he hopes his inheritance will buy him a divorce and allow him to marry Anna, Matthew announces his engagement to Lavinia Swire, and Sybil gets involved in the war effort.

title: Episode #2.2
desc: April 1917. With John still absent, Isobel's butler Molesley makes a play for Anna but is rejected. Robert gets a new valet, shell-shocked ex-soldier Henry Lang, whilst William goes off to war. Edith learns to drive a tractor extremely well, and nearly succumbs to a kiss from the married farmer Mr. Drake. Sybil and Thomas work in the cottage hospital, where the latter begins to learn some humanity. At Isobel's suggestion - and to Violet's dismay - Downton Abbey is turned into a convalescent ward to ease the hospital's bed shortage. Mary invites middle-aged newspaper ...

title: Episode #2.3
desc: Downton is turned into a convalescent hospital for the war wounded and through circumstances Thomas is given authority in its operation as Anna and Bates are briefly reunited and Branson plots against a heroic general dining at Downton.

title: Episode #2.4
desc: Matthew and William are missing in France, the mounting tensions between Cora and Isobel result in Isobel's volunteering for France, Bates returns to Downton, and the servants open a soup kitchen for unemployed veterans.

title: Episode #2.5
desc: August 1918: Deserted by the baby's father, Ethel has been installed with her child in a cottage on the estate by a sympathetic Mrs. Hughes, who brings her food. Jane, a war widow, has taken Ethel's place as a maid. Vera Bates returns, having spent John's money but with no intention of sticking to their arrangement and planning to make money by selling the story of Lady Mary's indiscretion to Carlisle's newspaper. Tipped off by Anna, Mary goes to see him and explains all, thus scotching Vera's plan as the newspaper owner threatens her with libel action. Having ...

title: Episode #2.6
desc: An unrecognizable burn victim turns up at the convalescent home claiming to be Mary's presumed drowned cousin Patrick, Carlisle plans to lure Carson from Downton, and Bates' wife reneges on her divorce agreement.

title: Episode #2.7
desc: Ethel confronts her baby's grandparents, Bates thinks he might have played a role in his wife's death, Branson and Sybil elope, and Carlyle tries to recruit Anna to spy on Mary.

title: Episode #2.8
desc: The Spanish Flu disrupts plans for Matthew's wedding when Cora, Lavinia, Carson, Molesley, and other staff members fall ill. Ethel has to decide the future for her son, and Jane resigns from Downton.

title: Christmas at Downton Abbey
desc: Christmas 1919. Downton Abbey is hosting a lavish Christmas party, yet despite being the season of goodwill, tensions are rife and Bates' arrest has cast a shadow over the festivities.

title: Episode #3.1
desc: Spring of 1920. Wedding guests descend on Downton Abbey, where disasters threaten. One of which is Cora's freewheeling American mother, who tries to loosen up her in-laws.

title: Episode #3.2
desc: A conflict between two members of the house staff escalates. Meanwhile, the family tries to impress Martha by planning a lavish dinner party.

title: Episode #3.3
desc: The fate of Downton Abbey hinges on a letter from a dead man. Edith and Sir Anthony face their own fateful moment. Mrs. Hughes confronts a crisis.

title: Episode #3.4
desc: August 1920: Two social revolutions arrive at Downton Abbey: the Irish civil war and the fight for women's suffrage. A mysterious conspiracy keeps Anna and Bates apart.

title: Episode #3.5
desc: The Crawleys excitedly await as the new addition to the family is soon to come. Meanwhile, Anna attempts to uncover evidence for Bates's innocence. But then, when tragedy strikes, will things ever be the same again?

title: Episode #3.6
desc: Things go badly amiss at Downton Abbey. Robert and Cora are not speaking. The servants are shunning Matthew's mother, Isobel. And Matthew and Robert have fallen out. Bates takes a gamble.

title: Episode #3.7
desc: A vindictive Ms. O'Brien hatches a damaging plot. Edith makes a major decision. Matthew devises a major plan for changing things, and Tom's brother pays a visit.

title: Episode #3.8
desc: Change arrives in a big way for several key characters at Downton Abbey. A yearly cricket match with the village sees old scores settled and new plots are hatched.

title: A Journey to the Highlands
desc: The Crawleys go to Duneagle Castle to celebrate Christmas with the MacClares. Everyone is delighted as they fish, hunt, and dine. Unfortunately, when the Crawleys return, tragedy strikes. Will things ever be the same again?

title: Episode #4.1
desc: Mary is still inconsolable six months after Matthew's death, Edith supports Michael going to Germany to divorce his wife, Molesley looks for a job, and there is a surprise applicant for Ms. O'Brien's job.

title: Episode #4.2
desc: An unofficial will from Matthew comes into the family's hand, Thomas plots against Anna, Rose gets involved in a scrap at a servant's dance, and Mrs. Crawley tries to reconcile Carson and Trigg.

title: Episode #4.3
desc: An extravagant house party at the Abbey gives the Crawleys a chance to reconnect with old friends, but some guests prove more welcome than others, and along with the celebrations come deceit and heartache.

title: Episode #4.4
desc: Anthony Gillingham returns to Downton to propose to Mary, Edna tries to coerce Tom into marrying her, and Anna will not tell Bates what's bothering her.

title: Episode #4.5
desc: Mrs. Hughes tells Bates an edited version of Anna's rape, Edith goes to London to see Michael, Alfred takes a culinary test, and the Countess suspects new employee Pegg of theft and Robert tries to keep a tenant.

title: Episode #4.6
desc: A birthday party is planned for Robert, but Rose's contribution to the event surprises those above and below stairs, a new farming venture on the Downton estate comes with dramatic repercussions for Mary, and Edith receives troubling news.

title: Episode #4.7
desc: Cora's playboy brother, Harold, is in trouble, so Robert must travel to America to help bail him out; a new farming venture at Downton sees Blake and Mary putting aside their differences.

title: Episode #4.8
desc: Rosamund comes up with a plan to help Edith, but Violet sees right through it; Isobel is the object of someone's attention, while Mary asks Gillingham for a very big favor.

title: The London Season
desc: Summer of 1923. It's summer and as part of Rose's 'coming out' she is to be presented at Buckingham Palace. The Crawley family go to London to prepare Grantham House for this busy social program.

title: Episode #5.1
desc: Tim Drewe guesses the parentage of Marigold, Mary receives another proposal from Tony, Violet plays matchmaker, Thomas continues to press Baxter for information with blackmail, and a flash fire threatens the mansion.

title: Episode #5.2
desc: James leaves Downton, Mary has a weekend rendezvous with Gillingham, Carson and the Earl disagree for the site of the War memorial, a wireless becomes part of Downton life, and Edith becomes Marigold's godmother.

title: Episode #5.3
desc: Mary wakes up in bed with Tony Gillingham after their tryst and returns to Downton, where she learns that a building firm want to buy land for a housing estate, to which Robert objects. Violet discovers from her butler Spratt about Mary and Tony but covers for her before summoning her for an explanation. Mary explains to her that she plans to marry Tony but later tells Tom the truth, that she has no intention. In return he confesses that he is considering a move to America. Following the policeman's visit, Anna is perturbed that her ordeal will be revealed, ...

title: Episode #5.4
desc: The Countess confesses her past with Prince Kuragin, Lord Merton proposes to Isobel, Rose's parents are divorcing, Lord Grantham becomes jealous of Simon, and Lady Mary tells Gillingham she won't marry him.

title: Episode #5.5
desc: Tom ends his relationship with Sarah, Rose meets a young man of Russian descent, Rosamund's visit to Marigold has consequences, Mrs. Patmore asks advice for her inheritance, and Simon Bricker expresses his love for Cora.

title: Episode #5.6
desc: Violet's new maid doesn't seem to be working out, Kuragin reveals he still loves Violet, Anna realizes Bates' innocence, and Thomas reveals a secret to Baxter.

title: Episode #5.7
desc: Atticus brings his parents, Edith and her daughter are brought home by Cora, Tom decides to take his daughter to America, Baxter volunteers to testify for Bates, and Isis is dying.

title: Episode #5.8
desc: Kuragin tells Violet he wants to live with her, someone tries to break up the Atticus Rose wedding, Daisy wants to live in London, and Anna is accused of Green's murder.

title: A Moorland Holiday
desc: Autumn of 1924. It's grouse shooting season and Rose's father-in-law invites the Crawley family to a shooting party in Northumberland.

title: Episode #6.1
desc: Lady Mary's past catches up with her when an unwelcome visitor delivers an ultimatum, and news about the running of Downton Hospital puts Violet on the warpath.

title: Episode #6.2
desc: What begins as a happy day out for the family and servants ends in panic and leaves Robert with a difficult decision to make.

title: Episode #6.3
desc: An old acquaintance comes to Edith's aid, while Mr Carson and Mrs Hughes' big day brings an unexpected arrival.

title: Episode #6.4
desc: Anna and Mary face a crisis and a figure from the past surprises those above and below stairs.

title: Episode #6.5
desc: Violet embroils the Minister of Health in the hospital row, but his visit ends in catastrophe. Mary's suspicions are aroused.

title: Episode #6.6
desc: Downton Abbey opens its doors to the public for charity, Barrow's actions are misconstrued, Mary and Henry's romance blossoms, and tensions between Cora and Violet reach a dramatic climax.

title: Episode #6.7
desc: The family face a shocking turn of events at Brooklands racetrack while Molesley and Daisy are put to the test.

title: Episode #6.8
desc: Romance blossoms but a betrayal of trust threatens the chance of lasting happiness. Thomas considers desperate measures.

title: Christmas Special
desc: Two-hour Christmas special and the series finale. Mary endeavors to build bridges with her sister while Edith's secret continues to pose a threat. As Henry settles into the role of husband and stepfather, finding his place at Downton proves more difficult.

title: The Empty House
desc: Believed dead after his fatal encounter with Professor Moriarity three years earlier, Sherlock Holmes returns to England to foil a plot to murder him by a former Moriarity gang member.

title: The Priory School
desc: The headmaster of a prestigious prep school calls on Holmes for help when the ten year old only son of powerful but publicity-shy duke disappears.

title: The Second Stain
desc: Holmes is asked by the country's Prime Minister to aid in the recovery of a stolen diplomatic letter, which, if published, might lead England into war.

title: The Musgrave Ritual
desc: An obscure family document containing an enigmatic ritual holds the key to a hidden treasure if Holmes can decipher the mystery.

title: The Abbey Grange
desc: Holmes is called to a manor house to investigate the brutal murder of a country lord with a fireplace poker and reconcile the story of his bruised and battered wife with the facts.

title: The Man with the Twisted Lip
desc: Responding to a grieving wife, Holmes investigates the apparent murder of her husband in an apartment above an opium den.

title: The Six Napoleons
desc: Inspector Lastrade reveals to Holmes that someone has been inexplicably breaking into homes for the senseless purpose of breaking small busts of Napoleon.

title: The Devil's Foot
desc: While convalescing in Cornwall, a depressive Holmes investigates the apparent death from apoplexy of a local woman and the unexplained sudden dementia of her two brothers.

title: Silver Blaze
desc: Holmes investigates the disappearance of a champion racehorse and the murder of its trainer on a lonely moor.

title: Wisteria Lodge
desc: A bored Holmes eagerly accepts a case involving the disappearance of an amateur Spanish cartographer as well as his servants from his rented country lodge.

title: The Bruce Partington Plans
desc: Sherlock's brother Mycroft enlists his younger sibling to locate missing patent plans that pertain to a strategically critical state-of-the-art submarine.

title: Introduction of Kuru Family, Raja Bharat and Raja Shantanu
desc: It is an introduction of King Bharata, founder of Bharata race of lunar dynasty. He sows the seed of democratic thinking. Later is story of his successor King Shantanu.

title: Ganga Kills Her Sons
desc: Shantanu breaks his vow. Ganga explains her act.

title: Bhishma Is Grown-up
desc: Devavrat is crowned as Yuvraj, heir apparent to King Shantanu. But, to enable his father's remarriage to a village girl, Devavrat vows to remain unmarried for the rest of his life and renounces his rights to the throne.

title: Bhisma Pratigya/Iccha Mrityu Vardaan
desc: Bhisma gets the Iccha Mrityu Vardaan. With all these sacrifices for Shantanu, do he gets peace.

title: Amba, Ambika and Ambalika's Introduction
desc: Bhisma action for restoring the image of Hastinapur will lead to his death.

title: Birth of Pandu, Dhritarashtra and Vidur
desc: Rishi Vyas is introduced and is the father of Pandu, Dhritarashtra and Vidhur. These are imparted knowledge and training by Bhisma and a new king of Hastinapur is selected.

title: Karna's Birth-story, Dhritarashtra and Gandhari Get Married and Pandu and Kunti Get Married
desc: This is the story of Karna's birth. Marriage Dhritarashtra and Gandhari; and Pandu and Kunti. Introduction of an important character Shakuni.

title: Madri is gifted to Pandu, Pandu is resting and Sage Kindama's curse on Pandu
desc: Pandu establishes the supremacy of the Kuru House. During his campaigns he takes another wife, Madri. After the campaigns, Pandu goes to the forest for relaxation with his two queens Kunti and Madri.

title: Dhritarashtra is king his sanyas and Kansa is king and Akashwani about Krishna
desc: While hunting, Pandu accidentally kills a Sage. To do penance Pandu decides to spend his life in exile and entrusts Kingdom to Dhritarastra. In time five children are born to Kunti and Madri. Dhritarastra had a hundred sons from Gandhari.

title: Birth of Balarama and Five Pandavas
desc: In Mathura, King Kans dethrones his father and takes over. He arranges his sister Devki's marriage with his influential friend Vasudev. But when a Sage predicts Kans' death, he imprisons Devki and Vasudev.

title: Krishna Janma
desc: Kans personally kills Devki's first six children. Devki's seventh "pregnancy" is taken over by Vasudev's second wife, giving birth to Balram. During eighth child, Vasudev is able to smuggle out the child.

title: Pootna's Death
desc: Gokul is in a festive mood to celebrate the birth of Krishna, unaware of the fact that King Kans has assigned Demon Pootna to kill all the newborns.

title: Krishna brahmand darshan and Krishna gets caught while stealing makhan
desc: While Yashoda happily reared Shri Krishna in Nandgaon, his real mother Devki, and his father Vasudev spent days inside the prison in Mathura.

title: Maiya Mori Mai nahi makhan khayo and Kaliya Nag Tandav
desc: Krishna enjoys his times in Nandgaon, showing his divine power time to time.

title: Radha and Gopikas, protest against Mathura, Devakasur and Trulambasur Vadh
desc: Krishna grows up to an 11-year-old boy. Now he has given up stealing butter; instead he steals the hearts of the young "Gopinis". Radha is one such "Gopini" who has lost her heart to him.

title: Kansa invites Krishna to Mathura
desc: Kansa came to know about the true identity of Krishna, and invited him to Mathura by faking his repentance.

title: Kansa vadh
desc: Krishna departs for Mathura. The residents of Mathura have heard of his divine powers and they pay obeisance. Eventually Krishna faces his uncle, Kans.

title: Pandu's Death
desc: Shri Krishna releases King Ugrasen and his parents Devki and Vasudev who had been imprisoned by Kans. Pandu dies in the forest and Kunti returns to Hastinapur with her children.

title: Satyavati, Ambika, Ambalika take sanyas with Rishi Vyas
desc: Before leaving for Tapovan, Satyavati tells Dhritarashtra to look after the Pandavas. Kauravas and the Pandavas grow up together. Shakuni instigates Duryodhan against the Pandavas and rivalry develops between the Kauravas and Pandavas.

title: Duryodhan Poisons Bhim and Bhim Gets Strength of 1000 Elephants
desc: Rivalry between Duryodhan and Bheem develops. Duryodhan plots to poison Bheem.

title: Sudama's chivda and Dron arrives to Hastinapur
desc: Kunti forbids Bheem from saying anything about Duryodhan's attempt to kill him. Vidur suspects something and goes to see Bheeshma. Dronacharya is introduced as one of the teachers of Kuru princes.

title: Ekalavya, Karna's Education, Arjun's Test of Bird's Eye
desc: Drona trains the Kuru princes in the art of 'Gada Yudh' (Mace fighting). Bheem and Duryodhan specialize in it and exhibit their skills. Drona is specially delighted by Arjun's prowess and he loves him even more than his own son.

title: Shastra Pooja, Drona insults Karna and Arjun's Test
desc: Dronacharya trains princes in the art of archery and other military skills. Arjun gets poised by his teacher, Duryodhan is often advised to control his arrogance. Shakuni rebukes Gandhari for not seeing through the plots of the Pandavas.

title: All grown up, prince is to be nominated and everyone exhibit their skills in Rangbhoomi, Karna challenges Arjun and Duryodhan gives Anga desh to Karna
desc: A special stadium is built to exhibit the feats of the Kuru princes in front of spectators. Members of the royal household are invited.

title: Drona's guru dakshina to capture Dhrupad
desc: Drona asks for his gurudakshina in the form of captured King Drupad. Pursuram arrives at the Gurukul and gives Shri Krishna his Sudarshan Chakra. He asks Shri Krishna to lay the foundation of a New Yuga (New Era).

title: Krishna gets Sudarshan chakra from Parshuram, defeats Jarasandh and orders building Dwarika
desc: Krishna advises the King of Mathura, to shift his capital from Mathura to Dwarka. The Heir to the throne of Hastinapur is to be chosen and Duryodhan is staking his claim while Drona, Vidur and the people of Hastinapur favor Yudhishthir.

title: Yudhishthir Is Crowned as Prince. Rukmini Is Being Forced to Marry Shishupal
desc: The court meets to name the Heir Apparent to the throne of Hastinapur. Jarasandh asks Bheeshmak to invite Shishupal, the Chedi King, to marry his daughter Rukmani and make Shishupal his ally.

title: Krishna Kidnaps Rukmini
desc: Shri Krishna has received a letter from Rukmani asking him to take her away from Vidarbha before she is married to Shishupal. Krishna goes to Vidarbha.

title: Lakshagraha Is Built in Varnavar by Purochan
desc: Duryodhan asks Dhritrashtra to send the Pandav brothers to Varnavat to attend a festival. He threatens to commit suicide if Pandav brothers are not sent to Varnavat.

title: Tunneling in Varnavat Begins
desc: The Pandavs are suspicious of Duryodhan's eagerness to send Yudhishthir to Varnavat; so they accompany him to Varnavat. Vidur learns that Duryodhan's spies had been collecting wax, oil and other flammable materials in the recent past.

title: Hidimb Vadh and Bhima's marriage
desc: After escaping from the tragedy, the Pandavas arrive in a forest and rest. Bheem and Arjun want to confront the Kauravas, but Kunti and Yudhishthir decide against it.

title: Escape from Lakshagraha
desc: Only three days are left for the house of wax to go up in flames and for Kunti and her five sons to burn to death. Vidur informs Pandas of the evil plan and sends them a miner who helps them dig a tunnel to escape.

title: Dristadyumna & Draupadi Birth and Draupadi Swayamvar
desc: Drupad organizes a grand swayamvar for Draupadi and invites all the princes and brahmins.

title: Bakasur Vadh
desc: The Pandavas stay in the city of Ekchakra in the guise of Brahmins. Kunti and Pandavas learn of a cruel and terribly strong rakshasa named Bakasur who was harassing the people.

title: Arjun Wins Draupadi and Later She Became the Wives of 5 Pandavas
desc: Without pause or hesitation, Arjun shoots his arrow into the target and wins Draupadi's hand in marriage. Kunti unknowingly asks the five Pandava brothers to share the bride prize.

title: Pandavas Leave from Panchal to Hastinapur
desc: Duryodhan and Shakuni are furious when they learn that the Pandava brothers are alive and that King Dhritrashtra has sent Vidur to call them back to Hastinapur.

title: Pandavas Arrives at Hastinapur and Kingdom Is Divided
desc: The Pandavs return to Hastinapur. Determined to establish peace between the Kauravas and the Pandavas, Bheeshma suggests giving half the Kingdom to Yudhishthir.

title: Pandav Get Khandavprastha
desc: The decision to partition the Kingdom of Hastinapur between the Kauravas and Padavas is not liked by the Pandavas, but Krishna consoles them and tells them that Khandavprastha is their Karambhoomi (field of action).

title: Coronation of Yudhirsthir, Khandavprastha Becomes Indraprastha
desc: Ydhishthir knew that the land he was to rule was a barren wasteland, but accepted this injustice because he wanted peace. The Pandavas reach Khandavprastha, and with the help of Krishna and Balram, they renovate the ruined city.

title: Arjun runs away with Subhadra
desc: To avoid rivalry among pandavas, they had come to a decision to have Draupadi divide her time equally between the five brothers. Once while helping a Brahmin, Arjun had to violate the rule and had to go on a pilgrimage.

title: Arjun Weds Subhadra. Arjun Gets Devdatta Conch and Gandiv and Bhim Gets His Gada
desc: Arjun and Subhadra arrive in Dwarika and are formally married. Arjun, Bheem and Sri Krishna eventually go to Magadh and challenge Jarasandh for a combat. Jarasandh chooses to fight with Bheem.

title: Jarasandh Vadh, Rajsuya Yagnya begins, Shishupals Story
desc: Bheem and Jarasandh were so equally matched in strength that they fought for nearly fourteen days without rest.

title: Rajsuya Yagya, Shishupal Vadh
desc: The first honor of Rajsuya Yagna is rendered to Sri Krishna. Shishupal asks, "When there are so many kings gathered in this assembly, why should the first honor be paid to Krishna - a cowherd boy and the son of a servant of Ugrasena?"

title: Vyas Predicts War, Draupadi Laughs at Duryodhan
desc: Duryodhan walks around Yudhishthir's 'Maya Mahal" and falls into one of the pools. Draupadi calls him the "blind son of a blind father." Duryodhan, Kama and Shakuni plan to avenge Draupadi for her taunting remarks.

title: Pandavas Go to Hastinapur to Gamble
desc: Dhritarashtra orders Vidur to go to Indraprastha and to invite Yudhishthir to Hastinapur to play dice with Duryodhan. The Pandavs arrive in Hastinapur and pay their respects to the King.

title: Yudhirshthir Loses Everything in the Gamble
desc: Duryodhan suggests that Shakuni cast the dice for him. Yudhishthir loses his entire Kingdom, his brothers, himself and Draupadi.

title: Vastraharan of Draupadi
desc: Duryodhan asks his brother Dushasan to bring Draupadi to the assembly hall. Dushasan drags Draupadi to the hall and tries to disrobe her but a miracle occurs.

title: Pandavas Get Back Everything
desc: Gandhari warns Dhritarashtra that the attempt to disrobe Draupadi would cause the destruction of his lineage. Dhritarashtra gives everything back to the Pandavs.

title: Re-match of Dyut
desc: Duryodhan threatens to wage war against the Pandavs. When Dhritrashtra forbids him from war, Duryodhan secures Dhritrashtra's approval to entice Yudhishthir to another game of dice.

title: Vanvas Begins
desc: The departure of the Pandavs upsets Bheeshma, Vidur, Drona and the other elders of the Royal House of Kurus. Vidur advises Dhritrashtra to summon them back. Dhritrashtra rebukes Vidur, so Vidur leaves.

title: Gandharvas Catch Duryodhan
desc: Gandharvas attack and capture Duryodhan when he teases their princess, but Bhim and Arjun come to aid.

title: Arjun Worships Lord Indra and Lord Shiva for Divyastra and Gets Pashupatastra
desc: After hearing about the Pandav's exile, Krishna goes to visit them. He advises the Pandavs to prepare for war and tells Arjun to do penance to obtain divine weapons.

title: Krishna's story of one grain of rice, Bhim meets Ghatotkach and Hanuman, Arjun learns dance from Chitrasen
desc: Duruvasa and his followers visit Pandavs. Draupadi is worried as her cooking vessel is empty. In Indralok, Lord Indra advises Arjun to learn dance and music from Chitrasen to help him during his 13th year when incognito.

title: Arjun gets curse of impotency from Urvashi, Abhimanyus as a kid, Jayadraths head is shaved
desc: In Indralok, Lord Indra limits Urvashi's curse on Arjun to one year during which he becomes an eunuch.Arjun returns from Indralok armed with divine weapons. He accompanies Bheem while they rescue Draupadi from Jayadrath.

title: Story of Poisoned Water and Yaksha, Abhimanyu Is Grown-up
desc: Jayadrath, Duryodhan's brother-in-law, does penance for kidnapping Draupadi and is rewarded by Lord Shiva. In the forest, the Pandavas plan their 13th year of exile to live incognito and to work in another kingdom.

title: Agyatvas in Matsya Desh
desc: Pandavas live incognito and serve King Virat. Yudhishthir becomes Kanak, a courtier. Bheem becomes cook. Nakul and Sahadev look after cattle and horses. Arjun becomes Brihannala, an eunuch. Draupadi becomes Sairandhri, handmaiden to Queen.

title: Karna's curse, Draupadi as Maid Sairandhri rejects Keechak
desc: Karna has assumed the guise of a brahmin and has come a disciple of Parushram. In Virat, Queen Sudeshna's brother Keechak professes his love for Draupadi.

title: Keechak Vadh by Bheema
desc: Keechak is mad with lust for Draupadi. Draupadi runs to the Virat court, where Keechak angrily kicks her in the presence of Yudhishthir and Bheem. Draupadi reports the matter to Queen Sudeshna and asks Bheem for protection and revenge.

title: Kaurav Attack Matsya Desh
desc: The news of Keechak's death reaches Duryodhan. He suspects that Bheem is responsible and decides to invade Virat. King Susarma of Trigarta also invades Virat.

title: Viraat yudh and clothes for Uttara's dolls
desc: Duryodhan and Karna advance into battle. Arjun attacks the Kaurav army and the Kaurav warriors fall unconscious due to his magical weapons. News arrives from the battlefield and King Virat Virat boasts about the glory of his son Uttar.

title: Abhimanyu's Marriage and Pandavs Decide to Send a Doot to Hastinapur
desc: After the wedding of Abhimanyu and Uttara, Krishna, the Pandavas, Virat and others meet in Virat's assembly. They decide to send an emissary to Hastinapur to seek the restoration of Indraprastha.

title: Dhritarashtra Does Not Agree and Sends Sanjay
desc: Vidur advises Dhritrashtra to return Indraprastha to the Pandavas. Dhritrashtra refuses to accept the advice. He sends his charioteer Sanjay with a message to Yudhishthir, telling the Pandavs they should spend 12 more years in exile.

title: Duryodhan gets Narayani Sena from Krishna
desc: In Hastinapur, everyone is nervous when Sanjay returns from meeting with Yudhishthir and his allies.Duryodhan remains adamant about going to war. Shakuni advises Duryodhan to seek Krishna's help.

title: Krishna took Virat Avtar and Indra takes Karna's kawach kundala
desc: Krishna goes to the court of Hastinapur and suggests peace between Pandavas and Kauravas.But Duryodhan insists that the Pandavas must return to the forest. Duryodhan finds the suggestion unacceptable and threatens to seize Krishna.

title: Krishna Goes to Hastinapur as Shanti Doot
desc: A war between the Kauravas and the Pandavas looks inevitable but Krishna makes a last attempt for peace. Krishna arrives in Hastinapur.

title: Karn's Identity Is Disclosed
desc: Krishna's peace mission has failed. Before leaving for Uapplavya, Krishna meets with Karna and tells him to be true to Dharma and not to support sinful Duryodhan.

title: Vidur Resigns As A Prime Minister, Kunti Meets Karn
desc: Vidur submits his resignation to Dhritrashtra.Kunti worries about the battle to be fought between her sons, Karna and the Pandav brothers. She visits Karna and tells him the truth about his birth.

title: Sanjay Gets Divya Drishti, Uluk Goes To Pandavs
desc: The stage is set for the Kurukshetra war. Yudhishthir holds a meeting and appoints Dhristadymna as Supreme Commandar of the Pandav army. Vyas visits Dhritrashtra and offers to bestow divine eyesight unto him.

title: Shikhandi's Story
desc: Shikhandi, who was Amba in a previous life, is anxious for the Kurukshetra war because he wants to fight Bheeshma. Amba swore to take revenge on Bheeshma, so she was reborn as Shikhandi, the elder brother of Draupadi.

title: Duryodhan Tricks Shalya To Join Kauravs
desc: All the warriors except Balaram and Rukhmi (Rukmani's brother) move towards the battlefield. Balaram remains neutral and both parties deny Rukhmi's help. Duryodhan tricks Salya into joining the Kaurava army.

title: Arjun Worships Devi Durga, Rules Of War Laid
desc: Krishna tells Arjun to seek Goddess Durga's blessings for winning the war. Arjun prays to the Goddess. Krishna drives Arjun to the middle of the battlefield in his chariot.

title: Kurukshetra War Begins And Arjun Drops His Weapons, Geeta Saar Begins
desc: Arjun refuses to fight and kill his relatives and friends. Krishna advises Arjun to be strong. Krishna's teaching to Arjun at the battlefield form the basis of the "Bhagawad Gita" (the Song of God).

title: Geeta Saar Continues
desc: On the battlefield, Krishna continues to talk to Arjun about the importance of following duty. He emphasizes the importance of selfless action without the desire to seek a reward for it.

title: Geeta Saar Continues And Krishna Shows His Maha Avtar
desc: Unable to satisfy Arjun's hopeless conscience, Krishna grants divine eyesight to Arjun and stuns him with his "Viraat Roop" (divine manifestation).

title: Yudhishthir Gets Blessings, Yuyutsu Changes Side And War Begins, Abhimanyu Faces Bhishma
desc: After being blessed by the elders, Yudhisthir goes to the middle of the battlefield and announces that anyone who wants to change sides must do so now.

title: Uttar Dies, Arjun Faces Bhishma And Day 2 Begins
desc: During the afternoon of the first day of battle, Abhimanyu attacks grandsire Bheeshma and brings down his chariot's flag.As the battle continues, Drona brings down Shristamyumna's flag and Salya slays Uttar, the prince of Virat.

title: Arjun Is Unstoppable, 3rd Day Is Over, 4th Day Begins, Bheem Is Surrounded, 10 Kauravs Are Killed, Krishna Takes Out His Sudarshan
desc: The Pandava army had fared poorly during the first day of battle. Dhrishtadyumna, the commander-in-chief of the Pandavas, devises strategies to avoid a repetition of the first day.

title: 9th Day Is Over And 16 Kauravs Are Dead, Bhishma Tells Arjun How To Take Him Out Of The War
desc: Bheeshma tells Pandavas that only a woman could bring his death for he would not raise his hand against a woman. The Pandavas decided to use Shikhandi in their fight against Bheeshma.

title: Bhishma Lies On The Bed Of Arrows, Karn Meets Bhishma
desc: On the tenth day of battle, Arjun positions Shikhandi in front of him and attacks Bheeshma. As Arjun's arrows pierce his body, Bheeshma smiles.

title: Day 11, Dronacharya Tries To Capture Yudhishthir But Is Unsuccessful, Shantanu Comes To Bhishma
desc: The Kaurav warriors sit in council and decide to have Drona capture Yudhisthir alive. Drona agrees to the plan after Duryodhan promises that Yudhisthir would not be sentenced to death after he is captured.

title: Abhimanyu Vadh
desc: Yudhisthir learns about Drona's plan to arrange the Kaurav forces in the Chakra-Vyuha. Unfortunately, Yudhistir cannot depend on Arjun for Susarama has lured him away from the battlefield, but Arjun's son, Abhimanyu, offers his assistance.

title: Arjun Vows To Kill Jaydrath And Story About Jaydraths Curse
desc: Arjun kills Susarma the Trigartha Chief and returns to the Pandava camp. He learns about Abhimanyu's death and discovers that Jayadhrath was the main cause of his son's death. Arjun vows to kill Jayadhrath before sunset the next day.

title: Arjun Breaks Kamalvyuh To Get To Jaydrath
desc: On the battlefield Arjun tells Krishna to take his chariot to Jayadhrath. "There is a wall of Kaurav army between you and Jayadhrath," says Krishna. "I have to break that wall to complete my oath," declares Arjun.

title: Ghatotkach Dies
desc: Bheem and Hidimba's mighty son, Ghatotkach, joins the Pandvas in the battle. Duryodhan realizes that Ghatotkach must be destroyed and encourages Karna to use his "Shakti" (divine weapon).

title: Jaydrath Vadh
desc: Arjun vows to kill Jayadhrath before sunset to avenge the death of his son Abhimanyu. If he is unable to kill Jayadhrath before sunset, Arjun swears he will burn himself to death.

title: Dushasan Dies And Karn Fights With Arjun, Krishna Puts The Rath In The Land So That Arjun Is Saved
desc: On the battlefield, Dushashan attacks Bheem with his arrows. Bheem remembers what Dushashan had done to Draupadi and the anger blazes within him. Bheem jumps from his chariot and attacks Dushashan.

title: Dronacharya Dies
desc: Drona spreads fear and destruction in the Pandava army. "If he were to hear that his son, Ashwathama is dead, he would lose interest in life and throw down his weapons", says Krishna.

title: Shakuni Dies, Yudhishthir Curses All Woman Kind And Duryodhan Becomes Iron Bodied
desc: Kunti visits the battlefield in the middle of the night to grieve over the dead body of her son Karna. Yudhisthir finds her and learns that Karna was his brother.

title: Karn's Curse, Karn Dies
desc: As the sun rises in the sky the battle between Karna and Arjun begins.

title: Balram Arrives, Bheem Duryodhan Gada Yudh
desc: The battle between Bheem and Duryodhan begins. The warriors appear equal in strength and skill, but Krishna informs Bheem that Duryodhan could be defeated if he smashes Duryodhan's thighs.

title: Duryodhan Dies, Ashwatthama, Krip And Kritvarma Remain, Parikshit's Story
desc: Duryodhan commands Ashwathama,new commander-in-chief, to kill the Pandavas. Ashwathama, Kripacharya and Krit Verma arrive at the Pandava camp in the middle of the night as Dhristdyumna and Draupadi's five sons are sleeping.

title: Yudhishthir Becomes Samrat Of Hastinapur, Bhishma Dies
desc: After the mourning period is over, Krishna leads Yudhishthir to the throne.After the affairs of the state are in order, Krishna takes the Pandava brothers to Bheeshma.

title: Dhritarashtra Tries To Kill Bheem
desc: The Kurukshetra war has ended. The Pandavas visit Dhritrashtra who coldly embraces Yudhishthira. Dhritarashtra then moves forward to embrace Bheem, but Krishna tells Bheem to put an iron statue in his place.

title: Wolferton Splash
desc: A young Princess Elizabeth marries Prince Philip. As King George VI's health worsens, Winston Churchill becomes Prime Minister for the second time.

title: Hyde Park Corner
desc: With King George too ill to travel, Elizabeth and Phillip embark on a four-continent Commonwealth tour. Party leaders attempt to undermine Churchill.

title: Windsor
desc: With Elizabeth in a new role, Phillip tries to assert some power. Churchill wants to delay the coronation. King George's disgraced brother arrives.

title: Act of God
desc: When dense fog cripples London for days and creates a serious health hazard, Churchill's inaction leaves him vulnerable to his political enemies.

title: Smoke and Mirrors
desc: Elizabeth rejects protocol by appointing Phillip to coordinate her coronation, but his ideas create conflict. The Duke of Windsor returns to London.

title: Gelignite
desc: Margaret and Peter come to Elizabeth with a request. With a royal scandal about to break in the newspapers, the Queen Mother intervenes.

title: Scientia Potentia Est
desc: As the Soviets test the H-bomb, both Churchill and Eden have major health crises. Angry about her inadequate education, Elizabeth hires a tutor.

title: Pride & Joy
desc: Elizabeth and Phillip go on an exhausting world journey. Margaret takes over some of her sister's official duties and tries to liven things up.

title: Assassins
desc: As tensions with Phillip increase, Elizabeth spends time with her old friend Porchey. Churchill's portrait is painted for his 80th birthday.

title: Gloriana
desc: Margaret and Peter are reunited, but another obstacle stands in their way. Elizabeth is torn between her duty as Queen and her love for her sister.

title: Misadventure
desc: As Philip leaves for a long tour, Elizabeth makes an upsetting discovery. Prime Minister Eden wants to strike back after Egypt seizes the Suez Canal.

title: A Company of Men
desc: Elizabeth feels disconnected from Philip. Eden copes with international pressure and ill health. An interview stirs up harrowing memories for Philip.

title: Lisbon
desc: Palace insiders try to prevent a scandal that could reflect poorly on Philip. Eden faces censure from his cabinet and the press.

title: Beryl
desc: When Elizabeth and Philip throw a grand party for their 10th anniversary, both Margaret and the new Prime Minister experience romantic tribulations.

title: Marionettes
desc: After Elizabeth makes a tone-deaf speech at a Jaguar factory, she and the monarchy come under public attack by an outspoken lord.

title: Vergangenheit
desc: A secret World War II document opens Elizabeth's eyes to grim realities about a family member. The Duke of Windsor campaigns to re-enter public life.

title: Matrimonium
desc: A letter from Peter Townsend spurs Margaret to make a bold proposal. Elizabeth has good news that causes complications for Margaret.

title: Dear Mrs. Kennedy
desc: Inspired by Jackie Kennedy and against her government's wishes, Elizabeth takes an unconventional approach to resolving an issue in Ghana.

title: Paterfamilias
desc: Philip insists that Prince Charles attend his alma mater in Scotland and reminisces about the life-changing difficulties he experienced there.

title: Mystery Man
desc: A salacious government scandal hits close to home for Elizabeth and Philip. Elizabeth retreats to Scotland for the rest of a difficult pregnancy.

title: Olding
desc: The royal family mourns the passing of Winston Churchill. The United Kingdom ushers in a new prime minister, the Labour Party's Harold Wilson whom Prince Philip and Queen Elizabeth hear might be a Soviet spy.

title: Margaretology
desc: While Princess Margaret and Lord Snowdon visit the USA, the queen, at the bidding of Harold Wilson, asks them to make a side trip to Washington, D.C. to ask President Johnson for financial assistance for the United Kingdom.

title: Aberfan
desc: A horrible disaster in the Welsh town of Aberfan leaves scores of children dead, but when the Queen takes a week to decide to visit the town to offer solace to its people, she must confront her reasons for postponing the trip.

title: Bubbikins
desc: Left without a home by a political coup in Athens, Philip's eccentric mother, Princess Alice of Greece, is invited to live in Buckingham Palace by the Queen.

title: Coup
desc: While the Queen travels abroad to learn about horse training, unhappiness among the British elite with the devaluation of the pound involves Lord Mountbatten in a plan to oust Harold Wilson.

title: Tywysog Cymru
desc: Prince Charles is sent to Aberystwyth to learn Welsh from an ardent nationalist in preparation for the ceremony for his investiture as Prince of Wales.

title: Moondust
desc: The 1969 moon landing occasions a mid-life crisis in Prince Philip, who thinks of the adventures he has missed as the Queen's consort.

title: Dangling Man
desc: Charles visits the exiled Duke of Windsor in his Paris chateau, only to find him very ill. But will the Queen make peace with her uncle before he dies?

title: Imbroglio
desc: While Princess Anne dates her elder brother's polo rival Andrew Parker Bowles, Prince Charles falls deeply in love with Camilla Shand causing the Queen Mother and Lord Mountbatten to interfere.

title: Cri de Coeur
desc: As her marriage falls apart, Princess Margaret finds solace in the arms of a much younger landscape gardener. The Queen and the nation celebrate Elizabeth II's Silver Jubilee.

title: Gold Stick
desc: As Elizabeth welcomes Britain's first woman prime minister and Charles meets a young Diana Spencer, an IRA attack brings tragedy to the royal family.

title: The Balmoral Test
desc: Margaret Thatcher visits Balmoral but has trouble fitting in with the royal family, while Charles finds himself torn between his heart and family duty.

title: Fairytale
desc: After Charles proposes, Diana moves into Buckingham Palace and finds her life filled with princess training, loneliness and Camilla Parker Bowles.

title: Favourites
desc: While Margaret Thatcher struggles with the disappearance of her favorite child, Elizabeth reexamines her relationships with her four children.

title: Fagan
desc: As Thatcher's policies create rising unemployment, a desperate man breaks into the palace, where he finds Elizabeth's bedroom and awakens her for a talk.

title: Terra Nullius
desc: On a tour of Australia, Diana struggles to balance motherhood with her royal duties while both she and Charles cope with their marriage difficulties.

title: The Hereditary Principle
desc: Grappling with mental health issues, Margaret seeks help and discovers an appalling secret about estranged relatives of the royal family.
As many nations condemn apartheid in South Africa, tensions mounts between Thatcher and Elizabeth about their clashing opinions on applying sanctions.

title: Avalanche
desc: Charles is caught in a deadly avalanche, prompting both him and Diana to reevaluate their commitment to their troubled marriage.

title: War
desc: Amid a growing challenge to her power, Thatcher fights for her position. Charles grows more determined to separate from Diana as their marriage unravels.

title: UPSC - Optional Me Kya Hai?
desc: Abhilash has stepped into the world of Old Rajinder Nagar to prepare for the UPSC exams. His choices become difficult as it is his last attempt and he is considering changing the optional subject.

title: Teacher Sahi Hona Chahiye
desc: Abhilash is worried about his General Studies Exam. Dissatisfied with his mentor, he decides to quit his coaching institute.

title: Positive Approach Rakh Yaar
desc: Taunted for his 'negative approach', Abhilash switches to studying at the library. Things turn 'positive' when Dhairya enters his life.

title: Plan B Kya Hai?
desc: Abhilash realizes that no matter how determined he is, it's really tough to crack UPSC and he can't be overly optimistic with his dream of becoming an IAS officer. He realizes that he needs a Plan B.

title: Pre... Mains Aur Life
desc: IAS Abhilash Sharma is struggling when the past meets the present. Things take a turn when a mentor from the past, returns as a friend.

title: Pilot
desc: While Dutch and Claudette investigate the murder of Nancy Reborg, they discover that her daughter is missing and has been sold by her addict father to a child molester. David tries to crack corruption in the Barn by recruiting Terry to help him take down Vic.

title: Our Gang
desc: Following the shooting death of a police department informant, Aceveda turns up the heat in the investigation of Mackey and his Strike Team.

title: The Spread
desc: It's warrant sweep day at the Barn. Vic and the Strike Team discover visiting NBA superstar Derrick Tripp hanging out with his "homies" before the evening game with the Lakers. Vic decides to do his part for the home team by keeping Tripp as a "friendly hostage". One of Vic's street informants, Connie, approaches him after having been roughed up by a new john. Vic hands off the case to Claudette and Dutch, who is convinced they're on the trail of a serial killer. Dutch's theories are proved wrong when he and Claudette ultimately discover that their perp is not a ...

title: Dawg Days
desc: A dispute over an up-and-coming singer's success erupts in a gang war that threatens to bring Vic down, too; a case that could help Aceveda's political future sends Dutch and Claudette searching for a missing day laborer.

title: Blowback
desc: Mackey must recover the stolen evidence from a drug bust before Aceveda is able to pin the theft on him.

title: Cherrypoppers
desc: As Dutch's theory about a serial killer preying on prostitutes proves true, he convinces Aceveda to launch an all out effort to find him before he strikes again; Julien decides to bring down Vic for stealing drugs.

title: Pay in Pain
desc: The murder of seven gang members has Vic be teamed with a Latino detective assigned to crack the case.

title: Cupid & Psycho
desc: As the Strike Team is reassigned pending the investigation in the theft of evidence, Vic teams with Claudette in order to keep some deadly drugs off the street.

title: Throwaway
desc: Lemonhead sets out to make things right following his shooting of an unarmed man.

title: Dragonchasers
desc: As Dutch uncovers a lead to the serial killer, a reporter questions force Aceveda to explain problems he thought were buried far in the past.

title: Carnivores
desc: A confrontation between a local drug dealer and Black Muslims places Vic in danger of being exposed.

title: Two Days of Blood
desc: As a deployment policy leads to a double homicide that places Aceveda in the hot seat with potential voters, Vic is forced to help Gilroy avoid being implicated in a hit and run.

title: Circles
desc: As cop killings strike Farmington, Aceveda is caught between two corrupt cops looking to save their own skins.

title: The Quick Fix
desc: As Captain Aceveda tries to fend off a city council investigation, Vic looks to stop a pair of brutal drug lords from moving into Farmington.

title: Dead Soldiers
desc: An arson attack on a local drug dealer threatens to expose Vic's protection racket.

title: Partners
desc: An amputated arm sends Dutch in search of a sadomasochistic killer; Vic sets out to help his old mentor on the force get revenge against the thug whose complaint forced him into retirement.

title: Carte Blanche
desc: A murder investigation leads Vic to a massive money-laundering scheme.

title: Greenlit
desc: Elementary school drug dealing prompts Vic to redouble his efforts to bring down a ruthless new supplier.

title: Homewrecker
desc: The Barn mobilizes to investigate a murderous rampage at a battered women's shelter.

title: Barnstormers
desc: As a new murder investigation exposes Dutch's crisis of confidence, Vic sets out to stop the abuse of a neighbor by her violent boyfriend.

title: Scar Tissue
desc: Vic and the Strike team set their sights on taking Armadillo off the streets for good.

title: Co-Pilot
desc: In a look back at the Barn's early days, Vic struggles to secure his hold on the Strike Team command, while Dutch is faced with choosing between a veteran detective and Claudette.

title: Coyotes
desc: The leak of the auditor's report jeopardizes the futures of everyone at the Farm.

title: Inferno
desc: Vic mobilizes the Strike Team to help Aceveda's election campaign; Dutch and Claudette suspect a teenaged girl is lying about the rape accusation she's made against her employer.

title: Breakpoint
desc: As his own life starts crumbling around him, Vic pitches in to help Dutch in the search for a deadly pedophile.

title: Dominoes Falling
desc: As he struggles to keep his job, Vic pushes ahead with a new plan to hijack a mob money shipment.

title: Playing Tight
desc: Vic sets out to stop stolen military weapons from fueling a gang war, unaware that it threatens to expose him as the mastermind behind the theft of the Armenian mob's laundered money.

title: Blood and Water
desc: Vic promises a gang lieutenant the top job if he agrees to set up his boss; Dutch and Claudette's investigation into a gang shooting points to an unexpected triggerman.

title: Bottom Bitch
desc: A hooker wants to Vic to punish her former pimp, Dutch arrests a sex offender in an elderly woman's rape.

title: Streaks and Tips
desc: The rivalry between the Strike Team and the Decoy Squad heats up as they compete to find a murder suspect.

title: Mum
desc: As Dutch and Claudette continue to pursue a rapist who is targeting elderly women, the arrest of a local gang member threatens to expose the Strike Team's involvement in the money train heist.

title: Posse Up
desc: Officer Tommy Hisk becomes a prime suspect in the murder of his ex-wife and son.

title: Safe
desc: As missing persons investigation uncovers a graveyard for illegal immigrants working in an illicit drug lab.

title: Cracking Ice
desc: Vic is enlisted to help save his rivals on the Decoy team from having their undercover operation exposed.

title: Slipknot
desc: A lynching threatens to ignite a race war between Farmington's black and Latino gangs.

title: What Power Is...
desc: Captain Aceveda turns up the heat in his search for the gangster who sexually assaulted him.

title: Strays
desc: As Dutch tries to understand "The Cuddler" rapist, Vic enlists Danny for an important undercover assignment.

title: Riceburner
desc: The pursuit of a gang hitman pits the tight-lipped Korean community against the police.

title: Fire in the Hole
desc: As Vic tries to sidetrack the money train investigation, Claudette goes undercover to crack a child porn ring.

title: All In
desc: As the Strike Team is threatened with exposure in the money train heist, Claudette goes it alone in order to find evidence of a public defender's drug addiction.

title: On Tilt
desc: As Vic goes after Margos, Claudette risks her career to see that an innocent man is freed from prison.

title: The Cure
desc: The Shield (2002) enters its fourth season with Vic Mackey adrift after his past actions have caught up with him. He's no longer the cop he used to be - the Strike Team has dissolved and he's stuck babysitting a menial surveillance sting that keeps him off the street. With Captain Aceveda moving on to his new City Council position, Captain Monica Rawling prepares to take over the Barn and implement her controversial anti-gang policies.

title: Grave
desc: Vic agrees to quietly bring in a teenaged drug user before learning of his role in a deadly armed robbery.

title: Bang
desc: When her official arrival at the Barn is greeted by the outbreak of a deadly gang war, Monica assigns Vic the task of ending it.

title: Doghouse
desc: As Vic pursues an escaped rapist, A.D.A Insardi sends Dutch and Claudette after a low level drug dealer.

title: Tar Baby
desc: As Monica is forced to defend her crime-fighting tactics, Vic's pursuit of a killer creates problems for Antwon, while Dutch's secret deal with the D.A.'s office gets him and Claudette assigned to a murder investigation.

title: Insurgents
desc: A raid on a church being used as a drug drop places Monica in hot water with the community and her own cops.

title: Hurt
desc: As Aceveda uses a cleverly-edited videotape to force her to sideline Vic, Monica goes toe-to-toe with a social worker whose negligence led to the hospitalization of a seven-year-old foster child.

title: Cut Throat
desc: With Shane under orders to deliver Vic's body to Antwon, Monica looks for the leak that has led to the murder of some neighborhood informants.

title: String Theory
desc: As Shane enlists Vic and his men in the search for the body of a teenaged informant, the disappearance of two cops on patrol begins to look like payback for Monica's tough new policies.

title: Back in the Hole
desc: As Vic decides to tell Monica the truth about Shane, Dutch and Claudette suspect an alleged serial killer of murder.

title: A Thousand Deaths
desc: Vic pits Antwon's henchmen against each other in an effort to find the cop killers; Dutch and Claudette suspect Detective Billings of failing to stop a deadly carjacking.

title: Judas Priest
desc: Vic and Monica work to link Antwon to the cop killings, only to have Aceveda sell them out in an effort to keep the truth about his sexual assault from being made public.

title: Ain't That a Shame
desc: Monica asks Vic to find a way to hold Antwon Mitchell responsible for the murder of two Farmington cops.

title: Extraction
desc: As the Strike Team tries to end a race war between Blacks and Mexicans, Dutch and Claudette investigate a riot at a high school that also stem from racial tensions.

title: Enemy of Good
desc: Lem's loyalty to Vic is tested when he's interrogated by Lt. Kavanaugh and Aceveda about the Strike Team's corrupt past.

title: Jailbait
desc: While the Strike Team figures out their next step concerning IAD's investigation into Lem, they put Tina undercover to help bust a sex trafficking operation.

title: Tapa Boca
desc: As Becca contemplates whether or not to represent the Strike Team, Vic discovers the truth about Emolia.

title: Trophy
desc: Kavanaugh bugs the Strike Team's clubhouse to get his stalled investigation back on track as Vic and the guys try to end a deadly prescription drug ring.

title: Rap Payback
desc: The walls close in on Vic when Kavanaugh invades the Barn and sets up office.

title: Man Inside
desc: The Strike Team's solidarity begins to crack under Kavanaugh's constant scrutiny.

title: Kavanaugh
desc: As Kavanaugh deals with the emotional circumstances surrounding the return of his ex-wife, his obsession to take down the Strike Team comes to a head.

title: Smoked
desc: With their finances frozen, Vic and his guys are forced to find other means to bail Lem out of jail.

title: Of Mice and Lem
desc: While Lem prepares to plead guilty to the heroin charges, Vic strikes a deal with Antwon Mitchell that will guarantee Lem's safety in prison.

title: Postpartum
desc: Vic arranges to get Lem safely out of the country and set up a new life for him in Mexico.

title: Wins and Losses
desc: This 15-minute season six prequel shows the immediate aftermath of season 5. It is the day of Lem's memorial service, and an emotional time for Vic, Shane and Ronnie.

title: On the Jones
desc: Shane's guilt for killing Lem intensifies after the Strike Team learns that he didn't make a deal with the authorities, and Kavanaugh resorts to threatening informants and planting evidence to pin Lem's murder on Vic.

title: Baptism by Fire
desc: Detectives discover the evidence Kavanaugh planted to make Vic look guilty for Lem's death, but Dutch begins to suspect that everything is too convenient. Meanwhile, Vic tries to find the Salvadoran leader Guardo, who escaped to Mexico.

title: Back to One
desc: Vic captures Guardo and tries to coerce a confession to Lem's murder out of him. However, Shane, the real killer, begs Vic for leniency on Guardo's behalf. Meanwhile, Dutch and Gardocki bring down a gang of meth dealers.

title: The New Guy
desc: Claudette begins making radical changes to the Strike Team in anticipation of Vic's imminent forced retirement. Meanwhile, Vic's helplessness for not saving Lem boils over after he fails to play peacemaker in a gang war.

title: Haunts
desc: Shane is hospitalized after a beating, and his wife leaves him for having an affair. An unlikely suspect emerges in the serial rapist case, and an undercover agent in the Salvadoran gang tells Vic that Guardo didn't kill Lem.

title: Chasing Ghosts
desc: After Vic learns that Guardo wasn't Lem's killer, he begins to suspect that Shane could have been responsible. Meanwhile, Vic does a favor for a city official, hoping it will give him an ally in his quest to avoid early retirement.

title: Exiled
desc: Shane contacts the Armenian mob and collects information against the Strike Team, in order to protect himself from Vic. Meanwhile, Vic learns that Hernan lied about the San Marcos massacre when the Byz Lats retaliate against the Salvadorans.

title: The Math of the Wrath
desc: Shane offers his services to Kesakhian's daughter, who is running the Armenian mob for her sick father. Meanwhile, Hiatt tells Vic that Claudette has made sure that Vic's "retirement" from the Strike Team is a done deal.

title: Recoil
desc: Vic's city official can't help him out with his forced retirement, but he finds a new ally when he solves the San Marcos murders. Shane and Vic fight over Kesakhian's daughter's loyalties, and Billings gets revenge on Dutch.

title: Spanish Practices
desc: Vic and Aceveda form an unlikely alliance to expose a mutual enemy.

title: Coefficient of Drag
desc: Vic and Shane's relationship continues to deteriorate as they work against each other to track down the Armenian hit man. The war between the Mexicans and Salvadorans continues, and Vic gets a temporary reprieve from early retirement.

title: Snitch
desc: Vic's plan to play the Armenians against the Mexicans could backfire when the wrong man is targeted. Dutch plays hardball to get a witness to a homicide to step forward, and the mayor's new initiative to stop gang violence backfires.

title: Money Shot
desc: Vic sets up a plan behind Shane's back to get the Armenians on their side. Meanwhile, Gardocki starts getting fed up about Vic continuing to work with Shane, and Dutch tries to get Danni a desk job to protect her.

title: Genocide
desc: Now that Aceveda has taken the "blackmail box" from Vic, Vic tries to convince Cruz Pezuela that the Armenians stole it. However, his ruse has more unintended consequences.

title: Game Face
desc: Vic learns that the federal agent helping them out is in the "blackmail box" and has ties to Cruz Pezuela. Dutch tries to find out if he has a future serial killer on his hands, and Claudette's health is brought into question.

title: Animal Control
desc: Vic launches his latest plan to get rid of the Armenian threat. However, the main difference in this plan is that, if successful, it will get rid of Shane too. Meanwhile for Shane, a ghost from his past reemerges.

title: Bitches Brew
desc: Vic loses his hearing, which is brought up ahead of schedule, and faces early retirement. He also loses favor with Cruz Pezuela and begins playing hardball with Dani, who wants him to give up all rights to their child.

title: Parricide
desc: Shane's plan to get rid of Vic and Ronnie falls apart and threatens to be exposed. Cruz Pezuela asks Vic to strong-arm a priest, while David Aceveda joins Vic in working with the feds to bring Pezuela down.

title: Moving Day
desc: Vic turns in his badge a week early and sets out to find and kill Shane and his wife. However, Ronnie is benched after Claudette shuts down the Strike Team. Meanwhile, Aceveda finds out more disturbing information about Cruz Pezuela.

title: Party Line
desc: As he puts a price on Shane's head, Vic is asked to prove his loyalty to Beltran by killing Pezuela.

title: Petty Cash
desc: As everything falls into place for the sting operation to bring Vic down, Shane is desperate for money. Back at the Barn, Ronnie tries to intercept a blackmail package, and Aceveda begins to question Pezuela's "suicide."

title: Possible Kill Screen
desc: Mara breaks her collarbone and accidentally shoots and kills an innocent person when Shane's plan to get more money goes sideways. Meanwhile, Vic contemplates leaving Ronnie out to dry and taking a deal with the Feds without him.

title: Family Meeting
desc: As Vic hopes his immunity deal will help keep his family together, and Shane takes extreme measures to keep his pregnant wife from being charged with murder, Dutch finds he's a suspect in the disappearance of a teenage serial killer's mother.

title: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
desc: Homer is forced to become a department store Santa when Marge spends the family's Christmas savings on removing Bart's tattoo.

title: Bart the Genius
desc: Bart ends up at a school for gifted children after cheating on an IQ test.

title: Homer's Odyssey
desc: After losing his job, Homer contemplates ending it all, until he discovers a new life path as a safety advocate.

title: There's No Disgrace Like Home
desc: After being embarrassed by the rest of the family at a company picnic, Homer becomes obsessed with improving their behavior towards each other.

title: Bart the General
desc: After being beaten up by Nelson Muntz one too many times, Bart turns to Grampa for help, and soon leads a rebellion against the school bully.

title: Moaning Lisa
desc: A depressed Lisa's spirit is lifted when she meets a jazz-man, Bleeding Gums Murphy.

title: The Call of the Simpsons
desc: Homer takes the family camping, but it soon becomes a misadventure when they lose their equipment and Homer is mistaken for Bigfoot.

title: The Telltale Head
desc: Bart gets more than he bargained for when he saws the head off a statue of the town's founder.

title: Life on the Fast Lane
desc: Marge contemplates an affair with a handsome bowling instructor.

title: Homer's Night Out
desc: After a photograph of Homer canoodling with an exotic dancer is distributed throughout Springfield, he finds himself kicked out of the house by Marge.

title: The Crepes of Wrath
desc: Bart is sent to France on a student exchange program, where he's treated like a slave; An Albanian student takes Bart's place in the family.

title: Krusty Gets Busted
desc: After Krusty is found guilty of robbing the Kwik-E-Mart following Homer's eyewitness testimony, Bart and Lisa set out to prove his innocence.

title: Some Enchanted Evening
desc: Homer and Marge enjoy a night on the town, leaving the kids with a diabolical babysitter, with a surprising secret.

title: Bart Gets an F
desc: Mrs. Krabappel, fed up with Bart's lackadaisical approach to his studies, gives him an ultimatum: shape up or repeat the fourth grade.

title: Simpson and Delilah
desc: Homer lies on a medical insurance form in order to obtain a miracle hair restoring drug.

title: Treehouse of Horror
desc: The Simpsons move into a cursed house, then are abducted by aliens, before Homer is ensconced in a tale by Edgar Allen Poe.

title: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
desc: After the power plant experiences bad publicity and is threatened with closure, Mr. Burns decides to run for Governor in order to have power over the law.

title: Dancin' Homer
desc: Homer's heckling of the Springfield Isotopes baseball team during one of their games inadvertently leads to his appointment as the new team mascot.

title: Dead Putting Society
desc: In an attempt to show up Ned Flanders, Homer pits Bart against Ned's son, Todd, in a miniature golf competition.

title: Bart vs. Thanksgiving
desc: On Thanksgiving, Bart runs away after fighting with Lisa.

title: Bart the Daredevil
desc: After seeing a motorcycle daredevil at a monster truck show, Bart becomes a death-defying daredevil skateboarder.

title: Itchy & Scratchy & Marge
desc: Marge becomes a crusader against cartoon violence after "Itchy and Scratchy" seemingly inspires Maggie to attack Homer.

title: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
desc: While skateboarding down the street, Bart is hit by a car driven by Mr. Burns. Homer turns down Mr. Burns' token offer of $100, and instead hires ambulance-chaser Lionel Hutz to bring an outrageous lawsuit against the millionaire.

title: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish
desc: After apparently consuming poison blowfish, Homer is told that he only has 24 hours to live.

title: The Way We Was
desc: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they met and fell in love in high school.

title: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment
desc: Homer gets a crooked cable guy to install free cable in the Simpson home, and as a result, Lisa faces an ethical crisis over her family's stealing.

title: Principal Charming
desc: Homer tries to set Selma up with Principal Skinner, only for him to fall for Patty instead.

title: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?
desc: After Grampa is hospitalized, he reveals that Homer has a half-brother, and the family set out to find him.

title: Bart's Dog Gets an F
desc: After an uncontrollable Santa's Little Helper destroys several important Simpson possessions, Homer announces that he will be thrown out of the house unless he completes obedience training.

title: Old Money
desc: After Grampa's new girlfriend dies and leaves him $106,000 in her will, he tries to decide what to do with it.

title: Brush with Greatness
