desc: After rekindling her artistic talents, Marge is commissioned to paint a portrait of Mr. Burns; Homer vows to lose weight after getting trapped in a water slide.

title: Lisa's Substitute
desc: Lisa has a crush on her substitute teacher; Bart decides to run for class president.

title: The War of the Simpsons
desc: Homer must decide whether he should complete marriage counseling or skip out to catch a legendary catfish; Bart and Lisa take advantage of Grampa's ignorance of the house rules.

title: Three Men and a Comic Book
desc: Bart, Milhouse and Martin each pitch in to buy an expensive comic book, which soon has a disastrous effect on their friendship.

title: Blood Feud
desc: After Bart saves Mr. Burns' life with a blood transfusion, Homer vows revenge when they receive only a "thank you" card as compensation.

title: Stark Raving Dad
desc: Homer accidentally lands in a mental hospital and ends up sharing a room with a white man who thinks he is Michael Jackson.

title: Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington
desc: After winning a political essay contest, Lisa is invited to Washington, D.C., but she soon becomes upset after discovering how policy-making really works.

title: When Flanders Failed
desc: After wishing for Flanders to lose his business, Homer discovers that his neighbor is actually about to go bankrupt and decides to help him out.

title: Bart the Murderer
desc: After having a horrible day, Bart gets a job tending bar for a group of gangsters and becomes the prime suspect when Principal Skinner mysteriously disappears.

title: Homer Defined
desc: Homer is a hero after averting a nuclear meltdown that he nearly caused, but he doesn't want to tell anyone that he stopped it completely by accident.

title: Like Father, Like Clown
desc: Bart and Lisa try to reunite Krusty the Clown with his father.

title: Treehouse of Horror II
desc: The Simpson family receives a severed monkey's paw which can grant wishes, Bart gains magical powers which he uses to turn Homer into a Jack-in-the-box, and Mr. Burns uses Homer's brain to create a robot.

title: Lisa's Pony
desc: Homer buys Lisa a pony that the family can ill afford.

title: Saturdays of Thunder
desc: After Homer fails a fathering test, he decides to help Bart build his Soap Box Derby racer.

title: Flaming Moe's
desc: Moe claims a drink that Homer invented is his own, with the drink making the bar a local hot spot, but threatens his friendship with Homer.

title: Burns Verkaufen der Kraftwerk
desc: Burns decides to retire and sells the power plant to a German consortium for an exorbitant price. Homer's laziness and inefficiency are quickly exposed by his new bosses, and he is laid off.

title: I Married Marge
desc: As Marge goes to the doctor for a pregnancy test, Homer tells the children of the events leading up to his marriage, and Bart's birth.

title: Radio Bart
desc: After Bart receives a microphone which can transmit through radios, he decides to pull a series of pranks and eventually convinces the town that a boy has fallen down a well.

title: Lisa the Greek
desc: Homer uses Lisa (and her prognostic skills) to help him bet on football games.

title: Homer Alone
desc: While Marge spends a couple of days at Rancho Relaxo after she has a breakdown, Bart and Lisa stay with Patty and Selma, and Homer stays at home to take care of Maggie.

title: Bart the Lover
desc: After Mrs. Krabappel gives Bart a month of detention, he gets his revenge by responding to her newspaper singles ad; Homer uses a swear jar to cut down on his cursing.

title: Homer at the Bat
desc: Homer and his co-workers qualify for the plant softball team's league final, but Mr. Burns hires nine professional MLB players in order to win a $1 million bet.

title: Separate Vocations
desc: Lisa and Bart take an examination at the school that is supposed to determine what they will be when they grow up, but the kids are not so sure.

title: Dog of Death
desc: After the Simpsons regret paying for an expensive surgery for Santa's Little Helper, he runs away from home and is trained by Mr. Burns to become an attack dog.

title: Colonel Homer
desc: Homer becomes the manager of a beautiful young country singer and finds himself almost attracted to her, sparking Marge's jealousy.

title: Black Widower
desc: Sideshow Bob gets out of jail and plots to take his revenge on Bart by marrying his Aunt Selma and killing her.

title: The Otto Show
desc: After Otto loses his job as school bus driver because he does not have a license, Bart convinces Homer and Marge to let Otto stay with them until he gets back on his feet.

title: Bart's Friend Falls in Love
desc: Bart becomes jealous when Milhouse falls in love with a new student named Samantha; Homer accidentally receives a vocabulary-building tape instead of a weight-loss one.

title: Brother, Can You Spare Two Dimes?
desc: After Homer "wins" a $2000 settlement with the plant for radiation affecting his sperm count, his brother Herb comes to Springfield with an idea that could help him get his fortune back.

title: Kamp Krusty
desc: Bart and Lisa attend "Kamp Krusty" but it is nothing like they thought it would be; Homer's hair grows back and he loses weight while the kids are away.

title: A Streetcar Named Marge
desc: Marge stars in a musical adaptation of A Streetcar Named Desire, but is angry with Homer's lack of interest; Maggie squares off with her strict new daycare owner.

title: Homer the Heretic
desc: Homer decides to stay at home every Sunday while the rest of the family continues to attend church, and soon finds himself in an ominous situation.

title: Lisa the Beauty Queen
desc: Homer enters Lisa in the Little Miss Springfield pageant to build her self-esteem.

title: Treehouse of Horror III
desc: An evil Krusty the Clown doll tries to kill Homer; Marge is captured by a giant ape who falls in love with her; Bart inadvertently raises the dead.

title: Itchy & Scratchy: The Movie
desc: With Bart continually getting in trouble, Homer bans him from seeing the new Itchy & Scratchy movie.

title: Marge Gets a Job
desc: When Marge takes a job at the power plant, Mr. Burns falls in love with her; Bart "cries wolf" to avoid taking a test.

title: New Kid on the Block
desc: Bart develops a crush on his new neighbor, only to discover that she's dating Jimbo Jones; Homer sues an all-you-can-eat restaurant after he's kicked out.

title: Mr. Plow
desc: Homer opens a successful snow-plowing business, only to inspire Barney to start a rival outfit that puts him out of work.

title: Lisa's First Word
desc: While trying to coax Maggie into saying her first word, Homer and Marge talk about how Lisa spoke hers.

title: Homer's Triple Bypass
desc: Years of poor eating habits catch up with Homer when he suffers a massive heart attack, but the family can't afford the triple bypass operation he needs.

title: Marge vs. the Monorail
desc: After receiving a considerable donation of money, Springfield builds a monorail system with Homer as the conductor, unaware they've just boarded a one-way train to Hell.

title: Selma's Choice
desc: Selma starts to feel broody, but after taking Bart and Lisa to Duff Gardens, she changes her mind.

title: Brother from the Same Planet
desc: When Bart gets tired of Homer's horrible parenting skills, he enrolls in the "Bigger Brother" program where he's assigned a fantastic role model.

title: I Love Lisa
desc: Lisa gives Ralph a Valentine's card out of pity, but soon regrets it when he develops an unwanted crush on her.

title: Duffless
desc: After Homer loses his license for DUI, Marge pressures him to give up beer for a month; Lisa attempts to prove that Bart is less intelligent than a hamster.

title: Last Exit to Springfield
desc: When Mr. Burns revokes the plant's dental plan, forcing Lisa to be fitted with cheap, ugly braces, Homer leads its union into going on strike.

title: So It's Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
desc: As Homer recovers in hospital due to Bart's disastrous April Fool's Day prank, the family reminiscences over earlier hardships.

title: The Front
desc: Bart and Lisa convince Grampa to let them use his name for episodes of "Itchy and Scratchy" they have written; Homer re-takes a test he failed in high school.

title: Whacking Day
desc: Marge home-schools Bart after he is expelled from Springfield Elementary; Lisa protests a barbaric local holiday centered around clubbing snakes to death.

title: Marge in Chains
desc: A misunderstanding leads to Marge being imprisoned for shoplifting, with her absence soon descending the family, and eventually, the town into chaos.

title: Krusty Gets Kancelled
desc: When Krusty's show is canceled after losing viewers to a ventriloquist and his dummy, Bart and Lisa organize a celebrity-filled comeback special for their favorite Clown.

title: Homer's Barbershop Quartet
desc: After the kids find a record with Homer's picture on it, he recalls the story of how he achieved fame in the 1980s with his barbershop quartet, The Be Sharps.

title: Cape Feare
desc: After being released from prison on parole, Sideshow Bob plots to murder Bart.

title: Homer Goes to College
desc: When a surprise inspection of the nuclear power plant reveals that Homer is not qualified to do his job, he is forced to go to college.

title: Rosebud
desc: After his birthday party goes wrong, Mr. Burns begins to want his childhood toy, a teddy bear named Bobo; Homer finds that Maggie is in possession of the doll.

title: Treehouse of Horror IV
desc: Homer sells his soul to the Devil for a donut, Bart contends with a gremlin on the side of the school bus which only he can see, and the family discovers that Mr. Burns is a vampire.

title: Marge on the Lam
desc: A girls' night out turns into a high speed chase when Marge learns her friend is driving a stolen car.

title: Bart's Inner Child
desc: Brad Goodman, a self-help guru, encourages Springfield to act more like Bart, with disastrous results.

title: Boy Scoutz 'n the Hood
desc: After joining the Junior Campers while on a sugar high, Bart reluctantly invites Homer to accompany him on the group's annual father-son rafting trip, which soon goes awry.

title: The Last Temptation of Homer
desc: Homer's marriage is in trouble when he develops an attraction to a new co-worker; Bart undergoes medical treatments that make him look like a nerd.

title: $pringfield (Or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling)
desc: Mr. Burns builds a casino when Springfield decides to legalize gambling, with Marge becoming addicted to the slot machines.

title: Homer the Vigilante
desc: An outbreak of burglaries inspires Homer to lead a vigilante group.

title: Bart Gets Famous
desc: Bart becomes an overnight sensation as the "I didn't do it" boy on Krusty the Clown's show.

title: Homer and Apu
desc: Apu moves in with the Simpsons after losing his job when Homer gets ill from the contaminated food; James Woods takes over the Kwik-E-Mart.

title: Lisa vs. Malibu Stacy
desc: Angered by the vacuous phrases her Malibu Stacy doll utters, Lisa works with Malibu Stacy's original designer to create a doll with admirable traits.

title: Deep Space Homer
desc: In an effort to increase the dismal television ratings for their space launches, NASA decides to send an ordinary man into space, and Homer is chosen for the task.

title: Homer Loves Flanders
desc: After Flanders invites Homer to a football game, the pair become friends, but Homer's possessiveness and loutish behaviour slowly turns Ned against him.

title: Bart Gets an Elephant
desc: After Bart receives an elephant as a prize for calling in to a radio station, the animal proves to be too costly to care for and Homer decides to sell it.

title: Burns' Heir
desc: After coming close to death, Mr. Burns decides than it's time to find an heir to his empire, and chooses Bart because of his truly devious nature.

title: Sweet Seymour Skinner's Baadasssss Song
desc: Bart accidentally gets Principal Skinner fired on inspection day, with Ned Flanders taking over as his replacement.

title: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
desc: Bart witnesses the alleged assault of a waiter by Mayor Quimby's nephew, but coming forward will mean admitting to skipping class, and face the consequences.

title: Lady Bouvier's Lover
desc: Grampa falls in love with Marge's mother, but must compete with Mr. Burns for her heart.

title: Secrets of a Successful Marriage
desc: Homer begins teaching a class on how to have a successful marriage, but jeopardizes his own marriage by revealing secrets about himself and Marge.

title: Bart of Darkness
desc: Confined to his room with a broken leg, Bart suspects Ned Flanders of murdering Maude; the family's new swimming pool earns Lisa popularity among the neighborhood kids.

title: Lisa's Rival
desc: Lisa is jealous when a new girl in class is smarter than she is; Homer obtains a giant mound of sugar.

title: Another Simpsons Clip Show
desc: The family recalls past tales of lost love.

title: Itchy & Scratchy Land
desc: A family vacation to Itchy & Scratchy Land turns disastrous when the robots malfunction and turn on the tourists.

title: Sideshow Bob Roberts
desc: When Sideshow Bob is released from prison and is elected Mayor of Springfield, Bart and Lisa suspect foul play and are determined to expose his corruption.

title: Treehouse of Horror V
desc: The family's job at Mr. Burns' country estate goes awry when Homer goes mad; Homer's attempt to repair a toaster results in inadvertent time travel; The school staff turn cannibalistic.

title: Bart's Girlfriend
desc: Bart falls for Reverend Lovejoy's daughter and is surprised when she becomes a bad influence on him.

title: Lisa on Ice
desc: Sibling rivalry between Bart and Lisa ensues when they become the star players of their respective ice hockey teams.

title: Homer Badman
desc: Homer accidentally lands himself in trouble with the law and with the kids' babysitter after stealing a gummy replica at a candy convention.

title: Grampa vs. Sexual Inadequacy
desc: Homer and Abe hit the road to sell Abe's miraculous aphrodisiac.

title: Fear of Flying
desc: Marge goes into therapy to cure her of her traumatizing fear of flying.

title: Homer the Great
desc: Homer becomes a member of a mysterious organization called the Stonecutters and is heralded as "the chosen one".

title: And Maggie Makes Three
desc: Homer recounts the story of Maggie's birth when the kids ask why there are no photos of her in the family album.

title: Bart's Comet
desc: Bart discovers a comet that is on a collision course with Springfield.

title: Homie the Clown
desc: Homer becomes a Krusty the Clown stand-in, but is mistaken for the real Krusty by the Springfield mafia.

title: Bart vs. Australia
desc: After he makes a collect call to Australia and refuses to pay for it, Bart sparks an international incident, with the Simpsons forced to travel to the country in order to repair political relations.

title: Homer vs. Patty and Selma
desc: Desperate for money, Homer takes a loan from Patty and Selma; Bart discovers a natural talent for ballet.

title: A Star Is Burns
desc: The citizens of Springfield host their own film festival, with popular movie critic Jay Sherman arriving from New York to judge.

title: Lisa's Wedding
desc: A fortune teller gives Lisa a look at her wedding in the year 2010.

title: Two Dozen and One Greyhounds
desc: Santa's Little Helper's new mate has puppies, and Mr. Burns schemes to steal them and make them into a coat.

title: The PTA Disbands
desc: Bart manipulates Mrs. Krabappel into leading a teachers' strike against Principal Skinner, but is perturbed when Marge becomes his substitute.

title: 'Round Springfield
desc: When Bart is hospitalized, Lisa runs into her mentor Bleeding Gums Murphy, who is also a patient, and becomes devastated when he dies soon after.

title: The Springfield Connection
desc: Marge deals with corruption and crime when she joins the Springfield police force.

title: Lemon of Troy
desc: When a group of Shelbyville kids steal Springfield's sacred lemon tree, Bart and his friends venture there to get the tree back.

title: Who Shot Mr. Burns? Part One
desc: After Mr. Burns steals oil from Springfield Elementary and blocks out the sun, an unknown person shoots him.

title: Who Shot Mr. Burns? Part Two
desc: Mr. Burns is laying in the hospital while the investigation into his shooter begins. Every citizen has motivation, but it's Simpson DNA that has been found.

title: Radioactive Man
desc: Milhouse is cast as Radioactive Man's sidekick in a Hollywood production of the comic book.

title: Home Sweet Home-Dum-Diddly Doodily
desc: Marge and Homer lose custody of the kids, who are sent to live at the Flanders' house.

title: Bart Sells His Soul
desc: Bart casually sells his soul to Milhouse for $5 but soon regrets it; Moe converts his dank bar into a family restaurant.

title: Lisa the Vegetarian
desc: A trip to a local petting zoo convinces Lisa to give up meat, despite excessive pressure to convince her not to do so.

title: Treehouse of Horror VI
desc: A lightning storm causes giant advertising mascots to come to life; The children are terrorized by Groundskeeper Willie in their dreams; Homer finds himself trapped in another dimension.

title: King Size Homer
desc: Homer intentionally gains more weight in order to qualify for disability and work from home, but soon realizes that being morbidly obese comes with its own problems.

title: Mother Simpson
desc: After faking his own death, Homer is reunited with his mother, who harbors a deep secret.

title: Sideshow Bob's Last Gleaming
desc: Sideshow Bob again escapes from prison and takes control of a TV screen at an air show, demanding all television stations immediately go off the air.

title: The Simpsons 138th Episode Spectacular!
desc: Troy McClure hosts a retrospective of the first 137 episodes of The Simpsons (1989).

title: Marge Be Not Proud
desc: Marge's relationship with Bart is strained when he is caught shoplifting before Christmas.

title: Team Homer
desc: Homer starts a bowling team with Moe, Apu and Otto, but Mr. Burns insists on joining after learning that the team was funded with his money; Springfield Elementary introduces uniforms.

title: Two Bad Neighbors
desc: Former President George Bush and his wife, Barbara, move into the Simpsons' neighborhood and soon clash with Bart and Homer.

title: Scenes from the Class Struggle in Springfield
desc: After buying a Chanel suit at a bargain price, Marge finds herself invited to a country club by a former schoolmate. Taken in by the opulence of the place, she is soon overcome by a desperation to fit in.

title: Bart the Fink
desc: Krusty the Clown is left almost broke after Bart inadvertently rats him out to the IRS, forcing Krusty to take drastic action.

title: Lisa the Iconoclast
desc: Lisa may figure out what to do when she discovers that Springfield's founding father was actually a murderous thief while researching for an essay.

title: Homer the Smithers
desc: When Smithers is forced to take a vacation, he appoints Homer as his temporary replacement.

title: The Day the Violence Died
desc: Bart and Lisa meet a vagabond who claims to be the creator of Itchy from "Itchy and Scratchy."

title: A Fish Called Selma
desc: Washed-up movie star Troy McClure starts dating Selma in an attempt to silence bizarre rumors about his personal life and resuscitate his career.

title: Bart on the Road
desc: Bart makes a fake driver's license and takes Milhouse, Martin and Nelson on a huge road trip; Lisa spends time with Homer at the power plant.

title: 22 Short Films About Springfield
desc: A series of vignettes highlights a day in the life of various Springfield residents.

title: Raging Abe Simpson and His Grumbling Grandson in 'The Curse of the Flying Hellfish'
desc: One of Grampa's old war buddies dies, and it's revealed that Mr. Burns is the only other living member of his WWII squad and things go sour quickly.

title: Much Apu About Nothing
desc: Anti-immigration fever sweeps Springfield, which threatens to lead to the deportation of Apu, until Homer decides to reject the mob mentality and help him become a legal citizen.

title: Homerpalooza
desc: In an attempt to prove to his kids that es a cool dad, Homer takes them to a music festival but ends up embarrassing them after being hired in a sideshow.

title: Summer of 4'2"
desc: After realizing how unpopular she is, a disillusioned Lisa sees the vacation to Ned Flanders' beach house as an opportunity to reinvent herself.

title: Treehouse of Horror VII
desc: Bart discovers his Siamese twin in the attic; Lisa becomes a God after she accidentally creates life in a science fair project; Kang and Kodos plot to conquer the planet.

title: You Only Move Twice
desc: After moving to another town for a new job, Homer must decide whether or not to stay when the family have a hard time with the transfer.

title: The Homer They Fall
desc: Homer becomes a boxer after Moe discovers his amazing ability to take a punch.

title: Burns, Baby Burns
desc: The Simpsons try to reunite Mr. Burns with Larry, his slovenly long-lost son.

title: Bart After Dark
desc: Marge leads a crusade against a local burlesque house after she discovers Bart working there.

title: A Milhouse Divided
desc: Homer questions the state of his marriage after Luann Van Houten demands a divorce from Kirk.

title: Lisa's Date with Density
desc: Lisa develops a crush on Nelson, and tries to reform him; Homer gets an autodialer and decides to make easy money with a telemarketing scam.

title: Hurricane Neddy
desc: After a hurricane destroys Ned Flanders' house, he suffers a nervous breakdown and is forced to confront repressed problems from his childhood.

title: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer
desc: After eating insanity peppers at a chili cook-off, Homer has a hallucination of a talking coyote urging him to find his soulmate.

title: The Springfield Files
desc: Special Agents Mulder and Scully arrive in Springfield after Homer claims to have seen an alien.

title: The Twisted World of Marge Simpson
desc: Marge enters the pretzel vending business, but when she fails, Homer recruits some help from the mob.

title: Mountain of Madness
desc: Homer and Mr. Burns get trapped in a snowed-in cabin during a company retreat.

title: The Itchy & Scratchy & Poochie Show
desc: Homer is cast as Poochie, a new "Itchy and Scratchy" character designed to reverse declining ratings; a hip college student moves in with the Simpsons.

title: Simpsoncalifragilisticexpiala(Annoyed Grunt)cious
desc: Marge is stressed from motherhood and hires a British nanny to help out around the house, who struggles to teach Bart and Lisa how to behave.

title: Homer's Phobia
desc: After Marge befriends John, a gay store owner, Homer worries that his presence will have a negative effect on Bart's sexuality.

title: Brother from Another Series
desc: Bart suspects a paroled Sideshow Bob is up to his old tricks when he is hired by his brother Cecil to assist in the construction of a dam.

title: My Sister, My Sitter
desc: Bart is outraged when Lisa becomes his babysitter.

title: Homer vs. the 18th Amendment
desc: After alcohol is banned in Springfield, Homer adopts the moniker of the "Beer Baron" to bootleg liquor, prompting an investigation from an uptight Treasury agent.

title: Grade School Confidential
desc: Bart discovers Principal Skinner and Mrs Krabappel kissing, and it's not long before the whole town knows of their secret affair.

title: The Canine Mutiny
desc: When the items Bart purchased with a fake credit card are repossessed, he claims that Santa's Little Helper is the dog he bought instead of his new pet, Laddie.

title: The Old Man and the Lisa
desc: Burns loses his fortune and recruits Lisa to help him get it back.

title: In Marge We Trust
desc: Marge becomes a church counselor; Homer discovers his face on a Japanese detergent logo.

title: Homer's Enemy
desc: Homer's laziness begets the ire of his industrious but arrogant new co-worker Frank Grimes; Bart buys a run-down factory for a dollar.

title: The Simpsons Spin-Off Showcase
desc: Troy McClure presents three spinoffs: "Chief Wiggins, P.I.," "The Love-Matic Grandpa," and "The Simpson Family Smile-Time Variety Hour."

title: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson
desc: Bart is sent to a military school to be disciplined; Lisa, seeking a challenge, enrolls with him, but faces discrimination as the school's only girl cadet.

title: The City of New York vs. Homer Simpson
desc: Homer must travel to New York to get his car back, which is illegally parked at World Trade Center Plaza.

title: The Principal and the Pauper
desc: At his 20th anniversary celebration as school principal, Principal Skinner is discovered to be an imposter of the real Seymour Skinner.

title: Lisa's Sax
desc: Homer recounts the story of Bart's first day of school, which corresponds with the story of how Lisa got her saxophone.

title: Treehouse of Horror VIII
desc: Homer battles mutants after Springfield is annihilated by a neutron bomb; Bart has his DNA mixed with a fly; Marge is revealed to be a witch in colonial Springfield.

title: The Cartridge Family
desc: After a massive soccer riot, Homer purchases a gun to protect the family.

title: Bart Star
desc: A damning report on childhood obesity in Springfield leads to the formation of a pee-wee football team. After belittling Ned Flanders, Homer ends up coaching the team, but his favoring of Bart makes him unpopular.

title: The Two Mrs. Nahasapeemapetilons
desc: Apu receives a letter from his mother stating that it's time for him fulfilled his arranged marriage obligation, he pretends Marge is his wife.

title: Lisa the Skeptic
desc: Townspeople believe Lisa has unearthed the fossiled remains of a angel.

title: Realty Bites
desc: Marge becomes a real-estate agent.

title: Miracle on Evergreen Terrace
desc: When Bart accidentally burns down the family's Christmas tree and gifts, he claims that a robber stole everything. As a result, the town gets them a new tree and pitches in to raise funds.

title: All Singing, All Dancing
desc: Homer is disappointed when the western he rented turns out to be a musical, so the family reminds him of the musical moments in the show's history.

title: Bart Carny
desc: Bart and Homer befriend two carnies and invite them to stay with them, but the carnies soon swindle the Simpsons out of their house.

title: The Joy of Sect
desc: An evil cult called the Movementarians brainwashes the citizens of Springfield and it's up to Marge to get them back.

title: Das Bus
desc: While the kids become stranded on a desert island, Homer attempts to cash in on the Internet.

title: The Last Temptation of Krust
desc: After a disastrous performance, Krusty changes his image and becomes an edgy stand-up.

title: Dumbbell Indemnity
desc: Homer and Moe attempt insurance fraud so that Moe can support his new girlfriend. When Homer ends up in jail, Moe has to decide whether or not to come forward.

title: Lisa the Simpson
desc: Lisa fears she is losing her intelligence when she learns about the fabled Simpson gene. Meanwhile, Jasper freezes himself in the Kwik-E-Mart freezer.

title: This Little Wiggy
desc: Bart is reluctant to hang out with Ralph Wiggum, until he gains access to Chief Wiggum's master key to the city.

title: Simpson Tide
desc: Homer causes an international incident after he joins the Naval reserves.

title: The Trouble with Trillions
desc: Homer is forced to spy for the IRS after an audit. But when he is asked to retrieve a trillion dollar bill from Mr. Burns, he switches sides and the two flee to Cuba for refuge.

title: Girly Edition
desc: Bart and Lisa become locked in competition when they anchor a children's news program; Homer adopts a helper monkey.

title: Trash of the Titans
desc: Homer becomes the sanitation commissioner for Springfield. His ineptitude pollutes the town and leads to a drastic solution.

title: King of the Hill
desc: After humiliating Bart at a church picnic, Homer resolves to get in shape. Soon, he is contacted by an energy bar company that wants him to climb a mountain as a promotion.

title: Lost Our Lisa
desc: Lisa gets lost after she tries to take a bus to a museum.

title: Natural Born Kissers
desc: Homer and Marge's attempt to spice up their marriage leads to the couple being chased naked through Springfield.

title: Lard of the Dance
desc: Homer and Bart try to start their own grease business; Lisa organizes a school dance.

title: The Wizard of Evergreen Terrace
desc: Homer's midlife crisis leads to a disastrous attempt at being an inventor.

title: Bart the Mother
desc: When Bart accidentally kills a mother bird, he tries to make amends by raising the eggs.

title: Treehouse of Horror IX
desc: Homer receives an evil hair transplant; Bart and Lisa get trapped in an Itchy and Scratchy cartoon; Maggie is revealed to be an alien.

title: When You Dish Upon a Star
desc: Homer becomes a Hollywood insider when he befriends Alec Baldwin and Kim Basinger.

title: D'oh-in' in the Wind
desc: Homer becomes a hippie after a revelation about his middle name.

title: Lisa Gets an 'A'
desc: When Lisa cheats on a test, she has a moral crisis when her perfect score qualifies the school for grant money; Homer adopts a lobster as a pet.

title: Homer Simpson in: 'Kidney Trouble'
desc: Homer gets cold feet before a transplant operation which could save Grampa's life.

title: Mayored to the Mob
desc: Homer deals with corruption when he becomes Mayor Quimby's bodyguard.

title: Viva Ned Flanders
desc: When Homer takes Ned to Las Vegas in an attempt to get him to loosen up, the two end up drunkenly marrying a pair of cocktail waitresses.

title: Wild Barts Can't Be Broken
desc: The children of Springfield revolt after a curfew is enforced.

title: Sunday, Cruddy Sunday
desc: Homer and his friends head to the Super Bowl, but are forced to sneak in when they discover their tickets are counterfeit.

title: Homer to the Max
desc: Homer changes his name to "Max Power" after discovering that he shares his name with a dimwitted TV character.

title: I'm with Cupid
desc: The husbands of Springfield plot revenge after Apu outshines them on Valentine's Day.

title: Marge Simpson in: 'Screaming Yellow Honkers'
desc: Marge's new SUV gives her a potent case of road rage.

title: Make Room for Lisa
desc: Lisa feels that her relationship with her father will never be close, and she develops stress-induced stomach pains; Marge inadvertently knocks out Milhouse.

title: Maximum Homerdrive
desc: Homer takes Bart with him on a cross-country delivery on behalf of a trucker who died before completing it; Marge and Lisa experience problems with their new novelty doorbell.

title: Simpsons Bible Stories
desc: Three famous religious stories are retold Simpsons style as the family nods off at church.

title: Mom and Pop Art
desc: Homer becomes the talk of the Springfield art community when a failed barbecue pit he worked on is mistaken for an art project.

title: The Old Man and the 'C' Student
desc: Bart is punished with community service at the Retirement Castle after he ruins Springfield's chances of hosting the Olympics.

title: Monty Can't Buy Me Love
desc: When a wealthy man moves to Springfield, Mr. Burns begins to feel that he is losing his grasp on the citizens and decides to enlist the help of Homer.

title: They Saved Lisa's Brain
desc: Lisa is invited to join the Springfield chapter of MENSA and after Mayor Quimby flees, the group ends up running the city. Meanwhile, Homer poses for a series of erotic photos.

title: Thirty Minutes Over Tokyo
desc: The Simpsons must perform on a Japanese game show after Homer loses their money on a vacation.

title: Beyond Blunderdome
desc: Convinced he's the only man with guts to tell him the truth, Mel Gibson insists Homer accompanies him in Hollywood to help fix his newest film project.

title: Brother's Little Helper
desc: Bart is put on medication to control his behavior, but the pills cause him to become paranoid and insane.

title: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner?
desc: When Homer is hired as a local food critic by a newspaper in Springfield, he finds himself in deep trouble after his reviews turn out to be too critical.

title: Treehouse of Horror X
desc: The Simpsons attempt to cover up their accidental murder of Ned Flanders. Bart and Lisa acquire super powers. An electronic apocalypse threatens Springfield.

title: E-I-E-I-(Annoyed Grunt)
desc: Homer cowards out of a pistol-duel and hides out with the rest of the family on a country farm.

title: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder
desc: Homer becomes a minor celebrity around Springfield after bowling a perfect game.

title: Eight Misbehavin'
desc: Apu struggles with fatherhood after Manjula gives birth to octuplets.

title: Take My Wife, Sleaze
desc: Homer's attempt at creating a motorcycle gang attracts a real gang, who kidnap Marge.

title: Grift of the Magi
desc: A toy company purchases Springfield Elementary and uses the student body as a focus group for their new Christmas toy Funzo.

title: Little Big Mom
desc: Lisa finds out how rough Marge has it when her mom is in traction and she becomes the woman of the house. Homer and Bart's antics get her so worked up she conspires to teach them a lesson.

title: Faith Off
desc: Bart is led to believe he has special healing powers after a tent revival.

title: The Mansion Family
desc: Homer receives responsibility for Mr. Burns' mansion when he is on leave and takes Burns' yacht to international waters to have a party.

title: Saddlesore Galactica
desc: The Simpsons get an abused horse and make him a contender in horse racing. Homer finds out a secret conspiracy about jockeys. Lisa tries to reach President Clinton when the results of a school band talent competition seem tainted.

title: Alone Again, Natura-Diddly
desc: Ned deals with his grief after Maude's untimely death.

title: Missionary: Impossible
desc: When Homer is wanted dead for reneging on a 10,000 dollar pledge to PBS, Reverend Lovejoy sets him up for missionary work in the South Pacific until the heat dies down.

title: Pygmoelian
desc: Plastic surgery not only transforms Moe the Bartender from ugly to hunky, it helps gets him a job on a hit daytime drama.

title: Bart to the Future
desc: Bart gets a glimpse of the future while the family is on vacation at an Indian casino.

title: Days of Wine and D'oh'ses
desc: Homer doesn't like it when Barney quits drinking; Bart and Lisa get into trouble when they enter a photo contest for the new phone book cover.

title: Kill the Alligator and Run
desc: Fearing he only has three years to live, Homer takes the family on a vacation to Florida, where they become fugitives after seemingly killing a famous alligator.

title: Last Tap Dance in Springfield
desc: Lisa has difficulties learning to tap dance; Bart and Milhouse ditch summer camp to spend a week living in the mall.

title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge
desc: Everybody loves the new Simpsons' house guest Becky. Except Marge, who thinks Becky wants to kill her.

title: Behind the Laughter
desc: Fans are invited to take a behind-the-scenes look at "The Simpsons," revisiting some of the most memorable experiences the family has been through.

title: Treehouse of Horror XI
desc: Homer must do one good deed to get into Heaven; Bart and Lisa encounter a witch in a gingerbread house; Super-intelligent dolphins strike back at humanity.

title: A Tale of Two Springfields
desc: Springfield is split in two when Homer revolts because his area code is changed; the new town walls itself off from the neighbors.

title: Insane Clown Poppy
desc: After he learns he has a daughter, Krusty turns to Homer for parenting advice.

title: Lisa the Treehugger
desc: Lisa's crush on an environmental activist inspires her to live in a tree threatened by loggers.

title: Homer vs. Dignity
desc: Desperate for money, Homer accepts payment from Mr. Burns in exchange for humiliating himself.

title: The Computer Wore Menace Shoes
desc: Homer's gossip website becomes a huge hit, but when his information runs out he resorts to making up news.

title: The Great Money Caper
desc: The whole town of Springfield conspires to teach Homer and Bart a lesson after the pair begin running confidence scams.

title: Skinner's Sense of Snow
desc: A freak blizzard traps the students of Springfield Elementary inside their school. Their lives at stake, they are at the mercy of the rescue efforts of a woozy Homer and Ned.

title: HOMR
desc: An X-ray reveals a crayon lodged in Homer's brain. After the crayon is removed, Homer experiences a sudden surge in intelligence, making him closer to Lisa and isolated from his friends.

title: Pokey Mom
desc: Marge befriends a convict with an artistic streak. Meanwhile, Homer battles the chiropractic industry after he creates a miracle back pain cure.

title: Worst Episode Ever
desc: Bart and Milhouse are left in charge of the comic book store after Comic Book Guy is hospitalized.

title: Tennis the Menace
desc: Homer installs a tennis court in the backyard, but his lousy playing creates a rift in the family.

title: Day of the Jackanapes
desc: When a new television game show grows in popularity and begins to draw away Krusty's TV audience e decided to retire from the television business.

title: New Kids on the Blecch
desc: A music producer offers Bart and his friends a chance to participate in an up-and-coming boyband, but the boys are not up to it after making a discovery.

title: Hungry Hungry Homer
desc: Homer is forced to go on a hunger strike by the Springfield Isotopes after uncovering a secret plan to have the baseball team moved to New Mexico.

title: Bye Bye Nerdy
desc: Problems with a bully lead Lisa to examine just what makes bullies aggressive. Meanwhile, Homer gets into the baby-proofing business.

title: Simpson Safari
desc: The Simpsons win a trip to Africa after Homer finds a golden animal cracker from the 60's in the loft.

title: Trilogy of Error
desc: Homer's rush to the hospital to re-attach his severed thumb, Lisa's rush to school to win the science fair, and Bart's run-in with an illegal fireworks scheme interconnect from their point of view.

title: I'm Goin' to Praiseland
desc: With Homer's help, Flanders tries to establish a Christian theme park based on drawings in Maude's sketch book.

title: Children of a Lesser Clod
desc: After a debilitating injury forces him to stay indoors, Homer begins a daycare center.

title: Simpsons Tall Tales
desc: A hobo tells the Simpsons tall tales on a train ride to Delaware. In the first story, Homer is outcast from society as Paul Bunyan. Then, Lisa travels the country planting trees as Connie Appleseed. Finally, Bart and Nelson raft down the Mississippi as Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn.

title: Treehouse of Horror XII
desc: A gypsy puts a curse on Homer; The Simpsons' new automated house malfunctions and tries to kill Homer; Bart and Lisa attend a school for wizards.

title: The Parent Rap
desc: After Bart takes a joyride in a police car, a judge orders him to be tethered to Homer at all times.

title: Homer the Moe
desc: Homer and his friends are forced to drink in the Simpsons' garage after Moe the Bartender renovates his shady bar into a hipster hangout.

title: A Hunka Hunka Burns in Love
desc: Mr. Burns falls in love with a younger woman and recruits Homer to help him impress her.

title: The Blunder Years
desc: A hypnotist uncovers a traumatic experience from Homer's childhood.

title: She of Little Faith
desc: Homer and Bart get careless with a model rocket and accidentally do damage to Springfield's church, but when Mr. Burns offers to commercialize it to repair the destruction, Lisa leaves Christianity behind to become a Buddhist.

title: Brawl in the Family
desc: A social services officer brings unity to the Simpson family, but their newfound happiness is threatened when the cocktail waitress Homer married in Vegas shows up at their door.

title: Sweets and Sour Marge
desc: Marge rallies for a ban on sugar after Springfield is declared America's fattest city.

title: Jaws Wired Shut
desc: Marge can't deal with the quiet after Homer has his jaws wired shut.

title: Half-Decent Proposal
desc: Marge's high school sweetheart Artie Ziff returns and offers Homer a million dollars to spend a weekend with Marge.

title: The Bart Wants What It Wants
desc: Bart breaks up with his new girlfriend Greta, but gets jealous when she begins dating Milhouse.

title: The Lastest Gun in the West
desc: Bart meets a retired cowboy movie star and convinces him to make a comeback on The Krusty the Clown Show.

title: The Old Man and the Key
desc: Abe gets his driver's license back to impress a new woman at the retirement home.

title: Tales from the Public Domain
desc: Homer reads three stories from an overdue library book, imagining himself as Odysseus, Lisa as Joan of Arc and Bart as Hamlet.

title: Blame It on Lisa
desc: Lisa sponsors an orphan in Brazil, and when he goes missing she convinces the family to go to Brazil to find him. While there, Homer is kidnapped.

title: Weekend at Burnsie's
desc: After a traumatizing eye injury, Homer becomes a habitual user of medical marijuana.

title: Gump Roast
desc: In this clip show, the citizens of Springfield honor Homer Simpsons with a Roast, but the festivities take a turn for the worst when aliens crash it.

title: I Am Furious Yellow
desc: Bart's comic about Homer becomes a hit on-line, prompting Homer to attempt to control his anger.

title: The Sweetest Apu
desc: Apu's marriage is on the rocks after Manjula finds out he cheated on her.

title: Little Girl in the Big Ten
desc: Lisa pretends to be a college student when she befriends two college girls; Bart is forced to live in a plastic bubble after being bit by a mosquito.

title: The Frying Game
desc: Homer and Marge find themselves on death row after they are framed for murder.

title: Papa's Got a Brand New Badge
desc: Homer becomes chief of police after a scandal forces Wiggum out.

title: Treehouse of Horror XIII
desc: Homer clones himself with a magic hammock; Zombie cowboys come back from the dead after Springfield bans guns; The Simpsons family take a vacation on an island where Dr. Hibbert can turn people into animals.

title: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation
desc: When Homer is secretly videotaped complaining about his family in a taxi, they send him off to a rock and roll fantasy camp so he can try to live his dream.

title: Bart vs. Lisa vs. 3rd Grade
desc: Bart and Lisa are respectively held back and moved forward one grade, putting them in the same class.

title: Large Marge
desc: Marge accidentally gets breast implants.

title: Helter Shelter
desc: The Simpsons family must participate in a reality television show in which they try to live in the same way that the families did in the 1800s.

title: The Great Louse Detective
desc: Homer has to use Sideshow Bob in order to track down a potential assassin.

title: Special Edna
desc: After Skinner once again has let Mrs. Krabappel down, Bart takes her to the cinema. To cheer her up, Bart nominates Krabappel for the 'teacher of the year' award. The nominations is accepted, and soon the Simpsons family and Mrs. Krabappel are going to the award ceremony in Orlando, Florida, where Skinner tries to get back Krabappel by asking her to marry him.

title: The Dad Who Knew Too Little
desc: Homer hires a private detective to learn more about Lisa.

title: The Strong Arms of the Ma
desc: Marge takes up body-building to boost her self-esteem after being mugged at the Kwik-E-Mart.

title: Pray Anything
desc: Homer turns to religion to help him get what he wants, and is soon awarded the church in an injury settlement. Homer then turns the church into his personal party pad, and Reverend Lovejoy leaves Springfield to wallow in its hedonism.

title: Barting Over
desc: After finding out Homer squandered his money from a baby commercial, Bart moves out into a loft, and meets skateboarding legend Tony Hawk.

title: I'm Spelling as Fast as I Can
desc: Lisa participates in the Spellympics, but Homer is busy traveling cross-country as Krusty Burger test-markets a new sandwich. Lisa is confident that she will win, until she learns that the contest is rigged against her.

title: A Star Is Born Again
desc: Ned Flanders starts dating a famous movie star, but has difficulties with the tabloids following them everywhere.

title: Mr. Spritz Goes to Washington
desc: The family makes Krusty run for Congress because of air traffic being redirected to fly dangerously close to their house.

title: C.E.D'oh
desc: Homer takes over the power plant after tricking Mr. Burns into making him the official owner of the power plant.

title: 'Scuse Me While I Miss the Sky
desc: Lisa becomes interested in astronomy and starts fighting the light pollution which is preventing her from being able to enjoy her new hobby.

title: Three Gays of the Condo
desc: When Homer finds an old note revealing Marge only married him because she was pregnant with Bart, he moves into a condo with two gay guys.

title: Dude, Where's My Ranch?
desc: Homer writes a Christmas carol called "Everybody Hates Ned Flanders," which soon becomes so popular that the family decides to leave town for a while.

title: Old Yeller-Belly
desc: Homer throws out Santa's Little Helper for not saving him from a fire, but soon the dog becomes Duff's new mascot.

title: Brake My Wife, Please
desc: Because of Homer losing his driver's license, Marge has to drive everyone everywhere, which is so stressful for her that she accidentally runs over Homer leading to the two seeing a marriage counselor.

title: Moe Baby Blues
desc: After saving Maggie's life, Moe develops a special bond with her, much to Homer's dismay.

title: The Bart of War
desc: Bart and Milhouse are forced into community service after destroying Flanders' memorial and join separate community groups, pitting themselves against each other.

title: Treehouse of Horror XIV
desc: First, Homer kills the Grim Reaper and takes his place in Reaper Madness. Then, Professor Frink's father is revived, only to kill people and steal their organs in Frinkenstein. Finally, Bart and Milhouse get a stop watch that can stop time in Stop the World, I Want To Goof Off.

title: My Mother the Carjacker
desc: Homer's mother returns to Springfield, and the city pardons her from the charges against her. Mr Burns is furious about this and makes a plan to get Mona Simpson in prison.

title: The President Wore Pearls
desc: Lisa feuds with Principal Skinner after being elected school president.

title: The Regina Monologues
desc: Prime minister Tony Blair welcomes the Simpsons to England where they run into author J.K. Rowling and actor Ian McKellen.

title: The Fat and the Furriest
desc: At the dump Homer is videotaped while being attacked by a bear. The town regards him a coward, so Homer decides to strike back at the bear.

title: Today, I Am a Clown
desc: Krusty decides to do what he never did when he was thirteen years old - have a Bar Mitzvah.

title: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season
desc: After spending all his money on an expensive gift for himself, and the family thinking he should be less of an egoist, Homer decides to change his ways.

title: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens and Gays
desc: A concert for babies ends in a riot, so the childless adults of Springfield gather to make the town less child-friendly.

title: I, (Annoyed Grunt)-Bot
desc: Homer pretends to be a robot and competes in Robot Wars to win Bart's affection; Lisa has cat trouble.

title: Diatribe of a Mad Housewife
desc: Marge is inspired to write a novel, but the storyline of the book (a fat, mean husband, and a handsome, sweet neighbor) makes Homer jealous.

title: Margical History Tour
desc: Marge tells Lisa, Bart and Millhouse three history stories because the library doesn't have any.

title: Milhouse Doesn't Live Here Anymore
desc: Milhouse moves to Capital City, and therefore Lisa and Bart become best friends.

title: Smart & Smarter
desc: When Maggie is revealed to have an IQ of 167, Lisa is no longer the genius of the family, causing a rivalry between the sisters.

title: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner
desc: Artie Ziff is discovered hiding out in the Simpsons' attic.

title: Co-Dependent's Day
desc: Marge takes up heavy drinking to spend more time with Homer. Bart and Lisa confront a famous movie director about the drop in quality his films have taken.

title: The Wandering Juvie
desc: After playing a prank on the whole town, Bart is sentenced to six months of juvenile detention. There he meets Gina, who forces Bart to escape with her.

title: My Big Fat Geek Wedding
desc: Mrs. Krabapel falls for Comic Book Guy and they plan a Star Trek like wedding. Principal Skinner plans to prevent it.

title: Catch 'Em If You Can
desc: Homer and Marge try to have a vacation without the kids but Bart and Lisa follow them everywhere they go.

title: Simple Simpson
desc: Homer becomes a costumed vigilante who uses pies for weapons after witnessing Lisa get humiliated at a competition at the state fair.

title: The Way We Weren't
desc: Marge and Homer find out that they actually kissed each other at age 10 without knowing they were each other's first kisses, and tell the story about this.

title: Bart-Mangled Banner
desc: An accidental photo showing Bart mooning the American flag makes the Simpsons the most hated family in town.

title: Fraudcast News
desc: After Mr. Burns is erroneously reported as dead, he buys all of he media outlets in order to prevent them from writing scathing articles about him.

title: Treehouse of Horror XV
desc: Ned gains the power to foresee people's deaths; Maggie is shrunk inside a vitamin capsule and swallowed; Eliza Simpson and her sidekick hunt down a murderer.

title: All's Fair in Oven War
desc: Homer buys Marge a new kitchen, and Marge likes cooking in the new kitchen so much she attends the Ovenfresh Bakeoff.

title: Sleeping with the Enemy
desc: Because she thinks her own children do not appreciate her anymore, Marge becomes a mother figure for Nelson.

title: She Used to Be My Girl
desc: Marge becomes jealous when Lisa begins idolizing her old high school friend, Chloe Talbot, a famous reporter.

title: Fat Man and Little Boy
desc: Bart begins designing T-shirt slogans, and his T-shirts become very popular among the citizens of Springfield.

title: Midnight Rx
desc: Homer goes to Canada with Apu and Ned to purchase Grampa's medication, but the three have problems getting home because the border guard thinks Apu is a terrorist.

title: Mommie Beerest
desc: Homer gives Moe an enormous amount of money so he doesn't have to close down.

title: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass
desc: A video of Homer dancing becomes so popular that all major sports players hires Homer to design celebration dances for them.

title: Pranksta Rap
desc: Bart went to a rap concert Marge told him not to go to. In order to avoid punishment from Marge, he makes Marge and Homer believe he has been kidnapped.

title: There's Something About Marrying
desc: A townsperson comes out of the closet when Springfield legalized same-sex marriages in a plot to bolster tourism; Homer uses the Internet to become a minister.

title: On a Clear Day I Can't See My Sister
desc: After bullying her, Bart is restricted by court order to come too close to Lisa.

title: Goo Goo Gai Pan
desc: Selma decides to adopt a child, so the whole family goes to China.

title: Mobile Homer
desc: After a garage-cleaning accident, Marge wants Homer to get life insurance. Instead, the family gets an RV.

title: The Seven-Beer Snitch
desc: Springfield builds an opera house, but since no-one attends it they convert it into a prison. Old and forgotten laws are used to fill the prison, and therefore Homer goes to jail for kicking a can five times in a row. In jail, Homer becomes a snitch

title: Future-Drama
desc: Bart and Lisa see into the future where their lives have changed.

title: Don't Fear the Roofer
desc: Homer meets a new friend, Ray the Roofer, but gets confined to a mental institution when his friends and family think he made him up.

title: The Heartbroke Kid
desc: Bart starts living on food from the new candy machine in school only, but he becomes so overweight that he has to go to a fat camp.

title: A Star Is Torn
desc: Lisa attends a singing competition for children, and Homer becomes her manager because of his skill to write songs that the crowd loves.

title: Thank God It's Doomsday
desc: Homer hears about the Rapture, and by using numerology to calculate when the Rapture is coming he learns that it is only one week away.

title: Home Away from Homer
desc: After Homer humiliates Ned Flanders, Ned, Rod, and Todd decides to leave Springfield and live in Humbleton, Pennsylvania.

title: The Father, the Son, and the Holy Guest Star
desc: Bart is expelled from Springfield Elementary, and Bart is therefore enrolled in St. Jerome's Catholic School.

title: The Bonfire of the Manatees
desc: When Marge leaves Homer because he allowed an adult movie being shot in their house, she seeks self fulfillment in protecting manatees.

title: The Girl Who Slept Too Little
desc: A new cemetery right outside the window of Lisa's room makes Lisa suffer from many sleepless nights.

title: Milhouse of Sand and Fog
desc: Maggie contracts the chicken pox and Homer gets the great idea to charge parents to get their own children sick by throwing a pox party, but his plan backfires.

title: Treehouse of Horror XVI
desc: An android son replaces Bart; Homer and friends are the quarry in Mr. Burns' hunting tournament; a witch turns townsfolk into their Halloween costumes.

title: Marge's Son Poisoning
desc: Marge and Bart start spending more time together, and make a tradition of cycling to a tea house in a small village outside Springfield.

title: See Homer Run
desc: When a recall election puts Mayor Quimby's job up for grabs, Homer seizes the opportunity to win office and gain his daughter's love.

title: The Last of the Red Hat Mamas
desc: Milhouse tutors Lisa in Italian, and Marge joins the Cheery Red Tomatoes, a group that plans to rob Mr. Burns of one million dollars worth of Fabergé eggs.

title: The Italian Bob
desc: The Simpsons become lost in Italy, finding their way to a small town that Sideshow Bob has become the mayor of.

title: Simpsons Christmas Stories
desc: Homer tells the tale of the first Christmas ever, while Grandpa pursues his decade-old feud with Santa.

title: Homer's Paternity Coot
desc: When a frozen mailman from the 60's is found in a Springfield glacier, doubts arise about whether Abe really is Homer's father.

title: We're on the Road to D'ohwhere
desc: When Homer is on his way to Vegas to meet up with his friends, he has to make a detour to take Bart to an education camp. Meanwhile, Marge has discovered a surprising source of income.

title: My Fair Laddy
desc: Bart and Lisa bet whether Lisa can turn Groundskeeper Willie into a proper gentleman.

title: The Seemingly Never-Ending Story
desc: In this story within a story within a story within a story, a cave-exploring expedition, an angry sheep and a lovestruck Moe become inextricably entwined.

title: Bart Has Two Mommies
desc: Marge starts babysitting the Flanders boys, leading Homer to spend more time with Bart and Lisa. Bart gets kidnapped by a lonely movie chimpanzee.

title: Homer Simpson, This Is Your Wife
desc: As part of a new Fox show, the Simpsons participate in a wife-swap.

title: Million Dollar Abie
desc: After blowing Springfield's chances for an NFL franchise, Grandpa goes to an assisted-suicide center, then becomes a bullfighter.

title: Kiss Kiss, Bang Bangalore
desc: Homer gets sent to India when the power plant is relocated there. Selma and Patty kidnap Richard Dean Anderson after he spurns their MacGyver fan club.

title: The Wettest Stories Ever Told
desc: While waiting for the dinner at the Frying Dutchman, the family starts telling three stories about ships: "Journey on the Mayflower", "Mutiny on the Bounty", and "The Neptune Adventure".

title: Girls Just Want to Have Sums
desc: Springfield Elementary is divided into two separate schools (one for boys, one for girls) following Principal Skinner's demotion. Concerned that the boys are receiving a higher standard of education, Lisa disguises herself as a boy.

title: Regarding Margie
desc: After hitting her head on a stool Marge suffers from amnesia. Slowly but surely memories are starting to come back, except memories about Homer.

title: The Monkey Suit
desc: After seeing a museum exhibit on evolution, in which creation is labeled a myth, an outraged Ned Flanders teams with Reverend Lovejoy to blackmail Principal Skinner into requiring creationism to be taught in classrooms, eventually at the expense of any mention of evolution. Lisa becomes outraged herself, and forms a student organization to teach evolution, leading to ... Read all

title: Homer and Marge Turn a Couple Play
desc: Marge and Homer try their luck at celebrity marriage counselling.

title: The Mook, the Chef, the Wife and Her Homer
desc: When Fat Tony has to take a time-out due to a whacking attempt, Homer and Bart take over the business.

title: Jazzy & The Pussycats
desc: Lisa becomes depressed when Bart becomes a better jazz musician than her. So she decides to set up an animal shelter in the Simpsons' attic.

title: Please Homer, Don't Hammer 'Em
desc: Marge begins her own carpentry business, but Homer becomes the face of the business because nobody will take a female carpenter seriously. And Bart uses Principal Skinner's peanut allergy to his advantage.

title: Treehouse of Horror XVII
desc: A meteorite turns Homer into a rampaging blob with a voracious appetite; Bart brings a Golem to life; an alien invasion hoax turns real.

title: G.I. (Annoyed Grunt)
desc: Homer is duped into signing up for the Army, and his hijinks after basic training ultimately results in a military occupation of Springfield.

title: Moe'N'a Lisa
desc: Lisa helps Moe become a distinguished poet, but she turns on him when he takes all the credit for his newfound greatness.

title: Ice Cream of Margie (with the Light Blue Hair)
desc: Homer becomes an ice cream man after being fired from the plant, and Marge uses his leftover Popsicle sticks to create folk art figures.

title: The Haw-Hawed Couple
desc: Bart and Nelson become best friends, but Bart surprisingly discovers that the fringe benefits aren't worth Nelson's neediness.

title: Kill Gil, Vol. 1 & 2
desc: The Simpsons let Gil stay with them during Christmas. However, he stays for 11 months because Marge can't tell him "no."

title: The Wife Aquatic
desc: Homer returns Marge to Barnacle Bay, where she spent her beloved summer vacations. But when they get there, they discover that it is no longer a tourist spot.

title: Revenge Is a Dish Best Served Three Times
desc: While Homer tries to get revenge on a driver who cut him off, his family warns him of the folly of revenge by telling stories based on "The Count of Monte Cristo," "Revenge of the Nerds," and "Batman."

title: Little Big Girl
desc: Lisa embellishes her family heritage as Native American for a school project; Bart gets a driver's license and develops a relationship with an older girl.

title: Springfield Up
desc: A parody of the "Up Series" of British documentaries, in which a filmmaker follows Homer and his friends from grade school into their 40s.

title: Yokel Chords
desc: In this parody of The Sound of Music (1965), Lisa becomes a tutor for Cletus' seven children, until Krusty tries to exploit them as entertainers. Meanwhile, Bart becomes emotionally attached to his school-appointed psychiatrist.

title: Rome-old and Juli-eh
desc: Selma and Grampa fall in love and end up getting married, a marriage both Homer and Patty are against.

title: Homerazzi
desc: Homer becomes a successful Paparazzi, but Springfield's celebrities decide to get their revenge on him.

title: Marge Gamer
desc: Marge decides to find out what their Internet has to offer and soon gets hooked on an online role-playing game; Homer referees Lisa's soccer game.

title: The Boys of Bummer
desc: Bart becomes the most hated person in Springfield after he is the goat in a championship baseball game, and Homer's new job as a mattress salesman ruins his and Marge's sex life.

title: Crook and Ladder
desc: Homer, Moe, Apu and Principal Skinner become volunteer firefighters. But just because they're not getting paid doesn't mean that they can't find a way to receive compensation.

title: Stop or My Dog Will Shoot
desc: Homer unwittingly drags the family into a cornfield maze after attempting to leave a boring Harvest fest that Marge brought them to. When everyone except Homer escapes, Santa's Little Helper rescues him and becomes the town hero. So the Simpsons enroll him in Police Dog Academy where he's teamed with Lou.

title: 24 Minutes
desc: Bart and Lisa join forces to stop the school bullies from setting off a stink bomb at the school bake sale.

title: You Kent Always Say What You Want
desc: After Kent Brockman is fired as a news anchor, he and Lisa use the Internet to expose the Fox News Conspiracy.

title: He Loves to Fly and He D'ohs
desc: Homer falls in love with private planes after taking a flight to Chicago with Mr. Burns. So Marge hires Homer a "life manager" to help him think positively and find a job that will allow him to fly for a living.

title: Homer of Seville
desc: Homer becomes an opera star after an injury improves his singing voice. His newfound popularity forces him to hire a personal assistant, who turns out to be an obsessed stalker.

title: Midnight Towboy
desc: Homer becomes the most hated man in town after he becomes a tow truck driver, and Marge teaches Maggie to not be an over-dependent baby.

title: I Don't Wanna Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
desc: Marge promises to visit a convicted bank robber in prison, but is afraid to follow through. But when the convict escapes from prison, Marge is the first person he pays a visit to.

title: Treehouse of Horror XVIII
desc: The eighteenth Simpsons Halloween Special features parodies of the movies "E.T." and "Mr. and Mrs. Smith."

title: Little Orphan Millie
desc: Milhouse's parents are lost at sea, which causes him to become a troubled loner. But his new persona makes him the new most popular kid at school, which sparks jealousy in Bart.

title: Husbands and Knives
desc: When Marge becomes a successful businesswoman, Homer becomes worried that she will dump him for a trophy husband. Therefore, he decides to have plastic surgery to make himself look like a hunk.

title: Funeral for a Fiend
desc: Bart is responsible for Sideshow Bob's death after his latest attempt at revenge is foiled, but is his death actually part of the plan?

title: Eternal Moonshine of the Simpson Mind
desc: Homer goes to Dr. Frink to help him recover his memories from the night before, and he discovers, based on his interpretation of the memories, that Marge is having an affair.

title: E Pluribus Wiggum
desc: Springfield becomes the site of the first presidential primary. The townspeople soon get sick of all of the presidential candidates sucking up to them, and decide to support their own write-in candidate: Ralph Wiggum.

title: That '90s Show
desc: Homer and Marge tell the kids about their life in the early 1990s before they were born, when Marge was enrolled in Springfield College and Homer was the lead singer of a grunge rock band.

title: Love, Springfieldian Style
desc: A series of romantic Valentine's Day parodies based on "Bonnie and Clyde," "Lady and the Tramp," and "Sid and Nancy."

title: The DeBarted
desc: The new prankster in Bart's fourth grade class actually turns out to be a mole brought in by Principal Skinner to infiltrate Bart's inner circle. Homer falls in love with his loaner car after Marge wrecks their old one.

title: Dial 'N' for Nerder
desc: One of Bart's pranks results in Martin's death, but Lisa doesn't want him to confess because she would be considered an accomplice. Marge hires a television crew to find out if Homer is cheating on his diet.

title: Smoke on the Daughter
desc: Marge has Lisa take up ballet, mainly to have Lisa live out her own childhood dreams. Lisa then succumbs to peer pressure from her ballet mates and takes up smoking. Meanwhile, Homer and Bart try to start their own beef jerky business.

title: Papa Don't Leech
desc: When the Simpsons discover that Lurleen Lumpkin is on the skids, Marge reluctantly agrees to take her in and help her find her deadbeat dad who abandoned her 30 years ago.

title: Apocalypse Cow
desc: Bart tries to save the cow he raised for his 4-H club from the slaughterhouse, and in the process winds up getting accidentally engaged to one of Cletus's daughters.

title: Any Given Sundance
desc: Lisa's documentary about her family is accepted into the Sundance Film Festival. However, her family gets upset with her when they discover that the film is far from flattering.

title: Mona Leaves-a
desc: Homer's mom dies, and as part of her will, she asks him to spread her ashes. However, her request turns out to be part of her final act of rebellion against the system.

title: All About Lisa
desc: In a parody of "All About Eve," Lisa stabs Krusty in the back, takes his job, and wins a prestigious award. Meanwhile, Homer and Bart take up coin collecting.

title: Sex, Pies and Idiot Scrapes
desc: Homer and Ned go into business together as bounty hunters, and Marge takes a job at an erotic bakery.

title: Lost Verizon
desc: Bart gets in trouble with Marge after she finds out that he has Denis Leary's cell phone and is using it to make prank phone calls.

title: Double, Double, Boy in Trouble
desc: Bart trades lives with his multi-millionaire lookalike, but discovers that his lookalike's life isn't all he thought it would be.

title: Treehouse of Horror XIX
desc: The Simpsons' 19th Halloween Special, with parodies of "Transformers," "Mad Men," and "It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown."

title: Dangerous Curves
desc: The Simpsons take a Fourth of July vacation to a cabin hotel, which cause Homer and Marge to reminisce about two episodes from their past where they stayed in the cabin.

title: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
desc: Homer gets a job breaking up couples, and Lisa becomes an expert crossword puzzle solver, but Homer bets against her in a competition.

title: MyPods and Boomsticks
desc: Homer suspects that the family of Bart's new Muslim friend from Jordan is part of a terrorist plot, and Lisa becomes obsessed with her new MyPod.

title: The Burns and the Bees
desc: Mr. Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game, and the new arena he plans to have Springfield build for the team threatens to interfere with Lisa's new bee sanctuary.

title: Lisa the Drama Queen
desc: Lisa and her new best friend create their own fantasy world, but Marge doesn't want Lisa to see her friend anymore after she finds out that they're too far gone in it.

title: Take My Life, Please
desc: Homer finds out that he actually won the senior class president election, and he gets an opportunity to find out how his life would have been different if it had happened.

title: How the Test Was Won
desc: Bart and his fellow underachievers are taken on a "field trip" to Capital City so that they can miss the standardized test, and Homer makes sure that nothing bad happens until their insurance goes back into effect.

title: No Loan Again, Naturally
desc: The Simpsons lose their house, but Flanders buys it and offers to rent it back to them. But when they turn out to be less-than-reliable renters, Flanders kicks them out.

title: Gone Maggie Gone
desc: In order to rescue Maggie from a Catholic orphanage, Lisa must solve a series of puzzles to reveal the identity of a gem that will bring peace to Springfield.

title: In the Name of the Grandfather
desc: The Simpsons take Grandpa to Ireland so he can go back to visit a pub he went to during the war, but Grandpa and Homer get suckered into buying the bar.

title: Wedding for Disaster
desc: Homer is kidnapped moments before he and Marge are supposed to re-renew their vows. However, Marge comes to the conclusion that Homer left her at the altar.

title: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe
desc: Moe begins dating a little person he met on the Internet, while Maggie is being bullied at the playground next to Moe's where Homer is leaving her.

title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
desc: Bart gets Milhouse to take the rap for a prank at school, and then blows him off when he falls for a cute 5th grade do-gooder, prompting Milhouse's wrath. Meanwhile, Lisa begins taking "happy pills" to improve her negative outlook.

title: Father Knows Worst
desc: Homer becomes a "helicopter parent" at Springfield Elementary by helping Bart finish a class project and helping Lisa become popular, and Marge finds a secret sauna in their house.

title: Waverly Hills, 9021-D'Oh
desc: The Simpsons set up a fake residence in Waverly Hills so that Bart and Lisa can attend school there.

title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
desc: A series of parodies based on four strong women: Queen Elizabeth, Snow White, Lady MacBeth, and Ayn Rand.

title: Coming to Homerica
desc: Townspeople build a wall around Springfield to keep "immigrants" from Ogdenville from relocating to their town.

title: Homer the Whopper
desc: A Hollywood studio makes a movie based on Comic Book Guy's comic book character "Everyman," and Homer is cast in the lead. However, Homer's weight fluctuations cause problems for the production.

title: Bart Gets a 'Z'
desc: When Bart's prank gets Ms. Krabappel fired from Springfield Elementary School, he tries to make it up to her without letting her know that he was responsible.

title: The Great Wife Hope
desc: Marge takes on the owner of an ultimate fighting league in the ring in order to get the sport banned in Springfield.

title: Treehouse of Horror XX
desc: Lisa becomes livid with Miss Hoover, and in a series of homages to classic Hitchcock sets out for deadly revenge. Next, Krusty's latest fast-food sandwich transforms news anchor Kent Brockman into an enraged zombie and twenty-eight days later, cannibal zombies have overrun Springfield. In the final frightening fable, Homer accidentally falls through a trapdoor in Moe'... Read all

title: The Devil Wears Nada
desc: Marge rediscovers her sexuality after appearing in a racy calendar, but Homer is too tired to respond to her advances because he is being worked to death by his new boss, Carl.

title: Pranks and Greens
desc: Bart meets the boy responsible for the greatest prank in Springfield Elementary School history, and discovers that he's now a 19-year-old loser. Meanwhile, Marge is scolded for providing unhealthy snacks for Maggie's play group.

title: Rednecks and Broomsticks
desc: Homer becomes an expert on moonshine when he starts hanging out with Cletus after he saves the Simpsons' lives, while Lisa becomes friends with three teenage Wiccans.

title: Oh Brother, Where Bart Thou?
desc: Bart becomes jealous of Maggie and Lisa's special bond as sisters, so he goes to an orphanage and "adopts" a little brother.

title: Thursdays with Abie
desc: Homer becomes jealous when a syndicated newspaper columnist begins publishing Grandpa's stories, while Bart is assigned to take care of the class's stuffed sheep for the weekend.

title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
desc: The antagonism between Krusty and the new female co-star forced upon him soon turns to romance, while a headhunter encourages Homer, Lenny and Carl to take a job at another nuclear power plant.

title: Million Dollar Maybe
desc: Homer can't tell Marge he won the lottery because he was supposed to be giving a wedding toast when he bought the ticket. But Bart soon finds out where he's hiding the money and begins to blackmail him.

title: Boy Meets Curl
desc: Homer and Marge become members of the U.S. Olympic curling team. At the games, Lisa becomes addicted to collecting pins, and Bart tries to save her.

title: The Color Yellow
desc: While searching for an admirable ancestor for a class project, Lisa discovers the story of a relative named Eliza Simpson, who may or may not have helped a slave escape to freedom.

title: Postcards from the Wedge
desc: When Bart unsuccessfully tries to play Homer and Marge against each other, he comes up with a dangerous prank that is sure to get their attention.

title: Stealing First Base
desc: Bart gets Springfield Elementary School in legal trouble when he kisses the enigmatic daughter of two lawyers, while Lisa is depressed about being ostracized because she is smart.

title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed
desc: Ned takes the Simpsons on a pilgrimage to Israel in order to try and save Homer, but soon discovers that he may not be worth saving.

title: American History X-cellent
desc: Mr Burns is sent to prison for art theft, where a scary inmate introduces him to religion. Meanwhile Smithers becomes the boss at the plant, and Bart and Lisa try to share an ant farm.

title: Chief of Hearts
desc: Homer and Chief Wiggum's new friendship is put to the test when the chief becomes needy after being shot, while Marge suspects that Bart may be dealing drugs.

title: The Squirt and the Whale
desc: After a violent storm, Lisa tries to rally the townspeople and come to the rescue of a beached whale.

title: To Surveil, with Love
desc: Springfield covers the town with surveillance cameras after Homer creates a bomb scare at the train station. Meanwhile, Lisa considers becoming a brunette so that people will take her more seriously.

title: Moe Letter Blues
desc: Homer, Apu and Reverend Lovejoy all suspect that Moe may have left with one of their wives after receiving a mysterious letter, but which one is it?

title: The Bob Next Door
desc: Bart is convinced that the Simpsons' new friendly, unassuming neighbor is actually Sideshow Bob in disguise.

title: Judge Me Tender
desc: Moe's gruff and abrasive personality makes him the perfect hyper-critical judge, and lands him a spot on American Idol. Meanwhile, Homer makes Marge uncomfortable when he starts spending more time at home with Moe's now closed.

title: Elementary School Musical
desc: While Homer and Bart accompany Krusty to Oslo so he can receive the Nobel Peace Prize, Marge enrolls Lisa for a week in performing arts camp.

title: Loan-a Lisa
desc: Lisa uses the $50 she receives from Grandpa to give Nelson a microloan to jump-start his bicycle business, but soon comes to regret the decision.

title: MoneyBart
desc: Lisa takes over as manager of Bart's baseball team and uses statistical analysis to build a winner, but she takes all of the fun out of it and causes Bart to quit the team.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXI
desc: A Satanic board game causes other popular board games to come to life, Homer and Marge rescue a possible killer and let him on their boat, and a parody of "Twilight" where Lisa falls for a young vampire.

title: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
desc: When Lisa discovers that Marge was also a model student, she tries to find out where everything changed so that she doesn't repeat her mistakes. Meanwhile, a series of chance accidents cause Bart to replace Nelson as school bully.

title: The Fool Monty
desc: After Mr. Burns finds out that he is dying, he has an accident and loses his memory, and all the townspeople use the situation to get their revenge on him.

title: How Munched Is That Birdie in the Window?
desc: Bart adopts a carrier pigeon, but Santa's Little Helper eats it.

title: The Fight Before Christmas
desc: Marge gets depressed when the rest of the family does not get into the holiday spirit, and she writes a letter, hoping to get some help; Mr. Burns and Moe's new friend delay the Simpsons as they attempt to travel to Hawaii for the holiday.

title: Donnie Fatso
desc: Homer goes to prison after attempting to get out of a series of fines with a bribe, but agrees to a reduced sentence by informing on Fat Tony for the FBI.

title: Moms I'd Like to Forget
desc: Bart sets out to uncover the origins of a sword-shaped scar on his hand; Marge reconnects with three friends she fell out with years ago.

title: Flaming Moe
desc: Moe tries to keep his 'straightness' a secret when he opens a gay bar; Skinner falls for a new teacher.

title: Homer the Father
desc: Homer picks up parenting advice from an 80s sitcom; Bart becomes involved in trading nuclear secrets.

title: The Blue and the Gray
desc: Moe employs Homer as his wing man, only to find Homer has more luck with the ladies than he does; Marge finds her first gray hair.

title: Angry Dad: The Movie
desc: Bart's "Angry Dad" character gets his own movie, but when the movie starts winning awards, Homer tries to hog all the credit.

title: The Scorpion's Tale
desc: Lisa's school project leads to the discovery of a new drug that makes the elderly less cranky and more tolerable.

title: A Midsummer's Nice Dreams
desc: After Tommy Chong walks away from the Cheech & Chong reunion tour, Homer goes on the road as his replacement. Meanwhile, Marge tries to help the cat lady with her hoarding problem.

title: Love Is a Many Strangled Thing
desc: The tables are turned for Homer and Bart after a therapist cures Homer of his violent tendencies toward the boy.

title: The Great Simpsina
desc: The family is greeted by folk singer Ewell Freestone when they visit a peach farm, but when Marge goes overboard with peach-inspired dishes, Lisa and Bart try to get rid of the unwanted fruit. Later, Lisa becomes a magician's apprentice to the legendary Great Raymondo who helps her develop her craft, but a schoolgirl crush clouds her judgment when she is coaxed into r... Read all

title: The Real Housewives of Fat Tony
desc: Selma falls in love with and marries Fat Tony, and Lisa discovers that Bart has a skill for finding truffles.

title: Homer Scissorhands
desc: Homer opens his own salon after he discovers that he has skills as a hair stylist, and Lisa becomes suspicious after Millhouse gets a 5th grade girlfriend.

title: 500 Keys
desc: While Homer takes the Duff Blimp for a joyride, Lisa discovers a secret room in the basement of Sprinfield Elementary School.

title: The Ned-Liest Catch
desc: When Krabbapple gets suspended and put into detention after hurting Bart, Bart tries to break her out, but it ends that Flanders is the one that saves her life. But soon, Ned figures out that Edna has also dated other men such as Homer, Skinner Comic Book Guy and Aerosmith drummer Joey Kramer.

title: The Falcon and the D'Ohman
desc: Homer tries to befriend the new security guard at the nuclear power plant, who for some unknown reason isn't interested and keeps having flashbacks to his violent past as a government agent.

title: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
desc: Superintendant Chalmers gets fired after using unconventional methods to teach Bart and his friends about Teddy Roosevelt, so the boys take over Springfield Elementary until he gets his old job back.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXII
desc: Homer takes a dangerous dive into an isolated canyon on Candy Peak, but when a crashing boulder traps his arm, he channels Aron Ralston to save himself. In "The Diving Bell and Butterball," the first of three hair-raising Halloween tales, a venomous spider bite leaves Homer paralyzed, but when Lisa discovers Homer's ability to communicate through natural gases, he is ... Read all

title: Replaceable You
