desc: Homer is betrayed by his new assistant at work and winds up working for her, and Bart and Martin create a science project that brings joy to the seniors at the Springfield Retirement Castle.

title: The Food Wife
desc: Homer is worried that he is no longer the cool parent after Marge, Bart, and Lisa become foodies.

title: The Book Job
desc: Homer and Bart put together a team to author the next successful tween novel franchise and make a million dollars, but discover that they need Lisa's help to pull it off.

title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
desc: Homer gets promoted to accounts manager at the nuclear power plant, but soon learns the job robs you of your soul. Meanwhile, Lisa introduces Bart to "Little Women."

title: The Ten-Per-Cent Solution
desc: Krusty the Clown is stuck in a rut when the television network pulls his show from the air and his talent agency drops him as a client. But when the Simpsons introduce him to seasoned agent Annie, they are surprised to learn that Annie was Krusty's very first agent. Despite their rocky relationship, Annie is convinced to re-sign Krusty and craft his career comeback. B... Read all

title: Holidays of Future Passed
desc: Thirty years in the future the Simpsons get together for Christmas. Bart and Lisa are struggling as parents to connect with their children.

title: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson
desc: Homer becomes the host of a popular political talk show, starts an "everyman" movement in Springfield, and ends up hand-picking Ted Nugent as the Republican nominee for president.

title: The D'oh-cial Network
desc: Lisa creates an online social network that becomes a Springfield obsession, but later becomes a victim of user backlash.

title: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
desc: While Bart tries to regain Milhouse's friendship, Moe's bar cleaning rag tells his unlikely story of how he got to where he is today.

title: The Daughter Also Rises
desc: Lisa falls for an adventurous, Hemingway-esque young boy, while Bart and Millhouse set out to bust all the myths that surround Springfield Elementary School.

title: At Long Last Leave
desc: The town votes to kick the Simpsons out of Springfield, so they decide to move to the Outlands.

title: Exit Through the Kwik-E-Mart
desc: Bart becomes an urban vandal and decides to use Homer as his inspiration, while Apu hits hard times when a new trendy market takes all the Kwik-E-Mart customers.

title: How I Wet Your Mother
desc: The family break into Homer's dreams Inception-style after he begins wetting the bed.

title: Them, Robot
desc: Mr. Burns replaces all of the nuclear plant employees with robots--except for Homer, who stays along to supervise the robots and serve as a human scapegoat.

title: Beware My Cheating Bart
desc: Jimbo's girlfriend cheats on Jimbo with Bart, and Homer uses his new treadmill to catch up on a TV series about plane crash victims stranded on an island.

title: A Totally Fun Thing Bart Will Never Do Again
desc: Bart gets the family to take the cruise vacation of his dreams, and then launches a fiendish plot to ensure that it goes on forever.

title: The Spy Who Learned Me
desc: Homer uses his paid sick leave to improve his marriage, with the help of his imaginary friend, super-spy Stradivarius Cain. Meanwhile, Bart gets revenge on Nelson for stealing everyone's lunch money.

title: Ned 'N Edna's Blend Agenda
desc: After Ned and Edna announce publicly that they were secretly married, the two clash over how to raise Rod and Todd.

title: Lisa Goes Gaga
desc: After a desperate attempt by Lisa to become more popular backfires, Lady Gaga shows up in Springfield to help her with her self-esteem.

title: Moonshine River
desc: The Simpsons go back to New York City so that Bart can find his old girlfriend Mary Spuckler. Meanwhile, Lisa and Marge spend the trip trying to take in New York culture on the cheap.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXIII
desc: A black hole threatens to swallow Springfield, Homer tries to find the source of paranormal activity, and a "Back to the Future" parody in which Bart keeps Marge from marrying Homer.

title: Adventures in Baby-Getting
desc: Marge decides that she wants another baby, but Homer doesn't want one. Meanwhile, Bart tries to figure out where Lisa is secretly going after school.

title: Gone Abie Gone
desc: Homer invests Lisa's college fund on an online poker site. Meanwhile Abe disappears from the Springfield Retirement Castle.

title: Penny-Wiseguys
desc: Fat Tony has to serve jury duty, and his clerk, Dan, must run the mafia while he's gone. Meanwhile, Lisa considers making a disgusting change to her diet.

title: A Tree Grows in Springfield
desc: Homer becomes addicted to his new tablet computer. But when it is destroyed Homer becomes despondent, until he finds and provides hope for Springfield in the most unlikely place.

title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
desc: Homer befriends a hipster and invites his family to move in next door. However, their friendship soon sours as Springfield is transformed into a haven for "coolness."

title: To Cur with Love
desc: When Homer shows no remorse over almost losing Santa's Little Helper, Grandpa tells everyone the story of Homer's childhood dog.

title: Homer Goes to Prep School
desc: Homer joins the "Springfield Preppers," an off-the-grid survivalist group whose leader has set up a top-secret retreat outside of town to prepare for the end of the world.

title: A Test Before Trying
desc: The fate of Springfield Elementary rests on Bart and his test scores, and Homer finds way to make money with his own parking meter.

title: Changing of the Guardian
desc: Homer and Marge find the perfect young couple and ask them to be the guardians for the kids in case something happens to them.

title: Love Is a Many Splintered Thing
desc: Mary Spuckler returns to Springfield and begins a relationship with Bart. However, Bart treats her with disrespect.

title: Hardly Kirk-ing
desc: Bart poses Millhouse as his father so that they can do adult activities, and Homer becomes skilled at finding lost objects thanks to Highlights magazine.

title: Gorgeous Grampa
desc: Homer's obsession with the TV show "Storage Battles" leads the family to discover Grampa's past identity as "Gorgeous Godfrey," the most feared, villainous man in pro-wrestling history

title: Black-Eyed, Please
desc: Ned gets fed up with Homer and punches him in the eye, and Lisa is a bullying victim from her new substitute teacher.

title: Dark Knight Court
desc: When Bart is accused of a prank he says he didn't commit, Lisa is forced to defend him in youth court, with former attorney general Janet Reno serving as judge.

title: What Animated Women Want
desc: Homer contemplates his next move after getting in the doghouse with Marge, while Millhouse's new Stanley Kowalski-inspired persona makes him suddenly attractive to Lisa.

title: Pulpit Friction
desc: Springfield gets a bedbug scare, the new assistant pastor at church appoints Homer as a deacon, and Marge loses her wedding dress.

title: Whiskey Business
desc: A new makeover could put Moe in a position to make big money, Bart fails at his job of taking care of Grandpa, and Lisa fights the shameless exploitation of Bleeding Gums Murphy's likeness.

title: The Fabulous Faker Boy
desc: Bart takes piano lessons from a cute Russian girl, Marge tries to teach the girl's father how to drive, and Homer loses the last of his hair.

title: Dangers on a Train
desc: When Marge tries to buy Homer snack cakes for their anniversary, she winds up meeting a married man who shares a common love of British television.

title: The Saga of Carl
desc: Homer, Moe, Lenny and Carl win the lottery, but Carl steals the ticket and leaves with the money for Iceland.

title: Homerland
desc: Homer returns from a nuclear power convention a changed man, and Lisa begins to suspect that he has become a domestic terrorist.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXIV
desc: The scariest Simpsons Halloween show yet, featuring an opening by Guillermo Del Toro.

title: Four Regrettings and a Funeral
desc: While attending a funeral, Homer, Marge, Mr. Burns, and Kent Brockman recall a past regret and try to find a way to rectify the situation.

title: YOLO
desc: Homer is stunned to learn he'll only live once. A pen pal from his youth helps him live that life to its fullest. Meanwhile Springfield Elementary institutes an honor code.

title: Labor Pains
desc: Homer helps take care of a child that he delivered in an elevator, and Lisa tries to organize the Springfield Atoms cheerleaders against the team's greedy owner.

title: The Kid Is All Right
desc: Lisa is distressed when she discovers that her new friend is a Republican, and they wind up running against each other as Springfield Elementary's second grade representative.

title: Yellow Subterfuge
desc: Principal Skinner promises the students that the best-behaved can take a ride in a submarine. Bart believes his past indiscretions will be forgotten. Lisa tries to help Krusty by suggesting him to sell the foreign rights to his shows.

title: White Christmas Blues
desc: When a sudden tourist spike means that the family cannot afford Christmas, the Simpsons open up their house to boarders.

title: Steal This Episode
desc: Fed up with the high price of Hollywood films, Homer begins screening pirated movies in his backyard, but is busted by the FBI after Marge turns him in.

title: Married to the Blob
desc: Comic Book Guy seeks romantic advice from Homer when he falls for a Japanese woman who's interested in manga.

title: Specs and the City
desc: Mr. Burns' Christmas present to his employees, a pair of augmented reality glasses, places a strain on Homer and Marge's relationship. Meanwhile, Bart wrestles with giving a Valentine's Day card to Nelson.

title: The Man Who Grew Too Much
desc: Lisa becomes friends with Sideshow Bob, who now has a new job working with genetically-altered foods. Meanwhile, Marge becomes frustrated teaching abstinence for the church.

title: Diggs
desc: Bart becomes friends with a schoolmate who enjoys falconry, but turns out to be mentally disturbed.

title: The Winter of His Content
desc: When Abe and two of his friends move in with the Simpsons after the Springfield Retirement Castle closes, Homer begins to embrace their lifestyle. Meanwhile, Nelson initiates Bart into the bully group after coming to his defense.

title: The War of Art
desc: The friendship between the Simpsons and the Van Houtens is challenged when a painting the Simpsons buy from the Van Houtens' yard sale is discovered to be extremely valuable.

title: You Don't Have to Live Like a Referee
desc: Homer becomes a referee for the World Cup and finds himself tested by bribers when the Simpsons travel to Brazil.

title: Luca$
desc: Marge becomes worried when Lisa starts dating a competitive eater-in-training, while Bart receives gifts from Snake Jailbird for helping him out.

title: Days of Future Future
desc: Thirty years into the future, Bart is having trouble dealing with his divorce, Lisa is struggling with her marriage to Milhouse, and Marge is finally fed up after burying yet another Homer clone.

title: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting
desc: Bart becomes a savior to Springfield couples trying to conceive when he inadvertently uses voodoo to get his art teacher pregnant.

title: Brick Like Me
desc: The Lego version of Homer begins to suspect that his entire Lego world is not real when a toy triggers a flashback to an alternate reality.

title: Pay Pal
desc: When Homer ruins his and Marge's chances of making a new couple friend, Marge decides to concentrate on finding a friend for Lisa. However, Lisa suddenly makes a new friend on her own.

title: The Yellow Badge of Cowardge
desc: Bart wins the annual "last day of school" race - with a little help from Nelson - and Homer attempts to bring back 4th of July fireworks, which have been canceled due to low budget cuts.

title: Clown in the Dumps
desc: Krusty has a crisis of conscience and retires from show business after his father dies before ever approving of his career. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes worried about Homer's health and life expectancy.

title: The Wreck of the Relationship
desc: Homer and Bart turn to the open seas to improve their relationship, and Marge becomes a trash talking victim after she drafts Homer's fantasy football team.

title: Super Franchise Me
desc: Marge opens a sandwich franchise store after her sandwiches become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. But running day-to-day at the store proves challenging, especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXV
desc: The 25th annual 'Simpsons' Halloween special includes an alternate dimension, a "Clockwork Orange"-style gang led by Moe and a visit from the Tracey Ullman-era Simpsons.

title: Opposites A-Frack
desc: An Assemblywoman brought in by Lisa to stop Mr. Burns' fracking operation ends up falling for him as much as he does for her.

title: Simpsorama
desc: The Simpsons meet the Planet Express crew, who have come to Springfield in the present to stop them from destroying the future.

title: Blazed and Confused
desc: Bart tricks his family into a camping trip at a strange event known as "Blazing Guy" so that he can get revenge on his sadistic new fourth grade teacher.

title: Covercraft
desc: Homer forms a cover band with other dads in town when he takes up bass guitar to deal with a mid-life crisis, but the band's modest success is soon overwhelmed by Apu's breakout potential.

title: I Won't Be Home for Christmas
desc: Marge kicks Homer out of the house for Christmas after he consoles Moe on Christmas Eve instead of going home.

title: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
desc: An amusement park ride takes the Simpsons to the home planet of Kang and Kodos.

title: Bart's New Friend
desc: Homer is hypnotized into believing he's ten years old and ends up stuck in his new age when the hypnotist dies, so he bonds with Bart and refuses to take back the responsibilities of adulthood.

title: The Musk Who Fell to Earth
desc: Inventor Elon Musk comes to Springfield, and Homer inspires him with a new idea that could revolutionize Springfield, but winds up costing Mr. Burns a ton of money.

title: Walking Big & Tall
desc: Marge tries to get Homer to lose weight. But instead, he finds a support group that encourages him to embrace his largeness.

title: My Fare Lady
desc: Marge gets a job as a driver for a transportation app service, while Moe is forced to work as a janitor at the nuclear plant after Homer causes the bar to go bankrupt.

title: The Princess Guide
desc: Moe falls in love with a Nigerian princess whose father is working out a uranium deal with Mr. Burns.

title: Sky Police
desc: The congregation, led by Marge, is forced to resort to gambling in order to collect money to fix the church, which Chief Wiggum destroyed with a jet pack he received by mistake.

title: Waiting for Duffman
desc: After "Duffman" retires, Homer wins a reality competition to become his replacement. But his contract states that he cannot drink beer, which gives him a new perspective on alcohol.

title: Peeping Mom
desc: Marge decides to follow Bart everywhere until he confesses to being involved in a bulldozer crash. Meanwhile, Homer ignores Santa's Little Helper when Ned gets a new dog.

title: The Kids Are All Fight
desc: The story of Bart and Lisa's rivalry is told when Homer finds an old film strip.

title: Let's Go Fly a Coot
desc: Bart takes up smoking e-cigarettes to impress Milhouse's cousin Annika while the rest of the family learns about Grampa's days in the Air Force.

title: Bull-E
desc: Bart gets bullied at a school dance, so Marge gets an anti-bullying law passed, which results in Homer being put in therapy for bulling Ned.

title: Mathlete's Feat
desc: Groundskeeper Willie becomes the coach of the mathletes, Lisa and other kids from Springfield Elementary compete against Waverly Hills Elementary.

title: Every Man's Dream
desc: Marge decides it's finally time to separate from Homer, and quickly moves on with her life. Homer is initially devastated, but soon stumbles into a romance with a younger woman.

title: 'Cue Detective
desc: A celebrity television chef challenges Homer to a barbecue cook-off. But before the competition, Homer's new, prized barbecue grill is stolen.

title: Puffless
desc: Patty and Selma try to quit smoking, but Patty moves in with the Simpsons when Selma takes it up again. Meanwhile, Maggie goes on an adventure with some local creatures.

title: Halloween of Horror
desc: The Simpsons are proud to be the most festively decorated house on the block. But when Lisa is traumatized at Krustyland Horror Night, she feels she cannot handle Halloween anymore.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXVI
desc: After killing Bart, Sideshow Bob doesn't know what to do with himself; Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss; Because of radiation, Lisa, Bart and Milhouse gain super-powers.

title: Friend with Benefit
desc: Lisa makes a new friend at school - Harper, who happens to be super-rich, while Homer makes friends with Harper's dad and sets out to continue living the good life when Lisa decides to end the friendship.

title: Lisa with an "S"
desc: Broadway legend Laney Fontaine transforms Lisa into a show-biz kid after Homer loses her chance at band camp.

title: Paths of Glory
desc: Lisa tries to restore the reputation of a forgotten Springfield female inventor, while Bart takes full advantage of a diagnosis that he is a sociopath.

title: Barthood
desc: A tale of Bart's journey from youth to adulthood, where he is constantly in search of approval from his father and in the shadow of his more-successful younger sister.

title: The Girl Code
desc: When Homer loses his job due to Marge's social media post, he begins working as a dishwasher at a Greek restaurant. Meanwhile, Lisa creates an app that can predict the effect any post on social media will have.

title: Teenage Mutant Milk-Caused Hurdles
desc: Bart and Principal Skinner battle over the affection of Bart's new teacher, and a new milk-based product that Homer buys from the Kwik-E-Mart causes big changes in Bart and Lisa.

title: Much Apu About Something
desc: Apu's nephew makes big changes when he takes over the Kwik-E-Mart business, and Bart decides that he's through with being bad after his latest prank spirals out of control.

title: Love Is in the N2-O2-Ar-CO2-Ne-He-CH4
desc: Professor Frink's new invention turns him into a ladies' man, while a new pill at the Springfield Retirement Castle causes Grandpa to hallucinate back to his happiest moments.

title: Gal of Constant Sorrow
desc: Lisa tries to launch the career of a homeless Appalachian folk singer, but Bart warns her that she will just let her down. Meanwhile, Homer tries to rescue the cat, who is trapped in the walls of the house.

title: Lisa the Veterinarian
desc: Lisa takes a job as veterinarian's assistant, but soon lets the responsibilities of the job get to her head. Meanwhile, Marge decides to take a job as a crime scene cleaner.

title: The Marge-ian Chronicles
desc: Lisa signs up for an opportunity to be part of a mission to colonize Mars in ten years, and Homer's strategy to use reverse psychology to talk her out of it backfires.

title: The Burns Cage
desc: Homer tries to raise Smithers' spirits by finding him a man, and Lisa gets the lead in the school production of "Casablanca" alongside a new male student, sparking Millhouse's jealousy.

title: How Lisa Got Her Marge Back
desc: After Lisa overhears Marge say that she doesn't like Lisa's jazz music, Marge takes Lisa on a trip to Capitol City to regain her friendship. Meanwhile, Bart uses Maggie as his new partner in crime for his practical jokes.

title: Fland Canyon
desc: Maggie will not go to sleep, so Homer tells her a bedtime story about when the Simpsons and the Flanders went to the Grand Canyon together.

title: To Courier with Love
desc: After promising Marge the trip of a lifetime, Homer makes a deal with a travel agent to be a courier of a top-secret briefcase in exchange for a discounted family vacation to Paris.

title: Simprovised
desc: While trying to overcome a fear of public speaking, Homer creates an improv comedy troupe; Marge rebuilds Bart's treehouse.

title: Orange Is the New Yellow
desc: Marge lets Bart go to the park alone because he's too irritating, then she ends up getting arrested for leaving him unsupervised.

title: Monty Burns' Fleeing Circus
desc: Mr. Burns puts on a variety show at the Springfield Bowl.

title: Friends and Family
desc: Homer finds a new friend in a woman who acts just like him when Mr. Burns hires the other Simpsons as his live-in virtual reality family.

title: The Town
desc: Homer takes the family on a "hate-cation" to Boston after he catches Bart rooting for a rival football team.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXVII
desc: The children of Springfield fight to the death, Hunger Games style; Lisa's imaginary friend kills her real friends; Moe recruits Bart into his group of covert barfly agents.

title: Trust But Clarify
desc: Bart and Lisa investigate Krusty's new candy; Marge helps Homer dress for a promotion; Kent Brockman struggles with the changing media world.

title: There Will Be Buds
desc: Homer coaches the kids' lacrosse team with Kirk Van Houten, who disappears before the championship game, after Homer rants about him being a loser.

title: Havana Wild Weekend
desc: The Simpsons go to Cuba to get Grampa cheap medical care when the Retirement Castle and V.A. hospital are unable to solve his health problems.

title: Dad Behavior
desc: Homer discovers an app that makes his life easier, while Grampa learns that he'll be a father again.

title: The Last Traction Hero
desc: Homer is placed in a cast following a workplace accident, leading Marge to receive romance from an unexpected source; Lisa attempts to keep the peace as bus monitor.

title: The Nightmare After Krustmas
desc: Krusty and his daughter spend Christmas with the Simpsons; Reverend Lovejoy seeks converts to boost attendance at church; A Christmas toy scares Maggie.

title: Pork and Burns
desc: A Japanese book on minimalism inspires Marge to adapt to a new way of living, so the Simpsons have to part with items that no longer bring them joy.

title: The Great Phatsby
desc: Mr Burns tries to relive his glory days, and crosses paths with a mysterious music mogul.

title: Fatzcarraldo
desc: When all the fast food restaurants in Springfield become healthy, Homer turns to the last bastion of greasy food for comfort; Lisa must find a good news story when her school radio station is in jeopardy.

title: The Cad and the Hat
desc: Bart ruins Lisa's perfect day out of jealousy and becomes haunted by the manifestation of his guilty conscious. Homer is revealed to be a master chess player which helps him bond with his competitive dad.

title: Kamp Krustier
desc: Bart and Lisa return home following a traumatic incident at Kamp Krusty, putting an end to Homer and Marge's sexual encounters.

title: 22 for 30
desc: A mocumentary about how Bart became a star basketball player at Springfield Elementary only to fall prey to fame, his own ego and the schemes of mobster Fat Tony.

title: A Father's Watch
desc: As Homer and Marge try a different parenting style on the hellraising Bart, Grampa gives him a special watch that becomes Bart's moral center. But Bart loses it and tries everything to get it back.

title: The Caper Chase
desc: Mr. Burns opens his own for-profit university, hiring the completely unqualified Homer as a professor, only to lose him to a mad scientist.

title: Looking for Mr. Goodbart
desc: Bart bonds with Skinner's mother over their mutual dislike of Skinner and realizes that he could make a bundle by befriending other lonely and disgruntled grandmothers of Springfield for money.

title: Moho House
desc: Mr. Burns makes a bet with his old friend that nothing can break Homer and Marge apart. But that's where Moe comes in.

title: Dogtown
desc: After a successful animal rights campaign, all dogs in Springfield are allowed to go where they want and do what they want. Pack mentality quickly kicks in and the dogs of Springfield assert their dominance by threatening the people.

title: The Serfsons
desc: In a medieval world, Lisa is forced to use illegal magic when Marge's mother is turned into an Ice Walker.

title: Springfield Splendor
desc: Lisa's sad experience is adapted into a graphic novel, which becomes a Broadway show.

title: Whistler's Father
desc: Homer launches Maggie's baby-celebrity career with her whistling talent; Marge is hired to style Fat Tony's brothel.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXVIII
desc: Maggie gets possessed by a demon; Lisa discovers a creepy/perfect version of her family in an alternative universe; Homer cannibalizes himself.

title: Grampy Can Ya Hear Me
desc: Grampa gets a hearing aid and finally hears what everyone has been saying about him.

title: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used To Be
desc: Marge runs for mayor and uses Homer as the butt of her jokes to gain public support.

title: Singin' in the Lane
desc: Homer gets his old bowling team back together and they wind up competing with arrogant millionaires.

title: Mr. Lisa's Opus
desc: In the future, Lisa writes a college application essay to Harvard and recalls disappointing past birthdays that helped shape her.

title: Gone Boy
desc: When Bart goes missing, the town puts together a search party to find him.

title: Haw-Haw Land
desc: Lisa falls for a crooning jazz pianist named Brendan; Bart discovers he has an affinity for chemistry.

title: Frink Gets Testy
desc: Mr. Burns builds a doomsday ark after he believes the world is ending; Professor Frink is tasked with determining who is worth saving.

title: Homer is Where the Art Isn't
desc: Homer is accused of stealing a multimillion-dollar painting and only freelance insurance investigator Manacek can prove his innocence or guilt.

title: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
desc: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they went from loving life without kids to being miserable parents.

title: Fears of a Clown
desc: Bart goes to prankster rehab after a clown-mask prank terrifies the town and ruins Krusty's career causing him to give up comedy and try serious drama.

title: No Good Read Goes Unpunished
desc: Marge forces everyone to give up their electronics and go to the book store in an effort to bring the family together.

title: King Leer
desc: Homer and Marge attempt to reunite Moe with his troubled family.

title: Lisa Gets the Blues
desc: The Simpsons' flight to Gainesville gets re-routed to New Orleans, where Lisa must regain her confidence as a jazz musician.

title: Forgive and Regret
desc: On his deathbed, Grampa makes a confession to Homer about the notes from Homer's mother that got lost when she left. This angers Homer to the point of refusing to reconcile with Abe after he miraculously recovers.

title: Left Behind
desc: Homer gets Flanders a job at the power plant; Marge feels there's no spark left in their marriage.

title: Throw Grampa from the Dane
desc: The Simpsons go to Denmark so Grampa can benefit from its free health-care system.

title: Flanders' Ladder
desc: When Bart falls into a coma after he is struck by lightning, he is visited by ghosts seeking closure.

title: Bart's Not Dead
desc: Bart ends up in the hospital after taking a dare and lies about going to heaven to cover it up, but Homer takes a deal with Christian producers to make a movie about it.

title: Heartbreak Hotel
desc: Marge and Homer travel to a tropical island and go on Marge's favorite reality competition program to win a million dollars.

title: My Way or the Highway to Heaven
desc: While God and St. Peter discuss who will get into heaven, the citizens of Springfield recall divine encounters.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXIX
desc: Homer wins an oyster-eating contest against the mythical Cthulhu, Springfield is overrun by plant body-snatchers, Lisa finally snaps and Mr. Burns opens a retirement home with some Jurassic upgrades.

title: Baby You Can't Drive My Car
desc: A self-driving car company comes to Springfield, poaching all of the power plant employees with their fun work environment.

title: From Russia Without Love
desc: Bart, Nelson and Milhouse get a mail-order bride for Moe as a hardcore prank.

title: Werking Mom
desc: In search of a job, Marge gets one selling plastic food storage containers - as a drag queen; Lisa tries to make the world better.

title: Krusty the Clown
desc: Krusty hides out at a circus after he nearly kills Homer, who becomes a TV recapper and gives him a bad grade.

title: Daddicus Finch
desc: Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge attempts to help Homer balance attention between the kids.

title: 'Tis the 30th Season
desc: Marge is determined to fix Christmas following a failed Black Friday shopping spree, but Homer and the kids surprise her with a vacation in Florida.

title: Mad About the Toy
desc: Motivated by a PTSD episode Grampa had while babysitting the kids, the Simpsons take a journey to Grampa's past as a post-WW2 toy model for plastic army men, and Abe finally faces his on confused sexuality.

title: The Girl on the Bus
desc: Lisa tries to live a double life when she makes a new friend and gets a taste of what it would be like to live with a more cultured family.

title: I'm Dancing as Fat as I Can
desc: Homer tries to make amends for binging his and Marge's favorite show without her; Bart prepares for "Krusty's Holiday Trample".

title: The Clown Stays in the Picture
desc: On Marc Maron's podcast, Krusty reveals the untold story of his past movie project, The Sands of Space. Hearing the podcast, Bart and Lisa learn their parents were production assistants on the movie in the early days of their relationship.

title: 101 Mitigations
desc: Homer steals Comic Book Guy's car and must either prove his innocence in court or reconcile with him.

title: I Want You (She's So Heavy)
desc: When a romantic night ends in injury for Homer and Marge, Lisa turns to an unlikely source to fix their strained relationship.

title: E My Sports
desc: Homer discovers a passion for coaching Bart in video game competitions; Lisa's plan to bring Homer back to reality creates chaos.

title: Bart vs. Itchy & Scratchy
desc: Bart's friends start a boys rights activist group to protest Krusty's all-female reboot of Itchy and Scratchy. When they catch Bart enjoying it, they kick him out, so he joins Bossy Riot, a militant feminist gang of sixth-grade girls.

title: Girl's in the Band
desc: Homer works extra shifts at the plant so Lisa can play in the Capitol City Youth Philharmonic.

title: I'm Just a Girl Who Can't Say D'oh
desc: Marge becomes Director of Springfield's local theater, armed with Lisa's script resembling "Hamilton"; Homer joins a baby class with Maggie, and takes a liking to supervisor Chloe.

title: D'oh Canada
desc: Lisa is mistakenly given political asylum in Canada during a family trip to Niagara Falls.

title: Woo-Hoo Dunnit?
desc: The documentary crime series "Dateline: Springfield" goes in-depth to solve the case of Lisa's missing college fund.

title: Crystal Blue-Haired Persuasion
desc: Marge starts a business selling healing crystals and other New Age products to the naive mothers of Springfield when Homer's job cuts children's health-care benefits, leading Marge to use the crystals as a cheaper solution for Bart's ADD.

title: The Winter of Our Monetized Content
desc: Bart and Homer become social media celebrities when a video of them fighting goes viral; Lisa fights the school's new industrialized detention system.

title: Go Big or Go Homer
desc: Homer inspires a 35-year-old millennial who idolizes him to start his own business, which leads the mob to chase both of them.

title: The Fat Blue Line
desc: When the wrong man is arrested for pickpocketing Springfield during the San Castellaneta street festival, Chief Wiggum sets out to catch the real criminal.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXX
desc: The 30th Treehouse of Horror features a demon Maggie, a mission to rescue Milhouse from another dimension, dead-Homer's spirit trying on some new bodies for size and Selma finally finding love in an unlikely place - the alien in the basement.

title: Gorillas on the Mast
desc: After visiting Aquatraz Water Park, Lisa and Bart set out to free from captivity the most vicious animals in Springfield. Homer fulfills a lifelong dream and buys a boat, only to realize how much boat ownership sucks.

title: Marge the Lumberjill
desc: Marge becomes a competitive lumberjack and goes on a month-long retreat to Portland with her trainer, whom Homer fears will take his wife away from him.

title: Livin la Pura Vida
desc: The Simpsons join other Springfield families on the Van Houtens' annual trip to Costa Rica, where Homer befriends Patty's new girlfriend and Lisa discovers how the Van Houtens are able to afford this trip every year.

title: Thanksgiving of Horror
desc: The Simpsons face various Thanksgiving nightmares, including the first Thanksgiving, an A.I. mishap and a dangerous space mission complicated by a sentient cranberry sauce.

title: Todd, Todd, Why Hast Thou Forsaken Me?
desc: Todd blames God for his mother's death and rejects his faith, so Ned sends him to live with the Simpsons, hoping they can scare him into believing in God again.

title: Bobby, It's Cold Outside
desc: Sideshow Bob gets the role of Santa Claus at Santa's Village amusement park. Meanwhile, someone is stealing all the Christmas packages off people's front porches.

title: Hail to the Teeth
desc: Homer and Marge attend Artie Ziff's wedding and become quite uncomfortable when they realize that his bride-to-be is a clone of Marge.

title: The Miseducation of Lisa Simpson
desc: The sea captain finds treasure for which he's been searching for 40 years, but City Hall claims it since it was in city limits. Marge convinces the townspeople to use the windfall to build a STEM school. Homer crusades against automation.

title: Frinkcoin
desc: Professor Frink invents a cryptocurrency that makes him the richest man in Springfield, a title Mr. Burns has no intention of giving up.

title: Bart the Bad Guy
desc: Bart uses spoilers for a superhero movie he saw to get what he wants, but two movie executives will stop at nothing to keep his knowledge secret.

title: Screenless
desc: Marge implements a limit on screen time for the whole family, only to realize she's the one addicted to screens.

title: Better Off Ned
desc: Jealous of Bart's bond with Ned, Homer mentors Nelson in retaliation, but an act of heroism helps Homer to regain Bart's respect.

title: Highway to Well
desc: Marge gets a job at an upscale cannabis dispensary leading Homer to open a competing business that replicates the scuzzy days of scoring weed from and old-school pot connection.

title: The Incredible Lightness of Being a Baby
desc: Maggie reunites with baby Hudson, but Marge isn't too crazy about his mom. Homer befriends Cletus Spuckler who recently discovered a vast underground reserve of helium gas on his property, attracting unwanted attention from Mr. Burns.

title: Warrin' Priests
desc: Reverend Lovejoy investigates the mysterious past of a new priest who's come to town and shaken things up at church.

title: Warrin' Priests Part 2
desc: In Michigan, Reverend Lovejoy learns the true reason why Bode came to Springfield and the congregation must decide whether to banish their new priest.

title: The Hateful Eight-Year-Olds
desc: Lisa joins a group of rich girls when she makes a friend who loves horses; Homer takes Marge on a romantic cruise.

title: The Way of the Dog
desc: The Simpsons explore the tragic past of Santa's Little Helper when he bites Marge.

title: Undercover Burns
desc: Mr. Burns goes undercover at the power plant as an employee named Fred and befriends Homer and the gang, but a jealous Smithers plots to bring the old Burns back.

title: I, Carumbus
desc: At a museum exhibit of Ancient Rome, Marge and Homer imagine themselves in Rome where Homer is more ambitious.

title: Now Museum, Now You Don't
desc: Lisa stays home from school and fantasizes about the history of Western art.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXXI
desc: The 31st annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a frightening look at the 2020 election, parodies of Pixar and Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse and a ninth birthday Lisa just can't get over.

title: The 7 Beer Itch
desc: Homer is tempted by a British femme fatale while Marge and the kids are on a seaside vacation.

title: Podcast News
desc: Grampa is accused of a crime, while Kent Brockman questions his career.

title: Three Dreams Denied
desc: Bart becomes a voice over actor, Comic Book Guy is humiliated at Comic-Con and Lisa is set up for a fall.

title: The Road to Cincinnati
desc: Skinner and Chalmers take an 800-mile car ride to an administrator's convention in Cincinnati.

title: Sorry Not Sorry
desc: Lisa calls Ms. Hoover a hack and refuses to apologize, then learns her private pain.

title: A Springfield Summer Christmas for Christmas
desc: A cable channel films a Christmas movie in Springfield and Skinner falls in love.

title: The Dad-Feelings Limited
desc: The origin story of Comic Book Guy is revealed as he and Kumiko debate having a baby.

title: Diary Queen
desc: Bart learns a surprising secret when he finds Mrs. Krabappel's diary at a yard sale, while Lisa discovers an even bigger surprise.

title: Wad Goals
desc: Bart becomes a successful caddy, but Marge thinks it may ruin his character.

title: Yokel Hero
desc: Cletus becomes a singing sensation and ruins everything when he turns on his fans, while Homer becomes a new man.

title: Do Pizza Bots Dream of Electric Guitars
desc: Homer tries to reunite a mechanical band from his youth, but J.J. Abrams beats him to it.

title: Manger Things
desc: A secret from Flanders' past and a never-before-seen room in the Simpson home are revealed.

title: Uncut Femmes
desc: Sarah Wiggum is more than she seems; Marge participates in a jewel heist.

title: Burger Kings
desc: Mr. Burns joins the plant-based burger business, convincing Lisa that he's changed for the better.

title: Panic on the Streets of Springfield
desc: Lisa's imaginary friend is a depressed British singer from the 1980s; Homer becomes a truck guy.

title: Mother and Child Reunion
desc: In the future, Lisa makes a shocking college decision that hurts Marge, leading to a surprising place.

title: The Man from G.R.A.M.P.A.
desc: A British secret agent comes to Springfield to find a Russian spy.

title: The Last Barfighter
desc: A secret society of bartenders seeks revenge on Homer and his friends when Moe breaks their most sacred rule.

title: The Star of the Backstage
desc: Marge stages a revival of a musical from high school, but her pleasant memories are threatened by the return of her old rival.

title: Bart's in Jail!
desc: When Grampa falls victim to a phone scam, the Simpsons set out to get his money back.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXXII
desc: The 32nd annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a spoof of "Parasite" and a segment where Bambi gets his revenge.

title: The Wayz We Were
desc: Moe is faced with a difficult choice when Evergreen Terrace develops a traffic problem.

title: Lisa's Belly
desc: Lisa reacts to a hurtful word spoken by Marge while Bart gets swole.

title: A Serious Flanders
desc: Homer and Ned get sucked into the violent world of prestige TV when a ruthless debt collector comes to Springfield.

title: A Serious Flanders: Part 2
desc: Things go from bad to worse for Homer and Ned.

title: Portrait of a Lackey on Fire
desc: Smithers finds true love with a famous fashion designer, but this new relationship may destroy Springfield.

title: Mothers and Other Strangers
desc: In a flashback to his teen years, Homer goes on a road trip with his father to search for his mother.

title: A Made Maggie
desc: Fat Tony becomes Maggie's godfather.

title: The Longest Marge
desc: Marge battles Mr. Burns for the soul of a brash young football prodigy.

title: Kuroi kenshi
desc: The Black Swordsman, known as Guts, enters a small village and begins clashing with an army led by evil apostles.

title: Taka no dan
desc: Guts faces a man wearing a large armor suit in one-on-one combat. He also has to go against the Band of Hawk on his journey.

title: Uijin
desc: Griffith defeats Guts, and makes him a member of the Band of the Hawk. The Hawks go on a midnight raid and Griffith chooses Guts for the most important position of rear guard.

title: Kami no te
desc: Guts settles in with the Band of the Hawk, and Griffith shows him his Behelit. Guts remembers his childhood, being raised by his adoptive father and mentor Gambino. Three years pass and the Band of the Hawk grow in power and numbers.

title: Kenpû
desc: Guts is now a commander in Griffith's army, and is taking risks in battle. Griffith is knighted as a viscount in the Midland court to the nobles' dismay. Guts saves the Hawks in battle, to Casca's chagrin.

title: Fushi no Zodd
desc: Guts leads his men to raid a castle under Chuder occupation, but his men are wiped out by Nosferatu Zodd the Immortal, a fearsome giant warrior.

title: Tsurugi no aruji
desc: Though he and Guts are still injured from their encounter with Nosferatu Zodd, Griffith uses it to get closer to the King and his daughter Charlotte. Guts and some of the Hawks feel that Griffith is pulling away from them.

title: Inbou
desc: Griffith and Guts continue to have success in battle and Griffith is made a count. General Yurius is furious about this, and the minister Foss plants the idea of murder in his mind. The plan is to shoot Griffith with a poison arrow during an upcoming hunt.

title: Ansatsu
desc: Griffith and the Princess are growing closer during the hunt when Griffith is shot in the chest with a poisoned arrow.

title: Toutoi mono
desc: Guts assassinates Yurius. But something went wrong and Guts lost himself and then he decide something.

title: Kassen
desc: Griffith and the Hawks lead the march into battle. Where Casca went into Trouble and Guts went to help her. But they both got lost and no one went to search.

title: Futari
desc: Casca tells her story. Griffith helped her save her from being raped.

title: Kesshi gyou
desc: The commander of the Blue Whale Knights and his crew find Guts and Casca. Though completely outnumbered, Guts tells Casca to run and stays to fight. Some men go after Casca, catching her and holding her down in order to rape her. Guts continues fighting.

title: Yume no kagaribi
desc: Guts and Casca are rescued by Judo and his men, and after being treated for their injuries Casca learns of Guts true feelings of being in the Band of the Hawk. And what he plans to do after the war is over.

title: Kessen
desc: Griffith and the Band of the Hawk are given the authority to lead charge that may finally end the 100 year war.

title: Shourisha
desc: The Band of the Hawk leads the final charge of the war, Casca gets some payback for her earlier defeat, and Guts gains some unlikely assistance from an old enemy while fighting a powerful knight.

title: Eikou no shunkan
desc: The Hawk returns victorious in their battle and have a night of well deserved celebration. As another assassination attempt unfolds on Griffith during the festivities.

title: Honoo no bohyou
desc: The conspirators of Griffiths assassination revel in their victory, but how long will it last whenever the plan goes awry. And what will Casca and the Hawk do when Guts makes a decision that will shake them to the core.

title: Wakare
desc: Guts decides to leave the Band of the Hawk unable to bear Griffiths dream any longer. But Griffith won't accept this without a fight.

title: Hibana
desc: Guts stays at an old friends house for a year during his journey. That soon changes after he learns of what happened to the Hawk after he left.

title: Kokuhaku
desc: Guts returns to the Hawk and learns of Griffiths capture. And Casca reveals her true feelings to Guts.

title: Sennyuu
desc: The Band of the Hawk successfully rescues Griffith....but only to find that he is no longer the man they rememeber, which infuriates Guts.

title: Zen'yasai
desc: As the Band of Hawk mourn over their leaders crippling state, Guts makes plans to leave once more with Casca and his men in company. But will his plan change when he learns of Casca's decision to not leave Griffith?

title: Shoku
desc: Griffith, being distraught over his crushed dream, decides to make a sacrifice to regain his lost power.

title: Eien no koku
desc: The Eclipse takes it toll on the Band of the Hawk, as Guts fights to survive against the horrors that will shape him...for better or worse.

title: I'm Luffy! The Man Who Will Become the Pirate King!
desc: Alvida pirates plunder a ship only to find a barrel containing a strange boy names Luffy who is on a quest to find the legendary "One Piece" and become the King of Pirates.

title: The Great Swordsman Appears! Pirate Hunter, Roronoa Zoro
desc: Luffy and Koby arrive at Shell Island where they meet Roronoa Zoro, a bounty hunter held under arrest by Captain Morgan.

title: Morgan vs. Luffy! Who's This Beautiful Young Girl?
desc: Luffy convinces Zoro to join her crew, but they must defeat Captain Morgan first. Meanwhile, Koby is accepted as a marine.

title: Luffy's Past! The Red-haired Shanks Appears!
desc: Luffy reflects on his past and how he came in possession of his Straw Hat.

title: Fear, Mysterious Power! Pirate Clown Captain Buggy!
desc: Nami tricks Luffy into allowing her to turn him over to Buggy as a battle ensues.

title: Desperate Situation! Beast Tamer Mohji vs. Luffy!
desc: After Buggy's defeat Mohji and Richie seek revenge while Luffy meets a small dog guarding his master's store.

title: Sozetsu Ketto! Kengo Zoro VS Kyokugei no Kabaji!
desc: The city's mayor rushes to fight Buggy but the Straw Hat Pirates come to his aid. Zoro fights Cajabi while Luffy faces Buggy himself.

title: Shousha wa docchi? Akuma no mi no nouryoku taiketsu!
desc: Luffy becomes enrages when Buggy rips his straw hat as the battle continues.

title: Seigi no usotsuki? Kyaputen Usoppu
desc: Nami forms an alliance with the Straw Hat Pirates as their navigator as the crew arrives at Syrup Village where they meet Usopp.

title: Chijou saikyou no hen na yatsu! Saiminjutsushi Jango
desc: Luffy and Usopp learn that Kaya's caretaker, Klahadore pairs up with a strange man plot as they plot to kill her.

title: Inbou o abake! Kaizoku shitsuji Kyaputen Kuro
desc: After learning of Captain Kuro's evil plan, Usopp runs back to the village to warn Kaya, only to find that after all his years of lying no one believes him.

title: Gekitotsu! Kuroneko kaizokudan sakamichi no daikoubou!
desc: The Black Cat Pirates lead by Jango will do their move at dawn. In order to protect the village from mayhem, the south coast slope will need to be blocked off. So according to Usopp, the south slope is the only way to the village. His plan is to cover it with oil and attack the pirate with surprise. But by the time it was morning, Nami heard voices coming from the oth... Read all

title: Kyoufu no futarigumi! Nyâban kyoudai vs Zoro
desc: The Straw Hat Pirates take out most of the Black Cat Pirates, so Jango orders the Nyaban Brothers to attack. Meanwhile, after getting hypnotized by Jango, Luffy gets himself stuck under the collapsed mast of the Black Cat Pirates' ship.

title: Rufi fukkatsu! Kaya ojousama no kesshi no taikou
desc: Captain Kuro arrives at the scene, and with Zoro too injured to fight, Luffy being incapacitated, and the other two being too weak to handle him, things seem hopeless. However, Kaya herself appears to bargain with Kuro.

title: Kuro o taose! Otoko Usoppu namida no ketsui!
desc: Zoro and Buchi face off once again as Luffy and Kuro begin their fight.

title: Kaya o mamore! Usoppu kaizokudan daikatsuyaku!
desc: As the fight between Luffy and Kuro is close to an end, the Usopp Pirates do their best to avoid Jango.

title: Ikari bakuhatsu! Kuro vs Rufi kecchaku no yukue!
desc: Kuro's ultimate attack destroys everything in the area and Luffy becomes enraged by his lack of regard for his crew.

title: Anta ga chunjuu! Gaimon to kimyou na nakama
desc: With Usopp now in the crew and a new ship, the Going Merry, the Straw Hats head to an island said to hold a fabled treasure, only to encounter a strange man stuck in a treasure box.

title: Santouryuu no kako! Zoro to Kuina no chikai!
desc: While Usopp and Luffy fool around with the ship's cannon one day, Zoro dreams about his childhood and the promise he made to Kuina.

title: Manukarezaru kyaku! Sanji no meshi to Gin on
desc: Zoro, Nami, and Usopp went into the restaurant to see what's taking Luffy so long. Only to find an aftermath of a brutal fight. Sanji, who gave Iron Fist a real good kick. Is holding him with his grasp. And tells him that money won't repay the hard work he's put himself through in making that soup. Patty, a buff cook came out from the men's room saw what Sanji is doin... Read all

title: Meibutsu kokku! Kaijou resutoran no Sanji
desc: The crew meets Johnny and Yosaku, Zoro's former companions, and they set sail for the Baratie restaurant in search of a cook.

title: Saikyou no kaizoku kantai! Teitoku Don Kurîku
desc: Gin returns to the Baratie with his also-starving captain, Don Krieg, to whom Sanji once more gives food, but Don Krieg betrays the cook once he regains his energy.

title: Mamore Baratie! Daikaizoku akaashi no Zefu
desc: It is revealed that Chef Zeff was a great pirate known as Red Leg Zeff. Gin explains the catastrophe the fleet met in Grand Line when they encountered Hawk-Eyes Mihawk, and Krieg attempts to take control of the Baratie.

title: Tama no me no Mihôku! Kenzoku Zoro umi ni chiru
desc: As Nami steals the Going Merry, Mihawk has returned to finish the job, but Zoro challenges him to a duel in order to achieve his dream.

title: Hissatsu ashiwaza sakuretsu! Sanji vs Teppeki no Pâru
desc: Mihawk leaves after defeating Zoro, so Krieg continues his invasion as Sanji reveals his fighting skills. Meanwhile, Johnny and Yosaku leave with Usopp and the wounded Zoro to go after Nami.

title: Zefu to Sanji no yume Maboroshi no ôru burû
desc: With Zeff held captive by Gin, Sanji has no choice but to take Pearl's hits, and he reflects on why Zeff means so much to him.

title: Reitetsu hijou no kijin Kaizoku kantai soutaichou Gin
desc: Gin finishes off Pearl, claiming that he wants to kill Sanji himself. Still wounded, Sanji faces Gin while Luffy attacks Don Krieg.

title: Shinaneeyo! Gekitou Rufi vs Kurîku!
desc: When Gin refuses to kill Sanji, Krieg uses poison gas on him. Luffy seems to have the advantage in the fight until Krieg pulls out his explosive Battle Spear.

title: Shitou no Ketchaku! Hara ni Kukutta Ippon no Yari!
desc: Even after taking several hits from the Battle Spear, Luffy refuses to give up.

title: Tabidachi! Umi no kokku wa Rufi to tomoni
desc: Gin decides to go back to the Grand Line with Krieg despite still being poisoned, and Sanji makes the difficult decision on whether to stay or to go with Luffy just as Yosaku comes back with the news that he knows where Nami is.

title: Higashi no Umi Saiaku no Otoko! Gyojin Kaizoku Arlong!
desc: The crew chases after Nami, who stole their ship, and Yosaku takes time during the trip to explain about Arlong and his Fishmen to Luffy and Sanji. Meanwhile, Usopp, Johnny, and Zoro arrive at the island Nami docked at.

title: Cocoyashi Mura no Majo! Arlong no Onna Kanbu
desc: Zoro is tied up by wrist to ankle. Arlong keeps asking him on what is his true plan. And Zoro kept telling him he's looking for a woman and called him half fish. Arlong let the insult went by and told Zoro that he hates man kind so much. He believes that mermen should be the superior species on the planet. As mermen are stronger and have the ability to live underwater... Read all

title: Usopp Shisu?! Luffy Jouriku wa Mada?
desc: After Zoro escapes with Nami's help, she tries to prove her loyalty to the Arlong Pirates by appearing to kill Usopp. Meanwhile, Luffy's group finally arrives at the island.

title: Zen'in Shuuketsu! Usopp ga Kataru Nami no Shinjitsu
desc: Luffy, Sanji, and Yosaku made a crash landing in the plains of the island. Zoro(who got ran over by their boat) tells them that he needs to go rescue Usopp from the mermen. Only when Johnny came by all depressed and told them that Usopp has been killed by Nami. Either one of them, including Luffy couldn't believe it. Luffy declined that it's a lie, but Johnny wished t... Read all

title: Himerareta Kako! Onna Senshi Bell-mere!
desc: Nojiko starts her story about Nami's childhood and their adopted mother, Bellemere. Despite being poor and none of them being related by blood, they had a happy life.

title: Ikinuke! Haha Bellemere to Nami no Kizuna!
desc: Nojiko continues her story, explaining how their life was ruined when the Arlong Pirates first took over the village.

title: Luffy Tatsu! Uragirareta Yakusoku no Ketsumatsu!
desc: When marine officers under Arlong confiscate Nami's money, the villagers start a rebelion. Desperate, Nami asks Luffy for help.

title: Luffy Dai Pinch! Gyojin Tai Luffy Kaizokudan
desc: The Straw Hats face the Fishmen themselves as the villagers watch from the sidelines.

title: Luffy Suibotsu! Zoro vs Tako no Hacchan
desc: Arlong has trapped Luffy in the ocean and Zoro faces the six-sword wielding octopus Hatchan.

title: Hokoritakaki Senshi! Gekitou Sanji to Usopp
desc: Sanji was about to help Luffy out, until Kurobi swam and knocked Sanji out. He continuously beat Sanji up with his karate moves. And didn't gave him a chance to resurface for air. Kurobi goes on how inferior Humans are when it comes to needing air to survive. As Sanji is running out of breathe, he discovers that Kurobi has gills like a fish. Which means that Kurobi wi... Read all

title: Luffy Zenkai! Nami no Ketsui to Mugiwara Boushi
desc: With Arlong's officers defeated Zoro and Sanji take on Arlong but prove that they aren't a match for him. However, with Luffy finally free, he takes on Arlong himself.

title: Sakuretsu! Gyojin Arlong Umi kara no Moukougeki!
desc: Luffy returns to the fight, and the battle with Arlong versus Luffy begins.

title: Gyojin Teikoku no Owari! Nami wa Ore no Nakama Da!
desc: The battle spreads into Arlong Park itself and Arlong is no longer holding back.

title: Egao no Tabidachi! Saraba Furusato Cocoyashi Mura
desc: Arlong's reign of terror is over, and no one has anything on their mind except to party. As the crew celebrates, Nami reflects on her hometown and decides to officially join the Straw Hat Pirates.

title: Joukinkubi! Mugiwara no Luffy Yo ni Shirewataru
desc: With Buggy, Krieg and Arlong defeated, Luffy now has the highest bounty in East Blue.

title: Mugiwara o Oe! Chiisana Buggy no Daibouken
desc: It's morning, and the Straw Hat Pirates are enjoying their breakfast. Nami remembered when she and Luffy first meet, back when they encountered Buggy the Clown. Nami asked Luffy, if he'd know what had happen to Buggy. Luffy doesn't have a slight clue, but figures he's somewhere far away. Meanwhile on an island, the clown of terror himself, Buggy has spent his time wis... Read all

title: Omachikane! Aa Fukkatsu no Buggy Senchou!
desc: Buggy tells the mystery woman he's accompanied with. That he's planning to find his old crew. Meanwhile we learn that that the Buggy Crew had escaped from the angry mob of villagers and had to cat off cowardly. Mohji and Cabaji both were worried on what became of their captain. As the only thing they have left of him are his parts(which were all gathered and tied up t... Read all

title: Hajimari to Owari no Machi: Loguetown Jouriku
desc: The Straw Hat Pirate Crew, has finally made it to LougeTown. The place where the famous Pirate King Gold Roger was born, raised, and died in. Luffy looks forward in seeing Gold Roger's execution platform. Meanwhile familiar enemies are lurking the town.

title: Sandai Kitetsu to Yubashiri! Zoro no Shintou to Onna Souchou
desc: While searching for a pair of new swords to replace the ones shattered by Mihawk, Zoro meets a woman named Tashigi. At first site, she looks exactly like Kuina.

title: Usopp Tai Kozure no Daddy: Mahiru no Kettou
desc: Usopp manages to anger the daughter of bounty hunter Daddy the Father. All because he wanted a pair of new goggles, that were meant to be a gift for Daddy. Usopp finds his own life at stake, when Daddy challenges him over a duel to claim the goggles.

title: Honoo no Ryouri Battle? Sanji VS Bijin Chef
desc: Sanji enters a cooking contest against a woman named Carmen for an Elephant Tuna that he has always dreamed of cooking. Meanwhile Buggy and Alvida reveal themselves to Luffy who is about to be executed by them.

title: Buggy no Revenge! Shokeidai de Warau Otoko!
desc: All seems lost when Buggy has Luffy trapped on top of Gold Roger's execution platform. Can Luffy be able to escape his own death? Meanwhile an unusual storm of any king has formed up in LogueTown, and a mysterious figure appears out of no where.

title: Densetsu wa Hajimatta! Mezase Grand Line
desc: After Luffy escaped his execution, he, Zoro, and Sanji are heading back to the harbor. The storm that just occurred is like no other. But it will give the Straw Hat Pirates the advantage to use the ocean's current to head straight to the Grand Line. Meanwhile Cabaji, Buggy, and Alvida fight their way through the line of marines. They decide to retreat, so Buggy uses h... Read all

title: Aratanaru Bouken no Yokan! Nazo no Shoujo Apis
desc: During the storm, a girl escaped from a Marine ship. The report was sent to Admiral Nelson Royale, who is very disappointed that the marines had made this mistake. And explained to them that the girl is the key to obtaining Ryuukotsu, the elixir of eternal life. His servant Erik was given a task to search and find the girl at all costs. It's been 2 days since the Stra... Read all

title: Kiseki no Seibutsu! Apis no Himitsu to Densetsu no Shima
desc: The Staw Hat Pirates find themselves stranded in the Calm Belt. A place where ships never come out alive. They all don't find it to be dangerous, but Nami had to explain to them on why it is an issue. The Calm Belt is a current of calm water that guards the entrance to the Grand Line. Wind and waves never occur in the Calm Belt, which makes the sails on a ship useless... Read all

title: Eric Shutsugeki! Gunkanjima kara no Daidasshutsu!
desc: Nami and Luffy went to tell Usopp, Zoro, and Sanji on what they've witnessed. Only to find them all asleep, while the half asleep Bokuden is still talking about Gunkan Island's ancestry. They woke, and heard from a village local that a group of marine ships are coming ashore. Nami told the him that if Bokuden wakes up, just tell him that they'll protect Apis at all co... Read all

title: Zekkai no Kotou! Densetsu no Lost Island
desc: The Straw Hat Pirates and Apis are now taking Ryuuji back to Dragon's Nest, Lost Island. The marines back at Gunkan Island are busy repairing the damages they've caused. Erik informs the major, that he has a hunch on where they'll find the millennium dragon. And insists they head straight to where the Straw Head Pirates are going. Erik made sure that a report to Admir... Read all

title: Haikyo no Kettou! Kinpaku no Zoro VS Erik!
desc: The Straw Hat Pirates. Apis and Ryuuji find themselves in a temple on what believed to be the Dragon's Nest. But all they found was a high ceiling with pictures of dragons and people. It didn't look like a place where dragons once roam. Apis asked Ryuuji, but he doesn't even know what this place is either. Usopp complained that the dragon isn't too helpful at all. Whi... Read all

title: Luffy Kanzen Houi! Teitoku Nelson no Hisaku
desc: The Going Merry is avoiding the line of fire from the Marine Ships of the 8th Divison. Admiral Nelson is entertained by the whole thing, and tells a marine official to send out a flag signal telling Major that they have it under control. Erik however isn't going to let the Admiral get the Sennenryuu for himself. And asks the Major for 3 capable men and a rowboat. Luff... Read all

title: Oozora o Mau Mono! Yomigaeru Sennen no Densetsu!
desc: Luffy tells Ryuuji to not give up hope, but he remained in the water and began to sank. Admiral Nelson orders the marines to reel in the dragon with a gun spear cannon. Luffy however prevented the spear from piercing into Ryuuji. Luffy asked him on why he's doing this. Nelson just says that the only thing he wants from the dragon is eternal youth and nothing more. Luf... Read all

title: Ikari no Kecchaku! Red Line o Norikoero!
desc: Erik the Whirlwind is still around, and would of drown if the the ocean level didn't drain. He still has the idea that the Ryuukotsu has the elixir of life. Nami corrected him, that the Ryuukotsu is calcified and is merely impossible to create elixir out of. Erik however has his eyes set on the living dragons. Instead of killing them, he offer them all a deal in shari... Read all

title: Saisho no Toride? Kyodai Kujira Laboon Arawaru
desc: The Grand Line, the greatest ocean in the world according to Luffy. As our heroes slide down the water current slope of the Red Line, it was much like a ride. As they approach to the bottom, Zoro hears a strange noise, which Nami thinks was just the wind. Usopp used his goggle to see what was up ahead, Sanji thinks it's a mountain, but Nami knows that there isn't supp... Read all

title: Otoko no Yakusoku! Luffy to Kujira Saikai no Chikai
desc: Crocus told the Straw Hat Pirates the reason why Laboon is ramming against the Red Line. Long ago, when Crocus was looking after the lighthouses, a group of pirates entered the Grand Line, from Reverse Mountain. A little island whale(a young Laboon) had followed them all the way from the West Blue. Normally Island Whales travel with their own species, but not this one... Read all

title: Kaizoku Kangei no Machi? Whiskey Peak Jouriku
desc: As the Going Merry travels to Whiskey Peak, our friends experience the Grand Line's unpredictable weather. First it was snowing, which Luffy and Usopp found an activity to do including snow ball fights and snowman building. Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday were complaining that there's no heater. Nami told them to shut up as she couldn't help but how strange that it became co... Read all

title: Sakuretsu Santouryuu! Zoro VS Baroque Works!
desc: Zoro knows about the Baroque Works organization. And for that he must die. But he disappear off the roof. And reappeared in the crowd of bounty hunters. They got out their guns to shoot him, but they all missed and shoot each other. Mr. 8 discovers that Zoro is no ordinary swordsman. As Zoro drew his sword behind Mr. 8 before he could blink. Soon Zoro is chased by the... Read all

title: Shinken Shoubu! Luffy VS Zoro Nazo no Daikettou!
desc: Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine were informed by the boss that one of their agents knows some secrets that can't be leaked out. They know Mr. 8 and Miss Wednesday's true identities are were placed orders to eliminate them. Mr. 8 tries to kill them with his canons. But discovers that there's not a scratch on them. Igaram tried all he could to stop them but got hurt badly. And... Read all

title: Oujo Vivi o Todokero! Luffy Kaizoku Dan Shukkou
desc: Luffy and Zoro defeated Miss Valentine and Mr. 5 while they fight their pointless battle. Nami came by and put an end to it. Luffy soon learned what really happened and forgive Zoro for thinking he killed the locals for nothing. Nami tells Vivi that they'll do it only for a matter of money. Vivi however doesn't have anything in return, she just wants to be returned to... Read all

title: Ganbare Coby! Coby-Meppo Kaigun Funtou Ki
desc: Coby & Helmeppo return in their own side story episode.

title: Coby-Meppo no Ketsui! Garp Chuujou no Oyagokoro
desc: Coby and Helmeppo are mentored by Vice Admiral Garp in becoming marines.

title: Taiko no Shima! Little Garden ni Hisomu Kage!
desc: Straw Hat Pirate sails toward Little Garden, and unlike its name, the prehistoric animals living on the island are far from little. Everyone spreads out for another adventure and food, while Nami and Usopp stay aboard, frightened. Not long afterward, a giant approaches the ship.

title: Dekkai Kettou! Kyojin Dorry to Brogy
desc: Nami and Usopp are taken into Brogy's camp, meanwhile, Vivi and Luffy meet another giant, Dorry. They reveal that they will fight against each other whenever the volcano on the island erupts.

title: Luffy Ikaru! Seinaru Kettou ni Hiretsu na Wana!
desc: Brogy gives Dorry booze from Nami and Usopp. The booze explodes when Dorry drinks it. The duel starts once again, and even though his chance to win is very low due to his injury, Dorry still heads into the battle.

title: Brogy Shouri no Goukyuu! Elbaf no Kecchaku
desc: The salvage of a hundred year duel ends?

title: Ma no Candle! Munen no Namida to Ikari no Namida
desc: Mr. 3 manages to capture Broggy with his wax. He also captures Vivi, Nami and Zoro, and tries to turn them into wax figures.

title: Luffy o Osou Maryoku! Colors Trap
desc: Luffy tries to save Nami, Vivi and Zoro who are almost turned into wax figures. However, Miss Golden Week, partner of Mr. 3, keeps Luffy busy with her colors trap.

title: Iza Hangeki! Usopp no Kiten to Kaenboshi!
desc: With Vivi, Nami, and Zoro are almost petrified completely by the wax and Luffy is trapped by Miss Golden Week's power, Usopp is the only one left to save them all.

title: Saraba Kyojin no Shima! Arabasuta o Mezase
desc: After defeating Baroque Works on the island, Straw Hat Pirate sets sail to Arabasta. Brogy and Dorry set them off and help them escape from the giant goldfish that tries to eat Going Merry.

title: Nami ga Byouki? Umi ni Furu Yuki no Mukou ni!
desc: Luffy's crew gets a trouble when their navigator, Nami, is sick, and they do not have a doctor on the ship.

title: Kishuu! Bliking Gou to Blik no Wapol
desc: Straw Hat crew tries to find a doctor in a nearby island, but they are attacked by the pirate Wapol.

title: Isha no Inai Shima? Na mo Naki Kuni no Bouken!
desc: Not only that the island has no name, it doesn't have a doctor as well. The only one called doctor lives in the castle on the mountain's top. Sanji and Luffy go taking Nami there, while Vivi and Usopp stay behind, and listen to the history of the island from Dalton.

title: Happy kai? Majo to Yobareta Isha!
desc: It turns out that Dr. Kureha is on the other side of the island, and Usopp, Vivi and Dalton rush to find her. However, Dalton returns to the village after heard that Wapol comes back.

title: Dolton no Kakugo! Wapol Gundan Shima ni Jouriku
desc: Dalton faces Wapol, who wants to take over the island once more, but gets hit by arrows. The avalanche stops, and it injures Sanji. It is up for Luffy now to climb the mountain to save both Nami and Sanji.

title: Yuki no Sumu Shima! Drum-Rocky o Nobore!
desc: Avalanche aftermath & the mountain climbing on the Drum Rockies.

title: Tonakai wa Aoppana! Chopper no Himitsu
desc: Nami asks Chopper to join Straw Hat's crew, but the reindeer refuses. Knowing Chopper's unique ability, Luffy is also interested to have him as the crew.

title: Hamidashi Mono no Yume! Yabuisha Hiluluk!
desc: It is a flashback to the past of Chopper and Dr. Hiruluk, the first human shows him affection, told by Dr. Kureha.

title: Hiluluk no Sakura to Uketsugareyuku Ishi!
desc: Flashbacks revealing the death of Dr. Hiruluk and the cruelty of Wapol as the king at that time and how Chopper is encouraged to carry on Dr. Hiruluk's will.

title: Versus Wapol Gundan! Bakubaku no Mi no Nouryoku!
desc: Wapol has arrived to the castle and wants to take down Hirulug's flag. He and his crew engage in a battle with Luffy, Sanji and Chopper trying protect the flag.

title: Zoan-kei Akuma no Mi! Chopper Nanadan Henkei
desc: Chopper fights against one of Wapol's crew. He shows his ability to transform into seven forms using Rumble Ball which he creates by himself.

title: Oukoku no Shihai Owaru Toki! Shinnen no Hata wa Eien ni
desc: The rest of Luffy's crew and the villagers find the ropeway Dr. Kureha uses to go from the castle to the village and vice versa. Meanwhile. Luffy manages to defeat Wapol.

title: Hiluluk no Sakura! Drum Rocky no Kiseki
desc: Chopper is finally convinced to join Luffy's crew, and though Dr. Kureha is not too happy with the idea of Chopper being a pirate, she gives him a very remarkable farewell gift.

title: Sayonara Drum-tou! Boku wa Umi e Deru!
desc: Straw Hat's crew continues their journey to Vivi's homeland.

title: Arabasta no Eiyuu to Senjou no Ballerina
desc: Luffy and Usopp accidentally fish Mr. 2 Bon Clay who spends a short time with Straw Hat crew showing off the ability of his devil fruit.

title: Iza Sabaku no Kuni e! Ame o Yobu Kona to Hanrangun
desc: Straw Hat crew arrives at Nanohana, the port city of Alabasta. Luffy gets separated from the others, and somehow learns about Dance Powder.

title: Gouketsu-tachi no Saikai! Yatsu no Na wa Hiken no Ace
desc: Straw Hat crew meets Smoker and Tashigi. Smoker almost corners them when suddenly a powerful pirate appears to save Luffy. Luffy reveals him as Portgas D. Ace, his older brother.

title: Ace to Luffy! Atsuki Omoi to Kyoudai no Kizuna
desc: Luffy and his crew manages to run away from Smoker and they meet Ace in their ship. Ace reveals that he is in a mission of searching for a man named Blackbeard.

title: Midori no Machi Erumaru to Kung Fu Jugon!
desc: Ace joins Luffy crew's journey temporarily and they go to the 'Green City' of Erumalu, which is only a desert now.

title: Suna no Kuni no Bouken! Ennetsu no Daichi ni Sumu Mamono
desc: Straw Hat crew's journey through the desert after leaving Erumalu.

title: Sabaku no Kaizokudan Toujou! Jiyuu ni Ikiru Otoko-tachi
desc: Straw Hat crew meets the Desert Pirates, and Vivi realizes she knows the girl from the Desert Pirates when they were still young girls.

title: Nisemono no Iji! Kokoro no Hanrangun Kamyu!
desc: Straw Hat crew helps Vivi testing a group of men pretending to be Rebel Army who guard a small village.

title: Hanrangun Senshi Kouza! Vivi ni Chikatta Yume!
desc: Luffy and crew take a break for lunch in the desert, and Vivi reveals her past with Kohza, the leader of the Rebel Army.

title: Kagerou no Kettou! Ace vs Otoko Scorpion
desc: Ace pursues a bounty hunter who claims he has defeated Blackbeard, only to find that it is a total lie. Ace concludes that Blackbeard isn't in Alabasta and leaves Luffy's crew.

title: Iseki to Mayoigo! Vivi to Nakama to Kuni no Katachi
desc: Luffy, Zoro, and Chopper get lost in the desert.

title: Spiders Cafe ni 8-ji Teki Kanbu Shuugou
desc: Baroke Work's teams 1,2, and 4 meet at the Spider's Cafe to await for the meeting with Mr 0. They are carried to the Rain Dinner casino where Crocodile reveals his identity. Meanwhile, Luffy's crew meets with Toto, Kohza's father.

title: Luffy Tai Vivi! Nakama ni Kakeru Namida no Chikai
desc: Luffy and Vivi fight against each other when Luffy says that Vivi's idea to stop the rebellion is naive and the only way to solve the problem in Arabasta is by defeating the Crocodile.

title: Alabasta Sensen! Yume no Machi Rainbase
desc: Instead of trying to stop the Rebel Army to war against the kingdom's Army, Straw Hat's crew decides to go after Crocodile at Rainbase, only to meet with Smoker and Tashigi once more and fall right into Crocodile's trap.

title: Zettai Zetsumei no Wana! Rain Dinners Totsunyuu
desc: Most of Straw Hat's crew is trapped along with Smoker by Crocodile. Vivi and a royal guardian, Pell, fight against Miss All Sunday.

title: Utopia Sakusen Hatsudou! Ugokidashita Uneri
desc: Operation Utopia is set into motion. With his devil fruit's ability, Mr. 2 impersonates King Cobra and orders the destruction of Nanohana. Enraged, Rebel Army begins to move.

title: Kyoufu no Bananawani to Mr. Prince
desc: Vivi tries desperately to get the key of the cage that traps most of Craw Hat crew from the humongous crocodiles known as Bananawani. Meanwhile, someone contacts Crocodile and introduces himself as Mr. Prince.

title: Gyakuten Dai Dasshutsu e no Kagi! Doru-Doru Ball!
desc: Mr. Prince is actually Sanji, who lures Crocodile out so that he can go in and help the others. He manages to open the cage since using the copy key made from the wax of Mr. 3, who is swallowed by one of the Bananawani.

title: Nasake Muyou no Shitou! Luffy vs Crocodile
desc: Straw Hat crew rush to Alubarne, where the final battle will take place. But Luffy is captured by Crocodile, so he tells the others to go without him. Battle between Luffy and Crocodile begins, with Crocodile overpowers him with his devil fruit's ability, sand.

title: Kiseki e no Shissou! Arabasta Doubutsu Land
desc: The rest of Straw Hat crew reaches Alubarna, while in Rainbase, Luffy gets stabbed by Crocodile, who leaves him to die. However, the mysterious Miss All Sunday saves Luffy.

title: Hanrangun Tai Kokuougun! Kessen wa Alubarna!
desc: The war between Royal Army and Rebel Army is about to start and Straw Hat crew sets up a plan to stop it.

title: Nageki no Alubarna! Gekitou Carue Taichou!
desc: Vivi is standing between Alubarne and incoming Rebel Army to speak with Kohza. But a member of Baroque Work infiltrating the Royal Army interferes by shooting the cannon, sending dust spreading and covering the area. Vivi is nearly trampled, but Karoo sacrifices himself and covers her with his body.

title: Nakama no Yume ni Chikau! Kettou Mogurazuka 4-bangai
desc: Usopp and Chopper struggle against Mr. 4 and Miss Merry Christmas, who attack them from underground and with explosive balls. Scared and badly injured, Usopp tries to flee, but stop immediately when the enemy claims that Luffy is killed by Crocodile.

title: Honjitsu Daikoukai! Mane-Mane Montage!
desc: Though badly injured, Usopp is enraged by Miss Merry Christmas's taunt. Sanji is still engaged in battle against Mr. 2 and they are evenly matched.

title: Nami ni Henshin! Bon Clay Renpatsu Ballet Kenpou
desc: Mr.2 keeps changing into Nami so that Sanji can't attack him, but then Sanji notices that Mr.2 should turn back into himself to use his Kenpo. Vivi decides to save the country by destroying the palace, but then Crocodile appears with the kidnapped King Cobra.

title: Nami no Senpuu Chuuihou! Clima Takt Sakuretsu
desc: It's a fight between Miss Doublefinger and Nami with her new weapon, Clima Tact.

title: Ouke ni Tsutawaru Himitsu! Kodai Heiki Pluton
desc: Nami manages to defeat Miss Doublefinger after several false attempts using her Clima Tact. Meanwhile, Crocodile reveals his true objective, ancient weapon Pluton, that lies somewhere in Alabasta.

title: Gouken no Gokui! Koutetsu o Kiru Chikara to Mono no Kokyuu
desc: Zoro struggles in a fierce battle against Mr. 1, who can turn his body parts into blades. After being injured very badly, Zoro learns that his katana should be able to cut steel in order to win.

title: Tatakai wa Owatta! Kooza ga Kakageta Shiroi Hata
desc: Kohza eavesdrops the conversation between Crocodile and Vivi, and now after knowing the truth, he tries to stop the Rebel Army for attacking by raising a white flag. However, Baroque Work's infiltrator in Royal Army shots him, and Crocodile spreads sand storm everywhere, encouraging the war.

title: Vivi no Koe no Yukue! Hero wa Maiorita!
desc: Crocodile tells Vivi that he sets a bomb that will destroy Alubarna and people within. Then he drops Vivi from the top of the castle, but Luffy and Pell catch her. Luffy once again challenge Crocodile into battle, claiming that now he knows Crocodile's weakness.

title: Suna Wani to Mizu Luffy! Kettou Dai 2 Round
desc: Luffy uses water to fight Crocodile, since water will not let Crocodile turns into sand. Meanwhile, the rest of Straw Hat crew tries to find the location of the bomb. Miss All Sunday, a.k.a Nico Robin, forces King Cobra to show her the location of Pluton.

title: Wanippoi! Ouke no Haka e Hashire Luffy!
desc: After defeating Luffy for the second time, Crocodile joins Nico Robin in the middle of her translating the Poneglyph. Robin admits that the Poneglyph does not mention Pluton at all, and Crocodile stabs her saying that she isn't useful anymore to him.

title: Akumu no Toki Semaru! Koko wa Sunasunadan Himitsu Kichi
desc: After recovering, Luffy fights Crocodile again in the tomb, this time using his blood as water replacement. He gets poisoned but still he fights Crocodile with all his might. Meanwhile, Vivi finally finds out the location of the bomb and tells the others.

title: Idainaru Tsubasa! Waga Na wa Kuni no Shugoshin Pell
desc: Vivi manages to cut the bomb's fuses, but realizes that the bomb has been set to explode at a certain time. Only several seconds left before the bomb explodes, and suddenly, Pell appears, sacrificing himself by taking the bomb up to the sky.

title: Koeteiku! Arabasta ni Ame ga Furu!
desc: The bomb explodes in the sky, the impact blows away the sand storm. At the same time, Luffy defeats Crocodile and punches him through the bedrock. Even so, the war is still raging, and though Vivi screams at the top of her lungs to make them stop, nobody listens to her, until the first drops of rain fall down and calm them.

title: Buki yo Saraba! Kaizoku to Ikutsuka no Seigi
desc: The first rain fall in 3 years/The end of the Alabasta War!

title: Kaizoku-tachi no Utage to Arabasta Dasshutsu Sakusen!
desc: After defeating Crocodile, Luffy's crew is preparing to sail away when they find out that Mr 2 took the Going Merry and is awaiting for them at the Sandora River. He claims to need their friendship.

title: Hajimari wa Ano Hi! Vivi ga Kataru Boukentan!
desc: Vivi gives her speech in front of the people of Alabasta today. At the same time, Straw Hat crew waits for her to come and sail with them. However, the Marine begins to chase them. It turns out that Vivi has Igaram to stand in the podium, while she and Karoo go to the promised location. In front of the crew, and heard by all of Alabasta's people, Vivi states that she ... Read all

title: Kiken na Kaori! Shichininme wa Nico Robin!
desc: With Mr.2's help, Straw Hat crew manages to escape from Marines. Suddenly, Nico Robin appears from the inside of the ship and persuades Luffy and the rest of the crew to let her be the seventh crew.

title: Hajimete no Kranke! Rumble Ball Hiwa
desc: Straw Hat crew lands on an uninhabited island. As usual, some of the crew is sent to gather food or survey the island. Chopper stays behind to guard the ship, but realize that Robin stays as well. Awkwardly he tells the story about his mentor, and also his first patient, Dr. Kureha.

title: Koukaishi no Hanran! Yuzurenai Yume no Tame ni!
desc: Accidentally, Luffy fishes a huge ammonite and apparently it is a kind of vehicle owned by a traveling salesman. Nami gets a pile of paper and then begins to draw the map of the world like she always dreams about, only to find that she should restart twice drawing the map of the Reverse Mountain due to the mischief of the crew.

title: Uketsugareru Recipe! Curry no Tetsujin Sanji
