desc: As the Super Fight tournament heads for its grand finale, the Class S heroes battle to hold back the tide of monster incursions. Meanwhile, Atomic Samurai is setting in motion a plan of his own.

title: The Resistance of the Strong
desc: Goketsu, the first Super Fight Tournament champion, arrives in the stadium. Having now become a monster, he's aiming to force the Super Fight competitors to turn into monsters themselves. When several do, it's up to Suiryu to take them on alone.

title: The Troubles of the Strongest
desc: Saitama returns to the battle, but is starting to get through a gloomy state because of an obvious reason.

title: The Encircling Net of Justice
desc: The Monster Association invited all of the S-Class heroes to their hideout in City Z. Meanwhile, Garo encounters a serious threat.

title: Everyone's Dignity
desc: Garou continues his fight against the A Class heroes while some prominent S Class heroes make special entrances.

title: Cleaning Up the Disciple's Mess
desc: As the fight continues between Garou and his former master, Bang, a prominent threat from the Monster Association reappears.

title: BoJack Horseman: The BoJack Horseman Story, Chapter One
desc: A publishing house eagerly awaits BoJack's memoirs, but he hasn't even started yet. His agent/ex and his publisher try to talk him into working with a ghost writer, but BoJack's too despondent about being washed up to focus.

title: BoJack Hates the Troops
desc: BoJack gets into trouble after taking muffins a Navy Seal had "dibs" on and then calling American soldiers jerks on live television.

title: Prickly Muffin
desc: A child actress from the sitcom BoJack starred in 20 years ago shows up at his house leading to a series of chaotic events.

title: Zoës and Zeldas
desc: Bojack mentors Todd in his upcoming career; meanwhile Diane's ex-boyfriend writes an article about Mr. Peanutbutter for an online article.

title: Live Fast, Diane Nguyen
desc: A business trip for BoJack and Diane takes a detour; Todd runs a scam that gets him in trouble.

title: Our A-Story Is a 'D' Story
desc: In a bout of drunken jealousy toward Mr. Peanutbutter, BoJack steals the "D" from the Hollywood sign for Diane. Meanwhile, Todd finds himself juggling two very demanding dates.

title: Say Anything
desc: Princess Carolyn tries to have it all and prove she's the best agent in the biz, while Bojack, Todd, and Vanessa Gecko make it as difficult as possible.

title: The Telescope
desc: When he learns his old friend from "Horsin' Around" is dying, BoJack tries to mend fences.

title: Horse Majeure
desc: A love struck BoJack tries to sabotage a wedding; Todd accepts a surprising new professional role.

title: One Trick Pony
desc: BoJack shoots a movie at Mr. Peanutbutter's house; Diane finishes her book.

title: Downer Ending
desc: BoJack embarks on a project in his typically gonzo style, leading to a drug-fueled revelation.

title: Later
desc: Months after his memoir is released, BoJack's being considered for a role that's a life long dream.

title: BoJack Horseman Christmas Special: Sabrina's Christmas Wish
desc: BoJack and Todd watch a very special Christmas episode of "Horsin' Around" to celebrate the holidays.

title: Brand New Couch
desc: Picking up where he left off, Bojack Horseman is now set to start filming his dream movie Secretariat.

title: Yesterdayland
desc: BoJack is drawn to the one female in town who has no idea who he is (because she was in a coma). Todd opens a theme park.

title: Still Broken
desc: A funeral turns into a treasure hunt for the "Horsin' Around" cast and a potential schmoozefest for Princess Carolyn and Mr. Peanutbutter. Meanwhile, Todd briefly reinvents himself.

title: After the Party
desc: Mr. Peanutbutter throws Diane a surprise birthday party, putting tension on their relationship. Princess Carolyn and Vincent have a serious talk. Wanda tells BoJack a joke.

title: Chickens
desc: Todd tries to save a chicken from the slaughter house while Bojack and Kelsey are allowed some bonding time.

title: Higher Love
desc: Princess Carolyn sees an opportunity when Mr. Peanutbutter's agent dies. BoJack flips when he says the "L" word out loud to Wanda.

title: Hank After Dark
desc: Diane goes off script during BoJack's book tour, jeopardizing Mr. Peanutbutter's new show. Todd gets involved in international affairs.

title: Let's Find Out
desc: BoJack Horseman is a contestant on Mr. Peanutbutter's new game show, facing off against a mystery 'bigger celebrity' contestant.

title: The Shot
desc: BoJack, Kelsey, Todd, Princess Carolyn, and Mr. Peanutbutter attempt to shoot a crucial scene in the Secretariat movie that was not in the script. Princess Carolyn and Diane contemplate their respective careers.

title: Yes And
desc: Diane crashes at BoJack's place after quitting her job following Sebastian St. Clair, which puts a strain on BoJack and Wanda's relationship. Todd joins an improv comedy troupe which turns out to be a cult.

title: Escape from L.A.
desc: Bojack runs off to New Mexico to reconnect with an old friend, only to find she's happily married with a family. After staying longer than planned, Bojack makes another life mistake.

title: Out to Sea
desc: BoJack discovers the Secretariat film was finished without him. Princess Carolyn starts her own agency firm. Todd finds himself trapped in the improv comedy cult.

title: Start Spreading the News
desc: Bojack goes to New York to be interviewed for his new film. Todd tags along and realizes he bit off a little more than he could chew.

title: The BoJack Horseman Show
desc: It's 2007, and Princess Carolyn works tirelessly to get Bojack to stop basking in the light of the glory days and start working again. Diane and Mr. Peanutbutter meet, and Todd kisses a girl.

title: BoJack Kills
desc: Bojack is framed for a murder. Meanwhile, Todd and Mr. Peanutbutter are sprayed by a skunk.

title: Fish Out of Water
desc: As Bojack is forced to attend an underwater movie festival to promote his new movie, a series of events and the inability to communicate with underwater life ensures that not everything goes as planned.

title: Love And/Or Marriage
desc: While Todd and Bojack crash a rehearsal dinner, Diane gets high with a client. Princess Carolyn goes on a series of blind dates.

title: Brrap Brrap Pew Pew
desc: Diane's tweet lands Sextina Aquafina in hot water. Prankster and A-list actor Jurj Clooners gets under BoJack's skin.

title: Stop the Presses
desc: Todd builds a giant papier-mâché Todd head. A customer service rep gives Bojack some good advice when he tries to cancel his newspaper subscription.

title: Old Acquaintance
desc: Bojack is up for a part in David Pincher's latest film. Diane meets Mr. Peanutbutter's brother and Todd takes the business in a new direction.

title: Best Thing That Ever Happened
desc: After Princess Carolyn's latest mistake as BoJack's agent gets worse and worse, their entire relationship comes into question.

title: It's You
desc: Mr. Peanutbutter announces the Oscar nominees. Bojack surrounds himself with admires, not realizing how much his true friendships are falling apart.

title: That's Too Much, Man!
desc: Bojack gets Sarah Lynn to break her sobriety to help drown his depression, and experiences the next few months through blackouts.

title: That Went Well
desc: Bojack hits rock bottom. Mr. Peanutbutter and Todd save the day. Princess Carolyn finds a new calling

title: See Mr. Peanutbutter Run
desc: Mr. Peanutbutter starts his campaign for Governor of California by challenging the current governor to a ski race while BoJack is nowhere to be found.

title: The Old Sugarman Place
desc: BoJack goes off the grid and winds up at his grandparents' dilapidated home in Michigan where he reflects on his family legacy and befriends another soul haunted by the past.

title: Hooray! Todd Episode!
desc: Helpful to a fault, Todd is spread thin doing favors for Princess Carolyn, Mr. Peanutbutter and a visitor with a potential connection to BoJack.

title: Commence Fracking
desc: The campaign takes a toll on Diane's love life. BoJack helps Hollyhock search for her mom. Princess Carolyn tries to get pregnant.

title: Thoughts and Prayers
desc: A mass shooting at a mall creates a PR nightmare for Princess Carolyn. BoJack takes Hollyhock to visit his estranged mother.

title: Stupid Piece of Sh*t
desc: Surrounded by family, BoJack spirals into self-loathing. Princess Carolyn and Rutabaga Rabitowitz plan Courtney and Todd's sham wedding.

title: Underground
desc: Mr. Peanutbutter's posh campaign fundraiser takes a terrifying turn. As chaos swirls around them. BoJack and Diane get drunk.

title: The Judge
desc: Hollyhock starts dating an intern on BoJack's new show. Princess Carolyn meets Ralph's parents. Mr. Peanutbutter throws his support behind Woodchuck.

title: Ruthie
desc: On one awful day, Princess Carolyn deals with rejection, deception and loss. BoJack and Diane try to track down Hollyhock's birth certificate.

title: lovin that cali lifestyle!!
desc: Diane leaks damaging information on Jessica Biel, Todd's clown dentist business hits a snag, and Princess Carolyn finds hope in an unlikely place.

title: Time's Arrow
desc: In 1963, young socialite Beatrice Sugarman meets the rebellious Butterscotch Horseman at her debutante party.

title: What Time Is It Right Now
desc: Princess Carolyn pitches "Philbert" to company execs. Todd gets a better business idea. BoJack comes to a realization about Hollyhock.

title: The Light Bulb Scene
desc: BoJack has misgivings about his new show. Princess Carolyn visits an adoption agency. Todd interviews for a job at WhatTimeIsItRightNow.com.

title: The Dog Days Are Over
desc: Diane divorces Mr. Peanutbutter and moves into a shabby studio. Feeling melancholy, she travels to Vietnam to get away from it all.

title: Planned Obsolescence
desc: Todd meet's Yolanda's parents, who don't know she's asexual. Mr. Peanutbutter romances a young waitress. Gina confesses a childhood dream to BoJack.

title: BoJack the Feminist
desc: When Princess Carolyn casts a disgraced celeb in "Philbert," BoJack inadvertently takes a stand. Mr. Peanutbutter tries to toughen up his image.

title: The Amelia Earhart Story
desc: Painful memories come rushing back when Princess Carolyn visits her hometown and meets a pregnant teen. A stunt goes awry on the "Philbert" set.

title: Free Churro
desc: BoJack delivers a eulogy at a funeral.

title: INT. SUB
desc: Diane's therapist encourages her to set boundaries with BoJack. A missing string cheese ignites a dispute between Todd and Princess Carolyn.

title: Mr. Peanutbutter's Boos
desc: At BoJack's 25th annual Halloween party, Pickles gets a crash course in Mr. Peanutbutter's romantic history -- and some advice from Diane.

title: Ancient History
desc: A visiting Hollyhock dumps BoJack's painkillers, sending him on a desperate search for more. Todd tries to solve Emily's dating dilemma.

title: Head in the Clouds
desc: At the "Philbert" premiere party, Princess Carolyn deftly negotiates a deal, Gina steps into the limelight, and Diane confronts BoJack.

title: The Showstopper
desc: "Philbert" is a hit, and filming begins on Season 2. But as BoJack spirals deeper into addiction, he loses his grip on reality.

title: The Stopped Show
desc: In the midst of the latest PR crisis, Princess Carolyn gets a life-changing opportunity. With Diane's help, BoJack finally faces the music.

title: A Horse Walks into a Rehab
desc: BoJack checks into Pastiches, a Malibu rehab facility, where he grapples with memories of Sarah Lynn's death and his own troubled childhood.

title: The New Client
desc: When her nanny quits, Princess Carolyn struggles to balance the demands of work and parenting. Mr. Peanutbutter visits BoJack in rehab.

title: Feel-Good Story
desc: Girl Croosh sends Diane on the road with rugged cameraman Guy, but she balks when they ask her to produce more feel-good stories.

title: Surprise!
desc: Todd organizes a surprise wedding for Pickles and Mr. Peanutbutter, but the party quickly goes off the rails when Mr. Peanutbutter makes a confession.

title: A Little Uneven, Is All
desc: Dr. Champ tells BoJack it's time to leave rehab. Mr. Peanutbutter's reputation takes a hit. In Chicago, Diane wrestles with writer's block.

title: The Kidney Stays in the Picture
desc: The assistants of Hollywoo go on strike. BoJack tries to help Dr. Champ. When Todd learns that his mother needs a kidney, Diane comes up with a plan.

title: The Face of Depression
desc: BoJack travels around the country reconnecting with loved ones, while Mr. Peanutbutter embarks on his own national tour as the face of depression.

title: A Quick One, While He's Away
desc: A reporter digs into the circumstances surrounding Sarah Lynn's death. Hollyhock goes to a party in New York City.

title: Intermediate Scene Study w/ BoJack Horseman
desc: When BoJack starts teaching an acting class at Wesleyan, Hollyhock sets some boundaries in their relationship.

title: Good Damage
desc: Diane's depression lifts, but she's still struggling to start writing her memoir. Reporters Paige and Max pay Penny a visit.

title: Sunk Cost and All That
desc: While Paige and Max question Mr. Peanutbutter at his restaurant, a panicked BoJack tries to piece together what's happening.

title: Xerox of a Xerox
desc: After the Sarah Lynn story breaks, BoJack gives a live interview on TV. Diane meets Guy's teenage son.

title: The Horny Unicorn
desc: BoJack gets a new AA sponsor. Todd plans a sophisticated party to impress his parents. Diane gets to know Sonny.

title: Angela
desc: Angela Diaz reaches out to BoJack. Princess Carolyn gets an offer from Lenny Turtletaub. Todd cooks up a scheme.

title: The View from Halfway Down
desc: BoJack reconnects with faces from his past.

title: Nice While It Lasted
desc: A celebration brings people together.

title: Secrets
desc: The small German town of Winden is shaken by the disappearance of a teenage boy. While the townsfolk are occupied with secrets of their own, at nightfall a group of teenagers attempts to recover something the missing boy may have left behind.

title: Lies
desc: When a grim discovery leaves the police baffled, Ulrich seeks a search warrant for the power plant. A mysterious stranger checks into the hotel.

title: Past and Present
desc: It's 1986, and Ulrich's brother, Mads, has been missing for a month. Confusion reigns as past and present intertwine.

title: Double Lives
desc: Bizarre occurrences give Charlotte a sense of déjà vu, and she suspects Peter is hiding something. Franziska snaps when Magnus confronts her.

title: Truths
desc: Hannah takes her obsession with Ulrich too far. The stranger asks Regina to deliver an important package. Martha is torn between Jonas and Bartosz.

title: Sic Mundus Creatus Est
desc: Ulrich looks to the past for answers and dredges up disturbing family secrets. Armed with new tools, Jonas probes the cave's murky depths.

title: Crossroads
desc: Ulrich questions a frail and frightened Helge in the nursing home. Jonas searches for Mikkel, but the stranger warns him about meddling with the past.

title: As You Sow, so You Shall Reap
desc: In 1953, the disfigured bodies of two boys are exhumed at a construction site, the future location of Winden's nuclear power plant.

title: Everything Is Now
desc: Ulrich runs afoul of the law, Helge tries to dodge Egon Tiedemann, Claudia harnesses the cave's powers, and Katharina lashes out at Hannah.

title: Alpha and Omega
desc: Peter gets a shock. Jonas learns the truth about his family, but there are more surprises still to come. Helge makes a sacrifice.

title: Beginnings and Endings
desc: Six months after the disappearances, the police form a task force. In 2052, Jonas learns that most of Winden perished in an apocalyptic event.

title: Dark Matter
desc: Clausen and Charlotte interview Regina. The Stranger takes Hannah to 1987, where Claudia has an unnerving encounter and Egon visits an old nemesis.

title: Ghosts
desc: In 1954, a missing Helge returns, but he'll only speak to Noah. In 1987, Claudia brings the time machine to Tannhaus, and Egon questions Ulrich again.

title: The Travelers
desc: Jonas meets an ominous figure. While the kids comb the cave for answers, the adults gather in the bunker to share what they know about the travelers.

title: Lost and Found
desc: In 1987, Ulrich seizes an opportunity. The kids return to the cave with the time machine, and Jonas learns of a loophole that could change the future.

title: An Endless Cycle
desc: Armed with a plan to prevent the apocalypse, Jonas travels to 2019. During the Nielsens' anniversary party, Ulrich sneaks off with Hannah.

title: The White Devil
desc: Martha meets the Stranger and learns his true identity. Claudia tries to prevent Egon's death in 1987. Hannah travels to 1954 to see Ulrich.

title: Endings and Beginnings
desc: On the day of the apocalypse, Clausen executes a search warrant at the power plant as Jonas and Claudia use the time machine to connect past and future.

title: Deja-vu
desc: In 2019, Jonas emerges from the cave into a different but not unfamiliar world: The town of Winden reeling from the recent disappearance of a young boy.

title: The Survivors
desc: Martha travels to 1888 to warn her friends about the 2020 disaster. Winden residents past and present search for their missing loved ones.

title: Adam and Eva
desc: Charlotte and Ulrich try to piece together what happened in the bunker. In different times and worlds, Jonas and Martha work to gain each other's trust.

title: The Origin
desc: Jonas and Martha travel to the year 2052 and get a glimpse of a grim future. In 1954, two residents of Winden go missing, and Hannah receives surprising news.

title: Life and Death
desc: In 2020, a visitor delivers a warning to Claudia. The day before the apocalypse, Jonas begins to question Eve's motives.

title: Light and Shadow
desc: Adam holds Martha captive in 2020. On the day of the apocalypse, an increasingly frantic Martha begs Bartosz for his help.

title: Between the Time
desc: Across three centuries, residents of Winden continue their desperate quest to alter their fates and save their loved ones.

title: The Paradise
desc: Claudia reveals to Adam how everything is connected and how he can destroy the knot.

title: Prologue to the Beginning and End
desc: A scientist can't recall events that others claim he experienced.

title: Time Travel Paranoia
desc: Okabe is surprised to see Makise up and about after she was killed.

title: Parallel Process Paranoia
desc: Okabe suspects his microwave oven is behind the recent unusual events.

title: Interpreter Rendezvous...
desc: Okabe needs to find a very old computer to hack a very new tech.

title: Starmine Rendezvous
desc: A successful hack reveals SERN's big secret.

title: Butterfly Effect's Divergence
desc: Okabe's small scale experiment is partially successful.

title: Divergence Singularity
desc: Okabe takes his experimentation to the next level by texting the winning lotto numbers back in time, but he fails to consider how his actions might alter the present - or the future.

title: Chaos Theory Homeostasis I
desc: The latest experiment for Okabe and his lab mates leads to the disappearance of one of their own. Next, they'll attempt to use their time travel technology to make a young boy's dream a reality.

title: Chaos Theory Homeostasis II
desc: Okabe grows concerned over the drastic changes his experimentation is causing, and the IBN-5100 disappears from the lab. The only hope for finding a replacement rests upon the delicate shoulders of Feyris the cat girl.

title: Chaos Theory Homeostasis III
desc: The part-time warrior from downstairs tells Okabe about the search for her missing father. Meanwhile, the aspiring mad scientist is troubled by a mysterious text message.

title: Dogma in Event Horizon
desc: As the lab members prepare to transport human memories by way of a Time Leap, Okabe receives some highly disturbing news: Makise may be a SERN spy!

title: Dogma in Ergosphere
desc: Tension builds at the Lab when Makise and Suzuha both show up for the party, but that's just the beginning. As the night draws to a close, armed thugs - led by a familiar face - come looking for the time machine.

title: Metaphysics Necrosis
desc: Okabe, desperate to prevent the tragedy he's already seen happen, summons the courage for a daring Time Leap. Can he save the life of his oldest and dearest companion?

title: Physically Necrosis
desc: Despite his many attempts, Okabe is unable to prevent the death of Mayuri, so he turns to Makise for help solving the riddle of time travel. Later, Suzuha's true identity is revealed

title: Missing Link Necrosis
desc: Suzuha reveals the orgins of SERN's future totalitarianism. While she continues her work to destroy the organization, Okabe and Mayuri continue the search for Suzuha's father.

title: Sacrificial Necrosis
desc: The truth about Suzuha's father is finally revealed. Okabe realizes the devastating consequences of stopping her from leaving the night of the party.

title: Made in Complex
desc: After the change in divergence fails to have a lasting effect, Okabe and Kurisu set out to further manipulate time in the hopes of gaining an IBN 5100.

title: Fractal Androgynous
desc: In a further attempt to rescue Mayuri from her fate, Okabe reveals Ruka's past to her. Ruka must make a difficult decision that might change her entire life.

title: Endless Apoptosis
desc: Okabe must make a time leap in order to save Moeka from herself. He realizes that all is not what it seems as Moeka's shady behavior leads him closer to the IBN 5100.

title: Finalize Apoptosis
desc: With the help of Kurisu and Moeka, Okabe attempts to get closer to the IBN 5100 and the mysterious FB. As he closes in on SERN's network, he realizes that the path to victory will not be without additional sacrifice.

title: Paradox Meltdown
desc: With his new discovery in mind, Okabe continues his attempts to protect Mayuri while also trying to avoid Kurisu's potential impending fate.

title: Being Meltdown
desc: In order to continue his work against SERN, Okabe must finally choose between saving Kurisu or Mayuri.

title: Open the Steins Gate
desc: Tasked with preventing an impending World War III by an alternate Suzuha, Okabe finds himself playing an active part in Kurisu's death.

title: Achievement Point
desc: Okabe has one final chance to travel back in time, set everything right, and save the girl he never even got to love. His mission is vital, but it may mean the end for the mad scientist.

title: Egoistic Poriomania
desc: After being invited to Los Angeles by Faris, Okabe finds himself chasing after someone who looks strikingly like Suzuha. Later, Okabe and Kurisu discuss their potential love for each other.

title: Kyoukaimenjou No Missing Link - Divide by Zero
desc: Alternate 23rd episode of Steins;Gate, which leads into the story of "Steins;Gate 0".

title: Episode #1.1
desc: Thomas Shelby plans to fix a horse race; some guns turn up stolen.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: Thomas Shelby starts a feud with a gypsy family and finally meets with Inspector Campbell to talk about the stolen guns.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: Thomas is livid to find out that Ada and Freddie are married; IRA sympathizers tries to get information from Thomas about the stolen guns.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: Thomas attempts to make a deal with Campbell; The Peaky's war with the Lees intensifies.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: The Shelbys get a surprise visit by an almost forgotten relative. Thomas has one more dangerous plan with the cops.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: Tommy and the Peaky Blinders prepare for a big operation, that quickly becomes way trickier than they thought.

title: Episode #2.1
desc: When Birmingham crime boss Tommy Shelby's beloved Garrison pub is bombed, he finds himself blackmailed into murdering an Irish dissident.

title: Episode #2.2
desc: After murdering an Irish dissident, Tommy has no choice but to be a pawn in Inspector Campbell's treacherous political game.

title: Episode #2.3
desc: After joining London crime boss Alfie Solomons in a business venture, Tommy worries that Alfie's newly revealed volatility could pose a problem.

title: Episode #2.4
desc: The Peaky Blinders take over London's Eden Club; Sabini convinces his old adversary Alfie Solomons to join forces and eradicate the gang.

title: Episode #2.5
desc: The Peaky Blinders are under attack. Tommy's power base in London is obliterated, and both Arthur and Michael are arrested and imprisoned.

title: Episode #2.6
desc: Tommy plans to execute the mission given to him by Campbell: the assassination of a high-ranking member of the military establishment.

title: Episode #3.1
desc: It is Thomas Shelby's long-awaited wedding day. A mysterious visitor imperils the entire Shelby family, and Tommy finds himself pulled into a web of intrigue more lethal than anything he has yet encountered.

title: Episode #3.2
desc: Tommy discovers the extent of the mission given to him and the extreme lengths his new paymasters are willing to go to in their quest for power. Meanwhile his own family's activities lead to escalating danger in Birmingham.

title: Episode #3.3
desc: Tommy travels to Wales seeking absolution and uncovers a traitor in the Economic League. Michael develops a taste for guns. Arthur gets good news.

title: Episode #3.4
desc: Polly goes to confession, igniting a chain of events that reveals a trap being laid at the Shelbys' expense. Tommy plans an exit from dirty business.

title: Episode #3.5
desc: As the Russians test the Peaky Blinders, Tommy realises that he is seriously outmaneuvered. But he has an ace up his sleeve.

title: Episode #3.6
desc: As Tommy prepares to commit the most audacious crime of his career, an unexpected blow forces him to face his worst fears in a race against time.

title: The Noose
desc: It is Christmas and Tommy Shelby receives a letter that makes him realize that he and every member of the family are in danger. He knows that it is time for the family to bury their differences and face the enemy together.

title: Heathens
desc: As the Shelbys come to terms with shocking events, Tommy makes a decision he may come to regret. Meanwhile, a bold new enemy makes his move.

title: Blackbird
desc: Luca Changretta understands the complexity of his enemy, as the weight of gypsy tradition hangs upon Arthur. But could there be a traitor within the Peaky Blinders' midst?

title: Dangerous
desc: In a daring cat and mouse chase, will Tommy be outwitted by his enemies? And with the return of an old friend, Tommy tries to distract himself with other pursuits.

title: The Duel
desc: Tommy prepares himself as the bloody battle lines are drawn between the Peaky Blinders and Changretta. A deal is struck - with potentially devastating consequences.

title: The Company
desc: During the fight between Goliath and Bonnie Gold events escalate. Then Audrey Changretta appears at a funeral, waving a white flag. She proposes to declare the Vendetta between her family and the Shelbys settled. And she names her price.

title: Black Tuesday
desc: In the wake of the Wall Street Crash, Tommy faces new dangers from unexpected quarters.

title: Black Cats
desc: As the Peaky Blinders come under fire, Tommy is warned about a traitor in his midst.

title: Strategy
desc: As the charismatic Mosley shows his hand, Tommy makes a treacherous new alliance.

title: The Loop
desc: Tommy agrees to dangerous new partnerships, and a Shelby party promises fireworks.

title: The Shock
desc: As Tommy reveals his intentions for Mosley, someone close to the Shelbys is targeted.

title: Mr. Jones
desc: Family tensions surface after an unexpected announcement. Tommy puts his plan for Oswald Mosley into action, but has he underestimated his opponent?

title: Chapter 1: The Mandalorian
desc: A Mandalorian bounty hunter tracks a target for a well-paying, mysterious client.

title: Chapter 2: The Child
desc: Target in hand, the Mandalorian must now contend with scavengers.

title: Chapter 3: The Sin
desc: The battered Mandalorian returns to his client for his reward.

title: Chapter 4: Sanctuary
desc: The Mandalorian teams up with an ex-soldier to protect a farming village from raiders.

title: Chapter 5: The Gunslinger
desc: On a familiar desert planet, the Mandalorian helps a rookie bounty hunter who is in over his head.

title: Chapter 6: The Prisoner
desc: The Mandalorian is part of a crew of mercenaries springing a convict from a prison ship.

title: Chapter 7: The Reckoning
desc: An old contact extends an invitation for the Mandalorian to make peace with his enemies.

title: Chapter 8: Redemption
desc: The Mandalorian and his allies come to know their true enemy, who already knows much about them.

title: Chapter 9: The Marshal
desc: The Mandalorian is drawn to the Outer Rim in search of others of his kind.

title: Chapter 10: The Passenger
desc: The Mandalorian must ferry a passenger with precious cargo on a risky journey.

title: Chapter 11: The Heiress
desc: The Mandalorian braves high seas and meets unexpected allies.

title: Chapter 12: The Siege
desc: The Mandalorian rejoins old allies for a new mission.

title: Chapter 13: The Jedi
desc: The Mandalorian travels to a world ruled by a ruthless magistrate who has made a powerful enemy.

title: Chapter 14: The Tragedy
desc: The Mandalorian and Child travel to an ancient site.

title: Chapter 15: The Believer
desc: To move against the Empire, the Mandalorian needs the help of an old enemy.

title: Chapter 16: The Rescue
desc: The Mandalorian and his allies attempt a daring rescue.
