title: Samuel Jackson Beer & Racial Draft
desc: Dave debuts Samuel Jackson beer, shows us how much cooler life would be if everything were in slow motion and reveals the latest picks in "The Racial Draft".

title: Negrodamus & The Niggar Family
desc: Dave plays the watermelon-shooting Black Gallagher and introduces the Niggar Family; Paul Mooney guest stars as "Negrodamus." Musical guest DMX.

title: White People Can't Dance & The Three Daves
desc: Dave explores the myth that white people can't dance and charts his own emotional growth at ages 18, 24, and 30; musical performance by John Mayer & Ahmir "Questlove" Thompson.

title: The Love Contract & True Hollywood Stories: Rick James
desc: Dave introduces The Love Contract and the first of Charlie Murphy's True Hollywood Stories featuring Rick James. Musical guest Ludacris.

title: True Hollywood Stories: Prince & Red Balls Energy Drink
desc: Charlie Murphy reveals another True Hollywood Story featuring Prince, and Paul Mooney answers life's biggest questions as "Negrodamus." Cee-Lo performs "Call Me".

title: The Internet & Moment In The Life Of Lil Jon
desc: Dave considers what life is like for rap sensation Lil' Jon and imagines how sleazy the Internet would look if it were a place. Anthony Hamilton performs "Comin' From Where I'm From".

title: World Series Of Dice & Mooney On Movies
desc: Dave broadcasts the World Series of Dice and spends another moment in the life of Lil' John; musical performance by Common & Kanye West.

title: I Know Black People & Keeping It Real Goes Wrong
desc: Dave hosts his new game show "I Know Black People," with another installment of "When Keeping it Real Goes Wrong"; musical performance by Erykah Badu.

title: Oprah's Baby Daddy & Jury Duty
desc: Dave imagines life as Oprah's baby's daddy and shares his experience as a jury member on the OJ Simpson trial; musical performance by Wyclef Jean.

title: Kneehigh Park & Making Da Band
desc: Dave takes a closer look at the Diddy-driven show "Making da Band" and premieres his new puppet show Kneehigh Park; musical performance by Snoop Dogg.

title: Mandela Boot Camp & The Time Haters
desc: Dave reveals his greatest misses. Previously unaired sketches that did not work.

title: Wayne Brady & Tyrone Biggums's Fear Factor
desc: Wayne Brady replaces Dave on his own show and takes him for a menacing ride. Tyrone Biggums returns as a guest on Fear Factor.

title: Lil Jon On Lil Jon & Black Bush
desc: Dave considers how recent events would have played out if President Bush were black and spends another moment in the life of Lil' John.

title: The Best of Chappelle's Show: Season 2, Volume 1
desc: The best sketches from season 2 of the Comedy Central hit series "Chappelle's Show."

title: Music Jump-Off
desc: A collection of musical acts from past episodes.

title: The Best of Chappelle's Show: Season 2, Volume 2 (except Rick James)
desc:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

title: $55 Million & Getting Revenge
desc: Dave's got a big new contract and sets out to get revenge on all those who have wronged him, while everyone else tries to charge him more money for everything now that he's rich.

title: Black Howard Dean & Stereotype Pixies
desc: Dave screams his way across the campaign trail as Howard Dean, gets into a fight as Gary Coleman, and tries to ignore the racial stereotype pixies that follow him everywhere he goes.

title: Show Business & Lil Jon In Love
desc: Dave finally gets his chance to meet the great and powerful Show Business, and introduces us to a group of monsters victimized by discrimination.

title: Pilot
desc: In 1980, a group of high school students face various social struggles. Wealthy "brain" Lindsay wants to rebel. Her geeky freshman brother Sam and his two friends are targeted by a bully.

title: Beers and Weirs
desc: When Mr. and Mrs. Weir go out of town for the weekend, Lindsay hosts a keg party. Sam, Bill, and Neal are worried that the party-goers will get too rowdy, so they substitute a keg of non-alcoholic beer for the one the freaks have on ice.

title: Tricks and Treats
desc: Halloween doesn't go as expected for Sam, Lindsay, or their parents.

title: Tests and Breasts
desc: Daniel cons Lindsay into helping him pass an algebra test, while Sam and his pals try to figure out the basics of human sexuality.

title: I'm with the Band
desc: Lindsay encourages Nick to pursue a career in music. Nick continues to practice with his current band, but quickly decides he's better than them. Lindsay encourages Nick to audition for a bigger local band. When things don't go well in the audition, Lindsay is there to comfort Nick. Sam, Bill, and Neal struggle with having to shower in gym class.

title: Carded and Discarded
desc: Sam, Neal, and Bill befriend a pretty new transfer student, but soon fear of losing her to the popular crowd and try to win her over with a series of fun things they plan for her. Lindsay, Nick, Daniel, and Ken decide to get fake IDs so they can see a hot local band perform at a bar. However, after they go through the trouble of getting their IDs and going into the ba... Read all

title: Girlfriends and Boyfriends
desc: Lindsay and Nick get more serious, and her parents give unwanted advice. Sam joins the yearbook staff to get closer to Cindy, who thinks of him only as a friend.

title: We've Got Spirit
desc: Sam tries out to be the school mascot hoping to impress Cindy. Meanwhile, Daniel, Ken, and Kim suddenly become the basketball team's most rabid fans following a series of run-ins with jocks from the rival school, Lincoln High. Lindsay tries to figure out the best way to break up with Nick.

title: The Diary
desc: Lindsay's parents are convinced Kim is leading their daughter down a path toward drugs and sex, so they consider taking a peek in her diary. Meanwhile, Bill is tired of the same jocks picking the teams during P.E., often leaving him picked last, so he makes prank calls to Coach Fredricks then confronts him directly. The adults may be the ones learning lessons from the... Read all

title: Looks and Books
desc: Lindsay stops hanging out with her "freak" friends after a car accident, and decides to rejoin the mathletes. Sam adopts a new modern hair style and wardrobe in the hopes of impressing Cindy.

title: The Garage Door
desc: Neal learns his father is cheating on his mother. Ken develops a crush on the tuba player in the school's marching band and Lindsay helps set them up.

title: Chokin' and Tokin'
desc: When Bill talks about being allergic to peanuts in class, Alan tries to prove he's lying but Bill ends up in the hospital after an allergic reaction. Lindsay smokes weed for the first time.

title: Kim Kelly Is My Friend
desc: Kim befriends Lindsay but she has ulterior motives, while Sam is bullied mercilessly by Karen Scarfolli, whose locker is next to his.

title: Discos and Dragons
desc: Nick explores disco, Lindsay listens to the Grateful Dead, and Daniel tries something new. What's cool? Friendship.

title: Smooching and Mooching
desc: Nick stays with the Weirs after a fight with his father and the geeks go to a make-out party.

title: The Little Things
desc: As McKinley High prepares for a visit from Vice President Bush, Ken and Sam must sort out conflicted feelings in their love lives.

title: Dead Dogs and Gym Teachers
desc: Lindsay tries to convince Harold to let her join her friends at a Who concert. Kim and Lindsay accidentally run over Millie's dog. Kim starts hanging out with Millie. Lindsay wants to tell Millie the truth about her dog, but Kim does not. Meanwhile, Nick teaches himself to play guitar and writes a love ballad for Lindsay. Ms. Haverchuck stuns Bill with the news that s... Read all

title: Noshing and Moshing
desc: Neal wrestles with the dilemma of whether to tell his mother about his father's affair. Lindsay is given detention after coming to the aid of a girl being attacked by a boy. Daniel deals with pressures at home and with Kim. He escapes from his problems through punk music.

title: Pilot
desc: American football coach Ted Lasso is hired by a wealthy divorcée to coach English soccer team AFC Richmond.

title: Biscuits
desc: It's Ted's first day of coaching, and fans aren't happy. He makes little headway but remains undeterred as the team plays its first match.

title: Trent Crimm: The Independent
desc: To arrange an in-depth expose, Rebecca pairs cynical journalist Trent Crimm with Ted for a day. Ted and Roy venture into the community.

title: For the Children
desc: Rebecca hosts the team's annual charity benefit, where Ted stages a reconciliation between Roy and Jamie.

title: Tan Lines
desc: Ted reunites with his wife and son. Ted makes a bold choice and takes Jamie out of the game.

title: Two Aces
desc: When Jamie refuses to train, Ted turns to talented new signing Dani Rojas-and the team is struck by an age-old curse.

title: Make Rebecca Great Again
desc: Rebecca deals with her anniversary blues. Ted signs papers and has a small breakdown. An old friend of Rebecca introduces herself to Ted.

title: The Diamond Dogs
desc: Ted and Roy are both having relationship problems. Ted consults the Diamond Dogs while Roy lays it on the line with Keeley.

title: All Apologies
desc: After a series of mistakes on the pitch, pressure mounts to bench Roy. Rebecca finally reveals the truth to Ted.

title: The Hope That Kills You
desc: Richmond plays a climactic match that will determine the fates of Ted and his club.

title: Goodbye Earl
desc: AFC Richmond brings in a sports psychologist to help the team overcome their unprecedented seven game tie-streak.

title: Lavender
desc: Ted is surprised by the reappearance of a familiar face; Roy tries out a new gig.

title: Do the Right-est Thing
desc: Rebecca has a special visitor shadow her at work. A player's return is not welcomed by the team.

title: Carol of the Bells
desc: It's Christmas in Richmond. Rebecca enlists Ted for a secret mission, Roy and Keeley search for a miracle and the Higginses open up their home.

title: Rainbow
desc: Nate learns how to be assertive from Keeley and Rebecca. Ted asks Roy for a favor. Roy reconsiders his future.

title: The Signal
desc: Ted is fired up that the new team dynamic seems to be working. But will they have a chance in the quarter final?

title: Headspace
desc: With things turning around for Richmond, it's time for everyone to work on their issues - like Ted's discomfort, Nate's confidence and Roy's attention.

title: Man City
desc: Ted and Dr. Sharon realize they might have to meet each other halfway. Tensions are high as the team prepares for their FA Cup semi-final against Man City.

title: Beard After Hours
desc: After the semi-final defeat, Beard sets out on an all-night odyssey through London in order to collect his thoughts.

title: No Weddings and a Funeral
desc: Rebecca is stunned by a sudden loss. The team rallies to show their support, but Ted finds himself grappling with a piece of his past.

title: Midnight Train to Royston
desc: A billionaire football enthusiast from Ghana makes Sam an unbelievable offer. Ted plans something special for Dr. Sharon's last day with the team.

title: Inverting the Pyramid of Success
desc: Richmond gets their final chance to win promotion as Ted deals with the fallout of Trent Crimm's painfully honest exposé.

title: Descenso
desc: Chilean drug chemist Cockroach brings his product to Colombian smuggler Pablo Escobar. DEA agent Steve Murphy joins the war on drugs in Bogota.

title: The Sword of Simón Bolivar
desc: Communist radical group M-19 makes a move against the narcos, while Murphy gets an education in Colombian law enforcement from his new partner Peña.

title: The Men of Always
desc: Murphy encounters the depths of government corruption when he and Peña try to derail Escobar's political ambitions by proving he's a narco.

title: The Palace in Flames
desc: Despite a new extradition treaty, the U.S. puts more money into fighting communism, creating new challenges for Murphy and Peña in the hunt for Pablo.

title: There Will Be a Future
desc: Pablo's extreme methods put the narcos on the brink of war with Carillo and the government. Peña tries to protect his witness.

title: Explosivos
desc: Peña and Carillo close in on Gacha. Murphy tries to protect pro-extradition candidate Gaviria from a notorious assassin connected to Pablo.

title: You Will Cry Tears of Blood
desc: Pablo goes into hiding as the political tide turns against him, but he finds a way to strike back. Murphy and Peña finally get the CIA to help them.

title: La Gran Mentira
desc: A tragic mistake forces the government to change tactics in the fight against Pablo. But Pablo faces bigger threats from inside his empire.

title: La Catedral
desc: The hunt for Pablo seems to be over after he makes a deal with the government, but Murphy and Peña - and the Cali Cartel - have other plans.

title: Despegue
desc: Pablo's activities in prison provoke the government into taking extreme action. Murphy and Peña face a situation of their own.

title: Free at Last
desc: In the aftermath of a massive military effort to take Pablo into custody, the family reunites while enemies worry. Steve and Connie fight about safety.

title: Cambalache
desc: Tata gets impatient with life on the run. Pablo responds to President Gaviria's reward offer. Steve and Javier meet their new boss.

title: Our Man in Madrid
desc: President Gaviria has a new job for an old colleague. The Search Bloc's new tactics shake up Pablo, but also unsettle Steve and Javier.

title: The Good, the Bad, and the Dead
desc: The Cali cartel discusses moving in on Pablo's territory. Limón proposes a plan to Maritza. Tata gets a gun for protection.

title: The Enemies of My Enemy
desc: The Search Bloc gets a new leader. Javier loses faith in the system. Pablo brings Tata's brother Carlos down from Miami to cheer her up.

title: Los Pepes
desc: The newly-formed Los Pepes want to destroy Pablo and his empire. Tata's brother urges her to leave and seek safety with her children.

title: Deutschland 93
desc: As the danger intensifies for the Escobars, Pablo sends his family to another country. Gaviria weighs the opportunity to use them as leverage.

title: Exit El Patrón
desc: Colombia begins to turn on Escobar after his latest terrorist attack. Tata receives help from an unlikely ally. Quica gets increasingly anxious.

title: Nuestra Finca
desc: Pablo is reunited with an estranged family member. Judy Moncada's life is put in danger. The DEA and CIA clash over how to handle Los Pepes.

title: Al Fin Cayó!
desc: Javier deals with the repercussions from Judy's interview. Tata tries to convince Pablo to surrender for the sake of his children.

title: The Kingpin Strategy
desc: The Gentlemen of Cali gather their associates together for a big surprise announcement about the future of their business.

title: The Cali KGB
desc: A gas incident threatens to destroy the agreement between Cali and the government and requires Jorge's help. Peña has problems with his old contact in Los Pepes.

title: Follow the Money
desc: The Rodríguez brothers are hiding during the negotiations. Pacho meets the Lord of the Heavens in Mexico. Peña's new DEA team visits Cali.

title: Checkmate
desc: Peña hatches a plan to try to capture Cali leader Gilberto Rodriguez. Amado proposes a business idea to Pacho.

title: MRO
desc: Paranoid about leaks, Miguel cracks down on his security. Pacho makes a decision about his new offer. Peña works on cultivating a witness.

title: Best Laid Plans
desc: Jorge takes a dangerous risk. An accident in New York threatens to expose Chepe. Peña travels to Curacao to arrest a potential witness.

title: Sin Salida
desc: Peña plans another secret operation to topple a member of the Cali cartel but may run out of time while looking for him.

title: Convivir
desc: David seeks revenge on behalf of his father and puts Enrique in danger. Peña asks Don Berna for help on a rescue mission.

title: Todos Los Hombres del Presidente
desc: David follows his suspicions. Peña is shocked to discover the depth of corruption in the Colombian government. Miguel is sought after once again.

title: Going Back to Cali
desc: David and Peña are in a race against each other to find Pallomari. Peña makes a serious decision about the future of his career.

title: Uno
desc: Struggling public defender Jimmy McGill constructs an elaborate yet questionable plan for winning back a pair of wealthy potential clients.

title: Mijo
desc: Jimmy's latest scam has gone horribly wrong and he's face-to-face with violent criminals and being forced to talk his way out of a life-threatening situation.

title: Nacho
desc: Jimmy must prove that Nacho is innocent when he is wrongly suspected of kidnapping.

title: Hero
desc: Jimmy makes a bold move against Hamlin in an effort to attract potential clients.

title: Alpine Shepherd Boy
desc: After a strange encounter with the police, Chuck ends up in the hospital. Jimmy meets up with a series of unruly clients.

title: Five-O
desc: Mike's days as a police officer in Philadelphia catch up to him when he's questioned about a tragic event from his past.

title: Bingo
desc: The Kettlemans seek Jimmy as their lawyer after turning down an offer from HHM, going as far as attempting to blackmail him.

title: RICO
desc: Jimmy discovers the Sandpiper Retirement Home has been scamming his elderly clients, and prepares to take legal action.

title: Pimento
desc: Chuck wants to transfer the Sandpiper case to HHM much to Jimmy's dismay. Mike gets a job offer working as a bodyguard.

title: Marco
desc: Jimmy seizes an opportunity to reconnect with an old friend; Chuck adjusts to a new way of life.

title: Switch
desc: Jimmy decides to quit the law after turning down a job at Davis & Main. Mike breaks ties with a former associate.

title: Cobbler
desc: While Mike attempts to track down Pryce's stolen baseball cards, Jimmy must defend him when the police call him in for further questioning.

title: Amarillo
desc: Jimmy struggles with client outreach and decides to shoot a TV commercial for Davis & Main. Mike begins an investigation.

title: Gloves Off
desc: Jimmy and Kim face the repercussions of the TV commercial. Mike makes a deal with Nacho in regards to his newest job offer.

title: Rebecca
desc: Jimmy chafes under his restrictive work environment; Kim goes to extremes to dig herself from a bottomless hole at HHM.

title: Bali Ha'i
desc: Jimmy finds comfort in familiarity; Kim receives a life-changing proposal; when he is threatened, Mike finds himself pushed to the limit.

title: Inflatable
desc: When Mike's hand is forced, he can no longer hide his frustration; Mike and Jimmy work together to keep the peace.

title: Fifi
desc: Mike aims to settle the score with an enemy; an unexpected opportunity presents itself to Jimmy.

title: Nailed
desc: Mike takes a methodical approach to his mission; someone questions Chuck's capabilities; Jimmy faces a personal dilemma.

title: Klick
desc: Jimmy must make a hard choice; Mike takes control of matters; Hamlin delivers shocking news.

title: Mabel
desc: As Chuck plots his next move, another lie comes back to haunt Jimmy. A rattled Mike tries to find out who's been tracking his movements - and how.

title: Witness
desc: Jimmy and Kim hire an assistant; Mike seeks out a mysterious acquaintance; and Chuck uses the law to gain an advantage over Jimmy.

title: Sunk Costs
desc: Jimmy decides to represent a new client, much to Kim's dismay. Meanwhile, Mike meets a formidable ally who presents him an enticing offer.

title: Sabrosito
desc: Jimmy calls in a favor from Mike. Meanwhile, new complications disrupt the Salamancas' business; and Chuck and Jimmy struggle to compromise.

title: Chicanery
desc: Kim and Jimmy face off with an adversary. Jimmy looks to Chuck's past to secure his future. Jimmy loses an ally and gains another.

title: Off Brand
desc: Jimmy embarks on a new endeavor. Chuck pushes himself to the limit. Nacho finds himself ensnared in a power struggle.

title: Expenses
desc: Jimmy tries to settle his debts. Nacho reunites with an old acquaintance. Mike helps Stacey with a project and makes a meaningful connection.

title: Slip
desc: Jimmy is pushed to desperate measures. Nacho picks up a skill and Mike explores an alliance. Kim stands up to Hamlin.

title: Fall
desc: Jimmy visits an old friend and takes up a new pastime; Chuck and Hamlin spar over the future of the firm; and Kim faces challenges at work.

title: Lantern
desc: Kim resolves to take some time off from work, while Jimmy does his best to make amends; Nacho takes a major gamble with his future; Hamlin applies pressure on Chuck to finally make a decision.

title: Smoke
desc: Jimmy struggles to cope with Chuck's tragic incident. Mike ponders his role at Madrigal. Howard makes a startling confession.

title: Breathe
desc: Jimmy seeks new employment. Gus navigates the fallout from Hector's collapse. Kim endeavors to support Jimmy in the wake of Chuck's death.

title: Something Beautiful
desc: Jimmy puts a risky plan into motion; as alliances shift, Nacho finds himself in the crosshairs; Kim contemplates her future.

title: Talk
desc: A restless Jimmy embarks on a new endeavor while Mike burns bridges; Kim pursues her bliss; Nacho tries to survive a turf war.

title: Quite a Ride
desc: Jimmy identifies a new market for his talents; Mike vets a potential partnership; Kim drives a hard bargain.

title: Piñata
desc: While Jimmy daydreams about reconstituting Wexler-McGill, Kim sets out to secure her own future; Mike puts a plan into motion for Gus.

title: Something Stupid
desc: Jimmy runs into a problem as he expands his business that only Kim can solve. Gus gets involved in Hector's medical care. Mike has to deal with a setback.

title: Coushatta
desc: Jimmy goes to great lengths to right a wrong, as Kim pulls out all the stops for a case; Mike lets his team blow off steam; Nacho receives a visitor.

title: Wiedersehen
desc: Jimmy and Kim unburden themselves, risking their relationship in the process; Nacho is forced to make the rounds with Lalo; Mike has cause to worry.

title: Winner
desc: Jimmy turns the page on his reputation; Lalo tracks a loose end in Gus's operation; Mike is forced to make a difficult decision.

title: Magic Man
desc: Now doing business as Saul Goodman, Jimmy unveils an unorthodox strategy that tests Kim's tolerance of his new legal persona. Lalo searches for the mysterious "Michael."

title: 50% Off
desc: Jimmy's promotional stunt has unintended consequences. Nacho takes extreme measures to earn Lalo's trust. Saul is a success at the courthouse, but still has yet to win Kim over. Simmering with rage and self-loathing, Mike loses his temper.

title: The Guy for This
desc: Jimmy's business enters uncharted territory. Kim's confidence is tested when she's faced with a legal problem only she can solve. Nacho navigates increased pressure from Gus. Mike continues to spiral.

title: Namaste
desc: As Jimmy doubles down on "Saul Goodman", a deeply conflicted Kim brings him an interesting proposition. Gus makes a sacrifice in order to play the long game. Mike attempts to smooth things over with his family.

title: Dedicado a Max
desc: Mike takes an impromptu trip out of town; as she and Jimmy grow closer over their campaign to help a client, Kim makes a surprising call.

title: Wexler v. Goodman
desc: Kim tries to pump the brakes on Jimmy's latest scheme, but it may be too late to stop Saul; Mike turns the heat up on Lalo; Nacho attempts to enlist support from above.

title: JMM
desc: Jimmy and Kim build a legal firewall with help from Huell; Kim sets things straight with her clients as Jimmy is compromised by his; Gus calms troubled waters in service of his plot to build an empire; Mike does damage control.

title: Bagman
desc: When a simple errand for a client goes sideways, Jimmy is pushed to the limit; Mike takes measures to contain the wrath of the cartel; Lalo gets an unexpected visitor.

title: Bad Choice Road
desc: In the wake of Jimmy's traumatic misadventure, Kim takes stock of what is important; Jimmy attempts to return to business as usual, but it's more difficult than anticipated; Gus and Mike set a plan in motion.

title: Something Unforgivable
desc: Jimmy and Kim make a sideways move that takes a serious turn; Nacho gets closer to the cartel than he'd like.

title: Captain Cook
desc: Captain Blackadder spots an opportunity to get away from the trenches when General Melchett announces a painting competition for the cover of "King and Country" magazine.

title: Corporal Punishment
desc: Blackadder hatches a cunning plan to avoid starvation and ignore his orders by eating a carrier pigeon.

title: Major Star
desc: Blackadder sees an opportunity to escape the trenches by organizing a variety show as entertainment for the troops.

title: Private Plane
desc: Blackadder and his friends join the Air Corps, wrongly believing it will be less dangerous than being in the trenches.

title: General Hospital
desc: The General asks Blackadder to find a spy in the hospital; one of the patients has a thick German accent and an interest in all things military.

title: Goodbyeee
desc: Blackadder pretends that he's insane to avoid certain death carrying out the General's order for the "big push".

title: It's Always Sunny on TV
desc: The original unaired pilot to It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia (2004) plot-wise closely resembling Charlie Has Cancer (2005).

title: The Gang Gets Racist
desc: The guys hire Dee's friend as a promoter for the bar and get more than they bargained for. Charlie seeks black friends to prove he isn't a racist.

title: Charlie Wants an Abortion
desc: In this take on the abortion debate Dennis and Mac go to opposite sides of an abortion rally to pick up women while Charlie deals with an unruly kid he believes to be his son.

title: Underage Drinking: A National Concern
desc: The gang turns Paddy's into a safe haven for teens, but things get weird when they all get asked to the local high school prom.

title: Charlie Has Cancer
desc: When Charlie confidentially confides that he has cancer, it leads to a series of instances of the guys manipulating women and one gorgeous transsexual (not a transvestite).

title: Gun Fever
desc: When Paddy's gets robbed, the gang decides to purchase a gun with many issues. At the same time Dee is dating a mysterious man which the gang suspects to be the robber.

title: The Gang Finds a Dead Guy
desc: A guy dies in Paddy's pub. Dennis and Mac use the guy's death as an excuse to get close to the guy's attractive granddaughter. Meanwhile, Charlie discovers that Dennis and Dee's grandfather was a Nazi.

title: Charlie Got Molested
desc: The gang learns that Charlie's former elementary school teacher is on trial for child molestation and they attempt to stage an intervention to get Charlie to admit that he was.

title: Charlie Gets Crippled
desc: The gang discovers the perks of being handicapped when Charlie becomes wheel-chair bound after an accident. Dennis and Dee's estranged father returns.

title: The Gang Goes Jihad
desc: When half of Paddy's gets bought out by a business developer, the gang seeks revenge. Unfortunately, an ill-timed dog-napping plot, a poorly made video tape, and a flaming bag of poop threaten the gang's chances of getting their property back.

title: Mac Bangs Dennis' Mom
desc: Tensions run high in the gang when Mac courts Dennis and Dee's mom and the two organize a stakeout to blackmail Frank and get out of "Charlie work".

title: Dennis and Dee Go on Welfare
desc: Dennis and Dee quit their jobs and concoct a plan to get welfare benefits so they can pursue their unrealistic goals and dreams.

title: Hundred Dollar Baby
desc: Inspired by the movie "Million Dollar Baby", Frank teaches Dee to inflict punishment while Dennis and Mac teach Charlie to take punishment. But both fighting careers are derailed by the use of "performance enhancing supplements".

title: The Gang Gives Back
desc: After being arrested for arson, Charlie is sentenced to community service and required to attend AA. Here he makes a discovery that could assist him in his ongoing effort to connect with the Waitress.

title: The Gang Exploits a Miracle
desc: Frank tries to cavort the holy crowd when Mac discovers a water stain on Paddy's wall that closely resembles the Virgin Mary.

title: The Gang Runs for Office
desc: The gang discovers that if you run for office, people will pay you to quit. So of course, the gang exploits this and Dennis runs for office. At the same time Frank and Charlie try to stop this, which ends up in a feud.

title: Charlie Goes America All Over Everybody's Ass
desc: To prove their patriotism, Charlie and Dee try to upstage the local anti-smoking group, while Dennis and Mac turn Paddy's into a bastion of true freedom. But when Frank takes things too far, Paddy's is populated with creeps and lowlifes, and the gang decides they want to live under a totalitarian state.

title: Dennis and Dee Get a New Dad
desc: When Dennis and Dee discover their mother has lied to them about Frank being their dad, they get to know their real father. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie attempt to impress Mac's imprisoned father by becoming hardened criminals.

title: The Gang Finds a Dumpster Baby
desc: Mac and Dee decide to raise a baby they find in the dumpster. Dennis talks some trash while going green and befriending radical environmentalist groups, while Charlie and Frank go dumpster-diving.

title: The Gang Gets Invincible
desc: Dennis, Mac, and Dee take part in the Philadelphia Eagles' open tryouts, while Frank drops acid and freaks out when he and Charlie tailgate next to the McPoyles.

title: The Gang Gets Held Hostage
desc: The McPoyle brothers and sister Margaret take the gang hostage at Paddy's, raising the stakes to a new level in the feud between the two groups.

title: Dennis and Dee's Mom Is Dead
desc: After Dennis and Dee's gold-digging mother dies from a botched plastic-surgery operation, Dee and Frank scheme to get their name in the will, while Dennis inherits the house and makes plans for a party mansion.

title: The Gang Solves the North Korea Situation
desc: As they prepare for the annual Pub Crawl, the gang is horrified to learn that they face competition from a new Korean bar.

title: The Aluminum Monster vs. Fatty Magoo
desc: Dee discovers that the biggest loser and fatty from high school is now a successful and thin fashion designer... now making Dee the biggest loser.

title: Frank Sets Sweet Dee on Fire
desc: In their quest to become famous, Frank, Charlie, and Mac, search for newsworthy footage to air on public access.

title: The Gang Sells Out
desc: A corporate chain offers to buy the Paddy's Pub, leaving Dee and Charlie unemployed and forcing them to find jobs at another restaurant, where they abuse their positions and take advantage of the manager, who is Dee's friend.

title: Sweet Dee's Dating a Retarded Person
desc: While Dennis and Dee try to figure out if the rapper Dee is dating has a mental handicap or not, Charlie, Mac, and Frank try to start their own band without knowledge of how to play musical instruments.

title: Mac Is a Serial Killer
desc: After reading that a serial killer is on the loose, the gang notices that Mac is acting shady and decides to find out if he's the man behind the murders.

title: Dennis Looks Like a Registered Sex Offender
desc: Dennis is angry because he's being mistaken for a fat guy rather than the sex offender who moved next door to Charlie. Meanwhile, Mac's father is released from prison and he and Mac have some catching up to do.

title: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 1
desc: After stumbling upon a kilo of cocaine, the gang is forced to pay off a $25,000 debt to the mob. Mac becomes a mob informant, while Frank pimps out Dennis as an escort at the local country club. Charlie stumbles upon an opportunity to sell illegal narcotics.

title: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 2
desc: While paying off their debt to the mob, Charlie and Dee try to find a way to make fake cocaine in order to fool them, while Dennis ranks in thousands of dollars being pimped out at the local country club. Mac realizes his position as a mob informant isn't being utilized to its full potential.

title: Bums: Making a Mess All Over the City
desc: Dee and Mac become Guardian Angels and clean up the streets when a bum starts using the alley behind the bar to masturbate. Meanwhile, Dennis, Charlie, and Frank impersonate police officers in order to get preferential treatment.

title: The Gang Dances Their Asses Off
desc: After Charlie accidentally puts Paddy's Pub up for 1st prize in a local dance competition, Frank makes the gang participate in the contest. Here, they form alliances and try to cheat the other contestants, as well as themselves, out of first place.

title: Mac and Dennis: Manhunters
desc: Mac and Dennis pursue the ultimate high of hunting another man by stalking Rickety Cricket, while Dee and Charlie become obsessed with eating human flesh after they come to believe Frank has fed some of it to them.

title: The Gang Solves the Gas Crisis
desc: While Mac, Dennis, and Charlie use their classic setup to sell gallons of gasoline door to door, Frank subjects Dee to a series of torture and mind games when he suspects that Dee is trying to kill him while the two plot to steal their inheritance from Bruce Mathis.

title: Mac's Banging the Waitress
desc: Charlie manipulates Mac and Dennis when he accuses the two of them with sleeping with the coffee shop waitress.

title: America's Next Top Paddy's Billboard Model Contest
desc: After buying a billboard, Frank subjects Dennis to a series of humiliating tests in a competition to get on the billboard, while Mac tries to find female subjects willing to go through his own version of a reality show, of sorts.

title: Mac & Charlie Die: Part 1
desc: After Mac's father is released from prison, Mac and Charlie stage their own deaths to save their lives.

title: Mac & Charlie Die: Part 2
desc: After Mac and Charlie fake their own deaths, the rest of the gang finds unique ways of dealing with the loss.

title: Who Pooped the Bed?
desc: Frank and Charlie find someone has pooped in their bed, leading Mac and Dennis to join them as they attempt to find the culprit.

title: Paddy's Pub: The Worst Bar in Philadelphia
desc: The gang kidnaps the writer of a review claiming that Paddy's is the worst bar in Philadelphia and tries to force him to change his mind. But things get worse when Dennis and Dee accidentally kidnap the writer's neighbor.

title: Dennis Reynolds: An Erotic Life
desc: While Frank and Mac come up with ways to spice up Dennis' erotic memoir, Dee finds that spending time in Charlie's shoes is way more difficult than it seems, and vice-versa.

title: Sweet Dee Has a Heart Attack
desc: After Dee suffers a heart attack, she and Dennis try a healthier lifestyle. Charlie and Mac join the corporate work force to get health insurance.

title: The Gang Cracks the Liberty Bell
desc: In order to get Paddy's recognized by the city as a historical landmark, Mac, Dennis, and Charlie flash back to 1776 to tell the tale of the Paddy's crew's involvement in the cracking of the Liberty Bell.

title: The Gang Gets Extreme: Home Makeover Edition
desc: While trying to make their own dreams come true, the gang decides to pay it forward to an unlucky family living in the city only to have their plans backfire on them.

title: The Nightman Cometh
desc: Charlie stages a rock opera based on his song "Nightman," and recruits the rest of the gang to help him with it.

title: The Gang Exploits the Mortgage Crisis
desc: While Frank buys a foreclosed house with intentions of selling it for profit, Mac and Dennis become hot-headed real estate brokers, and Dee takes advantage of a suburban couple looking to hire a surrogate mother.

title: The Gang Hits the Road
desc: The gang takes Dee's new subcompact car and a U-haul on the road with the intentions of hitting the Grand Canyon, and Charlie attempts to expand his horizons.

title: The Great Recession
desc: Mac and Dennis try to cut back Paddy's expenses by firing Dee and Charlie, and Frank figures out a clever way to keep the bar afloat.

title: The Gang Gives Frank an Intervention
desc: After Frank embarrasses himself at the funeral of a deceased relative, Dennis and Dee decide that it's finally time to give him an intervention for his reckless lifestyle.

title: The Waitress Is Getting Married
desc: Dee discovers that the waitress Charlie is obsessed with is getting married to her ex-boyfriend and plots to derail the wedding, while Mac, Frank and Dennis try to get Charlie back on the dating scene.

title: The World Series Defense
desc: Fighting a series of traffic tickets, Dennis, along with the rest of the gang, tell the judge about their horrific experiences at Game 5 of the Phillies' world series.

title: The Gang Wrestles for the Troops
desc: The gang decides to put on a wrestling show for troops returning home while Dee courts a soldier who doesn't seem like the person she's chatting online with.

title: Paddy's Pub: Home of the Original Kitten Mittens
desc: The gang attempts to create a merchandising angle for Paddy's when a convention comes to Philly.

title: Mac and Dennis Break Up
desc: Taking Dee's advice seriously, Mac and Dennis decide that they're too co-dependent on each other and need to spend time apart. Meanwhile Charlie and Frank help Dee out with a major cat problem in her apartment.

title: A Very Sunny Christmas
desc: Dennis and Dee decide to teach Frank a lesson "A Christmas Carol"-style, and Mac and Charlie learn some shocking things about their childhood Christmas traditions.

title: The D.E.N.N.I.S. System
desc: Dennis presents his fool-proof plan for picking up chicks, but soon finds that the gang each has their own fool-proof plans for one-upping each other.

title: Mac and Charlie Write a Movie
desc: After Dee gets cast as an extra in the new M. Night Shyamalan movie, Mac and Charlie see a perfect opportunity to pitch their script, while Frank becomes a casting agent for Dennis.

title: The Gang Reignites the Rivalry
desc: Mac, Dennis, and Charlie seek revenge on another bar after their 10-year ban in a local flip-cup tournament is lifted, but find they need serious practice. Dee discovers new skills, and Frank wears tight pants.

title: Mac Fights Gay Marriage
desc: Mac pulls out the big guns to protect the sanctity of marriage, while the rest of the gang reap the rewards of marital bliss.

title: Dennis Gets Divorced
desc: Marital bliss turns to marital business, as the gang experiences the emotional and economic tribulations of divorce.

title: The Gang Buys a Boat
desc: The gang attempts to open themselves up to the adventures of the sea after they purchase their 'new' boat.

title: Mac's Big Break
desc: After Mac wins a radio contest to score a goal on the Flyers' ice, he and Charlie train for the event - badly, while Dennis and Dee start their own radio program.

title: Mac and Charlie: White Trash
desc: Mac & Charlie attempt to fix up their old pool after getting rejected by a country club, Dennis, Dee, and Frank attempt to gain entry to the club.

title: Mac's Mom Burns Her House Down
desc: Charlie and Mac set up a truly odd couple after Mac's Mom burns the house down, while Frank discovers the importance of paternal care when Dee falls ill.

title: Who Got Dee Pregnant?
desc: The gang gets a real 'scare' after Dee reveals she's pregnant, forcing the guys to recall their last hazy Halloween Party to determine if one of them might be the father.

title: The Gang Gets a New Member
desc: A blast from the past prompts the guys to expand membership, and Dee to re-consider her future.

title: Dee Reynolds: Shaping America's Youth
desc: Motivated by the drama teacher who inspired her, Dee takes a job as a substitute teacher and exposes her students to the culture of Paddy's with a field trip to see the Gang's take on the Lethal Weapon series: Lethal Weapon 5.

title: Charlie Kelly: King of the Rats
desc: When keeping the basement rodent-free drives Charlie to the brink, the gang decides to put the cynicism aside and throw a surprise party to cheer him up.

title: The Gang Gets Stranded in the Woods
desc: Things go awry as the Gang travels to Atlantic City for a charity benefit. While Frank, Dee and Mac try to survive in the woods, Dennis and Charlie hitch a ride to the city and have the night of their lives.

title: Dee Gives Birth
desc: Before Dee's baby arrives, The Gang tries to figure out who is the father by throwing a house party for all her former flings.

title: Frank's Pretty Woman
desc: When Frank decides to marry a prostitute, the gang tries to uncover her heart of gold.

title: The Gang Goes to the Jersey Shore
desc: Dennis and Dee take the gang to their favorite childhood vacation spot, but things aren't quite how they remembered them.

title: Frank Reynolds' Little Beauties
desc: The gang accidentally hosts a child beauty pageant.

title: Sweet Dee Gets Audited
desc: Dee faces an IRS audit over her claim that the baby she carried as a surrogate is her dependent, while the guys decide to run the bar in an unemotional, democratic manner rather than their typical method of shouting and personal attacks.

title: Frank's Brother
desc: When Frank's long lost brother Gino shows up at the bar, the two of them tell the gang about the jazz club they ran in the 1960s and 70s, and how they fell out over Shadynasty, a singer who was the love of both of their lives.

title: The Storm of the Century
desc: As a hurricane threatens Philadelphia, Mac, Dennis and Charlie go to a mall to buy supplies and check out the large breasted TV reporter broadcasting from there, while Frank and Dee prepare Paddy's, and its basement bunker, for the storm.

title: CharDee MacDennis: The Game of Games
desc: On a day of ultimate boredom and listlessness, the gang breaks out a homemade board game, created by Mac, Dee, Charlie, and Dennis.

title: The ANTI-Social Network
desc: The gang's plan to use Facebook to promote Paddy's goes awry when they become obsessed with tracking down a man who shushed them while they were visiting a trendy new club.

title: The Gang Gets Trapped
desc: Inspired by Indiana Jones, Dennis, Dee, and Frank sneak into a house supposed to contain a rare vase, but become trapped when the owners return home early.

title: How Mac Got Fat
desc: During confession, Mac tells a priest how Paddy's sudden spell of success resulted in him becoming fat, and why the rest of the gang is to blame.

title: Thunder Gun Express
desc: A presidential visit to Philadelphia threatens to keep the gang from seeing a new action movie, leaving Dennis stuck in traffic, Frank stealing a boat, and Dee and Charlie prowling the city's sewers.

title: The High School Reunion
desc: The gang attends their high school reunion, at which Dee manages to ingratiate herself with the popular crowd, Charlie and Mac get picked on, and Dennis is ignored by everyone.

title: The High School Reunion Part 2: The Gang's Revenge
desc: Humiliated by the popular crowd at their high school reunion, the gang attempts to gain revenge, with predictably disastrous results.

title: Pop-Pop: The Final Solution
desc: Dennis and Dee's Nazi grandfather is wasting away in a hospital, and it's their choice whether to pull the plug or not. Meanwhile, Charlie and Mac go crazy trying to find a dog painting they think has a lot of value.

title: The Gang Recycles Their Trash
desc: While the city of Philadelphia's garbage men are on strike, Dennis, Mac, and Charlie decide to start a trash pick up business. And while being a big success, they must find out where to put this newly picked up trash.

title: The Maureen Ponderosa Wedding Massacre
desc: The gang are the prime suspects for the McPoyle-Ponderosa wedding massacre.

title: Charlie and Dee Find Love
desc: After invading the world of the wealthy, Charlie and Dee find romance. Not to be left out, Dennis, Frank and Mac try to get in on the action.

title: The Gang Gets Analyzed
desc: When Dee gets asked by her therapist to bring in her so called 'issues,' Dee brings in the whole gang. And since they have all been called in, they have their own one on one therapy sessions, while many issues arise.

title: Charlie's Mom Has Cancer
desc: Charlie's Mom tells him she has cancer. The gang tries to help her out, each in their own way. Meanwhile, Frank thinks his mind may be slipping.

title: Frank's Back in Business
desc: Under threat of a hostile takeover, the board of Frank's old company calls him back to run the company. As before, Frank maximizes the company's product: money. Dennis, Mac and Dee find Phillies VIP tickets and find themselves in a business deal of their own.

title: Charlie Rules the World
desc: The gang starts playing an online video game and Charlie becomes obsessed with becoming the best player in the game. Meanwhile, Dennis is upset everyone else is playing the game all the time and not out enjoying the real world.

title: The Gang Dines Out
desc: The gang turns up at the same restaurant for dinner at three different tables. They pretend not to notice they noticed they are noticing each other. Then the one-upmanship begins.

title: Reynolds vs. Reynolds: The Cereal Defense
desc: When Frank accidentally hits Dennis's car while Dennis is eating cereal, Frank and Dennis go to the Paddy's Pub court to face off on who will pay for the damages.

title: The Gang Broke Dee
desc: Dee embraces the desperate, self-loathing qualities the guys have beaten her into over the years, sending her stand-up comedy to unexpected places.

title: Gun Fever Too: Still Hot
desc: After Frank appears on TV advocating gun ownership, the rest of the gang takes a look at the ownership process and alternatives to find common ground.

title: The Gang Tries Desperately to Win an Award
desc: The gang attempts to win the award for Philidelphia's Best Bar.

title: Mac and Dennis Buy a Timeshare
desc: After making some very questionable investment choices, the gang try to dump their losses on Ben The Soldier while they look for the man who is pulling their strings.

title: Mac Day
desc: Each member of the gang gets one day to do whatever they want while the rest of the gang must participate. This is Mac's day.

title: The Gang Saves the Day
desc: When the gang find themselves in the middle of a robbery at a local convenience store, they all imagine what will happen next.

title: The Gang Gets Quarantined
desc: When a severe flu outbreak sweeps Philadelphia the gang voluntarily quarantine themselves inside of Paddy's.

title: Flowers for Charlie
desc: When an experiment successfully multiplies Charlie's intellect and takes him away from the bar, the rest of the gang find themselves struggling to complete the menial 'Charlie Work' that has kept the bar running for so long.

title: The Gang Makes Lethal Weapon 6
desc: After creative differences over what constitutes tasteful nudity cause Frank to pull his money out of Lethal Weapon 6 during filming, Mac, Dennis, and Charlie screen their rough footage for investors in hopes of raising enough capital to finish the production of their latest masterpiece.

title: The Gang Squashes Their Beefs
desc: When some bad blood with old foes compromises their ideal Thanksgiving, the gang decides to make amends by breaking bread with those they've hurt.

title: The Gang Beats Boggs
desc: The gang try to beat a record set by Wade Boggs of 70 beers on a cross-country flight.

title: The Gang Group Dates
desc: The gang decides to start a group dating service at Paddy's.

title: Psycho Pete Returns
desc: Mac and Charlie are excited for the return of their old high school friend, Pete, while the rest of the gang fears for his psychotic behavior.

title: Charlie Work
desc: Charlie is determined to make sure Paddy's Pub passes its health inspection.

title: The Gang Spies Like U.S.
desc: When Dennis and Mac send Dee to spy on the fish factory across the street, Frank and Charlie become suspicious themselves.

title: The Gang Misses the Boat
desc: The gang decides to spend some time apart in order to find out who they really are.

title: Mac Kills His Dad
desc: After Mac's dad is suspected of murder, Mac sets out to clear his father of any wrong doing.

title: The Gang Goes on Family Fight
desc: When the gang appears on a nationally broadcast game show, Dennis does his best to make a good impression.

title: Frank Retires
desc: When Frank decides to retire, the gang fights over who gets to be in charge of the bar.

title: Ass Kickers United: Mac and Charlie Join a Cult
desc: Mac and Charlie become brainwashed by a cult.

title: Chardee MacDennis 2: Electric Boogaloo
desc: The foursome demonstrate Chardee MacDennis for an interested board game executive.

title: Frank Falls Out the Window
desc: After falling out of the window, Frank thinks that it's 2006; the other three see this as a do-over.

title: The Gang Hits the Slopes
desc: Dennis and Frank square off against Dee and Mac for control of the mountain, while Charlie learns that the slopes have their own set of rules.

title: Dee Made a Smut Film
desc: The Gang debates modern art after seeing Dee in a smut film; Mac and Charlie enlist the help of Frank and Cricket in order to prove that modern art is worthless, whilst Dee and Dennis adapt his erotic memoirs to prove that it isn't.

title: Mac & Dennis Move to the Suburbs
desc: Dennis and Mac head to the suburbs for cheap rent and open spaces but quickly find out that they are meant for city life.

title: Being Frank
desc: A day in the life of Frank Reynolds as he tries to keep up with the gang's newest scheme.

title: McPoyle vs. Ponderosa: The Trial of the Century
desc: Liam McPoyle teams up with the lawyer to sue Bill Ponderosa for his lost eye; old grievances resurface.

title: Charlie Catches a Leprechaun
desc: Dennis tries to create an innovative mobile Paddy's pub experience but runs into trouble when customers refuse to cooperate, while Charlie and Mac attempt to catch a thieving leprechaun.

title: The Gang Goes to Hell
desc: The gang board a Christian cruise liner under upon Mac's request, to soon find out that it does not cater to their sinful ways.

title: The Gang Goes to Hell: Part Two
desc: The gang gets real with one another in the face of death.

title: The Gang Turns Black
desc: After an electric heating blanket shorts out while the gang watches The Wiz, they look in the mirror and realize they've turned black. They have to work out how to get back to being themselves by going through all the classic body switching shenanigans.

title: The Gang Goes to a Water Park
desc: The gang takes a trip to a local waterpark, ripe with personal agendas and ulterior motives. Dennis feeds off his mantra of "the park provides" and takes on a protégé. Frank and Charlie are determined to ride every ride by any means necessary and Mac and Dee get stuck in a tube slide for most of the day.

title: Old Lady House: A Situation Comedy
desc: The gang installs spy cameras in Mrs. Kelly and Mrs. Mac's house, to soon realise that the footage would make for a successful sitcom.

title: Wolf Cola: A Public Relations Nightmare
desc: Franks Fluids LLC is in big trouble after a news segment shows Wolf Cola has become the official drink of Boko Haram.

title: Making Dennis Reynolds a Murderer
desc: An episode filmed in the true crime style of Making a Murderer and The Jinx which begins with 911 call: A cat-woman formerly known as Maureen Ponderosa has been found dead in an alley and Dennis is the prime suspect.

title: Hero or Hate Crime?
desc: The gang go to a professional arbitrator to decide who's the rightful owner of a scratch-off lottery ticket.

title: PTSDee
desc: After finding out she's a male stripper's "rock bottom," Dee goes on a mission to prove she's the best thing that ever happened to him. Dennis takes over for the stripper with the help of his bag boy, Charlie. Meanwhile, Mac and Frank get sucked into a VR war game that causes Mac to develop his own case of PTSD.

title: The Gang Tends Bar
desc: It's Valentine's Day and Paddy's is packed with customers. Dennis implores the gang to do one day of actual work but everyone else is distracted by a mystery crate Cricket spotted in the alley. Eventually, the gang becomes convinced Dennis really wants them to work on their relationships and everyone shares their grievances without much resolution.

title: A Cricket's Tale
desc: A typical day in the life of Cricket, with possible redemption when his family intervenes.

title: Dennis' Double Life
desc: Dennis reveals that he has a baby from his layover time in North Dakota and everyone offers solutions to the problem, but in the end, Dennis must decide which life to continue to lead.

title: The Gang Makes Paddy's Great Again
desc: Meet Cindy, the new, ethnically diverse female member of the gang who can successfully pull off scams. Everything is working until Mac introduces a new member: a life-like sex doll that looks exactly like Dennis.

title: The Gang Escapes
desc: When Mac and Dennis are looking to boost productivity around their apartment, Sweet Dee hires an "escape room experience" service.

title: The Gang Beats Boggs: Ladies Reboot
desc: For a chance to get one over on the guys, Dee joins an all-female flight with Artemis, the Waitress, Charlie's mom, and Mac's mom to beat the Wade Boggs 'drinking whilst on a flight' record.

title: Time's Up for the Gang
desc: Paddy's has been put on a list of bars that are sexually hostile to women, so the gang must attend a sexual-harassment seminar in order to get off the list.

title: The Gang Gets New Wheels
desc: Dee gets in with a group of cool, rich housewives. Dennis hits it off with some everyday blue-collar bros. Frank struggles to renew his license, and Charlie and Mac deal with a new generation of bicycle bullies.

title: The Gang Solves the Bathroom Problem
desc: Jimmy Buffett is in town and the positive vibes are alive at the bar. However, when Mac comes out of the women's bathroom, no one can leave until the bathroom situation is solved.

title: The Gang Does a Clip Show
desc: With nothing to do while their phones update to the latest software, the gang decides to reminisce on old times; as everyone misremembers events from their past, the gang's current reality becomes altered.

title: Charlie's Home Alone
desc: It's the weekend of Super Bowl LII from Charlie's perspective. While Charlie searches the back office, Cricket steals the suit leaving Charlie home alone to defend himself.

title: The Gang Wins the Big Game
desc: It's the most important weekend of their lives and Frank has treated the gang and a crew of their ragtag hangers-on with tickets to see the Eagles in the Super Bowl!

title: Mac Finds His Pride
desc: Frank tries to recruit Mac for the gang's float for the Gay Pride Parade; Frank comes to the realization that Mac will never be secure with his sexual identity unless he comes out to his father.

title: The Gang Gets Romantic
desc: Mac concocts a scheme to attract single women to rent Dennis's bedroom while Frank and Charlie make similar plans to draw in young European coeds, but neither ad attracts their intended target.

title: Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool
desc: The Gang finds themselves in the middle of a focus group after a screening of Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool.

title: Dee Day
desc: The guys are in the final preparation stage for an unknown scheme when Dee excitedly enters to inform them that today is "Dee Day" and the guys must do everything she wants without complaint.

title: The Gang Chokes
desc: Annoyed that the Gang failed to react as he nearly choked to death on an appetizer, Frank decides the Waiter, his savior, is the only person who has his back.

title: The Gang Texts
desc: During their trip to the Philadelphia Zoo, Mac sets up a group text for The Gang that leads to confusion.

title: The Janitor Always Mops Twice
desc: In the black-and-white noir world of his memory, Charlie navigates the seedy underbelly of Philadelphia as Frank has been "diarrhea poisoned," and it's up to Charlie to clean up the mess.

title: The Gang Solves Global Warming
desc: As a record-breaking heat wave overtakes Philly, the Gang plans to profit from global warming by pumping up the A/C so people will congregate at Paddy's and save energy at home.

title: Paddy's Has a Jumper
desc: While a suicidal man threatens to jump off Paddy's pub, the gang wonders whether they should help the poor man or let him fall to his death.

title: A Woman's Right to Chop
desc: When a trendy new hair salon opens up right next door to Paddy's, Dennis and Frank go on the offensive to stop women from cutting off their hair. Meanwhile, Mac is reunited with his childhood dog Poppins.

title: Waiting for Big Mo
desc: Dennis and Charlie stand guard at the entrance to their laser tag base waiting to ambush the legendary "Big Mo," but Dennis begins to ponder the reasons they play laser tag and if their pursuit of a victory is worth their effort.

title: 2020: A Year In Review
desc: The gang looks back on 2020 to justify their numerous PPP loans as they contributed to the chaos of the past political year way more than anyone could have imagined.

title: The Gang Makes Lethal Weapon 7
desc: Upon discovering that their self-made Lethal Weapon sequels have been pulled from the local library, the Gang decides to address their political incorrectness by making another film: Lethal Weapon 7.

title: The Gang Buys a Roller Rink
desc: In the past, an innocent Dennis learns the horrifying details of Frank's business, a truly sweet Dee is excited to head off for Hollywood, while Charlie and Mac's jobs at the roller rink are in jeopardy

title: The Gang Replaces Dee With a Monkey
desc: When the Gang suspects Dee is menopausal, they scramble to find a new employee for Paddy's Pub; Dee decides to put her acting career on hold in order to mentor young actors.

title: The Gang's Still in Ireland
desc: Dennis and Dee explore their new accommodations in the countryside; Frank accompanies Charlie to find the truth about Charlie's Irish childhood pen pal; Mac has an identity crisis and decides to join the seminary.

title: The Gang Goes to Ireland
desc: The gang's in Dublin where Dennis ends up helping Frank with some of his business's dirty work; Mac and Charlie learn about their Irish heritage; Dee rushes to the set of an Irish soap opera, where she will play an "Obnoxious American MILF."

title: Dee Sinks in a Bog
desc: Mac spends a day at the seminary to truly understand what it takes to become a priest; Dennis and Frank plan an elaborate trap to humiliate Charlie's pen pal; Dee prepares for a date with an Irish doctor; Charlie bonds with his pen pal.

title: The Gang Carries a Corpse Up a Mountain
desc: The Gang attempts to ascend a mountain in order for Charlie to fulfill an old and mysterious Irish burial tradition; one by one, the Gang backs out until Charlie is left to honor the dead body alone.

title: A Touch of Class
desc: Basil is delighted when a member of the aristocracy chooses to stay at the Fawlty Towers, snubbing the normal guests who frequent the hotel. What Basil does not know, however, is that the man is not a Lord but a confidence trickster who attempts to steal his collection of rare coins. As Basil's desperation to keep such an 'upstanding' guest increases, he becomes increasingly tolerant towards the man's behavior, only to have the guest arrested in a police raid on the hotel.

title: The Builders
desc: Over his wife's objections, Basil hires his usual firm of incompetents (O'Reilly's) to do some carpentry work in the hotel lobby. With both Basil and Sybil out for the afternoon, they leave Polly in charge. She decides to have a nap, leaving the English-challenged Manuel in charge. When Basil returns, he finds a solid wall where once stood doors to the dining room and still no door to the kitchen per his work order. Sybil takes an I-told-you-so attitude and insists he hire a qualified builder to fix the mess, but Basil decides to get O'Reilly back to right the wrong, ...

title: The Wedding Party
desc: Basil Fawlty's puritanical streak comes out when a young couple he suspects of not being married tries to book a double room. He's ready to give them rooms on separate floors until Sybil steps in. It turns out that the couple know Polly but when he sees her coming out of their room - she was trying on a dress her friend had brought her for the wedding they would be attending - Basil begins to think everyone has gone mad. All that's left is for another guest, Mrs. Peignoir, to get tipsy and make a pass at him. For Manuel, it's his birthday and a night of celebrating ...

title: The Hotel Inspectors
desc: Basil Fawlty goes on the alert when he hears there are hotel inspectors in the area.

title: Gourmet Night
desc: The Fawltys are very pleased with their new chef, Kurt. He was recommended to them by their friend André who runs a nice restaurant in town. All in all, he's working out quite well and they decide to have a gourmet evening on Thursdays to try and promote, in Basil's eye at any rate, a better class of clientèle. Kurt gets along well with everyone and seems to have a particular interest in Manuel. When the big day finally arrives, they find themselves with only four guests booked for the dining room - which Sybil puts down to Basil's advert in the local paper saying 'no...

title: The Germans
desc: A moose head to be hung, a fire drill to be conducted, and German guests are all a bit much for Basil to handle while Sybil's in hospital.

title: Communication Problems
desc: When Mrs. Richards, a demanding woman who is hard of hearing, checks into the hotel, Basil, Sybil and Polly find themselves with a very difficult customer. Meanwhile, Basil bets on a horse that is sure to win, however he must not let Sybil find out.

title: The Psychiatrist
desc: Confusion arises when Basil tries to catch a girl in a playboy's room after hours, all the while unnerved by a psychiatrist's presence.

title: Waldorf Salad
desc: Customer dissatisfaction with the Fawlty Towers dining experience comes to a head when an insistent American comes for a stay.

title: The Kipper and the Corpse
desc: One of the guests has died in his sleep, but Basil thinks it's due to serving him spoiled food.

title: The Anniversary
desc: Basil plans a surprise anniversary party for Sybil but, thinking he's forgotten it again, she walks out just before the guests arrive.

title: Basil the Rat
desc: Basil and the rest of the staff are in deep trouble when the health inspector turns up and delivers an enormous list of problems with the hotel. Things become even worse when Manuel's rat gets loose in the hotel.

title: Celebration
desc: Media magnate Logan Roy shocks his family with a stunning announcement on his 80th birthday. The news shatters his son Kendall, the heir apparent who's in the midst of negotiating the purchase of digital-media venture.

title: Shit Show at the Fuck Factory
desc: While Logan is in the hospital, tensions rise when backup plans should be made by the family.

title: Lifeboats
desc: As their first act as CEO and COO, Ken and Roman try to dig the company out of a financial mess. Meanwhile, Marcia prevents the family from seeing the recovering Roy.

title: Sad Sack Wasp Trap
desc: The family attends an annual company gala overseen by Connor and highlighted by a surprise announcement.

title: I Went to Market
desc: Kendall begins to plot a vote of no confidence against Logan; Tom questions his prenup.

title: Which Side Are You On?
desc: Roman and Kendall attempt to sway the board, while Shiv explores her options in D.C.

title: Austerlitz
desc: The Roys gather for a family therapy session; Kendall finds his sobriety tested.

title: Prague
desc: Tom has a bachelor's party to remember; Kendall and Roman eye new business opportunities.

title: Pre-Nuptial
desc: The Roys assemble at an English castle for Shiv and Tom's wedding; Kendall's plans are fast-tracked.

title: Nobody Is Ever Missing
desc: Roman faces technical difficulties. Tom marks his territory. Kendall hits rock bottom with tragic consequences.

title: The Summer Palace
desc: Still addled from the events in England, Kendall tries to make amends with his dad; Logan receives some unvarnished advice from his financial banker; Tom maneuvers for a new position in the company.

title: Vaulter
desc: Roman and Kendall do a "routine health check" of a new media brand to help Vaulter determine the future of the company; Tom tasks Greg with sniffing out waste at ATN; Connor and Willa host a soiree to mark their return to New York.

title: Hunting
desc: Logan informs his skeptical management team of his plan to make another attempt to acquire Pierce; Greg worries his pre-meeting will puts his standing with the family at risk; Connor's presidential announcement irritates Logan.

title: Safe Room
desc: Roman begins a six-week management training program in the Parks division; Logan and Kendall arrange a covert meeting with a PGM CEO as a controversy surrounding a star anchor leads to a day of chaos at ATN headquarters.

title: Tern Haven
desc: Shiv, Roman and Connor veer from their roles at a weekend retreat to woo the Pierces.

title: Argestes
desc: Logan's deal with the Pierces is threatened; Kendall, Shiv and Roman differ on damage control strategies.

title: Return
desc: A trip to the UK finds the Roy kids negotiating with their mother; Logan turns to Rhea for advice.

title: Dundee
desc: The entire Roy clan travels to Logan's hometown of Dundee, Scotland, for a celebration of Logan's 50 years in the business; Kendall becomes enamored with Jennifer, an actress in Willa's play; a former employee proves difficult to silence.

title: DC
desc: Logan, Kendall, Gerri and Tom testify before Congress; Shiv speaks candidly to Kira, a victim who is set to be a key witness; in Turkey, Roman's business pitch takes a chilling turn.

title: This Is Not for Tears
desc: Logan looks for a sacrificial lamb among his closest allies as the future of the company hangs in the balance.

title: Secession
desc: Following his bombshell presser, a righteous Kendall scrambles to find a base of operations, while Logan's team searches for safe harbor.

title: Mass in Time of War
desc: Kendall tries to get his siblings, as well as Stewy and Sandi on his side. Fearing his legal situation, Greg asks Ewan for help.

title: The Disruption
desc: With the DOJ at the door, Logan summons his arsenal, while Tom makes a potentially life changing offer. Kendall becomes obsessed with his own takedown.

title: Lion in the Meadow
desc: Logan and Kendall have their first meeting together with Josh, a major investor worried about their family feud.

title: Retired Janitors of Idaho
desc: Kendall and the Waystar team find themselves working together at the annual shareholders' meeting, where Logan's health takes a turn.

title: What It Takes
desc: Logan and team head to Virginia for a conservative political conference, where Roman finds out surprising news about his mother.

title: Too Much Birthday
desc: At Kendall's lavish birthday bash, Shiv and Roman try to arrange a meeting with Lukas Matsson, a tech mogul who recently snubbed Logan.

title: Chiantishire
desc: After a tense board meeting to discuss acquisition of Matsson's GoJo, Roman shares his suspicions about their mother's new beau with Shiv. As a luxe family wedding gets underway in Italy, Gerri draws a line in the sand with Roman, the Waystar team grows increasingly concerned about Matsson's rogue tweets, and Shiv and Caroline have a heart-to-heart, of sorts.

title: All the Bells Say
desc: Matsson's vision for the business leads Shiv and Roman to manage the fallout, while Logan weighs his options.

title: Inventory
desc: Vaibhav migrates to Kota to prepare for India's toughest college entrance examination. Does this late entrant stand a chance in the race?

title: Assembly Line
desc: Vaibhav is part of the pack but 'studying' isn't the only hurdle he faces. When Meena, Uday and Shivangi fail to help him, Jeetu volunteers. Will Jeetu be able to save Vaibhav from the horrors of mess-food, insomnia and constipation?

title: Optimization
desc: There may be several paths to manufacture a product. But are the processes followed utilizing the resources optimally? Is the path followed that of least resistance?

title: Shut Down
desc: What is a better strategy to attain a goal - An uninterrupted stride without any intermissions or one that consists of rejuvenating breaks? Vaibhav and Meena find their modes of recharging.

title: Overhaul
desc: How far can one go to ensure success? Vaibhav left his home once for the cause, will he be able to do the same again?

title: Reasoning
desc: With their new classes off to a bleak start, Vaibhav and his peers question the value of the IIT dream and seek inspiration from a trusted source.

title: Control System
desc: Struggling with Physics, Vaibhav attempts to bend the rules to attend Jeetu's classes. Meena frets that teenage hormones will get the best of him.

title: Atmospheric Pressure
desc: Jeetu searches for staff for his institute, making some reluctant choices along the way. Filled with self-doubt, Vartika evades practice tests at Aimers.

title: Repair & Maintenance
desc: When a bout of jaundice slows Vaibhav down in his studying, Jeetu insists he calls his only hope to get well quickly: his mother.

title: Packaging
desc: JEE results send Kota into celebration mode and give Vaibhav, Meena and Uday glimpses into their own futures, but the occasion comes with sad truths.

title: Chapter 1: The Old Grist Mill
desc: Lost in the mysterious woods of the Unknown, two brothers named Wirt and Gregory run into a jaded old woodsman.

title: Chapter 2: Hard Times at the Huskin' Bee
desc: A bluebird named Beatrice offers to guide Wirt and Greg to Adelaide of the Pasture (the good woman of the woods) and help them get home.

title: Chapter 3: Schooltown Follies
desc: Wirt, Greg, and Beatrice get all mixed up in the musical antics of a schoolhouse of animals.

title: Chapter 4: Songs of the Dark Lantern
desc: Beatrice is left out in the rain with a brainless horse while Wirt and Greg must ask for directions in a lively colonial tavern called "The Dark Lantern."

title: Chapter 5: Mad Love
desc: Is millionaire Quincy Endicott's sprawling mansion haunted by a beautiful ghost, or is the tea baron going mad?

title: Chapter 6: Lullaby in Frogland
desc: Wirt and Greg go on a lighthearted romp aboard the Frogland Ferry as they approach Adelaide of the Pasture.

title: Chapter 7: The Ringing of the Bell
desc: Wirt meets Lorna, a young woman forced to do housework by an odious witch with a magic bell.

title: Chapter 8: Babes in the Woods
desc: While Wirt and Greg lay down to rest, they're drawn into a dreamworld of cherubs, flowers, and clouds.

title: Chapter 9: Into the Unknown
desc: The origin of Wirt and Greg's descent into the Unknown reveals itself.

title: Chapter 10: The Unknown
desc: The Beast has come. The final chapter begins.

title: Episode #1.1
desc: The small northwest town of Twin Peaks, Washington is shaken up when the body of the Homecoming Queen, Laura Palmer, is discovered washed up on a riverbank, wrapped in plastic.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: Agent Cooper enjoys the comforts of the Great Northern Hotel. Bobby Briggs and Mike Nelson are released from jail. Doctor Hayward hands over the autopsy report on Laura Palmer.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: Ben Horne's brother, Jerry, arrives in Twin Peaks; together they travel to One Eyed Jack's and meet with the madam, Blackie O'Reilly. Audrey leaves a clue for Cooper. Deputy Hawk finds a bloody towel near the crime scene.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: Cooper meets with Audrey, who confesses to leaving him the note about One Eyed Jack's. Cooper tells Truman he can't remember who the killer was in his dream, but insists the dream is a code to solving the crime.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: Cooper questions Dr. Jacoby, who suspects Leo Johnson is the killer. Gordon Cole, Cooper's supervisor, calls in with Albert's report. Josie Packard spies on Ben Horne and Catherine Martell. Hawk tracks down the One-Armed Man.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: Cooper and company have tea with the Log Lady, who tells them there was a third man following after Leo and Jacques the night Laura died. At Jacques Renault's cabin Cooper, Hawk, and Truman find Waldo the bird.

title: Episode #1.7
desc: Audrey cons her way into working at the perfume counter where Laura worked and discovers that it's being used as a recruitment post for One Eyed Jack's. James, Donna and Maddy plan to lure Jacoby away from his office.

title: Episode #1.8
desc: Audrey is hired at One Eyed Jack's, but is caught in a trap when her father arrives. Cooper gets Jacques Renault to reveal the details of Laura's last night in the cabin. Deputy Andy saves Truman's life and apprehends Renault.

title: Episode #2.1
desc: A wounded Agent Cooper has a vision of a giant who gives him several clues about the murder of Laura Palmer. Shelly and Pete recover from the mill fire, but Josie and Catherine are missing.

title: Episode #2.2
desc: Albert determines that neither Leo nor Jacques killed Laura, but he is unable to find any leads into who shot Cooper. Cooper says they must find the third man, who he believes to be Bob, the gray-haired man.

title: Episode #2.3
desc: Ronette is attacked in her hospital bed by an unseen person. Jean Renault, brother of Jacques and Bernard, plans to blackmail Ben Horne for the release of Audrey. Donna meets with Harold Smith, a shut-in who had befriended Laura.

title: Episode #2.4
desc: Leland confesses to killing Jacques Renault. Andy wants to take a new sperm count test. Rumor spreads that a food critic is coming to Twin Peaks. Jean asks Ben to set a trap for Cooper in exchange for Audrey's life.

title: Episode #2.5
desc: Cooper remembers the message under his bed. Shelly and Bobby begin Leo's home care. Sternwood hears pretrial motions and declares Leo not fit for trial. Nadine comes home, still thinking she's in high school.

title: Episode #2.6
desc: James saves the girls from a tormented Harold. Cooper brings Audrey home. Bobby and Shelly learn that their insurance plans have backfired. Donna tries to convince Truman that Harold Smith has Laura's secret diary.

title: Episode #2.7
desc: Cooper and the One-Armed Man inspect guests at the Great Northern. Hawk finds Harold Smith dead - with a mysterious suicide note and the diary torn to shreds. Leo speaks to Bobby about "new shoes."

title: Episode #2.8
desc: Donna and James wonder why Maddy left so suddenly. Norma's mother arrives with the news that she's married a new man, Ernie Niles. Cooper tells Leland they arrested Ben Horne for Laura's murder.

title: Episode #2.9
desc: Albert returns to examine Maddy. Cooper asks for twenty-four hours to finish his case. James and Donna reaffirm their love. Andy accidentally leads Donna and Cooper back to Mrs. Tremond's house.

title: Episode #2.10
desc: Leland is laid to rest and Sarah Palmer tries to accept all that has happened to her family. Dr. Jacoby returns from Hawaii. Cooper prepares to leave Twin Peaks. Mayor Milford objects to his brother's engagement to a younger woman.

title: Episode #2.11
desc: Mrs. Briggs talks about her husband's disappearance into the woods. Nadine is put on the wrestling team, where she falls for Mike Nelson. James is hired by the mysterious, wealthy Evelyn Marsh. Dick takes on an orphan, Little Nicky.

title: Episode #2.12
desc: Ben takes Bobby under his wing in a hope to destroy Hank and Jean. However, Ben's mental state is starting to crack. Cooper starts to look at buying real estate. Major Briggs's supervisor reveals that Briggs was studying the woods.

title: Episode #2.13
desc: Major Briggs has no memory of the place he was taken, but now has an odd tattoo on his neck. Andy and Dick break into Little Nicky's files. Mike and Nadine begin an affair. Evelyn asks James to kill her husband.

title: Episode #2.14
desc: Windom Earle has taken his first victim in the deadly chess game. Audrey tells Bobby they have to save Ben from his civil war fantasy. Leo awakes and attacks Shelly, but Bobby is able to fend him off.

title: Episode #2.15
desc: The police look for James in the Marsh murder. Bobby and Shelly tell Truman that Leo escaped; and Bobby reveals that he saw Hank shoot Leo the night the mill burned. Albert returns to Twin Peaks with information on Windom Earle.

title: Episode #2.16
desc: Truman puts Hank in prison for the attempted murder of Leo, while Hank points the finger at Josie for the murder of Andrew Packard. Albert reveals that Josie shot Cooper. Ben enlists the help of John Justice Wheeler.

title: Episode #2.17
desc: Harry sinks into a deep depression after Josie's death. Josie's body holds more questions than answers. Norma's troubled sister, Annie, arrives in Twin Peaks. Wheeler and Audrey hit it off. Cooper's stalemate angers Earle.

title: Episode #2.18
desc: Harry is attacked by Jones in his sleep. Audrey and Wheeler begin a relationship. Gordon Cole returns with a report that Windom Earle worked with Major Briggs on Project Bluebook. Cole reinstates Cooper in the FBI.

title: Episode #2.19
desc: Cooper and company find the mysterious petroglyph. Windom Earle befriends a rock 'n' roll youth, and tells him tales of places called the White and Black Lodge. Pete helps Catherine open the first puzzle box.

title: Episode #2.20
desc: Bobby and Shelly reaffirm their love. Cooper calls Shelly, Donna and Audrey together to warn them about Earle. Briggs shows Cooper a tape of Windom Earle making a report on his quest for the Black Lodge.

title: Episode #2.21
desc: Windom Earle sets his sights on the Miss Twin Peaks contest. Lucy chooses a father for her baby. Leo is punished when he frees Major Briggs. Cooper unlocks the key to entering the Black Lodge. Annie and Dale make a commitment.

title: Episode #2.22
desc: Agent Cooper follows Windom Earle and Annie into the depths of the Black Lodge. Big Ed and Norma get a shock when Nadine suffers head trauma. Andrew and Pete unlock Eckhardt's final box and Audrey stages an act of civil disobedience.

title: The National Anthem
desc: Prime Minister Michael Callow faces a shocking dilemma when Princess Susannah, a much-loved member of the Royal Family, is kidnapped.

title: Fifteen Million Merits
desc: In a world where people's lives consist of riding exercise bikes to gain credits, Bing tries to help a woman get on to a singing competition show.

title: The Entire History of You
desc: In the near future, everyone has access to a memory implant that records everything they do, see and hear. You need never forget a face again - but is that always a good thing?

title: Be Right Back
desc: After learning about a new service that lets people stay in touch with the deceased, a lonely, grieving Martha reconnects with her late lover.

title: White Bear
desc: Victoria wakes up and cannot remember anything about her life. Everyone she encounters refuses to communicate with her, and they all seem to know something she doesn't. But what?

title: The Waldo Moment
desc: A failed comedian who voices a popular cartoon bear named Waldo finds himself mixing in politics when TV executives want Waldo to run for office.

title: White Christmas
