desc: Light (known to the world as Kira) tests the Death Note to understand the scope of its powers by killing off six convicts in various ways and confirms he can control his victims' actions before they die.

title: Tactics
desc: Soichiro Yagami demands to meet with L in person when he finds out that L has secretly brought FBI agents into Japan. Light, meanwhile, has found a way to get those very FBI agents off the case - permanently.

title: Unraveling
desc: Light meets a woman at the Police Department with an urgent message for the Kira task force.

title: Overcast
desc: Light uses the Death Note to try to get rid of the woman who could get him captured and is shocked when it doesn't work.

title: Glare
desc: Light, entirely aware of L's surveillance equipment in his home, begins a very careful game to throw off suspicion.

title: Encounter
desc: L's suspicions are momentarily subdued, but he does not discard the possibility that Light may be Kira and decides to meet him in person. At the college entrance exams, Light notices a mysterious and eccentric student staring at him.

title: Doubt
desc: In a bid to profile Light's behavior, L challenges him to a game of tennis. L asks him some questions regarding the Kira case and invites him to help the investigation. The two then receive news that Light's father has had a heart attack.

title: Assault
desc: As the Kira investigation team discusses the disappearance of Naomi Misora, Sakura TV broadcasts an audio tape allegedly from Kira. To prevent Kira from gaining public support, L demands that the broadcast be stopped.

title: Love
desc: Light meets with L and the detectives. Meaning to test Light's analytical skills, L has him listen to the recordings confiscated by the team to determine if there are any clues in the reader's voice.

title: Confession
desc: Light goes to Aoyama to discover the identity of the second Kira before L becomes more suspicious, but Misa Amane, the new Kira, uses her unusual gift to find Light before he finds her.

title: Friend
desc: Light and Misa show each other their Death Notes, and Light asks Misa to have her shinigami Rem get rid of L, which Misa will do in order to have Light fall in love with her.

title: Wager
desc: Convinced the two Kiras have met and worried at the prospect of his own murder, L declares that the event of his death will prove Light is Kira.

title: Decision
desc: In a plan to remove all suspicions from himself, Light tells L that he thinks he may be Kira subconsciously and asks to be confined. Light's father believes it is also a good idea to be confined to a cell as well as he cannot risk his emotions getting the better of him. In confinement, Light gives Ryuk the order to have his memory wiped, leaving L confused now that hi... Read all

title: Execution
desc: Getting nowhere fast, L thinks of a new plan to get Light, Misa and Mr. Yagami out of confinement.

title: Ally
desc: L's depression causes a scuffle to break out in the new headquarters, and a recent string of CEO deaths has L and Light thinking that Kira may be killing for monetary profit.

title: Matsuda
desc: Matsuda, the task force member eager to distinguish himself, decides, while assigned to watch Misa, to do a little snooping on his own at the Yotsuba Group's Tokyo headquarters.

title: Makeshift
desc: After Light establishes a mole within the Yotsuba Group, L separates himself from the rest of the task force and recruits Misa.

title: Performance
desc: The third Kira sets his eyes on Misa after meeting her. While Misa takes a break from meeting the Yotsuba Group, Rem contacts her. Misa is able to see the shinigami, but her memories of being the second Kira do not return.

title: Guidance
desc: After learning that Higuchi is Kira, L decides that they mustn't apprehend him till they understand his killing method.

title: Frenzy
desc: L and Light, watching from the investigation team building, wonder whom Higuchi (seemingly alone) is talking to. L wonders if it's a shinigami. With Rem beside him, Higuchi - frantic to kill Matsuda - takes "the deal" to become unstoppable.

title: Revival
desc: The team arrests Higuchi for being Kira and causing multiple murders. Inspecting Higuchi's Death Note, team members who touch it abruptly discover that shinigami do exist, and when Light takes the Death Note from L, his memory returns.

title: Silence
desc: Light, his memory recovered, orders Misa to begin killing after Higuchi dies. The Shinigami Rem realizes that everything is going according to Light's plan, and that L will arrest Misa as Kira unless Rem acts quickly.

title: Renewal
desc: After L's death, the world needs a new great detective, and it's generally agreed that Light take his place.

title: Abduction
desc: New investigator Near steps forward, a central figure in the SPK, an American organization trying to catch Kira without relying on L (whom they know is a fake). Near, aware of the existence of Death Notes, wants to get his hands on one, but a challenge to his efforts comes from his orphanage rival, Mello, who throws a curve into Near's efforts by having his underworld... Read all

title: Impatience
desc: In trying to retrieve his kidnapped sister, Light learns of two opposing factions trying to take him down, the SPK lead by N and a crime syndicate lead by Mello.

title: Father
desc: Mello learns some valuable information concerning false entries in his Death Note from its true owner. Soichiro agrees to take on the shinigami eyes to thwart him.

title: Justice
desc: Mello busts into SPK headquarters to retrieve a photograph of himself to make sure he won't be killed by Kira. In exchange for Near giving him the picture, Mello drops an important hint about the Death Notes: some of the rules are fake.

title: Transfer
desc: Near escapes the mob attack, and Light once again proves his ability to stay a step ahead by creating a fourth Kira.

title: Selection
desc: Star newscaster Kiyomi Takada becomes Kira's spokesperson to the world (after Mikami "deletes" Demegawa). She just so happens to have been Light's girlfriend in college. Aizawa's suspicions about Light grow.

title: Scorn
desc: Near goes to Japan, allegedly as bait for Kira. Following Light's instructions, Takada asks Mikami to send her five pages of the Death Note. She tells him that he will continue his work in a fake book made to look like the real one.

title: Vigilance
desc: Aizawa figures out what's going on and tells Near, who already knows about the notes. Near instructs Aizawa to continue watching Light, and then puts in motion a plan to separate Misa from Light.

title: Malice
desc: Mello kidnaps Takada in a daring operation, getting in the way of both Near and Light's plans to set up a meeting between the SPK and the investigation team.

Near, along with the SPK, meets Light and the task force at a warehouse for the final showdown. To everyone's shock, Near reveals that Kira's follower, Mikami, is at the warehouse and is writing everyone's name in the Death Note.

title: New World
desc: Though Mikami has written all the investigators' names in the Death Note, a minute passes and everyone is still alive. Near seizes Mikami's Death Note, and all is at last revealed.

title: Tractoring
desc: Jeremy Clarkson embarks on his path towards muddy misery and potential ruin by running his own farm.

title: Sheeping
desc: Jeremy decides to get a flock of sheep, not realising the added complications these high-maintenance animals will bring.

title: Shopping
desc: Jeremy Clarkson decides to open a farm shop to sell his own produce. This sounds like it should be easy. It isn’t.

title: Wilding
desc: Jeremy Clarkson decides to become a naturalist.

title: Pan (dem) icking
desc: As Covid-19 puts Britain on lockdown, Jeremy suddenly finds that his biggest worries aren’t all related to the upcoming lambing season.

title: Melting
desc: Jeremy discovers why British farmers are always complaining about the weather. It’s mostly because it never does what they want it to do.

title: Fluffing
desc: As the drought drags on and harvest time gets closer, Jeremy and his motley crew have a fearsome list of jobs to complete.

title: Harvesting
desc: After months of hard work Clarkson's farm arrives at a make or break moment; harvest time.

title: Episode #1.1
desc: Agâh Beyoglu is upset by his initial diagnosis of Alzheimer. Agâh recognizes that forgotten is an opportunity to commit a murder that he has planned for years but is constantly delaying.

title: Episode #1.2
desc: The murder that Agâh had committed is the first ring of a chain of murders. Nevra finds a message on a victim that makes her reconsider resigning from her job.

title: Episode #1.3
desc: An important common point between Nevra's with Agâh, who has been lost in an inquiry filled with dead ends, will emerge.

title: Episode #1.4
desc: It affects not all Agah but all the people around him. A very big surprise awaits Nevra, who spent her birthday with Ates.

title: Episode #1.5
desc: The clues of the murders made by Agah lead Nevra and Murder office to Kambura. But what they will learn there will increase the question marks in their heads.

title: Episode #1.6
desc: Agah adds new murders to the murders he has committed. The dark face of the Agah's old friend Cemil begins to emerge. Nevra wants to solve the killings on her own way.

title: Episode #1.7
desc: Agâh is setting up new games for his secrets to not appear, but there is something he does not even know about; changing personality will cause surprise murders.

title: Episode #1.8
desc: As the mysterious "Dog Killer" becomes a phenomenon, he goes to a change in his Agah plans and decides to take the big step first.

title: Episode #1.9
desc: Nevra believes that she now finds the cause of the murders. So she continues to investigate Kambura with all her might to stop the killings.

title: Episode #1.10
desc: Assuming that she found a victim of crime committed in Kambura many years ago, Nevra realizes that she was actually wrong, but she does not leave the trail of this crime and continues to climb over the clues in Kambura.

title: Episode #1.11
desc: The war which they gave with the memories of Nevra and Agâh are forcing them. While Agâh can not recall the details of the murders he has committed, Nevra has to rely on her past memories.

title: Episode #1.12
desc: It is impossible to escape from confronting facts when everyone is approaching the end in his story. Surprise collaborations will cause great changes in the life of Agâh and Nevra.

title: To the Ends of the Earth
desc: David Attenborough travels from the Arctic to the Antarctic to discover magical new ice worlds inhabited by the most extraordinary animal survivors on Earth.

title: Spring
desc: Each spring, massive sweet water thawing rapidly transforms the polar regions and the surrounding seas, where broken-off ice floats to. This is crucial in the life cycle of many species, sometimes extremely elaborate. Many colonies (re)unite to mate, hatch and/or start raising offspring, especially in 'temperate' parts, such as South Georgia island.

title: Summer
desc: In Summer, the non-stop sunlight fires an unrelenting thaw, transforming much of the polar regions into fertile land and open sea, while immense masses of melted sweet water pour into the oceans. Many species profit from the relatively benign conditions to mate, breed and raise their young. However for some, such as ice-bears, the lack of ice also causes major trouble... Read all

title: Autumn
desc: After non-stop summer months, the polar regions have expanded maximally, abundant food turns even the bears sociable. However the shortening of days soon starts reversing the process as frost expands the ice again. So many seasonal migrations turn too, mainly leaving for warmer regions. A stunning exception are the 'giant' emperor penguins, who arrive to mate, lay and... Read all

title: Winter
desc: The polar struggle to survive is even harder in winter, missing a single rare prey can be lethal. Well-adapted anatomy is crucial, but also tricks such as isolation with snow or preys' fur. The Antarctic is nearly deserted, except for seals and emperor penguins, even the slightly milder Artic is left by most species, failing to do so is a gamble which can exterminate ... Read all

title: The Last Frontier
desc: The polar regions are earth's least hospitable environment, yet people live in the Arctic regions. Modern urbanized life is possibly even there thanks to technology, but some (often tribal) communities still practice traditional methods, dependent on specific fauna, such as reindeer herding, dog sleds, hunting seals and collecting bird eggs. Some of those are even use... Read all

title: On Thin Ice
desc: David Attenborough journeys to both polar regions to investigate what rising temperatures will mean for the people and wildlife that live there.

title: The Epic Journey
desc: Features the best highlights of the series spanning the entire polar year - from the depths of winter to the melting world of the polar summer.

title: The Making of 'Frozen Planet'
desc: A behind-the-scenes special which follows the Frozen Planet film crews braving the elements.

title: Science at the End of the Earth
desc: During the filming of Frozen Planet, the team got unprecedented access to film the story of the South Pole Station - the most extreme and remote scientific research base on earth. This film traces the history of the base, which began unwittingly with early explorers like Scott and Amundsen and their quest to be the first humans to reach the South Pole, dragging tools ... Read all

title: The Train Job
desc: Mal has second thoughts after discovering that two boxes of Alliance goods his crew has been hired to steal are full of badly needed medical supplies headed for the mining town of Paradiso.

title: Bushwhacked
desc: Serenity is pulled in by an Alliance cruiser while investigating a spaceship that was attacked by Reavers. Simon and River must hide to prevent capture, while something is wrong with the lone survivor of the attacked spaceship.

title: Our Mrs. Reynolds
desc: A woman claiming to be Mal's wife appears aboard Serenity.

title: Jaynestown
desc: Mal and the crew of Serenity land to pick up some contraband In Canton, a township on Higgins' Moon, where labor is provided under servitude run by the local magistrate. Jayne had once robbed the boss with a partner but barely escaped by jettisoning from their getaway vehicle his partner (now waiting for revenge) and the money boxes (who have made him a legendary hero... Read all

title: Out of Gas
desc: When Serenity's life support system fails, Mal orders the crew off the ship - but he stays behind.

title: Shindig
desc: In order to secure a job transporting cargo off-planet for a client, Mal attends a social event where a dance with Inara leads to him being challenged to a swordfight in defense of her honor.

title: Safe
desc: Mal must choose which crew members to save when one is gravely wounded and two others are kidnapped. Simon finds an uneasy haven in a remote village, but River's uncanny perceptions jeopardize the Tams' temporary safety.

title: Ariel
desc: Serenity travels to the core world Ariel and Simon comes up with a plan to steal drugs from the hospital.

title: War Stories
desc: Niska catches up with the Serenity crew.

title: Objects in Space
desc: Serenity encounters a ruthlessly professional bounty hunter, Jubal Early, who will stop at nothing to retrieve River. But River, feeling unwelcome on the ship, takes a novel approach to escaping from the Alliance.

title: Serenity
desc: Malcolm Reynolds is a veteran and the captain of Serenity. He and his crew are smuggling goods, but they need to pick up some passengers for extra money. However, not all the passengers are what they seem.

title: Heart of Gold
desc: A Companion-trained friend of Inara's who runs a brothel on a remote planet calls for help from Serenity when a local reveals his intentions to take the baby from a woman he impregnated.

title: Trash
desc: Saffron returns to offer the crew a mission but not everyone is willing to trust her again.

title: The Message
desc: A dying request from an old army buddy turns treacherous for Mal, Zoë, and the rest of the crew.

title: Oceans: Into the Blue
desc: Nearly all human populations in coastal areas interact intensively with the sea. The food harvest is enormous, varied and obtained in various, sometimes ingenious ways, including cooperation with wild dolphins. Dangers and scarcity worsen for environmental reasons, climate change bodes even worse. Aquatic sports are also culturally important, sometimes even defining.

title: Deserts: Life in the Furnace
desc: Deserts cover a third of the earth's land mass, yet harbor only some 300,000 inhabitants, many of which are (semi-)nomadic hunters/herdsmen, making navigation and adapted animals, such as camels, vital. The only 7,000 years old Sahara, the planet's vastest sand-pan, counts many tribes. The stony Gobi enjoys melting snow, wind-transported in all the way from Siberia, b... Read all

title: Arctic: Life in the Deep Freeze
desc: In the vast icy wastes of the Arctic very little grows. It's dark for months in the winter and the freezing temperatures make it particularly inhospitable. Yet four million people live there thanks to ingenious survival techniques passed down through generations. In Greenland, where food is hard to come by and dogs are a crucial means of transport, Amos and his son Ka... Read all

title: Jungles: People of the Trees
desc: Although a mall part of earth's landmass, tropical rain forests contain half the animal species, mainly on altitudes out of human reach, losing 100 a day, often undiscovered, trough rapid wood-cut, clearing for agriculture etcetera. The rare surviving native tribal jungle cultures go to great lengths to remain in ecological harmony with wildlife and cope with dangers ... Read all

title: Mountains: Life in Thin Air
desc: Life in the mountains demands elaborate adaptations, for despite the extreme biological diversity people often have little choice of meat supply, despite elaborate hunting methods such as nets in clearings to lure giant bats. In developed regions, modern technology helps control avalanches. Relative isolation comes at a price, as for health care, and leads to bizarre ... Read all

title: Grasslands: The Roots of Power
desc: Grass lands cover vast plains, such as savanna, prairies and pampas. The many, almost indestructible grass species, for various types of soil and other conditions, feed huge herds, whose migrations are followed by many predators and (semi-)nomadic peoples, such as the Mongol master horsemen. Some still practice hunting-gathering, such as the Khoisan, or traditional 'n... Read all

title: Rivers: Friend and Foe
desc: Man always was attracted by rivers, not unlike seas, for water, fishing, irrigation, transport. And he deals in many ways with their dangers, ranging from torrents, frost and perilous crossing to floods. Most lack moder technology, hence are reduced to minimal control, rather adapting to the tide then controlling it.

title: Cities: Surviving the Urban Jungle
desc: Urban environments are man-made, so human design seems totally to overtake wildlife habitats. Yet animals abound in cities and suburbs, many as pets or working, but others exempt by religion or even able to pursue their natural life with some fancy adapting, as many animals do in the wild.

title: The Cat and the Claw Part I
desc: Catwoman and Batman join forces in an attempt to foil the evil forces of a terrorist by the name of Red Claw.

title: On Leather Wings
desc: Batman finds himself tangling with a Jekyll-and-Hyde bat creature after it attacks a night watchman and the police wage a war on the Dark Knight.

title: Heart of Ice
desc: Batman must stop a vengeful Mr. Freeze from fulfilling his vendetta against a callous businessman.

title: Feat of Clay Part I
desc: A disfigured actor is forced to frame Bruce Wayne.

title: Feat of Clay Part II
desc: Forcibly overdosed on a shapechanging substance, Matt Hagan has become the shapeshifting monster, Clayface, and now wants revenge on Roland Dagget.

title: It's Never Too Late
desc: Batman intervenes in a gang war and tries to convince the older of two rival bosses to change his ways.

title: Joker's Favor
desc: An ordinary man finds himself forced to assist The Joker in one of his crimes.

title: The Cat and the Claw Part II
desc: Batman and Catwoman must work together to stop Red Claw from releasing a viral plague outside Gotham.

title: Pretty Poison
desc: When Harvey Dent is poisoned with derivative from an extinct flower, Batman must hunt down the assailant, the plant fanatic Poison Ivy, who happens to be Harvey's fiancee.

title: Nothing to Fear
desc: Batman faces off against the Scarecrow whose fear gas makes the superhero afraid of disgracing the Wayne name.

title: Be a Clown
desc: The Joker infiltrates the birthday party of Mayor Hill's son to plant a bomb.

title: Appointment in Crime Alley
desc: On Batman's annual intensive patrol of the street where his parents were murdered, Roland Dagget plots to devastate it.

title: P.O.V.
desc: The day after a police sting to catch a drug lord goes disastrously wrong, the events of the night before are reconstructed by the accounts of three police officers: Harvey Bullock, Renee Montoya, and a rookie.

title: The Clock King
desc: A ruined efficiency expert with an uncanny sense of timing and schedules plots his revenge against Mayor Hill.

title: The Last Laugh
desc: The Joker's plot to send all of Gotham into insanity with Joker-gas from a garbage scow leads to a battle on the water.

title: Eternal Youth
desc: A health resort, reputed to able to restore one's youth, has a horrific price Batman must cancel.

title: Two-Face Part I
desc: On the election trail, Harvey Dent gradually loses control of his repressed evil alternate personality until gangster Rupert Thorne inadvertently unleashes it.

title: Two-Face Part II
desc: Two-Face begins robbing Rupert Thorne's business in revenge while both the gangster and Batman hunt the dichotomous supervillain for their own reasons.

title: Fear of Victory
desc: While investigating a mysterious series of athlete panic attacks during games, Robin is exposed to the fear toxin of the culprit, The Scarecrow.

title: I've Got Batman in My Basement
desc: While trying to thwart Penguin's robbery of a rare Faberge egg, Batman is weakened by exposure to a toxic gas. He takes shelter in a basement apartment belonging to a teen-aged amateur detective.

title: Vendetta
desc: A convict turned witness disappears and Harvey Bullock, who arrested him, is suspected in the incident.

title: Prophecy of Doom
desc: A con man convinces a large group of Gotham's richest men that he can see into the future by arranging a series of near-fatal accidents.

title: The Forgotten
desc: While in disguise investigating the disappearance of homeless people, Batman is attacked and abducted to a slave camp with his memory lost.

title: Mad as a Hatter
desc: When a jealous scientist with a passion for Alice in Wonderland uses his mind control devices to have his dream girl for his own, Batman must intervene.

title: The Cape and Cowl Conspiracy
desc: A master designer of deathtraps is hired to take Batman's cowl and cape.

title: Perchance to Dream
desc: After being knocked out in a mysterious warehouse, Batman wakes up in a world where his parents are alive, he is engaged to Selina Kyle, and someone else is Batman.

title: The Underdwellers
desc: Batman discovers a subterranean colony of children in the sewer system dominated by the insane Sewer King.

title: Night of the Ninja
desc: A former fellow student of one of Wayne's old sensei's begins stalking the billionaire in revenge as a ninja.

title: The Strange Secret of Bruce Wayne
desc: A sinister doctor uses his mind reading machine to learn Batman's secret identity and attempts to auction it.

title: Tyger Tyger
desc: Selina Kyle is captured by a mad scientist and transformed into a humanoid cat creature.

title: Dreams in Darkness
desc: While affected by the Scarecrow's fear toxin, Batman finds himself an inmate of Arkham Asylum.

title: Beware the Gray Ghost
desc: A series of bombings reminiscent of a long lost TV series occur and the washed up star of it may be connected.

title: Cat Scratch Fever
desc: While Catwoman searches for her missing cat, she uncovers a plot to infect Gotham City that Batman must help stop.

title: I Am the Night
desc: Batman has serious doubts about his calling when Commissioner Gordon is seriously wounded.

title: Almost Got 'im
desc: In a bar, a collection of Batman's enemies chat about their failed attempts to kill him.

title: Moon of the Wolf
desc: Batman investigates sightings of an apparent werewolf.

title: Terror in the Sky
desc: The Man-Bat appears to be on the loose again, but it isn't clear if Dr. Kirk Langstrom is involved.

title: Christmas with the Joker
desc: On Christmas Eve, Joker broadcasts a pirate Christmas special on television. Batman and Robin have until midnight to fight their way past Joker's traps hidden all over town and rescue Commissioner Gordon, Harvey Bullock, and Summer Gleeson.

title: Heart of Steel: Part I
desc: A hyper-sophisticated robot steals computer technology from Wayne Enterprises, leading Batman to a sentient supercomputer, H.A.R.D.A.C., and its plan to replace humans with androids.

title: Heart of Steel: Part II
desc: Batman tracks a series of robots to Cybertron's headquarters, with some assistance from Barbara Gordon.

title: If You're So Smart, Why Aren't You Rich?
desc: A fired puzzle designer seeks revenge against his greedy former employer as The Riddler.

title: Joker's Wild
desc: When the Joker learns that a casino owner is using his likeness for the theme of his business, he escapes Arkham Asylum to destroy it while unaware of the owner's real motives.

title: His Silicon Soul
desc: H.A.R.D.A.C.'s robot replica of Bruce Wayne wanders around, believing itself to be the real Batman.

title: Off Balance
desc: Batman teams up with the mysterious Talia to retrieve a prototype weapon from the supervillain, Count Vertigo.

title: What Is Reality?
desc: When the Riddler traps Commissioner Gordon's consciousness in a virtual reality device, Batman must enter the villain's construct to save him.

title: The Laughing Fish
desc: The Joker threatens the patent office staff when they refuse to copyright his disfigured fish.

title: Harley and Ivy
desc: Harley Quinn teams up with Poison Ivy and both become the Queens of Crime, after the Joker and Batman find out.

title: The Mechanic
desc: The Penguin finds the mechanic who designs Batman's Batmobiles and forces him to turn the current model into a deathtrap.

title: The Man Who Killed Batman
desc: A small time crook tells his story of how he accidentally seemed to kill Batman, and how now everyone wants to kill him next.

title: Zatanna
desc: A stage magician - and former friend of Bruce Wayne - is framed for grand larceny.

title: Robin's Reckoning: Part 1
desc: After learning the name of an extortion ringleader, Batman mysteriously refuses to let Robin continue the investigation with him.

title: Birds of a Feather
desc: It's love for the Penguin when socialite Veronica Vreeland hooks up with him, but it's only an attempt to raise her social status.

title: Robin's Reckoning: Part 2
desc: Batman orders Robin to stay at home while he goes to catch Tony Zucco, but Robin goes out anyway.

title: Blind as a Bat
desc: Although temporarily blinded, Batman is still determined to stop The Penguin who is threatening the city with a prototype attack helicopter.

title: Day of the Samurai
desc: Batman visits one of his teachers to help fight Kyodai Ken who has learned the secret of a death touch attack.

title: See No Evil
desc: A small-time crook has stolen an invisibility suit, which he has been using to steal jewels, and now plans to steal his young daughter from his ex-wife.

title: The Demon's Quest: Part I
desc: Robin is kidnapped, and Batman unexpectedly joins forces with Ra's Al Ghul, whose daughter Talia has also been taken.

title: The Demon's Quest: Part II
desc: Batman must stop R'as Al Ghul's plot to destroy the earth.

title: Read My Lips
desc: Batman must stop an insane ventriloquist whose alternate criminal personality dominates him through his gangster dummy.

title: Fire from Olympus
desc: An energy weapon developed by the Army has disappeared, and Batman discovers that a mad shipping magnate who now fancies himself the god Zeus will use it to devastate Gotham.

title: Shadow of the Bat
desc: Commissioner James Gordon is arrested for corruption, forcing his daughter, Barbara Gordon, to take a dramatic step to help him.

title: Shadow of the Bat Part II
desc: Barbara Gordon, now Batgirl, joins Batman and Robin's investigation of Commissioner Gordon's framing.

title: Mudslide
desc: Clayface resurfaces with his body's cellular integrity decaying.

title: The Worry Men
desc: The Mad Hatter plants mind-control devices inside miniature native dolls distributed to high-society Gothamites by Veronica Vreeland.

title: Paging the Crime Doctor
desc: After losing his medical license, Dr. Matthew Thorne, younger brother of crime boss Rupert Thorne and a former colleague of Thomas Wayne and Leslie Tompkins, is forced to peddle his services to his brother and members of his gang. When Rupert insists that Matthew perform his heart surgery, Batman must protect both of them from assassination.

title: House and Garden
desc: Poison Ivy, after being released from Arkham, has apparently settled for a normal life, married to her psychiatrist and doting on his two children. Batman and Robin are suspicious, however, because semi-sentient plant-like creatures are committing mayhem all over Gotham.

title: Sideshow
desc: Killer Croc escapes a prison train and finds refuge with a group of former circus freaks living in the mountains, who take pity on him.

title: Avatar
desc: Batman travels to Egypt and joins with Talia to hunt down Ra's al Ghul who is searching for an ancient source of ultimate power.

title: Trial
desc: A district attorney who loathes Batman is forced to defend him in a twisted parody of a trial run by the inmates of Arkham Asylum who have seized control and taken them both prisoner.

title: Harlequinade
desc: When Joker steals a nuclear weapon, Batman arranges for Harley Quinn's release from Arkham, so she can help him track the Joker down.

title: Bane
desc: Rupert Thorne hires steroid-enhanced mercenary Bane to eliminate Batman.

title: Second Chance
desc: Before undergoing surgery meant to remove both his disfigurement and his alternate personality, Two-Face/Harvey Dent is kidnapped by persons unknown.

title: Riddler's Reform
desc: The Riddler has apparently gone straight, but Batman is not so sure.

title: Baby-Doll
desc: A washed-up actress with a bizarre condition that makes her look permanently like a child seeks revenge against her canceled show's cast and crew.

title: Time Out of Joint
desc: Batman and Robin battle the Clock King who has a prototype device that allows him to operate at an extremely accelerated time rate apart from the rest of his reality.

title: Harley's Holiday
desc: On her first day of release, Harley Quinn gets into a ridiculous amount of trouble in record time.

title: Make 'Em Laugh
desc: Batman and Robin investigate why various comedians are suddenly committing crimes with comically bizarre motifs.

title: Batgirl Returns
desc: Batgirl, Catwoman and Robin team up to investigate the theft of a valuable cat statuette.

title: Lock-Up
desc: Disgraced fanatical warder of Arkham Asylum sets himself as a vigilante jailer.

title: Deep Freeze
desc: An elderly amusement park owner breaks Mr. Freeze out of jail, hoping to be "frozen" like him in order to achieve immortality.

title: The Terrible Trio
desc: Three rich youths who commit armed robbery for fun are pursued by Batman as their irresponsible hobby escalates into potentially worse deeds.

title: Showdown
desc: While the Dynamic Duo race to stop Ra's Al Ghul from performing a kidnapping, the wild west story of how he was once opposed by the disfigured bounty hunter, Jonah Hex, is told.

title: Catwalk
desc: Catwoman is trying to go straight, but is recruited by The Ventriloquist as a jewel thief.

title: A Bullet for Bullock
desc: Det. Bullock reluctantly asks for Batman's assistance when he is convinced someone is trying to kill him.

title: The Lion and the Unicorn
desc: Red Claw kidnaps an old colleague of Alfred's from the British Secret Service, to gain access to a hidden missile silo.

title: Ocean World
desc: The ocean's influence dominates the world's weather systems and supports an enormous range of life. This first episode demonstrates the sheer scale, power and complexity of the "Blue Planet".

title: The Deep
desc: The deep sea, which gets darker with increasing depth until no more sunlight penetrates at about a kilometer depth, and ever colder closer to the bottom of the ocean, covers most of the planet and is thus by far the largest habitat on earth, yet has been explored less than space, so most scientific expeditions, at depths requiring modern submarine technology, discover... Read all

title: Open Ocean
desc: Endless blue stretches in every direction. The sea bed is a staggering eight kilometers deeper down and the nearest island is 500 kilometers away. There is nothing save the burning sun above and the blackened abyss below. How, then, does life exist?

title: Frozen Seas
desc: Life on the edge of a frozen sea is tough. Ice at both poles is constantly moving, and in winter freezes solid with air temperatures 70 °C below freezing. Only in spring, with the retreating ice and light reaching the water, does life begin again.

title: Seasonal Seas
desc: Shafts of sunlight are the vital source of energy used by the countless billions of plankton that grow every spring and summer in the world's temperate sea, the richest of all habitats.

title: Coral Seas
desc: Coral reefs are the rainforests of the sea; fish compete for food, territory and mates within this oasis of life. Incredible time-lapse photography shows the dramatic formation of a coral reef, portraying its inhabitants and its ultimate destruction.

title: Tidal Seas
desc: Tidal marshes are one of the most productive parts of the world. Numerous plants support numerous animals, yet life is not easy: predators are attracted to these enormous quantities of food, forcing animals to seek constant protection from attack.

title: Coasts
desc: The boundary between land and sea is an exciting place, with seabirds, turtles, and marine mammals constantly coming and going.

title: Where Is Everybody?
desc: Mike Ferris finds himself alone in the small Oakwood town and without recollection about his name, where he is or who he is. Mike wanders through the town trying to find a living soul. The tension increases and Mike has a breakdown.

title: One for the Angels
desc: A pitchman is visited by Mr. Death and is forced to get his priorities in order.

title: Mr. Denton on Doomsday
desc: The town drunk in the old-west faces his past when Fate lends a hand.

title: The Sixteen-Millimeter Shrine
desc: Barbara Jean Trenton is a faded film star who lives in the past by constantly re-watching her old movies instead of moving on with her life, so her associates try to lure her out of her self-imposed isolation.

title: Walking Distance
desc: A man travels back in time to his childhood, arriving just a few miles away from his native town.

title: Escape Clause
desc: A hypochondriac man sells his soul to the devil, exchanging it for several thousand years of immortality.

title: The Lonely
desc: A convict, living alone on an asteroid, receives from the police a realistic woman-robot.

title: Time Enough at Last
desc: A henpecked book lover finds himself blissfully alone with his books after a nuclear war.

title: Perchance to Dream
desc: A fatigued man fights to stay awake as he explains to a psychiatrist that if he falls asleep it will trigger a nightmare, which will cause his heart to fail.

title: Judgment Night
desc: It's 1942, and a man finds himself on a ship in the Atlantic, not knowing who he is, nor how he got there. He does know the ship will soon be attacked by a German U-boat.

title: And When the Sky Was Opened
desc: Three astronauts return to Earth after seemingly having made an encounter that dooms them and their craft to erasure from existence itself.

title: What You Need
desc: A small time crook plans to exploit an old street peddler who has the uncanny knack of selling people exactly what they will shortly need.

title: The Four of Us Are Dying
desc: A man who can change his face to look like other people uses his ability to improve his life, regardless of his effect on others.

title: Third from the Sun
desc: Two families of Government employees plan to steal a spaceship and travel to another planet just prior to a nuclear war. They must also deal with a stooge who wants to stop them.

title: I Shot an Arrow into the Air
desc: Order breaks down between three surviving crewmen whose rocket ship crashes on an unknown world with limited water and supplies.

title: The Hitch-Hiker
desc: A young woman driving cross-country becomes frantic when she keeps passing the same man on the side of the road. No matter how fast she drives, the man is always up ahead, hitching her for a ride.

title: The Fever
desc: A middle-aged man catches gambling fever from a slot machine that he believes is calling his name.

title: The Last Flight
desc: A World War I British fighter pilot lands at an American air base in France 42 years in the future.

title: The Purple Testament
desc: A U.S. Army lieutenant serving in the Philippines during WWII develops a harrowing ability to see in the faces of the men of his platoon, the men who will be the next ones to die.

title: Elegy
desc: Three astronauts touch down on an asteroid, where they discover a world of people that appear to be frozen in time. Confused, they theorize as to why everyone is motionless, until a man springs to life and explains.

title: Mirror Image
desc: While waiting in a bus station, Millicent Barnes has the strange feeling that her doppelganger is trying to take over her life.

title: The Monsters Are Due on Maple Street
desc: On a peaceful suburban street, strange occurrences and mysterious people stoke the residents' paranoia to a disastrous intensity.

title: A World of Difference
desc: A businessman sitting in his office inexplicably finds that he is on a production set and in a world where he is a movie star. Uninterested in the newfound fame, he fights to get back to his home and family.

title: Long Live Walter Jameson
desc: A father forbids a history professor from marrying his daughter when he discovers that the captivating lecturer is actually an immortal who has lived for thousands of years.

title: People Are Alike All Over
desc: Fearing the worst, the lone survivor of a crash-landing on Mars finds the native inhabitants, to his relief, very hospitable indeed, but there's a catch.

title: Execution
desc: When a 20th-century scientist tests out his time machine he accidentally retrieves a murderer from 1880, saving him from the hangman's noose. Unaware of the man's history, the scientist attempts to acclimatize him to his new surroundings.

title: The Big Tall Wish
desc: An aging boxer finds himself the winner of a match he thought he had lost, the result a six-year-old's frantic wish. But can a world-weary, embittered man still believe in miracles, or will he turn his back on them?

title: A Nice Place to Visit
desc: When bad guy Henry Francis Valentine dies in a shootout with police, he wakes up in the next world where his every wish is granted forever, and ever.

title: Nightmare as a Child
desc: A schoolteacher keeps seeing a strange little girl in her apartment building.

title: A Stop at Willoughby
desc: Tired of his miserable job and wife, a businessman starts dreaming on the train each night, about an old, idyllic town called Willoughby. Soon he has to know whether the town is real and fancies the thought of seeking refuge there.

title: The Chaser
desc: A young man obsessed with winning over an uninterested beauty gets more than he bargained for when he buys a love potion to gain her affection.

title: A Passage for Trumpet
desc: A suicidally despondent trumpet player finds himself in a bizarre world where he seems to be invisible to everyone, except for one helpful other musician.

title: Mr. Bevis
desc: After losing his job, his car and his apartment on the same day, an eccentric loser gets a new life from his guardian angel, but there is a price to keeping it.

title: The After Hours
desc: A woman is treated badly by some odd salespeople on an otherwise empty department store floor.

title: The Mighty Casey
desc: A down-and-out baseball team's fortunes are lifted by a mysterious but seemingly unbeatable young player.

title: A World of His Own
desc: A writer demonstrates he can control reality simply by dictating changes.

title: King Nine Will Not Return
desc: A pilot of a downed WW II bomber comes to in the African desert and desperately tries to find out what happened to the rest of his crew.

title: The Man in the Bottle
desc: A luckless couple stumbles upon fortune when a genie materializes from a bottle in their antique shop. The genie grants them four wishes but warns them, prophetically, to be careful what you wish for.

title: Nervous Man in a Four Dollar Room
desc: Small time criminal Jackie Rhoades must face both his past and his conscience while waiting for his next assignment.

title: A Thing About Machines
desc: Bartlett Finchley's paranoia about the machines around proves true.

title: The Howling Man
desc: Seeking refuge from a storm, a traveler comes upon a bizarre abbey of monks, who have imprisoned a man who begs for his help. When he confronts the head monk, he is told that the man is the Devil, and he must decide whom to believe.

title: Eye of the Beholder
desc: A young woman lying in a hospital bed, her head wrapped in bandages, awaits the outcome of a surgical procedure performed by the State in a last-ditch attempt to make her look "normal."

title: Nick of Time
desc: A pair of newlyweds stopping in a small town are trapped by their own superstition when playing a fortune telling machine in a local diner.

title: The Lateness of the Hour
desc: The daughter of an inventor objects to their "perfect" home where they are waited on by mechanical servants.

title: The Trouble with Templeton
desc: A nostalgic actor revisits his late wife and friends at their old haunt, only to find that he is now out of place there.

title: A Most Unusual Camera
desc: When three unintelligent crooks get ahold of a camera that takes pictures of the future, they set out to make a quick fortune with their new toy.

title: The Night of the Meek
desc: After a derelict Santa Claus is fired on Christmas Eve, he finds a mysterious bag that gives out presents. With this bag he sets out to fulfill his one wish - to see the less fortunate inherit the bounties of Christmas.

title: Dust
desc: A sympathetic sheriff and a callous con man are among the many who gather in a desert town on a hot day to see a man hanged for killing a child while drunk.

title: Back There
desc: At a prominent club in Washington, D.C., a socialite argues about whether it would be possible to change history by traveling back in time. When he leaves the club he finds himself in 1865, on the night that President Lincoln will be shot.

title: The Whole Truth
desc: A used car salesman buys a car that dooms him to tell only the truth!

title: The Invaders
desc: When a woman investigates a clamor on the roof of her rural house, she discovers a small UFO and little aliens emerging from it. Or so it seems.

title: A Penny for Your Thoughts
desc: Gaining telepathic abilities when his coin lands on its edge, bank clerk Hector B. Poole learns about the difference between other people's plans and fantasies.

title: Twenty Two
desc: While in the hospital recovering from overwork, Liz Powell keeps dreaming about going down to the hospital morgue.

title: The Odyssey of Flight 33
desc: Passing through the sound barrier, a commercial airliner inadvertently travels back in time.

title: Mr. Dingle, the Strong
desc: A timid vacuum-cleaner salesman is given the strength of 300 men by some experimenting aliens.

title: Static
desc: An old radio is taking bitter bachelor Ed Lindsay back to a happier time before what he considers worthless tripe on television when he starts picking up radio programs from the 1930's and 1940's.

title: The Prime Mover
desc: A compulsive gambler cajoles his friend to use his telekinesis to affect the results of the gambling tables in Las Vegas.

title: Long Distance Call
desc: A toy telephone becomes the link between a young boy and his dead grandmother.

title: A Hundred Yards Over the Rim
desc: A pioneer from a wagon train in 1847 sets off to find something for his ill son and stumbles into present-day New Mexico.

title: The Rip Van Winkle Caper
desc: After successfully stealing a gold shipment, a group of criminals and their scientist accomplice put themselves in suspended animation in a remote desert cave. When they awaken decades later, complications ensue when their truck is destroyed.

title: The Silence
desc: Annoyed by a club member's constant chatter, a man bets him he cannot remain silent for a year, living in a glass enclosure in the club basement.

title: Shadow Play
desc: Adam Grant is trapped in a recurring nightmare, in which he is sentenced to death by execution. He tries to convince the people around him that they are imaginary and that they will cease to exist if the execution is carried out.

title: The Mind and the Matter
desc: Using the power of mind over matter, Archibald Beechcroft remakes the world to his own specifications.

title: Will the Real Martian Please Stand Up?
desc: Following a frantic phone call about a crashed spaceship, two policeman try and determine who among the passengers of a bus at a snowed-in roadside diner is from another world.

title: The Obsolete Man
desc: In a future totalitarian society, a librarian is declared obsolete and sentenced to death.

title: Two
desc: Two survivors of an apocalyptic battle, a man and a woman from each opposing sides, approach each other suspiciously.

title: The Arrival
desc: Federal aviation investigator Grant Sheckly must deal with a mystery when a plane lands at an airport without pilots, passengers or luggage.

title: The Shelter
desc: A suburban dinner party is interrupted by a bulletin warning of an impending nuclear attack. As the neighbors scramble to prepare themselves, they turn against the one family that installed a permanent bomb shelter.

title: The Passersby
desc: While headed home, a Confederate soldier meets an anguished woman at the end of the Civil War.

title: A Game of Pool
desc: A frustrated pool champ has beaten everyone. Everyone except one man; the legend, Fats Brown. Brown is dead, and the champ can only curse his name. But guess who just walked in.

title: The Mirror
desc: A Central American revolutionary comes into the possession of a mirror that shows him his potential assassins.

title: The Grave
desc: Old West lawman Conny Miller visits the grave of a man who he failed to track down to prove he was never afraid of him but gets more than he bargained for.

title: It's a Good Life
desc: On an isolated family farm, a young boy with vast mental powers, but lacking emotional development, holds his terrified family in thrall to his every juvenile wish.

title: Deaths-Head Revisited
desc: A former German SS captain returns to Dachau concentration camp and begins reminiscing on the power he enjoyed there, until he finds himself on trial by those who died at his hands.

title: The Midnight Sun
desc: When the Earth falls out of orbit, two women try to cope with increasingly oppressive heat in a nearly abandoned city.

title: Still Valley
desc: In June 1863, Confederate soldiers come across a warlock who can help bring victory to the Southern cause.

title: The Jungle
desc: A businessman who has recently returned from Africa is stalked by the superstitions and warnings of a witch doctor.

title: Once Upon a Time
desc: Janitor Woodrow Mulligan gets a trip from 1890 to 1962 courtesy of his employer's time helmet.

title: Five Characters in Search of an Exit
desc: An Army major awakens in a small room with no idea of who he is or how he got there. He finds four other people in the same room, and they all begin to question how they each arrived there, and more importantly, how to escape.

title: A Quality of Mercy
desc: Hot-shot new Lieutenant Katell tries to make his mark on the last day of World War II in the Pacific and gets a unique perspective on his actions.

title: Nothing in the Dark
desc: An old woman has fought with death a thousand times and has always won. But now she finds herself afraid to let a wounded policeman in her door for fear he is Mr. Death. Is he?

title: One More Pallbearer
desc: Wealthy Paul Radin tries to get three people from his past to apologize to him by offering them shelter from a staged and phony nuclear war scenario.

title: Dead Man's Shoes
desc: A homeless man takes the shoes off a dead gangster and steps into his life.

title: The Hunt
desc: Upon returning from a coon hunt, Hyder Simpson discovers that no one can see or hear him because he has passed on.

title: Showdown with Rance McGrew
desc: The star of a Western TV series suddenly finds himself transported back in time to the real Wild West, and face-to-face with the real Jesse James.

title: Kick the Can
desc: An old man living in a rest home thinks he's found the secret of youth in children's games.

title: A Piano in the House
desc: Sadistic and hated theater critic Fitzgerald Fortune buys a player piano that has the power to reveal the souls of all who hear it.

title: The Last Rites of Jeff Myrtlebank
desc: A young man wakes up at his own funeral and wants to know what the heck is going on. The townfolk are glad to see him back, but they begin to wonder if he's a man.. or something else?

title: To Serve Man
desc: An alien race comes to Earth, promising peace and sharing technology. A linguist and his team set out to translate the aliens' language, using a book whose title they deduce is "To Serve Man."

title: The Fugitive
desc: Jenny and the other kids don't realize that the kindly yet magical old duffer they play with in the park is really an intergalactic fugitive hiding out till two serious men come looking for him, asking questions that test their friendship.

title: Little Girl Lost
desc: Awakened in the middle of the night by the cries of his daughter, a father enters the girl's room to find that she has vanished - even though he can still hear her crying out for help.

title: Person or Persons Unknown
desc: David Gurney wakes up to another ordinary day. Except today, nobody knows who he is.

title: The Little People
desc: On a desolate planet, two astronauts discover an entire society populated by incredibly small beings. One of the astronauts decides to rule the society as a god.

title: Four O'Clock
desc: A very obsessed man wants to expose evil in the world, investigating people he sees as murderers, subversives, perverts and communists, then attempting to ruin their lives.

title: Hocus-Pocus and Frisby
desc: A rural gas station attendant given to telling tall tales about himself is kidnapped by aliens who believe him to be one of Earth's leading intellects.

title: The Trade-Ins
desc: An elderly couple shop for younger replacement bodies, then resort to desperate measures to cover the cost.

title: The Gift
desc: A man from the stars comes with a gift to a small Mexican village whose residents do not welcome this stranger.

title: The Dummy
desc: Ventriloquist Jerry Etherson is convinced that his dummy, Willie, is alive and evil. He locks Willie in a trunk and makes plans for a new act with a new dummy. Too bad he didn't clear those plans with Willie first.

title: Young Man's Fancy
desc: Newlywed Alex Walker finds himself being pulled back to his childhood and back to his widowed mother in the house where he grew up.

title: I Sing the Body Electric
desc: A recent widower, needing loving care for his three young children, orders a cybernetic "grandmother". While two of the children accept her, one of his daughters fiercely rejects her, with near tragic consequences.

title: Cavender Is Coming
desc: Inept guardian angel Harmon Cavender is given a chance to earn his wings by helping an unconventional big city woman, the young, awkward Agnes Grep.

title: The Changing of the Guard
desc: After being forced to retire, Professor Fowler contemplates suicide when he doesn't feel he's made a difference in the world.

title: In His Image
desc: A young man grapples with an urge to kill and confusion about his origins.

title: The Thirty-Fathom Grave
desc: As a U.S. Navy destroyer cruises near Guadalcanal in the South Pacific, its sonar detects muted but constant hammering on metal undersea. The eerie sounds emanate from a submarine on the ocean floor, apparently there since World War II. The ship's chief boatswain's mate becomes very nervous, having served aboard that sub - and he was its sole survivor.

title: Valley of the Shadow
desc: A reporter stumbles into a peaceful town where miracles seem to occur due to technology and the townsfolk won't let him leave.

title: He's Alive
desc: A tiny neo-Nazi organization struggles pathetically to succeed in a big city. A mysterious figure begins to ruthlessly guide a young, insecure U.S. Nazi leader, and the group begins to draw more attention.

title: Mute
desc: The orphaned daughter of telepathic parents must learn to speak and deal with a world she cannot communicate in.

title: Death Ship
desc: An interplanetary expedition from Earth finds an exact duplicate of their ship and themselves crashed on the planet they were surveying. Should they stay or risk taking off and crashing?

title: Jess-Belle
desc: Appalachian beauty Jess-Belle can't bear to lose the object of her passion to the local rich girl, so she turns to the local witch for aid. The results bring unexpected and tragic consequences.

title: Miniature
desc: Mousey misfit Charley Parkes finds the world unfolding before him in a museum doll house to be more real than his boring job and overbearing mother.

title: Printer's Devil
desc: A man sells his soul to the Devil to save his failing newspaper and gets more than he bargained for.

title: No Time Like the Past
desc: A scientist attempts to use a time machine to prevent tragedies, both in world history and in his own past.

title: The Parallel
desc: Astronaut Robert Gaines returns from space to a world that is not exactly the one he left from.

title: I Dream of Genie
desc: A wiseacre genie appears from a lamp to a meek man, George P. Hanley. Hanley is so used to bad luck, he imagines how each of three possible wishes could go very wrong - but the genie will grant him only one wish!

title: The New Exhibit
desc: A wax-museum employee fights to preserve five figures of famous murderers.

title: Of Late I Think of Cliffordville
desc: Aging tycoon William Feathersmith is bored with life and makes arrangements through a devilish travel agency to return to the Cliffordville of his youth and start all over again.

title: The Incredible World of Horace Ford
desc: Toymaker Horace Ford is increasingly preoccupied with memories of his childhood, endangering his job and marriage - but a visit to his old neighborhood brings a haunting encounter, suggesting the time was not as idyllic as he remembers.

title: On Thursday We Leave for Home
desc: The first human space colony is about to be rescued from the forsaken planet they've been on for three decades. But their leader's having a hard time accepting that change will happen when they get back to Earth.

title: Passage on the Lady Anne
desc: A young American couple, the Ransomes, who are trying to salvage their troubled marriage, insist on booking passage on an old trans-Atlantic cruise liner. But other passengers try to persuade them to disembark immediately.

title: The Bard
desc: Julius Moomer, a talentless, but relentless, self-promoting hack who dreams of becoming a successful television writer, uses a book of magic to summon William Shakespeare to write dramatic teleplays that Moomer will pass off as his own. Shakespeare becomes irritated by Moomer's lack of appreciation and is even more appalled when he discovers the changes wrought on his plays by cynical television executives.

title: In Praise of Pip
desc: A wearied bookie, learning of his grown soldier son Pip dying in South Vietnam, gets to spend one last delightful hour with a ten-year-old version of him at an amusement park.

title: Steel
desc: In 1974, boxing has been outlawed and is performed by mechanical robots. With his next and possibly last fight approaching and his robot in need of repair, he resorts to one last desperate gamble.

title: Nightmare at 20,000 Feet
desc: A man, newly recovered from a nervous breakdown, becomes convinced that a monster only he sees is damaging the plane he's flying in.

title: A Kind of a Stopwatch
desc: A man is given a stopwatch that halts time.

title: The Last Night of a Jockey
desc: A washed-up jockey gets his wish while waiting for the results of his race fixing hearing.

title: Living Doll
desc: A frustrated father does battle with his stepdaughter's talking doll, whose vocabulary includes such phrases as "I hate you" and "I'm going to kill you".

title: The Old Man in the Cave
desc: In a post-apocalyptic settlement in 1974, the inhabitants' survival is dependent on the advice of an unseen man living in a nearby cave. This dependence is tested when a band of soldiers descends on their town.

title: Uncle Simon
desc: Caregiver Barbara Polk receives a surprise after her uncle's death.

title: Probe 7, Over and Out
desc: Colonel Cook, stranded on another planet with no hope for rescue, meets a woman who is the sole survivor from another planet.

title: The 7th Is Made Up of Phantoms
desc: On June 25, 1964, three Army National Guard soldiers on maneuvers near the Little Big Horn battle site find themselves unwittingly involved in Custer's Last Stand.

title: A Short Drink from a Certain Fountain
desc: An aging married man convinces his brother to inject him with a youth serum.

title: Ninety Years Without Slumbering
desc: An old man believes that his life will end the moment his grandfather clock stops ticking.

title: Ring-A-Ding Girl
desc: Movie star Bunny Blake receives a ring from her hometown which is giving her warnings to come home while she flies cross country.

title: You Drive
desc: After being involved with a hit-and-run accident, which resulted in killing a child, Mr. Oliver Pope is haunted by his car.

title: The Long Morrow
desc: Before leaving on a decades-long mission, astronaut Douglas Stansfield meets a woman and falls in love.

title: The Self-Improvement of Salvadore Ross
desc: Salvadore Ross has a unique talent where he can trade physical characteristics with other people and will do anything to get the love of Leah Maitland.

title: Number 12 Looks Just Like You
desc: In a future society, everyone must undergo an operation at age 19 to become beautiful and conform to society. One young woman desperately wants to hold onto her own identity.

title: Black Leather Jackets
desc: Three leather-jacket-wearing, motorcycle-riding men invade a peaceful neighborhood.

title: Night Call
desc: Telephone calls begin to haunt a disabled elderly woman.

title: From Agnes - with Love
desc: A computer technician begins to take advice for his love life from Agnes, the computer he works with.

title: Spur of the Moment
desc: An engaged heiress is terrorized by a middle-aged woman on a horse pleading with her not to go through with her impending marriage.

title: An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge
desc: During the American Civil War in 1862, a condemned Confederate prisoner, Peyton Farquhar, is due to be hanged by Union troops.

title: Queen of the Nile
desc: A reporter interviews a Hollywood movie queen who has a secret to her eternal beauty.

title: What's in the Box
desc: Philanderer Joe Britt sees his indiscretions shown on his own TV set after it was worked on by a unique repairman.

title: The Masks
desc: Wealthy Jason Foster is dying and he invites his greedy heirs to a Mardi Gras party where they must wear the masks he specially had made for them or else be cut off from their inheritance.

title: I am the Night - Color Me Black
desc: The Sun doesn't rise on a small town where an execution is scheduled to take place.

title: Sounds and Silences
desc: Roswell Flemington enjoys loud noises, is an annoyance to others and is suitably punished.

title: Caesar and Me
desc: When Irish ventriloquist Jonathan West cannot find any work, his dummy Caesar suggests that he turn to burglary.

title: The Jeopardy Room
desc: A defector is trapped in a hotel room and given three hours to find a hidden bomb.

title: Stopover in a Quiet Town
desc: A hung-over couple awaken to find themselves not only in a strange house, but in a deserted town, where nothing is as it should be.

title: The Encounter
desc: Post-WWII Hawaii. Two men of once-opposing races are stuck in an attic full of war trophies, including a samurai sword waiting to dutifully avenge its slain master.

title: Mr. Garrity and the Graves
desc: Mr. Garrity comes into town of Happiness, Arizona offering to resurrect the dead and reunite the townsfolk with their departed loved ones out of the goodness of his heart. Do the town-folks want these miracles to occur?

title: The Brain Center at Whipple's
desc: A heartless CEO completely automates his factory and lays off almost all of his workers over the objections of his employees.

title: Come Wander with Me
desc: Singer Floyd Burney searches the backwoods for new songs and finds Mary Rachel and much more deep in the Twilight Zone.

title: The Fear
desc: Charlotte Scott and state trooper Robert Franklin seem to be stalked by giants.

title: The Bewitchin' Pool
desc: Two children escape their bickering parents through a portal in the bottom of their swimming pool to a magical land watched over by a kindly old woman the children call Aunt T.

title: Part 1: Days 1-7
desc: The Beatles arrive at Twickenham Studios and have three weeks to complete 14 new songs and a live show.

title: Part 2: Days 8-16
desc: John, Paul and Ringo meet with George following his walkout and move the session to Apple Studios.

title: Part 3: Days 17-22
desc: The Beatles must decide if they will perform live for the first time in three years.

title: Risk Se Ishq
desc: In the 70's, a Ghatkopar-based middle-class lad joins the stock market and soon picks up the art of jobbing. where will this new found skill take him in future?

title: Cobra Killer
desc: A bankrupt and fatherless Harshad fights despair and starts a firm, Growmore Consultancy. His friend, Pranav Sheth gets him corporate clients and Bhushan comes on board.

title: Paise Ki Dukaan
desc: Once the money market catches Harshad's fancy, he launches his own cartel of brokers and starts dealing with banks. Soon he bags SBI as his client and fate takes a U turn. Watch ahead to know how

title: Harshad Mehta Is A Liar
desc: Harshad's sudden success catches the attention of a young financial journalist, Sucheta Dalal who is actively looking for evidence against him. Will Harshad at all get to enjoy his extravagant life to his heart's content ?

title: Kundali Mein Shani
desc: RBI Governor on seeing fishy transaction in Harshad's SBI account ask the bank to keep a close eye on his fund movements. Harshad in his safeguarding attempt tries to sweep the 500 crores off the books. Will this go unnoticed?

title: Stop Press
desc: While Harshad clears off most of his debts to SBI, Sucheta, on receiving a tip off from Bellary just won't give up her ordeal of exposing the fraud of 500 crores. Both have just twenty four hours to turn table

title: Dalal Street Ka Dariya
desc: Venkitarajan gets to know that there are multiple banks involved in the money scam and that the scam is much bigger in stature than what it appears on the surface. RBI installs an investigating committee. What are the findings?

title: Matador
desc: Once Sucheta get to know from Venkatarajan about the involvement of NHB in the scam, she releases this news which leads CBI to start with interrogation of Pherwani. Harshad fears of Pherwani telling the truth. What will Harshad do next?

title: Ek Crore Ka Suitcase
desc: The government tries to negotiate with Harshad Mehta and his lawyer but eventually it didn't work. And one day Harshad along with his lawyer Mr.Ram Jethmalani conducted a press conference in which publicly tell everyone that the then PM Mr.PV Narsimharao had been given a briefcase of Rs. 1 crore.

title: Main History Banana Chahta Hoon
desc: Delhi strikes a deal with Harshad, based on which he withdraws his press statement. Growmore get back to life with most of Harshad's assets being frozen. However, Bhushan's revelation is soon going to turn Harshad's world upside down.

title: Welcome to the Playground
desc: Orphaned sisters Vi and Powder bring trouble to Zaun's underground streets in the wake of a heist in posh Piltover.

title: The Base Violence Necessary for Change
desc: An epic showdown between old rivals results in a fateful moment for Zaun. Jayce and Viktor risk it all for their research.

title: Some Mysteries Are Better Left Unsolved
desc: Idealistic inventor Jayce attempts to harness magic through science --- despite his mentor's warning. Criminal kingpin Silco tests a powerful substance.

title: Happy Progress Day!
desc: With Piltover prospering from their tech, Jayce and Viktor weigh their next move. A familiar face re-emerges from Zaun to wreak havoc.

title: Everybody Wants to Be My Enemy
desc: Rogue enforcer Caitlyn tours the undercity alongside Vi to track down Silco. Jayce puts a target on his back trying to root out Piltover corruption.

title: When These Walls Come Tumbling Down
desc: An eager protege undermines his mentor on the council as a magical tech rapidly evolves. With authorities in pursuit, Jinx must face her past.

title: Oil and Water
desc: Disowned heir Mel and her visiting mother trade combat tactics. Caitlyn and Vi forge an unlikely alliance. Jinx undergoes a startling change.

title: The Boy Savior
desc: Caitlyn and Vi meet an ally in Zaun's streets and head into a frenzied battle with a common foe. Viktor makes a dire decision.

title: The Monster You Created
desc: Perilously close to war, the leaders of Piltover and Zaun reach an ultimatum. But a fateful standoff changes both cities forever.

title: Déjà Vu (1858-1961)
desc: After nearly a century of French colonial rule, Vietnam emerges independent, but divided.

title: Riding the Tiger (1961-1963)
desc: President John F. Kennedy and his advisors consider how deeply the U.S. should get involved in South Vietnam as a communist insurgency and Buddhist protests intensify.

title: The River Styx (January 1964-December 1965)
desc: Fearing Saigon's collapse, President Lyndon B. Johnson authorizes the bombing of North Vietnam, and sends U.S. ground troops to the south.

title: Resolve (January 1966-June 1967)
desc: North Vietnamese troops make their way down the Ho Chi Minh Trail, defying American air power. While the anti-war movement escalates back home, American soldiers realize this war is like no other.

title: This Is What We Do (July-December 1967)
desc: As casualties mount on both sides, American soldiers face deadly ambushes and artillery. President Lyndon B. Johnson assures the American public that victory is within reach.

title: Things Fall Apart (January-June 1968)
desc: Shaken by the violence of the Tet Offensive, assassinations of leaders and domestic unrest, Americans begin to doubt President Lyndon B. Johnson's promise that victory in Vietnam is near and he ultimately decides not to seek reelection.

title: The Veneer of Civilization (June 1968-May 1969)
desc: Draft-age Americans wrestle with their choices. Richard Nixon narrowly wins the presidential election. Soldiers on all sides of the conflict witness savagery and courage.

title: The History of the World (April 1969-May 1970)
desc: President Richard Nixon begins withdrawing American troops from Vietnam, but his authorization of the invasion of Cambodia sparks large protests in America.

title: A Disrespectful Loyalty (May 1970-March 1973)
desc: The South Vietnamese fight on their own, succumbing to terrible losses in Laos. After he is reelected, President Richard Nixon strikes a peace deal with Hanoi that sees the release of American prisoners of war.

title: The Weight of Memory (March 1973 - Onward)
desc: Civil war continues in Vietnam as President Richard Nixon resigns. After North Vietnamese troops regain control of Saigon and the war ends, people from all sides search for reconciliation.

title: Unaired Pilot
desc: Invalided home from the war in Afghanistan, Dr. John Watson becomes roommates with the world's only "consulting detective," Sherlock Holmes. Within a day their friendship is forged and several murders are solved.

title: A Study in Pink
desc: War vet Dr. John Watson returns to London in need of a place to stay. He meets Sherlock Holmes, a consulting detective, and the two soon find themselves digging into a string of serial "suicides."

title: The Blind Banker
desc: Mysterious symbols and murders are showing up all over London, leading Sherlock and John to a secret Chinese crime syndicate called Black Lotus.

title: The Great Game
desc: Mycroft needs Sherlock's help, but a remorseless criminal mastermind puts Sherlock on a distracting crime-solving spree via a series of hostage human bombs through which he speaks.

title: A Scandal in Belgravia
desc: Sherlock must confiscate something of importance from a mysterious woman named Irene Adler.

title: The Hounds of Baskerville
desc: Sherlock and John investigate the ghosts of a young man who has been seeing monstrous hounds out in the woods where his father died.

title: The Reichenbach Fall
desc: Jim Moriarty hatches a mad scheme to turn the whole city against Sherlock.

title: Many Happy Returns
desc: John and Lestrade try to move on with their lives after Sherlock's apparent death. However, Anderson believes he is still alive.

title: The Empty Hearse
desc: Mycroft calls Sherlock back to London to investigate an underground terrorist organization.

title: The Sign of Three
desc: Sherlock tries to give the perfect best man speech at John's wedding when he suddenly realizes a murder is about to take place.

title: His Last Vow
desc: Sherlock goes up against Charles Augustus Magnussen, media tycoon and a notorious blackmailer.

title: The Abominable Bride
desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson find themselves in 1890s London in this Christmas special.

title: The Six Thatchers
desc: Sherlock takes on the case of finding out who is going around and smashing six unique head statues of late Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher.

title: The Lying Detective
desc: Sherlock goes up against the powerful and seemingly unassailable Culverton Smith - a man with a very dark secret indeed.

title: The Final Problem
desc: A dark secret in the Holmes family rears its head with a vengeance, putting Sherlock and friends through a series of sick, manipulative psychological and potentially fatal games.

title: Hagane no renkinjutsushi
desc: The Elric brothers adjust to military life and take part in a manhunt for Isaac the Freezer, a former State Alchemist bent on ending the reign of Fuhrer Bradley.

title: Hajimari no hi
desc: A glimpse into the past reveals the pain and desperation that drove the Elric boys to break alchemy's greatest taboo - human transmutation - and their reasons for becoming dogs of the military.

title: Jakyô no machi
desc: Science and faith collide when the Elrics confront Father Cornello. He claims to work miracles, but the brothers suspect him of abusing a Philosopher's Stone to manipulate his flock.

title: An Alchemist's Distress
desc: The Elrics meet Shou Tucker, a leading researcher in the field of chimeras. He has much to teach Ed and Al about alchemy - and the horrible cruelty that sometimes accompanies it.

title: Rain of Sorrow
desc: Edward and Alphonse are attacked by Scar, a mysterious killer wanted for a string of gruesome murders. His powers are incredible - and his obsession with slaying State Alchemists might be justified.

title: Kibou no michi
desc: Before arriving at the Rockbell home for repairs, the Elrics meet Dr. Marcoh, a State Alchemist running from past sins. The information he gives Ed and Al could put the Philosopher's Stone within reach.

title: Kakusareta shinjitsu
desc: The Elrics discover the horrific ingredient needed to create a Philosopher's Stone. When night falls, they prowl the grounds of a secret laboratory in search of more facts - but the brothers find only danger.

title: Daigo kenkyuujo
desc: Ed and Al furiously battle the Fifth Laboratory's psychotic guards. In the chaos, the truth behind the Philosopher's Stone is buried beneath rubble - and disturbing new questions are unearthed.

title: Tsukurareta omoi
desc: Al is haunted by the notion his entire existence was simply created by his brother. When the youngest Elric angrily reveals these suspicions, only Winry can convince him just how wrong he is about Ed.

title: Sorezore no yukusaki
desc: When the conspiracy surrounding the Philosopher's Stone closes in on the highest ranks of the military, one of Mustang's most trusted and cherished allies is murdered.

title: Rasshubarê no kiseki
desc: The Elrics, realizing alchemy has yet to unlock the mysteries of creating life, feel powerless when a new friend goes into labor. Winry, however, jumps into action with a young thief named Paninya.

title: Ichi wa zen, Zen wa ichi
desc: While visiting Izumi, their childhood teacher, the Elrics recall the early difficulties of grasping equivalent exchange. They also discover she shares their intimate knowledge of alchemy's greatest taboo.

title: Daburisu no kemono tachi
desc: Al is abducted by chimeras led by the seemingly indestructible Homunculus known as Greed. When Ed's rescue attempt falls short, Izumi proves once more that she's got the brothers' best interests in mind.

title: Chika ni hisomu mono tachi
desc: In a violent clash with Greed, King Bradley proves to be a brutal opponent. But the man who finally destroys the Ultimate Shield is more powerful than even the Fuhrer himself.

title: Touhou no shisha
desc: The Elrics scuffle with Ling Yao and his attendants, Lan Fan and Fu, visitors from Xing seeking the Philosopher's Stone. Ed may not like him, but Ling Yao's not leaving until he gets what he wants.

title: Tomo no ashiato
desc: After learning of Hughes's fate, Ed and Al are ravaged by sadness and guilt. Envy still hides in plain sight among the State Alchemists, and another Homunculus is on the verge of infiltrating their ranks as well.

title: Reitetsu na honoo
desc: Freed by an unlikely liberator, Ross's escape is interrupted by Mustang. Even those most loyal to the Flame Alchemist are shaken by the controversial action he takes against the accused killer of Maes Hughes.

title: Chiisana ningen no gouman na tenohira
desc: Ed's journey to a distant land of legend offers surprising new details behind Mustang's alleyway encounter with Ross. After a fateful encounter of his own, Elric learns a stunning secret about Winry's parents.

title: Death of the Undying
desc: Mustang, Alphonse, Havoc, and Hawkeye split up to search a military laboratory. If Lust has her way, none of them will ever see each other again.

title: Bozen no chichi
desc: Hohenheim's visit ends with a grave warning to Pinako, but Ed finds hope among the charred ruins of his childhood. Now more than ever, he has confidence that Al can be returned to his body.

title: Moumoku no Renkinjutsushi
desc: Edward and Al heard a rumor about alchemist who has successfully competed human transmutation and decided to visit him.

title: Gusha no zenshin
desc: Hoping to learn more about the Homunculi, Ed and Al devise a risky strategy to lure the creatures out of hiding. Step one of the brothers' plan: risk death at the hands of their most dangerous enemy - Scar.

title: Tooku no senaka
desc: Scar's mission to destroy those who slaughtered his people is fueled by justifiable rage. Upon learning the role Scar played in her parents' deaths, Winry claims those murderous feelings as her own.

title: Ikusaba no shoujo
desc: Cooperation between Mustang's cabal and Ling Yao's band leads to the capture of a Homunculus. Unfortunately, their actions also capture the eye of the Homunculus hiding atop the military's ranks.

title: Hara no naka
desc: Gluttony's twisted powers overwhelm the Elrics - and the creature's appetite is satisfied by battle's end. Meanwhile, Mustang acts on his suspicions of Bradley and finds himself in the belly of the beast.

title: Yami no tobira
desc: The Homunculi are winning. Ed and Ling face a horrific enemy within the hellish expanse of Gluttony's gut. In Central, Mustang can only watch as his loyal band of soldiers is divided by Bradley.

title: Saikai
desc: Truths are exposed when Al finds the one called Father, and Mustang hears the tale of Bradley's creation - but the most amazing revelation is reserved for Ed after he once again breaks alchemy's greatest taboo.

title: Hazama no utage
desc: Visions of the past play out as Hohenheim reflects on the follies of man; the pain that comes with family, the truths of Alchemy and the roots of war.

title: Otousama
desc: The Elrics come face to face with Father - and his face is familiar indeed. Powerless and amazed, Ed and Al can only watch as Father creates a new Homunculus with alchemy that should be impossible.

title: Gusha no agaki
desc: The Elrics are at Bradley's mercy; if the brothers make one wrong move, those dearest to them will pay. As Mustang quietly gathers allies at his side, Ed discovers there may be no need to find a Philosopher's Stone.

title: Ishuvâru senmetsusen
desc: As Edward hears Hawkeye's tale of a time when idealistic young soldiers were tasked with genocide, the horrors of the Ishvalan battlefield are revealed.

title: 520 senzu no yakusoku
desc: Even as his subordinates are scattered, Mustang finds he still has allies - unfortunately, so do his enemies. The Homunculi unleash one of the Ishvalan War's most notorious killers to deal with Scar and Marcoh.

title: Daisoutou no musuko
desc: A secret encounter allows Mustang to spark new ambitions in an old friend - an ally with loyal troops at his command. Meanwhile, Edward and Alphonse share a chance meeting with their biggest fan - young Selim Bradley.

title: Burigguzu no hokuheki
desc: The frigid northern borderlands become a battlefield when Kimblee finally closes in on Scar. Deeper into the frozen wasteland, Ed and Al's fight is against the bitter elements as they struggle to reach Fort Briggs.

title: Koori no joou
