desc: The soldiers at Fort Briggs remain ever vigilant against the threat of spies from Drachma. The massive compound may seem impenetrable - but a violent intruder offers destructive proof to the contrary.

title: Kono kuni no katachi
desc: Edward uncovers a conspiracy of staggering scope: a plot that has already claimed countless victims. Clues suggest that Fort Briggs will soon know bloodshed - and an entire nation will suffer.

title: Kazoku no shouzou
desc: As Raven tries to corrupt Armstrong, Ed and Al can only wait in their cell. Long ago, their father faced his own captivity, confined to an eternity of regret in an undying body. To escape the pain, he said goodbye.

title: Hajimari no homunkurusu
desc: The first Homunculus reveals itself; Edward is surprised by an offer from Kimblee: Fullmetal can have all he has searched for - in exchange for becoming a mass murderer.

title: Simple na Hitobito
desc: After breaking automail, scared of Winry's reaction Edward and Al buy her gifts.

title: Bazukûru no gekitou
desc: When Scar is cornered by a pair of gruesome chimera, the Elrics must enter the fray as his unlikely allies. Later, Winry's attempt to confront Scar over his role in her parents' death ends in disaster.

title: Hakuchuu no yume
desc: The ruse of Winry's abduction by Scar is revealed, but a plan of rescue must still be hatched. A brutal storm is coming - one which only Alphonse Elric can brave.

title: Homunkurusu
desc: Long ago, the blood of a simple slave was used in an experiment which created a strange, shapeless being. In exchange for the gift of existence, the being gave the slave a name - and cursed him with immortality.

title: Naraku
desc: Bound by more than blood, the Elrics have long shared joy and pain. Now, with Al wandering the frigid void - and Ed losing blood by Kimblee's hand - the mystical connection of their souls could prove fatal.

title: Hangeki no kizashi
desc: May and Marcoh's efforts to decode the research of Scar's brother yield progress, but it might be too late to prevent catastrophe. Violence is spreading across the land, and it will soon reach the northern border.

title: Ari no hitokami
desc: In the snowy north, the soldiers of Fort Briggs engage an invading army and Marcoh leads an attack against monstrous Envy. In Central, an ominous and shocking secret is revealed to Olivier Armstrong.

title: Barin barin no zenkai
desc: Hohenheim and Alphonse enjoy a chance to get reacquainted. Their bond is restored with ease, inspiring the father to share his secrets with his sons - but one of them is far away and on the run.

title: Yaskusoku no hi
desc: The Promised Day is approaching. While most will face the coming chaos with their own kind, Edward forms a new group comprised of human, chimera and Homunculus

title: Semaru kage
desc: Those who have prepared to reclaim a nation find their plans exposed. The chaos multiplies after an assassin strikes down a mighty leader in broad daylight, and Alphonse falls prey to monsters in the dark.

title: Yami no shisha
desc: A sinister voice rings out from the shell of Al's armor, and Ed and Greed find themselves under attack. As the Homunculi use the darkness to their advantage, a face from the past arrives to join the battle.

title: Chikadou no chikai
desc: After investigating the twisted roots of the Bradley family tree, Mustang gathers his most loyal troops. Meanwhile, Ed and his allies continue fighting Selim, who shocks everyone by turning on his own kind.

title: Oyako no jou
desc: With his father's help, Al takes incredible steps to contain the monstrous Pride. As the sun begins to rise on the Promised Day, the youngest Elric listens while the Homunculus ponders his very human mother.

title: Sentoraru douran
desc: Mustang leads a ragtag assault force of hardy northern troops - and welcome faces from the past - against Central's defenses. Victory seems certain until the military's most horrifying secret is revealed.

title: Fushi no gundan
desc: Ed's crew faces a horde of ravenous mannequins, abominations powered by human souls. The twisted creatures aren't the only unstoppable force on the battlefield - Pride, Sloth, and Envy are on the move.

title: Minna no chikara
desc: With the philosopher stone in his possession, Alphonse fearlessly takes on pride and Kimble. Elsewhere, the Armstrongs find themselves trapped between Sloth's onslaught and the guns of Central's troops.

title: Fukushuu no honoo
desc: After a startling radio broadcast grants Mustang's forces the advantage over Central's troops, the Flame Alchemist unleashes the brutal power of burning hatred in the battle against the killer of Maes Hughes.

title: Sensei Monogatari
desc: Izumi's alchemy training and her first love.

title: Rekka no saki ni
desc: As Envy writhes within the firestorm unleashed by Mustang's vengeful rage, Hawkeye must take drastic measures to prevent the Flame Alchemist's hatred from going out of control.

title: Otonatachi no ikizama
desc: A rebel victory is imminent and hope takes hold among Mustang and Armstrong's troops. Central's forces teeter on the brink of collapse - until their fallen leader returns to take control.

title: Daisoutou no kikan
desc: Central's forces fight with renewed vigor following Bradley's return, and the Führer himself enters the battle. His first opponent is an armored tank. His second foe is even tougher.

title: Eien no itoma
desc: The battle for a nation's soul descends into chaos. Bradley unleashes death on those who dare engage him. Beneath Central, the one responsible for the Führer's creation unleashes something far, far worse.

title: Hitobashira
desc: Mustang must make a difficult choice: will he break alchemy's greatest taboo? Or will he watch the person dearest to him die? Meanwhile, it grows ever more difficult to discern where Ling ends and Greed begins.

title: Ushinawareta hikari
desc: As the light of the sun vanishes, Mustang learns the loss which comes from seeing the other side of the Gateway - and five sacrifices gather in the dark presence of the Father.

title: Ten no hitomi, shi no tobira
desc: The light is gone. Shadows swallow everything. As the planet quakes and the heavens tremble, the souls of heroes and villains alike vanish into darkness. The circle is complete.

title: Kami o nomikomishi mono
desc: Millions of lifeless bodies litter the landscape of Amestris, and a being with the power to create suns is unleashed upon the world. Unless Hohenheim has something amazing up his sleeve, all is surely lost.

title: Seizetsunaru hangeki
desc: A truly epic battle erupts when Edward, Mustang, Hawkeye, Greed, Izumi, and Armstrong attack the god-like Father. The odds are against the forces of good - until one brave boy makes a shocking sacrifice.

title: Tobira no mukougawa
desc: Ed fights the original homunculus known as 'The father' trying to defeat him in order to get his and Al's body back.

title: Tabiji no hate
desc: Ed and Al start a new adventure in searching for new and innovative ways of alchemy.

title: Sore mo mata Kare no Senjou
desc: While in military academy, Mustang and Hughes become friends.

title: 4-Koma Theater
desc: Short specials from the DVDs/BDs.

title: The Making of Life
desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the series' most memorable moments around the world through the eyes of the cameramen and women.

title: Challenges of Life
desc: David Attenborough shows us how some animals have evolved new hunting, mating and parental techniques to help them survive the challenges of life.

title: Reptiles & Amphibians
desc: Reptilians survive from the age of the Saurians, but if many look Ancient that's because their early and sometimes relatively recent adaptations to widely varied conditions worldwide still work admirably. Examples include lizards like the giant Komodo dragon, still top-dog on his Indonesian island, the feared crocodilian hunters, color-changing chameleons and snake sp... Read all

title: Mammals
desc: Mammals dominate the planet. They do it through having warm blood and by the care they lavish on their young. Filming in the bitter Antarctic winter reveal how a mother Weddell seal wears her teeth down keeping open a hole in the ice so she can catch fish for her pup. A powered hot air balloon captures stunning images of millions of migrating bats as they converge on ... Read all

title: Fish
desc: Countless fish fill the seas and almost all other waters on the blue planet, some even visit or invade bordering land. Evolution created a huge variety in size, shape, defense means etc., fit for varies ways of life in all kinds of waters, allowing camouflage, shelter etc. They occupy various positions in aquatic and related food chains, eaten by and/or eating other f... Read all

title: Birds
desc: Birds descend from dinosaurs who developed feathers. Those allow most of them to fly, which few other vertebrates can. Some birds gave up flying, like penguins, who specialize in diving and prove feather's fabulous insulating efficiency. Feathers are also key to courting, almost as varied as bird physiognomy and ways of solitary or social life almost all over the glob... Read all

title: Insects
desc: Insects and - species outnumber all higher animals by far. Their immense variety reflect adaptation to an extreme range of ecological conditions, even gravely toxic ones. Especially the nearly 60,000 fly species cover about all the globe. Many can fly, which helps getting everywhere, but they also occur on/in soil, water, host plants or animals, cavities etcetera. The... Read all

title: Hunters and Hunted
desc: The struggle of life is often based on 'eat (and/)or be eaten'. Therefore evolutionary success is largely defined in terms of skills to survive as prey and/or hunter. Mammals are particularly successful worldwide because the add to anatomical adaptation an intelligence allowing quick and greatly diverse strategies to find preys, shelter, fight (back) etcetera.

title: Creatures of the Deep
desc: Marine invertebrates, the descendants of one billion years of evolutionary history, are the most abundant creatures in the ocean. In the Sea of Cortez, packs of Humboldt squid make night-time raids from the deep to co-operatively hunt sardines. Beneath the permanent Antarctic sea ice of McMurdo Sound, sea urchins, red sea stars and nemertean worms are filmed scavengin... Read all

title: Plants
desc: Flora has evolved to live in extreme conditions and a wide variety of locations and seen as the eldest 'creatures' on the planet. Their struggle for life, like animals (only usually much slower), is about food (including parasitism and 'flesh-eating'). They strive to find water, to procreate: notably pollination-mostly by animals and semination - gliding or by weather... Read all

title: Primates
desc: Primates include apes, monkeys and even more primitive simians, such as lemurs. Thanks to their intelligence, the higher primates take adaptation beyond anatomical evolution: their behavior transcends instinct thanks to learning and invention. Their social life especially holds the seeds of human culture, such as tribal warfare. They occur in widely different environm... Read all

title: Episode I
desc: Flashbacks chronicle Michael Jordan's college and early NBA days. The Bulls make a preseason trip to Paris amid tensions with GM Jerry Krause.

title: Episode II
desc: Scottie Pippen rises from obscurity to become one of the NBA's best players. An injury early in Michael's career sows distrust with Bulls management.

title: Episode III
desc: Dennis Rodman's attitude and energy help the team win, but bring the drama off the court. The Bulls struggle to overcome the Pistons in the late '80s.

title: Episode IV
desc: Phil Jackson's unique philosophy and demeanor take the Bulls to the next level. The team finally gets past Detroit and earns a shot at an NBA title.

title: Episode V
desc: From Air Jordan and "Be Like Mike" to the '92 NBA Finals and the Olympic Dream Team, Michael becomes a global cultural icon unlike any other.

title: Episode VI
desc: A revealing book and scrutiny of his gambling put a dent in Michael's reputation, but he remains focused on winning a third straight title in 1993.

title: Episode VII
desc: Crushed by the death of his father, a mentally exhausted Michael retires in 1993 - to play baseball. The Bulls move on with Scottie in the lead role.

title: Episode VIII
desc: Michael's return energizes the Bulls, the city and the NBA, but a playoff loss in 1995 fuels him to work harder than ever to get back on top.

title: Episode IX
desc: The Bulls face stiff challenges to their reign in 1997 against Utah and in 1998 versus Indiana. Role player Steve Kerr makes his mark on the dynasty.

title: Episode X
desc: Battered and exhausted, the Bulls conclude their "Last Dance" with a sixth championship. Michael, Phil and others reflect on the end of the dynasty.

title: A New Germany: 1933-1939
desc: Program chronicles the draconian measures taken by Adolf Hitler to become absolute dictator of Germany and begin his domination of Europe.

title: Distant War: September 1939-May 1940
desc: France and Great Britain enter World War 2 following Germany's invasion of Poland. But with the exception of its navy Britain is rather uncertain how to prepare. After a failed operation in Norway lead by Churchill, Chamberlain is, ironically, replaced as Prime Minister by Churchill.

title: France Falls: May-June 1940
desc: As their forces invade Northern Europe German strategists capitalize time and again on French preconceptions confounding French defenses.

title: Alone: May 1940-May 1941
desc: In the end of May 1940, when the last French cities are captured by the Germans, half a million British and French soldiers retreat to the last channel port still open to them: Dunkerque. The following days Great Britain carries out the biggest evacuation in history. 330.000 French and British soldiers are picked up by boats and brought over the channel to England. Ge... Read all

title: Barbarossa: June-December 1941
desc: Following the conquest of France Hitler, almost casually by blitzkrieg standards, turn his eyes toward Russia. But Stalin is equally lackadaisical in preparing defenses against Germany. The German invasion rapidly reaches the gates of Moscow where it is stopped cold by the onset of winter then crushed by the Russian counterattack.

title: Banzai! Japan 1931-1942
desc: Following Japan's conquest of eastern Asia the Allies finally respond with sanctions. They prove so threatening to Japan that it prepares to conquer Southeast Asia to secure the resources it needs. But first the threat from the British and American Pacific fleets must be eliminated.

title: On Our Way: U.S.A. 1939-1942
desc: Although those in the know figured it was just a matter of time, the United States only reluctantly participated in World War 2. But it was not a foregone conclusion that the United States would side against both Germany and Japan. Japan's attack on Pearl Harbor precipitated a quick decision. But in Germany's case a long series of mutual provocations, some intended, s... Read all

title: The Desert: North Africa - 1940-1943
desc: In 1940 Mussolini deploys a massive army to invade British held Egypt, to capture the Suez Canal and most of all to establish an Italian empire to rival Germany's. So begins a multi-year campaign over a meaningless stretch of desert involving forces from a dozen nations and characterized by persistent attackers, stubborn defenders and ultimately controlled by supply l... Read all

title: Stalingrad: June 1942-February 1943
desc: Germany is dealt a crushing defeat when the Russians' stubborn defense of Stalingrad delays the German offensive giving the Russians time to mass their forces for a counter attack that surrounds then destroys the German Sixth Army and its supporting forces.

title: Wolf Pack: U-Boats in the Atlantic - 1939-1944
desc: For three years German u-boats ravage transatlantic convoys. Despite the critical need for the supplies and materiel British leadership give scant attention to the matter for two years. Finally in 1943 the allies begin introducing new tactics and weapons while Germany continues to focus on the numbers game.

title: Red Star: The Soviet Union - 1941-1943
desc: Bent on fulfilling Hilter's policy of colonizing Russia, German forces invade subjecting inhabitants of occupied lands to servitude or death. Russians respond with a mass evacuation and scorched earth policy, reestablishing their industrial capacity far to the east. After German forces fail to break Lenigrade or to capture Kursk and the surrounding Russian forces Russ... Read all

title: Whirlwind: Bombing Germany - September 1939-April 1944
desc: While the British continue to rely on night bombing the American forces attempt to use more dangerous but more precise daylight bombing to interdict German military production and crush the national will.

title: Tough Old Gut: Italy - November 1942-June 1944
desc: After driving the Germans from North Africa the Allies turn their sites on Italy. But the Italian campaign turned out to be tougher the anyone expected. American reluctance to divert resources from the planned Normandy invasion, geographic challenges and German reinforcements hinders the Allied campaign which continued until the eve of the Normandy invasion.

title: It's a Lovely Day Tomorrow: Burma - 1942-1944
desc: Allied forces were totally unprepared for the Japanese invasion of Burma in 1942. The Japanese quickly overran the country. The Allies counter-attacked using troops unfamiliar with jungle warfare which were unsuccessful against the Japanese guerrilla forces. But the Allies persisted and gradually adapted to the jungle environment. As additional forces arrived the Alli... Read all

title: Home Fires: Britain - 1940-1944
desc: The war effort required total commitment from British citizens stretching their bodies and spirits to the breaking point and occasionally beyond it. As a result of grim news early in the war, German bombing of British cities and disagreements on critical policies Churchill faced a no confidence vote. But extraordinary measures gradually put the kingdom on an effective... Read all

title: Inside the Reich: Germany - 1940-1944
desc: Germany is jubilant after the surrender of France. Then the unsuccessful expansion of the war to include Russia and England gradually turns German morale from joy to fatalism. Even der Führer falls victim to the insidious fatalism caused first by the crushing defeat at Stalingrad then the bunker bombing that nearly killed him. All the while the tightening Nazi grip an... Read all

title: Morning: June-August 1944
desc: Four years after France fell the Allies invade Normandy. Caught by surprise the German defenses are quickly overcome. Heading inland the Allies win major victories against fierce resistance.

title: Occupation: Holland - 1940-1944
desc: The Dutch are shocked when the Germans bomb Rotterdam and invade their neutral country. But Germany follows with insidious conciliatory gestures that ease tensions. Germany gradually exploits the populace with conscriptions, forced labor and deportation of Jewish citizens. Finally anticipating liberation as the Allies move westward, Dutch suffering intensifies. As the... Read all

title: Pincers: August 1944-March 1945
desc: As the Allies debate how to prosecute the the invasion of Germany, Hitler settles the question with a massive counter attack in the Ardenne. Failure of the attack leaves German defenses of the Western Front in shambles. Meanwhile, Russian forces are also closing in but Stalin orders a pause so the SS can crush the Polish resistance.

title: Genocide: 1941-1945
desc: The history of the Nazi persecution of the Jews, showing events leading to the "Final Solution". Footage and Interviews with SS officers and Jewish survivors from various countries describe how the extermination camps operated and what existence was like there.

title: Nemesis: Germany - February-May 1945
desc: The closing weeks of the European war bring retribution for Germany in the form of carpet bombing cities like Dresden, the collapse of the Whermacht, atrocities by Soviet forces, and finally the fall of Berlin and suicide of Hitler.

title: Japan: 1941-1945
desc: After the victories in 1941-2, Japanese fortunes reverse as America succeeds in destroying their aircraft fleet and Pacific island bases. At home, shortages of goods and manpower lead to desperation for the population.

title: Pacific: February 1942-July 1945
desc: The island hopping strategy of Admiral Nimitz and General MacArthur leads from one costly, battle after another. The Japanese fight fanatically as the war gets ever closer to home, but Americans finally use their newest weapon, the A-bomb.

title: The Bomb: February-September 1945
desc: Following the events from the death of US President Roosevelt through to the dropping of the two bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki that prompted Japan's surrender.

title: Reckoning: 1945... and After
desc: As wretched survivours suffer deprivations amongst the ruins, half of Germany and eastern Europe trade one socialist tyranny for another as the Soviets take power. Japan is occupied by the U. S., but the colonial empires disintegrate.

title: Remember
desc: For many the Second World War was the most significant experience of their lives. These are heartbreaking first hand remembrances from a vast array of survivors from both sides of the war.

title: Pilot
desc: A strangely eccentric genius scientist and inventor moves into the home of his daughter and her family and begins to strongly influence his young grandson.

title: Lawnmower Dog
desc: Rick helps Jerry out with the dog.

title: Anatomy Park
desc: It's Christmas. Rick shrinks Morty, injecting him into a homeless man to save Anatomy Park. Jerry tries to have a Christmas free of electronic devices, but regrets his decision when his parents introduce him to their new friend.

title: M. Night Shaym-Aliens!
desc: Rick and Morty try to get to the bottom of a mystery.

title: Meeseeks and Destroy
desc: Rick provides the family with a solution to their problems, freeing him up to go on an adventure led by Morty.

title: Rick Potion #9
desc: After Rick gives Morty a love potion for a school dance, things quickly spiral out of control when the serum splices with the flu - causing it to spread. Rick and Morty scramble to cure the crisis, making matters worse in the process.

title: Raising Gazorpazorp
desc: Morty becomes a father to an alien baby, while Rick and Summer get trapped in a dangerous dimension.

title: Rixty Minutes
desc: Rick hooks up the family's TV with interdimensional cable, allowing them to watch infinite TV from across the multiverse.

title: Something Ricked This Way Comes
desc: Summer gets a job at a pawn shop owned by the devil. Jerry helps Morty with his science fair project.

title: Close Rick-counters of the Rick Kind
desc: Rick, falsely blamed for Murder by the council of Ricks, begins a cross-dimensional pursuit with the authorities while attempting to prove his innocence.

title: Ricksy Business
desc: Beth and Jerry head for an iceberg of a date leaving Rick in charge. Morty doesn't get to go on any more adventures if the house isn't in the same condition when they get back.

title: A Rickle in Time
desc: Having restarted time, Rick, Morty and Summer are in a quantum-uncertain state of existence. An argument leads to the creation of two alternate timelines, which need to be stitched back together fast if they are to escape quantum collapse.

title: Mortynight Run
desc: Rick and Morty try to save a gas life form while Jerry resides in a daycare made for Jerrys.

title: Auto Erotic Assimilation
desc: Rick gets emotional. Beth and Jerry get into a fight.

title: Total Rickall
desc: The Smith house is locked down after parasites threaten to take over the world by multiplying through flashbacks.

title: Get Schwifty
desc: Rick and morty must aid Earth after a giant head disrupts the planet, demanding to see a hit song performed.

title: The Ricks Must Be Crazy
desc: Rick is having trouble with his car and they have to fix it by traveling to the microverse.

title: Big Trouble in Little Sanchez
desc: Rick joins in on some hijinks by transferring his consciousness into teenage "Tiny Rick." Beth and Jerry sort out their relationship.

title: Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate
desc: Jerry is faced with the difficult decision of losing his manhood in order to save an alien leader from imminent death. Meanwhile, Rick, Morty and Summer explore the possibilities of interdimensional television.

title: Look Who's Purging Now
desc: Rick and Morty arrive on an alien planet to fix their ship just as the day of the purge begins there, Jerry and Summer work on their father-daughter relationship, but his lack of employment keeps coming up.

title: The Wedding Squanchers
desc: The Smith family is invited to the wedding of Rick's best friend, Birdperson. Things go south when it's discovered that the bride isn't who she says she is.

title: The Rickshank Rickdemption
desc: Rick, still in galactic prison, puts an intricate escape plan into action. Back on Earth, which is now under federation control, Morty and Summer have an argument about their grandpa.

title: Rickmancing the Stone
desc: With the kids dealing with their parents' divorce, Rick takes them to a Mad Max-style universe where he tries to steal a green crystal from a group of scavengers.

title: Pickle Rick
desc: Rick turns himself into a pickle while Beth, Summer, and Morty go to family therapy.

title: Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender
desc: Rick and Morty are summoned by the Vindicators to stop Worldender but end up in a deathtrap conceived by Drunk Rick.

title: The Whirly Dirly Conspiracy
desc: Rick takes Jerry on a sympathy adventure to a resort where everyone is immortal when there, and Jerry meets some old acquaintances of Rick's who want payback.

title: Rest and Ricklaxation
desc: Following a stressful adventure, Rick and Morty go on a break to a spa where they remove their toxins, which in turn take a form of their own.

title: The Ricklantis Mixup
desc: Whilst Rick and Morty go off to adventure in Atlantis, we take a look at how the Citadel has rebuilt itself since both Rick and Morty visited.

title: Morty's Mind Blowers
desc: Rick reveals to Morty his "Morty's mind blowers," a collection of memories Morty asked Rick to erase from his mind.

title: The ABCs of Beth
desc: Rick brings Beth to a world he created for her when she was younger while Beth looks for a long-lost childhood friend trapped there for years.

title: The Rickchurian Mortydate
desc: Rick and Morty are called upon by the president to kill a vicious alien in the secret tunnels under the White House.

title: Edge of Tomorty: Rick Die Rickpeat
desc: Rick brings Morty to a planet containing crystals that show whoever is touching them all the ways they may die depending on their choices.

title: The Old Man and the Seat
desc: Rick goes to his private bathroom to find that someone else has used it. Jerry creates an app with an unlikely alien and Morty pays the price.

title: One Crew over the Crewcoo's Morty
desc: On a treasure-seeking expedition in an alien temple, Rick and Morty discover that a heist expert has snatched the prize from under their noses. Further twists, turns and double-crosses abound.

title: Claw and Hoarder: Special Ricktim's Morty
desc: Morty asks Rick for a dragon and Rick finds a wizard of another dimension who makes a soul bonding contract between Morty and a dragon called Balthromaw. Meanwhile, Jerry meets a talking cat in his bedroom who wants to fly to Florida.

title: Rattlestar Ricklactica
desc: Morty discovers a race of intelligent space snakes after suffering a potentially lethal bite. Jerry attempts to prove that he isn't completely incompetent.

title: Never Ricking Morty
desc: An anthology episode that follows Rick and Morty on a train with people who don't like Rick. They have to find their way out but they bump into unexpected situations along the way.

title: Promortyus
desc: Rick, Morty and Summer visit an alien civilisation, where Rick and Morty are controlled by parasites and Summer lives a luxurious lifestyle.

title: The Vat of Acid Episode
desc: Rick & Morty go on a simple exchange as Rick tells Morty if something goes wrong jump into the same vat of acid as he does.

title: Childrick of Mort
desc: Rick, Morty, Beth, Summer and Jerry share a galactic adventure.

title: Star Mort Rickturn of the Jerri
desc: An adventure with an invisibility belt, but a family that disappears together, must stay together.

title: Mort Dinner Rick Andre
desc: Rick hosts dinner for his ocean dwelling nemesis, while Morty gets the wine.

title: Mortyplicity
desc: The Smiths suspect they're being hunted. But who's even real?

title: A Rickconvenient Mort
desc: Morty falls in love with an ecological heroine named Planetina, and quickly has trouble with the people that created her. Rick and Summer visit planets that are about to stop existing to have crazy parties and forget their problems.

title: Rickdependence Spray
desc: Morty has the idea to use a horse breeding mount to extract his semen, but after Rick tries to use it to create a weapon, thinking it was horse sperm, he ends up creating sperm monsters that threaten the entire country.

title: Amortycan Grickfitti
desc: Summer and Morty steal Rick's car to impress a new kid at school. Meanwhile, Rick and Jerry have a guys' night from hell.

title: Rick & Morty's Thanksploitation Spectacular
desc: In this Thanksgiving episode, Rick and Morty need to get a presidential pardon.

title: Gotron Jerrysis Rickvangelion
desc: Summer enables Rick's addiction to collecting giant combining robots, and the family becomes The Family.

title: Rickternal Friendshine of the Spotless Mort
desc: Rick attempts to save a beloved friend.

title: Forgetting Sarick Mortshall
desc: Rick gets new sidekicks, while Morty makes a new friend.

title: Rickmurai Jack
desc: Rick is living his best anime life. Meanwhile in the Citadel of Ricks, a long game played by one particular Morty is reaching its conclusion.

title: Episode #6.1
desc: Plot kept under wraps.

title: Winter Is Coming
desc: Eddard Stark is torn between his family and an old friend when asked to serve at the side of King Robert Baratheon; Viserys plans to wed his sister to a nomadic warlord in exchange for an army.

title: The Kingsroad
desc: While Bran recovers from his fall, Ned takes only his daughters to King's Landing. Jon Snow goes with his uncle Benjen to the Wall. Tyrion joins them.

title: Lord Snow
desc: Jon begins his training with the Night's Watch; Ned confronts his past and future at King's Landing; Daenerys finds herself at odds with Viserys.

title: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
desc: Eddard investigates Jon Arryn's murder. Jon befriends Samwell Tarly, a coward who has come to join the Night's Watch.

title: The Wolf and the Lion
desc: Catelyn has captured Tyrion and plans to bring him to her sister, Lysa Arryn, at the Vale, to be tried for his, supposed, crimes against Bran. Robert plans to have Daenerys killed, but Eddard refuses to be a part of it and quits.

title: A Golden Crown
desc: While recovering from his battle with Jaime, Eddard is forced to run the kingdom while Robert goes hunting. Tyrion demands a trial by combat for his freedom. Viserys is losing his patience with Drogo.

title: You Win or You Die
desc: Robert has been injured while hunting and is dying. Jon and the others finally take their vows to the Night's Watch. A man, sent by Robert, is captured for trying to poison Daenerys. Furious, Drogo vows to attack the Seven Kingdoms.

title: The Pointy End
desc: The Lannisters press their advantage over the Starks; Robb rallies his father's northern allies and heads south to war; The White Walkers attack the Wall; Tyrion returns to his father with some new friends.

title: Baelor
desc: Robb goes to war against the Lannisters. Jon finds himself struggling on deciding if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Drogo has fallen ill from a fresh battle wound. Daenerys is desperate to save him.

title: Fire and Blood
desc: Robb vows to get revenge on the Lannisters. Jon must officially decide if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Daenerys says her final goodbye to Drogo.

title: The North Remembers
desc: Tyrion arrives at King's Landing to take his father's place as Hand of the King. Stannis Baratheon plans to take the Iron Throne for his own. Robb tries to decide his next move in the war. The Night's Watch arrive at the house of Craster.

title: The Night Lands
desc: Arya makes friends with Gendry. Tyrion tries to take control of the Small Council. Theon arrives at his home, Pyke, in order to persuade his father into helping Robb with the war. Jon tries to investigate Craster's secret.

title: What Is Dead May Never Die
desc: Tyrion tries to see who he can trust in the Small Council. Catelyn visits Renly to try and persuade him to join Robb in the war. Theon must decide if his loyalties lie with his own family or with Robb.

title: Garden of Bones
desc: Lord Baelish arrives at Renly's camp just before he faces off against Stannis. Daenerys and her company are welcomed into the city of Qarth. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie find themselves imprisoned at Harrenhal.

title: The Ghost of Harrenhal
desc: Tyrion investigates a secret weapon that King Joffrey plans to use against Stannis. Meanwhile, as a token for saving his life, Jaqen H'ghar offers to kill three people that Arya chooses.

title: The Old Gods and the New
desc: Theon seizes control of Winterfell. Jon captures a wildling, named Ygritte. The people of King's Landing begin to turn against King Joffrey. Daenerys looks to buy ships to sail for the Seven Kingdoms.

title: A Man Without Honor
desc: Bran and Rickon have escaped Winterfell. Theon tries to hunt them down. Daenerys' dragons have been stolen. Jon travels through the wilderness with Ygritte as his prisoner. Sansa has bled and is now ready to have Joffrey's children.

title: The Prince of Winterfell
desc: Stannis is just days from King's Landing. Tyrion prepares for his arrival. Jon and Qhorin are taken prisoner by the wildlings. Catelyn is arrested for releasing Jaime. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie plan to escape from Harrenhal.

title: Blackwater
desc: Stannis Baratheon's fleet and army arrive at King's Landing and the battle for the city begins. Cersei plans for her and her children's future.

title: Valar Morghulis
desc: Joffrey puts Sansa aside for Margaery Tyrell. Robb marries Talisa Maegyr. Jon prepares to meet Mance Rayder. Arya says farewell to Jaqen H'ghar. Daenerys tries to rescue her dragons.

title: Valar Dohaeris
desc: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, while the Night's Watch survivors retreat south. In King's Landing, Tyrion asks for his reward. Littlefinger offers Sansa a way out.

title: Dark Wings, Dark Words
desc: Bran and company meet Jojen and Meera Reed. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie meet the Brotherhood. Jaime travels through the wilderness with Brienne. Sansa confesses her true feelings about Joffery to Margaery.

title: Walk of Punishment
desc: Robb and Catelyn arrive at Riverrun for Lord Hoster Tully's funeral. Tywin names Tyrion the new Master of Coin. Arya says goodbye to Hot Pie. The Night's Watch returns to Craster's. Brienne and Jaime are taken prisoner.

title: And Now His Watch Is Ended
desc: Jaime mopes over his lost hand. Cersei is growing uncomfortable with the Tyrells. The Night's Watch is growing impatient with Craster. Daenerys buys the Unsullied.

title: Kissed by Fire
desc: Robb's army is falling apart. Jaime reveals a story, to Brienne, that he has never told anyone. Jon breaks his vows. The Hound is granted his freedom. The Lannisters hatch a new plan.

title: The Climb
desc: Jon and the wildlings scale the Wall. The Brotherhood sells Gendry to Melisandre. Robb does what he can to win back the Freys. Tyrion tells Sansa about their engagement.

title: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
desc: Jon and the wildlings travel south of the Wall. Talisa tells Robb that she's pregnant. Arya runs away from the Brotherhood. Daenerys arrives at Yunkai. Jaime leaves Brienne behind at Harrenhal.

title: Second Sons
desc: Daenerys tries to persuade the Second Sons to join her against Yunkai. Stannis releases Davos from the dungeons. Sam and Gilly are attacked by a White Walker. Sansa and Tyrion wed.

title: The Rains of Castamere
desc: Robb and Catelyn arrive at the Twins for the wedding. Jon is put to the test to see where his loyalties truly lie. Bran's group decides to split up. Daenerys plans an invasion of Yunkai.

title: Mhysa
desc: Bran and company travel beyond the Wall. Sam returns to Castle Black. Jon says goodbye to Ygritte. Jaime returns to King's Landing. The Night's Watch asks for help from Stannis.

title: Two Swords
desc: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King's Landing. At Castle Black, Jon stands trial. Daenerys is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old enemy.

title: The Lion and the Rose
desc: Joffrey and Margaery's wedding has come. Tyrion breaks up with Shae. Ramsay tries to prove his worth to his father. Bran and company find a Weirwood tree.

title: Breaker of Chains
desc: Tyrion is arrested for the murder of Joffrey and awaits trial. Sansa escapes King's Landing. Sam sends Gilly to Mole's Town as the Night's Watch finds itself in a tight spot. Meereen challenges Daenerys.

title: Oathkeeper
desc: Jaime entrusts a task to Brienne. Daenerys frees Meereen. Jon is given permission to lead a group of Night's Watchmen to Craster's Keep. Bran and company are taken hostage.

title: First of His Name
desc: Tommen is crowned King of the Seven Kingdoms. Cersei builds her case against Tyrion. Sansa and Lord Baelish arrive at the Eyrie. The Night's Watch attacks Craster's Keep.

title: The Laws of Gods and Men
desc: Tyrion's trial has come. Yara and her troops storm the Dreadfort to free Theon. Daenerys meets Hizdar zo Loraq. Stannis makes a deal with the Iron Bank of Braavos.

title: Mockingbird
desc: Tyrion tries to find a champion. Daenerys sleeps with Daario. The Hound becomes wounded. Jon's advice is ignored at Castle Black. Brienne and Podrick receive a tip on Arya's whereabouts.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
desc: Theon helps Ramsay seize Moat Cailin. The wildlings attack Mole's Town. Sansa comes up with a story to protect Lord Baelish. Daenerys finds out a secret about Jorah Mormont. Oberyn Martell faces Gregor Clegane, the Mountain.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
desc: The battle between the Night's Watch and the wildlings has come.

title: The Children
desc: Jon makes an important decision. Daenerys experiences new consequences. Brienne and Podrick have an unexpected encounter. Bran achieves a goal, while Tyrion makes an important discovery.

title: The Wars to Come
desc: Cersei and Jaime adjust to a world without Tywin. Tyrion and Varys arrive at Pentos. In Meereen, a new enemy emerges. Jon is caught between two kings.

title: The House of Black and White
desc: Arya arrives in Braavos. Jaime takes on a secret mission. Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death. Stannis makes Jon a generous offer as the Night's Watch elects a new Lord Commander. Daenerys is faced with a difficult decision.

title: High Sparrow
desc: Tommen and Margaery wed. Arya has trouble adapting to her new life. Littlefinger reveals his plans to Sansa. Jon gives his first orders as Lord Commander. Tyrion and Varys arrive in Volantis.

title: Sons of the Harpy
desc: Jorah Mormont sets sail alongside his prisoner, Tyrion. Cersei makes a move against the Tyrells. Jaime and Bronn sneak into Dorne. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their plans. Melisandre tempts Jon. The Harpies attack.

title: Kill the Boy
desc: Daenerys arrests the heads of Meereen's great families. Jon makes a difficult decision. Theon is forced to face Sansa. Stannis rides south. Tyrion and Jorah enter the ruins of Old Valyria.

title: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
desc: Arya is put to the test. Tyrion and Jorah are captured by slavers. Loras Tyrell is judged by the Sparrows. Jaime and Bronn face the Sand Snakes. Sansa marries Ramsay Bolton.

title: The Gift
desc: Jon heads east as trouble begins to stir for Sam and Gilly at Castle Black. Sansa asks Theon for help. Tyrion and Jorah are sold as slaves. Cersei savors her triumph over the Tyrells as new plots are developed in the shadows.

title: Hardhome
desc: Tyrion advises Daenerys. Sansa forces Theon to tell her a secret. Cersei remains stubborn. Arya meets her first target. Jon and Tormund meet with the wildling elders.

title: The Dance of Dragons
desc: Jon and the wildlings return to Castle Black. Jaime meets with Doran Martell. Stannis makes a hard choice. Arya runs into Meryn Trant. Daenerys attends the grand reopening of the fighting pits.

title: Mother's Mercy
desc: Stannis arrives at Winterfell. Tyrion runs Meereen as Daario and Jorah go after Daenerys. Jaime and Myrcella leave Dorne. Jon sends Sam and Gilly to Oldtown. Arya challenges the Many-Faced God. Cersei confesses her sins.

title: The Red Woman
desc: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Daenerys is brought before Khal Moro. Tyrion gets used to living in Meereen. Ramsay sends his dogs after Theon and Sansa. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their move. Cersei mourns for Myrcella.

title: Home
desc: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. Tommen meets with Cersei. Tyrion makes a bold move. Theon leaves while at Pyke new issues arise. Ramsay's brother is born. Davos asks Melisandre for a miracle.

title: Oathbreaker
desc: Daenerys arrives at Vaes Dothrak. Sam and Gilly sail for Horn Hill. Arya trains as No One. Varys finds information on the Sons of the Harpy. Ramsay receives a gift. Tommen meets with the High Sparrow. At Castle Black, a miracle occurs.

title: Book of the Stranger
desc: Sansa arrives at Castle Black. Tyrion makes a deal with the slave masters. Jorah and Daario sneak into Vaes Dothrak. Ramsay sends a letter to Jon. Theon arrives at Pyke. Cersei and Olenna Tyrell plot against the High Sparrow.

title: The Door
desc: Sansa and Jon make plans. Arya is given another chance to prove herself. Jorah confesses a secret to Daenerys. Tyrion meets with a red priestess. Yara finds her rule tested. Bran discovers the origin of the White Walkers.

title: Blood of My Blood
desc: Bran and Meera find a new ally. Gilly meets Sam's family. Arya makes a difficult choice. The Lannisters and Tyrells march against the High Sparrow.

title: The Broken Man
desc: Jon and Sansa gather troops. Jaime arrives at Riverrun. Olenna Tyrell plans to leave King's Landing. Theon and Yara plan a destination. Arya makes plans to leave.

title: No One
desc: Brienne arrives at Riverrun. Arya seeks shelter. Jaime meets with Edmure Tully. Cersei challenges the Faith. Sandor Clegane hunts for revenge. Tyrion faces the consequences of earlier decisions.

title: Battle of the Bastards
desc: Jon and Sansa face Ramsay Bolton on the fields of Winterfell. Daenerys strikes back at her enemies. Theon and Yara arrive in Meereen.

title: The Winds of Winter
desc: Cersei and Loras Tyrell stand trial by the gods. Daenerys prepares to set sail for Westeros. Davos confronts Melisandre. Sam and Gilly arrive in the Citadel. Bran discovers a long-kept secret. Lord Frey has an uninvited guest.

title: Dragonstone
desc: Jon organizes the North's defenses. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home. Arya reminds the Freys "the North remembers." Sam adapts to life in Oldtown. The Night King makes his way south.

title: Stormborn
desc: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces resistance. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros. Cersei gathers her allies. Arya has a reunion with old friends. Sam risks his career and life.

title: The Queen's Justice
desc: Jon and Daenerys finally meet. Cersei gains a new ally. Sansa receives an unexpected visitor. Sam is confronted for his actions.

title: The Spoils of War
desc: Daenerys takes matters into her own hands. Arya reaches her destination. Jaime and Bronn collect the spoils from the war with the Tyrells.

title: Eastwatch
desc: Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way.

title: Beyond the Wall
desc: Jon and his team go beyond the wall to capture a wight. Daenerys has to make a tough decision.

title: The Dragon and the Wolf
desc: Everyone meets in King's Landing to discuss the fate of the realm. In Winterfell, Sansa confronts Arya. Sam reaches Winterfell, where he and Bran discover a shocking secret about Jon Snow.

title: Winterfell
desc: Jon and Daenerys arrive in Winterfell and are met with skepticism. Sam learns about the fate of his family. Cersei gives Euron the reward he aims for. Theon follows his heart.

title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
desc: Jaime faces judgment and Winterfell prepares for the battle to come.

title: The Long Night
desc: The Night King and his army have arrived at Winterfell and the great battle begins.

title: The Last of the Starks
desc: The Battle of Winterfell is over and a new chapter for Westeros begins.

title: The Bells
desc: Forces have arrived at King's Landing for the final battle.

title: The Iron Throne
desc: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors.

title: Pilot
desc: A mobster passes out at a family barbecue and seeks therapy to understand why.

title: 46 Long
desc: Tony is getting fed up with his mother. Brendan Filone acts against Tony's wishes. Salvatore and Paulie try to track down A.J.'s teacher's stolen car.

title: Denial, Anger, Acceptance
desc: Tony encourages an unwanted son-in-law to divorce, Carmela learns another secret of Tony's, Meadow experiments with speed to study for the SATs, and Chris and Brendan find out the price of disrespecting Junior.

title: Meadowlands
desc: Jackie's death leaves a power vacuum, Brendan's death leaves Chris fearing for his life, and Anthony's discovery of what his father really does leaves him confused.

title: College
desc: While visiting colleges with Meadow, Tony spots a snitch. Carmela, meanwhile, discovers something about Dr. Melfi.

title: Pax Soprana
desc: Tony tries to balance Junior against the other capos, while Carmela reasserts herself as the woman in Tony's life.

title: Down Neck
desc: Anthony has disciplinary problems at school, prompting Tony to recount memories of his childhood with Dr. Melfi.

title: The Legend of Tennessee Moltisanti
desc: The FBI begins closing in on the DiMeo family. Tony and Carmela are angry over all the attention Italians get from the authorities, while Chris fumes that he's not getting enough attention.

title: Boca
desc: The capos discuss what to do about the local soccer coach, while Junior's mouth causes him some embarrassment.

title: A Hit Is a Hit
desc: Tony tries to branch out into legitimate investments, while Chris and Adriana decide to try their hands at music production.

title: Nobody Knows Anything
desc: Following the arrest of two of his men, Tony suspects a traitor. Efforts to discover who, however, are stymied.

title: Isabella
desc: The stress Tony is going through begins to take its toll, and the hit Junior has ordered doesn't help.

title: I Dream of Jeannie Cusamano
desc: Tony starts cleaning house, while Artie feels torn between keeping the peace in his household, and getting even with Tony for destroying his restaurant.

title: Guy Walks Into a Psychiatrist's Office
desc: Pussy returns after months in hiding, Chris starts a boiler room stock operation, and Tony's long-lost sister shows up on the doorstep.

title: Do Not Resuscitate
desc: Junior leaves prison due to ill health and placed under house arrest, while Livia's health also declines. Pussy begins talking with someone interested in learning more about Tony.

title: Toodle-Fucking-Oo
desc: Richie Aprile gets out after ten years in prison and starts reasserting his authority while unaware of the changes made in the crime family's archetype. Meadow gets in trouble after a party gets out of hand.

title: Commendatori
desc: Tony, Paulie and Chris travel to Naples to conduct a business deal, while Pussy becomes more stressed over trying to balance his secret lives.

title: Big Girls Don't Cry
desc: Paulie and Silvio get promoted, Furio gets welcomed, Pussy gets pushed aside, and Chris gets frustrated with his Hollywood aspirations.

title: The Happy Wanderer
desc: Tony's old school friend digs himself into trouble with his gambling, while Tony's family problems only continue to grow.

title: D-Girl
desc: Anthony continues to cause problems at home, while Pussy's divided loyalties cause him greater anguish.

title: Full Leather Jacket
desc: Rebellion by some of the lower soldiers ends in bloodshed, while Carmela starts intimidating her neighbors to help Meadow's chances at Georgetown.

title: From Where to Eternity
desc: Chris awakens from his coma with a message for Tony and Paulie. Carmela, meanwhile, wants Tony to take a cut.

title: Bust-Out
desc: Tony continues putting the squeeze on David, while Richie discusses the possibility with Junior of removing some competition while 'Big Pussy' Bonpensiero continues to be an informant.

title: House Arrest
desc: Junior feels the restrictions of his house arrest acutely, while Tony starts putting in hours at his actual job to allay FBI suspicions, while Junior and Richie uses the garbage pick up routes for a double purpose.

title: The Knight in White Satin Armor
desc: Richie and Janice get engaged, but Richie's violent temper finally takes him too far. Tony, meanwhile, breaks up with Irina, much to her dismay.

title: Funhouse
desc: Tony gets sick from food poisoning and blames Artie's restaurant. Pussy, meanwhile, reaches the end of the line.

title: Mr. Ruggerio's Neighborhood
desc: The FBI has trouble finding a new informant, so they attempt to bug the Soprano home. Meanwhile, Anthony continues to get into trouble at school.

title: Proshai, Livushka
desc: An unexpected death brings the whole family together one more time, and old tensions resurface while at the funeral.

title: Fortunate Son
desc: Chris becomes a made man, while Tony experiences another panic attack. Meadow continues to seethe over Tony's treatment of her boyfriend.

title: Employee of the Month
desc: Dr. Melfi is brutally attacked, and when the justice system lets her down, she must consider asking Tony for help.

title: Another Toothpick
desc: Tony and Carmela try a therapy session together, which ends in an angry dispute. Artie, meanwhile, tries to move in on Adriana.

title: University
desc: Noah and Meadow's relationship is disrupted by her roommate, while Ralphie starts getting rough with one of the strippers from the Bada Bing causing Tony to intervene and questionably violating one of the mafia codes of conduct.

title: Second Opinion
desc: Junior continues his cancer treatments, but the prognosis is iffy. Chris, meanwhile, finds himself under suspicion from Paulie.

title: He Is Risen
desc: Tensions rise between Tony and Ralphie until circumstances demand that they resolve their differences. Meadow gets involved with Jackie's son, and ends up in trouble.

title: The Telltale Moozadell
desc: Tony continues seeing Gloria, another of Dr. Melfi's patients, while Meadow continues seeing Jackie Jr.

title: To Save Us All from Satan's Power
desc: Tony starts having flashbacks about Pussy's betrayal, and then later discovers that Jackie Jr. has been failing in his responsibilities.

title: Pine Barrens
desc: While Silvio has the flu, Chris and Paulie run his collections for him, which results in the pair getting lost in the woods and nearly freezing to death while Tony's affair with Gloria goes sour as does Meadow's relationship with Jackie Jr.

title: Amour Fou
desc: Gloria grows increasingly demanding until Tony realizes who she is, and Jackie Jr. ends up in very serious trouble when Chris realizes who he is.

title: Army of One
desc: Ralphie issues his final decision on the fate of Jackie Jr., Anthony Jr., faces military school after getting expelled, Paulie and Ralphie have a financial conflict while the FBI assigns Adriana a new "friend."

title: For All Debts Public and Private
desc: Chris puts a ghost from his past to rest, while Carmela grows uneasy about her future.

title: No Show
desc: Chris' success earns him some jealousy, Adriana learns the truth about her friend, and Meadow still claims that Jackie Jr.'s death still weighs heavily on her.

title: Christopher
desc: Columbus Day ignites tensions between Italians and Native Americans, and Bobby receives devastating news about his wife.

title: The Weight
desc: A joke sparks a series of hit contracts, while Carmela finds herself happier than perhaps she should be that Furio will be around for good.

title: Pie-o-My
desc: Ralph buys a racehorse, but Tony ends up more attached to it than Ralphie is. Carmela starts trying to invest in her future.

title: Everybody Hurts
desc: Tony feels depressed over the negative impact he has on people who don't deserve it, while Carmela tries to set up Furio with a friend, AJ is uncomfortable with his girlfriend's wealth, Artie attempts a new business venture.

title: Watching Too Much Television
desc: Adriana learns that life is not like TV shows, while Tony discovers that a former girlfriend has moved on, along with Ralphie and others they scam the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Mergers and Acquisitions
desc: Paulie has to take care of some rough relationships for his mother, while Tony's fancy for a fellow horse fancier lands him in trouble with Carmela.

title: Whoever Did This
desc: Ralph's callous behavior finally steps over the line, while Chris gets deeper into his heroin addiction and Uncle Junior's mental capacity begins to become in question.

title: The Strong, Silent Type
desc: In the midst of suspicions that he killed Ralph, Tony tries to intervene to get Chris clean and sober.

title: Calling All Cars
desc: Tony's dreams seem to tell him where his life is headed, but he still feels as though he's out of control.

title: Eloise
desc: Carmela and Furio grow too close for safety, while Paulie discovers that he's not as big a fish as he thought he was.

title: Whitecaps
desc: Junior's trial comes to an end, but Tony's trials are just getting underway. Also, the Sopranos almost purchase a house on the beach.

title: Two Tonys
desc: Some of the old guards are released from prison and want to get back in the action. Chris and Paulie are at each other's throats over matters of money and respect, and Tony decides to tell Dr. Melfi what's really on his mind.

title: Rat Pack
desc: Carmine's passing opens new wounds, while cousin Tony wants to put his past behind him. Tony Soprano, meanwhile, discovers a traitor.

title: Where's Johnny?
desc: With Carmine's passing and Feech's arrival, turf wars are breaking out around New Jersey. Junior's mental health, meanwhile, starts to decline.

title: All Happy Families
desc: Feech makes a pain of himself by trying to return to his past glory. Carmela tries to work with Anthony's teacher to rein in their out-of-control son.

title: Irregular Around the Margins
desc: A car crash puts Tony and Adriana in a compromising position, and Cousin Tony tries to keep Chris from getting the wrong impression and the wrong information.

title: Sentimental Education
desc: Carmela has another furtive romance collapse, while Tony B. throws away a chance to turn his life around.

title: In Camelot
desc: Tony learns about his father through the man's mistress, while Chris' friend learns that there are habits more harmful to your health than heroin.

title: Marco Polo
desc: An uncomfortable party leads Tony and Carmela to a partial reconciliation, while cousin Tony gets an offer he decides not to refuse.

title: Unidentified Black Males
desc: Tony finds out that his cousin wants a bigger share of responsibilities, while Finn makes an embarrassing discovery about Vito.

title: Cold Cuts
desc: Chris and cousin Tony do some digging to make sure old secrets stay buried, while Janice puts her marriage in jeopardy with her fierce temper.

title: The Test Dream
desc: Cousin Tony heads off to avenge the death of his good friend, while a dream reveals to Tony what he must do to prevent a full-scale war.

title: Long Term Parking
desc: Tony makes a request to Johnny Sack on behalf of his cousin, and Adriana makes a request to the FBI, followed by one to Chris.

title: All Due Respect
desc: Tony realizes that he must take care of family messes himself in order to keep the peace within his own clan.

title: Members Only
desc: Gene Pontecorvo makes a final break from the mob life, while Junior's paranoid delusions could be the end of Tony.

title: Join the Club
desc: The family tries to cope with Tony's hospitalization and deteriorating condition, while Tony begins to hallucinate a new life parallel to his own.

title: Mayham
desc: While the gang begins to turn on itself, Tony finds himself at the threshold, while Christopher gives another try to enter the movie business, however this time as a producer rather than a screenwriter.

title: The Fleshy Part of the Thigh
desc: Tony goes home and returns to business, perhaps with a new frame of mind. Paulie receives a shock about his mother.

title: Mr. & Mrs. John Sacrimoni Request
desc: Johnny Sack is granted permission to attend his daughter's wedding. Tony improves his personal security and Vito's secret double life is exposed.

title: Live Free or Die
desc: Tony hires help from overseas to fulfill a favor he was asked for by Johnny Sack and decides if one of his top earners deserves a second chance as he acknowledges to Dr. Melfi he was given a second chance when survived his gun shot wound.

title: Luxury Lounge
desc: Christopher and Carmine travel to Hollywood to take the next step in making their movie but quickly realize they're out of their depth. Artie feuds with Benny after his restaurant falls prey to one of Tony's scams.

title: Johnny Cakes
desc: Vito considers starting a new life in New Hampshire, while Anthony Jr. looking for a purpose and finds it when he continues his pursuit of revenge against Junior.

title: The Ride
desc: Paulie finds public opinion turned against him after an amusement ride accident. Christopher tries to start a new life as a husband and father.

title: Moe n' Joe
desc: Tony reflects on how growing up with Janice colors his attitudes now, while Vito tries to make a new life for himself in New Hampshire.

title: Cold Stones
desc: Phil takes out his revenge on Vito, while Tony grows frustrated with Anthony Jr's lack of ambition or work ethic.

title: Kaisha
desc: Tony and Phil begin an explosive conflict that puts Phil in the hospital, while Christopher and Tony both embark on new romances with the same woman.

title: Soprano Home Movies
desc: Carmela and Tony go away to Bobby's cabin upstate New York for Tony's birthday up where a fight emerges between Tony and Bobby over Janice. Meanwhile A.J. is throwing a party at the Soprano home.

title: Stage 5
desc: Johnny Sac finds out he only has 3 months to live. Meanwhile, 'Cleaver' premieres and is a hit, while Carmela has mixed emotions about it, saying too much of it is based on Tony.

title: Remember When
desc: While forced to lay low in Miami, Tony begins to question Paulie's loyalty. Junior and Phil Leotardo both make moves to gain power in their respective territories.

title: Chasing It
desc: Tony hits an unlucky series of gambling losses, causing tension with both Carmela and Hesh. AJ and Blanca decide to make major changes in their relationship.

title: Walk Like a Man
desc: Christopher's father-in-law is the unwitting catalyst of a new feud between Christopher and Paulie. AJ struggles with depression.

title: Kennedy and Heidi
desc: Tony travels to Las Vegas after a tragedy occurs.

title: The Second Coming
desc: Tony fails to reason with Phil as more problems increase with Anthony Jr as his depression worsens.

title: The Blue Comet
desc: The allegiance of those closest to Tony is put to the test. A case of mistaken identity has serious ramifications.

title: Made in America
desc: Tony and his family have to stay in hiding until Phil Leotardo is dealt with. His family doesn't like the lifestyle they have been forced to adopt. AJ and Meadow move onto the next step in their lives. Tony confronts Junior one last time.

title: The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean
desc: Carl Sagan examines our planet's place in the universe by leading us on a journey from Earth to Deep Space.

title: One Voice in the Cosmic Fugue
desc: Carl Sagan examines the origin, development, and complexity of life on Earth and speculates on the possibility of life developing elsewhere in the universe.

title: Harmony of the Worlds
desc: After briefly looking at the pseudoscience of astrology, Carl Sagan examines the history of astronomy from ancient times through Ptolemy to Johannes Kepler.

title: Heaven and Hell
desc: Carl Sagan examines the nature of comets before turning to a close look at the planet Venus.

title: Blues for a Red Planet
desc: Carl Sagan looks at the search for life on Mars from the speculations of Percival Lowell and H.G. Wells to the arrival of the Viking probes.

title: Travellers' Tales
desc: Carl Sagan looks at the planets Jupiter and Saturn by examining the work of Galileo, Huygens, and the Voyager probes.

title: The Backbone of Night
desc: Carl Sagan looks at the work of ancient Greek scientists and astronomers including Thales, Anaximander, Democritus, and Pythagoras.

title: Journeys in Space and Time
desc: Carl Sagan explains scientific concepts like relativity and examines the possibility of time travel.

title: The Lives of the Stars
desc: Carl Sagan examines the life cycle of stars from their creation to their deaths.

title: The Edge of Forever
desc: Carl Sagan focuses on the origin of the universe by discussing the Big Bang, Galaxies, Dimensions, and the expansion of the universe.

title: The Persistence of Memory
desc: Carl Sagan examines life on earth discussing genes, DNA, the brain, and human social development.

title: Encyclopaedia Galactica
desc: Carl Sagan examines the possibility extraterrestrial life and discusses his skepticism about UFOs.

title: Who Speaks for Earth?
desc: Carl Sagan considers the significance of science and discuss the importance of human survival in the nuclear age.

title: Avatar: The Last Airbender
desc: Sokka and his sister Kya - later renamed Katara, must travel the world to find masters for Aang, who is the Avatar. However, they must evade a critical foe, Prince Zuko of the Fire Nation, who wants to capture Aang.

title: The Boy in the Iceberg
desc: The legend of the Avatar is told. Katara and Sokka find a strange boy within an iceberg.

title: The Avatar Returns
desc: Aang and Katara inadvertently set off a trap the brings the warmongering Fire Nation to the Southern Water Tribe's peaceful village at the South Pole.

title: The Southern Air Temple
desc: After his departure from the Southern Air Temple 100 years ago, an excited Aang finally returns home but is disillusioned by what he finds there.

title: The Warriors of Kyoshi
desc: The gang arrives at Kyoshi Island and are captured by some Kyoshi warriors. When Aang reveals that he is the avatar, news quickly spreads out and suddenly reaches to Prince Zuko who then goes to Kyoshi Island to capture him.

title: The King of Omashu
desc: Aang's abilities as an airbender are challenged by a king.

title: Imprisoned
desc: In a nearby Earth Village, the gang meets a teenage earthbender named Haru. This village lives in fear of the Fire Nation, for soldiers there capture any earthbenders they can find.

title: The Spirit World: Winter Solstice, Part 1
desc: Aang and friends visit a village being terrorized by an angry spirit. Iroh is captured by Earth Kingdom soldiers.

title: Avatar Roku: Winter Solstice, Part 2
desc: To contact the spirit of the previous Avatar, Aang must reach a temple in the Fire Nation before the sun sets on the following day. There he will learn what he must do to restore balance to the world. Zuko must defy his banishment to follow Aang.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
desc: Katara, desperate to improve her abilities and teach Aang, steals an expensive waterbending scroll from pirates, causing them to pursue the group.

title: Jet
desc: Aang, Katara, and Sokka have their friendship tested by a charismatic Rebel Leader who is fighting against the Fire Nation.

title: The Great Divide
desc: Aang is tested as the Avatar when he must help two feuding clans cross a dangerous canyon peacefully.

title: The Storm
desc: Aang relives the events after finding out that he is the Avatar 100 years ago and tells them to Katara, while Iroh tells the story of Zuko's scar and banishment to the crew.

title: The Blue Spirit
desc: When Aang is captured by the Fire Nation, his only hope is a mysterious masked figure.

title: The Fortuneteller
desc: The gang visits a village where a fortuneteller lives who is said to never be wrong. Aang tries to show Katara how he feels about her.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
desc: Sokka and Katara meet a friend of their father who offers to take them to join the Water Tribe's navy. Aang fears his friends will choose seeing their father again over staying with him.

title: The Deserter
desc: When he meets an outcast from the Fire Nation, Aang is impatient to skip ahead in his training.

title: The Northern Air Temple
desc: Aang is upset when he finds an old Air Temple has been desecrated by an old inventor and his son.

title: The Waterbending Master
desc: The heroes finally arrive at the North Pole. But for Katara, the trip may have been in vain, as Master Pakku refuses to teach girls waterbending.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
desc: While Katara herself becomes a great waterbending master, Commander Zhao plans a siege on the Northern Water Tribe. Meanwhile, Sokka's on a mission to stop this siege while Aang tries to buy them some time.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
desc: As the Fire Nation continues its assault on the Northern Water Tribe, Sokka, Katara and Yue set out on a search for Aang, being guided by his spirit.

title: The Avatar State
desc: Aang and friends arrive in the Earth Kingdom to begin his earthbending training, but a local general convinces Aang that all he needs to do is learn to control his Avatar state. Azula, Zuko's sister, arrives to escort her brother and uncle back to the Fire Nation.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
desc: On their way to Omashu, Team Avatar is forced to travel underground to avoid Fire Nation attacks. Iroh and Zuko adjust to life as fugitives.

title: Return to Omashu
desc: Finding the city of Aang's old friend, King Bumi, captured by the Fire Nation, the heroes hatch a plan to rescue Aang's earthbending teacher. Azula gathers two old friends to help her hunt the Avatar.

title: The Swamp
desc: Aang hears a swamp calling to him. In the swamp, Aang and the gang find out that this is not any natural swamp.

title: Avatar Day
desc: Sokka and Katara have to solve a centuries-old crime when Aang is imprisoned for a murder allegedly committed by one of his past incarnations.

title: The Blind Bandit
desc: While looking for an Earthbending teacher, Aang, and his friends discover a young blind girl with secrets of her own.

title: Zuko Alone
desc: As Zuko tries to make it by in exile without his uncle, he remembers how his father became Firelord and what happened to his mother.

title: The Chase
desc: Team Avatar is getting chased by a mysterious machine, they become sleep deprived when they try to get away from Azula and her two friends. Katara and Toph get into a heated argument, she calls the earth bender out on her unhelpful attitude. Aang realizes the reason why they are being followed by the crown princess and her friends is because of Appa's shedding. Aang and his friends finally clean Appa up and he tries to create a fake decoy trail with the fur to trick Azula and her friends. Aang is finally cornered by the princess, she reveals that she is the younger ...

title: Bitter Work
desc: Aang begins to learn earthbending from Toph; Uncle Iroh resumes teaching Zuko firebending to better prepare him for facing Azula, and reveals a new technique he learned from watching waterbenders.

title: The Library
desc: When he learns that there is a lost Library with all the knowledge in the world, Sokka convinces the others to seek it out in hopes of finding a weakness of the Fire Nation.

title: The Desert
desc: Lost in the desert without Appa, Team Avatar must find a way out. Iroh and Zuko make contact with a secret organization.

title: The Serpent's Pass
desc: After getting tickets for the ferry headed to Ba Sing Se, the gang meets an old friend. They skip the ferry ride to help some refugees, one of which is going to have a baby, get to Ba Sing Se. They must lead the refugees through the Serpent's Pass, a dangerous mountain-side path surrounded by water.

title: The Drill
desc: After arriving at the great wall of Ba Sing Se, Aang and the gang discover that the Fire Nation has constructed a great drilling machine to penetrate the wall. The drill is also followed by an army of Fire Nation troops. Also, Zuko and Iroh are having trouble hiding the fact that they are both Firebenders.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
desc: After getting a house to stay in, Aang and company are given a tour of Ba Sing Se. As they try to get in to tell the Earth King the news, they find that nothing is quite what is seems. Jet is in the city, too, and he is positive that Iroh and Zuko are Firebenders.

title: The Tales of Ba Sing Se
desc: A series of short stories covering some of the time spent by Katara, Toph, Iroh, Sokka, Aang, Zuko and Momo as they live in Ba Sing Se.

title: Appa's Lost Days
desc: In this special episode, we go back in time to the moment Appa was stolen, will find out where he has gone and who he has met along the way and more importantly where he is now!

title: Lake Laogai
desc: The Avatar gang encounters Jet in Ba Sing Se and he helps them to discover the location of Appa. But they will end up discovering something else, a secret of the city.

title: The Earth King
desc: The kids battle Long Feng and the Dai Li when they attempt to show the Earth King the vast conspiracy taking place in his city. Zuko becomes seriously ill and has feverish dreams as he faces a spiritual crisis.

title: The Guru
desc: Aang receives guidance from Guru Pathik at the Eastern Air Temple; Sokka is reunited with his long-lost father; Princess Azula has something diabolical in store for her enemies; Uncle and Zuko run their own tea shop.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
desc: The heroes work together to stop Azula's destructive plans; Zuko finds companionship in an unlikely source and learns the time has come to make an imperative choice about his future.

title: The Awakening
desc: Weeks after the fall of the Earth Kingdom, Aang and his friends must infiltrate the Fire Nation. Katara meets her father for the first time in years. Zuko returns home, but is uneasy with his newfound reputation.

title: The Headband
desc: Posing as a regular kid, Aang goes to a Fire Nation school and sees what's missing from their lives. Zuko visits his uncle in prison.

title: The Painted Lady
desc: When Aang and his friends come across a fishing village being poisoned by a nearby factory, a local legend comes to life to help the townspeople.

title: Sokka's Master
desc: After deciding he's the least valuable member of the team, Sokka seeks an apprenticeship with a sword-master. The rest of the gang tries to adjust to being without him. The imprisoned Iroh may not be as beaten as he seems.

title: The Beach
desc: On a forced vacation, Zuko, Azula, Ty Lee and Mai try to blend in with normal teenagers and learn about themselves and one another. Aang and company are attacked by an ominous assassin.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
desc: Both Aang and Zuko must learn the history of how the war began. Zuko learns a secret about his great-grandfather's past.

title: The Runaway
desc: When Toph discovers a quick way to make cash, Katara disapproves, and the rift between them has disastrous consequences.

title: The Puppetmaster
desc: Creepy things are afoot when the gang meets a mysterious old innkeeper with a secret.

title: Nightmares and Daydreams
desc: As the invasion approaches, Aang has recurring nightmares about being unprepared to face the Firelord. Zuko feels the perks and pressures of being the prince again.

title: Day of the Black Sun
desc: Zuko makes a decision about his future. Aang reunites with many of his old friends in a full-scale invasion of the Fire Nation capitol to coincide with an eclipse which will remove the Fire Nation's powers.

title: Day of the Black Sun
desc: The invasion seems to be succeeding until Aang learns that their arrival was anticipated. Zuko confronts his father.

title: The Western Air Temple
desc: The gang hides out in the Western Air Temple. Zuko tries to convince the gang of his change in heart, but they are very hesitant. Combustion Man/Sparky-Sparky Boom Man attacks again.

title: The Firebending Masters
desc: Zuko has joined up with Aang's group and is now ready to teach Aang fire bending. Unfortunately, Zuko has found out that he has lost his ability and must now relearn it. Zuko and Aang travel to find the original source of fire bending so that they both can learn from The Firebending Masters.

title: The Boiling Rock: Part 1
desc: Sokka and Zuko head to the Fire Nation's most heavily guarded prison, the Boiling Rock, in hopes of finding and breaking out the captured invasion force.

title: The Boiling Rock
desc: The escape is planned and the heroes attempt to break from the prison that very day. But problems come when Azula, Mai and Ty Lee arrive at the prison.

title: The Southern Raiders
desc: Trying to prove that she can trust him, Zuko helps Katara track down the man who killed her mother.

title: The Ember Island Players
desc: The gang, now hiding at Ember Island, watch a play about themselves and their adventures.

title: Sozin's Comet
desc: Sozin's Comet is only three days away. Zuko tells the others what the Fire Lord plans on the day of the comet and the gang realizes that they must stop him before then. But Aang doubts that he can do what is expected of him.

title: Sozin's Comet
desc: Aang awakes on a mysterious island and confronts his past lives for advice on how to stop the Fire Lord without killing him. The rest of the group searches for Aang.

title: Sozin's Comet
desc: Zuko battles his sister with Katara's help for the right to be named Fire Lord. Elsewhere, Aang meets Ozai just as the comet arrives.

title: Sozin's Comet, Part 4: Avatar Aang
desc: Aang's moment of truth arrives. Can he defeat Ozai, the Phoenix King? Will he be forced to take a human life? All the characters face their greatest challenges.

title: One Planet
desc: Witness the planet's breathtaking diversity -- from seabirds carpet-bombing the ocean to wildebeests eluding the wild dogs of the Serengeti.

title: Frozen Worlds
desc: On the unforgiving frontier of climate change, polar bears, walruses, seals and penguins find their icy Edens in peril.

title: Jungles
desc: Jungles and rainforests are home to an incredible variety of species like preening birds, intelligent orangutans and remarkably ambitious ants.

title: Coastal Seas
desc: From fearsome sharks to lowly urchins, 90 percent of marine creatures live in coastal waters. Protecting these habitats is a battle humanity must win.

title: From Deserts to Grasslands
desc: Cameras follow desert elephants seeking sustenance, bison roaming North American grasslands and caterpillars living the good life underground.

title: The High Seas
desc: Venture into the deep, dark and desolate oceans that are home to an abundance of beautiful - and downright strange - creatures.

title: Fresh Water
desc: The need for fresh water is as strong as ever. However, the supply is becoming increasingly unpredictable for all manner of species.

title: Forests
desc: Examine the fragile interdependence that exists between forests' wide variety of residents, including bald eagles, hunting dogs and Siberian tigers.

title: Standing Up in the Milky Way
desc: A thrilling, new adventure across space and time begins.

title: Some of the Things That Molecules Do
desc: Artificial selection is one example, eyes another, of the well-documented and inescapable process of evolution--change in a population of species over time--by natural selection. These are some of the things that molecules do.

title: When Knowledge Conquered Fear
desc: Neil deGrasse Tyson sets off on the Ship of the Imagination to chase a single comet through its million-year plunge toward Sol. Later, Tyson visits the birth-place of Sir Isaac Newton and retraces the unlikely friendship between Newton and brilliant polymath Edmond Halley. It was Halley's patience and generosity which allowed Newton to conquer his fear of isolation an... Read all

title: A Sky Full of Ghosts
desc: Explores how light, time and gravity affects our perception of the universe

title: Hiding in the Light
desc: The Ship of the Imagination travels back in time to reveal 11th century Europe and North Africa during the golden age of Islam, when brilliant physicist Ibn al-Haytham discovered the scientific method and first understood how we see, and how light travels. Later, William Herschel discovers the infrared and the signature hidden in the light of every star, eventually un... Read all

title: Deeper, Deeper, Deeper Still
desc: The Ship of the Imagination ventures on an epic voyage to the bottom of a dewdrop to explore the universe on the smallest scale and observe exotic life forms invisible to the naked eye. Then, host Neil deGrasse Tyson explains the neural network in our brains which determine our sense of smell and memory, and later, he travels deep beneath the surface of the Earth to d... Read all

title: The Clean Room
desc: To determine the true age of the Earth, geochemist Clair Patterson developed the uranium-lead dating method to make an unprecedented discovery - calculating Earth's age of 4.5 billion years. But Patterson's groundbreaking discoveries were just beginning. Patterson made it his mission to draw public attention to the detrimental effects of lead in the environment and de... Read all

title: Sisters of the Sun
desc: Explores the violent cosmic phenomenon of supernovas, which on average occur once per galaxy per century or one billion times per year in the observable universe.

title: The Lost Worlds of Planet Earth
desc: The Ship of the Imagination embarks on a journey through space and time to grasp how the autobiography of the Earth is written in its atoms, its oceans, its continents and all living things. Later, American geologist Marie Tharp creates the first true map of Earth's ocean floor, and discovers microscopic life that exists deep beneath the ocean.

title: The Electric Boy
desc: Travel to 19th century England and meet Michael Faraday, a child of poverty who grew up to invent the motor and the generator.
